versets.fr: 34. Un châtiment les atteindra dans la vie présente. Le châtiment de l'au-delà sera cependant plus écrasant et ils n'auront nul protecteur contre Allah.
versets.en: 34. For them is a torment in the life of this world, and certainly, harder is the torment of the Hereafter. And they have no protector against Allah.

versets.ar: 35. ۞ مَّثَلُ الْجَنَّةِ الَّتِي وُعِدَ الْمُتَّقُونَ ۖ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ ۖ أُكُلُهَا دَائِمٌ وَظِلُّهَا ۚ تِلْكَ عُقْبَى الَّذِينَ اتَّقَوا ۖ وَّعُقْبَى الْكَافِرِينَ النَّارُ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Tel est le paradis qui a été promis aux pieux: sous lequel coulent les ruisseaux; ses fruits sont perpétuels, ainsi que son ombrage. Voilà la fin de ceux qui pratiquent la piété, tandis que la fin des mécréants sera le Feu.
versets.en: 35. The description of the Paradise which the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2): have been promised! -Underneath it rivers flow, its provision is eternal and so is its shade, this is the end (final destination) of the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2), and the end (final destination) of the disbelievers is Fire. (See Verse 47:15)

versets.ar: 36. وَالَّذِينَ آتَيْنَاهُمُ الْكِتَابَ يَفْرَحُونَ بِمَا أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكَ ۖ وَمِنَ الْأَحْزَابِ مَن يُنكِرُ بَعْضَهُ ۚ قُلْ إِنَّمَا أُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ اللَّهَ وَلَا أُشْرِكَ بِهِ ۚ إِلَيْهِ أَدْعُو وَإِلَيْهِ مَآبِ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. Et ceux à qui Nous avons déjà donné le Livre se réjouissent de ce qu'on a fait descendre vers toi. Tandis que certaines factions en rejettent une partie. Dis: «Il m'a seulement été commandé d'adorer Allah et de ne rien Lui associer. C'est à Lui que j'appelle [les gens], Et c'est vers Lui que sera mon retour».
versets.en: 36. Those to whom We have given the Book (such as 'Abdullah bin Salam and other Jews who embraced Islam), rejoice at what has been revealed unto you (i.e. the Quran), but there are among the Confederates (from the Jews and pagans) those who reject a part thereof. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "I am commanded only to worship Allah (Alone) and not to join partners with Him. To Him (Alone) I call and to Him is my return."

versets.ar: 37. وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَنزَلْنَاهُ حُكْمًا عَرَبِيًّا ۚ وَلَئِنِ اتَّبَعْتَ أَهْوَاءَهُم بَعْدَمَا جَاءَكَ مِنَ الْعِلْمِ مَا لَكَ مِنَ اللَّهِ مِن وَلِيٍّ وَلَا وَاقٍ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. Ainsi l'avons-Nous fait descendre (le Coran) [sous forme] de loi en arabe. Et si tu suis leurs passions après ce que tu as reçu comme savoir, il n'y aura pour toi, contre Allah, ni allié ni protecteur.
versets.en: 37. And thus have We sent it (the Quran) down to be a judgement of authority in Arabic. Were you (O Muhammad SAW) to follow their (vain) desires after the knowledge which has come to you, then you will not have any Wali (protector) or defender against Allah.

versets.ar: 38. وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا رُسُلًا مِّن قَبْلِكَ وَجَعَلْنَا لَهُمْ أَزْوَاجًا وَذُرِّيَّةً ۚ وَمَا كَانَ لِرَسُولٍ أَن يَأْتِيَ بِآيَةٍ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ اللَّهِ ۗ لِكُلِّ أَجَلٍ كِتَابٌ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. Et Nous avons certes envoyé avant toi des messagers, et leur avons donné des épouses et des descendants. Et il n'appartient pas à un Messager d'apporter un miracle, si ce n'est qu'avec la permission d'Allah. Chaque échéance a son terme prescrit.
versets.en: 38. And indeed We sent Messengers before you (O Muhammad SAW), and made for them wives and offspring. And it was not for a Messenger to bring a sign except by Allah's Leave. (For) each and every matter there is a Decree (from Allah).

versets.ar: 39. يَمْحُو اللَّهُ مَا يَشَاءُ وَيُثْبِتُ ۖ وَعِندَهُ أُمُّ الْكِتَابِ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. Allah efface ou confirme ce qu'Il veut et l'Ecriture primordiale est auprès de Lui.
versets.en: 39. Allah blots out what He wills and confirms (what He wills). And with Him is the Mother of the Book (Al-Lauh Al-Mahfuz)

versets.ar: 40. وَإِن مَّا نُرِيَنَّكَ بَعْضَ الَّذِي نَعِدُهُمْ أَوْ نَتَوَفَّيَنَّكَ فَإِنَّمَا عَلَيْكَ الْبَلَاغُ وَعَلَيْنَا الْحِسَابُ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. Que Nous te fassions voir une partie de ce dont Nous les menaçons, ou que Nous te fassions mourir (avant cela), ton devoir est seulement la communication du message, et le règlement de compte sera à Nous.
versets.en: 40. Whether We show you (O Muhammad SAW) part of what We have promised them or cause you to die, your duty is only to convey (the Message) and on Us is the reckoning.

versets.ar: 41. أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا أَنَّا نَأْتِي الْأَرْضَ نَنقُصُهَا مِنْ أَطْرَافِهَا ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَحْكُمُ لَا مُعَقِّبَ لِحُكْمِهِ ۚ وَهُوَ سَرِيعُ الْحِسَابِ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. Ne voient-ils pas que Nous frappons la terre et que Nous la réduisons de tous côtés? C'est Allah qui juge et personne ne peut s'opposer à Son jugement, et Il est prompt à régler les comptes.
versets.en: 41. See they not that We gradually reduce the land (of disbelievers, by giving it to the believers, in war victories) from its outlying borders. And Allah judges, there is none to put back His Judgement and He is Swift at reckoning.

versets.ar: 42. وَقَدْ مَكَرَ الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ فَلِلَّهِ الْمَكْرُ جَمِيعًا ۖ يَعْلَمُ مَا تَكْسِبُ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ الْكُفَّارُ لِمَنْ عُقْبَى الدَّارِ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. Certes ceux d'avant eux ont manigancé (contre leur Messager); le stratagème tout entier appartient à Allah. Il sait ce que chaque âme acquiert. Et les mécréants sauront bientôt à qui appartient la bonne demeure finale.
versets.en: 42. And verily, those before them did devise plots, but all planning is Allah's. He knows what every person earns, and the disbelievers will know who gets the good end (final destination).

versets.ar: 43. وَيَقُولُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَسْتَ مُرْسَلًا ۚ قُلْ كَفَىٰ بِاللَّهِ شَهِيدًا بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَكُمْ وَمَنْ عِندَهُ عِلْمُ الْكِتَابِ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. Et ceux qui ne croient pas disent: «Tu n'es pas un Messager». Dis: «Allah suffit, comme témoin entre vous et moi, et ceux qui ont la connaissance du Livre (sont aussi témoins)».
versets.en: 43. And those who disbelieve, say: "You (O Muhammad SAW) are not a Messenger." Say: "Sufficient for a witness between me and you is Allah and those too who have knowledge of the Scripture (such as 'Abdullah bin Salam and other Jews and Christians who embraced Islam)."

versets.ar: 1. الر ۚ كِتَابٌ أَنزَلْنَاهُ إِلَيْكَ لِتُخْرِجَ النَّاسَ مِنَ الظُّلُمَاتِ إِلَى النُّورِ بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَاطِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَمِيدِ ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. Alif, Lâm, Râ. (Voici) un livre que nous avons fait descendre sur toi, afin que - par la permission de leur Seigneur - tu fasses sortir les gens des ténèbres vers la lumière, sur la voie du Tout Puissant, du Digne de louange.
versets.en: 1. Alif-Lam-Ra. [These letters are one of the miracles of the Quran, and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings]. (This is) a Book which We have revealed unto you (O Muhammad SAW) in order that you might lead mankind out of darkness (of disbelief and polytheism) into light (of belief in the Oneness of Allah and Islamic Monotheism) by their Lord's Leave to the Path of the All-Mighty, the Owner of all Praise.

versets.ar: 2. اللَّهِ الَّذِي لَهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۗ وَوَيْلٌ لِّلْكَافِرِينَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ شَدِيدٍ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Allah, à qui appartient tout ce qui est dans les cieux et sur la terre. Et malheur aux mécréants, pour un dur châtiment [qu'ils subiront].
versets.en: 2. Allah to Whom belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth! And woe unto the disbelievers from a severe torment.

versets.ar: 3. الَّذِينَ يَسْتَحِبُّونَ الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا عَلَى الْآخِرَةِ وَيَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ وَيَبْغُونَهَا عِوَجًا ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ فِي ضَلَالٍ بَعِيدٍ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Ceux qui préfèrent la vie d'ici-bas à l'au-delà, obstruent [aux gens] le chemin d'Allah et cherchent à le rendre tortueux, ceux-là sont loin dans l'égarement.
versets.en: 3. Those who prefer the life of this world instead of the Hereafter, and hinder (men) from the Path of Allah (i.e. Islam) and seek crookedness therein - They are far astray.

versets.ar: 4. وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا مِن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا بِلِسَانِ قَوْمِهِ لِيُبَيِّنَ لَهُمْ ۖ فَيُضِلُّ اللَّهُ مَن يَشَاءُ وَيَهْدِي مَن يَشَاءُ ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Et Nous n'avons envoyé de Messager qu'avec la langue de son peuple, afin de les éclairer. Allah égare qui Il veut et guide qui Il veut. Et, c'est Lui le Tout Puissant, le Sage.
versets.en: 4. And We sent not a Messenger except with the language of his people, in order that he might make (the Message) clear for them. Then Allah misleads whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

versets.ar: 5. وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مُوسَىٰ بِآيَاتِنَا أَنْ أَخْرِجْ قَوْمَكَ مِنَ الظُّلُمَاتِ إِلَى النُّورِ وَذَكِّرْهُم بِأَيَّامِ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِّكُلِّ صَبَّارٍ شَكُورٍ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Nous avons certes, envoyé Moïse avec Nos miracles [en lui disant]: «Fais sortir ton peuple des ténèbres vers la lumière, et rappelle-leur les jours d'Allah». [Ses bienfaits]. Dans tout cela il y a des signes pour tout homme plein d'endurance et de reconnaissance.
versets.en: 5. And indeed We sent Musa (Moses) with Our Ayat (signs, proofs, and evidences) (saying): "Bring out your people from darkness into light, and make them remember the annals of Allah. Truly, therein are evidences, proofs and signs for every patient, thankful (person)."

versets.ar: 6. وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِ اذْكُرُوا نِعْمَةَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ إِذْ أَنجَاكُم مِّنْ آلِ فِرْعَوْنَ يَسُومُونَكُمْ سُوءَ الْعَذَابِ وَيُذَبِّحُونَ أَبْنَاءَكُمْ وَيَسْتَحْيُونَ نِسَاءَكُمْ ۚ وَفِي ذَٰلِكُم بَلَاءٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ عَظِيمٌ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. (Rappelle-toi) quand Moïse dit à son peuple: «Rappelez-vous le bienfait d'Allah sur vous quand Il vous sauva des gens de Pharaon qui vous infligeaient le pire châtiment. Ils massacraient vos fils et laissaient en vie vos filles. Il y avait là une dure épreuve de la part de votre Seigneur»,
versets.en: 6. And (remember) when Musa (Moses) said to his people: "Call to mind Allah's Favour to you, when He delivered you from Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) people who were afflicting you with horrible torment, and were slaughtering your sons and letting your women alive, and in it was a tremendous trial from your Lord."

versets.ar: 7. وَإِذْ تَأَذَّنَ رَبُّكُمْ لَئِن شَكَرْتُمْ لَأَزِيدَنَّكُمْ ۖ وَلَئِن كَفَرْتُمْ إِنَّ عَذَابِي لَشَدِيدٌ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. Et lorsque votre Seigneur proclama: «Si vous êtes reconnaissants, très certainement J'augmenterai [Mes bienfaits] pour vous. Mais si vous êtes ingrats, Mon châtiment sera terrible».
versets.en: 7. And (remember) when your Lord proclaimed: "If you give thanks (by accepting Faith and worshipping none but Allah), I will give you more (of My Blessings), but if you are thankless (i.e. disbelievers), verily! My Punishment is indeed severe."

versets.ar: 8. وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ إِن تَكْفُرُوا أَنتُمْ وَمَن فِي الْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَغَنِيٌّ حَمِيدٌ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Et Moïse dit: «Si vous êtes ingrats, vous ainsi que tous ceux qui sont sur terre, [sachez] qu'Allah Se suffit à Lui-même et qu'Il est digne de louange.
versets.en: 8. And Musa (Moses) said: "If you disbelieve, you and all on earth together, then verily! Allah is Rich (Free of all wants), Owner of all Praise."

versets.ar: 9. أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ نَبَأُ الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِكُمْ قَوْمِ نُوحٍ وَعَادٍ وَثَمُودَ ۛ وَالَّذِينَ مِن بَعْدِهِمْ ۛ لَا يَعْلَمُهُمْ إِلَّا اللَّهُ ۚ جَاءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُهُم بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ فَرَدُّوا أَيْدِيَهُمْ فِي أَفْوَاهِهِمْ وَقَالُوا إِنَّا كَفَرْنَا بِمَا أُرْسِلْتُم بِهِ وَإِنَّا لَفِي شَكٍّ مِّمَّا تَدْعُونَنَا إِلَيْهِ مُرِيبٍ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Ne vous est-il pas parvenu le récit de ceux d'avant vous, du peuple de Noé, des `Aad, des Thamud et de ceux qui vécurent après eux, et que seul Allah connaît? Leurs messagers vinrent à eux avec des preuves, mais ils dirent, ramenant leurs mains à leurs bouches: «Nous ne croyons pas [au message] avec lequel vous avez été envoyés et nous sommes, au sujet de ce à quoi vous nous appelez, dans un doute vraiment troublant».
versets.en: 9. Has not the news reached you, of those before you, the people of Nuh (Noah), and 'Ad, and Thamud? And those after them? None knows them but Allah. To them came their Messengers with clear proofs, but they put their hands in their mouths (biting them from anger) and said: "Verily, we disbelieve in that with which you have been sent, and we are really in grave doubt as to that to which you invite us (i.e. Islamic Monotheism)."

versets.ar: 10. ۞ قَالَتْ رُسُلُهُمْ أَفِي اللَّهِ شَكٌّ فَاطِرِ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ يَدْعُوكُمْ لِيَغْفِرَ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمْ وَيُؤَخِّرَكُمْ إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۚ قَالُوا إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا تُرِيدُونَ أَن تَصُدُّونَا عَمَّا كَانَ يَعْبُدُ آبَاؤُنَا فَأْتُونَا بِسُلْطَانٍ مُّبِينٍ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Leurs messagers dirent: «Y a-t-il un doute au sujet d'Allah, Créateur des cieux et de la terre, qui vous appelle pour vous pardonner une partie de vos péchés et vous donner un délai jusqu'à un terme fixé?» [Les mécréants] répondirent: «Vous n'êtes que des hommes comme nous. Vous voulez nous empêcher de ce que nos ancêtres adoraient. Apportez-nous donc une preuve évidente».
versets.en: 10. Their Messengers said: "What! Can there be a doubt about Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth? He calls you (to Monotheism and to be obedient to Allah) that He may forgive you of your sins and give you respite for a term appointed." They said: "You are no more than human beings like us! You wish to turn us away from what our fathers used to worship. Then bring us a clear authority i.e. a clear proof of what you say)."

versets.ar: 11. قَالَتْ لَهُمْ رُسُلُهُمْ إِن نَّحْنُ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُكُمْ وَلَٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ يَمُنُّ عَلَىٰ مَن يَشَاءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا أَن نَّأْتِيَكُم بِسُلْطَانٍ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ اللَّهِ ۚ وَعَلَى اللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. Leurs messagers leur dirent: «Certes, nous ne sommes que des humains comme vous. Mais Allah favorise qui Il veut parmi Ses serviteurs. Il ne nous appartient de vous apporter quelque preuve, que par la permission d'Allah. Et c'est en Allah que les croyants doivent placer leur confiance.
versets.en: 11. Their Messengers said to them: "We are no more than human beings like you, but Allah bestows His Grace to whom He wills of His slaves. It is not ours to bring you an authority (proof) except by the Permission of Allah. And in Allah (Alone) let the believers put their trust.

versets.ar: 12. وَمَا لَنَا أَلَّا نَتَوَكَّلَ عَلَى اللَّهِ وَقَدْ هَدَانَا سُبُلَنَا ۚ وَلَنَصْبِرَنَّ عَلَىٰ مَا آذَيْتُمُونَا ۚ وَعَلَى اللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ الْمُتَوَكِّلُونَ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. Et qu'aurions-nous à ne pas placer notre confiance en Allah, alors qu'Il nous a guidés sur les sentiers [que nous devions suivre]? Nous endurerons sûrement la persécution que vous nous infligez. Et ceux qui ont confiance en Allah s'en remettent entièrement à Lui.»
versets.en: 12. "And why should we not put our trust in Allah while He indeed has guided us our ways. And we shall certainly bear with patience all the hurt you may cause us, and in Allah (Alone) let those who trust, put their trust."

versets.ar: 13. وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لِرُسُلِهِمْ لَنُخْرِجَنَّكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِنَا أَوْ لَتَعُودُنَّ فِي مِلَّتِنَا ۖ فَأَوْحَىٰ إِلَيْهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ لَنُهْلِكَنَّ الظَّالِمِينَ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. Et ceux qui ont mécru dirent à leurs messagers: «Nous vous expulserons certainement de notre territoire, à moins que vous ne réintégriez notre religion!» Alors, leur Seigneur leur révéla: «Assurément Nous anéantirons les injustes,
versets.en: 13. And those who disbelieved, said to their Messengers: "Surely, we shall drive you out of our land, or you shall return to our religion." So their Lord inspired them: "Truly, We shall destroy the Zalimun (polytheists, disbelievers and wrong-doers.).

versets.ar: 14. وَلَنُسْكِنَنَّكُمُ الْأَرْضَ مِن بَعْدِهِمْ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَنْ خَافَ مَقَامِي وَخَافَ وَعِيدِ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. et vous établirons dans le pays après eux. Cela est pour celui qui craint Ma présence et craint Ma menace».
versets.en: 14. "And indeed, We shall make you dwell in the land after them. This is for him who fears standing before Me (on the Day of Resurrection or fears My Punishment) and also fears My Threat."

versets.ar: 15. وَاسْتَفْتَحُوا وَخَابَ كُلُّ جَبَّارٍ عَنِيدٍ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Et ils demandèrent [à Allah] la victoire. Et tout tyran insolent fut déçu.
versets.en: 15. But they (the Messengers) sought victory and help [from their Lord (Allah)], and every obstinate, arrogant dictator (who refuses to believe in the Oneness of Allah) was brought to a complete loss and destruction.

versets.ar: 16. مِّن وَرَائِهِ جَهَنَّمُ وَيُسْقَىٰ مِن مَّاءٍ صَدِيدٍ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. L'Enfer est sa destination et il sera abreuvé d'une eau purulente
versets.en: 16. In front of him (every obstinate, arrogant dictator) is Hell, and he will be made to drink boiling, festering water.

versets.ar: 17. يَتَجَرَّعُهُ وَلَا يَكَادُ يُسِيغُهُ وَيَأْتِيهِ الْمَوْتُ مِن كُلِّ مَكَانٍ وَمَا هُوَ بِمَيِّتٍ ۖ وَمِن وَرَائِهِ عَذَابٌ غَلِيظٌ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. qu'il tentera d'avaler à petites gorgées. Mais c'est à peine s'il peut l'avaler. La mort lui viendra de toutes parts, mais il ne mourra pas; et il aura un châtiment terrible.
versets.en: 17. He will sip it unwillingly, and he will find a great difficulty to swallow it down his throat, and death will come to him from every side, yet he will not die and in front of him, will be a great torment.

versets.ar: 18. مَّثَلُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِرَبِّهِمْ ۖ أَعْمَالُهُمْ كَرَمَادٍ اشْتَدَّتْ بِهِ الرِّيحُ فِي يَوْمٍ عَاصِفٍ ۖ لَّا يَقْدِرُونَ مِمَّا كَسَبُوا عَلَىٰ شَيْءٍ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الضَّلَالُ الْبَعِيدُ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. Les œuvres de ceux qui ont mécru en leur Seigneur sont comparables à de la cendre violemment frappée par le vent, dans un jour de tempête. Ils ne tireront aucun profit de ce qu'ils ont acquis. C'est cela l'égarement profond.
versets.en: 18. The parable of those who disbelieve in their Lord is that their works are as ashes, on which the wind blows furiously on a stormy day, they shall not be able to get aught of what they have earned. That is the straying, far away (from the Right Path).

versets.ar: 19. أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ بِالْحَقِّ ۚ إِن يَشَأْ يُذْهِبْكُمْ وَيَأْتِ بِخَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Ne vois-tu pas qu'Allah a créé les cieux et la terre pour une juste raison? S'Il voulait, Il vous ferait disparaître et ferait venir de nouvelles créatures,
versets.en: 19. Do you not see that Allah has created the heavens and the earth with truth? If He will, He can remove you and bring (in your place) a new creation!

versets.ar: 20. وَمَا ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ بِعَزِيزٍ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. et cela n'est nullement difficile pour Allah.
versets.en: 20. And for Allah that is not hard or difficult (i.e. very easy for Allah).

versets.ar: 21. وَبَرَزُوا لِلَّهِ جَمِيعًا فَقَالَ الضُّعَفَاءُ لِلَّذِينَ اسْتَكْبَرُوا إِنَّا كُنَّا لَكُمْ تَبَعًا فَهَلْ أَنتُم مُّغْنُونَ عَنَّا مِنْ عَذَابِ اللَّهِ مِن شَيْءٍ ۚ قَالُوا لَوْ هَدَانَا اللَّهُ لَهَدَيْنَاكُمْ ۖ سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْنَا أَجَزِعْنَا أَمْ صَبَرْنَا مَا لَنَا مِن مَّحِيصٍ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Et tous comparaîtront devant Allah. Puis, les faibles diront à ceux qui s'enflaient d'orgueil: «Nous étions bien vos suiveurs. Pouvez-vous nous être de quelque utilité contre le châtiment d'Allah?» - Alors, les autres diront: «Si Allah nous avait guidés nous vous aurions certainement guidés. Il est indifférent pour nous de nous plaindre ou d'endurer; nous n'avons pas d'échappatoire».
versets.en: 21. And they all shall appear before Allah (on the Day of Resurrection) then the weak will say to those who were arrogant (chiefs): "Verily, we were following you; can you avail us anything from Allah's Torment?" They will say: "Had Allah guided us, we would have guided you. It makes no difference to us (now) whether we rage, or bear (these torments) with patience, there is no place of refuge for us."

versets.ar: 22. وَقَالَ الشَّيْطَانُ لَمَّا قُضِيَ الْأَمْرُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ وَعَدَكُمْ وَعْدَ الْحَقِّ وَوَعَدتُّكُمْ فَأَخْلَفْتُكُمْ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ لِيَ عَلَيْكُم مِّن سُلْطَانٍ إِلَّا أَن دَعَوْتُكُمْ فَاسْتَجَبْتُمْ لِي ۖ فَلَا تَلُومُونِي وَلُومُوا أَنفُسَكُم ۖ مَّا أَنَا بِمُصْرِخِكُمْ وَمَا أَنتُم بِمُصْرِخِيَّ ۖ إِنِّي كَفَرْتُ بِمَا أَشْرَكْتُمُونِ مِن قَبْلُ ۗ إِنَّ الظَّالِمِينَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. Et quand tout sera accompli, le Diable dira: «Certes, Allah vous avait fait une promesse de vérité; tandis que moi, je vous ai fait une promesse que je n'ai pas tenue. Je n'avais aucune autorité sur vous si ce n'est que je vous ai appelés, et que vous m'avez répondu. Ne me faites donc pas de reproches; mais faites-en à vous-mêmes. Je ne vous suis d'aucun secours et vous ne m'êtes d'aucun secours. Je vous renie de m'avoir jadis associé [à Allah]». Certes, un châtiment douloureux attend les injustes [les associateurs].
versets.en: 22. And Shaitan (Satan) will say when the matter has been decided: "Verily, Allah promised you a promise of truth. And I too promised you, but I betrayed you. I had no authority over you except that I called you, so you responded to me. So blame me not, but blame yourselves. I cannot help you, nor can you help me. I deny your former act in associating me (Satan) as a partner with Allah (by obeying me in the life of the world). Verily, there is a painful torment for the Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc.)."

versets.ar: 23. وَأُدْخِلَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِمْ ۖ تَحِيَّتُهُمْ فِيهَا سَلَامٌ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. Et on fera entrer ceux qui croient et font de bonnes œuvres, dans les jardins sous lesquels coulent les ruisseaux, pour y demeurer éternellement, par permission de leur Seigneur. Et là, leur salutation sera: «Salâm» (Paix).
versets.en: 23. And those who believed (in the Oneness of Allah and His Messengers and whatever they brought) and did righteous deeds, will be made to enter Gardens under which rivers flow, - to dwell therein forever (i.e. in Paradise), with the permission of their Lord. Their greeting therein will be: Salam (peace!).

versets.ar: 24. أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ ضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا كَلِمَةً طَيِّبَةً كَشَجَرَةٍ طَيِّبَةٍ أَصْلُهَا ثَابِتٌ وَفَرْعُهَا فِي السَّمَاءِ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. N'as-tu pas vu comment Allah propose en parabole une bonne parole pareille à un bel arbre dont la racine est ferme et la ramure s'élançant dans le ciel?
versets.en: 24. See you not how Allah sets forth a parable? - A goodly word as a goodly tree, whose root is firmly fixed, and its branches (reach) to the sky (i.e. very high).

versets.ar: 25. تُؤْتِي أُكُلَهَا كُلَّ حِينٍ بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهَا ۗ وَيَضْرِبُ اللَّهُ الْأَمْثَالَ لِلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Il donne à tout instant ses fruits, par la grâce de son Seigneur. Allah propose des paraboles à l'intention des gens afin qu'ils s'exhortent.
versets.en: 25. Giving its fruit at all times, by the Leave of its Lord and Allah sets forth parables for mankind in order that they may remember.

versets.ar: 26. وَمَثَلُ كَلِمَةٍ خَبِيثَةٍ كَشَجَرَةٍ خَبِيثَةٍ اجْتُثَّتْ مِن فَوْقِ الْأَرْضِ مَا لَهَا مِن قَرَارٍ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Et une mauvaise parole est pareille à un mauvais arbre, déraciné de la surface de la terre et qui n'a point de stabilité.
versets.en: 26. And the parable of an evil word is that of an evil tree uprooted from the surface of earth having no stability.

versets.ar: 27. يُثَبِّتُ اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِالْقَوْلِ الثَّابِتِ فِي الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا وَفِي الْآخِرَةِ ۖ وَيُضِلُّ اللَّهُ الظَّالِمِينَ ۚ وَيَفْعَلُ اللَّهُ مَا يَشَاءُ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Allah affermit les croyants par une parole ferme, dans la vie présente et dans l'au-delà. Tandis qu'Il égare les injustes. Et Allah fait ce qu'Il veut.
versets.en: 27. Allah will keep firm those who believe, with the word that stands firm in this world (i.e. they will keep on worshipping Allah Alone and none else), and in the Hereafter. And Allah will cause to go astray those who are Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc.), and Allah does what He wills.

versets.ar: 28. ۞ أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى الَّذِينَ بَدَّلُوا نِعْمَتَ اللَّهِ كُفْرًا وَأَحَلُّوا قَوْمَهُمْ دَارَ الْبَوَارِ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Ne vois-tu point ceux qui troquent les bienfaits d'Allah contre l'ingratitude et établissent leur peuple dans la demeure de la perdition
versets.en: 28. Have you not seen those who have changed the Blessings of Allah into disbelief (by denying Prophet Muhammad SAW and his Message of Islam), and caused their people to dwell in the house of destruction?

versets.ar: 29. جَهَنَّمَ يَصْلَوْنَهَا ۖ وَبِئْسَ الْقَرَارُ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. ...l'Enfer, où ils brûleront? Et quel mauvais gîte!
versets.en: 29. Hell, in which they will burn, - and what an evil place to settle in!

versets.ar: 30. وَجَعَلُوا لِلَّهِ أَندَادًا لِّيُضِلُّوا عَن سَبِيلِهِ ۗ قُلْ تَمَتَّعُوا فَإِنَّ مَصِيرَكُمْ إِلَى النَّارِ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Et ils ont donné à Allah des égaux afin d'égarer (les gens) de Son sentier. - Dis: «Jouissez [de cette vie] car votre destination sera le feu».
versets.en: 30. And they set up rivals to Allah, to mislead (men) from His Path! Say: "Enjoy (your brief life)! But certainly, your destination is the (Hell) Fire!"

versets.ar: 31. قُل لِّعِبَادِيَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا يُقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَيُنفِقُوا مِمَّا رَزَقْنَاهُمْ سِرًّا وَعَلَانِيَةً مِّن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِيَ يَوْمٌ لَّا بَيْعٌ فِيهِ وَلَا خِلَالٌ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. Dis à Mes serviteurs qui ont cru, qu'ils accomplissent la Salât et qu'ils dépensent [dans le bien] en secret et en public de ce que Nous leur avons attribué, avant que vienne le jour où il n'y a ni rachat ni amitié.
versets.en: 31. Say (O Muhammad SAW) to 'Ibadi (My slaves) who have believed, that they should perform As-Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat), and spend in charity out of the sustenance We have given them, secretly and openly, before the coming of a Day on which there will be neither mutual bargaining nor befriending.

versets.ar: 32. اللَّهُ الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَأَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَأَخْرَجَ بِهِ مِنَ الثَّمَرَاتِ رِزْقًا لَّكُمْ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ الْفُلْكَ لِتَجْرِيَ فِي الْبَحْرِ بِأَمْرِهِ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ الْأَنْهَارَ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. Allah, c'est Lui qui a crée les cieux et la terre et qui, du ciel, a fait descendre l'eau; grâce à laquelle Il a produit des fruits pour vous nourrir. Il a soumis à votre service les vaisseaux qui, par Son ordre, voguent sur la mer. Et Il a soumis à votre service les rivières.
versets.en: 32. Allah is He Who has created the heavens and the earth and sends down water (rain) from the sky, and thereby brought forth fruits as provision for you; and He has made the ships to be of service to you, that they may sail through the sea by His Command; and He has made rivers (also) to be of service to you.

versets.ar: 33. وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ الشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ دَائِبَيْنِ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. Et pour vous, Il a assujetti le soleil et la lune à une perpétuelle révolution. Et Il vous a assujetti la nuit et le jour.
versets.en: 33. And He has made the sun and the moon, both constantly pursuing their courses, to be of service to you; and He has made the night and the day, to be of service to you.

versets.ar: 34. وَآتَاكُم مِّن كُلِّ مَا سَأَلْتُمُوهُ ۚ وَإِن تَعُدُّوا نِعْمَتَ اللَّهِ لَا تُحْصُوهَا ۗ إِنَّ الْإِنسَانَ لَظَلُومٌ كَفَّارٌ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. Il vous a accordé de tout ce que vous Lui avez demandé. Et si vous comptiez les bienfaits d'Allah, vous ne sauriez les dénombrer. L'homme est vraiment très injuste, très ingrat.
versets.en: 34. And He gave you of all that you asked for, and if you count the Blessings of Allah, never will you be able to count them. Verily! Man is indeed an extreme wrong-doer, - a disbeliever (an extreme ingrate, denies Allah's Blessings by disbelief, and by worshipping others besides Allah, and by disobeying Allah and His Prophet Muhammad SAW).

versets.ar: 35. وَإِذْ قَالَ إِبْرَاهِيمُ رَبِّ اجْعَلْ هَٰذَا الْبَلَدَ آمِنًا وَاجْنُبْنِي وَبَنِيَّ أَن نَّعْبُدَ الْأَصْنَامَ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Et (rappelle-toi) quand Abraham dit: «O mon Seigneur, fais de cette cité un lieu sûr, et préserve-moi ainsi que mes enfants de l'adoration des idoles.
versets.en: 35. And (remember) when Ibrahim (Abraham) said: "O my Lord! Make this city (Makkah) one of peace and security, and keep me and my sons away from worshipping idols.

versets.ar: 36. رَبِّ إِنَّهُنَّ أَضْلَلْنَ كَثِيرًا مِّنَ النَّاسِ ۖ فَمَن تَبِعَنِي فَإِنَّهُ مِنِّي ۖ وَمَنْ عَصَانِي فَإِنَّكَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. O mon Seigneur, elles (les idoles) ont égaré beaucoup de gens. Quiconque me suit est des miens. Quant à celui qui me désobéit... c'est Toi, le Pardonneur, le Très Miséricordieux!
versets.en: 36. "O my Lord! They have indeed led astray many among mankind. But whoso follows me, he verily is of me. And whoso disobeys me, - still You are indeed Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

versets.ar: 37. رَّبَّنَا إِنِّي أَسْكَنتُ مِن ذُرِّيَّتِي بِوَادٍ غَيْرِ ذِي زَرْعٍ عِندَ بَيْتِكَ الْمُحَرَّمِ رَبَّنَا لِيُقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ فَاجْعَلْ أَفْئِدَةً مِّنَ النَّاسِ تَهْوِي إِلَيْهِمْ وَارْزُقْهُم مِّنَ الثَّمَرَاتِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَشْكُرُونَ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. O notre Seigneur, j'ai établi une partie de ma descendance dans une vallée sans agriculture, près de Ta Maison sacrée [la Ka'ba], - ô notre Seigneur - afin qu'ils accomplissent la Salât. Fais donc que se penchent vers eux les cœurs d'une partie des gens. Et nourris-les de fruits. Peut-être seront-ils reconnaissants?
versets.en: 37. "O our Lord! I have made some of my offspring to dwell in an uncultivable valley by Your Sacred House (the Ka'bah at Makkah); in order, O our Lord, that they may perform As-Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat), so fill some hearts among men with love towards them, and (O Allah) provide them with fruits so that they may give thanks.

versets.ar: 38. رَبَّنَا إِنَّكَ تَعْلَمُ مَا نُخْفِي وَمَا نُعْلِنُ ۗ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ مِن شَيْءٍ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِي السَّمَاءِ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. O notre Seigneur, Tu sais, vraiment, ce que nous cachons et ce que nous divulguons: - et rien n'échappe à Allah, ni sur terre, ni au ciel! -
versets.en: 38. "O our Lord! Certainly, You know what we conceal and what we reveal. Nothing on the earth or in the heaven is hidden from Allah.

versets.ar: 39. الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي وَهَبَ لِي عَلَى الْكِبَرِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ وَإِسْحَاقَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّي لَسَمِيعُ الدُّعَاءِ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. Louange à Allah, qui en dépit de ma vieillesse, m'a donné Ismaël et Isaac. Certes, mon Seigneur entend bien les prières.
versets.en: 39. "All the praises and thanks be to Allah, Who has given me in old age Isma'il (Ishmael) and Ishaque (Isaac). Verily! My Lord is indeed the All-Hearer of invocations.

versets.ar: 40. رَبِّ اجْعَلْنِي مُقِيمَ الصَّلَاةِ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِي ۚ رَبَّنَا وَتَقَبَّلْ دُعَاءِ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. O mon Seigneur! Fais que j'accomplisse assidûment la Salât ainsi qu'une partie de ma descendance; exauce ma prière, ô notre Seigneur!
versets.en: 40. "O my Lord! Make me one who performs As-Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat), and (also) from my offspring, our Lord! And accept my invocation.

versets.ar: 41. رَبَّنَا اغْفِرْ لِي وَلِوَالِدَيَّ وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ يَوْمَ يَقُومُ الْحِسَابُ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. O notre Seigneur! pardonne-moi, ainsi qu'à mes père et mère et aux croyants, le jour de la reddition des comptes».
versets.en: 41. "Our Lord! Forgive me and my parents, and (all) the believers on the Day when the reckoning will be established."

versets.ar: 42. وَلَا تَحْسَبَنَّ اللَّهَ غَافِلًا عَمَّا يَعْمَلُ الظَّالِمُونَ ۚ إِنَّمَا يُؤَخِّرُهُمْ لِيَوْمٍ تَشْخَصُ فِيهِ الْأَبْصَارُ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. Et ne pense point qu'Allah soit inattentif à ce que font les injustes. Ils leur accordera un délai jusqu'au jour ou leurs regards se figeront.
versets.en: 42. Consider not that Allah is unaware of that which the Zalimun (polytheists, wrong-doers, etc.) do, but He gives them respite up to a Day when the eyes will stare in horror.

versets.ar: 43. مُهْطِعِينَ مُقْنِعِي رُءُوسِهِمْ لَا يَرْتَدُّ إِلَيْهِمْ طَرْفُهُمْ ۖ وَأَفْئِدَتُهُمْ هَوَاءٌ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. Ils courront [suppliant], levant la tête, les yeux hagards et les cœurs vides.
versets.en: 43. (They will be) hastening forward with necks outstretched, their heads raised up (towards the sky), their gaze returning not towards them and their hearts empty (from thinking because of extreme fear).

versets.ar: 44. وَأَنذِرِ النَّاسَ يَوْمَ يَأْتِيهِمُ الْعَذَابُ فَيَقُولُ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا رَبَّنَا أَخِّرْنَا إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ قَرِيبٍ نُّجِبْ دَعْوَتَكَ وَنَتَّبِعِ الرُّسُلَ ۗ أَوَلَمْ تَكُونُوا أَقْسَمْتُم مِّن قَبْلُ مَا لَكُم مِّن زَوَالٍ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. Et avertis les gens du jour où le châtiment les atteindra et ceux qui auront été injustes diront: «O notre Seigneur accorde-nous un court délai, nous répondrons à Ton appel et suivrons les messagers». - N'avez-vous pas juré auparavant que vous ne deviez jamais disparaître?
versets.en: 44. And warn (O Muhammad SAW) mankind of the Day when the torment will come unto them; then the wrong-doers will say: "Our Lord! Respite us for a little while, we will answer Your Call and follow the Messengers!" (It will be said): "Had you not sworn aforetime that you would not leave (the world for the Hereafter).

versets.ar: 45. وَسَكَنتُمْ فِي مَسَاكِنِ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا أَنفُسَهُمْ وَتَبَيَّنَ لَكُمْ كَيْفَ فَعَلْنَا بِهِمْ وَضَرَبْنَا لَكُمُ الْأَمْثَالَ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. Et vous avez habité, les demeures de ceux qui s'étaient fait du tort à eux-mêmes. Il vous est apparu en toute évidence comment Nous les avions traité et Nous vous avons cité les exemples.
versets.en: 45. "And you dwelt in the dwellings of men who wronged themselves, and it was clear to you how We had dealt with them. And We put forth (many) parables for you."

versets.ar: 46. وَقَدْ مَكَرُوا مَكْرَهُمْ وَعِندَ اللَّهِ مَكْرُهُمْ وَإِن كَانَ مَكْرُهُمْ لِتَزُولَ مِنْهُ الْجِبَالُ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. Ils ont certes comploté. Or leur complot est (inscrit) auprès d'Allah même si leur complot était assez puissant pour faire disparaître les montagnes...
versets.en: 46. Indeed, they planned their plot, and their plot was with Allah, though their plot was a great (one, still) it would never be able to remove the mountains (real mountains or the Islamic law) from their places (as it is of no importance) [Tafsir Ibn Kathir, Vol. 2, Page 597]. [It is said by some interpreters regarding this Verse that the Quraish pagans plotted against Prophet Muhammad SAW to kill him but they failed and were unable to carry out their plot which they plotted].

versets.ar: 47. فَلَا تَحْسَبَنَّ اللَّهَ مُخْلِفَ وَعْدِهِ رُسُلَهُ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ ذُو انتِقَامٍ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. Ne pense point qu'Allah manque à Sa promesse envers Ses messagers. Certes Allah est Tout Puissant et Détenteur du pouvoir de punir,
versets.en: 47. So think not that Allah will fail to keep His Promise to His Messengers. Certainly, Allah is All-Mighty, - All-Able of Retribution.

versets.ar: 48. يَوْمَ تُبَدَّلُ الْأَرْضُ غَيْرَ الْأَرْضِ وَالسَّمَاوَاتُ ۖ وَبَرَزُوا لِلَّهِ الْوَاحِدِ الْقَهَّارِ ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. au jour où la terre sera remplacée par une autre, de même que les cieux et où (les hommes) comparaîtront devant Allah, l'Unique, le Dominateur Suprême.
versets.en: 48. On the Day when the earth will be changed to another earth and so will be the heavens, and they (all creatures) will appear before Allah, the One, the Irresistible.

versets.ar: 49. وَتَرَى الْمُجْرِمِينَ يَوْمَئِذٍ مُّقَرَّنِينَ فِي الْأَصْفَادِ ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. Et ce jour-là, tu verras les coupables, enchaînés les uns aux autres,
versets.en: 49. And you will see the Mujrimun (criminals, disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah Islamic Monotheism, polytheists, disobedient to Allah, etc.) that Day bound together in fetters; [Muqarranun in fetters; mean:- with their hands and feet tied to their necks with chains.]

versets.ar: 50. سَرَابِيلُهُم مِّن قَطِرَانٍ وَتَغْشَىٰ وُجُوهَهُمُ النَّارُ ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. leurs tuniques seront de goudron et le feu couvrira leurs visages.
versets.en: 50. Their garments will be of pitch, and fire will cover their faces.

versets.ar: 51. لِيَجْزِيَ اللَّهُ كُلَّ نَفْسٍ مَّا كَسَبَتْ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَرِيعُ الْحِسَابِ ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. (Tout cela) afin qu'Allah rétribue chaque âme de ce qu'elle aura acquis. Certes Allah est prompt dans Ses comptes.
versets.en: 51. That Allah may requite each person according to what he has earned. Truly, Allah is Swift at reckoning.

versets.ar: 52. هَٰذَا بَلَاغٌ لِّلنَّاسِ وَلِيُنذَرُوا بِهِ وَلِيَعْلَمُوا أَنَّمَا هُوَ إِلَٰهٌ وَاحِدٌ وَلِيَذَّكَّرَ أُولُو الْأَلْبَابِ ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. Ceci est un message (le Coran) pour les gens afin qu'ils soient avertis, qu'ils sachent qu'Il n'est qu'un Dieu unique, et pour que les doués d'intelligence s'exhortent.
versets.en: 52. This (Quran) is a Message for mankind (and a clear proof against them), in order that they may be warned thereby, and that they may know that He is the only One Ilah (God - Allah) - (none has the right to be worshipped but Allah), and that men of understanding may take heed.

versets.ar: 1. الر ۚ تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْكِتَابِ وَقُرْآنٍ مُّبِينٍ ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. Alif, Lâm, Râ. Voici les versets du Livre et d'une Lecture explicite.
versets.en: 1. Alif-Lam-Ra. [These letters are one of the miracles of the Quran, and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings]. These are the Verses of the Book, and a plain Quran.

versets.ar: 2. رُّبَمَا يَوَدُّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَوْ كَانُوا مُسْلِمِينَ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. [Le Jour du Jugement Dernier] les mécréants voudraient avoir été Musulmans [soumis].
versets.en: 2. Perhaps (often) will those who disbelieve wish that they were Muslims [those who have submitted themselves to Allah's Will in Islam Islamic Monotheism, this will be on the Day of Resurrection when they will see the disbelievers going to Hell and the Muslims going to Paradise].

versets.ar: 3. ذَرْهُمْ يَأْكُلُوا وَيَتَمَتَّعُوا وَيُلْهِهِمُ الْأَمَلُ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Laisse-les manger, jouir (un temps), et être distraits par l'espoir; car bientôt ils sauront!
versets.en: 3. Leave them to eat and enjoy, and let them be preoccupied with (false) hope. They will come to know!

versets.ar: 4. وَمَا أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا وَلَهَا كِتَابٌ مَّعْلُومٌ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Or Nous ne détruisons aucune cité sans qu'elle n'ait eu [un terme fixé en] une Ecriture connue.
versets.en: 4. And never did We destroy a township but there was a known decree for it.

versets.ar: 5. مَّا تَسْبِقُ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَمَا يَسْتَأْخِرُونَ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Nulle communauté ne devance son terme, ni ne le retarde.
versets.en: 5. No nation can anticipate its term, nor delay it.

versets.ar: 6. وَقَالُوا يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِي نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ الذِّكْرُ إِنَّكَ لَمَجْنُونٌ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Et ils (les mecquois) disent: «O toi sur qui on a fait descendre le Coran, tu es certainement fou!
versets.en: 6. And they say: "O you (Muhammad SAW) to whom the Dhikr (the Quran) has been sent down! Verily, you are a mad man.

versets.ar: 7. لَّوْ مَا تَأْتِينَا بِالْمَلَائِكَةِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. Pourquoi ne nous es-tu pas venu avec les Anges, si tu es du nombre des véridiques?»
versets.en: 7. "Why do you not bring angels to us if you are of the truthful ones?"

versets.ar: 8. مَا نُنَزِّلُ الْمَلَائِكَةَ إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ وَمَا كَانُوا إِذًا مُّنظَرِينَ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Nous ne faisons descendre les Anges qu'avec la vérité; et alors, il ne leur sera pas accordé de répit [à ces impies].
versets.en: 8. We send not the angels down except with the truth (i.e. for torment, etc.), and in that case, they (the disbelievers) would have no respite!

versets.ar: 9. إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا الذِّكْرَ وَإِنَّا لَهُ لَحَافِظُونَ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. En vérité c'est Nous qui avons fait descendre le Coran, et c'est Nous qui en sommes gardien.
versets.en: 9. Verily We: It is We Who have sent down the Dhikr (i.e. the Quran) and surely, We will guard it (from corruption).

versets.ar: 10. وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ فِي شِيَعِ الْأَوَّلِينَ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Et nous avons certes envoyé, avant toi, [des Messagers] parmi les peuples des Anciens.
versets.en: 10. Indeed, We sent Messengers before you (O Muhammad SAW) amongst the sects (communities) of old.

versets.ar: 11. وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. Et pas un Messager ne leur est venu sans qu'ils s'en soient moqués.
versets.en: 11. And never came a Messenger to them but they did mock him.

versets.ar: 12. كَذَٰلِكَ نَسْلُكُهُ فِي قُلُوبِ الْمُجْرِمِينَ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. C'est ainsi que Nous faisons pénétrer (la mécréance) dans les cœurs des coupables.
versets.en: 12. Thus do We let it (polytheism and disbelief) enter into the hearts of the Mujrimun [criminals, polytheists, pagans, etc. (because of their mockery at the Messengers)].

versets.ar: 13. لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِ ۖ وَقَدْ خَلَتْ سُنَّةُ الْأَوَّلِينَ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. Ils ne croiront pas en lui [le Messager ou le Coran] bien que se soit accompli le sort traditionnel des anciens.
versets.en: 13. They would not believe in it (the Quran), and already the example of (Allah's punishment of) the ancients (who disbelieved) has gone forth.

versets.ar: 14. وَلَوْ فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِم بَابًا مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ فَظَلُّوا فِيهِ يَعْرُجُونَ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. Et même si Nous ouvrions pour eux une porte du ciel, et qu'ils pussent y monter,
versets.en: 14. And even if We opened to them a gate from the heaven and they were to continue ascending thereto,

versets.ar: 15. لَقَالُوا إِنَّمَا سُكِّرَتْ أَبْصَارُنَا بَلْ نَحْنُ قَوْمٌ مَّسْحُورُونَ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. ils diraient: «Vraiment nos yeux sont voilés. Mais plutôt, nous sommes des gens ensorcelés».
versets.en: 15. They would surely say: "Our eyes have been (as if) dazzled. Nay, we are a people bewitched."

versets.ar: 16. وَلَقَدْ جَعَلْنَا فِي السَّمَاءِ بُرُوجًا وَزَيَّنَّاهَا لِلنَّاظِرِينَ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Certes Nous avons placé dans le ciel des constellations et Nous l'avons embelli pour ceux qui regardent.
versets.en: 16. And indeed, We have put the big stars in the heaven and We beautified it for the beholders.

versets.ar: 17. وَحَفِظْنَاهَا مِن كُلِّ شَيْطَانٍ رَّجِيمٍ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Et Nous l'avons protégé contre tout diable banni.
versets.en: 17. And We have guarded it (near heaven) from every outcast Shaitan (devil).

versets.ar: 18. إِلَّا مَنِ اسْتَرَقَ السَّمْعَ فَأَتْبَعَهُ شِهَابٌ مُّبِينٌ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. A moins que l'un d'eux parvienne subrepticement à écouter, une flamme brillante alors le poursuit.
versets.en: 18. Except him (devil) that gains hearing by stealing, he is pursued by a clear flaming fire.

versets.ar: 19. وَالْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَاهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ وَأَنبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ مَّوْزُونٍ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Et quant à la terre, Nous l'avons étalée et y avons placé des montagnes (immobiles) et y avons fait pousser toute chose harmonieusement proportionnée.
versets.en: 19. And the earth We spread out, and placed therein firm mountains, and caused to grow therein all kinds of things in due proportion.

versets.ar: 20. وَجَعَلْنَا لَكُمْ فِيهَا مَعَايِشَ وَمَن لَّسْتُمْ لَهُ بِرَازِقِينَ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. Et Nous y avons placé des vivres pour vous, et (placé aussi pour vous) des êtres que vous ne nourrissez pas.
versets.en: 20. And We have provided therein means of living, for you and for those whom you provide not [moving (living) creatures, cattle, beasts, and other animals].

versets.ar: 21. وَإِن مِّن شَيْءٍ إِلَّا عِندَنَا خَزَائِنُهُ وَمَا نُنَزِّلُهُ إِلَّا بِقَدَرٍ مَّعْلُومٍ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Et il n'est rien dont Nous n'ayons les réserves et Nous ne le faisons descendre que dans une mesure déterminée.
versets.en: 21. And there is not a thing, but with Us are the stores thereof. And We send it not down except in a known measure.

versets.ar: 22. وَأَرْسَلْنَا الرِّيَاحَ لَوَاقِحَ فَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَأَسْقَيْنَاكُمُوهُ وَمَا أَنتُمْ لَهُ بِخَازِنِينَ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. Et Nous envoyons les vents fécondants; et Nous faisons alors descendre du ciel une eau dont Nous vous abreuvons et que vous n'êtes pas en mesure de conserver.
versets.en: 22. And We send the winds fertilizing (to fill heavily the clouds with water), then caused the water (rain) to descend from the sky, and We gave it to you to drink, and it is not you who are the owners of its stores [i.e. to give water to whom you like or to withhold it from whom you like].

versets.ar: 23. وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ نُحْيِي وَنُمِيتُ وَنَحْنُ الْوَارِثُونَ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. Et c'est bien Nous qui donnons la vie et donnons la mort, et c'est Nous qui sommes l'héritier [de tout].
versets.en: 23. And certainly We! We it is Who give life, and cause death, and We are the Inheritors.

versets.ar: 24. وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْنَا الْمُسْتَقْدِمِينَ مِنكُمْ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْنَا الْمُسْتَأْخِرِينَ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Et Nous connaissons certes ceux qui parmi vous ont avancé et Nous connaissons ceux qui tardent encore.
versets.en: 24. And indeed, We know the first generations of you who had passed away, and indeed, We know the present generations of you (mankind), and also those who will come afterwards.

versets.ar: 25. وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُ حَكِيمٌ عَلِيمٌ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Certes, c'est ton Seigneur qui les rassemblera. Car c'est Lui le Sage, l'Omniscient.
versets.en: 25. And verily, your Lord will gather them together. Truly, He is All-Wise, All-Knowing.

versets.ar: 26. وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنسَانَ مِن صَلْصَالٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Nous créâmes l'homme d'une argile crissante, extraite d'une boue malléable.
versets.en: 26. And indeed, We created man from sounding clay of altered black smooth mud.

versets.ar: 27. وَالْجَانَّ خَلَقْنَاهُ مِن قَبْلُ مِن نَّارِ السَّمُومِ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Et quant au djinn, Nous l'avions auparavant créé d'un feu d'une chaleur ardente.
versets.en: 27. And the jinn, We created aforetime from the smokeless flame of fire.

versets.ar: 28. وَإِذْ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ إِنِّي خَالِقٌ بَشَرًا مِّن صَلْصَالٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Et lorsque ton Seigneur dit aux Anges: «Je vais créer un homme d'argile crissante, extraite d'une boue malléable,
versets.en: 28. And (remember) when your Lord said to the angels: "I am going to create a man (Adam) from sounding clay of altered black smooth mud.

versets.ar: 29. فَإِذَا سَوَّيْتُهُ وَنَفَخْتُ فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِي فَقَعُوا لَهُ سَاجِدِينَ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. et dès que Je l'aurai harmonieusement formé et lui aurai insufflé Mon souffle de vie, jetez-vous alors, prosternés devant lui».
versets.en: 29. "So, when I have fashioned him completely and breathed into him (Adam) the soul which I created for him, then fall (you) down prostrating yourselves unto him."

versets.ar: 30. فَسَجَدَ الْمَلَائِكَةُ كُلُّهُمْ أَجْمَعُونَ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Alors, les Anges se prosternèrent tous ensemble,
versets.en: 30. So, the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together.

versets.ar: 31. إِلَّا إِبْلِيسَ أَبَىٰ أَن يَكُونَ مَعَ السَّاجِدِينَ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. excepté Iblis qui refusa d'être avec les prosternés.
versets.en: 31. Except Iblis (Satan), - he refused to be among the prostrators.

versets.ar: 32. قَالَ يَا إِبْلِيسُ مَا لَكَ أَلَّا تَكُونَ مَعَ السَّاجِدِينَ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. Alors [Allah] dit: «O Iblis, pourquoi n'es-tu pas au nombre des prosternés?»
versets.en: 32. (Allah) said: "O Iblis (Satan)! What is your reason for not being among the prostrators?"

versets.ar: 33. قَالَ لَمْ أَكُن لِّأَسْجُدَ لِبَشَرٍ خَلَقْتَهُ مِن صَلْصَالٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. Il dit: «Je ne puis me prosterner devant un homme que Tu as créé d'argile crissante, extraite d'une boue malléable».
versets.en: 33. [Iblis (Satan)] said: "I am not the one to prostrate myself to a human being, whom You created from sounding clay of altered black smooth mud."

versets.ar: 34. قَالَ فَاخْرُجْ مِنْهَا فَإِنَّكَ رَجِيمٌ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. - Et [Allah] dit: «Sors de là [du Paradis], car te voilà banni!
versets.en: 34. (Allah) said: "Then, get out from here, for verily, you are Rajim (an outcast or a cursed one)." [Tafsir At-Tabari]

versets.ar: 35. وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكَ اللَّعْنَةَ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الدِّينِ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Et malédiction sur toi, jusqu'au Jour de la rétribution!»
versets.en: 35. "And verily, the curse shall be upon you till the Day of Recompense (i.e. the Day of Resurrection)."

versets.ar: 36. قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرْنِي إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. - Il dit: «O mon Seigneur, donne-moi donc un délai jusqu'au jour où ils (les gens) seront ressuscités».
versets.en: 36. [Iblis (Satan)] said: "O my Lord! Give me then respite till the Day they (the dead) will be resurrected."

versets.ar: 37. قَالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ الْمُنظَرِينَ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. [Allah] dit: «tu es de ceux à qui ce délai est accordé,
versets.en: 37. Allah said: "Then, verily, you are of those reprieved,

versets.ar: 38. إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْوَقْتِ الْمَعْلُومِ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. jusqu'au jour de l'instant connu» [d'Allah].
versets.en: 38. "Till the Day of the time appointed."

versets.ar: 39. قَالَ رَبِّ بِمَا أَغْوَيْتَنِي لَأُزَيِّنَنَّ لَهُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَأُغْوِيَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. - Il dit: «O mon Seigneur, parce que Tu m'as induit en erreur, eh bien je leur enjoliverai la vie sur terre et les égarerai tous,
versets.en: 39. [Iblis (Satan)] said: "O my Lord! Because you misled me, I shall indeed adorn the path of error for them (mankind) on the earth, and I shall mislead them all.

versets.ar: 40. إِلَّا عِبَادَكَ مِنْهُمُ الْمُخْلَصِينَ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. à l'exception, parmi eux, de Tes serviteurs élus.»
versets.en: 40. "Except Your chosen, (guided) slaves among them."

versets.ar: 41. قَالَ هَٰذَا صِرَاطٌ عَلَيَّ مُسْتَقِيمٌ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. - «[Allah] dit: voici une voie droite [qui mène] vers Moi.
versets.en: 41. (Allah) said: "This is the Way which will lead straight to Me."

versets.ar: 42. إِنَّ عِبَادِي لَيْسَ لَكَ عَلَيْهِمْ سُلْطَانٌ إِلَّا مَنِ اتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ الْغَاوِينَ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. Sur Mes serviteurs tu n'auras aucune autorité, excepté sur celui qui te suivra parmi les dévoyés.
versets.en: 42. "Certainly, you shall have no authority over My slaves, except those who follow you of the Ghawin (Mushrikun and those who go astray, criminals, polytheists, and evil-doers, etc.).

versets.ar: 43. وَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ لَمَوْعِدُهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. Et l'Enfer sera sûrement leur lieu de rendez-vous à tous.
versets.en: 43. "And surely, Hell is the promised place for them all.

versets.ar: 44. لَهَا سَبْعَةُ أَبْوَابٍ لِّكُلِّ بَابٍ مِّنْهُمْ جُزْءٌ مَّقْسُومٌ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. Il a sept portes; et chaque porte en a sa part déterminée».
versets.en: 44. "It (Hell) has seven gates, for each of those gates is a (special) class (of sinners) assigned.

versets.ar: 45. إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. Certes, les pieux seront dans des jardins avec des sources.
versets.en: 45. "Truly! The Muttaqun (pious and righteous persons - see V. 2:2) will be amidst Gardens and water-springs (Paradise).

versets.ar: 46. ادْخُلُوهَا بِسَلَامٍ آمِنِينَ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. «Entrez-y en paix et en sécurité».
versets.en: 46. "(It will be said to them): 'Enter therein (Paradise), in peace and security.'

versets.ar: 47. وَنَزَعْنَا مَا فِي صُدُورِهِم مِّنْ غِلٍّ إِخْوَانًا عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مُّتَقَابِلِينَ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. Et Nous aurons arraché toute rancune de leurs poitrines: et ils se sentiront frères, faisant face les uns aux autres sur des lits.
versets.en: 47. "And We shall remove from their breasts any sense of injury (that they may have), (So they will be like) brothers facing each other on thrones.

versets.ar: 48. لَا يَمَسُّهُمْ فِيهَا نَصَبٌ وَمَا هُم مِّنْهَا بِمُخْرَجِينَ ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. Nulle fatigue ne les y touchera. Et on ne les en fera pas sortir.
versets.en: 48. "No sense of fatigue shall touch them, nor shall they (ever) be asked to leave it."

versets.ar: 49. ۞ نَبِّئْ عِبَادِي أَنِّي أَنَا الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. Informe Mes serviteurs que c'est Moi le Pardonneur, le Très Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 49. Declare (O Muhammad SAW) unto My slaves, that truly, I am the Oft-Forgiving, the Most-Merciful.

versets.ar: 50. وَأَنَّ عَذَابِي هُوَ الْعَذَابُ الْأَلِيمُ ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. et que Mon châtiment est certes le châtiment douloureux.
versets.en: 50. And that My Torment is indeed the most painful torment.

versets.ar: 51. وَنَبِّئْهُمْ عَن ضَيْفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. Et informe-les au sujet des hôtes d'Abraham
versets.en: 51. And tell them about the guests (the angels) of Ibrahim (Abraham).

versets.ar: 52. إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا سَلَامًا قَالَ إِنَّا مِنكُمْ وَجِلُونَ ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. Quand ils entrèrent chez lui et dirent: «Salâm» - Il dit: «Nous avons peur de vous».
versets.en: 52. When they entered unto him, and said: Salaman (peace)! [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Indeed! We are afraid of you."

versets.ar: 53. قَالُوا لَا تَوْجَلْ إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَامٍ عَلِيمٍ ﴿53﴾
versets.fr: 53. Ils dirent: «N'aie pas peur! Nous t'annonçons une bonne nouvelle, [la naissance] d'un garçon plein de savoir».
versets.en: 53. They (the angels) said: "Do not be afraid! We give you glad tidings of a boy (son) possessing much knowledge and wisdom."

versets.ar: 54. قَالَ أَبَشَّرْتُمُونِي عَلَىٰ أَن مَّسَّنِيَ الْكِبَرُ فَبِمَ تُبَشِّرُونَ ﴿54﴾
versets.fr: 54. Il dit: «M'annoncez-vous [cette nouvelle] alors que la vieillesse m'a touché? Que m'annoncez-vous donc?»
versets.en: 54. [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Do you give me glad tidings (of a son) when old age has overtaken me? Of what then is your news?"

versets.ar: 55. قَالُوا بَشَّرْنَاكَ بِالْحَقِّ فَلَا تَكُن مِّنَ الْقَانِطِينَ ﴿55﴾
versets.fr: 55. - Ils dirent: «Nous t'annonçons la vérité. Ne sois donc pas de ceux qui désespèrent».
versets.en: 55. They (the angels) said: "We give you glad tidings in truth. So be not of the despairing ones."

versets.ar: 56. قَالَ وَمَن يَقْنَطُ مِن رَّحْمَةِ رَبِّهِ إِلَّا الضَّالُّونَ ﴿56﴾
versets.fr: 56. - Il dit: «Et qui désespère de la miséricorde de son Seigneur, sinon les égarés?»
versets.en: 56. [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "And who despairs of the Mercy of his Lord except those who are astray?"

versets.ar: 57. قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ أَيُّهَا الْمُرْسَلُونَ ﴿57﴾
versets.fr: 57. Et il [leur] dit: «Que voulez-vous, ô envoyés d'Allah?»
versets.en: 57. [Ibrahim (Abraham) again] said: "What then is the business on which you have come, O Messengers?"

versets.ar: 58. قَالُوا إِنَّا أُرْسِلْنَا إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ مُّجْرِمِينَ ﴿58﴾
versets.fr: 58. - Ils dirent: «En vérité, nous sommes envoyés à des gens criminels,
versets.en: 58. They (the angels) said: "We have been sent to a people who are Mujrimun (criminals, disbelievers, polytheists, sinners).

versets.ar: 59. إِلَّا آلَ لُوطٍ إِنَّا لَمُنَجُّوهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ ﴿59﴾
versets.fr: 59. à l'exception de la famille de Lot que nous sauverons tous
versets.en: 59. "(All) except the family of Lout (Lot). Them all we are surely going to save (from destruction).

versets.ar: 60. إِلَّا امْرَأَتَهُ قَدَّرْنَا ۙ إِنَّهَا لَمِنَ الْغَابِرِينَ ﴿60﴾
versets.fr: 60. sauf sa femme.«Nous (Allah) avions déterminé qu'elle sera du nombre des exterminés.
versets.en: 60. "Except his wife, of whom We have decreed that she shall be of those who remain behind (i.e. she will be destroyed)."

versets.ar: 61. فَلَمَّا جَاءَ آلَ لُوطٍ الْمُرْسَلُونَ ﴿61﴾
versets.fr: 61. Puis lorsque les envoyés vinrent auprès de la famille de Lot
versets.en: 61. Then, when the Messengers (the angels) came unto the family of Lout (Lot).

versets.ar: 62. قَالَ إِنَّكُمْ قَوْمٌ مُّنكَرُونَ ﴿62﴾
versets.fr: 62. celui-ci dit: «Vous êtes [pour moi] des gens inconnus».
versets.en: 62. He said: "Verily! You are people unknown to me."

versets.ar: 63. قَالُوا بَلْ جِئْنَاكَ بِمَا كَانُوا فِيهِ يَمْتَرُونَ ﴿63﴾
versets.fr: 63. - Ils dirent: «Nous sommes plutôt venus à toi en apportant (le châtiment) à propos duquel ils doutaient.
versets.en: 63. They said: "Nay, we have come to you with that (torment) which they have been doubting.

versets.ar: 64. وَأَتَيْنَاكَ بِالْحَقِّ وَإِنَّا لَصَادِقُونَ ﴿64﴾
versets.fr: 64. Et nous venons à toi avec la vérité. Et nous sommes véridiques.
versets.en: 64. "And we have brought to you the truth (the news of the destruction of your nation) and certainly, we tell the truth.

versets.ar: 65. فَأَسْرِ بِأَهْلِكَ بِقِطْعٍ مِّنَ اللَّيْلِ وَاتَّبِعْ أَدْبَارَهُمْ وَلَا يَلْتَفِتْ مِنكُمْ أَحَدٌ وَامْضُوا حَيْثُ تُؤْمَرُونَ ﴿65﴾
versets.fr: 65. Pars donc avec ta famille en parie de nuit et suis leurs arrières; et que nul d'entre vous ne se retourne. Et allez là où on vous le commande».
versets.en: 65. "Then travel in a part of the night with your family, and you go behind them in the rear, and let no one amongst you look back, but go on to where you are ordered."

versets.ar: 66. وَقَضَيْنَا إِلَيْهِ ذَٰلِكَ الْأَمْرَ أَنَّ دَابِرَ هَٰؤُلَاءِ مَقْطُوعٌ مُّصْبِحِينَ ﴿66﴾
versets.fr: 66. Et Nous lui annonçâmes cet ordre: que ces gens-là, au matin, seront anéantis jusqu'au dernier.
versets.en: 66. And We made known this decree to him, that the root of those (sinners) was to be cut off in the early morning.

versets.ar: 67. وَجَاءَ أَهْلُ الْمَدِينَةِ يَسْتَبْشِرُونَ ﴿67﴾
versets.fr: 67. Et les habitants de la ville (Sodome) vinrent [à lui] dans la joie.
versets.en: 67. And the inhabitants of the city came rejoicing (at the news of the young men's arrival).

versets.ar: 68. قَالَ إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ ضَيْفِي فَلَا تَفْضَحُونِ ﴿68﴾
versets.fr: 68. - Il dit: «Ceux-ci sont mes hôtes, ne me déshonorez donc pas.
versets.en: 68. [Lout (Lot)] said: "Verily! these are my guests, so shame me not.

versets.ar: 69. وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَلَا تُخْزُونِ ﴿69﴾
versets.fr: 69. Et craignez Allah. Et ne me couvrez pas d'ignominie.»
versets.en: 69. "And fear Allah and disgrace me not."

versets.ar: 70. قَالُوا أَوَلَمْ نَنْهَكَ عَنِ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿70﴾
versets.fr: 70. Ils dirent: «Ne t'avions-nous pas interdit de [recevoir] du monde?»
versets.en: 70. They (people of the city) said: "Did we not forbid you to entertain (or protect) any of the 'Alamin (people, foreigners, strangers, etc. from us)?"

versets.ar: 71. قَالَ هَٰؤُلَاءِ بَنَاتِي إِن كُنتُمْ فَاعِلِينَ ﴿71﴾
versets.fr: 71. Il dit: «Voici mes filles, si vous voulez faire [quelque chose]!»
versets.en: 71. [Lout (Lot)] said: "These (the girls of the nation) are my daughters (to marry lawfully), if you must act (so)."

versets.ar: 72. لَعَمْرُكَ إِنَّهُمْ لَفِي سَكْرَتِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ ﴿72﴾
versets.fr: 72. Par ta vie! ils se confondaient dans leur délire.
versets.en: 72. Verily, by your life (O Muhammad SAW), in their wild intoxication, they were wandering blindly.

versets.ar: 73. فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّيْحَةُ مُشْرِقِينَ ﴿73﴾
versets.fr: 73. Alors, au lever du soleil le Cri (la catastrophe) les saisit.
versets.en: 73. So As-Saihah (torment - awful cry, etc.) overtook them at the time of sunrise;

versets.ar: 74. فَجَعَلْنَا عَالِيَهَا سَافِلَهَا وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِّن سِجِّيلٍ ﴿74﴾
versets.fr: 74. Et Nous renversâmes [la ville] de fond en comble et fîmes pleuvoir sur eux des pierres d'argile dure.
versets.en: 74. And We turned (the towns of Sodom in Palestine) upside down and rained down on them stones of baked clay.

versets.ar: 75. إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِّلْمُتَوَسِّمِينَ ﴿75﴾
versets.fr: 75. Voilà vraiment des preuves, pour ceux qui savent observer!
versets.en: 75. Surely! In this are signs, for those who see (or understand or learn the lessons from the Signs of Allah).

versets.ar: 76. وَإِنَّهَا لَبِسَبِيلٍ مُّقِيمٍ ﴿76﴾
versets.fr: 76. Elle [cette ville] se trouvait sur un chemin connu de tous.
versets.en: 76. And verily! They (the cities) were right on the highroad (from Makkah to Syria i.e. the place where the Dead Sea is now).

versets.ar: 77. إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿77﴾
versets.fr: 77. Voilà vraiment une exhortation pour les croyants!
versets.en: 77. Surely! Therein is indeed a sign for the believers.

versets.ar: 78. وَإِن كَانَ أَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ لَظَالِمِينَ ﴿78﴾
versets.fr: 78. Et les habitants d'al-Aïka étaient [aussi] des injustes.
versets.en: 78. And the dwellers in the wood [i.e. the people of Madyan (Midian) to whom Prophet Shu'aib was sent by Allah), were also Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc.).

versets.ar: 79. فَانتَقَمْنَا مِنْهُمْ وَإِنَّهُمَا لَبِإِمَامٍ مُّبِينٍ ﴿79﴾
versets.fr: 79. Nous Nous sommes donc vengés d'eux. Et ces deux [cités], vraiment, sont sur une route bien évidente [que vous connaissez].
versets.en: 79. So, We took vengeance on them. They are both on an open highway, plain to see.

versets.ar: 80. وَلَقَدْ كَذَّبَ أَصْحَابُ الْحِجْرِ الْمُرْسَلِينَ ﴿80﴾
versets.fr: 80. Certes, les gens d'al-Hijr ont traité de menteurs les messagers.
versets.en: 80. And verily, the dwellers of Al-Hijr (the rocky tract) denied the Messengers.

versets.ar: 81. وَآتَيْنَاهُمْ آيَاتِنَا فَكَانُوا عَنْهَا مُعْرِضِينَ ﴿81﴾
versets.fr: 81. Nous leur avons montré Nos miracles, mais ils s'en étaient détournés.
versets.en: 81. And We gave them Our Signs, but they were averse to them.

versets.ar: 82. وَكَانُوا يَنْحِتُونَ مِنَ الْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا آمِنِينَ ﴿82﴾
versets.fr: 82. Et ils taillaient des maisons dans les montagnes, vivant en sécurité.
versets.en: 82. And they used to hew out dwellings from the mountains (feeling themselves) secure.

versets.ar: 83. فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّيْحَةُ مُصْبِحِينَ ﴿83﴾
versets.fr: 83. Puis, au matin, le Cri les saisit.
versets.en: 83. But As-Saihah (torment - awful cry etc.) overtook them in the early morning (of the fourth day of their promised punishment days).

versets.ar: 84. فَمَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ ﴿84﴾
versets.fr: 84. Ce qu'ils avaient acquis ne leur a donc point profité.
versets.en: 84. And all that which they used to earn availed them not.

versets.ar: 85. وَمَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ ۗ وَإِنَّ السَّاعَةَ لَآتِيَةٌ ۖ فَاصْفَحِ الصَّفْحَ الْجَمِيلَ ﴿85﴾
versets.fr: 85. Et Nous n'avons créé les cieux et la terre, et ce qui est entre eux, que pour une juste raison. Et l'Heure [sans aucun doute] arrivera! Pardonne-[leur] donc d'un beau pardon.
versets.en: 85. And We created not the heavens and the earth and all that is between them except with truth, and the Hour is surely coming, so overlook (O Muhammad SAW), their faults with gracious forgiveness. [This was before the ordainment of Jihad holy fighting in Allah's Cause].

versets.ar: 86. إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ الْخَلَّاقُ الْعَلِيمُ ﴿86﴾
versets.fr: 86. Ton Seigneur, c'est Lui vraiment le grand Créateur, l'Omniscient.
versets.en: 86. Verily, your Lord is the All-Knowing Creator.

versets.ar: 87. وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَاكَ سَبْعًا مِّنَ الْمَثَانِي وَالْقُرْآنَ الْعَظِيمَ ﴿87﴾
versets.fr: 87. Nous t'avons certes donné «les sept versets que l'on répète», ainsi que le Coran sublime.
versets.en: 87. And indeed, We have bestowed upon you seven of Al-Mathani (the seven repeatedly recited Verses), (i.e. Surat Al-Fatiha) and the Grand Quran.

versets.ar: 88. لَا تَمُدَّنَّ عَيْنَيْكَ إِلَىٰ مَا مَتَّعْنَا بِهِ أَزْوَاجًا مِّنْهُمْ وَلَا تَحْزَنْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَاخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿88﴾
versets.fr: 88. Ne regarde surtout pas avec envie les choses dont Nous avons donné jouissance temporaire à certains couples d'entre eux, ne t'afflige pas à leur sujet et abaisse ton aile pour les croyants.
versets.en: 88. Look not with your eyes ambitiously at what We have bestowed on certain classes of them (the disbelievers), nor grieve over them. And lower your wings for the believers (be courteous to the fellow-believers).

versets.ar: 89. وَقُلْ إِنِّي أَنَا النَّذِيرُ الْمُبِينُ ﴿89﴾
versets.fr: 89. Et dis: «Je suis l'avertisseur évident» (d'un châtiment),
versets.en: 89. And say: "I am indeed a plain warner."

versets.ar: 90. كَمَا أَنزَلْنَا عَلَى الْمُقْتَسِمِينَ ﴿90﴾
versets.fr: 90. De même que Nous avons fait descendre [le châtiment] sur ceux qui ont juré (entre eux),
versets.en: 90. As We have sent down on the dividers, (Quraish pagans or Jews and Christians).

versets.ar: 91. الَّذِينَ جَعَلُوا الْقُرْآنَ عِضِينَ ﴿91﴾
versets.fr: 91. ceux qui ont fait du Coran des fractions diverses, (pour créer des doutes).
versets.en: 91. Who have made the Quran into parts. (i.e. believed in a part and disbelieved in the other).

versets.ar: 92. فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَسْأَلَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ ﴿92﴾
versets.fr: 92. Par ton Seigneur! Nous les interrogerons tous
versets.en: 92. So, by your Lord (O Muhammad SAW), We shall certainly call all of them to account.

versets.ar: 93. عَمَّا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ ﴿93﴾
versets.fr: 93. sur ce qu'ils œuvraient.
versets.en: 93. For all that they used to do.

versets.ar: 94. فَاصْدَعْ بِمَا تُؤْمَرُ وَأَعْرِضْ عَنِ الْمُشْرِكِينَ ﴿94﴾
versets.fr: 94. Expose donc clairement ce qu'on t'a commandé et détourne-toi des associateurs.
versets.en: 94. Therefore proclaim openly (Allah's Message Islamic Monotheism) that which you are commanded, and turn away from Al-Mushrikun (polytheists, idolaters, and disbelievers, etc. - see V. 2:105).

versets.ar: 95. إِنَّا كَفَيْنَاكَ الْمُسْتَهْزِئِينَ ﴿95﴾
versets.fr: 95. Nous t'avons effectivement défendu vis-à-vis des railleurs.
versets.en: 95. Truly! We will suffice you against the scoffers.

versets.ar: 96. الَّذِينَ يَجْعَلُونَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ ۚ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ ﴿96﴾
versets.fr: 96. Ceux qui associent à Allah une autre divinité. Mais ils sauront bientôt.
versets.en: 96. Who set up along with Allah another ilah (god), they will come to know.

versets.ar: 97. وَلَقَدْ نَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ يَضِيقُ صَدْرُكَ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ ﴿97﴾
versets.fr: 97. Et Nous savons certes que ta poitrine se serre, à cause de ce qu'ils disent.
versets.en: 97. Indeed, We know that your breast is straitened at what they say.

versets.ar: 98. فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَكُن مِّنَ السَّاجِدِينَ ﴿98﴾
versets.fr: 98. Glorifie donc Ton Seigneur par Sa louange et sois de ceux qui se prosternent;
versets.en: 98. So glorify the praises of your Lord and be of those who prostrate themselves (to Him).

versets.ar: 99. وَاعْبُدْ رَبَّكَ حَتَّىٰ يَأْتِيَكَ الْيَقِينُ ﴿99﴾
versets.fr: 99. et adore ton Seigneur jusqu'à ce que te vienne la certitude (la mort).
versets.en: 99. And worship your Lord until there comes unto you the certainty (i.e. death).

versets.ar: 1. أَتَىٰ أَمْرُ اللَّهِ فَلَا تَسْتَعْجِلُوهُ ۚ سُبْحَانَهُ وَتَعَالَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. L'ordre d'Allah arrive. Ne le hâtez donc pas. Gloire à Lui! Il est au-dessus de ce qu'on Lui associe.
versets.en: 1. The Event (the Hour or the punishment of disbelievers and polytheists or the Islamic laws or commandments), ordained by Allah will come to pass, so seek not to hasten it. Glorified and Exalted be He above all that they associate as partners with Him.

versets.ar: 2. يُنَزِّلُ الْمَلَائِكَةَ بِالرُّوحِ مِنْ أَمْرِهِ عَلَىٰ مَن يَشَاءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ أَنْ أَنذِرُوا أَنَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا أَنَا فَاتَّقُونِ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Il fait descendre, par Son ordre, les Anges, avec la révélation sur qui Il veut parmi Ses serviteurs: «Avertissez qu'il n'est d'autre divinité que Moi. Craignez-Moi donc».
versets.en: 2. He sends down the angels with inspiration of His Command to whom of His slaves He pleases (saying): "Warn mankind that La ilaha illa Ana (none has the right to be worshipped but I), so fear Me (by abstaining from sins and evil deeds).

versets.ar: 3. خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ بِالْحَقِّ ۚ تَعَالَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Il a créé les cieux et la terre avec juste raison. Il transcende ce qu'on [Lui] associe.
versets.en: 3. He has created the heavens and the earth with truth. High be He Exalted above all they associate as partners with Him.

versets.ar: 4. خَلَقَ الْإِنسَانَ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ فَإِذَا هُوَ خَصِيمٌ مُّبِينٌ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Il a créé l'homme d'une goutte de sperme; et voilà que l'homme devient un disputeur déclaré.
versets.en: 4. He has created man from Nutfah (mixed drops of male and female sexual discharge), then behold, this same (man) becomes an open opponent.

versets.ar: 5. وَالْأَنْعَامَ خَلَقَهَا ۗ لَكُمْ فِيهَا دِفْءٌ وَمَنَافِعُ وَمِنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Et les bestiaux, Il les a créés pour vous; vous en retirez des [vêtements] chauds ainsi que d'autres profits. Et vous en mangez aussi.
versets.en: 5. And the cattle, He has created them for you; in them there is warmth (warm clothing), and numerous benefits, and of them you eat.

versets.ar: 6. وَلَكُمْ فِيهَا جَمَالٌ حِينَ تُرِيحُونَ وَحِينَ تَسْرَحُونَ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Ils vous paraissent beaux quand vous les ramenez, le soir, et aussi le matin quand vous les lâchez pour le pâturage.
versets.en: 6. And wherein is beauty for you, when you bring them home in the evening, and as you lead them forth to pasture in the morning.

versets.ar: 7. وَتَحْمِلُ أَثْقَالَكُمْ إِلَىٰ بَلَدٍ لَّمْ تَكُونُوا بَالِغِيهِ إِلَّا بِشِقِّ الْأَنفُسِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكُمْ لَرَءُوفٌ رَّحِيمٌ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. Et ils portent vos fardeaux vers un pays que vous n'atteindriez qu'avec peine. Vraiment, votre Seigneur est Compatissant et Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 7. And they carry your loads to a land that you could not reach except with great trouble to yourselves. Truly, your Lord is full of Kindness, Most Merciful.

versets.ar: 8. وَالْخَيْلَ وَالْبِغَالَ وَالْحَمِيرَ لِتَرْكَبُوهَا وَزِينَةً ۚ وَيَخْلُقُ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Et les chevaux, les mulets et les ânes, pour que vous les montiez, et pour l'apparat. Et Il crée ce que vous ne savez pas.
versets.en: 8. And (He has created) horses, mules and donkeys, for you to ride and as an adornment. And He creates (other) things of which you have no knowledge.

versets.ar: 9. وَعَلَى اللَّهِ قَصْدُ السَّبِيلِ وَمِنْهَا جَائِرٌ ۚ وَلَوْ شَاءَ لَهَدَاكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Il appartient à Allah [par Sa grâce, de montrer] le droit chemin car il en est qui s'en détachent. Or, s'Il voulait, Il vous guiderait tous.
versets.en: 9. And upon Allah is the responsibility to explain the Straight Path (i.e. Islamic Monotheism for mankind i.e. to show them legal and illegal, good and evil things, etc. so, whosoever accepts the guidance, it will be for his own benefit and whosoever goes astray, it will be for his own destruction), but there are ways that turn aside (such as Paganism, Judaism, Christianity, etc.). And had He willed, He would have guided you all (mankind).

versets.ar: 10. هُوَ الَّذِي أَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً ۖ لَّكُم مِّنْهُ شَرَابٌ وَمِنْهُ شَجَرٌ فِيهِ تُسِيمُونَ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. C'est Lui qui, du ciel, a fait descendre de l'eau qui vous sert de boisson et grâce à laquelle poussent des plantes dont vous nourrissez vos troupeaux.
versets.en: 10. He it is Who sends down water (rain) from the sky; from it you drink and from it (grows) the vegetation on which you send your cattle to pasture;

versets.ar: 11. يُنبِتُ لَكُم بِهِ الزَّرْعَ وَالزَّيْتُونَ وَالنَّخِيلَ وَالْأَعْنَابَ وَمِن كُلِّ الثَّمَرَاتِ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. D'elle, Il fait pousser pour vous, les cultures, les oliviers, les palmiers, les vignes et aussi toutes sortes de fruits. Voilà bien là une preuve pour des gens qui réfléchissent.
versets.en: 11. With it He causes to grow for you the crops, the olives, the date-palms, the grapes, and every kind of fruit. Verily! In this is indeed an evident proof and a manifest sign for people who give thought.

versets.ar: 12. وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ وَالشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ ۖ وَالنُّجُومُ مُسَخَّرَاتٌ بِأَمْرِهِ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يَعْقِلُونَ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. Pour vous, Il a assujetti la nuit et le jour; le soleil et la lune. Et à Son ordre sont assujetties les étoiles. Voilà bien là des preuves pour des gens qui raisonnent.
versets.en: 12. And He has subjected to you the night and the day, the sun and the moon; and the stars are subjected by His Command. Surely, in this are proofs for people who understand.

versets.ar: 13. وَمَا ذَرَأَ لَكُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ مُخْتَلِفًا أَلْوَانُهُ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يَذَّكَّرُونَ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. Ce qu'Il a créé pour vous sur la terre a des couleurs diverses. Voilà bien là une preuve pour des gens qui se rappellent.
versets.en: 13. And whatsoever He has created for you on this earth of varying colours [and qualities from vegetation and fruits, etc. (botanical life) and from animal (zoological life)]. Verily! In this is a sign for people who remember.

versets.ar: 14. وَهُوَ الَّذِي سَخَّرَ الْبَحْرَ لِتَأْكُلُوا مِنْهُ لَحْمًا طَرِيًّا وَتَسْتَخْرِجُوا مِنْهُ حِلْيَةً تَلْبَسُونَهَا وَتَرَى الْفُلْكَ مَوَاخِرَ فِيهِ وَلِتَبْتَغُوا مِن فَضْلِهِ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. Et c'est Lui qui a assujetti la mer afin que vous en mangiez une chair fraîche, et que vous en retiriez des parures que vous portez. Et tu vois les bateaux fendre la mer avec bruit, pour que vous partiez en quête de Sa grâce et afin que vous soyez reconnaissants.
versets.en: 14. And He it is Who has subjected the sea (to you), that you eat thereof fresh tender meat (i.e. fish), and that you bring forth out of it ornaments to wear. And you see the ships ploughing through it, that you may seek (thus) of His Bounty (by transporting the goods from place to place) and that you may be grateful.

versets.ar: 15. وَأَلْقَىٰ فِي الْأَرْضِ رَوَاسِيَ أَن تَمِيدَ بِكُمْ وَأَنْهَارًا وَسُبُلًا لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Et Il a implanté des montagnes immobiles dans la terre afin qu'elle ne branle pas en vous emportant avec elle de même que des rivières et des sentiers, pour que vous vous guidiez,
versets.en: 15. And He has affixed into the earth mountains standing firm, lest it should shake with you, and rivers and roads, that you may guide yourselves.

versets.ar: 16. وَعَلَامَاتٍ ۚ وَبِالنَّجْمِ هُمْ يَهْتَدُونَ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. ainsi que des points de repère. Et au moyen des étoiles [les gens] se guident.
versets.en: 16. And landmarks (signposts, etc. during the day) and by the stars (during the night), they (mankind) guide themselves.

versets.ar: 17. أَفَمَن يَخْلُقُ كَمَن لَّا يَخْلُقُ ۗ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Celui qui crée est-il semblable à celui qui ne crée rien? Ne vous souvenez-vous pas?
versets.en: 17. Is then He, Who creates as one who creates not? Will you not then remember?

versets.ar: 18. وَإِن تَعُدُّوا نِعْمَةَ اللَّهِ لَا تُحْصُوهَا ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَغَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. Et si vous comptez les bienfaits d'Allah, vous ne saurez pas les dénombrer. Car Allah est Pardonneur, et Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 18. And if you would count the graces of Allah, never could you be able to count them. Truly! Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

versets.ar: 19. وَاللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا تُسِرُّونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Et Allah sait ce que vous cachez et ce que vous divulguez.
versets.en: 19. And Allah knows what you conceal and what you reveal.

versets.ar: 20. وَالَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ لَا يَخْلُقُونَ شَيْئًا وَهُمْ يُخْلَقُونَ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. Et ceux qu'ils invoquent en dehors d'Allah ne créent rien, et ils sont eux-mêmes créés.
versets.en: 20. Those whom they (Al-Mushrikun) invoke besides Allah have not created anything, but are themselves created.

versets.ar: 21. أَمْوَاتٌ غَيْرُ أَحْيَاءٍ ۖ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ أَيَّانَ يُبْعَثُونَ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Ils sont morts, et non pas vivants, et ils ne savent pas quand ils seront ressuscités.
versets.en: 21. (They are) dead, lifeless, and they know not when they will be raised up.

versets.ar: 22. إِلَٰهُكُمْ إِلَٰهٌ وَاحِدٌ ۚ فَالَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ قُلُوبُهُم مُّنكِرَةٌ وَهُم مُّسْتَكْبِرُونَ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. Votre Dieu est un Dieu unique. Ceux qui ne croient pas en l'au-delà leurs cœurs nient (l'unicité d'Allah) et ils sont remplis d'orgueil.
versets.en: 22. Your Ilah (God) is One Ilah (God Allah, none has the right to be worshipped but He). But for those who believe not in the Hereafter, their hearts deny (the faith in the Oneness of Allah), and they are proud.

versets.ar: 23. لَا جَرَمَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا يُسِرُّونَ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ ۚ إِنَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ الْمُسْتَكْبِرِينَ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. Nul doute qu'Allah sait ce qu'ils cachent et ce qu'ils divulguent. Et assurément Il n'aime pas les orgueilleux.
versets.en: 23. Certainly, Allah knows what they conceal and what they reveal. Truly, He likes not the proud.

versets.ar: 24. وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُم مَّاذَا أَنزَلَ رَبُّكُمْ ۙ قَالُوا أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Et lorsqu'on leur dit: «Qu'est-ce que votre Seigneur a fait descendre?» Ils disent: «Des légendes anciennes!»
versets.en: 24. And when it is said to them: "What is it that your Lord has sent down (unto Muhammad SAW)?" They say: "Tales of the men of old!"

versets.ar: 25. لِيَحْمِلُوا أَوْزَارَهُمْ كَامِلَةً يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ ۙ وَمِنْ أَوْزَارِ الَّذِينَ يُضِلُّونَهُم بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ ۗ أَلَا سَاءَ مَا يَزِرُونَ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Qu'ils portent donc, au Jour de la Résurrection, tous les fardeaux de leurs propres œuvres ainsi qu'une partie des fardeaux de ceux qu'ils égarent, sans le savoir; combien est mauvais [le fardeau] qu'ils portent!
versets.en: 25. They will bear their own burdens in full on the Day of Resurrection, and also of the burdens of those whom they misled without knowledge. Evil indeed is that which they shall bear!

versets.ar: 26. قَدْ مَكَرَ الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ فَأَتَى اللَّهُ بُنْيَانَهُم مِّنَ الْقَوَاعِدِ فَخَرَّ عَلَيْهِمُ السَّقْفُ مِن فَوْقِهِمْ وَأَتَاهُمُ الْعَذَابُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Ceux qui ont vécu avant eux, certes, ont comploté, mais Allah attaqua les bases mêmes de leur bâtisse. Le toit s'écroula au-dessus d'eux et le châtiment les surprit d'où ils ne l'avaient pas pressenti.
versets.en: 26. Those before them indeed plotted, but Allah struck at the foundation of their building, and then the roof fell down upon them, from above them, and the torment overtook them from directions they did not perceive.

versets.ar: 27. ثُمَّ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ يُخْزِيهِمْ وَيَقُولُ أَيْنَ شُرَكَائِيَ الَّذِينَ كُنتُمْ تُشَاقُّونَ فِيهِمْ ۚ قَالَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْعِلْمَ إِنَّ الْخِزْيَ الْيَوْمَ وَالسُّوءَ عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Puis, le Jour de la Résurrection, Il les couvrira d'ignominie, et [leur] dira: «Où sont Mes associés pour lesquels vous combattiez?» - Ceux qui ont le savoir diront: «L'ignominie et le malheur tombent aujourd'hui sur les mécréants».
versets.en: 27. Then, on the Day of Resurrection, He will disgrace them and will say: "Where are My (so called) 'partners' concerning whom you used to disagree and dispute (with the believers, by defying and disobeying Allah)?"
