versets.ar: 62. فَلَمَّا جَاوَزَا قَالَ لِفَتَاهُ آتِنَا غَدَاءَنَا لَقَدْ لَقِينَا مِن سَفَرِنَا هَٰذَا نَصَبًا ﴿62﴾
versets.fr: 62. Puis, lorsque tous deux eurent dépassé [cet endroit,] il dit à son valet: «Apporte-nous notre déjeuner: nous avons rencontré de la fatigue dans notre présent voyage».
versets.en: 62. So when they had passed further on (beyond that fixed place), Musa (Moses) said to his boy-servant: "Bring us our morning meal; truly, we have suffered much fatigue in this, our journey."

versets.ar: 63. قَالَ أَرَأَيْتَ إِذْ أَوَيْنَا إِلَى الصَّخْرَةِ فَإِنِّي نَسِيتُ الْحُوتَ وَمَا أَنسَانِيهُ إِلَّا الشَّيْطَانُ أَنْ أَذْكُرَهُ ۚ وَاتَّخَذَ سَبِيلَهُ فِي الْبَحْرِ عَجَبًا ﴿63﴾
versets.fr: 63. [Le valet lui] dit: «Quand nous avons pris refuge près du rocher, vois-tu, j'ai oublié le poisson - le Diable seul m'a fait oublier de (te) le rappeler - et il a curieusement pris son chemin dans la mer».
versets.en: 63. He said:"Do you remember when we betook ourselves to the rock? I indeed forgot the fish, none but Shaitan (Satan) made me forget to remember it. It took its course into the sea in a strange (way)!"

versets.ar: 64. قَالَ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنَّا نَبْغِ ۚ فَارْتَدَّا عَلَىٰ آثَارِهِمَا قَصَصًا ﴿64﴾
versets.fr: 64. [Moïse] dit: «Voilà ce que nous cherchions». Puis, ils retournèrent sur leurs pas, suivant leurs traces.
versets.en: 64. [Musa (Moses)] said: "That is what we have been seeking." So they went back retracing their footsteps.

versets.ar: 65. فَوَجَدَا عَبْدًا مِّنْ عِبَادِنَا آتَيْنَاهُ رَحْمَةً مِّنْ عِندِنَا وَعَلَّمْنَاهُ مِن لَّدُنَّا عِلْمًا ﴿65﴾
versets.fr: 65. Ils trouvèrent l'un de Nos serviteurs à qui Nous avions donné une grâce, de Notre part, et à qui Nous avions enseigné une science émanant de Nous.
versets.en: 65. Then they found one of Our slaves, unto whom We had bestowed mercy from Us, and whom We had taught knowledge from Us.

versets.ar: 66. قَالَ لَهُ مُوسَىٰ هَلْ أَتَّبِعُكَ عَلَىٰ أَن تُعَلِّمَنِ مِمَّا عُلِّمْتَ رُشْدًا ﴿66﴾
versets.fr: 66. Moïse lui dit: «Puis-je te suivre, à la condition que tu m'apprennes de ce qu'on t'a appris concernant une bonne direction?»
versets.en: 66. Musa (Moses) said to him (Khidr) "May I follow you so that you teach me something of that knowledge (guidance and true path) which you have been taught (by Allah)?"

versets.ar: 67. قَالَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِيَ صَبْرًا ﴿67﴾
versets.fr: 67. [L'autre] dit: «Vraiment, tu ne pourras jamais être patient avec moi.
versets.en: 67. He (Khidr) said: "Verily! You will not be able to have patience with me!

versets.ar: 68. وَكَيْفَ تَصْبِرُ عَلَىٰ مَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِ خُبْرًا ﴿68﴾
versets.fr: 68. Comment endurerais-tu sur des choses que tu n'embrasses pas par ta connaissance?»
versets.en: 68. "And how can you have patience about a thing which you know not?"

versets.ar: 69. قَالَ سَتَجِدُنِي إِن شَاءَ اللَّهُ صَابِرًا وَلَا أَعْصِي لَكَ أَمْرًا ﴿69﴾
versets.fr: 69. [Moïse] lui dit: «Si Allah veut, tu me trouveras patient; et je ne désobéirai à aucun de tes ordres».
versets.en: 69. Musa (Moses) said: "If Allah will, you will find me patient, and I will not disobey you in aught."

versets.ar: 70. قَالَ فَإِنِ اتَّبَعْتَنِي فَلَا تَسْأَلْنِي عَن شَيْءٍ حَتَّىٰ أُحْدِثَ لَكَ مِنْهُ ذِكْرًا ﴿70﴾
versets.fr: 70. «Si tu me suis, dit [l'autre,] ne m'interroge sur rien tant que je ne t'en aurai pas fait mention».
versets.en: 70. He (Khidr) said: "Then, if you follow me, ask me not about anything till I myself mention it to you."

versets.ar: 71. فَانطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰ إِذَا رَكِبَا فِي السَّفِينَةِ خَرَقَهَا ۖ قَالَ أَخَرَقْتَهَا لِتُغْرِقَ أَهْلَهَا لَقَدْ جِئْتَ شَيْئًا إِمْرًا ﴿71﴾
versets.fr: 71. Alors les deux partirent. Et après qu'ils furent montés sur un bateau, l'homme y fit une brèche. [Moïse] lui dit: «Est-ce pour noyer ses occupants que tu l'as ébréché? Tu as commis, certes, une chose monstrueuse!»
versets.en: 71. So they both proceeded, till, when they embarked the ship, he (Khidr) scuttled it. Musa (Moses) said: "Have you scuttled it in order to drown its people? Verily, you have committed a thing "Imra" (a Munkar - evil, bad, dreadful thing)."

versets.ar: 72. قَالَ أَلَمْ أَقُلْ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِيَ صَبْرًا ﴿72﴾
versets.fr: 72. [L'autre] répondit: «N'ai-je pas dit que tu ne pourrais pas garder patience en ma compagnie?»
versets.en: 72. He (Khidr) said: "Did I not tell you, that you would not be able to have patience with me?"

versets.ar: 73. قَالَ لَا تُؤَاخِذْنِي بِمَا نَسِيتُ وَلَا تُرْهِقْنِي مِنْ أَمْرِي عُسْرًا ﴿73﴾
versets.fr: 73. «Ne t'en prends pas à moi, dit [Moïse,] pour un oubli de ma part; et ne m'impose pas de grande difficulté dans mon affaire».
versets.en: 73. [Musa (Moses)] said: "Call me not to account for what I forgot, and be not hard upon me for my affair (with you)."

versets.ar: 74. فَانطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰ إِذَا لَقِيَا غُلَامًا فَقَتَلَهُ قَالَ أَقَتَلْتَ نَفْسًا زَكِيَّةً بِغَيْرِ نَفْسٍ لَّقَدْ جِئْتَ شَيْئًا نُّكْرًا ﴿74﴾
versets.fr: 74. Puis ils partirent tous deux; et quand ils eurent rencontré un enfant, [l'homme] le tua. Alors [Moïse] lui dit: «As-tu tué un être innocent, qui n'a tué personne? Tu as commis certes, une chose affreuse!»
versets.en: 74. Then they both proceeded, till they met a boy, he (Khidr) killed him. Musa (Moses) said: "Have you killed an innocent person who had killed none? Verily, you have committed a thing "Nukra" (a great Munkar - prohibited, evil, dreadful thing)!"

versets.ar: 75. ۞ قَالَ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِيَ صَبْرًا ﴿75﴾
versets.fr: 75. [L'autre] lui dit: «Ne t'ai je pas dit que tu ne pourrais pas garder patience en ma compagnie?»
versets.en: 75. (Khidr) said: "Did I not tell you that you can have no patience with me?"

versets.ar: 76. قَالَ إِن سَأَلْتُكَ عَن شَيْءٍ بَعْدَهَا فَلَا تُصَاحِبْنِي ۖ قَدْ بَلَغْتَ مِن لَّدُنِّي عُذْرًا ﴿76﴾
versets.fr: 76. «Si, après cela, je t'interroge sur quoi que ce soit, dit [Moïse], alors ne m'accompagne plus. Tu seras alors excusé de te séparer de moi».
versets.en: 76. [Musa (Moses)] said: "If I ask you anything after this, keep me not in your company, you have received an excuse from me."

versets.ar: 77. فَانطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰ إِذَا أَتَيَا أَهْلَ قَرْيَةٍ اسْتَطْعَمَا أَهْلَهَا فَأَبَوْا أَن يُضَيِّفُوهُمَا فَوَجَدَا فِيهَا جِدَارًا يُرِيدُ أَن يَنقَضَّ فَأَقَامَهُ ۖ قَالَ لَوْ شِئْتَ لَتَّخَذْتَ عَلَيْهِ أَجْرًا ﴿77﴾
versets.fr: 77. Ils partirent donc tous deux; et quand ils furent arrivés à un village habité, ils demandèrent à manger à ses habitants; mais ceux-ci refusèrent de leur donner l'hospitalité. Ensuite, ils y trouvèrent un mur sur le point de s'écrouler. L'homme le redressa. Alors [Moïse] lui dit: «Si tu voulais, tu aurais bien pu réclamer pour cela un salaire».
versets.en: 77. Then they both proceeded, till, when they came to the people of a town, they asked them for food, but they refused to entertain them. Then they found therein a wall about to collapse and he (Khidr) set it up straight. [Musa (Moses)] said: If you had wished, surely, you could have taken wages for it!"

versets.ar: 78. قَالَ هَٰذَا فِرَاقُ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنِكَ ۚ سَأُنَبِّئُكَ بِتَأْوِيلِ مَا لَمْ تَسْتَطِع عَّلَيْهِ صَبْرًا ﴿78﴾
versets.fr: 78. «Ceci [marque] la séparation entre toi et moi, dit [l'homme,] Je vais t'apprendre l'interprétation de ce que tu n'as pu supporter avec patience.
versets.en: 78. (Khidr) said: "This is the parting between me and you, I will tell you the interpretation of (those) things over which you were unable to hold patience.

versets.ar: 79. أَمَّا السَّفِينَةُ فَكَانَتْ لِمَسَاكِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ فِي الْبَحْرِ فَأَرَدتُّ أَنْ أَعِيبَهَا وَكَانَ وَرَاءَهُم مَّلِكٌ يَأْخُذُ كُلَّ سَفِينَةٍ غَصْبًا ﴿79﴾
versets.fr: 79. Pour ce qui est du bateau, il appartenait à des pauvres gens qui travaillaient en mer. Je voulais donc le rendre défectueux, car il y avait derrière eux un roi qui saisissait de force tout bateau.
versets.en: 79. "As for the ship, it belonged to Masakin (poor people) working in the sea. So I wished to make a defective damage in it, as there was a king after them who seized every ship by force.

versets.ar: 80. وَأَمَّا الْغُلَامُ فَكَانَ أَبَوَاهُ مُؤْمِنَيْنِ فَخَشِينَا أَن يُرْهِقَهُمَا طُغْيَانًا وَكُفْرًا ﴿80﴾
versets.fr: 80. Quant au garçon, ses père et mère étaient des croyants; nous avons craint qu'il ne leur imposât la rébellion et la mécréance.
versets.en: 80. "And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared lest he should oppress them by rebellion and disbelief.

versets.ar: 81. فَأَرَدْنَا أَن يُبْدِلَهُمَا رَبُّهُمَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهُ زَكَاةً وَأَقْرَبَ رُحْمًا ﴿81﴾
versets.fr: 81. Nous avons donc voulu que leur Seigneur leur accordât en échange un autre plus pur et plus affectueux.
versets.en: 81. "So we intended that their Lord should change him for them for one better in righteousness and near to mercy.

versets.ar: 82. وَأَمَّا الْجِدَارُ فَكَانَ لِغُلَامَيْنِ يَتِيمَيْنِ فِي الْمَدِينَةِ وَكَانَ تَحْتَهُ كَنزٌ لَّهُمَا وَكَانَ أَبُوهُمَا صَالِحًا فَأَرَادَ رَبُّكَ أَن يَبْلُغَا أَشُدَّهُمَا وَيَسْتَخْرِجَا كَنزَهُمَا رَحْمَةً مِّن رَّبِّكَ ۚ وَمَا فَعَلْتُهُ عَنْ أَمْرِي ۚ ذَٰلِكَ تَأْوِيلُ مَا لَمْ تَسْطِع عَّلَيْهِ صَبْرًا ﴿82﴾
versets.fr: 82. Et quant au mur, il appartenait à deux garçons orphelins de la ville, et il y avait dessous un trésor à eux; et leur père était un homme vertueux. Ton Seigneur a donc voulu que tous deux atteignent leur maturité et qu'ils extraient, [eux-mêmes] leur trésor, par une miséricorde de ton Seigneur. Je ne l'ai d'ailleurs pas fait de mon propre chef. Voilà l'interprétation de ce que tu n'as pas pu endurer avec patience».
versets.en: 82. "And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the town; and there was under it a treasure belonging to them; and their father was a righteous man, and your Lord intended that they should attain their age of full strength and take out their treasure as a mercy from your Lord. And I did it not of my own accord. That is the interpretation of those (things) over which you could not hold patience."

versets.ar: 83. وَيَسْأَلُونَكَ عَن ذِي الْقَرْنَيْنِ ۖ قُلْ سَأَتْلُو عَلَيْكُم مِّنْهُ ذِكْرًا ﴿83﴾
versets.fr: 83. Et ils t'interrogent sur Dûl-Qarnayn. Dis: «Je vais vous en citer quelque fait mémorable».
versets.en: 83. And they ask you about Dhul-Qarnain. Say: "I shall recite to you something of his story."

versets.ar: 84. إِنَّا مَكَّنَّا لَهُ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَآتَيْنَاهُ مِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ سَبَبًا ﴿84﴾
versets.fr: 84. Vraiment, Nous avons affermi sa puissance sur terre, et Nous lui avons donné libre voie à toute chose.
versets.en: 84. Verily, We established him in the earth, and We gave him the means of everything.

versets.fr: 85. Il suivit donc une voie.
versets.en: 85. So he followed a way.

versets.ar: 86. حَتَّىٰ إِذَا بَلَغَ مَغْرِبَ الشَّمْسِ وَجَدَهَا تَغْرُبُ فِي عَيْنٍ حَمِئَةٍ وَوَجَدَ عِندَهَا قَوْمًا ۗ قُلْنَا يَا ذَا الْقَرْنَيْنِ إِمَّا أَن تُعَذِّبَ وَإِمَّا أَن تَتَّخِذَ فِيهِمْ حُسْنًا ﴿86﴾
versets.fr: 86. Et quand il eut atteint le Couchant, il trouva que le soleil se couchait dans une source boueuse, et, auprès d'elle il trouva une peuplade [impie]. Nous dîmes: «O Dûl-Qarnayn! ou tu les châties, ou tu uses de bienveillance à leur égard».
versets.en: 86. Until, when he reached the setting place of the sun, he found it setting in a spring of black muddy (or hot) water. And he found near it a people. We (Allah) said (by inspiration): "O Dhul-Qarnain! Either you punish them, or treat them with kindness."

versets.ar: 87. قَالَ أَمَّا مَن ظَلَمَ فَسَوْفَ نُعَذِّبُهُ ثُمَّ يُرَدُّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ فَيُعَذِّبُهُ عَذَابًا نُّكْرًا ﴿87﴾
versets.fr: 87. Il dit: «Quant à celui qui est injuste, nous le châtierons; ensuite il sera ramené vers son Seigneur qui le punira d'un châtiment terrible.
versets.en: 87. He said: "As for him (a disbeliever in the Oneness of Allah) who does wrong, we shall punish him; and then he will be brought back unto his Lord; Who will punish him with a terrible torment (Hell).

versets.ar: 88. وَأَمَّا مَنْ آمَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا فَلَهُ جَزَاءً الْحُسْنَىٰ ۖ وَسَنَقُولُ لَهُ مِنْ أَمْرِنَا يُسْرًا ﴿88﴾
versets.fr: 88. Et quant à celui qui croit et fait bonne œuvre, il aura, en retour, la plus belle récompense. Et nous lui donnerons des ordres faciles à exécuter».
versets.en: 88. "But as for him who believes (in Allah's Oneness) and works righteousness, he shall have the best reward, (Paradise), and we (Dhul-Qarnain) shall speak unto him mild words (as instructions)."

versets.fr: 89. Puis, il suivit (une autre) voie.
versets.en: 89. Then he followed another way,

versets.ar: 90. حَتَّىٰ إِذَا بَلَغَ مَطْلِعَ الشَّمْسِ وَجَدَهَا تَطْلُعُ عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍ لَّمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُم مِّن دُونِهَا سِتْرًا ﴿90﴾
versets.fr: 90. Et quand il eut atteint le Levant, il trouva que le soleil se levait sur une peuplade à laquelle Nous n'avions pas donné de voile pour s'en protéger.
versets.en: 90. Until, when he came to the rising place of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We (Allah) had provided no shelter against the sun.

versets.ar: 91. كَذَٰلِكَ وَقَدْ أَحَطْنَا بِمَا لَدَيْهِ خُبْرًا ﴿91﴾
versets.fr: 91. Il en fut ainsi et Nous embrassons de Notre Science ce qu'il détenait.
versets.en: 91. So (it was)! And We knew all about him (Dhul-Qarnain).

versets.fr: 92. Puis, il suivit (une autre) voie.
versets.en: 92. Then he followed (another) way,

versets.ar: 93. حَتَّىٰ إِذَا بَلَغَ بَيْنَ السَّدَّيْنِ وَجَدَ مِن دُونِهِمَا قَوْمًا لَّا يَكَادُونَ يَفْقَهُونَ قَوْلًا ﴿93﴾
versets.fr: 93. Et quand il eut atteint un endroit situé entre les Deux Barrières (montagnes), il trouva derrière elles une peuplade qui ne comprenait presque aucun langage.
versets.en: 93. Until, when he reached between two mountains, he found, before (near) them (those two mountains), a people who scarcely understood a word.

versets.ar: 94. قَالُوا يَا ذَا الْقَرْنَيْنِ إِنَّ يَأْجُوجَ وَمَأْجُوجَ مُفْسِدُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ فَهَلْ نَجْعَلُ لَكَ خَرْجًا عَلَىٰ أَن تَجْعَلَ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَهُمْ سَدًّا ﴿94﴾
versets.fr: 94. Ils dirent: «O Dûl-Qarnayn, les Yâ jûj et les Mâ jûj commettent du désordre sur terre. Est-ce que nous pourrons t'accorder un tribut pour construire une barrière entre eux et nous?»
versets.en: 94. They said: "O Dhul-Qarnain! Verily! Ya'juj and Ma'juj (Gog and Magog) are doing great mischief in the land. Shall we then pay you a tribute in order that you might erect a barrier between us and them?"

versets.ar: 95. قَالَ مَا مَكَّنِّي فِيهِ رَبِّي خَيْرٌ فَأَعِينُونِي بِقُوَّةٍ أَجْعَلْ بَيْنَكُمْ وَبَيْنَهُمْ رَدْمًا ﴿95﴾
versets.fr: 95. Il dit: «Ce que Mon Seigneur m'a conféré vaut mieux (que vos dons). Aidez-moi donc avec votre force et je construirai un remblai entre vous et eux.
versets.en: 95. He said: "That (wealth, authority and power) in which my Lord had established me is better (than your tribute). So help me with strength (of men), I will erect between you and them a barrier.

versets.ar: 96. آتُونِي زُبَرَ الْحَدِيدِ ۖ حَتَّىٰ إِذَا سَاوَىٰ بَيْنَ الصَّدَفَيْنِ قَالَ انفُخُوا ۖ حَتَّىٰ إِذَا جَعَلَهُ نَارًا قَالَ آتُونِي أُفْرِغْ عَلَيْهِ قِطْرًا ﴿96﴾
versets.fr: 96. Apportez-moi des blocs de fer». Puis, lorsqu'il en eut comblé l'espace entre les deux montagnes, il dit: «Soufflez!» Puis, lorsqu'il l'eut rendu une fournaise, il dit: «Apportez-moi du cuivre fondu, que je le déverse dessus».
versets.en: 96. "Give me pieces (blocks) of iron," then, when he had filled up the gap between the two mountain-cliffs, he said: "Blow," till when he had made it (red as) fire, he said: "Bring me molten copper to pour over it."

versets.ar: 97. فَمَا اسْطَاعُوا أَن يَظْهَرُوهُ وَمَا اسْتَطَاعُوا لَهُ نَقْبًا ﴿97﴾
versets.fr: 97. Ainsi, ils ne purent guère l'escalader ni l'ébrécher non plus.
versets.en: 97. So they [Ya'juj and Ma'juj (Gog and Magog)] were made powerless to scale it or dig through it.

versets.ar: 98. قَالَ هَٰذَا رَحْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّي ۖ فَإِذَا جَاءَ وَعْدُ رَبِّي جَعَلَهُ دَكَّاءَ ۖ وَكَانَ وَعْدُ رَبِّي حَقًّا ﴿98﴾
versets.fr: 98. Il dit: «C'est une miséricorde de la part de mon Seigneur. Mais, lorsque la promesse de mon Seigneur viendra, Il le nivellera. Et la promesse de mon Seigneur est vérité».
versets.en: 98. Dhul-Qarnain) said: "This is a mercy from my Lord, but when the Promise of my Lord comes, He shall level it down to the ground. And the Promise of my Lord is ever true."

versets.ar: 99. ۞ وَتَرَكْنَا بَعْضَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَمُوجُ فِي بَعْضٍ ۖ وَنُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ فَجَمَعْنَاهُمْ جَمْعًا ﴿99﴾
versets.fr: 99. Nous les laisserons, ce jour-là, déferler comme les flots les uns sur les autres, et on soufflera dans la Trompe et Nous les rassemblerons tous.
versets.en: 99. And on that Day [i.e. the Day Ya'juj and Ma'juj (Gog and Magog) will come out], We shall leave them to surge like waves on one another, and the Trumpet will be blown, and We shall collect them all together.

versets.ar: 100. وَعَرَضْنَا جَهَنَّمَ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْكَافِرِينَ عَرْضًا ﴿100﴾
versets.fr: 100. Et ce jour-là Nous présenterons de près l'Enfer aux mécréants,
versets.en: 100. And on that Day We shall present Hell to the disbelievers, plain to view,

versets.ar: 101. الَّذِينَ كَانَتْ أَعْيُنُهُمْ فِي غِطَاءٍ عَن ذِكْرِي وَكَانُوا لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ سَمْعًا ﴿101﴾
versets.fr: 101. dont les yeux étaient couverts d'un voile qui les empêchait de penser à Moi, et ils ne pouvaient rien entendre non plus.
versets.en: 101. (To) Those whose eyes had been under a covering from My Reminder (this Quran), and who could not bear to hear (it).

versets.ar: 102. أَفَحَسِبَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا أَن يَتَّخِذُوا عِبَادِي مِن دُونِي أَوْلِيَاءَ ۚ إِنَّا أَعْتَدْنَا جَهَنَّمَ لِلْكَافِرِينَ نُزُلًا ﴿102﴾
versets.fr: 102. Ceux qui ont mécru, comptent-ils donc pouvoir prendre, pour alliés, Mes serviteurs en dehors de Moi? Nous avons préparé l'Enfer comme résidence pour les mécréants.
versets.en: 102. Do then those who disbelieve think that they can take My slaves [i.e., the angels, Allah's Messengers, 'Iesa (Jesus), son of Maryam (Mary), etc.] as Auliya' (lords, gods, protectors, etc.) besides Me? Verily, We have prepared Hell as an entertainment for the disbelievers (in the Oneness of Allah Islamic Monotheism).

versets.ar: 103. قُلْ هَلْ نُنَبِّئُكُم بِالْأَخْسَرِينَ أَعْمَالًا ﴿103﴾
versets.fr: 103. Dis: «Voulez-vous que Nous vous apprenions lesquels sont les plus grands perdants, en œuvres?
versets.en: 103. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "Shall We tell you the greatest losers in respect of (their) deeds?

versets.ar: 104. الَّذِينَ ضَلَّ سَعْيُهُمْ فِي الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا وَهُمْ يَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّهُمْ يُحْسِنُونَ صُنْعًا ﴿104﴾
versets.fr: 104. Ceux dont l'effort, dans la vie présente, s'est égaré, alors qu'ils s'imaginent faire le bien.
versets.en: 104. "Those whose efforts have been wasted in this life while they thought that they were acquiring good by their deeds!

versets.ar: 105. أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِآيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَلِقَائِهِ فَحَبِطَتْ أَعْمَالُهُمْ فَلَا نُقِيمُ لَهُمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ وَزْنًا ﴿105﴾
versets.fr: 105. Ceux-là qui ont nié les signes de leur Seigneur, ainsi que Sa rencontre. Leurs actions sont donc vaines». Nous ne leur assignerons pas de poids au Jour de la Résurrection.
versets.en: 105. "They are those who deny the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) of their Lord and the Meeting with Him (in the Hereafter). So their works are in vain, and on the Day of Resurrection, We shall not give them any weight.

versets.ar: 106. ذَٰلِكَ جَزَاؤُهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ بِمَا كَفَرُوا وَاتَّخَذُوا آيَاتِي وَرُسُلِي هُزُوًا ﴿106﴾
versets.fr: 106. C'est que leur rétribution sera l'Enfer, pour avoir mécru et pris en raillerie Mes signes (enseignements) et Mes messagers.
versets.en: 106. "That shall be their recompense, Hell; because they disbelieved and took My Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) and My Messengers by way of jest and mockery.

versets.ar: 107. إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ كَانَتْ لَهُمْ جَنَّاتُ الْفِرْدَوْسِ نُزُلًا ﴿107﴾
versets.fr: 107. Ceux qui croient et font de bonnes œuvres auront pour résidence les Jardins du «Firdaws,» (Paradis),
versets.en: 107. "Verily! Those who believe (in the Oneness of Allah Islamic Monotheism) and do righteous deeds, shall have the Gardens of Al-Firdaus (the Paradise) for their entertainment.

versets.ar: 108. خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا لَا يَبْغُونَ عَنْهَا حِوَلًا ﴿108﴾
versets.fr: 108. où ils demeureront éternellement, sans désirer aucun changement.
versets.en: 108. "Wherein they shall dwell (forever). No desire will they have to be removed therefrom."

versets.ar: 109. قُل لَّوْ كَانَ الْبَحْرُ مِدَادًا لِّكَلِمَاتِ رَبِّي لَنَفِدَ الْبَحْرُ قَبْلَ أَن تَنفَدَ كَلِمَاتُ رَبِّي وَلَوْ جِئْنَا بِمِثْلِهِ مَدَدًا ﴿109﴾
versets.fr: 109. Dis: «Si la mer était une encre [pour écrire] les paroles de mon Seigneur, certes la mer s'épuiserait avant que ne soient épuisées les paroles de mon Seigneur, quand même Nous lui apporterions son équivalent comme renfort.»
versets.en: 109. Say (O Muhammad SAW to mankind). "If the sea were ink for (writing) the Words of my Lord, surely, the sea would be exhausted before the Words of my Lord would be finished, even if we brought (another sea) like it for its aid."

versets.ar: 110. قُلْ إِنَّمَا أَنَا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُكُمْ يُوحَىٰ إِلَيَّ أَنَّمَا إِلَٰهُكُمْ إِلَٰهٌ وَاحِدٌ ۖ فَمَن كَانَ يَرْجُو لِقَاءَ رَبِّهِ فَلْيَعْمَلْ عَمَلًا صَالِحًا وَلَا يُشْرِكْ بِعِبَادَةِ رَبِّهِ أَحَدًا ﴿110﴾
versets.fr: 110. Dis: «Je suis en fait un être humain comme vous. Il m'a été révélé que votre Dieu est un Dieu unique! Quiconque, donc, espère rencontrer son Seigneur, qu'il fasse de bonnes actions et qu'il n'associe dans son adoration aucun autre à son Seigneur».
versets.en: 110. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "I am only a man like you. It has been inspired to me that your Ilah (God) is One Ilah (God i.e. Allah). So whoever hopes for the Meeting with his Lord, let him work righteousness and associate none as a partner in the worship of his Lord."

versets.ar: 1. كهيعص ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. Kâf, Hâ', Yâ', 'Aîn, Sâd.
versets.en: 1. Kaf- Ha-Ya-'Ain-Sad. [These letters are one of the miracles of the Quran, and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings].

versets.ar: 2. ذِكْرُ رَحْمَتِ رَبِّكَ عَبْدَهُ زَكَرِيَّا ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. C'est un récit de la miséricorde de ton Seigneur envers Son serviteur Zacharie.
versets.en: 2. (This is) a mention of the mercy of your Lord to His slave Zakariya (Zachariah).

versets.ar: 3. إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُ نِدَاءً خَفِيًّا ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Lorsqu'il invoqua son Seigneur d'une invocation secrète,
versets.en: 3. When he called out his Lord (Allah) a call in secret,

versets.ar: 4. قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي وَهَنَ الْعَظْمُ مِنِّي وَاشْتَعَلَ الرَّأْسُ شَيْبًا وَلَمْ أَكُن بِدُعَائِكَ رَبِّ شَقِيًّا ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. et dit: «O mon Seigneur, mes os sont affaiblis et ma tête s'est enflammée de cheveux blancs. [Cependant], je n'ai jamais été malheureux [déçu] en te priant, ô mon Seigneur.
versets.en: 4. Saying: "My Lord! Indeed my bones have grown feeble, and grey hair has spread on my head, And I have never been unblest in my invocation to You, O my Lord!

versets.ar: 5. وَإِنِّي خِفْتُ الْمَوَالِيَ مِن وَرَائِي وَكَانَتِ امْرَأَتِي عَاقِرًا فَهَبْ لِي مِن لَّدُنكَ وَلِيًّا ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Je crains [le comportement] de mes héritiers, après moi. Et ma propre femme est stérile. Accorde-moi, de Ta part, un descendant
versets.en: 5. "And Verily! I fear my relatives after me, since my wife is barren. So give me from Yourself an heir,

versets.ar: 6. يَرِثُنِي وَيَرِثُ مِنْ آلِ يَعْقُوبَ ۖ وَاجْعَلْهُ رَبِّ رَضِيًّا ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. qui hérite de moi et hérite de la famille de Jacob. Et fais qu'il te soit agréable, ô mon Seigneur».
versets.en: 6. "Who shall inherit me, and inherit (also) the posterity of Ya'qub (Jacob) (inheritance of the religious knowledge and Prophethood, not the wealth, etc.). And make him, my Lord, one with whom You are Well-pleased!".

versets.ar: 7. يَا زَكَرِيَّا إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَامٍ اسْمُهُ يَحْيَىٰ لَمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُ مِن قَبْلُ سَمِيًّا ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. «O Zacharie, Nous t'annonçons la bonne nouvelle d'un fils. Son nom sera Yahya [Jean]. Nous ne lui avons pas donné auparavant d'homonyme».
versets.en: 7. (Allah said) "O Zakariya (Zachariah)! Verily, We give you the glad tidings of a son, His name will be Yahya (John). We have given that name to none before (him)."

versets.ar: 8. قَالَ رَبِّ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِي غُلَامٌ وَكَانَتِ امْرَأَتِي عَاقِرًا وَقَدْ بَلَغْتُ مِنَ الْكِبَرِ عِتِيًّا ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Et [Zacharie dit]: «O mon Seigneur, comment aurai-je un fils, quand ma femme est stérile et que je suis très avancé en vieillesse?»
versets.en: 8. He said: "My Lord! How can I have a son, when my wife is barren, and I have reached the extreme old age."

versets.ar: 9. قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ قَالَ رَبُّكَ هُوَ عَلَيَّ هَيِّنٌ وَقَدْ خَلَقْتُكَ مِن قَبْلُ وَلَمْ تَكُ شَيْئًا ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. [Allah] lui dit: «Ainsi sera-t-il! Ton Seigneur a dit: «Ceci m'est facile. Et avant cela, Je t'ai créé alors que tu n'étais rien».
versets.en: 9. He said: "So (it will be). Your Lord says; It is easy for Me. Certainly I have created you before, when you had been nothing!"

versets.ar: 10. قَالَ رَبِّ اجْعَل لِّي آيَةً ۚ قَالَ آيَتُكَ أَلَّا تُكَلِّمَ النَّاسَ ثَلَاثَ لَيَالٍ سَوِيًّا ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. «O mon Seigneur, dit [Zacharie], accorde-moi un signe». «Ton signe, dit [Allah,] sera que tu ne pourras pas parler aux gens pendant trois nuits tout en étant bien portant.
versets.en: 10. [Zakariya (Zachariah)] said: "My Lord! Appoint for me a sign." He said: "Your sign is that you shall not speak unto mankind for three nights, though having no bodily defect."

versets.ar: 11. فَخَرَجَ عَلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ مِنَ الْمِحْرَابِ فَأَوْحَىٰ إِلَيْهِمْ أَن سَبِّحُوا بُكْرَةً وَعَشِيًّا ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. Il sortit donc du sanctuaire vers son peuple; puis il leur fit signe de prier matin et soir.
versets.en: 11. Then he came out to his people from Al-Mihrab (a praying place or a private room, etc.), he told them by signs to glorify Allah's Praises in the morning and in the afternoon.

versets.ar: 12. يَا يَحْيَىٰ خُذِ الْكِتَابَ بِقُوَّةٍ ۖ وَآتَيْنَاهُ الْحُكْمَ صَبِيًّا ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. ... «O Yahya, tiens fermement au Livre (la Thora)!» Nous lui donnâmes la sagesse alors qu'il était enfant,
versets.en: 12. (It was said to his son): "O Yahya (John)! Hold fast the Scripture [the Taurat (Torah)]." And We gave him wisdom while yet a child.

versets.ar: 13. وَحَنَانًا مِّن لَّدُنَّا وَزَكَاةً ۖ وَكَانَ تَقِيًّا ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. ainsi que la tendresse de Notre part et la pureté. Il était pieux,
versets.en: 13. And (made him) sympathetic to men as a mercy (or a grant) from Us, and pure from sins [i.e. Yahya (John)] and he was righteous,

versets.ar: 14. وَبَرًّا بِوَالِدَيْهِ وَلَمْ يَكُن جَبَّارًا عَصِيًّا ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. et dévoué envers ses père et mère; et ne fut ni violent ni désobéissant.
versets.en: 14. And dutiful towards his parents, and he was neither an arrogant nor disobedient (to Allah or to his parents).

versets.ar: 15. وَسَلَامٌ عَلَيْهِ يَوْمَ وُلِدَ وَيَوْمَ يَمُوتُ وَيَوْمَ يُبْعَثُ حَيًّا ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Que la paix soit sur lui le jour où il naquit, le jour où il mourra, et le jour où il sera ressuscité vivant!
versets.en: 15. So Peace on him the day he was born the day that he dies and the day that he will be raised up to life (again)!

versets.ar: 16. وَاذْكُرْ فِي الْكِتَابِ مَرْيَمَ إِذِ انتَبَذَتْ مِنْ أَهْلِهَا مَكَانًا شَرْقِيًّا ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Mentionne, dans le Livre (le Coran), Marie, quand elle se retira de sa famille en un lieu vers l'Orient.
versets.en: 16. And mention in the Book (the Quran, O Muhammad SAW, the story of) Maryam (Mary), when she withdrew in seclusion from her family to a place facing east.

versets.ar: 17. فَاتَّخَذَتْ مِن دُونِهِمْ حِجَابًا فَأَرْسَلْنَا إِلَيْهَا رُوحَنَا فَتَمَثَّلَ لَهَا بَشَرًا سَوِيًّا ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Elle mit entre elle et eux un voile. Nous lui envoyâmes Notre Esprit (Gabriel), qui se présenta à elle sous la forme d'un homme parfait.
versets.en: 17. She placed a screen (to screen herself) from them; then We sent to her Our Ruh [angel Jibrael (Gabriel)], and he appeared before her in the form of a man in all respects.

versets.ar: 18. قَالَتْ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِالرَّحْمَٰنِ مِنكَ إِن كُنتَ تَقِيًّا ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. Elle dit: «Je me réfugie contre toi auprès du Tout Miséricordieux. Si tu es pieux, [ne m'approche point].»
versets.en: 18. She said: "Verily! I seek refuge with the Most Beneficent (Allah) from you, if you do fear Allah."

versets.ar: 19. قَالَ إِنَّمَا أَنَا رَسُولُ رَبِّكِ لِأَهَبَ لَكِ غُلَامًا زَكِيًّا ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Il dit: «Je suis en fait un Messager de ton Seigneur pour te faire don d'un fils pur».
versets.en: 19. (The angel) said: "I am only a Messenger from your Lord, (to announce) to you the gift of a righteous son."

versets.ar: 20. قَالَتْ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِي غُلَامٌ وَلَمْ يَمْسَسْنِي بَشَرٌ وَلَمْ أَكُ بَغِيًّا ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. Elle dit: «Comment aurais-je un fils, quand aucun homme ne m'a touchée, et que je ne suis pas prostituée?»
versets.en: 20. She said: "How can I have a son, when no man has touched me, nor am I unchaste?"

versets.ar: 21. قَالَ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ هُوَ عَلَيَّ هَيِّنٌ ۖ وَلِنَجْعَلَهُ آيَةً لِّلنَّاسِ وَرَحْمَةً مِّنَّا ۚ وَكَانَ أَمْرًا مَّقْضِيًّا ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Il dit: «Ainsi sera-t-il! Cela M'est facile, a dit ton Seigneur! Et Nous ferons de lui un signe pour les gens, et une miséricorde de Notre part. C'est une affaire déjà décidée».
versets.en: 21. He said: "So (it will be), your Lord said: 'That is easy for Me (Allah): And (We wish) to appoint him as a sign to mankind and a mercy from Us (Allah), and it is a matter (already) decreed, (by Allah). 

versets.ar: 22. ۞ فَحَمَلَتْهُ فَانتَبَذَتْ بِهِ مَكَانًا قَصِيًّا ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. Elle devint donc enceinte [de l'enfant], et elle se retira avec lui en un lieu éloigné.
versets.en: 22. So she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a far place (i.e. Bethlehem valley about 4-6 miles from Jerusalem).

versets.ar: 23. فَأَجَاءَهَا الْمَخَاضُ إِلَىٰ جِذْعِ النَّخْلَةِ قَالَتْ يَا لَيْتَنِي مِتُّ قَبْلَ هَٰذَا وَكُنتُ نَسْيًا مَّنسِيًّا ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. Puis les douleurs de l'enfantement l'amenèrent au tronc du palmier, et elle dit: «Malheur à moi! Que je fusse morte avant cet instant! Et que je fusse totalement oubliée!»
versets.en: 23. And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a date-palm. She said: "Would that I had died before this, and had been forgotten and out of sight!"

versets.ar: 24. فَنَادَاهَا مِن تَحْتِهَا أَلَّا تَحْزَنِي قَدْ جَعَلَ رَبُّكِ تَحْتَكِ سَرِيًّا ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Alors, il l'appela d'au-dessous d'elle, [lui disant:] «Ne t'afflige pas. Ton Seigneur a placé à tes pieds une source.
versets.en: 24. Then [the babe 'Iesa (Jesus) or Jibrael (Gabriel)] cried unto her from below her, saying: "Grieve not! Your Lord has provided a water stream under you;

versets.ar: 25. وَهُزِّي إِلَيْكِ بِجِذْعِ النَّخْلَةِ تُسَاقِطْ عَلَيْكِ رُطَبًا جَنِيًّا ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Secoue vers toi le tronc du palmier: il fera tomber sur toi des dattes fraîches et mûres.
versets.en: 25. "And shake the trunk of date-palm towards you, it will let fall fresh ripe-dates upon you."

versets.ar: 26. فَكُلِي وَاشْرَبِي وَقَرِّي عَيْنًا ۖ فَإِمَّا تَرَيِنَّ مِنَ الْبَشَرِ أَحَدًا فَقُولِي إِنِّي نَذَرْتُ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ صَوْمًا فَلَنْ أُكَلِّمَ الْيَوْمَ إِنسِيًّا ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Mange donc et bois et que ton œil se réjouisse! Si tu vois quelqu'un d'entre les humains, dis [lui:] «Assurément, j'ai voué un jeûne au Tout Miséricordieux: je ne parlerai donc aujourd'hui à aucun être humain».
versets.en: 26. "So eat and drink and be glad, and if you see any human being, say: 'Verily! I have vowed a fast unto the Most Beneficent (Allah) so I shall not speak to any human being this day. 

versets.ar: 27. فَأَتَتْ بِهِ قَوْمَهَا تَحْمِلُهُ ۖ قَالُوا يَا مَرْيَمُ لَقَدْ جِئْتِ شَيْئًا فَرِيًّا ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Puis elle vint auprès des siens en le portant [le bébé]. Ils dirent: «O Marie, tu as fait une chose monstrueuse!
versets.en: 27. Then she brought him (the baby) to her people, carrying him. They said: "O Mary! Indeed you have brought a thing Fariya (an unheard mighty thing).

versets.ar: 28. يَا أُخْتَ هَارُونَ مَا كَانَ أَبُوكِ امْرَأَ سَوْءٍ وَمَا كَانَتْ أُمُّكِ بَغِيًّا ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. «Sœur de Hârûn, ton père n'était pas un homme de mal et ta mère n'était pas une prostituée».
versets.en: 28. "O sister (i.e. the like) of Harun (Aaron) [not the brother of Musa (Moses), but he was another pious man at the time of Maryam (Mary)]! Your father was not a man who used to commit adultery, nor your mother was an unchaste woman."

versets.ar: 29. فَأَشَارَتْ إِلَيْهِ ۖ قَالُوا كَيْفَ نُكَلِّمُ مَن كَانَ فِي الْمَهْدِ صَبِيًّا ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. Elle fit alors un signe vers lui [le bébé]. Ils dirent: «Comment parlerions-nous à un bébé au berceau?»
versets.en: 29. Then she pointed to him. They said: "How can we talk to one who is a child in the cradle?"

versets.ar: 30. قَالَ إِنِّي عَبْدُ اللَّهِ آتَانِيَ الْكِتَابَ وَجَعَلَنِي نَبِيًّا ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Mais (le bébé) dit: «Je suis vraiment le serviteur d'Allah. Il m'a donné le Livre et m'a désigné Prophète.
versets.en: 30. "He ['Iesa (Jesus)] said: Verily! I am a slave of Allah, He has given me the Scripture and made me a Prophet;"

versets.ar: 31. وَجَعَلَنِي مُبَارَكًا أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُ وَأَوْصَانِي بِالصَّلَاةِ وَالزَّكَاةِ مَا دُمْتُ حَيًّا ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. Où que je sois, Il m'a rendu béni; et Il m'a recommandé, tant que je vivrai, la prière et la Zakât;
versets.en: 31. "And He has made me blessed wheresoever I be, and has enjoined on me Salat (prayer), and Zakat, as long as I live."

versets.ar: 32. وَبَرًّا بِوَالِدَتِي وَلَمْ يَجْعَلْنِي جَبَّارًا شَقِيًّا ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. et la bonté envers ma mère. Il ne m'a fait ni violent ni malheureux.
versets.en: 32. "And dutiful to my mother, and made me not arrogant, unblest.

versets.ar: 33. وَالسَّلَامُ عَلَيَّ يَوْمَ وُلِدتُّ وَيَوْمَ أَمُوتُ وَيَوْمَ أُبْعَثُ حَيًّا ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. Et que la paix soit sur moi le jour où je naquis, le jour où je mourrai, et le jour où je serai ressuscité vivant.»
versets.en: 33. "And Salam (peace) be upon me the day I was born, and the day I die, and the day I shall be raised alive!"

versets.ar: 34. ذَٰلِكَ عِيسَى ابْنُ مَرْيَمَ ۚ قَوْلَ الْحَقِّ الَّذِي فِيهِ يَمْتَرُونَ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. Tel est Issa (Jésus), fils de Marie: parole de vérité, dont ils doutent.
versets.en: 34. Such is 'Iesa (Jesus), son of Maryam (Mary). (it is) a statement of truth, about which they doubt (or dispute).

versets.ar: 35. مَا كَانَ لِلَّهِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ مِن وَلَدٍ ۖ سُبْحَانَهُ ۚ إِذَا قَضَىٰ أَمْرًا فَإِنَّمَا يَقُولُ لَهُ كُن فَيَكُونُ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Il ne convient pas à Allah de S'attribuer un fils. Gloire et Pureté à Lui! Quand Il décide d'une chose, Il dit seulement: «Sois!» et elle est.
versets.en: 35. It befits not (the Majesty of) Allah that He should beget a son [this refers to the slander of Christians against Allah, by saying that 'Iesa (Jesus) is the son of Allah]. Glorified (and Exalted be He above all that they associate with Him). When He decrees a thing, He only says to it, "Be!" and it is.

versets.ar: 36. وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ رَبِّي وَرَبُّكُمْ فَاعْبُدُوهُ ۚ هَٰذَا صِرَاطٌ مُّسْتَقِيمٌ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. Certes, Allah est mon Seigneur tout comme votre Seigneur. Adorez-le donc. Voilà un droit chemin».
versets.en: 36. ['Iesa (Jesus) said]: "And verily Allah is my Lord and your Lord. So worship Him (Alone). That is the Straight Path. (Allah's Religion of Islamic Monotheism which He did ordain for all of His Prophets)." [Tafsir At-Tabari]

versets.ar: 37. فَاخْتَلَفَ الْأَحْزَابُ مِن بَيْنِهِمْ ۖ فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِن مَّشْهَدِ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. [par la suite,] les sectes divergèrent entre elles. Alors, malheur aux mécréants lors de la vue d'un jour terrible!
versets.en: 37. Then the sects differed [i.e. the Christians about 'Iesa (Jesus)], so woe unto the disbelievers [those who gave false witness by saying that 'Iesa (Jesus) is the son of Allah] from the meeting of a great Day (i.e. the Day of Resurrection, when they will be thrown in the blazing Fire).

versets.ar: 38. أَسْمِعْ بِهِمْ وَأَبْصِرْ يَوْمَ يَأْتُونَنَا ۖ لَٰكِنِ الظَّالِمُونَ الْيَوْمَ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. Comme ils entendront et verront bien le jour où ils viendront à Nous! Mais aujourd'hui, les injustes sont dans un égarement évident.
versets.en: 38. How clearly will they (polytheists and disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah) see and hear, the Day when they will appear before Us! But the Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers) today are in plain error.

versets.ar: 39. وَأَنذِرْهُمْ يَوْمَ الْحَسْرَةِ إِذْ قُضِيَ الْأَمْرُ وَهُمْ فِي غَفْلَةٍ وَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. Et avertis-les du jour du Regret, quand tout sera réglé; alors qu'ils sont [dans ce monde] inattentifs et qu'ils ne croient pas.
versets.en: 39. And warn them (O Muhammad SAW) of the Day of grief and regrets, when the case has been decided, while (now) they are in a state of carelessness, and they believe not.

versets.ar: 40. إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَرِثُ الْأَرْضَ وَمَنْ عَلَيْهَا وَإِلَيْنَا يُرْجَعُونَ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. C'est Nous, en vérité, qui hériterons la terre et tout ce qui s'y trouve, et c'est à Nous qu'ils seront ramenés.
versets.en: 40. Verily! We will inherit the earth and whatsoever is thereon. And to Us they all shall be returned,

versets.ar: 41. وَاذْكُرْ فِي الْكِتَابِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ صِدِّيقًا نَّبِيًّا ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. Et mentionne dans le Livre, Abraham. C'était un très véridique et un Prophète.
versets.en: 41. And mention in the Book (the Quran) Ibrahim (Abraham). Verily! He was a man of truth, a Prophet.

versets.ar: 42. إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ يَا أَبَتِ لِمَ تَعْبُدُ مَا لَا يَسْمَعُ وَلَا يُبْصِرُ وَلَا يُغْنِي عَنكَ شَيْئًا ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. Lorsqu'il dit à son père: «O mon père, pourquoi adores-tu ce qui n'entend ni ne voit, et ne te profite en rien?
versets.en: 42. When he said to his father: "O my father! Why do you worship that which hears not, sees not and cannot avail you in anything?

versets.ar: 43. يَا أَبَتِ إِنِّي قَدْ جَاءَنِي مِنَ الْعِلْمِ مَا لَمْ يَأْتِكَ فَاتَّبِعْنِي أَهْدِكَ صِرَاطًا سَوِيًّا ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. O mon père, il m'est venu de la science ce que tu n'as pas reçu; suis-moi, donc, je te guiderai sur une voie droite.
versets.en: 43. "O my father! Verily! There has come to me of knowledge that which came not unto you. So follow me. I will guide you to a Straight Path.

versets.ar: 44. يَا أَبَتِ لَا تَعْبُدِ الشَّيْطَانَ ۖ إِنَّ الشَّيْطَانَ كَانَ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ عَصِيًّا ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. O mon père, n'adore pas le Diable, car le Diable désobéit au Tout Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 44. "O my father! Worship not Shaitan (Satan). Verily! Shaitan (Satan) has been a rebel against the Most Beneficent (Allah).

versets.ar: 45. يَا أَبَتِ إِنِّي أَخَافُ أَن يَمَسَّكَ عَذَابٌ مِّنَ الرَّحْمَٰنِ فَتَكُونَ لِلشَّيْطَانِ وَلِيًّا ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. O mon père, je crains qu'un châtiment venant du Tout Miséricordieux ne te touche et que tu ne deviennes un allié du Diable».
versets.en: 45. "O my father! Verily! I fear lest a torment from the Most Beneficent (Allah) overtake you, so that you become a companion of Shaitan (Satan) (in the Hell-fire)." [Tafsir Al-Qurtubi]

versets.ar: 46. قَالَ أَرَاغِبٌ أَنتَ عَنْ آلِهَتِي يَا إِبْرَاهِيمُ ۖ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ لَأَرْجُمَنَّكَ ۖ وَاهْجُرْنِي مَلِيًّا ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. Il dit: «O Abraham, aurais-tu du dédain pour mes divinités? Si tu ne cesses pas, certes je te lapiderai, éloigne-toi de moi pour bien longtemps».
versets.en: 46. He (the father) said: "Do you reject my gods, O Ibrahim (Abraham)? If you stop not (this), I will indeed stone you. So get away from me safely before I punish you."

versets.ar: 47. قَالَ سَلَامٌ عَلَيْكَ ۖ سَأَسْتَغْفِرُ لَكَ رَبِّي ۖ إِنَّهُ كَانَ بِي حَفِيًّا ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. «Paix sur toi», dit Abraham. «J'implorerai mon Seigneur de te pardonner car Il m'a toujours comblé de Ses bienfaits.
versets.en: 47. Ibrahim (Abraham) said: "Peace be on you! I will ask Forgiveness of my Lord for you. Verily! He is unto me, Ever Most Gracious.

versets.ar: 48. وَأَعْتَزِلُكُمْ وَمَا تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ وَأَدْعُو رَبِّي عَسَىٰ أَلَّا أَكُونَ بِدُعَاءِ رَبِّي شَقِيًّا ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. Je me sépare de vous, ainsi que de ce que vous invoquez, en dehors d'Allah, et j'invoquerai mon Seigneur. J'espère ne pas être malheureux dans mon appel à mon Seigneur».
versets.en: 48. "And I shall turn away from you and from those whom you invoke besides Allah. And I shall call on my Lord; and I hope that I shall not be unblest in my invocation to my Lord."

versets.ar: 49. فَلَمَّا اعْتَزَلَهُمْ وَمَا يَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ وَهَبْنَا لَهُ إِسْحَاقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ ۖ وَكُلًّا جَعَلْنَا نَبِيًّا ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. Puis, lorsqu'il se fut séparé d'eux et de ce qu'ils adoraient en dehors d'Allah, Nous lui fîmes don d'Isaac et de Jacob; et de chacun Nous fîmes un prophète.
versets.en: 49. So when he had turned away from them and from those whom they worshipped besides Allah, We gave him Ishaque (Isaac) and Ya'qub (Jacob), and each one of them We made a Prophet.

versets.ar: 50. وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُم مِّن رَّحْمَتِنَا وَجَعَلْنَا لَهُمْ لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ عَلِيًّا ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. Et Nous leur donnâmes de par Notre miséricorde, et Nous leur accordâmes un langage sublime de vérité.
versets.en: 50. And We gave them of Our Mercy (a good provision in plenty), and We granted them honour on the tongues (of all the nations, i.e. everybody remembers them with a good praise).

versets.ar: 51. وَاذْكُرْ فِي الْكِتَابِ مُوسَىٰ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ مُخْلَصًا وَكَانَ رَسُولًا نَّبِيًّا ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. Et mentionne dans le Livre Moïse. C'était vraiment un élu, et c'était un Messager et un prophète.
versets.en: 51. And mention in the Book (this Quran) Musa (Moses). Verily! He was chosen and he was a Messenger (and) a Prophet.

versets.ar: 52. وَنَادَيْنَاهُ مِن جَانِبِ الطُّورِ الْأَيْمَنِ وَقَرَّبْنَاهُ نَجِيًّا ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. Du côté droit du Mont (Sinaï) Nous l'appelâmes et Nous le fîmes approcher tel un confident.
versets.en: 52. And We called him from the right side of the Mount, and made him draw near to Us for a talk with him [Musa (Moses)].

versets.ar: 53. وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُ مِن رَّحْمَتِنَا أَخَاهُ هَارُونَ نَبِيًّا ﴿53﴾
versets.fr: 53. Et par Notre miséricorde, Nous lui donnâmes Aaron son frère comme prophète.
versets.en: 53. And We bestowed on him his brother Harun (Aaron), (also) a Prophet, out of Our Mercy.

versets.ar: 54. وَاذْكُرْ فِي الْكِتَابِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ صَادِقَ الْوَعْدِ وَكَانَ رَسُولًا نَّبِيًّا ﴿54﴾
versets.fr: 54. Et mentionne Ismaël, dans le Livre. Il était fidèle à ses promesses; et c'était un Messager et un prophète.
versets.en: 54. And mention in the Book (the Quran) Isma'il (Ishmael). Verily! He was true to what he promised, and he was a Messenger, (and) a Prophet.

versets.ar: 55. وَكَانَ يَأْمُرُ أَهْلَهُ بِالصَّلَاةِ وَالزَّكَاةِ وَكَانَ عِندَ رَبِّهِ مَرْضِيًّا ﴿55﴾
versets.fr: 55. Et il commandait à sa famille la prière et la Zakât; et il était agréé auprès de son Seigneur.
versets.en: 55. And he used to enjoin on his family and his people As-Salat (the prayers) and the Zakat, and his Lord was pleased with him.

versets.ar: 56. وَاذْكُرْ فِي الْكِتَابِ إِدْرِيسَ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ صِدِّيقًا نَّبِيًّا ﴿56﴾
versets.fr: 56. Et mentionne Idris, dans le Livre. C'était un véridique et un prophète.
versets.en: 56. And mention in the Book (the Quran) Idris (Enoch). Verily! He was a man of truth, (and) a Prophet.

versets.ar: 57. وَرَفَعْنَاهُ مَكَانًا عَلِيًّا ﴿57﴾
versets.fr: 57. Et Nous l'élevâmes à un haut rang.
versets.en: 57. And We raised him to a high station.

versets.ar: 58. أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ أَنْعَمَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِم مِّنَ النَّبِيِّينَ مِن ذُرِّيَّةِ آدَمَ وَمِمَّنْ حَمَلْنَا مَعَ نُوحٍ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّةِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَإِسْرَائِيلَ وَمِمَّنْ هَدَيْنَا وَاجْتَبَيْنَا ۚ إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ آيَاتُ الرَّحْمَٰنِ خَرُّوا سُجَّدًا وَبُكِيًّا ۩ ﴿58﴾
versets.fr: 58. Voilà ceux qu'Allah a comblés de faveurs, parmi les prophètes, parmi les descendants d'Adam, et aussi parmi ceux que Nous avons transportés en compagnie de Noé, et parmi la descendance d'Abraham et d'Israël, et parmi ceux que Nous avons guidés et choisis. Quand les versets du Tout Miséricordieux leur étaient récités, ils tombaient prosternés en pleurant.
versets.en: 58. Those were they unto whom Allah bestowed His Grace from among the Prophets, of the offspring of Adam, and of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Nuh (Noah), and of the offspring of Ibrahim (Abraham) and Israel and from among those whom We guided and chose. When the Verses of the Most Beneficent (Allah) were recited unto them, they fell down prostrating and weeping.

versets.ar: 59. ۞ فَخَلَفَ مِن بَعْدِهِمْ خَلْفٌ أَضَاعُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَاتَّبَعُوا الشَّهَوَاتِ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَلْقَوْنَ غَيًّا ﴿59﴾
versets.fr: 59. Puis leur succédèrent des générations qui délaissèrent la prière et suivirent leurs passions. Ils se trouveront en perdition,
versets.en: 59. Then, there has succeeded them a posterity who have given up As-Salat (the prayers) [i.e. made their Salat (prayers) to be lost, either by not offering them or by not offering them perfectly or by not offering them in their proper fixed times, etc.] and have followed lusts. So they will be thrown in Hell.

versets.ar: 60. إِلَّا مَن تَابَ وَآمَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا فَأُولَٰئِكَ يَدْخُلُونَ الْجَنَّةَ وَلَا يُظْلَمُونَ شَيْئًا ﴿60﴾
versets.fr: 60. sauf celui qui se repent, croit et fait le bien: ceux-là entreront dans le Paradis et ne seront point lésés,
versets.en: 60. Except those who repent and believe (in the Oneness of Allah and His Messenger Muhammad SAW), and work righteousness. Such will enter Paradise and they will not be wronged in aught.

versets.ar: 61. جَنَّاتِ عَدْنٍ الَّتِي وَعَدَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ عِبَادَهُ بِالْغَيْبِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ وَعْدُهُ مَأْتِيًّا ﴿61﴾
versets.fr: 61. aux jardins du séjour (éternel) que le Tout Miséricordieux a promis à Ses serviteurs, [qui ont cru] au mystère. Car Sa promesse arrivera sans nul doute.
versets.en: 61. (They will enter) 'Adn (Eden) Paradise (everlasting Gardens), which the Most Beneficent (Allah) has promised to His slaves in the unseen: Verily! His Promise must come to pass.

versets.ar: 62. لَّا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا إِلَّا سَلَامًا ۖ وَلَهُمْ رِزْقُهُمْ فِيهَا بُكْرَةً وَعَشِيًّا ﴿62﴾
versets.fr: 62. On n'y entend nulle parole insignifiante; seulement: «Salâm»; et ils auront là leur nourriture, matin et soir.
versets.en: 62. They shall not hear therein (in Paradise) any Laghw (dirty, false, evil vain talk), but only Salam (salutations of peace). And they will have therein their sustenance, morning and afternoon. [See (V. 40:55)].

versets.ar: 63. تِلْكَ الْجَنَّةُ الَّتِي نُورِثُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا مَن كَانَ تَقِيًّا ﴿63﴾
versets.fr: 63. Voilà le Paradis dont Nous ferons hériter ceux de Nos serviteurs qui auront été pieux.
versets.en: 63. Such is the Paradise which We shall give as an inheritance to those of Our slaves who have been Al-Muttaqun (pious and righteous persons - See V. 2:2).

versets.ar: 64. وَمَا نَتَنَزَّلُ إِلَّا بِأَمْرِ رَبِّكَ ۖ لَهُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِينَا وَمَا خَلْفَنَا وَمَا بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ ۚ وَمَا كَانَ رَبُّكَ نَسِيًّا ﴿64﴾
versets.fr: 64. «Nous ne descendons que sur ordre de ton Seigneur. A Lui tout ce qui est devant nous, tout ce qui est derrière nous et tout ce qui est entre les deux. Ton Seigneur n'oublie rien.
versets.en: 64. And we (angels) descend not except by the Command of your Lord (O Muhammad SAW). To Him belongs what is before us and what is behind us, and what is between those two, and your Lord is never forgetful,

versets.ar: 65. رَّبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فَاعْبُدْهُ وَاصْطَبِرْ لِعِبَادَتِهِ ۚ هَلْ تَعْلَمُ لَهُ سَمِيًّا ﴿65﴾
versets.fr: 65. Il est le Seigneur des cieux et de la terre et de tout ce qui est entre eux. Adore-Le donc, et sois constant dans Son adoration. Lui connais-tu un homonyme?»
versets.en: 65. Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, so worship Him (Alone) and be constant and patient in His worship. Do you know of any who is similar to Him? (of course none is similar or coequal or comparable to Him, and He has none as partner with Him). [There is nothing like unto Him and He is the All-Hearer, the All-Seer].

versets.ar: 66. وَيَقُولُ الْإِنسَانُ أَإِذَا مَا مِتُّ لَسَوْفَ أُخْرَجُ حَيًّا ﴿66﴾
versets.fr: 66. Et l'homme dit: «Une fois mort, me sortira-t-on vivant?»
versets.en: 66. And man (the disbeliever) says: "When I am dead, shall I then be raised up alive?"

versets.ar: 67. أَوَلَا يَذْكُرُ الْإِنسَانُ أَنَّا خَلَقْنَاهُ مِن قَبْلُ وَلَمْ يَكُ شَيْئًا ﴿67﴾
versets.fr: 67. L'homme ne se rappelle-t-il pas qu'avant cela, c'est Nous qui l'avons créé, alors qu'il n'était rien?
versets.en: 67. Does not man remember that We created him before, while he was nothing?

versets.ar: 68. فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَحْشُرَنَّهُمْ وَالشَّيَاطِينَ ثُمَّ لَنُحْضِرَنَّهُمْ حَوْلَ جَهَنَّمَ جِثِيًّا ﴿68﴾
versets.fr: 68. Par ton Seigneur! Assurément, Nous les rassemblerons, eux et les diables. Puis, Nous les placerons autour de l'Enfer, agenouillés.
versets.en: 68. So by your Lord, surely, We shall gather them together, and (also) the Shayatin (devils) (with them), then We shall bring them round Hell on their knees.

versets.ar: 69. ثُمَّ لَنَنزِعَنَّ مِن كُلِّ شِيعَةٍ أَيُّهُمْ أَشَدُّ عَلَى الرَّحْمَٰنِ عِتِيًّا ﴿69﴾
versets.fr: 69. Ensuite, Nous arracherons de chaque groupe ceux d'entre eux qui étaient les plus obstinés contre le Tout Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 69. Then indeed We shall drag out from every sect all those who were worst in obstinate rebellion against the Most Beneficent (Allah).

versets.ar: 70. ثُمَّ لَنَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِالَّذِينَ هُمْ أَوْلَىٰ بِهَا صِلِيًّا ﴿70﴾
versets.fr: 70. Puis nous sommes Le meilleur à savoir ceux qui méritent le plus d'y être brûlés.
versets.en: 70. Then, verily, We know best those who are most worthy of being burnt therein.

versets.ar: 71. وَإِن مِّنكُمْ إِلَّا وَارِدُهَا ۚ كَانَ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ حَتْمًا مَّقْضِيًّا ﴿71﴾
versets.fr: 71. Il n'y a personne parmi vous qui ne passera pas par [L'Enfer]: Car [il s'agit là] pour ton Seigneur d'une sentence irrévocable.
versets.en: 71. There is not one of you but will pass over it (Hell); this is with your Lord; a Decree which must be accomplished.

versets.ar: 72. ثُمَّ نُنَجِّي الَّذِينَ اتَّقَوا وَّنَذَرُ الظَّالِمِينَ فِيهَا جِثِيًّا ﴿72﴾
versets.fr: 72. Ensuite, Nous délivrerons ceux qui étaient pieux et Nous y laisserons les injustes agenouillés.
versets.en: 72. Then We shall save those who use to fear Allah and were dutiful to Him. And We shall leave the Zalimun (polytheists and wrongdoers, etc.) therein (humbled) to their knees (in Hell).

versets.ar: 73. وَإِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ آيَاتُنَا بَيِّنَاتٍ قَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا أَيُّ الْفَرِيقَيْنِ خَيْرٌ مَّقَامًا وَأَحْسَنُ نَدِيًّا ﴿73﴾
versets.fr: 73. Et lorsque Nos versets évidents leur sont récités les mécréants disent à ceux qui croient: «Lequel des deux groupes a la situation la plus confortable et la meilleure compagnie?»
versets.en: 73. And when Our Clear Verses are recited to them, those who disbelieve (the rich and strong among the pagans of Quraish who live a life of luxury) say to those who believe (the weak, poor companions of Prophet Muhammad SAW who have a hard life): "Which of the two groups (i.e. believers and disbelievers) is best in (point of) position and as regards station (place of council for consultation)."

versets.ar: 74. وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْنٍ هُمْ أَحْسَنُ أَثَاثًا وَرِئْيًا ﴿74﴾
versets.fr: 74. Combien de générations, avant eux, avons-Nous fait périr, qui les surpassaient en biens et en apparence?
versets.en: 74. And how many a generation (past nations) have We destroyed before them, who were better in wealth, goods and outward appearance?

versets.ar: 75. قُلْ مَن كَانَ فِي الضَّلَالَةِ فَلْيَمْدُدْ لَهُ الرَّحْمَٰنُ مَدًّا ۚ حَتَّىٰ إِذَا رَأَوْا مَا يُوعَدُونَ إِمَّا الْعَذَابَ وَإِمَّا السَّاعَةَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ هُوَ شَرٌّ مَّكَانًا وَأَضْعَفُ جُندًا ﴿75﴾
versets.fr: 75. Dis: «Celui qui est dans l'égarement, que le Tout Miséricordieux prolonge sa vie pour un certain temps, jusqu'à ce qu'ils voient soit le châtiment, soit l'Heure dont ils sont menacés. Alors, ils sauront qui a la pire situation et la troupe la plus faible».
versets.en: 75. Say (O Muhammad SAW) whoever is in error, the Most Beneficent (Allah) will extend (the rope) to him, until, when they see that which they were promised, either the torment or the Hour, they will come to know who is worst in position, and who is weaker in forces. [This is the answer for the Verse No. 19:73]

versets.ar: 76. وَيَزِيدُ اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ اهْتَدَوْا هُدًى ۗ وَالْبَاقِيَاتُ الصَّالِحَاتُ خَيْرٌ عِندَ رَبِّكَ ثَوَابًا وَخَيْرٌ مَّرَدًّا ﴿76﴾
versets.fr: 76. Allah accroît la rectitude de ceux qui suivent le bon chemin, et les bonnes œuvres durables méritent auprès de ton Seigneur une meilleure récompense et une meilleure destination.
versets.en: 76. And Allah increases in guidance those who walk aright [true believers in the Oneness of Allah who fear Allah much (abstain from all kinds of sins and evil deeds which He has forbidden), and love Allah much (perform all kinds of good deeds which He has ordained)]. And the righteous good deeds that last, are better with your Lord, for reward and better for resort.

versets.ar: 77. أَفَرَأَيْتَ الَّذِي كَفَرَ بِآيَاتِنَا وَقَالَ لَأُوتَيَنَّ مَالًا وَوَلَدًا ﴿77﴾
versets.fr: 77. As-tu vu celui qui ne croit pas à Nos versets et dit: «On me donnera certes des biens et des enfants»?
versets.en: 77. Have you seen him who disbelieved in Our Ayat (this Quran and Muhammad SAW) and (yet) says: "I shall certainly be given wealth and children [if I will be alive (again)],"

versets.ar: 78. أَطَّلَعَ الْغَيْبَ أَمِ اتَّخَذَ عِندَ الرَّحْمَٰنِ عَهْدًا ﴿78﴾
versets.fr: 78. Est-il au courant de l'Inconnaissable ou a-t-il pris un engagement avec le Tout Miséricordieux?
versets.en: 78. Has he known the unseen or has he taken a covenant from the Most Beneficent (Allah)?

versets.ar: 79. كَلَّا ۚ سَنَكْتُبُ مَا يَقُولُ وَنَمُدُّ لَهُ مِنَ الْعَذَابِ مَدًّا ﴿79﴾
versets.fr: 79. Bien au contraire! Nous enregistrerons ce qu'il dit et accroîtrons son châtiment.
versets.en: 79. Nay! We shall record what he says, and We shall increase his torment (in the Hell);

versets.ar: 80. وَنَرِثُهُ مَا يَقُولُ وَيَأْتِينَا فَرْدًا ﴿80﴾
versets.fr: 80. C'est Nous qui hériterons ce dont il parle, tandis qu'il viendra à Nous, tout seul.
versets.en: 80. And We shall inherit from him (at his death) all that he talks of (i.e. wealth and children which We have bestowed upon him in this world), and he shall come to Us alone.

versets.ar: 81. وَاتَّخَذُوا مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ آلِهَةً لِّيَكُونُوا لَهُمْ عِزًّا ﴿81﴾
versets.fr: 81. Ils ont adopté des divinités en dehors d'Allah pour qu'ils leur soient des protecteurs (contre le châtiment).
versets.en: 81. And they have taken (for worship) aliha (gods) besides Allah, that they might give them honour, power and glory (and also protect them from Allah's Punishment etc.).

versets.ar: 82. كَلَّا ۚ سَيَكْفُرُونَ بِعِبَادَتِهِمْ وَيَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِمْ ضِدًّا ﴿82﴾
versets.fr: 82. Bien au contraire! [ces divinités] renieront leur adoration et seront pour eux des adversaires.
versets.en: 82. Nay, but they (the so-called gods) will deny their worship of them, and become opponents to them (on the Day of Resurrection).

versets.ar: 83. أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا الشَّيَاطِينَ عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ تَؤُزُّهُمْ أَزًّا ﴿83﴾
versets.fr: 83. N'as-tu pas vu que Nous avons envoyé contre les mécréants des diables qui les excitent furieusement [à désobéir]?
versets.en: 83. See you not that We have sent the Shayatin (devils) against the disbelievers to push them to do evil.

versets.ar: 84. فَلَا تَعْجَلْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا نَعُدُّ لَهُمْ عَدًّا ﴿84﴾
versets.fr: 84. Ne te hâte donc pas contre eux: Nous tenons un compte précis de [tous leurs actes].
versets.en: 84. So make no haste against them; We only count out to them a (limited) number (of the days of the life of this world and delay their term so that they may increase in evil and sins).

versets.ar: 85. يَوْمَ نَحْشُرُ الْمُتَّقِينَ إِلَى الرَّحْمَٰنِ وَفْدًا ﴿85﴾
versets.fr: 85. (Rappelle-toi) le jour où Nous rassemblerons les pieux sur des montures et en grande pompe, auprès du Tout Miséricordieux,
versets.en: 85. The Day We shall gather the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2) unto the Most Beneficent (Allah), like a delegate (presented before a king for honour).

versets.ar: 86. وَنَسُوقُ الْمُجْرِمِينَ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ وِرْدًا ﴿86﴾
versets.fr: 86. et pousserons les criminels à l'Enfer comme (un troupeau) à l'abreuvoir,
versets.en: 86. And We shall drive the Mujrimun (polytheists, sinners, criminals, disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah, etc.) to Hell, in a thirsty state (like a thirsty herd driven down to water),

versets.ar: 87. لَّا يَمْلِكُونَ الشَّفَاعَةَ إِلَّا مَنِ اتَّخَذَ عِندَ الرَّحْمَٰنِ عَهْدًا ﴿87﴾
versets.fr: 87. ils ne disposeront d'aucune intercession, sauf celui qui aura pris un engagement avec le Tout Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 87. None shall have the power of intercession, but such a one as has received permission (or promise) from the Most Beneficent (Allah).

versets.ar: 88. وَقَالُوا اتَّخَذَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ وَلَدًا ﴿88﴾
versets.fr: 88. Et ils ont dit: «Le Tout Miséricordieux S'est attribué un enfant!»
versets.en: 88. And they say: "The Most Beneficent (Allah) has begotten a son (or offspring or children) [as the Jews say: 'Uzair (Ezra) is the son of Allah, and the Christians say that He has begotten a son ['Iesa (Christ)], and the pagan Arabs say that He has begotten daughters (angels, etc.)]."

versets.ar: 89. لَّقَدْ جِئْتُمْ شَيْئًا إِدًّا ﴿89﴾
versets.fr: 89. Vous avancez certes là une chose abominable!
versets.en: 89. Indeed you have brought forth (said) a terrible evil thing.

versets.ar: 90. تَكَادُ السَّمَاوَاتُ يَتَفَطَّرْنَ مِنْهُ وَتَنشَقُّ الْأَرْضُ وَتَخِرُّ الْجِبَالُ هَدًّا ﴿90﴾
versets.fr: 90. Peu s'en faut que les cieux ne s'entrouvrent à ces mots, que la terre ne se fende et que les montagnes ne s'écroulent,
versets.en: 90. Whereby the heavens are almost torn, and the earth is split asunder, and the mountains fall in ruins,

versets.ar: 91. أَن دَعَوْا لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ وَلَدًا ﴿91﴾
versets.fr: 91. du fait qu'ils ont attribué un enfant au Tout Miséricordieux,
versets.en: 91. That they ascribe a son (or offspring or children) to the Most Beneficent (Allah).

versets.ar: 92. وَمَا يَنبَغِي لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ وَلَدًا ﴿92﴾
versets.fr: 92. alors qu'il ne convient nullement au Tout Miséricordieux d'avoir un enfant!
versets.en: 92. But it is not suitable for (the Majesty of) the Most Beneficent (Allah) that He should beget a son (or offspring or children).

versets.ar: 93. إِن كُلُّ مَن فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ إِلَّا آتِي الرَّحْمَٰنِ عَبْدًا ﴿93﴾
versets.fr: 93. Tous ceux qui sont dans les cieux et sur la terre se rendront auprès du Tout Miséricordieux, [sans exception], en serviteurs.
versets.en: 93. There is none in the heavens and the earth but comes unto the Most Beneficent (Allah) as a slave.

versets.ar: 94. لَّقَدْ أَحْصَاهُمْ وَعَدَّهُمْ عَدًّا ﴿94﴾
versets.fr: 94. Il les a certes dénombrés et bien comptés.
versets.en: 94. Verily, He knows each one of them, and has counted them a full counting.

versets.ar: 95. وَكُلُّهُمْ آتِيهِ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ فَرْدًا ﴿95﴾
versets.fr: 95. Et au Jour de la Résurrection, chacun d'eux se rendra seul auprès de Lui.
versets.en: 95. And everyone of them will come to Him alone on the Day of Resurrection (without any helper, or protector or defender).

versets.ar: 96. إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ سَيَجْعَلُ لَهُمُ الرَّحْمَٰنُ وُدًّا ﴿96﴾
versets.fr: 96. A ceux qui croient et font de bonnes œuvres, le Tout Miséricordieux accordera Son amour.
versets.en: 96. Verily, those who believe [in the Oneness of Allah and in His Messenger (Muhammad SAW)] and work deeds of righteousness, the Most Beneficent (Allah) will bestow love for them (in the hearts of the believers).

versets.ar: 97. فَإِنَّمَا يَسَّرْنَاهُ بِلِسَانِكَ لِتُبَشِّرَ بِهِ الْمُتَّقِينَ وَتُنذِرَ بِهِ قَوْمًا لُّدًّا ﴿97﴾
versets.fr: 97. Nous l'avons rendu (le Coran) facile [à comprendre] en ta langue, afin que tu annonces par lui la bonne nouvelle aux gens pieux, et que, tu avertisses un peuple irréductible.
versets.en: 97. So We have made this (the Quran) easy in your own tongue (O Muhammad SAW), only that you may give glad tidings to the Muttaqun (pious and righteous persons - See V. 2:2), and warn with it the Ludda (most quarrelsome) people.

versets.ar: 98. وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْنٍ هَلْ تُحِسُّ مِنْهُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ أَوْ تَسْمَعُ لَهُمْ رِكْزًا ﴿98﴾
versets.fr: 98. Que de générations avant eux avons-Nous fait périr! En retrouves-tu un seul individu? ou en entends-tu le moindre murmure?
versets.en: 98. And how many a generation before them have We destroyed! Can you (O Muhammad SAW) find a single one of them or hear even a whisper of them?

versets.fr: 1. Tâ-Hâ.
versets.en: 1. Ta-Ha. [These letters are one of the miracles of the Quran, and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings.]

versets.ar: 2. مَا أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْكَ الْقُرْآنَ لِتَشْقَىٰ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Nous n'avons point fait descendre sur toi le Coran pour que tu sois malheureux,
versets.en: 2. We have not sent down the Quran unto you (O Muhammad SAW) to cause you distress,

versets.ar: 3. إِلَّا تَذْكِرَةً لِّمَن يَخْشَىٰ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. si ce n'est qu'un Rappel pour celui qui redoute (Allah),
versets.en: 3. But only as a Reminder to those who fear (Allah).

versets.ar: 4. تَنزِيلًا مِّمَّنْ خَلَقَ الْأَرْضَ وَالسَّمَاوَاتِ الْعُلَى ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. (et comme) une révélation émanant de Celui qui a créé la terre et les cieux sublimes.
versets.en: 4. A revelation from Him (Allah) Who has created the earth and high heavens.

versets.ar: 5. الرَّحْمَٰنُ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ اسْتَوَىٰ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Le Tout Miséricordieux S'est établi «Istawâ» sur le Trône.
versets.en: 5. The Most Beneficent (Allah) Istawa (rose over) the (Mighty) Throne (in a manner that suits His Majesty).

versets.ar: 6. لَهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَمَا تَحْتَ الثَّرَىٰ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. A Lui appartient ce qui est dans les cieux, sur la terre, ce qui est entre eux et ce qui est sous le sol humide.
versets.en: 6. To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on the earth, and all that is between them, and all that is under the soil.

versets.ar: 7. وَإِن تَجْهَرْ بِالْقَوْلِ فَإِنَّهُ يَعْلَمُ السِّرَّ وَأَخْفَى ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. Et si tu élèves la voix, Il connaît certes les secrets, même les plus cachés.
versets.en: 7. And if you (O Muhammad SAW) speak (the invocation) aloud, then verily, He knows the secret and that which is yet more hidden.

versets.ar: 8. اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ لَهُ الْأَسْمَاءُ الْحُسْنَىٰ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Allah! Point de divinité que Lui! Il possède les noms les plus beaux.
versets.en: 8. Allah! La ilahla illa Huwa (none has the right to be worshipped but He)! To Him belong the Best Names.

versets.ar: 9. وَهَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ مُوسَىٰ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Le récit de Moïse t'est-il parvenu?
versets.en: 9. And has there come to you the story of Musa (Moses)?

versets.ar: 10. إِذْ رَأَىٰ نَارًا فَقَالَ لِأَهْلِهِ امْكُثُوا إِنِّي آنَسْتُ نَارًا لَّعَلِّي آتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِقَبَسٍ أَوْ أَجِدُ عَلَى النَّارِ هُدًى ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Lorsqu'il vit du feu, il dit à sa famille: «Restez ici! Je vois du feu de loin; peut-être vous en apporterai-je un tison, ou trouverai-je auprès du feu de quoi me guider».
versets.en: 10. When he saw a fire, he said to his family: "Wait! Verily, I have seen a fire, perhaps I can bring you some burning brand therefrom, or find some guidance at the fire."

versets.ar: 11. فَلَمَّا أَتَاهَا نُودِيَ يَا مُوسَىٰ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. Puis, lorsqu'il y arriva, il fut interpellé: «Moïse!
versets.en: 11. And when he came to it (the fire), he was called by name: "O Musa (Moses)!

versets.ar: 12. إِنِّي أَنَا رَبُّكَ فَاخْلَعْ نَعْلَيْكَ ۖ إِنَّكَ بِالْوَادِ الْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. Je suis ton Seigneur. Enlève tes sandales: car tu es dans la vallée sacrée, Tuwâ.
versets.en: 12. "Verily! I am your Lord! So take off your shoes, you are in the sacred valley, Tuwa.

versets.ar: 13. وَأَنَا اخْتَرْتُكَ فَاسْتَمِعْ لِمَا يُوحَىٰ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. Moi, Je t'ai choisi. Ecoute donc ce qui va être révélé.
versets.en: 13. "And I have chosen you. So listen to that which is inspired to you.

versets.ar: 14. إِنَّنِي أَنَا اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا أَنَا فَاعْبُدْنِي وَأَقِمِ الصَّلَاةَ لِذِكْرِي ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. Certes, c'est Moi Allah: point de divinité que Moi. Adore-Moi donc et accomplis la Salât pour te souvenir de Moi.
versets.en: 14. "Verily! I am Allah! La ilaha illa Ana (none has the right to be worshipped but I), so worship Me, and perform As-Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat) for My Remembrance.

versets.ar: 15. إِنَّ السَّاعَةَ آتِيَةٌ أَكَادُ أُخْفِيهَا لِتُجْزَىٰ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ بِمَا تَسْعَىٰ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. L'Heure va certes arriver. Je la cache à peine, pour que chaque âme soit rétribuée selon ses efforts.
versets.en: 15. "Verily, the Hour is coming and My Will is to keep it hidden that every person may be rewarded for that which he strives.

versets.ar: 16. فَلَا يَصُدَّنَّكَ عَنْهَا مَن لَّا يُؤْمِنُ بِهَا وَاتَّبَعَ هَوَاهُ فَتَرْدَىٰ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Que celui qui n'y croit pas et qui suit sa propre passion ne t'en détourne pas. Sinon tu périras.
versets.en: 16. "Therefore, let not the one who believes not therein (i.e. in the Day of Resurrection, Reckoning, Paradise and Hell, etc.), but follows his own lusts, divert you therefrom, lest you perish.

versets.ar: 17. وَمَا تِلْكَ بِيَمِينِكَ يَا مُوسَىٰ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Et qu'est-ce qu'il y a dans ta main droite, ô Moïse?»
versets.en: 17. "And what is that in your right hand, O Musa (Moses)?"

versets.ar: 18. قَالَ هِيَ عَصَايَ أَتَوَكَّأُ عَلَيْهَا وَأَهُشُّ بِهَا عَلَىٰ غَنَمِي وَلِيَ فِيهَا مَآرِبُ أُخْرَىٰ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. Il dit: «C'est mon bâton sur lequel je m'appuie, qui me sert à effeuiller (les arbres) pour mes moutons et j'en fais d'autres usages».
versets.en: 18. He said: "This is my stick, whereon I lean, and wherewith I beat down branches for my sheep, and wherein I find other uses."

versets.ar: 19. قَالَ أَلْقِهَا يَا مُوسَىٰ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. [Allah lui] dit: «Jette-le, O Moïse».
versets.en: 19. (Allah) said: "Cast it down, O Musa (Moses)!"

versets.ar: 20. فَأَلْقَاهَا فَإِذَا هِيَ حَيَّةٌ تَسْعَىٰ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. Il le jeta: et le voici un serpent qui rampait.
versets.en: 20. He cast it down, and behold! It was a snake, moving quickly.

versets.ar: 21. قَالَ خُذْهَا وَلَا تَخَفْ ۖ سَنُعِيدُهَا سِيرَتَهَا الْأُولَىٰ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. [Allah] dit: «Saisis-le et ne crains rien: Nous le ramènerons à son premier état.
versets.en: 21. Allah said:"Grasp it, and fear not, We shall return it to its former state,

versets.ar: 22. وَاضْمُمْ يَدَكَ إِلَىٰ جَنَاحِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَاءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوءٍ آيَةً أُخْرَىٰ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. Et serre ta main sous ton aisselle: elle en sortira blanche sans aucun mal, et ce sera là un autre prodige,
versets.en: 22. "And press your (right) hand to your (left) side, it will come forth white (and shining), without any disease as another sign,

versets.ar: 23. لِنُرِيَكَ مِنْ آيَاتِنَا الْكُبْرَى ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. afin que Nous te fassions voir de Nos prodiges les plus importants.
versets.en: 23. "That We may show you (some) of Our Greater Signs.

versets.ar: 24. اذْهَبْ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُ طَغَىٰ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Rends-toi auprès de Pharaon car il a outrepassé toute limite.
versets.en: 24. "Go to Fir'aun (Pharaoh)! Verily, he has transgressed (all bounds in disbelief and disobedience, and has behaved as an arrogant, and as a tyrant)."

versets.ar: 25. قَالَ رَبِّ اشْرَحْ لِي صَدْرِي ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. [Moïse] dit: «Seigneur, ouvre-moi ma poitrine,
versets.en: 25. [Musa (Moses)] said: "O my Lord! Open for me my chest (grant me self-confidence, contentment, and boldness).

versets.fr: 26. et facilite ma mission,
versets.en: 26. "And ease my task for me;

versets.ar: 27. وَاحْلُلْ عُقْدَةً مِّن لِّسَانِي ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. et dénoue un nœud en ma langue,
versets.en: 27. "And make loose the knot (the defect) from my tongue, (i.e. remove the incorrectness from my speech) [That occurred as a result of a brand of fire which Musa (Moses) put in his mouth when he was an infant]. [Tafsir At-Tabari, Vol. 16, Page 159].

versets.ar: 28. يَفْقَهُوا قَوْلِي ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. afin qu'ils comprennent mes paroles,
versets.en: 28. "That they understand my speech,

versets.ar: 29. وَاجْعَل لِّي وَزِيرًا مِّنْ أَهْلِي ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. et assigne-moi un assistant de ma famille:
versets.en: 29. "And appoint for me a helper from my family,

versets.ar: 30. هَارُونَ أَخِي ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Aaron, mon frère,
versets.en: 30. "Harun (Aaron), my brother;

versets.ar: 31. اشْدُدْ بِهِ أَزْرِي ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. accrois par lui ma force!
versets.en: 31. "Increase my strength with him,

versets.ar: 32. وَأَشْرِكْهُ فِي أَمْرِي ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. et associe-le à ma mission,
versets.en: 32. "And let him share my task (of conveying Allah's Message and Prophethood),

versets.ar: 33. كَيْ نُسَبِّحَكَ كَثِيرًا ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. afin que nous Te glorifions beaucoup,
versets.en: 33. "That we may glorify You much,

versets.ar: 34. وَنَذْكُرَكَ كَثِيرًا ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. et que nous T'invoquions beaucoup.
versets.en: 34. "And remember You much,

versets.ar: 35. إِنَّكَ كُنتَ بِنَا بَصِيرًا ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Et Toi, certes, Tu es Très Clairvoyant sur nous».
versets.en: 35. "Verily! You are of us Ever a Well-Seer."

versets.ar: 36. قَالَ قَدْ أُوتِيتَ سُؤْلَكَ يَا مُوسَىٰ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. [Allah] dit: «Ta demande est exaucée, ô Moïse.
versets.en: 36. Allah said: "You are granted your request, O Musa (Moses)!

versets.ar: 37. وَلَقَدْ مَنَنَّا عَلَيْكَ مَرَّةً أُخْرَىٰ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. Et Nous t'avons déjà favorisé une première fois
versets.en: 37. "And indeed We conferred a favour on you another time (before).

versets.ar: 38. إِذْ أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ أُمِّكَ مَا يُوحَىٰ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. lorsque Nous révélâmes à ta mère ce qui fut révélé:
versets.en: 38. "When We inspired your mother with that which We inspired.

versets.ar: 39. أَنِ اقْذِفِيهِ فِي التَّابُوتِ فَاقْذِفِيهِ فِي الْيَمِّ فَلْيُلْقِهِ الْيَمُّ بِالسَّاحِلِ يَأْخُذْهُ عَدُوٌّ لِّي وَعَدُوٌّ لَّهُ ۚ وَأَلْقَيْتُ عَلَيْكَ مَحَبَّةً مِّنِّي وَلِتُصْنَعَ عَلَىٰ عَيْنِي ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. «Mets-le dans le coffret, puis jette celui-ci dans les flots pour qu'ensuite le fleuve le lance sur la rive; un ennemi à Moi et à lui le prendra». Et J'ai répandu sur toi une affection de Ma part, afin que tu sois élevé sous Mon œil.
versets.en: 39. "Saying: 'Put him (the child) into the Tabut (a box or a case or a chest) and put it into the river (Nile), then the river shall cast it up on the bank, and there, an enemy of Mine and an enemy of his shall take him.' And I endued you with love from Me, in order that you may be brought up under My Eye,

versets.ar: 40. إِذْ تَمْشِي أُخْتُكَ فَتَقُولُ هَلْ أَدُلُّكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن يَكْفُلُهُ ۖ فَرَجَعْنَاكَ إِلَىٰ أُمِّكَ كَيْ تَقَرَّ عَيْنُهَا وَلَا تَحْزَنَ ۚ وَقَتَلْتَ نَفْسًا فَنَجَّيْنَاكَ مِنَ الْغَمِّ وَفَتَنَّاكَ فُتُونًا ۚ فَلَبِثْتَ سِنِينَ فِي أَهْلِ مَدْيَنَ ثُمَّ جِئْتَ عَلَىٰ قَدَرٍ يَا مُوسَىٰ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. Et vœilà que ta sœur (te suivait en) marchant et disait: «Puis-je vous indiquer quelqu'un qui se chargera de lui?» Ainsi, Nous te rapportâmes à ta mère afin que son oil se réjouisse et qu'elle ne s'afflige plus. Tu tuas ensuite un individu; Nous te sauvâmes des craintes qui t'oppressaient; et Nous t'imposâmes plusieurs épreuves. Puis tu demeuras des années durant chez les habitants de Madyan. Ensuite tu es venu, ô Moïse, conformément à un décret.
versets.en: 40. "When your sister went and said: 'Shall I show you one who will nurse him?' So We restored you to your mother, that she might cool her eyes and she should not grieve. Then you did kill a man, but We saved you from great distress and tried you with a heavy trial. Then you stayed a number of years with the people of Madyan (Midian). Then you came here according to the fixed term which I ordained (for you), O Musa (Moses)!

versets.ar: 41. وَاصْطَنَعْتُكَ لِنَفْسِي ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. Et je t'ai assigné à Moi-Même.
versets.en: 41. "And I have Istana'tuka, for Myself.

versets.ar: 42. اذْهَبْ أَنتَ وَأَخُوكَ بِآيَاتِي وَلَا تَنِيَا فِي ذِكْرِي ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. Pars, toi et ton frère, avec Mes prodiges; et ne négligez pas de M'invoquer.
versets.en: 42. "Go you and your brother with My Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.), and do not, you both, slacken and become weak in My Remembrance.

versets.ar: 43. اذْهَبَا إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُ طَغَىٰ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. Allez vers Pharaon: il s'est vraiment rebellé.
versets.en: 43. "Go, both of you, to Fir'aun (Pharaoh), verily, he has transgressed (all bounds in disbelief and disobedience and behaved as an arrogant and as a tyrant).

versets.ar: 44. فَقُولَا لَهُ قَوْلًا لَّيِّنًا لَّعَلَّهُ يَتَذَكَّرُ أَوْ يَخْشَىٰ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. Puis, parlez-lui gentiment. Peut-être se rappellera-t-il ou [Me] craindra-t-il?
versets.en: 44. "And speak to him mildly, perhaps he may accept admonition or fear Allah."

versets.ar: 45. قَالَا رَبَّنَا إِنَّنَا نَخَافُ أَن يَفْرُطَ عَلَيْنَا أَوْ أَن يَطْغَىٰ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. Ils dirent: «O notre Seigneur, nous craignons qu'il ne nous maltraite indûment, ou qu'il dépasse les limites».
versets.en: 45. They said: "Our Lord! Verily! We fear lest he should hasten to punish us or lest he should transgress (all bounds against us)."

versets.ar: 46. قَالَ لَا تَخَافَا ۖ إِنَّنِي مَعَكُمَا أَسْمَعُ وَأَرَىٰ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. Il dit: «Ne craignez rien. Je suis avec vous: J'entends et Je vois.
versets.en: 46. He (Allah) said: "Fear not, verily! I am with you both, hearing and seeing.

versets.ar: 47. فَأْتِيَاهُ فَقُولَا إِنَّا رَسُولَا رَبِّكَ فَأَرْسِلْ مَعَنَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ وَلَا تُعَذِّبْهُمْ ۖ قَدْ جِئْنَاكَ بِآيَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّكَ ۖ وَالسَّلَامُ عَلَىٰ مَنِ اتَّبَعَ الْهُدَىٰ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. Allez donc chez lui; puis, dites-lui: «Nous sommes tous deux, les messagers de ton Seigneur. Envoie donc les Enfants d'Israël en notre compagnie et ne les châtie plus. Nous sommes venus à toi avec une preuve de la part de ton Seigneur. Et que la paix soit sur quiconque suit le droit chemin!
versets.en: 47. "So go you both to him, and say: 'Verily, we are Messengers of your Lord, so let the Children of Israel go with us, and torment them not; indeed, we have come with a sign from your Lord! And peace will be upon him who follows the guidance!

versets.ar: 48. إِنَّا قَدْ أُوحِيَ إِلَيْنَا أَنَّ الْعَذَابَ عَلَىٰ مَن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. Il nous a été révélé que le châtiment est pour celui qui refuse d'avoir foi et qui tourne le dos».
versets.en: 48. 'Truly, it has been revealed to us that the torment will be for him who denies [believes not in the Oneness of Allah, and in His Messengers, etc.], and turns away.'(from the truth and obedience of Allah)"

versets.ar: 49. قَالَ فَمَن رَّبُّكُمَا يَا مُوسَىٰ ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. Alors [Pharaon] dit: «Qui donc est votre Seigneur, ô Moïse?»
versets.en: 49. Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "Who then, O Musa (Moses), is the Lord of you two?"

versets.ar: 50. قَالَ رَبُّنَا الَّذِي أَعْطَىٰ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ خَلْقَهُ ثُمَّ هَدَىٰ ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. «Notre Seigneur, dit Moïse, est Celui qui a donné à chaque chose sa propre nature puis l'a dirigée».
versets.en: 50. [Musa (Moses)] said: "Our Lord is He Who gave to each thing its form and nature, then guided it aright."

versets.ar: 51. قَالَ فَمَا بَالُ الْقُرُونِ الْأُولَىٰ ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. «Qu'en est-il donc des générations anciennes?» dit Pharaon.
versets.en: 51. [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] said: "What about the generations of old?"

versets.ar: 52. قَالَ عِلْمُهَا عِندَ رَبِّي فِي كِتَابٍ ۖ لَّا يَضِلُّ رَبِّي وَلَا يَنسَى ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. Moïse dit: «La connaissance de leur sort est auprès de mon Seigneur, dans un livre. Mon Seigneur [ne commet] ni erreur ni oubli.
versets.en: 52. [Musa (Moses)] said: "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord, in a Record. My Lord is neither unaware nor He forgets, "

versets.ar: 53. الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ مَهْدًا وَسَلَكَ لَكُمْ فِيهَا سُبُلًا وَأَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَأَخْرَجْنَا بِهِ أَزْوَاجًا مِّن نَّبَاتٍ شَتَّىٰ ﴿53﴾
versets.fr: 53. C'est Lui qui vous a assigné la terre comme berceau et vous y a tracé des chemins; et qui du ciel a fait descendre de l'eau avec laquelle Nous faisons germer des couples de plantes de toutes sortes.»
versets.en: 53. Who has made earth for you like a bed (spread out); and has opened roads (ways and paths etc.) for you therein; and has sent down water (rain) from the sky. And We have brought forth with it various kinds of vegetation.

versets.ar: 54. كُلُوا وَارْعَوْا أَنْعَامَكُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِّأُولِي النُّهَىٰ ﴿54﴾
versets.fr: 54. «Mangez et faites paître votre bétail». Voilà bien là des signes pour les doués d'intelligence.
versets.en: 54. Eat and pasture your cattle, (therein); verily, in this are proofs and signs for men of understanding.

versets.ar: 55. ۞ مِنْهَا خَلَقْنَاكُمْ وَفِيهَا نُعِيدُكُمْ وَمِنْهَا نُخْرِجُكُمْ تَارَةً أُخْرَىٰ ﴿55﴾
versets.fr: 55. C'est d'elle (la terre) que Nous vous avons créés, et en elle Nous vous retournerons, et d'elle Nous vous ferons sortir une fois encore.
versets.en: 55. Thereof (the earth) We created you, and into it We shall return you, and from it We shall bring you out once again.

versets.ar: 56. وَلَقَدْ أَرَيْنَاهُ آيَاتِنَا كُلَّهَا فَكَذَّبَ وَأَبَىٰ ﴿56﴾
versets.fr: 56. Certes Nous lui avons montré tous Nos prodiges; mais il les a démentis et a refusé (de croire).
versets.en: 56. And indeed We showed him [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] all Our Signs and Evidences, but he denied and refused.

versets.ar: 57. قَالَ أَجِئْتَنَا لِتُخْرِجَنَا مِنْ أَرْضِنَا بِسِحْرِكَ يَا مُوسَىٰ ﴿57﴾
versets.fr: 57. Il dit: «Es-tu venu à nous, ô Moïse, pour nous faire sortir de notre terre par ta magie?
versets.en: 57. He [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] said: "Have you come to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Musa (Moses)?

versets.ar: 58. فَلَنَأْتِيَنَّكَ بِسِحْرٍ مِّثْلِهِ فَاجْعَلْ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَكَ مَوْعِدًا لَّا نُخْلِفُهُ نَحْنُ وَلَا أَنتَ مَكَانًا سُوًى ﴿58﴾
versets.fr: 58. Nous t'apporterons assurément une magie semblable. Fixe entre nous et toi un rendez-vous auquel ni nous ni toi ne manquerons, dans un lieu convenable».
versets.en: 58. "Then verily, we can produce magic the like thereof; so appoint a meeting between us and you, which neither we, nor you shall fail to keep, in an open wide place where both shall have a just and equal chance (and beholders could witness the competition)."

versets.ar: 59. قَالَ مَوْعِدُكُمْ يَوْمُ الزِّينَةِ وَأَن يُحْشَرَ النَّاسُ ضُحًى ﴿59﴾
