versets.fr: 59. Alors Moïse dit: «Votre rendez-vous, c'est le jour de la fête. Et que les gens se rassemblent dans la matinée».
versets.en: 59. [Musa (Moses)] said: "Your appointed meeting is the day of the festival, and let the people assemble when the sun has risen (forenoon)."

versets.ar: 60. فَتَوَلَّىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ فَجَمَعَ كَيْدَهُ ثُمَّ أَتَىٰ ﴿60﴾
versets.fr: 60. Pharaon, donc, se retira. Ensuite il rassembla sa ruse puis vint (au rendez-vous).
versets.en: 60. So Fir'aun (Pharaoh) withdrew, devised his plot and then came back.

versets.ar: 61. قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰ وَيْلَكُمْ لَا تَفْتَرُوا عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا فَيُسْحِتَكُم بِعَذَابٍ ۖ وَقَدْ خَابَ مَنِ افْتَرَىٰ ﴿61﴾
versets.fr: 61. Moïse leur dit: «Malheur à vous! Ne forgez pas de mensonge contre Allah: sinon par un châtiment Il vous anéantira. Celui qui forge (un mensonge) est perdu».
versets.en: 61. Musa (Moses) said to them: "Woe unto you! Invent not a lie against Allah, lest He should destroy you completely by a torment. And surely, he who invents a lie (against Allah) will fail miserably."

versets.ar: 62. فَتَنَازَعُوا أَمْرَهُم بَيْنَهُمْ وَأَسَرُّوا النَّجْوَىٰ ﴿62﴾
versets.fr: 62. Là-dessus, ils se mirent à disputer entre eux de leur affaire et tinrent secrètes leurs discussions.
versets.en: 62. Then they debated with one another what they must do, and they kept their talk secret.

versets.ar: 63. قَالُوا إِنْ هَٰذَانِ لَسَاحِرَانِ يُرِيدَانِ أَن يُخْرِجَاكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُم بِسِحْرِهِمَا وَيَذْهَبَا بِطَرِيقَتِكُمُ الْمُثْلَىٰ ﴿63﴾
versets.fr: 63. Ils dirent: «Voici deux magiciens qui, par leur magie, veulent vous faire abandonner votre terre et emporter votre doctrine idéale.
versets.en: 63. They said: "Verily! These are two magicians. Their object is to drive you out from your land with magic, and overcome your chiefs and nobles.

versets.ar: 64. فَأَجْمِعُوا كَيْدَكُمْ ثُمَّ ائْتُوا صَفًّا ۚ وَقَدْ أَفْلَحَ الْيَوْمَ مَنِ اسْتَعْلَىٰ ﴿64﴾
versets.fr: 64. Rassemblez donc votre ruse puis venez en rangs serrés. Et celui qui aura le dessus aujourd'hui aura réussi».
versets.en: 64. "So devise your plot, and then assemble in line. And whoever overcomes this day will be indeed successful."

versets.ar: 65. قَالُوا يَا مُوسَىٰ إِمَّا أَن تُلْقِيَ وَإِمَّا أَن نَّكُونَ أَوَّلَ مَنْ أَلْقَىٰ ﴿65﴾
versets.fr: 65. Ils dirent: «O Moïse, ou tu jettes, [le premier ton bâton] ou que nous soyons les premiers à jeter?»
versets.en: 65. They said:"O Musa (Moses)! Either you throw first or we be the first to throw?"

versets.ar: 66. قَالَ بَلْ أَلْقُوا ۖ فَإِذَا حِبَالُهُمْ وَعِصِيُّهُمْ يُخَيَّلُ إِلَيْهِ مِن سِحْرِهِمْ أَنَّهَا تَسْعَىٰ ﴿66﴾
versets.fr: 66. Il dit: «Jetez plutôt». Et voilà que leurs cordes et leurs bâtons lui parurent ramper par l'effet de leur magie.
versets.en: 66. [Musa (Moses)] said: "Nay, throw you (first)!" Then behold, their ropes and their sticks, by their magic, appeared to him as though they moved fast.

versets.ar: 67. فَأَوْجَسَ فِي نَفْسِهِ خِيفَةً مُّوسَىٰ ﴿67﴾
versets.fr: 67. Moïse ressentit quelque peur en lui-même.
versets.en: 67. So Musa (Moses) conceived a fear in himself.

versets.ar: 68. قُلْنَا لَا تَخَفْ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الْأَعْلَىٰ ﴿68﴾
versets.fr: 68. Nous lui dîmes: «N'aie pas peur, c'est toi qui auras le dessus.
versets.en: 68. We (Allah) said: "Fear not! Surely, you will have the upper hand.

versets.ar: 69. وَأَلْقِ مَا فِي يَمِينِكَ تَلْقَفْ مَا صَنَعُوا ۖ إِنَّمَا صَنَعُوا كَيْدُ سَاحِرٍ ۖ وَلَا يُفْلِحُ السَّاحِرُ حَيْثُ أَتَىٰ ﴿69﴾
versets.fr: 69. Jette ce qu'il y a dans ta main droite; cela dévorera ce qu'ils ont fabriqué. Ce qu'ils ont fabriqué n'est qu'une ruse de magicien; et le magicien ne réussit pas, où qu'il soit».
versets.en: 69. "And throw that which is in your right hand! It will swallow up that which they have made. That which they have made is only a magician's trick, and the magician will never be successful, no matter whatever amount (of skill) he may attain."

versets.ar: 70. فَأُلْقِيَ السَّحَرَةُ سُجَّدًا قَالُوا آمَنَّا بِرَبِّ هَارُونَ وَمُوسَىٰ ﴿70﴾
versets.fr: 70. Les magiciens se jetèrent prosternés, disant: «Nous avons foi en le Seigneur d'Aaron et de Moïse».
versets.en: 70. So the magicians fell down prostrate. They said: "We believe in the Lord of Harun (Aaron) and Musa (Moses)."

versets.ar: 71. قَالَ آمَنتُمْ لَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ آذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ الَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ السِّحْرَ ۖ فَلَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَافٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ فِي جُذُوعِ النَّخْلِ وَلَتَعْلَمُنَّ أَيُّنَا أَشَدُّ عَذَابًا وَأَبْقَىٰ ﴿71﴾
versets.fr: 71. Alors Pharaon dit: «Avez-vous cru en lui avant que je ne vous y autorise? C'est lui votre chef qui vous a enseigné la magie. Je vous ferai sûrement, couper mains et jambes opposées, et vous ferai crucifier aux troncs des palmiers, et vous saurez, avec certitude, qui de nous est plus fort en châtiment et qui est le plus durable».
versets.en: 71. [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] said: "Believe you in him [Musa (Moses)] before I give you permission? Verily! He is your chief who taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you on the trunks of date-palms, and you shall surely know which of us [I (Fir'aun - Pharaoh) or the Lord of Musa (Moses) (Allah)] can give the severe and more lasting torment."

versets.ar: 72. قَالُوا لَن نُّؤْثِرَكَ عَلَىٰ مَا جَاءَنَا مِنَ الْبَيِّنَاتِ وَالَّذِي فَطَرَنَا ۖ فَاقْضِ مَا أَنتَ قَاضٍ ۖ إِنَّمَا تَقْضِي هَٰذِهِ الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا ﴿72﴾
versets.fr: 72. «Par celui qui nous a créés, dirent-ils, nous ne te préférerons jamais à ce qui nous est parvenu comme preuves évidentes. Décrète donc ce que tu as à décréter. Tes décrets ne touchent que cette présente vie.
versets.en: 72. They said: "We prefer you not over the clear signs that have come to us, and to Him (Allah) Who created us. So decree whatever you desire to decree, for you can only decree (regarding) this life of the world.

versets.ar: 73. إِنَّا آمَنَّا بِرَبِّنَا لِيَغْفِرَ لَنَا خَطَايَانَا وَمَا أَكْرَهْتَنَا عَلَيْهِ مِنَ السِّحْرِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰ ﴿73﴾
versets.fr: 73. Nous croyons en notre Seigneur, afin qu'Il nous pardonne nos fautes ainsi que la magie à laquelle tu nous as contraints». Et Allah est meilleur et éternel.
versets.en: 73. "Verily! We have believed in our Lord, that He may forgive us our faults, and the magic to which you did compel us. And Allah is better as regards reward in comparison to your [Fir'aun's (Pharaoh)] reward, and more lasting (as regards punishment in comparison to your punishment)."

versets.ar: 74. إِنَّهُ مَن يَأْتِ رَبَّهُ مُجْرِمًا فَإِنَّ لَهُ جَهَنَّمَ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحْيَىٰ ﴿74﴾
versets.fr: 74. Quiconque vient en criminel à son Seigneur, aura certes l'Enfer où il ne meurt ni ne vit.
versets.en: 74. Verily! Whoever comes to his Lord as a Mujrim (criminal, polytheist, disbeliever in the Oneness of Allah and His Messengers, sinner, etc.), then surely, for him is Hell, therein he will neither die nor live.

versets.ar: 75. وَمَن يَأْتِهِ مُؤْمِنًا قَدْ عَمِلَ الصَّالِحَاتِ فَأُولَٰئِكَ لَهُمُ الدَّرَجَاتُ الْعُلَىٰ ﴿75﴾
versets.fr: 75. Et quiconque vient auprès de Lui en croyant, après avoir fait de bonnes œuvres, voilà donc ceux qui auront les plus hauts rangs,
versets.en: 75. But whoever comes to Him (Allah) as a believer (in the Oneness of Allah, etc.), and has done righteous good deeds, for such are the high ranks (in the Hereafter),

versets.ar: 76. جَنَّاتُ عَدْنٍ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ جَزَاءُ مَن تَزَكَّىٰ ﴿76﴾
versets.fr: 76. les jardins du séjour (éternel), sous lesquels coulent les ruisseaux, où ils demeureront éternellement. Et voilà la récompense de ceux qui se purifient [de la mécréance et des péchés].
versets.en: 76. 'Adn (Edn) Paradise (everlasting Gardens), under which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever: such is the reward of those who purify themselves [(by abstaining from all kinds of sins and evil deeds) which Allah has forbidden and by doing all that which Allah has ordained)].

versets.ar: 77. وَلَقَدْ أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِي فَاضْرِبْ لَهُمْ طَرِيقًا فِي الْبَحْرِ يَبَسًا لَّا تَخَافُ دَرَكًا وَلَا تَخْشَىٰ ﴿77﴾
versets.fr: 77. Nous révélâmes à Moïse: «Pars la nuit, à la tête de Mes serviteurs, puis, trace-leur un passage à sec dans la mer: sans craindre une poursuite et sans éprouver aucune peur».
versets.en: 77. And indeed We inspired Musa (Moses) (saying): "Travel by night with Ibadi (My slaves) and strike a dry path for them in the sea, fearing neither to be overtaken [by Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] nor being afraid (of drowning in the sea)."

versets.ar: 78. فَأَتْبَعَهُمْ فِرْعَوْنُ بِجُنُودِهِ فَغَشِيَهُم مِّنَ الْيَمِّ مَا غَشِيَهُمْ ﴿78﴾
versets.fr: 78. Pharaon les poursuivit avec ses armées. La mer les submergea bel et bien.
versets.en: 78. Then Fir'aun (Pharaoh) pursued them with his hosts, but the sea-water completely overwhelmed them and covered them up.

versets.ar: 79. وَأَضَلَّ فِرْعَوْنُ قَوْمَهُ وَمَا هَدَىٰ ﴿79﴾
versets.fr: 79. Pharaon égara ainsi son peuple et ne le mît pas sur le droit chemin.
versets.en: 79. And Fir'aun (Pharaoh) led his people astray, and he did not guide them.

versets.ar: 80. يَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ قَدْ أَنجَيْنَاكُم مِّنْ عَدُوِّكُمْ وَوَاعَدْنَاكُمْ جَانِبَ الطُّورِ الْأَيْمَنَ وَنَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكُمُ الْمَنَّ وَالسَّلْوَىٰ ﴿80﴾
versets.fr: 80. O Enfants d'Israël, Nous vous avons déjà délivrés de votre ennemi, et Nous vous avons donné rendez-vous sur le flanc droit du Mont. Et Nous avons fait descendre sur vous la manne et les cailles.
versets.en: 80. O Children of Israel! We delivered you from your enemy, and We made a covenant with you on the right side of the Mount, and We sent down to you Al-Manna and quails,

versets.ar: 81. كُلُوا مِن طَيِّبَاتِ مَا رَزَقْنَاكُمْ وَلَا تَطْغَوْا فِيهِ فَيَحِلَّ عَلَيْكُمْ غَضَبِي ۖ وَمَن يَحْلِلْ عَلَيْهِ غَضَبِي فَقَدْ هَوَىٰ ﴿81﴾
versets.fr: 81. «Mangez des bonnes choses que Nous vous avons attribuées et ne vous montrez pas ingrats, sinon Ma colère s'abattra sur vous: et celui sur qui Ma colère s'abat, va sûrement vers l'abîme.
versets.en: 81. (Saying) eat of the Taiyibat (good lawful things) wherewith We have provided you, and commit no oppression therein, lest My Anger should justly descend on you. And he on whom My Anger descends, he is indeed perished.

versets.ar: 82. وَإِنِّي لَغَفَّارٌ لِّمَن تَابَ وَآمَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا ثُمَّ اهْتَدَىٰ ﴿82﴾
versets.fr: 82. Et je suis Grand Pardonneur à celui qui se repent, croit, fait bonne œuvre, puis se met sur le bon chemin».
versets.en: 82. And verily, I am indeed Forgiving to him who repents, believes (in My Oneness, and associates none in worship with Me) and does righteous good deeds, and then remains constant in doing them, (till his death).

versets.ar: 83. ۞ وَمَا أَعْجَلَكَ عَن قَوْمِكَ يَا مُوسَىٰ ﴿83﴾
versets.fr: 83. «Pourquoi Moïse t'es-tu hâté de quitter ton peuple?»
versets.en: 83. "And what made you hasten from your people, O Musa (Moses)?"

versets.ar: 84. قَالَ هُمْ أُولَاءِ عَلَىٰ أَثَرِي وَعَجِلْتُ إِلَيْكَ رَبِّ لِتَرْضَىٰ ﴿84﴾
versets.fr: 84. Ils sont là sur mes traces, dit Moïse. Et je me suis hâté vers Toi, Seigneur, afin que Tu sois satisfait.
versets.en: 84. He said: "They are close on my footsteps, and I hastened to You, O my Lord, that You might be pleased."

versets.ar: 85. قَالَ فَإِنَّا قَدْ فَتَنَّا قَوْمَكَ مِن بَعْدِكَ وَأَضَلَّهُمُ السَّامِرِيُّ ﴿85﴾
versets.fr: 85. Allah dit: «Nous avons mis ton peuple à l'épreuve après ton départ. Et le Sâmirî les a égarés».
versets.en: 85. (Allah) said: "Verily! We have tried your people in your absence, and As-Samiri has led them astray."

versets.ar: 86. فَرَجَعَ مُوسَىٰ إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ غَضْبَانَ أَسِفًا ۚ قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ أَلَمْ يَعِدْكُمْ رَبُّكُمْ وَعْدًا حَسَنًا ۚ أَفَطَالَ عَلَيْكُمُ الْعَهْدُ أَمْ أَرَدتُّمْ أَن يَحِلَّ عَلَيْكُمْ غَضَبٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ فَأَخْلَفْتُم مَّوْعِدِي ﴿86﴾
versets.fr: 86. Moïse retourna donc vers son peuple, courroucé et chagriné; il dit: «O mon peuple, votre Seigneur ne vous a-t-Il pas déjà fait une belle promesse? L'alliance a-t-elle donc été trop longue pour vous? ou avez-vous désiré que la colère de votre Seigneur s'abatte sur vous, pour avoir trahi votre engagement envers moi?»
versets.en: 86. Then Musa (Moses) returned to his people in a state of anger and sorrow. He said: "O my people! Did not your Lord promise you a fair promise? Did then the promise seem to you long in coming? Or did you desire that wrath should descend from your Lord on you, so you broke your promise to me (i.e. disbelieving in Allah and worshipping the calf)?"

versets.ar: 87. قَالُوا مَا أَخْلَفْنَا مَوْعِدَكَ بِمَلْكِنَا وَلَٰكِنَّا حُمِّلْنَا أَوْزَارًا مِّن زِينَةِ الْقَوْمِ فَقَذَفْنَاهَا فَكَذَٰلِكَ أَلْقَى السَّامِرِيُّ ﴿87﴾
versets.fr: 87. Ils dirent: «Ce n'est pas de notre propre gré que nous avons manqué à notre engagement envers toi. Mais nous fûmes chargés de fardeaux d'ornements du peuple (de Pharaon); nous les avons donc jetés (sur le feu) tout comme le Sâmirî les a lancés.
versets.en: 87. They said: "We broke not the promise to you, of our own will, but we were made to carry the weight of the ornaments of the [Fir'aun's (Pharaoh)] people, then we cast them (into the fire), and that was what As-Samiri suggested."

versets.ar: 88. فَأَخْرَجَ لَهُمْ عِجْلًا جَسَدًا لَّهُ خُوَارٌ فَقَالُوا هَٰذَا إِلَٰهُكُمْ وَإِلَٰهُ مُوسَىٰ فَنَسِيَ ﴿88﴾
versets.fr: 88. Puis il en a fait sortir pour eux un veau, un corps à mugissement. Et ils ont dit: «C'est votre divinité et la divinité de Moïse; il a donc oublié»!
versets.en: 88. Then he took out (of the fire) for them a statue of a calf which seemed to low. They said: "This is your ilah (god), and the ilah (god) of Musa (Moses), but [Musa (Moses)] has forgotten (his god).'"

versets.ar: 89. أَفَلَا يَرَوْنَ أَلَّا يَرْجِعُ إِلَيْهِمْ قَوْلًا وَلَا يَمْلِكُ لَهُمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا نَفْعًا ﴿89﴾
versets.fr: 89. Quoi! Ne voyaient-ils pas qu'il [le veau] ne leur rendait aucune parole et qu'il ne possédait aucun moyen de leur nuire ou de leur faire du bien?
versets.en: 89. Did they not see that it could not return them a word (for answer), and that it had no power either to harm them or to do them good?

versets.ar: 90. وَلَقَدْ قَالَ لَهُمْ هَارُونُ مِن قَبْلُ يَا قَوْمِ إِنَّمَا فُتِنتُم بِهِ ۖ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكُمُ الرَّحْمَٰنُ فَاتَّبِعُونِي وَأَطِيعُوا أَمْرِي ﴿90﴾
versets.fr: 90. Certes, Aaron leur avait bien dit auparavant: «O mon peuple, vous êtes tombés dans la tentation (à cause du veau). Or, c'est le Tout Miséricordieux qui est vraiment votre Seigneur. Suivez-moi donc et obéissez à mon commandement».
versets.en: 90. And Harun (Aaron) indeed had said to them beforehand: "O my people! You are being tried in this, and verily, your Lord is (Allah) the Most Beneficent, so follow me and obey my order."

versets.ar: 91. قَالُوا لَن نَّبْرَحَ عَلَيْهِ عَاكِفِينَ حَتَّىٰ يَرْجِعَ إِلَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ ﴿91﴾
versets.fr: 91. Ils dirent: «Nous continuerons à y être attachés, jusqu'à ce que Moïse retourne vers nous».
versets.en: 91. They said: "We will not stop worshipping it (i.e. the calf), until Musa (Moses) returns to us."

versets.ar: 92. قَالَ يَا هَارُونُ مَا مَنَعَكَ إِذْ رَأَيْتَهُمْ ضَلُّوا ﴿92﴾
versets.fr: 92. Alors [Moïse] dit: «Qu'est-ce qui t'a empêché, Aaron, quand tu les as vus s'égarer,
versets.en: 92. [Musa (Moses)] said: "O Harun (Aaron)! What stopped you when you saw them going astray;

versets.ar: 93. أَلَّا تَتَّبِعَنِ ۖ أَفَعَصَيْتَ أَمْرِي ﴿93﴾
versets.fr: 93. de me suivre? As-tu donc désobéi à mon commandement?»
versets.en: 93. "That you followed me not (according to my advice to you)? Have you then disobeyed my order?"

versets.ar: 94. قَالَ يَا ابْنَ أُمَّ لَا تَأْخُذْ بِلِحْيَتِي وَلَا بِرَأْسِي ۖ إِنِّي خَشِيتُ أَن تَقُولَ فَرَّقْتَ بَيْنَ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ وَلَمْ تَرْقُبْ قَوْلِي ﴿94﴾
versets.fr: 94. [Aaron] dit: «O fils de ma mère, ne me prends ni par la barbe ni par la tête. Je craignais que tu ne dises: «Tu as divisé les enfants d'Israël et tu n'as pas observé mes ordres».
versets.en: 94. He [Harun (Aaron)] said: "O son of my mother! Seize (me) not by my beard, nor by my head! Verily, I feared lest you should say: 'You have caused a division among the Children of Israel, and you have not respected my word!' "

versets.ar: 95. قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكَ يَا سَامِرِيُّ ﴿95﴾
versets.fr: 95. Alors [Moïse] dit: «Quel a été ton dessein? O Sâmirî?»
versets.en: 95. [Musa (Moses)] said: "And what is the matter with you. O Samiri? (i.e. why did you do so?)"

versets.ar: 96. قَالَ بَصُرْتُ بِمَا لَمْ يَبْصُرُوا بِهِ فَقَبَضْتُ قَبْضَةً مِّنْ أَثَرِ الرَّسُولِ فَنَبَذْتُهَا وَكَذَٰلِكَ سَوَّلَتْ لِي نَفْسِي ﴿96﴾
versets.fr: 96. Il dit: «J'ai vu ce qu'ils n'ont pas vu: j'ai donc pris une poignée de la trace de l'Envoyé; puis, je l'ai lancée. Voilà ce que mon âme m'a suggéré».
versets.en: 96. (Samiri) said: "I saw what they saw not, so I took a handful (of dust) from the hoof print of the messenger [Jibrael's (Gabriel) horse] and threw it [into the fire in which were put the ornaments of the Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) people, or into the calf]. Thus my inner-self suggested to me."

versets.ar: 97. قَالَ فَاذْهَبْ فَإِنَّ لَكَ فِي الْحَيَاةِ أَن تَقُولَ لَا مِسَاسَ ۖ وَإِنَّ لَكَ مَوْعِدًا لَّن تُخْلَفَهُ ۖ وَانظُرْ إِلَىٰ إِلَٰهِكَ الَّذِي ظَلْتَ عَلَيْهِ عَاكِفًا ۖ لَّنُحَرِّقَنَّهُ ثُمَّ لَنَنسِفَنَّهُ فِي الْيَمِّ نَسْفًا ﴿97﴾
versets.fr: 97. «Va-t-en, dit [Moïse]. Dans la vie, tu auras à dire (à tout le monde): «Ne me touchez pas!» Et il y aura pour toi un rendez-vous que tu ne pourras manquer. Regarde ta divinité que tu as adorée avec assiduité. Nous la brûlerons certes, et ensuite, nous disperserons [sa cendre] dans les flots.
versets.en: 97. Musa (Moses) said: "Then go away! And verily, your (punishment) in this life will be that you will say: "Touch me not (i.e. you will live alone exiled away from mankind); and verily (for a future torment), you have a promise that will not fail. And look at your ilah (god), to which you have been devoted. We will certainly burn it, and scatter its particles in the sea."

versets.ar: 98. إِنَّمَا إِلَٰهُكُمُ اللَّهُ الَّذِي لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ عِلْمًا ﴿98﴾
versets.fr: 98. En vérité, votre seul Dieu est Allah en dehors de qui il n'y a point de divinité. De Sa science Il embrasse tout.
versets.en: 98. Your Ilah (God) is only Allah, the One (La ilaha illa Huwa) (none has the right to be worshipped but He). He has full knowledge of all things.

versets.ar: 99. كَذَٰلِكَ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ مِنْ أَنبَاءِ مَا قَدْ سَبَقَ ۚ وَقَدْ آتَيْنَاكَ مِن لَّدُنَّا ذِكْرًا ﴿99﴾
versets.fr: 99. C'est ainsi que Nous te racontons les récits de ce qui s'est passé. C'est bien un rappel de Notre part que Nous t'avons apporté.
versets.en: 99. Thus We relate to you (O Muhammad SAW) some information of what happened before. And indeed We have given you from Us a Reminder (this Quran).

versets.ar: 100. مَّنْ أَعْرَضَ عَنْهُ فَإِنَّهُ يَحْمِلُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ وِزْرًا ﴿100﴾
versets.fr: 100. Quiconque s'en détourne (de ce Coran), portera au jour de la résurrection un fardeau;
versets.en: 100. Whoever turns away from it (this Quran i.e. does not believe in it, nor acts on its orders), verily, they will bear a heavy burden (of sins) on the Day of Resurrection,

versets.ar: 101. خَالِدِينَ فِيهِ ۖ وَسَاءَ لَهُمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ حِمْلًا ﴿101﴾
versets.fr: 101. ils resteront éternellement dans cet état, et quel mauvais fardeau pour eux au Jour de la Résurrection,
versets.en: 101. They will abide in that (state in the Fire of Hell), and evil indeed will it be that load for them on the Day of Resurrection;

versets.ar: 102. يَوْمَ يُنفَخُ فِي الصُّورِ ۚ وَنَحْشُرُ الْمُجْرِمِينَ يَوْمَئِذٍ زُرْقًا ﴿102﴾
versets.fr: 102. Le jour où l'on soufflera dans la Trompe, ce jour-là Nous rassemblerons les criminels tout bleus (de peur)!
versets.en: 102. The Day when the Trumpet will be blown (the second blowing): that Day, We shall gather the Mujrimun (criminals, polytheists, sinners, disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah, etc.) Zurqa: (blue or blind eyed with black faces).

versets.ar: 103. يَتَخَافَتُونَ بَيْنَهُمْ إِن لَّبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا عَشْرًا ﴿103﴾
versets.fr: 103. Ils chuchoteront entre eux: «Vous n'êtes restés là que dix [jours]!»
versets.en: 103. In whispers will they speak to each other (saying): "You stayed not longer than ten (days)."

versets.ar: 104. نَّحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ إِذْ يَقُولُ أَمْثَلُهُمْ طَرِيقَةً إِن لَّبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا يَوْمًا ﴿104﴾
versets.fr: 104. Nous connaissons parfaitement ce qu'ils diront lorsque l'un d'entre eux dont la conduite est exemplaire dira: «Vous n'êtes restés qu'un jour».
versets.en: 104. We know very well what they will say, when the best among them in knowledge and wisdom will say: "You stayed no longer than a day!"

versets.ar: 105. وَيَسْأَلُونَكَ عَنِ الْجِبَالِ فَقُلْ يَنسِفُهَا رَبِّي نَسْفًا ﴿105﴾
versets.fr: 105. Et ils t'interrogent au sujet des montagnes. Dis: «Mon Seigneur les dispersera comme la poussière,
versets.en: 105. And they ask you concerning the mountains, say; "My Lord will blast them and scatter them as particles of dust.

versets.ar: 106. فَيَذَرُهَا قَاعًا صَفْصَفًا ﴿106﴾
versets.fr: 106. et les laissera comme une plaine dénudée
versets.en: 106. "Then He shall leave it as a level smooth plain.

versets.ar: 107. لَّا تَرَىٰ فِيهَا عِوَجًا وَلَا أَمْتًا ﴿107﴾
versets.fr: 107. dans laquelle tu ne verras ni tortuosité, ni dépression.
versets.en: 107. "You will see therein nothing crooked or curved."

versets.ar: 108. يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَّبِعُونَ الدَّاعِيَ لَا عِوَجَ لَهُ ۖ وَخَشَعَتِ الْأَصْوَاتُ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ فَلَا تَسْمَعُ إِلَّا هَمْسًا ﴿108﴾
versets.fr: 108. Ce jour-là, ils suivront le Convocateur sans tortuosité; et les voix baisseront devant le Tout Miséricordieux. Tu n'entendras alors qu'un chuchotement.
versets.en: 108. On that Day mankind will follow strictly (the voice of) Allah's caller, no crookedness (that is without going to the right or left of that voice) will they show him (Allah's caller). And all voices will be humbled for the Most Beneficent (Allah), and nothing shall you hear but the low voice of their footsteps.

versets.ar: 109. يَوْمَئِذٍ لَّا تَنفَعُ الشَّفَاعَةُ إِلَّا مَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُ الرَّحْمَٰنُ وَرَضِيَ لَهُ قَوْلًا ﴿109﴾
versets.fr: 109. Ce jour-là, l'intercession ne profitera qu'à celui auquel le Tout Miséricordieux aura donné Sa permission et dont Il agréera la parole.
versets.en: 109. On that day no intercession shall avail, except the one for whom the Most Beneficent (Allah) has given permission and whose word is acceptable to Him.

versets.ar: 110. يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِهِ عِلْمًا ﴿110﴾
versets.fr: 110. Il connaît ce qui est devant eux et ce qui est derrière eux, alors qu'eux-mêmes ne Le cernent pas de leur science.
versets.en: 110. He (Allah) knows what happens to them (His creatures) in this world, and what will happen to them (in the Hereafter), and they will never compass anything of His Knowledge.

versets.ar: 111. ۞ وَعَنَتِ الْوُجُوهُ لِلْحَيِّ الْقَيُّومِ ۖ وَقَدْ خَابَ مَنْ حَمَلَ ظُلْمًا ﴿111﴾
versets.fr: 111. Et les visages s'humilieront devant Le Vivant, Celui qui subsiste par Lui-même «al-Qayyûm», et malheureux sera celui qui [se présentera devant Lui] chargé d'une iniquité.
versets.en: 111. And (all) faces shall be humbled before (Allah), the Ever Living, the One Who sustains and protects all that exists. And he who carried (a burden of) wrongdoing (i.e. he who disbelieved in Allah, ascribed partners to Him, and did deeds of His disobedience), became indeed a complete failure (on that Day).

versets.ar: 112. وَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِنَ الصَّالِحَاتِ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌ فَلَا يَخَافُ ظُلْمًا وَلَا هَضْمًا ﴿112﴾
versets.fr: 112. Et quiconque aura fait de bonnes œuvres tout en étant croyant, ne craindra ni injustice ni oppression.
versets.en: 112. And he who works deeds of righteousness, while he is a believer (in Islamic Monotheism) then he will have no fear of injustice, nor of any curtailment (of his reward).

versets.ar: 113. وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَنزَلْنَاهُ قُرْآنًا عَرَبِيًّا وَصَرَّفْنَا فِيهِ مِنَ الْوَعِيدِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَّقُونَ أَوْ يُحْدِثُ لَهُمْ ذِكْرًا ﴿113﴾
versets.fr: 113. C'est ainsi que nous l'avons fait descendre un Coran en [langue] arabe, et Nous y avons multiplié les menaces, afin qu'ils deviennent pieux ou qu'il les incite à s'exhorter?
versets.en: 113. And thus We have sent it down as a Quran in Arabic, and have explained therein in detail the warnings, in order that they may fear Allah, or that it may cause them to have a lesson from it (or to have the honour for believing and acting on its teachings).

versets.ar: 114. فَتَعَالَى اللَّهُ الْمَلِكُ الْحَقُّ ۗ وَلَا تَعْجَلْ بِالْقُرْآنِ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يُقْضَىٰ إِلَيْكَ وَحْيُهُ ۖ وَقُل رَّبِّ زِدْنِي عِلْمًا ﴿114﴾
versets.fr: 114. Que soit éxalté Allah, le Vrai Souverain! Ne te hâte pas [de réciter] le Coran avant que ne te soit achevée sa révélation. Et dis: «O mon Seigneur, accroît mes connaissances!»
versets.en: 114. Then High above all be Allah, the True King. And be not in haste (O Muhammad SAW) with the Quran before its revelation is completed to you, and say: "My Lord! Increase me in knowledge."

versets.ar: 115. وَلَقَدْ عَهِدْنَا إِلَىٰ آدَمَ مِن قَبْلُ فَنَسِيَ وَلَمْ نَجِدْ لَهُ عَزْمًا ﴿115﴾
versets.fr: 115. En effet, Nous avons auparavant fait une recommandation à Adam; mais il oublia; et Nous n'avons pas trouvé chez lui de résolution ferme.
versets.en: 115. And indeed We made a covenant with Adam before, but he forgot, and We found on his part no firm will-power.

versets.ar: 116. وَإِذْ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ اسْجُدُوا لِآدَمَ فَسَجَدُوا إِلَّا إِبْلِيسَ أَبَىٰ ﴿116﴾
versets.fr: 116. Et quand Nous dîmes aux Anges: «Prosternez-vous devant Adam», ils se prosternèrent, excepté Iblis qui refusa.
versets.en: 116. And (remember) when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves to Adam." They prostrated (all) except Iblis (Satan), who refused.

versets.ar: 117. فَقُلْنَا يَا آدَمُ إِنَّ هَٰذَا عَدُوٌّ لَّكَ وَلِزَوْجِكَ فَلَا يُخْرِجَنَّكُمَا مِنَ الْجَنَّةِ فَتَشْقَىٰ ﴿117﴾
versets.fr: 117. Alors Nous dîmes: «O Adam, celui-là est vraiment un ennemi pour toi et ton épouse. Prenez garde qu'il vous fasse sortir du Paradis, car alors tu seras malheureux.
versets.en: 117. Then We said: "O Adam! Verily, this is an enemy to you and to your wife. So let him not get you both out of Paradise, so that you be distressed in misery.

versets.ar: 118. إِنَّ لَكَ أَلَّا تَجُوعَ فِيهَا وَلَا تَعْرَىٰ ﴿118﴾
versets.fr: 118. Car tu n'y auras pas faim ni ne seras nu,
versets.en: 118. Verily, you have (a promise from Us) that you will never be hungry therein nor naked.

versets.ar: 119. وَأَنَّكَ لَا تَظْمَأُ فِيهَا وَلَا تَضْحَىٰ ﴿119﴾
versets.fr: 119. tu n'y auras pas soif ni ne seras frappé par l'ardeur du soleil».
versets.en: 119. And you (will) suffer not from thirst therein nor from the sun's heat.

versets.ar: 120. فَوَسْوَسَ إِلَيْهِ الشَّيْطَانُ قَالَ يَا آدَمُ هَلْ أَدُلُّكَ عَلَىٰ شَجَرَةِ الْخُلْدِ وَمُلْكٍ لَّا يَبْلَىٰ ﴿120﴾
versets.fr: 120. Puis le Diable le tenta en disant: «O Adam, t'indiquerai-je l'arbre de l'éternité et un royaume impérissable?»
versets.en: 120. Then Shaitan (Satan) whispered to him, saying: "O Adam! Shall I lead you to the Tree of Eternity and to a kingdom that will never waste away?"

versets.ar: 121. فَأَكَلَا مِنْهَا فَبَدَتْ لَهُمَا سَوْآتُهُمَا وَطَفِقَا يَخْصِفَانِ عَلَيْهِمَا مِن وَرَقِ الْجَنَّةِ ۚ وَعَصَىٰ آدَمُ رَبَّهُ فَغَوَىٰ ﴿121﴾
versets.fr: 121. Tous deux (Adam et Eve) en mangèrent. Alors leur apparut leur nudité. Ils se mirent à se couvrir avec des feuilles du paradis. Adam désobéit ainsi à son Seigneur et il s'égara.
versets.en: 121. Then they both ate of the tree, and so their private parts appeared to them, and they began to stick on themselves the leaves from Paradise for their covering. Thus did Adam disobey his Lord, so he went astray.

versets.ar: 122. ثُمَّ اجْتَبَاهُ رَبُّهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيْهِ وَهَدَىٰ ﴿122﴾
versets.fr: 122. Son Seigneur l'a ensuite élu, agréé son repentir et l'a guidé.
versets.en: 122. Then his Lord chose him, and turned to him with forgiveness, and gave him guidance.

versets.ar: 123. قَالَ اهْبِطَا مِنْهَا جَمِيعًا ۖ بَعْضُكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ عَدُوٌّ ۖ فَإِمَّا يَأْتِيَنَّكُم مِّنِّي هُدًى فَمَنِ اتَّبَعَ هُدَايَ فَلَا يَضِلُّ وَلَا يَشْقَىٰ ﴿123﴾
versets.fr: 123. Il dit: «Descendez d'ici, (Adam et Eve), [Vous serez] tous (avec vos descendants) ennemis les uns des autres. Puis, si jamais un guide vous vient de Ma part, quiconque suit Mon guide ne s'égarera ni ne sera malheureux.
versets.en: 123. (Allah) said:"Get you down (from the Paradise to the earth), both of you, together, some of you are an enemy to some others. Then if there comes to you guidance from Me, then whoever follows My Guidance shall neither go astray, nor fall into distress and misery.

versets.ar: 124. وَمَنْ أَعْرَضَ عَن ذِكْرِي فَإِنَّ لَهُ مَعِيشَةً ضَنكًا وَنَحْشُرُهُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ أَعْمَىٰ ﴿124﴾
versets.fr: 124. Et quiconque se détourne de Mon Rappel, mènera certes, une vie pleine de gêne, et le Jour de la Résurrection Nous l'amènerons aveugle au rassemblement».
versets.en: 124. "But whosoever turns away from My Reminder (i.e. neither believes in this Quran nor acts on its orders, etc.) verily, for him is a life of hardship, and We shall raise him up blind on the Day of Resurrection."

versets.ar: 125. قَالَ رَبِّ لِمَ حَشَرْتَنِي أَعْمَىٰ وَقَدْ كُنتُ بَصِيرًا ﴿125﴾
versets.fr: 125. Il dira: «O mon Seigneur, pourquoi m'as-Tu amené aveugle alors qu'auparavant je voyais?»
versets.en: 125. He will say:"O my Lord! Why have you raised me up blind, while I had sight (before)."

versets.ar: 126. قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ أَتَتْكَ آيَاتُنَا فَنَسِيتَهَا ۖ وَكَذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمَ تُنسَىٰ ﴿126﴾
versets.fr: 126. [Allah lui] dira: «De même que Nos Signes (enseignements) t'étaient venus et que tu les as oubliés, ainsi aujourd'hui tu es oublié».
versets.en: 126. (Allah) will say: "Like this, Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) came unto you, but you disregarded them (i.e. you left them, did not think deeply in them, and you turned away from them), and so this Day, you will be neglected (in the Hell-fire, away from Allah's Mercy)."

versets.ar: 127. وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي مَنْ أَسْرَفَ وَلَمْ يُؤْمِن بِآيَاتِ رَبِّهِ ۚ وَلَعَذَابُ الْآخِرَةِ أَشَدُّ وَأَبْقَىٰ ﴿127﴾
versets.fr: 127. Ainsi sanctionnons-nous l'outrancier qui ne croit pas aux révélations de son Seigneur. Et certes, le châtiment de l'au-delà est plus sévère et plus durable.
versets.en: 127. And thus do We requite him who transgresses beyond bounds [i.e. commits the great sins and disobeys his Lord (Allah) and believes not in His Messengers, and His revealed Books, like this Quran, etc.], and believes not in the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) of his Lord, and the torment of the Hereafter is far more severe and more lasting.

versets.ar: 128. أَفَلَمْ يَهْدِ لَهُمْ كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّنَ الْقُرُونِ يَمْشُونَ فِي مَسَاكِنِهِمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِّأُولِي النُّهَىٰ ﴿128﴾
versets.fr: 128. Cela ne leur a-t-il pas servi de direction, que Nous ayons fait périr avant eux tant de générations dans les demeures desquelles ils marchent maintenant? Voilà bien là des leçons pour les doués d'intelligence!
versets.en: 128. Is it not a guidance for them (to know) how many generations We have destroyed before them, in whose dwellings they walk? Verily, in this are signs indeed for men of understanding.

versets.ar: 129. وَلَوْلَا كَلِمَةٌ سَبَقَتْ مِن رَّبِّكَ لَكَانَ لِزَامًا وَأَجَلٌ مُّسَمًّى ﴿129﴾
versets.fr: 129. N'eussent-été un décret préalable de ton Seigneur et aussi un terme déjà fixé, (leur châtiment) aurait été inévitable (et immédiat).
versets.en: 129. And had it not been for a Word that went forth before from your Lord, and a term determined, (their punishment) must necessarily have come (in this world).

versets.ar: 130. فَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ الشَّمْسِ وَقَبْلَ غُرُوبِهَا ۖ وَمِنْ آنَاءِ اللَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْ وَأَطْرَافَ النَّهَارِ لَعَلَّكَ تَرْضَىٰ ﴿130﴾
versets.fr: 130. Supporte patiemment ce qu'ils disent et célèbre Sa louange, avant le lever du soleil, avant son coucher et pendant la nuit; et exalte Sa Gloire aux extrémités du jour. Peut-être auras-tu satisfaction:
versets.en: 130. So bear patiently (O Muhammad SAW) what they say, and glorify the praises of your Lord before the rising of the sun, and before its setting, and during some of the hours of the night, and at the sides of the day (an indication for the five compulsory congregational prayers), that you may become pleased with the reward which Allah shall give you.

versets.ar: 131. وَلَا تَمُدَّنَّ عَيْنَيْكَ إِلَىٰ مَا مَتَّعْنَا بِهِ أَزْوَاجًا مِّنْهُمْ زَهْرَةَ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا لِنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِ ۚ وَرِزْقُ رَبِّكَ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰ ﴿131﴾
versets.fr: 131. Et ne tends point les yeux vers ce dont Nous avons donné jouissance temporaire à certains groupes d'entre eux, comme décor de la vie présente, afin de les éprouver par cela. Ce qu'Allah fournit (au Paradis) est meilleur et plus durable.
versets.en: 131. And strain not your eyes in longing for the things We have given for enjoyment to various groups of them (polytheists and disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah), the splendour of the life of this world that We may test them thereby. But the provision (good reward in the Hereafter) of your Lord is better and more lasting.

versets.ar: 132. وَأْمُرْ أَهْلَكَ بِالصَّلَاةِ وَاصْطَبِرْ عَلَيْهَا ۖ لَا نَسْأَلُكَ رِزْقًا ۖ نَّحْنُ نَرْزُقُكَ ۗ وَالْعَاقِبَةُ لِلتَّقْوَىٰ ﴿132﴾
versets.fr: 132. Et commande à ta famille la Salât, et fais-la avec persévérance. Nous ne te demandons point de nourriture: c'est à Nous de te nourrir. La bonne fin est réservée à la piété.
versets.en: 132. And enjoin As-Salat (the prayer) on your family, and be patient in offering them [i.e. the Salat (prayers)]. We ask not of you a provision (i.e. to give Us something: money, etc.); We provide for you. And the good end (i.e. Paradise) is for the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2).

versets.ar: 133. وَقَالُوا لَوْلَا يَأْتِينَا بِآيَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّهِ ۚ أَوَلَمْ تَأْتِهِم بَيِّنَةُ مَا فِي الصُّحُفِ الْأُولَىٰ ﴿133﴾
versets.fr: 133. Et ils disent: «Pourquoi ne nous apporte-t-il pas un miracle de son Seigneur? La Preuve (le Coran) de ce que contiennent les Ecritures anciennes ne leur est-elle pas venue?
versets.en: 133. They say: "Why does he not bring us a sign (proof) from his Lord?" Has there not come to them the proof of that which is (written) in the former papers [Scriptures, i.e. the Taurat (Torah), and the Injeel (Gospel), etc. about the coming of the Prophet Muhammad SAW].

versets.ar: 134. وَلَوْ أَنَّا أَهْلَكْنَاهُم بِعَذَابٍ مِّن قَبْلِهِ لَقَالُوا رَبَّنَا لَوْلَا أَرْسَلْتَ إِلَيْنَا رَسُولًا فَنَتَّبِعَ آيَاتِكَ مِن قَبْلِ أَن نَّذِلَّ وَنَخْزَىٰ ﴿134﴾
versets.fr: 134. Et si Nous les avions fait périr par un châtiment avant lui [Muhammad], ils auraient certainement dit: «O notre Seigneur, pourquoi ne nous as-Tu pas envoyé de Messager? Nous aurions alors suivi Tes enseignements avant d'avoir été humiliés et jetés dans l'ignominie».
versets.en: 134. And if We had destroyed them with a torment before this (i.e. Messenger Muhammad SAW and the Quran), they would surely have said: "Our Lord! If only You had sent us a Messenger, we should certainly have followed Your Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.), before we were humiliated and disgraced."

versets.ar: 135. قُلْ كُلٌّ مُّتَرَبِّصٌ فَتَرَبَّصُوا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَصْحَابُ الصِّرَاطِ السَّوِيِّ وَمَنِ اهْتَدَىٰ ﴿135﴾
versets.fr: 135. Dis: «Chacun attend. Attendez donc! Vous saurez bientôt qui sont les gens du droit chemin et qui sont les bien-guidés».
versets.en: 135. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "Each one (believer and disbeliever, etc.) is waiting, so wait you too, and you shall know who are they that are on the Straight and Even Path (i.e. Allah's Religion of Islamic Monotheism), and who are they that have let themselves be guided (on the Right Path).

versets.ar: 1. اقْتَرَبَ لِلنَّاسِ حِسَابُهُمْ وَهُمْ فِي غَفْلَةٍ مُّعْرِضُونَ ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. [L'échéance] du règlement de leur compte approche pour les hommes, alors que dans leur insouciance ils s'en détournent.
versets.en: 1. Draws near for mankind their reckoning, while they turn away in heedlessness.

versets.ar: 2. مَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن ذِكْرٍ مِّن رَّبِّهِم مُّحْدَثٍ إِلَّا اسْتَمَعُوهُ وَهُمْ يَلْعَبُونَ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Aucun rappel [de révélation] récente ne leur vient de leur Seigneur, sans qu'ils ne l'entendent en s'amusant,
versets.en: 2. Comes not unto them an admonition (a chapter of the Quran) from their Lord as a recent revelation but they listen to it while they play,

versets.ar: 3. لَاهِيَةً قُلُوبُهُمْ ۗ وَأَسَرُّوا النَّجْوَى الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا هَلْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُكُمْ ۖ أَفَتَأْتُونَ السِّحْرَ وَأَنتُمْ تُبْصِرُونَ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. leurs cœurs distraits; et les injustes tiennent des conversations secrètes et disent: «Ce n'est là qu'un être humain semblable à vous? Allez-vous donc vous adonner à la magie alors que vous voyez clair?»
versets.en: 3. With their hearts occupied (with evil things) those who do wrong, conceal their private counsels, (saying): "Is this (Muhammad SAW) more than a human being like you? Will you submit to magic while you see it?"

versets.ar: 4. قَالَ رَبِّي يَعْلَمُ الْقَوْلَ فِي السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Il a répondu: «Mon Seigneur sait tout ce qui se dit au ciel et sur la terre; et Il est l'Audient, l'Omniscient».
versets.en: 4. He (Muhammad SAW) said: "My Lord knows (every) word (spoken) in the heavens and on earth. And He is the All-Hearer, the All-Knower."

versets.ar: 5. بَلْ قَالُوا أَضْغَاثُ أَحْلَامٍ بَلِ افْتَرَاهُ بَلْ هُوَ شَاعِرٌ فَلْيَأْتِنَا بِآيَةٍ كَمَا أُرْسِلَ الْأَوَّلُونَ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Mais ils dirent: «Voilà plutôt un amas de rêves! Ou bien Il l'a inventé. Ou, c'est plutôt un poète. Qu'il nous apporte donc un signe [identique] à celui dont furent chargés les premiers envoyés».
versets.en: 5. Nay, they say:"These (revelations of the Quran which are inspired to Muhammad SAW) are mixed up false dreams! Nay, he has invented it! Nay, he is a poet! Let him then bring us an Ayah (sign as a proof) like the ones (Prophets) that were sent before (with signs)!"

versets.ar: 6. مَا آمَنَتْ قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْيَةٍ أَهْلَكْنَاهَا ۖ أَفَهُمْ يُؤْمِنُونَ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Pas une seule cité parmi celles que Nous avons fait périr avant eux n'avait cru [à la vue des miracles]. Ceux-ci croiront-ils donc?
versets.en: 6. Not one of the towns (populations), of those which We destroyed, believed before them (though We sent them signs), will they then believe?

versets.ar: 7. وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا قَبْلَكَ إِلَّا رِجَالًا نُّوحِي إِلَيْهِمْ ۖ فَاسْأَلُوا أَهْلَ الذِّكْرِ إِن كُنتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. Nous n'avons envoyé avant toi que des hommes à qui Nous faisions des révélations. Demandez donc aux érudits du Livre, si vous ne savez pas.
versets.en: 7. And We sent not before you (O Muhammad SAW) but men to whom We inspired, so ask the people of the Reminder [Scriptures - the Taurat (Torah), the Injeel (Gospel)] if you do not know.

versets.ar: 8. وَمَا جَعَلْنَاهُمْ جَسَدًا لَّا يَأْكُلُونَ الطَّعَامَ وَمَا كَانُوا خَالِدِينَ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Et Nous n'en n'avons pas fait des corps qui ne consommaient pas de nourriture. Et ils n'étaient pas éternels.
versets.en: 8. And We did not create them (the Messengers, with) bodies that ate not food, nor were they immortals,

versets.ar: 9. ثُمَّ صَدَقْنَاهُمُ الْوَعْدَ فَأَنجَيْنَاهُمْ وَمَن نَّشَاءُ وَأَهْلَكْنَا الْمُسْرِفِينَ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Puis Nous réalisâmes la promesse (qui leur avait été faite). Nous les sauvâmes avec ceux que Nous voulûmes [sauver]. Et Nous fîmes périr les outranciers.
versets.en: 9. Then We fulfilled to them the promise, and We saved them and those whom We willed, but We destroyed Al-Musrifun (i.e. extravagants in oppression, polytheism and in sin).

versets.ar: 10. لَقَدْ أَنزَلْنَا إِلَيْكُمْ كِتَابًا فِيهِ ذِكْرُكُمْ ۖ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Nous avons assurément fait descendre vers vous un livre où se trouve votre rappel [ou votre renom]. Ne comprenez-vous donc pas?
versets.en: 10. Indeed, We have sent down for you (O mankind) a Book, (the Quran) in which there is Dhikrukum, (your Reminder or an honour for you i.e. honour for the one who follows the teaching of the Quran and acts on its orders). Will you not then understand?

versets.ar: 11. وَكَمْ قَصَمْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ كَانَتْ ظَالِمَةً وَأَنشَأْنَا بَعْدَهَا قَوْمًا آخَرِينَ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. Et que de cités qui ont commis des injustices, Nous avons brisées; et Nous avons créé d'autres peuples après eux.
versets.en: 11. How many a town (community), that were wrong-doers, have We destroyed, and raised up after them another people!

versets.ar: 12. فَلَمَّا أَحَسُّوا بَأْسَنَا إِذَا هُم مِّنْهَا يَرْكُضُونَ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. Quand [ces gens] sentirent Notre rigueur ils s'en enfuirent hâtivement.
versets.en: 12. Then, when they perceived (saw) Our Torment (coming), behold, they (tried to) flee from it.

versets.ar: 13. لَا تَرْكُضُوا وَارْجِعُوا إِلَىٰ مَا أُتْرِفْتُمْ فِيهِ وَمَسَاكِنِكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُسْأَلُونَ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. Ne galopez point. Retournez plutôt au grand luxe où vous étiez et dans vos demeures, afin que vous soyez interrogés.
versets.en: 13. Flee not, but return to that wherein you lived a luxurious life, and to your homes, in order that you may be questioned.

versets.ar: 14. قَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. Ils dirent: «Malheur à nous! Nous étions vraiment injustes».
versets.en: 14. They cried: "Woe to us! Certainly! We have been Zalimun (polytheists, wrong-doers and disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah, etc.)."

versets.ar: 15. فَمَا زَالَت تِّلْكَ دَعْوَاهُمْ حَتَّىٰ جَعَلْنَاهُمْ حَصِيدًا خَامِدِينَ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Telle ne cessa d'être leur lamentation jusqu'à ce que Nous les eûmes moissonnés et éteints.
versets.en: 15. And that cry of theirs ceased not, till We made them as a field that is reaped, extinct (dead).

versets.ar: 16. وَمَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاءَ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا لَاعِبِينَ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Ce n'est pas par jeu que Nous avons créé le ciel et la terre et ce qui est entre eux.
versets.en: 16. We created not the heavens and the earth and all that is between them for a (mere) play.

versets.ar: 17. لَوْ أَرَدْنَا أَن نَّتَّخِذَ لَهْوًا لَّاتَّخَذْنَاهُ مِن لَّدُنَّا إِن كُنَّا فَاعِلِينَ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Si Nous avions voulu prendre une distraction, Nous l'aurions prise de Nous-mêmes, si vraiment Nous avions voulu le faire.
versets.en: 17. Had We intended to take a pastime (i.e. a wife or a son, etc.), We could surely have taken it from Us, if We were going to do (that).

versets.ar: 18. بَلْ نَقْذِفُ بِالْحَقِّ عَلَى الْبَاطِلِ فَيَدْمَغُهُ فَإِذَا هُوَ زَاهِقٌ ۚ وَلَكُمُ الْوَيْلُ مِمَّا تَصِفُونَ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. Bien au contraire, Nous lançons contre le faux la vérité qui le subjugue, et le voilà qui disparaît. Et malheur à vous pour ce que vous attribuez [injustement à Allah].
versets.en: 18. Nay, We fling (send down) the truth (this Quran) against the falsehood (disbelief), so it destroys it, and behold, it (falsehood) is vanished. And woe to you for that (lie) which you ascribe (to Us) (against Allah by uttering that Allah has a wife and a son).

versets.ar: 19. وَلَهُ مَن فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَمَنْ عِندَهُ لَا يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ عَنْ عِبَادَتِهِ وَلَا يَسْتَحْسِرُونَ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. A Lui seul appartiennent tous ceux qui sont dans les cieux et sur la terre. Ceux qui sont auprès de Lui [les Anges] ne se considèrent point trop grands pour L'adorer et ne s'en lassent pas.
versets.en: 19. To Him belongs whosoever is in the heavens and on earth. And those who are near Him (i.e. the angels) are not too proud to worship Him, nor are they weary (of His worship).

versets.ar: 20. يُسَبِّحُونَ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ لَا يَفْتُرُونَ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. Ils exaltent Sa Gloire nuit et jour et ne s'interrompent point.
versets.en: 20. They (i.e. the angels) glorify His Praises night and day, (and) they never slacken (to do so).

versets.ar: 21. أَمِ اتَّخَذُوا آلِهَةً مِّنَ الْأَرْضِ هُمْ يُنشِرُونَ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Ont-ils pris des divinités qui peuvent ressusciter (les morts) de la terre?
versets.en: 21. Or have they taken (for worship) aliha (gods) from the earth who raise the dead?

versets.ar: 22. لَوْ كَانَ فِيهِمَا آلِهَةٌ إِلَّا اللَّهُ لَفَسَدَتَا ۚ فَسُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَرْشِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. S'il y avait dans le ciel et la terre des divinités autres qu'Allah, tous deux seraient certes dans le désordre. Gloire, donc à Allah, Seigneur du Trône; Il est au-dessus de ce qu'ils Lui attribuent!
versets.en: 22. Had there been therein (in the heavens and the earth) gods besides Allah, then verily both would have been ruined. Glorified be Allah, the Lord of the Throne, (High is He) above what they attribute to Him!

versets.ar: 23. لَا يُسْأَلُ عَمَّا يَفْعَلُ وَهُمْ يُسْأَلُونَ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. Il n'est pas interrogé sur ce qu'Il fait, mais ce sont eux qui devront rendre compte [de leurs actes].
versets.en: 23. He cannot be questioned as to what He does, while they will be questioned.

versets.ar: 24. أَمِ اتَّخَذُوا مِن دُونِهِ آلِهَةً ۖ قُلْ هَاتُوا بُرْهَانَكُمْ ۖ هَٰذَا ذِكْرُ مَن مَّعِيَ وَذِكْرُ مَن قَبْلِي ۗ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ الْحَقَّ ۖ فَهُم مُّعْرِضُونَ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Ont-ils pris des divinités en dehors de Lui? Dis: «Apportez votre preuve». Ceci est la révélation de ceux qui sont avec moi et de ceux qui étaient avant moi. Mais la plupart d'entre eux ne connaissent pas la vérité et s'en écartent.
versets.en: 24. Or have they taken for worship (other) aliha (gods) besides Him? Say: "Bring your proof:" This (the Quran) is the Reminder for those with me and the Reminder for those before me. But most of them know not the Truth, so they are averse.

versets.ar: 25. وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ مِن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا نُوحِي إِلَيْهِ أَنَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا أَنَا فَاعْبُدُونِ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Et Nous n'avons envoyé avant toi aucun Messager à qui Nous n'ayons révélé: «Point de divinité en dehors de Moi. Adorez-Moi donc».
versets.en: 25. And We did not send any Messenger before you (O Muhammad SAW) but We inspired him (saying): La ilaha illa Ana [none has the right to be worshipped but I (Allah)], so worship Me (Alone and none else)."

versets.ar: 26. وَقَالُوا اتَّخَذَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ وَلَدًا ۗ سُبْحَانَهُ ۚ بَلْ عِبَادٌ مُّكْرَمُونَ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Et ils dirent: «Le Tout Miséricordieux s'est donné un enfant». Pureté à Lui! Mais ce sont plutôt des serviteurs honorés.
versets.en: 26. And they say: "The Most Beneficent (Allah) has begotten a son (or children)." Glory to Him! They [those whom they call children of Allah i.e. the angels, 'Iesa (Jesus) son of Maryam (Mary), 'Uzair (Ezra), etc.], are but honoured slaves.

versets.ar: 27. لَا يَسْبِقُونَهُ بِالْقَوْلِ وَهُم بِأَمْرِهِ يَعْمَلُونَ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Ils ne devancent pas Son Commandement et agissent selon Ses ordres.
versets.en: 27. They speak not until He has spoken, and they act on His Command.

versets.ar: 28. يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ وَلَا يَشْفَعُونَ إِلَّا لِمَنِ ارْتَضَىٰ وَهُم مِّنْ خَشْيَتِهِ مُشْفِقُونَ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Il sait ce qui est devant eux et ce qui derrière eux. Et ils n'intercèdent qu'en faveur de ceux qu'Il a agréés [tout en étant] pénétrés de Sa crainte.
versets.en: 28. He knows what is before them, and what is behind them, and they cannot intercede except for him with whom He is pleased. And they stand in awe for fear of Him.

versets.ar: 29. ۞ وَمَن يَقُلْ مِنْهُمْ إِنِّي إِلَٰهٌ مِّن دُونِهِ فَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِيهِ جَهَنَّمَ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الظَّالِمِينَ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. Et quiconque d'entre eux dirait: «Je suis une divinité en dehors de Lui». Nous le rétribuerons de l'Enfer. C'est ainsi que Nous rétribuons les injustes.
versets.en: 29. And if any of them should say: "Verily, I am an ilah (a god) besides Him (Allah)," such a one We should recompense with Hell. Thus We recompense the Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc.).

versets.ar: 30. أَوَلَمْ يَرَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا أَنَّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ كَانَتَا رَتْقًا فَفَتَقْنَاهُمَا ۖ وَجَعَلْنَا مِنَ الْمَاءِ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ حَيٍّ ۖ أَفَلَا يُؤْمِنُونَ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Ceux qui ont mécru, n'ont-ils pas vu que les cieux et la terre formaient une masse compacte? Ensuite Nous les avons séparés et fait de l'eau toute chose vivante. Ne croiront-ils donc pas?
versets.en: 30. Have not those who disbelieve known that the heavens and the earth were joined together as one united piece, then We parted them? And We have made from water every living thing. Will they not then believe?

versets.ar: 31. وَجَعَلْنَا فِي الْأَرْضِ رَوَاسِيَ أَن تَمِيدَ بِهِمْ وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا فِجَاجًا سُبُلًا لَّعَلَّهُمْ يَهْتَدُونَ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. Et Nous avons placé des montagnes fermes dans la terre, afin qu'elle ne s'ébranle pas en les [entraînant]. Et Nous y avons placé des défilés servant de chemins afin qu'ils se guident.
versets.en: 31. And We have placed on the earth firm mountains, lest it should shake with them, and We placed therein broad highways for them to pass through, that they may be guided.

versets.ar: 32. وَجَعَلْنَا السَّمَاءَ سَقْفًا مَّحْفُوظًا ۖ وَهُمْ عَنْ آيَاتِهَا مُعْرِضُونَ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. Et Nous avons fait du ciel un toit protégé. Et cependant ils se détournent de ses merveilles.
versets.en: 32. And We have made the heaven a roof, safe and well guarded. Yet they turn away from its signs (i.e. sun, moon, winds, clouds, etc.).

versets.ar: 33. وَهُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ وَالشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ ۖ كُلٌّ فِي فَلَكٍ يَسْبَحُونَ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. Et c'est Lui qui a créé la nuit et le jour, le soleil et la lune; chacun voguant dans une orbite.
versets.en: 33. And He it is Who has created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon, each in an orbit floating.

versets.ar: 34. وَمَا جَعَلْنَا لِبَشَرٍ مِّن قَبْلِكَ الْخُلْدَ ۖ أَفَإِن مِّتَّ فَهُمُ الْخَالِدُونَ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. Et Nous n'avons attribué l'immortalité à nul homme avant toi. Est-ce que si tu meurs, toi, ils seront, eux, éternels?
versets.en: 34. And We granted not to any human being immortality before you (O Muhammad SAW), then if you die, would they live forever?

versets.ar: 35. كُلُّ نَفْسٍ ذَائِقَةُ الْمَوْتِ ۗ وَنَبْلُوكُم بِالشَّرِّ وَالْخَيْرِ فِتْنَةً ۖ وَإِلَيْنَا تُرْجَعُونَ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Toute âme doit goûter la mort. Nous vous éprouverons par le mal et par le bien [à titre] de tentation. Et c'est à Nous que vous serez ramenés.
versets.en: 35. Everyone is going to taste death, and We shall make a trial of you with evil and with good, and to Us you will be returned.

versets.ar: 36. وَإِذَا رَآكَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا إِن يَتَّخِذُونَكَ إِلَّا هُزُوًا أَهَٰذَا الَّذِي يَذْكُرُ آلِهَتَكُمْ وَهُم بِذِكْرِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ هُمْ كَافِرُونَ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. Quand les mécréants te voient, ils ne te prennent qu'en dérision (disant): «Quoi! Est-ce-là celui qui médit de vos divinités?» Et ils nient [tout] rappel du Tout Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 36. And when those who disbelieve (in the Oneness of Allah) see you (O Muhammad SAW), they take you not except for mockery (saying): "Is this the one who talks (badly) about your gods?" While they disbelieve at the mention of the Most Beneficent (Allah). [Tafsir. Al-Qurtubi].

versets.ar: 37. خُلِقَ الْإِنسَانُ مِنْ عَجَلٍ ۚ سَأُرِيكُمْ آيَاتِي فَلَا تَسْتَعْجِلُونِ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. L'homme a été créé prompt dans sa nature. Je vous montrerai Mes signes [la réalisation de Mes menaces]. Ne me hâtez donc pas.
versets.en: 37. Man is created of haste, I will show you My Ayat (torments, proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.). So ask Me not to hasten (them).

versets.ar: 38. وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا الْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. Et ils disent: «A quand cette promesse si vous êtes véridiques?»
versets.en: 38. And they say: "When will this promise (come to pass), if you are truthful."

versets.ar: 39. لَوْ يَعْلَمُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا حِينَ لَا يَكُفُّونَ عَن وُجُوهِهِمُ النَّارَ وَلَا عَن ظُهُورِهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. Si [seulement] les mécréants connaissaient le moment où ils ne pourront empêcher le feu de leurs visages ni de leurs dos, et où ils ne seront point secourus.
versets.en: 39. If only those who disbelieved knew (the time) when they will not be able to ward off the Fire from their faces, nor from their backs; and they will not be helped.

versets.ar: 40. بَلْ تَأْتِيهِم بَغْتَةً فَتَبْهَتُهُمْ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ رَدَّهَا وَلَا هُمْ يُنظَرُونَ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. Mais non, cela leur viendra subitement et ils seront alors stupéfaits; ils ne pourront pas le repousser et on ne leur donnera pas de répit.
versets.en: 40. Nay, it (the Fire or the Day of Resurrection) will come upon them all of a sudden and will perplex them, and they will have no power to avert it, nor will they get respite.

versets.ar: 41. وَلَقَدِ اسْتُهْزِئَ بِرُسُلٍ مِّن قَبْلِكَ فَحَاقَ بِالَّذِينَ سَخِرُوا مِنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. On s'est moqué de messagers venus avant toi. Et ceux qui se sont moqués d'eux, se virent frapper de toutes parts par l'objet même de leurs moqueries.
versets.en: 41. Indeed (many) Messengers were mocked before you (O Muhammad SAW), but the scoffers were surrounded by that, whereat they used to mock.

versets.ar: 42. قُلْ مَن يَكْلَؤُكُم بِاللَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ مِنَ الرَّحْمَٰنِ ۗ بَلْ هُمْ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّهِم مُّعْرِضُونَ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. Dis: «Qui vous protège la nuit et le jour, contre le [châtiment] du Tout Miséricordieux?» Pourtant ils se détournent du rappel de leur Seigneur.
versets.en: 42. Say: "Who can guard and protect you in the night or in the day from the (punishment of the) Most Beneficent (Allah)?" Nay, but they turn away from the remembrance of their Lord.

versets.ar: 43. أَمْ لَهُمْ آلِهَةٌ تَمْنَعُهُم مِّن دُونِنَا ۚ لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ نَصْرَ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَلَا هُم مِّنَّا يُصْحَبُونَ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. Ont-ils donc des divinités en dehors de Nous, qui peuvent les protéger? Mais celles-ci ne peuvent ni se secourir elles-mêmes, ni se faire assister contre Nous.
versets.en: 43. Or have they aliha (gods) who can guard them from Us? They have no power to help themselves, nor can they be protected from Us (i.e. from Our Torment).

versets.ar: 44. بَلْ مَتَّعْنَا هَٰؤُلَاءِ وَآبَاءَهُمْ حَتَّىٰ طَالَ عَلَيْهِمُ الْعُمُرُ ۗ أَفَلَا يَرَوْنَ أَنَّا نَأْتِي الْأَرْضَ نَنقُصُهَا مِنْ أَطْرَافِهَا ۚ أَفَهُمُ الْغَالِبُونَ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. Au contraire Nous avons accordé une jouissance [temporaire] à ceux-là comme à leurs ancêtres jusqu'à un âge avancé. Ne voient-ils pas que Nous venons à la terre que Nous réduisons de tous côtés? Seront-ils alors les vainqueurs?
versets.en: 44. Nay, We gave the luxuries of this life to these men and their fathers until the period grew long for them. See they not that We gradually reduce the land (in their control) from its outlying borders? Is it then they who will overcome.

versets.ar: 45. قُلْ إِنَّمَا أُنذِرُكُم بِالْوَحْيِ ۚ وَلَا يَسْمَعُ الصُّمُّ الدُّعَاءَ إِذَا مَا يُنذَرُونَ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. Dis: «Je vous avertis par ce qui m'est révélé». Les sourds, cependant, n'entendent pas l'appel quand on les avertit.
versets.en: 45. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "I warn you only by the revelation (from Allah and not by the opinion of the religious scholars and others). But the deaf (who follow the religious scholars and others blindly) will not hear the call, (even) when they are warned [(i.e. one should follow only the Quran and the Sunnah (legal ways, orders, acts of worship, statements of Prophet Muhammad SAW, as the Companions of the Prophet SAW did)].

versets.ar: 46. وَلَئِن مَّسَّتْهُمْ نَفْحَةٌ مِّنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّكَ لَيَقُولُنَّ يَا وَيْلَنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. Si un souffle du châtiment de ton Seigneur les effleurait, ils diraient alors: «Malheur à nous! Nous étions vraiment injustes».
versets.en: 46. And if a breath (minor calamity) of the Torment of your Lord touches them, they will surely cry: "Woe unto us! Indeed we have been Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc.).

versets.ar: 47. وَنَضَعُ الْمَوَازِينَ الْقِسْطَ لِيَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ فَلَا تُظْلَمُ نَفْسٌ شَيْئًا ۖ وَإِن كَانَ مِثْقَالَ حَبَّةٍ مِّنْ خَرْدَلٍ أَتَيْنَا بِهَا ۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِنَا حَاسِبِينَ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. Au Jour de la Résurrection, Nous placerons les balances exactes. Nulle âme ne sera lésée en rien, fût-ce du poids d'un grain de moutarde que Nous ferons venir. Nous suffisons largement pour dresser les comptes.
versets.en: 47. And We shall set up balances of justice on the Day of Resurrection, then none will be dealt with unjustly in anything. And if there be the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it. And Sufficient are We as Reckoners.

versets.ar: 48. وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ الْفُرْقَانَ وَضِيَاءً وَذِكْرًا لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. Nous avons déjà apporté à Moïse et Aaron le Livre du discernement (la Thora) ainsi qu'une lumière et un rappel pour les gens pieux,
versets.en: 48. And indeed We granted to Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron) the criterion (of right and wrong), and a shining light [i.e. the Taurat (Torah)] and a Reminder for Al-Muttaqun (the pious - see V. 2:2).

versets.ar: 49. الَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُم بِالْغَيْبِ وَهُم مِّنَ السَّاعَةِ مُشْفِقُونَ ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. qui craignent leur Seigneur malgré qu'ils ne Le voient pas, et redoutent l'Heure (la fin du monde).
versets.en: 49. Those who fear their Lord without seeing Him, while they are afraid of the Hour.

versets.ar: 50. وَهَٰذَا ذِكْرٌ مُّبَارَكٌ أَنزَلْنَاهُ ۚ أَفَأَنتُمْ لَهُ مُنكِرُونَ ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. Et ceci [le Coran] est un rappel béni que Nous avons fait descendre. Allez-vous donc le renier?
versets.en: 50. And this is a blessed Reminder (the Quran) which We have sent down, will you then (dare to) deny it?

versets.ar: 51. ۞ وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ رُشْدَهُ مِن قَبْلُ وَكُنَّا بِهِ عَالِمِينَ ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. En effet, Nous avons mis auparavant Abraham sur le droit chemin. Et Nous en avions bonne connaissance.
versets.en: 51. And indeed We bestowed aforetime on Ibrahim (Abraham) his (portion of) guidance, and We were Well-Acquainted with him (as to his Belief in the Oneness of Allah, etc.).

versets.ar: 52. إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ مَا هَٰذِهِ التَّمَاثِيلُ الَّتِي أَنتُمْ لَهَا عَاكِفُونَ ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. Quand il dit à son père et à son peuple: «Que sont ces statues auxquelles vous vous attachez?»
versets.en: 52. When he said to his father and his people: "What are these images, to which you are devoted?"

versets.ar: 53. قَالُوا وَجَدْنَا آبَاءَنَا لَهَا عَابِدِينَ ﴿53﴾
versets.fr: 53. ils dirent: «Nous avons trouvé nos ancêtres les adorant».
versets.en: 53. They said:"We found our fathers worshipping them."

versets.ar: 54. قَالَ لَقَدْ كُنتُمْ أَنتُمْ وَآبَاؤُكُمْ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ ﴿54﴾
versets.fr: 54. Il dit: «Certainement, vous avez été, vous et vos ancêtres, dans un égarement évident».
versets.en: 54. He said: "Indeed you and your fathers have been in manifest error."

versets.ar: 55. قَالُوا أَجِئْتَنَا بِالْحَقِّ أَمْ أَنتَ مِنَ اللَّاعِبِينَ ﴿55﴾
versets.fr: 55. Ils dirent: «Viens-tu à nous avec la vérité ou plaisantes-tu?»
versets.en: 55. They said: "Have you brought us the truth, or are you one of those who play about?"

versets.ar: 56. قَالَ بَل رَّبُّكُمْ رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ الَّذِي فَطَرَهُنَّ وَأَنَا عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكُم مِّنَ الشَّاهِدِينَ ﴿56﴾
versets.fr: 56. Il dit: «Mais votre Seigneur est plutôt le Seigneur des cieux et de la terre, et c'est Lui qui les a créés. Et je suis un de ceux qui en témoignent.
versets.en: 56. He said: "Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them and of that I am one of the witnesses.

versets.ar: 57. وَتَاللَّهِ لَأَكِيدَنَّ أَصْنَامَكُم بَعْدَ أَن تُوَلُّوا مُدْبِرِينَ ﴿57﴾
versets.fr: 57. Et par Allah! Je ruserai certes contre vos idoles une fois que vous serez partis».
versets.en: 57. "And by Allah, I shall plot a plan (to destroy) your idols after you have gone away and turned your backs."

versets.ar: 58. فَجَعَلَهُمْ جُذَاذًا إِلَّا كَبِيرًا لَّهُمْ لَعَلَّهُمْ إِلَيْهِ يَرْجِعُونَ ﴿58﴾
versets.fr: 58. Il les mit en pièces, hormis [la statue] la plus grande. Peut-être qu'ils reviendraient vers elle.
versets.en: 58. So he broke them to pieces, (all) except the biggest of them, that they might turn to it.

versets.ar: 59. قَالُوا مَن فَعَلَ هَٰذَا بِآلِهَتِنَا إِنَّهُ لَمِنَ الظَّالِمِينَ ﴿59﴾
versets.fr: 59. Ils dirent: «Qui a fait cela à nos divinités? Il est certes parmi les injustes».
versets.en: 59. They said: "Who has done this to our aliha (gods)? He must indeed be one of the wrong-doers."

versets.ar: 60. قَالُوا سَمِعْنَا فَتًى يَذْكُرُهُمْ يُقَالُ لَهُ إِبْرَاهِيمُ ﴿60﴾
versets.fr: 60. (Certains) dirent: «Nous avons entendu un jeune homme médire d'elles; il s'appelle Abraham».
versets.en: 60. They said: "We heard a young man talking (against) them who is called Ibrahim (Abraham)."

versets.ar: 61. قَالُوا فَأْتُوا بِهِ عَلَىٰ أَعْيُنِ النَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَشْهَدُونَ ﴿61﴾
versets.fr: 61. Ils dirent: «Amenez-le sous les yeux des gens afin qu'ils puissent témoigner.
versets.en: 61. They said: "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may testify."

versets.ar: 62. قَالُوا أَأَنتَ فَعَلْتَ هَٰذَا بِآلِهَتِنَا يَا إِبْرَاهِيمُ ﴿62﴾
versets.fr: 62. (Alors) ils dirent: «Est-ce toi qui as fait cela à nos divinités, Abraham?»
versets.en: 62. They said: "Are you the one who has done this to our gods, O Ibrahim (Abraham)?"

versets.ar: 63. قَالَ بَلْ فَعَلَهُ كَبِيرُهُمْ هَٰذَا فَاسْأَلُوهُمْ إِن كَانُوا يَنطِقُونَ ﴿63﴾
versets.fr: 63. Il dit: «C'est la plus grande d'entre elles que voici, qui l'a fait. Demandez-leur donc, si elles peuvent parler».
versets.en: 63. [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Nay, this one, the biggest of them (idols) did it. Ask them, if they can speak!"

versets.ar: 64. فَرَجَعُوا إِلَىٰ أَنفُسِهِمْ فَقَالُوا إِنَّكُمْ أَنتُمُ الظَّالِمُونَ ﴿64﴾
versets.fr: 64. Se ravisant alors, ils se dirent entre eux: «C'est vous qui êtes les vrais injustes».
versets.en: 64. So they turned to themselves and said: "Verily, you are the Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers)."

versets.ar: 65. ثُمَّ نُكِسُوا عَلَىٰ رُءُوسِهِمْ لَقَدْ عَلِمْتَ مَا هَٰؤُلَاءِ يَنطِقُونَ ﴿65﴾
versets.fr: 65. Puis ils firent volte-face et dirent: «Tu sais bien que celles-ci ne parlent pas».
versets.en: 65. Then they turned to themselves (their first thought and said): "Indeed you [Ibrahim (Abraham)] know well that these (idols) speak not!"

versets.ar: 66. قَالَ أَفَتَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنفَعُكُمْ شَيْئًا وَلَا يَضُرُّكُمْ ﴿66﴾
versets.fr: 66. Il dit: «Adorez-vous donc, en dehors d'Allah, ce qui ne saurait en rien vous être utile ni vous nuire non plus.
versets.en: 66. [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Do you then worship besides Allah, things that can neither profit you, nor harm you?

versets.ar: 67. أُفٍّ لَّكُمْ وَلِمَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ ۖ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ ﴿67﴾
versets.fr: 67. Fi de vous et de ce que vous adorez en dehors d'Allah! Ne raisonnez-vous pas?»
versets.en: 67. "Fie upon you, and upon that which you worship besides Allah! Have you then no sense?"

versets.ar: 68. قَالُوا حَرِّقُوهُ وَانصُرُوا آلِهَتَكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ فَاعِلِينَ ﴿68﴾
versets.fr: 68. Ils dirent: «Brûlez-le. Secourez vos divinités si vous voulez faire quelque chose (pour elles)».
versets.en: 68. They said: "Burn him and help your aliha (gods), if you will be doing."

versets.ar: 69. قُلْنَا يَا نَارُ كُونِي بَرْدًا وَسَلَامًا عَلَىٰ إِبْرَاهِيمَ ﴿69﴾
versets.fr: 69. Nous dîmes: «O feu, sois pour Abraham une fraîcheur salutaire».
versets.en: 69. We (Allah) said: "O fire! Be you coolness and safety for Ibrahim (Abraham)!"

versets.ar: 70. وَأَرَادُوا بِهِ كَيْدًا فَجَعَلْنَاهُمُ الْأَخْسَرِينَ ﴿70﴾
versets.fr: 70. Ils voulaient ruser contre lui, mais ce sont eux que Nous rendîmes les plus grands perdants.
versets.en: 70. And they wanted to harm him, but We made them the worst losers.

versets.ar: 71. وَنَجَّيْنَاهُ وَلُوطًا إِلَى الْأَرْضِ الَّتِي بَارَكْنَا فِيهَا لِلْعَالَمِينَ ﴿71﴾
versets.fr: 71. Et Nous le sauvâmes, ainsi que Lot, vers une terre que Nous avions bénie pour tout l'univers.
versets.en: 71. And We rescued him and Lout (Lot) to the land which We have blessed for the 'Alamin (mankind and jinns).

versets.ar: 72. وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُ إِسْحَاقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ نَافِلَةً ۖ وَكُلًّا جَعَلْنَا صَالِحِينَ ﴿72﴾
versets.fr: 72. Et Nous lui donnâmes Isaac et, de surcroît Jacob, desquels Nous fîmes des gens de bien.
versets.en: 72. And We bestowed upon him Ishaque (Isaac), and (a grandson) Ya'qub (Jacob). Each one We made righteous.

versets.ar: 73. وَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ أَئِمَّةً يَهْدُونَ بِأَمْرِنَا وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَيْهِمْ فِعْلَ الْخَيْرَاتِ وَإِقَامَ الصَّلَاةِ وَإِيتَاءَ الزَّكَاةِ ۖ وَكَانُوا لَنَا عَابِدِينَ ﴿73﴾
versets.fr: 73. Nous les fîmes des dirigeants qui guidaient par Notre ordre. Et Nous leur révélâmes de faire le bien, d'accomplir la prière et d'acquitter la Zakât. Et ils étaient Nos adorateurs.
versets.en: 73. And We made them leaders, guiding (mankind) by Our Command, and We inspired in them the doing of good deeds, performing Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat), and the giving of Zakat and of Us (Alone) they were worshippers.

versets.ar: 74. وَلُوطًا آتَيْنَاهُ حُكْمًا وَعِلْمًا وَنَجَّيْنَاهُ مِنَ الْقَرْيَةِ الَّتِي كَانَت تَّعْمَلُ الْخَبَائِثَ ۗ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمَ سَوْءٍ فَاسِقِينَ ﴿74﴾
versets.fr: 74. Et Lot! Nous lui avons apporté la capacité de juger et le savoir, et Nous l'avons sauvé de la cité où se commettaient les vices; ces gens étaient vraiment des gens du mal, des pervers.
versets.en: 74. And (remember) Lout (Lot), We gave him Hukman (right judgement of the affairs and Prophethood) and (religious) knowledge, and We saved him from the town (folk) who practised Al-Khaba'ith (evil, wicked and filthy deeds, etc.). Verily, they were a people given to evil, and were Fasiqun (rebellious, disobedient, to Allah).

versets.ar: 75. وَأَدْخَلْنَاهُ فِي رَحْمَتِنَا ۖ إِنَّهُ مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ ﴿75﴾
versets.fr: 75. et Nous l'avons fait entrer en Notre miséricorde. Il était vraiment du nombre des gens de bien.
versets.en: 75. And We admitted him to Our Mercy, truly, he was of the righteous.

versets.ar: 76. وَنُوحًا إِذْ نَادَىٰ مِن قَبْلُ فَاسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُ فَنَجَّيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ مِنَ الْكَرْبِ الْعَظِيمِ ﴿76﴾
versets.fr: 76. Et Noé, quand auparavant il fit son appel. Nous l'exauçâmes et Nous le sauvâmes, ainsi que sa famille, de la grande angoisse,
versets.en: 76. And (remember) Nuh (Noah), when he cried (to Us) aforetime. We listened to his invocation and saved him and his family from great distress.

versets.ar: 77. وَنَصَرْنَاهُ مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمَ سَوْءٍ فَأَغْرَقْنَاهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ ﴿77﴾
versets.fr: 77. et Nous le secourûmes contre le peuple qui traitait Nos prodiges de mensonges. Ils furent vraiment des gens du Mal. Nous les noyâmes donc tous.
versets.en: 77. We helped him against people who denied Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.). Verily, they were a people given to evil. So We drowned them all.

versets.ar: 78. وَدَاوُودَ وَسُلَيْمَانَ إِذْ يَحْكُمَانِ فِي الْحَرْثِ إِذْ نَفَشَتْ فِيهِ غَنَمُ الْقَوْمِ وَكُنَّا لِحُكْمِهِمْ شَاهِدِينَ ﴿78﴾
versets.fr: 78. Et David, et Salomon, quand ils eurent à juger au sujet d'un champ cultivé où des moutons appartenant à une peuplade étaient allés paître, la nuit. Et Nous étions témoin de leur jugement.
versets.en: 78. And (remember) Dawud (David) and Sulaiman (Solomon), when they gave judgement in the case of the field in which the sheep of certain people had pastured at night and We were witness to their judgement.

versets.ar: 79. فَفَهَّمْنَاهَا سُلَيْمَانَ ۚ وَكُلًّا آتَيْنَا حُكْمًا وَعِلْمًا ۚ وَسَخَّرْنَا مَعَ دَاوُودَ الْجِبَالَ يُسَبِّحْنَ وَالطَّيْرَ ۚ وَكُنَّا فَاعِلِينَ ﴿79﴾
versets.fr: 79. Nous la fîmes comprendre à Salomon. Et à chacun Nous donnâmes la faculté de juger et le savoir. Et Nous asservîmes les montagnes à exalter Notre Gloire en compagnie de David, ainsi que les oiseaux. Et c'est Nous qui sommes le Faiseur.
versets.en: 79. And We made Sulaiman (Solomon) to understand (the case), and to each of them We gave Hukman (right judgement of the affairs and Prophethood) and knowledge. And We subjected the mountains and the birds to glorify Our Praises along with Dawud (David), And it was We Who were the doers (of all these things).

versets.ar: 80. وَعَلَّمْنَاهُ صَنْعَةَ لَبُوسٍ لَّكُمْ لِتُحْصِنَكُم مِّن بَأْسِكُمْ ۖ فَهَلْ أَنتُمْ شَاكِرُونَ ﴿80﴾
versets.fr: 80. Nous lui (David) apprîmes la fabrication des cottes de mailles afin qu'elles vous protègent contre vos violences mutuelles (la guerre). En êtes-vous donc reconnaissants?
versets.en: 80. And We taught him the making of metal coats of mail (for battles), to protect you in your fighting. Are you then grateful?

versets.ar: 81. وَلِسُلَيْمَانَ الرِّيحَ عَاصِفَةً تَجْرِي بِأَمْرِهِ إِلَى الْأَرْضِ الَّتِي بَارَكْنَا فِيهَا ۚ وَكُنَّا بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَالِمِينَ ﴿81﴾
versets.fr: 81. Et (Nous avons soumis) à Salomon le vent impétueux qui, par son ordre, se dirigea vers la terre que Nous avions bénie. Et Nous sommes à même de tout savoir,
versets.en: 81. And to Sulaiman (Solomon) (We subjected) the wind strongly raging, running by his command towards the land which We had blessed. And of everything We are the All-Knower.

versets.ar: 82. وَمِنَ الشَّيَاطِينِ مَن يَغُوصُونَ لَهُ وَيَعْمَلُونَ عَمَلًا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَكُنَّا لَهُمْ حَافِظِينَ ﴿82﴾
versets.fr: 82. et parmi les diables il en était qui plongeaient pour lui et faisaient d'autres travaux encore, et Nous les surveillions Nous-mêmes.
versets.en: 82. And of the Shayatin (devils) (from the jinns) were some who dived for him, and did other work besides that; and it was We Who guarded them.

versets.ar: 83. ۞ وَأَيُّوبَ إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُ أَنِّي مَسَّنِيَ الضُّرُّ وَأَنتَ أَرْحَمُ الرَّاحِمِينَ ﴿83﴾
versets.fr: 83. Et Job, quand il implora son Seigneur: «Le mal m'a touché. Mais Toi, tu es le plus miséricordieux des miséricordieux»!
versets.en: 83. And (remember) Ayub (Job), when he cried to his Lord: "Verily, distress has seized me, and You are the Most Merciful of all those who show mercy."

versets.ar: 84. فَاسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُ فَكَشَفْنَا مَا بِهِ مِن ضُرٍّ ۖ وَآتَيْنَاهُ أَهْلَهُ وَمِثْلَهُم مَّعَهُمْ رَحْمَةً مِّنْ عِندِنَا وَذِكْرَىٰ لِلْعَابِدِينَ ﴿84﴾
versets.fr: 84. Nous l'exauçâmes, enlevâmes le mal qu'il avait, lui rendîmes les siens et autant qu'eux avec eux, par miséricorde de Notre part et en tant que rappel aux adorateurs.
versets.en: 84. So We answered his call, and We removed the distress that was on him, and We restored his family to him (that he had lost), and the like thereof along with them, as a mercy from Ourselves and a Reminder for all who worship Us.

versets.ar: 85. وَإِسْمَاعِيلَ وَإِدْرِيسَ وَذَا الْكِفْلِ ۖ كُلٌّ مِّنَ الصَّابِرِينَ ﴿85﴾
versets.fr: 85. Et Ismaël, Idris, et Dûl-Kifl! qui étaient tous endurants;
versets.en: 85. And (remember) Isma'il (Ishmael), and Idris (Enoch) and Dhul-Kifl (Isaiah), all were from among As-Sabirin (the patient ones, etc.).

versets.ar: 86. وَأَدْخَلْنَاهُمْ فِي رَحْمَتِنَا ۖ إِنَّهُم مِّنَ الصَّالِحِينَ ﴿86﴾
versets.fr: 86. que Nous fîmes entrer en Notre miséricorde car ils étaient vraiment du nombre des gens de bien.
versets.en: 86. And We admitted them to Our Mercy. Verily, they were of the righteous.

versets.ar: 87. وَذَا النُّونِ إِذ ذَّهَبَ مُغَاضِبًا فَظَنَّ أَن لَّن نَّقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ فَنَادَىٰ فِي الظُّلُمَاتِ أَن لَّا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا أَنتَ سُبْحَانَكَ إِنِّي كُنتُ مِنَ الظَّالِمِينَ ﴿87﴾
versets.fr: 87. Et Dû'n-Nûn (Jonas) quand il partit, irrité. Il pensa que Nous N'allions pas l'éprouver. Puis il fit, dans les ténèbres, l'appel que voici: «Pas de divinité à part Toi! Pureté à Toi! J'ai été vraiment du nombre des injustes».
versets.en: 87. And (remember) Dhan-Nun (Jonah), when he went off in anger, and imagined that We shall not punish him (i.e. the calamites which had befallen him)! But he cried through the darkness (saying): La ilaha illa Anta [none has the right to be worshipped but You (O Allah)], Glorified (and Exalted) are You [above all that (evil) they associate with You]. Truly, I have been of the wrong-doers."

versets.ar: 88. فَاسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُ وَنَجَّيْنَاهُ مِنَ الْغَمِّ ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نُنجِي الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿88﴾
versets.fr: 88. Nous l'exauçâmes et le sauvâmes de son angoisse. Et c'est ainsi que Nous sauvons les croyants.
versets.en: 88. So We answered his call, and delivered him from the distress. And thus We do deliver the believers (who believe in the Oneness of Allah, abstain from evil and work righteousness).

versets.ar: 89. وَزَكَرِيَّا إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُ رَبِّ لَا تَذَرْنِي فَرْدًا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ الْوَارِثِينَ ﴿89﴾
versets.fr: 89. Et Zacharie, quand il implora son Seigneur: «Ne me laisse pas seul, Seigneur, alors que Tu es le meilleur des héritiers».
versets.en: 89. And (remember) Zakariya (Zachariah), when he cried to his Lord: "O My Lord! Leave me not single (childless), though You are the Best of the inheritors."

versets.ar: 90. فَاسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُ وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُ يَحْيَىٰ وَأَصْلَحْنَا لَهُ زَوْجَهُ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا يُسَارِعُونَ فِي الْخَيْرَاتِ وَيَدْعُونَنَا رَغَبًا وَرَهَبًا ۖ وَكَانُوا لَنَا خَاشِعِينَ ﴿90﴾
versets.fr: 90. Nous l'exauçâmes, lui donnâmes Yahya et guérîmes son épouse. Ils concouraient au bien et Nous invoquaient par amour et par crainte. Et ils étaient humbles devant Nous.
versets.en: 90. So We answered his call, and We bestowed upon him Yahya (John), and cured his wife (to bear a child) for him. Verily, they used to hasten on to do good deeds, and they used to call on Us with hope and fear, and used to humble themselves before Us.

versets.ar: 91. وَالَّتِي أَحْصَنَتْ فَرْجَهَا فَنَفَخْنَا فِيهَا مِن رُّوحِنَا وَجَعَلْنَاهَا وَابْنَهَا آيَةً لِّلْعَالَمِينَ ﴿91﴾
versets.fr: 91. Et celle [la vierge Marie] qui avait préservé sa chasteté! Nous insufflâmes en elle un souffle (de vie) venant de Nous et fîmes d'elle ainsi que de son fils, un signe [miracle] pour l'univers.
versets.en: 91. And (remember) she who guarded her chastity [Virgin Maryam (Mary)], We breathed into (the sleeves of) her (shirt or garment) [through Our Ruh - Jibrael (Gabriel)], and We made her and her son ['Iesa (Jesus)] a sign for Al-'Alamin (the mankind and jinns).

versets.ar: 92. إِنَّ هَٰذِهِ أُمَّتُكُمْ أُمَّةً وَاحِدَةً وَأَنَا رَبُّكُمْ فَاعْبُدُونِ ﴿92﴾
versets.fr: 92. Certes, cette communauté qui est la vôtre est une communauté unique, et Je suis votre Seigneur. Adorez-Moi donc.
versets.en: 92. Truly! This, your Ummah [Sharia or religion (Islamic Monotheism)] is one religion, and I am your Lord, therefore worship Me (Alone). [Tafsir Ibn Kathir]

versets.ar: 93. وَتَقَطَّعُوا أَمْرَهُم بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ كُلٌّ إِلَيْنَا رَاجِعُونَ ﴿93﴾
versets.fr: 93. Ils se sont divisés en sectes. Mais tous, retourneront à Nous.
versets.en: 93. But they have broken up and differed as regards their religion among themselves. (And) they all shall return to Us.

versets.ar: 94. فَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِنَ الصَّالِحَاتِ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌ فَلَا كُفْرَانَ لِسَعْيِهِ وَإِنَّا لَهُ كَاتِبُونَ ﴿94﴾
versets.fr: 94. Quiconque fait de bonnes œuvres tout en étant croyant, on ne méconnaîtra pas son effort, et Nous le lui inscrivons [à son actif].
versets.en: 94. So whoever does righteous good deeds while he is a believer (in the Oneness of Allah Islamic Monotheism), his efforts will not be rejected. Verily! We record it in his Book of deeds.

versets.ar: 95. وَحَرَامٌ عَلَىٰ قَرْيَةٍ أَهْلَكْنَاهَا أَنَّهُمْ لَا يَرْجِعُونَ ﴿95﴾
versets.fr: 95. Il est défendu [aux habitants] d'une cité que Nous avons fait périr de revenir [à la vie d'ici-bas]!
versets.en: 95. And a ban is laid on every town (population) which We have destroyed that they shall not return (to this world again, nor repent to Us).

versets.ar: 96. حَتَّىٰ إِذَا فُتِحَتْ يَأْجُوجُ وَمَأْجُوجُ وَهُم مِّن كُلِّ حَدَبٍ يَنسِلُونَ ﴿96﴾
versets.fr: 96. Jusqu'à ce que soient relâchés les Yâjûj et les Mâjûj et qu'ils se précipiteront de chaque hauteur;
versets.en: 96. Until, when Ya'juj and Ma'juj (Gog and Magog) are let loose (from their barrier), and they swiftly swarm from every mound.

versets.ar: 97. وَاقْتَرَبَ الْوَعْدُ الْحَقُّ فَإِذَا هِيَ شَاخِصَةٌ أَبْصَارُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا قَدْ كُنَّا فِي غَفْلَةٍ مِّنْ هَٰذَا بَلْ كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ ﴿97﴾
versets.fr: 97. c'est alors que la vraie promesse s'approchera, tandis que les regards de ceux qui ont mécru se figent: «Malheur à nous! Nous y avons été inattentifs. Bien plus, nous étions des injustes».
versets.en: 97. And the true promise (Day of Resurrection) shall draw near (of fulfillment). Then (when mankind is resurrected from their graves), you shall see the eyes of the disbelievers fixedly stare in horror. (They will say): "Woe to us! We were indeed heedless of this; nay, but we were Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc.)."

versets.ar: 98. إِنَّكُمْ وَمَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ حَصَبُ جَهَنَّمَ أَنتُمْ لَهَا وَارِدُونَ ﴿98﴾
versets.fr: 98. «Vous serez, vous et ce que vous adoriez en dehors d'Allah, le combustible de l'Enfer, vous vous y rendrez tous.
versets.en: 98. Certainly! You (disbelievers) and that which you are worshipping now besides Allah, are (but) fuel for Hell! (Surely), you will enter it.

versets.ar: 99. لَوْ كَانَ هَٰؤُلَاءِ آلِهَةً مَّا وَرَدُوهَا ۖ وَكُلٌّ فِيهَا خَالِدُونَ ﴿99﴾
versets.fr: 99. Si ceux-là étaient vraiment des divinités, ils n'y entreraient pas; et tous y demeureront éternellement.
versets.en: 99. Had these (idols, etc.) been aliha (gods), they would not have entered there (Hell), and all of them will abide therein.

versets.ar: 100. لَهُمْ فِيهَا زَفِيرٌ وَهُمْ فِيهَا لَا يَسْمَعُونَ ﴿100﴾
versets.fr: 100. Ils y pousseront des gémissements, et n'y entendront rien.
versets.en: 100. Therein breathing out with deep sighs and roaring will be their portion, and therein they will hear not.

versets.ar: 101. إِنَّ الَّذِينَ سَبَقَتْ لَهُم مِّنَّا الْحُسْنَىٰ أُولَٰئِكَ عَنْهَا مُبْعَدُونَ ﴿101﴾
versets.fr: 101. En seront écartés, ceux à qui étaient précédemment promises de belles récompenses de Notre part.
versets.en: 101. Verily those for whom the good has preceded from Us, they will be removed far therefrom (Hell) [e.g. 'Iesa (Jesus), son of Maryam (Mary); 'Uzair (Ezra), etc.].

versets.ar: 102. لَا يَسْمَعُونَ حَسِيسَهَا ۖ وَهُمْ فِي مَا اشْتَهَتْ أَنفُسُهُمْ خَالِدُونَ ﴿102﴾
versets.fr: 102. Ils n'entendront pas son sifflement et jouiront éternellement de ce que leurs âmes désirent.
versets.en: 102. They shall not hear the slightest sound of it (Hell), while they abide in that which their ownselves desire.

versets.ar: 103. لَا يَحْزُنُهُمُ الْفَزَعُ الْأَكْبَرُ وَتَتَلَقَّاهُمُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ هَٰذَا يَوْمُكُمُ الَّذِي كُنتُمْ تُوعَدُونَ ﴿103﴾
versets.fr: 103. La grande terreur ne les affligera pas, et les Anges les accueilleront: «voici le jour qui vous a été promis».
