versets.fr: 33. Ils ne t'apporteront aucune parabole, sans que Nous ne t'apportions la vérité avec la meilleure interprétation.
versets.en: 33. And no example or similitude do they bring (to oppose or to find fault in you or in this Quran), but We reveal to you the truth (against that similitude or example), and the better explanation thereof.

versets.ar: 34. الَّذِينَ يُحْشَرُونَ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ أُولَٰئِكَ شَرٌّ مَّكَانًا وَأَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. Ceux qui seront traînés [ensemble] sur leurs visages vers l'Enfer, ceux-là seront dans la pire des situations et les plus égarés hors du chemin droit.
versets.en: 34. Those who will be gathered to Hell (prone) on their faces, such will be in an evil state, and most astray from the (Straight) Path.

versets.ar: 35. وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَى الْكِتَابَ وَجَعَلْنَا مَعَهُ أَخَاهُ هَارُونَ وَزِيرًا ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. En effet, Nous avons apporté à Moïse le Livre et lui avons assigné son frère Aaron comme assistant.
versets.en: 35. And indeed We gave Musa (Moses) the Scripture [the Taurat (Torah)], and placed his brother Harun (Aaron) with him as a helper;

versets.ar: 36. فَقُلْنَا اذْهَبَا إِلَى الْقَوْمِ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا فَدَمَّرْنَاهُمْ تَدْمِيرًا ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. Puis Nous avons dit: «Allez tous deux vers les gens qui ont traité de mensonge Nos preuves». Nous les avons ensuite détruits complètement.
versets.en: 36. And We said: "Go you both to the people who have denied Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.)." Then We destroyed them with utter destruction.

versets.ar: 37. وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ لَّمَّا كَذَّبُوا الرُّسُلَ أَغْرَقْنَاهُمْ وَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ لِلنَّاسِ آيَةً ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لِلظَّالِمِينَ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. Et le peuple de Noé, quand ils eurent démenti les messagers, Nous les noyâmes et en fîmes pour les gens un signe d'avertissement. Et Nous avons préparé pour les injustes un châtiment douloureux.
versets.en: 37. And Nuh's (Noah) people, when they denied the Messengers We drowned them, and We made them as a sign for mankind. And We have prepared a painful torment for the Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc).

versets.ar: 38. وَعَادًا وَثَمُودَ وَأَصْحَابَ الرَّسِّ وَقُرُونًا بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ كَثِيرًا ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. Et les 'Aad, les Thamûd, les gens d'Ar-Rass et de nombreuses générations intermédiaires!
versets.en: 38. And (also) 'Ad and Thamud, and the dwellers of Ar-Rass, and many generations in between.

versets.ar: 39. وَكُلًّا ضَرَبْنَا لَهُ الْأَمْثَالَ ۖ وَكُلًّا تَبَّرْنَا تَتْبِيرًا ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. A tous, cependant, Nous avions fait des paraboles et Nous les avions tous anéantis d'une façon brutale.
versets.en: 39. And for each of them We put forward examples (as proofs and lessons, etc.), and each (of them) We brought to utter ruin (because of their disbelief and evil deeds).

versets.ar: 40. وَلَقَدْ أَتَوْا عَلَى الْقَرْيَةِ الَّتِي أُمْطِرَتْ مَطَرَ السَّوْءِ ۚ أَفَلَمْ يَكُونُوا يَرَوْنَهَا ۚ بَلْ كَانُوا لَا يَرْجُونَ نُشُورًا ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. Ils sont passés par la cité sur laquelle est tombée une pluie de malheurs. Ne la voient-ils donc pas? Mais ils n'espèrent pas de résurrection!
versets.en: 40. And indeed they have passed by the town [of Prophet Lout (Lot)] on which was rained the evil rain. Did they (disbelievers) not then see it (with their own eyes)? Nay! But they used not to expect for any resurrection.

versets.ar: 41. وَإِذَا رَأَوْكَ إِن يَتَّخِذُونَكَ إِلَّا هُزُوًا أَهَٰذَا الَّذِي بَعَثَ اللَّهُ رَسُولًا ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. Et quand ils te voient, ils ne te prennent qu'en raillerie: «Est-ce là celui qu'Allah a envoyé comme Messager?
versets.en: 41. And when they see you (O Muhammad SAW), they treat you only as a mockery (saying):"Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a Messenger?

versets.ar: 42. إِن كَادَ لَيُضِلُّنَا عَنْ آلِهَتِنَا لَوْلَا أَن صَبَرْنَا عَلَيْهَا ۚ وَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ حِينَ يَرَوْنَ الْعَذَابَ مَنْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. Peu s'en est fallu qu'il ne nous égare de nos divinités, si ce n'était notre attachement patient à elles!». Cependant, ils sauront quand ils verront le châtiment, qui est le plus égaré en son chemin.
versets.en: 42. "He would have nearly misled us from our aliha (gods), had it not been that we were patient and constant in their worship!" And they will know when they see the torment, who it is that is most astray from the (Right) Path!

versets.ar: 43. أَرَأَيْتَ مَنِ اتَّخَذَ إِلَٰهَهُ هَوَاهُ أَفَأَنتَ تَكُونُ عَلَيْهِ وَكِيلًا ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. Ne vois-tu pas celui qui a fait de sa passion sa divinité? Est-ce à toi d'être un garant pour lui?
versets.en: 43. Have you (O Muhammad SAW) seen him who has taken as his ilah (god) his own desire? Would you then be a Wakil (a disposer of his affairs or a watcher) over him?

versets.ar: 44. أَمْ تَحْسَبُ أَنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ يَسْمَعُونَ أَوْ يَعْقِلُونَ ۚ إِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا كَالْأَنْعَامِ ۖ بَلْ هُمْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. Ou bien penses-tu que la plupart d'entre eux entendent ou comprennent? Ils ne sont en vérité comparables qu'à des bestiaux. Ou plutôt, ils sont plus égarés encore du sentier.
versets.en: 44. Or do you think that most of them hear or understand? They are only like cattle; nay, they are even farther astray from the Path. (i.e. even worst than cattle).

versets.ar: 45. أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَيْفَ مَدَّ الظِّلَّ وَلَوْ شَاءَ لَجَعَلَهُ سَاكِنًا ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَا الشَّمْسَ عَلَيْهِ دَلِيلًا ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. N'as-tu pas vu comment ton Seigneur étend l'ombre? S'Il avait voulu, certes, Il l'aurait faite immobile. Puis Nous lui fîmes du soleil son indice,
versets.en: 45. Have you not seen how your Lord spread the shadow. If He willed, He could have made it still then We have made the sun its guide [i.e. after the sunrise, it (the shadow) squeezes and vanishes at midnoon and then again appears in the afternoon with the decline of the sun, and had there been no sun light, there would have been no shadow].

versets.ar: 46. ثُمَّ قَبَضْنَاهُ إِلَيْنَا قَبْضًا يَسِيرًا ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. puis Nous la saisissons [pour la ramener] vers Nous avec facilité.
versets.en: 46. Then We withdraw it to Us a gradual concealed withdrawal.

versets.ar: 47. وَهُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ اللَّيْلَ لِبَاسًا وَالنَّوْمَ سُبَاتًا وَجَعَلَ النَّهَارَ نُشُورًا ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. Et c'est Lui qui vous fit de la nuit un vêtement, du sommeil un repos et qui fit du jour un retour à la vie active.
versets.en: 47. And it is He Who makes the night a covering for you, and the sleep (as) repose, and makes the day Nushur (i.e. getting up and going about here and there for daily work, etc. after one's sleep at night or like resurrection after one's death).

versets.ar: 48. وَهُوَ الَّذِي أَرْسَلَ الرِّيَاحَ بُشْرًا بَيْنَ يَدَيْ رَحْمَتِهِ ۚ وَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً طَهُورًا ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. Et c'est Lui qui envoya les vents comme une annonce précédant Sa miséricorde. Nous fîmes descendre du ciel une eau pure et purifiante,
versets.en: 48. And it is He Who sends the winds as heralds of glad tidings, going before His Mercy (rain), and We send down pure water from the sky,

versets.ar: 49. لِّنُحْيِيَ بِهِ بَلْدَةً مَّيْتًا وَنُسْقِيَهُ مِمَّا خَلَقْنَا أَنْعَامًا وَأَنَاسِيَّ كَثِيرًا ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. pour faire revivre par elle une contrée morte, et donner à boire aux multiples bestiaux et hommes que Nous avons créés.
versets.en: 49. That We may give life thereby to a dead land, and We give to drink thereof many of the cattle and men that We had created.

versets.ar: 50. وَلَقَدْ صَرَّفْنَاهُ بَيْنَهُمْ لِيَذَّكَّرُوا فَأَبَىٰ أَكْثَرُ النَّاسِ إِلَّا كُفُورًا ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. Nous l'avions répartie entre eux afin qu'ils se rappellent (de Nous). Mais la plupart des gens se refusent à tout sauf à être ingrats.
versets.en: 50. And indeed We have distributed it (rain or water) amongst them in order that they may remember the Grace of Allah, but most men refuse (or deny the Truth or Faith) and accept nothing but disbelief or ingratitude.

versets.ar: 51. وَلَوْ شِئْنَا لَبَعَثْنَا فِي كُلِّ قَرْيَةٍ نَّذِيرًا ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. Or, si Nous avions voulu, Nous aurions certes envoyé dans chaque cité un avertisseur.
versets.en: 51. And had We willed, We would have raised a warner in every town.

versets.ar: 52. فَلَا تُطِعِ الْكَافِرِينَ وَجَاهِدْهُم بِهِ جِهَادًا كَبِيرًا ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. N'obéis donc pas aux infidèles; et avec ceci (le Coran), lutte contre eux vigoureusement.
versets.en: 52. So obey not the disbelievers, but strive against them (by preaching) with the utmost endeavour, with it (the Quran).

versets.ar: 53. ۞ وَهُوَ الَّذِي مَرَجَ الْبَحْرَيْنِ هَٰذَا عَذْبٌ فُرَاتٌ وَهَٰذَا مِلْحٌ أُجَاجٌ وَجَعَلَ بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخًا وَحِجْرًا مَّحْجُورًا ﴿53﴾
versets.fr: 53. Et c'est Lui qui donne libre cours aux deux mers: l'une douce, rafraîchissante, l'autre salée, amère. Et Il assigne entre les deux une zone intermédiaire et un barrage infranchissable.
versets.en: 53. And it is He Who has let free the two seas (kinds of water), one palatable and sweet, and the other salt and bitter, and He has set a barrier and a complete partition between them.

versets.ar: 54. وَهُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ مِنَ الْمَاءِ بَشَرًا فَجَعَلَهُ نَسَبًا وَصِهْرًا ۗ وَكَانَ رَبُّكَ قَدِيرًا ﴿54﴾
versets.fr: 54. Et c'est Lui qui de l'eau a créé une espèce humaine qu'Il unit par les liens de la parenté et de l'alliance. Et ton Seigneur demeure Omnipotent.
versets.en: 54. And it is He Who has created man from water, and has appointed for him kindred by blood, and kindred by marriage. And your Lord is Ever All-Powerful to do what He will.

versets.ar: 55. وَيَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنفَعُهُمْ وَلَا يَضُرُّهُمْ ۗ وَكَانَ الْكَافِرُ عَلَىٰ رَبِّهِ ظَهِيرًا ﴿55﴾
versets.fr: 55. Mais ils adorent en dehors d'Allah, ce qui ne leur profite point, ni ne leur nuit! Et l'infidèle sera toujours l'allié des ennemis de son Seigneur!
versets.en: 55. And they (disbelievers, polytheists, etc.) worship besides Allah, that which can neither profit them nor harm them, and the disbeliever is ever a helper (of the Satan) against his Lord.

versets.ar: 56. وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَاكَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرًا وَنَذِيرًا ﴿56﴾
versets.fr: 56. Or, Nous ne t'avons envoyé que comme annonciateur et avertisseur.
versets.en: 56. And We have sent you (O Muhammad SAW) only as a bearer of glad tidings and a warner.

versets.ar: 57. قُلْ مَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِلَّا مَن شَاءَ أَن يَتَّخِذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبِيلًا ﴿57﴾
versets.fr: 57. Dis: «Je ne vous en demande aucun salaire (pour moi même). Toutefois, celui qui veut suivre un chemin conduisant vers son Seigneur [est libre de dépenser dans la voie d'Allah]».
versets.en: 57. Say: "No reward do I ask of you for this (that which I have brought from my Lord and its preaching, etc.), save that whosoever wills, may take a Path to his Lord.

versets.ar: 58. وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى الْحَيِّ الَّذِي لَا يَمُوتُ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِهِ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِهِ بِذُنُوبِ عِبَادِهِ خَبِيرًا ﴿58﴾
versets.fr: 58. Et place ta confiance en Le Vivant qui ne meurt jamais. Et par Sa louange, glorifie-Le. Il suffit comme Parfait Connaisseur des péchés de Ses serviteurs.
versets.en: 58. And put your trust (O Muhammad SAW) in the Ever Living One Who dies not, and glorify His Praises, and Sufficient is He as the All-Knower of the sins of His slaves;

versets.ar: 59. الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ اسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ ۚ الرَّحْمَٰنُ فَاسْأَلْ بِهِ خَبِيرًا ﴿59﴾
versets.fr: 59. C'est Lui qui, en six jours, a créé les cieux, la terre et tout ce qui existe entre eux, et le Tout Miséricordieux S'est établi «Istawâ» ensuite sur le Trône. Interroge donc qui est bien informé de Lui.
versets.en: 59. Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six Days. Then He Istawa (rose over) the Throne (in a manner that suits His Majesty). The Most Beneficent (Allah)! Ask Him (O Prophet Muhammad SAW), (concerning His Qualities, His rising over His Throne, His creations, etc.), as He is Al-Khabir (The All-Knower of everything i.e. Allah).

versets.ar: 60. وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ اسْجُدُوا لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ قَالُوا وَمَا الرَّحْمَٰنُ أَنَسْجُدُ لِمَا تَأْمُرُنَا وَزَادَهُمْ نُفُورًا ۩ ﴿60﴾
versets.fr: 60. Et quand on leur dit: «Prosternez-vous devant le Tout Miséricordieux», ils disent: «Qu'est-ce donc que le Tout Miséricordieux? Allons-nous nous prosterner devant ce que tu nous commandes?» - Et cela accroît leur répulsion.
versets.en: 60. And when it is said to them: "Prostrate to the Most Beneficent (Allah)! They say: "And what is the Most Beneficent? Shall we fall down in prostration to that which you (O Muhammad SAW) command us?" And it increases in them only aversion.

versets.ar: 61. تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ فِي السَّمَاءِ بُرُوجًا وَجَعَلَ فِيهَا سِرَاجًا وَقَمَرًا مُّنِيرًا ﴿61﴾
versets.fr: 61. Que soit béni Celui qui a placé au ciel des constellations et y a placé un luminaire (le soleil) et aussi une lune éclairante!
versets.en: 61. Blessed be He Who has placed in the heaven big stars, and has placed therein a great lamp (sun), and a moon giving light.

versets.ar: 62. وَهُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ خِلْفَةً لِّمَنْ أَرَادَ أَن يَذَّكَّرَ أَوْ أَرَادَ شُكُورًا ﴿62﴾
versets.fr: 62. Et c'est Lui qui a assigné une alternance à la nuit et au jour pour quiconque veut y réfléchir ou montrer sa reconnaissance.
versets.en: 62. And He it is Who has put the night and the day in succession, for such who desires to remember or desires to show his gratitude.

versets.ar: 63. وَعِبَادُ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الَّذِينَ يَمْشُونَ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ هَوْنًا وَإِذَا خَاطَبَهُمُ الْجَاهِلُونَ قَالُوا سَلَامًا ﴿63﴾
versets.fr: 63. Les serviteurs du Tout Miséricordieux sont ceux qui marchent humblement sur terre, qui, lorsque les ignorants s'adressent à eux, disent: «Paix»,
versets.en: 63. And the slaves of the Most Beneficent (Allah) are those who walk on the earth in humility and sedateness, and when the foolish address them (with bad words) they reply back with mild words of gentleness.

versets.ar: 64. وَالَّذِينَ يَبِيتُونَ لِرَبِّهِمْ سُجَّدًا وَقِيَامًا ﴿64﴾
versets.fr: 64. qui passent les nuits prosternés et debout devant leur Seigneur;
versets.en: 64. And those who spend the night before their Lord, prostrate and standing.

versets.ar: 65. وَالَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا اصْرِفْ عَنَّا عَذَابَ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ إِنَّ عَذَابَهَا كَانَ غَرَامًا ﴿65﴾
versets.fr: 65. qui disent: «Seigneur, écarte de nous le châtiment de l'Enfer». - car son châtiment est permanent.
versets.en: 65. And those who say: "Our Lord! Avert from us the torment of Hell. Verily! Its torment is ever an inseparable, permanent punishment."

versets.ar: 66. إِنَّهَا سَاءَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا ﴿66﴾
versets.fr: 66. Quels mauvais gîte et lieu de séjour!
versets.en: 66. Evil indeed it (Hell) is as an abode and as a place to dwell.

versets.ar: 67. وَالَّذِينَ إِذَا أَنفَقُوا لَمْ يُسْرِفُوا وَلَمْ يَقْتُرُوا وَكَانَ بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ قَوَامًا ﴿67﴾
versets.fr: 67. Qui, lorsqu'ils dépensent, ne sont ni prodigues ni avares mais se tiennent au juste milieu.
versets.en: 67. And those, who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor niggardly, but hold a medium (way) between those (extremes).

versets.ar: 68. وَالَّذِينَ لَا يَدْعُونَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ وَلَا يَقْتُلُونَ النَّفْسَ الَّتِي حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا يَزْنُونَ ۚ وَمَن يَفْعَلْ ذَٰلِكَ يَلْقَ أَثَامًا ﴿68﴾
versets.fr: 68. Qui n'invoquent pas d'autre dieu avec Allah et ne tuent pas la vie qu'Allah a rendue sacrée, sauf à bon droit; qui ne commettent pas de fornication - car quiconque fait cela encourra une punition
versets.en: 68. And those who invoke not any other ilah (god) along with Allah, nor kill such life as Allah has forbidden, except for just cause, nor commit illegal sexual intercourse and whoever does this shall receive the punishment.

versets.ar: 69. يُضَاعَفْ لَهُ الْعَذَابُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ وَيَخْلُدْ فِيهِ مُهَانًا ﴿69﴾
versets.fr: 69. et le châtiment lui sera doublé, au Jour de la Résurrection, et il y demeurera éternellement couvert d'ignominie;
versets.en: 69. The torment will be doubled to him on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein in disgrace;

versets.ar: 70. إِلَّا مَن تَابَ وَآمَنَ وَعَمِلَ عَمَلًا صَالِحًا فَأُولَٰئِكَ يُبَدِّلُ اللَّهُ سَيِّئَاتِهِمْ حَسَنَاتٍ ۗ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ غَفُورًا رَّحِيمًا ﴿70﴾
versets.fr: 70. sauf celui qui se repent, croit et accomplit une bonne œuvre; ceux-là Allah changera leurs mauvaises actions en bonnes, et Allah est Pardonneur et Miséricordieux;
versets.en: 70. Except those who repent and believe (in Islamic Monotheism), and do righteous deeds, for those, Allah will change their sins into good deeds, and Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

versets.ar: 71. وَمَن تَابَ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا فَإِنَّهُ يَتُوبُ إِلَى اللَّهِ مَتَابًا ﴿71﴾
versets.fr: 71. et quiconque se repent et accomplit une bonne œuvre c'est vers Allah qu'aboutira son retour.
versets.en: 71. And whosoever repents and does righteous good deeds, then verily, he repents towards Allah with true repentance.

versets.ar: 72. وَالَّذِينَ لَا يَشْهَدُونَ الزُّورَ وَإِذَا مَرُّوا بِاللَّغْوِ مَرُّوا كِرَامًا ﴿72﴾
versets.fr: 72. Ceux qui ne donnent pas de faux témoignages; et qui, lorsqu'ils passent auprès d'une frivolité, s'en écartent noblement;
versets.en: 72. And those who do not witness falsehood, and if they pass by some evil play or evil talk, they pass by it with dignity.

versets.ar: 73. وَالَّذِينَ إِذَا ذُكِّرُوا بِآيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ لَمْ يَخِرُّوا عَلَيْهَا صُمًّا وَعُمْيَانًا ﴿73﴾
versets.fr: 73. qui lorsque les versets de leur Seigneur leur sont rappelés, ne deviennent ni sourds ni aveugles;
versets.en: 73. And those who, when they are reminded of the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) of their Lord, fall not deaf and blind thereat.

versets.ar: 74. وَالَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا هَبْ لَنَا مِنْ أَزْوَاجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّاتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعْيُنٍ وَاجْعَلْنَا لِلْمُتَّقِينَ إِمَامًا ﴿74﴾
versets.fr: 74. et qui disent: «Seigneur, donne-nous, en nos épouses et nos descendants, la joie des yeux, et fais de nous un guide pour les pieux».
versets.en: 74. And those who say: "Our Lord! Bestow on us from our wives and our offspring who will be the comfort of our eyes, and make us leaders for the Muttaqun" (pious - see V. 2:2 and the footnote of V. 3:164)."

versets.ar: 75. أُولَٰئِكَ يُجْزَوْنَ الْغُرْفَةَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا وَيُلَقَّوْنَ فِيهَا تَحِيَّةً وَسَلَامًا ﴿75﴾
versets.fr: 75. Ceux-là auront pour récompense un lieu élevé [du Paradis] à cause de leur endurance, et ils y seront accueillis avec le salut et la paix,
versets.en: 75. Those will be rewarded with the highest place (in Paradise) because of their patience. Therein they shall be met with greetings and the word of peace and respect.

versets.ar: 76. خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ حَسُنَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا ﴿76﴾
versets.fr: 76. pour y demeurer éternellement. Quel beau gîte et lieu de séjour!
versets.en: 76. Abiding therein; excellent it is as an abode, and as a place to dwell.

versets.ar: 77. قُلْ مَا يَعْبَأُ بِكُمْ رَبِّي لَوْلَا دُعَاؤُكُمْ ۖ فَقَدْ كَذَّبْتُمْ فَسَوْفَ يَكُونُ لِزَامًا ﴿77﴾
versets.fr: 77. Dis: «Mon Seigneur ne se souciera pas de vous sans votre prière; mais vous avez, démenti (le Prophète). Votre [châtiment] sera inévitable et permanent.
versets.en: 77. Say (O Muhammad SAW to the disbelievers): "My Lord pays attention to you only because of your invocation to Him. But now you have indeed denied (Him). So the torment will be yours for ever (inseparable permanent punishment)."

versets.fr: 1. T'â, Sîn, Mim.
versets.en: 1. Ta-Sin-Mim. [These letters are one of the miracles of the Quran, and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings.]

versets.ar: 2. تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْكِتَابِ الْمُبِينِ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Voici les versets du Livre explicite.
versets.en: 2. These are the Verses of the manifest Book [this Quran, which was promised by Allah in the Taurat (Torah) and the Injeel (Gospel), makes things clear].

versets.ar: 3. لَعَلَّكَ بَاخِعٌ نَّفْسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُوا مُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Il se peut que tu te consumes de chagrin parce qu'ils ne sont pas croyants!
versets.en: 3. It may be that you (O Muhammad SAW) are going to kill yourself with grief, that they do not become believers [in your Risalah (Messengership) and in your Message of Islamic Monotheism].

versets.ar: 4. إِن نَّشَأْ نُنَزِّلْ عَلَيْهِم مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ آيَةً فَظَلَّتْ أَعْنَاقُهُمْ لَهَا خَاضِعِينَ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Si Nous voulions, Nous ferions descendre du ciel sur eux un prodige devant lequel leurs nuques resteront courbées.
versets.en: 4. If We will, We could send down to them from the heaven a sign, to which they would bend their necks in humility.

versets.ar: 5. وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن ذِكْرٍ مِّنَ الرَّحْمَٰنِ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا عَنْهُ مُعْرِضِينَ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Aucun nouveau rappel ne leur vient du Tout Miséricordieux sans qu'ils ne l'esquivent.
versets.en: 5. And never comes there unto them a Reminder as a recent revelation from the Most Beneficent (Allah), but they turn away therefrom.

versets.ar: 6. فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنبَاءُ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Et ils ont traité de mensonge [tout ce qui leur vient du Seigneur]. Il leur viendra bientôt des nouvelles de ce dont ils se raillent.
versets.en: 6. So they have indeed denied (the truth - this Quran), then the news of what they mocked at, will come to them.

versets.ar: 7. أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا إِلَى الْأَرْضِ كَمْ أَنبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍ كَرِيمٍ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. N'ont-ils pas observé la terre, combien Nous y avons fait pousser de couples généreux de toutes sortes?
versets.en: 7. Do they not observe the earth, how much of every good kind We cause to grow therein?

versets.ar: 8. إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Voilà bien là une preuve! Et la plupart d'entre eux ne croient pas.
versets.en: 8. Verily, in this is an Ayah (proof or sign), yet most of them (polytheists, pagans, etc., who do not believe in Resurrection) are not believers.

versets.ar: 9. وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Et ton Seigneur est en vérité Lui le Tout Puissant, le Très Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 9. And verily, your Lord! He is truly the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

versets.ar: 10. وَإِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰ أَنِ ائْتِ الْقَوْمَ الظَّالِمِينَ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Et lorsque ton Seigneur appela Moïse: «Rends-toi auprès du peuple injuste,
versets.en: 10. And (remember) when your Lord called Musa (Moses) (saying): "Go to the people who are Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doing),

versets.ar: 11. قَوْمَ فِرْعَوْنَ ۚ أَلَا يَتَّقُونَ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. [auprès du] peuple de Pharaon» ne craindront-ils pas (Allah)?
versets.en: 11. The people of Fir'aun (Pharaoh). Will they not fear Allah and become righteous?"

versets.ar: 12. قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. Il dit: «Seigneur, je crains qu'ils ne me traitent de menteur;
versets.en: 12. He said: "My Lord! Verily, I fear that they will belie me,

versets.ar: 13. وَيَضِيقُ صَدْرِي وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِي فَأَرْسِلْ إِلَىٰ هَارُونَ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. que ma poitrine ne se serre, et que ma langue ne soit embarrassée: Mande donc Aaron.
versets.en: 13. "And my breast straitens, and my tongue expresses not well. So send for Harun (Aaron) (to come along with me).

versets.ar: 14. وَلَهُمْ عَلَيَّ ذَنبٌ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقْتُلُونِ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. Ils ont un crime à me reprocher; je crains donc qu'ils ne me tuent».
versets.en: 14. "And they have a charge of crime against me, and I fear they will kill me."

versets.ar: 15. قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ فَاذْهَبَا بِآيَاتِنَا ۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسْتَمِعُونَ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Mais [Allah lui] dit: «Jamais! Allez tous deux avec Nos prodiges, Nous resterons avec vous et Nous écouterons.
versets.en: 15. Allah said: "Nay! Go you both with Our Signs. Verily! We shall be with you, listening.

versets.ar: 16. فَأْتِيَا فِرْعَوْنَ فَقُولَا إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Rendez-vous donc tous deux auprès de Pharaon, puis dites: «Nous sommes les messagers du Seigneur de l'univers,
versets.en: 16. "And when you both come to Fir'aun (Pharaoh), say: 'We are the Messengers of the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists),

versets.ar: 17. أَنْ أَرْسِلْ مَعَنَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. pour que tu renvoies les Enfants d'Israël avec nous».
versets.en: 17. "So allow the Children of Israel to go with us.' "

versets.ar: 18. قَالَ أَلَمْ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدًا وَلَبِثْتَ فِينَا مِنْ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. «Ne t'avons-nous pas, dit Pharaon, élevé chez nous tout enfant? Et n'as-tu pas demeuré parmi nous des années de ta vie?
versets.en: 18. [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] said [to Musa (Moses)]: "Did we not bring you up among us as a child? And you did dwell many years of your life with us.

versets.ar: 19. وَفَعَلْتَ فَعْلَتَكَ الَّتِي فَعَلْتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Puis tu as commis le méfait que tu as fait, en dépit de toute reconnaissance».
versets.en: 19. "And you did your deed, which you did (i.e. the crime of killing a man). And you are one of the ingrates."

versets.ar: 20. قَالَ فَعَلْتُهَا إِذًا وَأَنَا مِنَ الضَّالِّينَ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. «Je l'ai fait, dit Moïse, alors que j'étais encore du nombre des égarés.
versets.en: 20. Musa (Moses) said: "I did it then, when I was an ignorant (as regards my Lord and His Message).

versets.ar: 21. فَفَرَرْتُ مِنكُمْ لَمَّا خِفْتُكُمْ فَوَهَبَ لِي رَبِّي حُكْمًا وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Je me suis donc enfui de vous quand j'ai eu peur de vous: puis, mon Seigneur m'a donné la sagesse et m'a désigné parmi Ses messagers.
versets.en: 21. "So I fled from you when I feared you. But my Lord has granted me Hukman (i.e. religious knowledge, right judgement of the affairs and Prophethood), and appointed me as one of the Messengers.

versets.ar: 22. وَتِلْكَ نِعْمَةٌ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَيَّ أَنْ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. Est-ce là un bienfait de ta part [que tu me rappelles] avec reproche, alors que tu as asservi les Enfants d'Israël?»
versets.en: 22. "And this is the past favour with which you reproach me, that you have enslaved the Children of Israel."

versets.ar: 23. قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَا رَبُّ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. «Et qu'est-ce que le Seigneur de l'univers?» dit Pharaon.
versets.en: 23. Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "And what is the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists)?"

versets.ar: 24. قَالَ رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. «Le Seigneur des cieux et de la terre et de ce qui existe entre eux, dit [Moïse], si seulement vous pouviez en être convaincus!»
versets.en: 24. Musa (Moses) said: "Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, if you seek to be convinced with certainty."

versets.ar: 25. قَالَ لِمَنْ حَوْلَهُ أَلَا تَسْتَمِعُونَ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. [Pharaon] dit à ceux qui l'entouraient: «N'entendez-vous pas?
versets.en: 25. Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said to those around: "Do you not hear (what he says)?"

versets.ar: 26. قَالَ رَبُّكُمْ وَرَبُّ آبَائِكُمُ الْأَوَّلِينَ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. [Moïse] continue: «... Votre Seigneur, et le Seigneur de vos plus anciens ancêtres».
versets.en: 26. Musa (Moses) said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your ancient fathers!"

versets.ar: 27. قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ الَّذِي أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. «Vraiment, dit [Pharaon], votre messager qui vous a été envoyé, est un fou».
versets.en: 27. Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "Verily, your Messenger who has been sent to you is a madman!"

versets.ar: 28. قَالَ رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. [Moïse] ajouta: «... Le Seigneur du Levant et du Couchant et de ce qui est entre les deux; si seulement vous compreniez!»
versets.en: 28. Musa (Moses) said: "Lord of the east and the west, and all that is between them, if you did but understand!"

versets.ar: 29. قَالَ لَئِنِ اتَّخَذْتَ إِلَٰهًا غَيْرِي لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ الْمَسْجُونِينَ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. «Si tu adoptes, dit [Pharaon], une autre divinité que moi, je te mettrai parmi les prisonniers».
versets.en: 29. Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "If you choose an ilah (god) other than me, I will certainly put you among the prisoners."

versets.ar: 30. قَالَ أَوَلَوْ جِئْتُكَ بِشَيْءٍ مُّبِينٍ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. «Et même si je t'apportais, dit [Moïse], une chose (une preuve) évidente?
versets.en: 30. Musa (Moses) said: "Even if I bring you something manifest (and convincing)?"

versets.ar: 31. قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. «Apporte-la, dit [Pharaon], si tu es du nombre des véridiques».
versets.en: 31. Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "Bring it forth then, if you are of the truthful!"

versets.ar: 32. فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُّبِينٌ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. [Moïse] jeta donc son bâton et le voilà devenu un serpent manifeste.
versets.en: 32. So [Musa (Moses)] threw his stick, and behold, it was a serpent, manifest.

versets.ar: 33. وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ بَيْضَاءُ لِلنَّاظِرِينَ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. Et il tira sa main et voilà qu'elle était blanche (étincelante) à ceux qui regardaient.
versets.en: 33. And he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white to all beholders!

versets.ar: 34. قَالَ لِلْمَلَإِ حَوْلَهُ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَاحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. [Pharaon] dit aux notables autour de lui: «Voilà en vérité un magicien savant.
versets.en: 34. [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] said to the chiefs around him: "Verily! This is indeed a well-versed sorcerer.

versets.ar: 35. يُرِيدُ أَن يُخْرِجَكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُم بِسِحْرِهِ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Il veut par sa magie vous expulser de votre terre. Que commandez-vous?»
versets.en: 35. "He wants to drive you out of your land by his sorcery, then what is it your counsel, and what do you command?"

versets.ar: 36. قَالُوا أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَابْعَثْ فِي الْمَدَائِنِ حَاشِرِينَ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. Ils dirent: «Remets-les à plus tard, [lui] et son frère, et envoie des gens dans les villes, pour rassembler,
versets.en: 36. They said: "Put him off and his brother (for a while), and send callers to the cities

versets.ar: 37. يَأْتُوكَ بِكُلِّ سَحَّارٍ عَلِيمٍ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. et t'amener tout grand magicien savant».
versets.en: 37. "To bring up to you every well-versed sorcerer."

versets.ar: 38. فَجُمِعَ السَّحَرَةُ لِمِيقَاتِ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. Les magiciens furent donc réunis en rendez-vous au jour convenu.
versets.en: 38. So the sorcerers were assembled at a fixed time on a day appointed.

versets.ar: 39. وَقِيلَ لِلنَّاسِ هَلْ أَنتُم مُّجْتَمِعُونَ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. Et il fut dit aux gens: «Est-ce que vous allez vous réunir,
versets.en: 39. And it was said to the people: "Are you (too) going to assemble?

versets.ar: 40. لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ السَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُوا هُمُ الْغَالِبِينَ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. afin que nous suivions les magiciens, si ce sont eux les vainqueurs?»
versets.en: 40. "That we may follow the sorcerers [who were on Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) religion of disbelief] if they are the winners."

versets.ar: 41. فَلَمَّا جَاءَ السَّحَرَةُ قَالُوا لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ الْغَالِبِينَ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. Puis, lorsque les magiciens arrivèrent, ils dirent à Pharaon: «Y aura-t-il vraiment une récompense pour nous, si nous sommes les vainqueurs?»
versets.en: 41. So when the sorcerers arrived, they said to Fir'aun (Pharaoh): "Will there surely be a reward for us if we are the winners?"

versets.ar: 42. قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَّمِنَ الْمُقَرَّبِينَ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. Il dit: «Oui, bien sûr, vous serez alors parmi mes proches!»
versets.en: 42. He said: "Yes, and you shall then verily be of those brought near (to myself)."

versets.ar: 43. قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰ أَلْقُوا مَا أَنتُم مُّلْقُونَ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. Moïse leur dit: «Jetez ce que vous avez à jeter».
versets.en: 43. Musa (Moses) said to them: "Throw what you are going to throw!"

versets.ar: 44. فَأَلْقَوْا حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُوا بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ الْغَالِبُونَ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. Ils jetèrent donc leurs cordes et leurs bâtons et dirent: «Par la puissance de Pharaon!... C'est nous qui serons les vainqueurs».
versets.en: 44. So they threw their ropes and their sticks, and said: "By the might of Fir'aun (Pharaoh), it is we who will certainly win!"

versets.ar: 45. فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. Puis Moïse jeta son bâton, et voilà qu'il happait ce qu'ils avaient fabriqué.
versets.en: 45. Then Musa (Moses) threw his stick, and behold, it swallowed up all the falsehoods which they showed!

versets.ar: 46. فَأُلْقِيَ السَّحَرَةُ سَاجِدِينَ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. Alors les magiciens tombèrent prosternés,
versets.en: 46. And the sorcerers fell down prostrate.

versets.ar: 47. قَالُوا آمَنَّا بِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. disant: «Nous croyons au Seigneur de l'univers,
versets.en: 47. Saying: "We believe in the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists).

versets.ar: 48. رَبِّ مُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. Le Seigneur de Moïse et d'Aaron».
versets.en: 48. "The Lord of Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron)."

versets.ar: 49. قَالَ آمَنتُمْ لَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ آذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ الَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ السِّحْرَ فَلَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ ۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَافٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. [Pharaon] dit: «Avez-vous cru en lui avant que je ne vous le permette? En vérité, c'est lui votre chef, qui vous a enseigné la magie! Eh bien, vous saurez bientôt! Je vous couperai, sûrement, mains et jambes opposées, et vous crucifierai tous».
versets.en: 49. [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] said: "You have believed in him before I give you leave. Surely, he indeed is your chief, who has taught you magic! So verily, you shall come to know. Verily, I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you all."

versets.ar: 50. قَالُوا لَا ضَيْرَ ۖ إِنَّا إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. Ils disent: «Il n'y a pas de mal! Car c'est vers notre Seigneur que nous retournerons.
versets.en: 50. They said: "No harm! Surely, to our Lord (Allah) we are to return;

versets.ar: 51. إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَايَانَا أَن كُنَّا أَوَّلَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. Nous convoitons que notre Seigneur nous pardonne nos fautes pour avoir été les premiers à croire».
versets.en: 51. "Verily! We really hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, as we are the first of the believers [in Musa (Moses) and in the Monotheism which he has brought from Allah]."

versets.ar: 52. ۞ وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِي إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. Et Nous révélâmes à Moïse [ceci]: «Pars de nuit avec Mes serviteurs, car vous serez poursuivis».
versets.en: 52. And We inspired Musa (Moses), saying: "Take away My slaves by night, verily, you will be pursued."

versets.ar: 53. فَأَرْسَلَ فِرْعَوْنُ فِي الْمَدَائِنِ حَاشِرِينَ ﴿53﴾
versets.fr: 53. Puis, Pharaon envoya des rassembleurs [dire] dans les villes:
versets.en: 53. Then Fir'aun (Pharaoh) sent callers to (all) the cities.

versets.ar: 54. إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ لَشِرْذِمَةٌ قَلِيلُونَ ﴿54﴾
versets.fr: 54. «Ce sont, en fait, une bande peu nombreuse,
versets.en: 54. (Saying): "Verily! These indeed are but a small band.

versets.ar: 55. وَإِنَّهُمْ لَنَا لَغَائِظُونَ ﴿55﴾
versets.fr: 55. mais ils nous irritent,
versets.en: 55. "And verily, they have done what has enraged us;

versets.ar: 56. وَإِنَّا لَجَمِيعٌ حَاذِرُونَ ﴿56﴾
versets.fr: 56. tandis que nous sommes tous vigilants».
versets.en: 56. "But we are host all assembled, amply fore-warned."

versets.ar: 57. فَأَخْرَجْنَاهُم مِّن جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ ﴿57﴾
versets.fr: 57. Ainsi, Nous les fîmes donc sortir des jardins, des sources,
versets.en: 57. So, We expelled them from gardens and springs,

versets.ar: 58. وَكُنُوزٍ وَمَقَامٍ كَرِيمٍ ﴿58﴾
versets.fr: 58. des trésors et d'un lieu de séjour agréable.
versets.en: 58. Treasures, and every kind of honourable place.

versets.ar: 59. كَذَٰلِكَ وَأَوْرَثْنَاهَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ ﴿59﴾
versets.fr: 59. Il en fut ainsi! Et Nous les donnâmes en héritage aux enfants d'Israël.
versets.en: 59. Thus [We turned them (Pharaoh's people) out] and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit them.

versets.ar: 60. فَأَتْبَعُوهُم مُّشْرِقِينَ ﴿60﴾
versets.fr: 60. Au lever du soleil, ils les poursuivirent.
versets.en: 60. So they pursued them at sunrise.

versets.ar: 61. فَلَمَّا تَرَاءَى الْجَمْعَانِ قَالَ أَصْحَابُ مُوسَىٰ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَكُونَ ﴿61﴾
versets.fr: 61. Puis, quand les deux partis se virent, les compagnons de Moïse dirent: «Nous allons être rejoints».
versets.en: 61. And when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Musa (Moses) said: "We are sure to be overtaken."

versets.ar: 62. قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّ مَعِيَ رَبِّي سَيَهْدِينِ ﴿62﴾
versets.fr: 62. Il dit: «Jamais, car j'ai avec moi mon Seigneur qui va me guider».
versets.en: 62. [Musa (Moses)] said: "Nay, verily! With me is my Lord, He will guide me."

versets.ar: 63. فَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنِ اضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ الْبَحْرَ ۖ فَانفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرْقٍ كَالطَّوْدِ الْعَظِيمِ ﴿63﴾
versets.fr: 63. Alors Nous révélâmes à Moïse: «Frappe la mer de ton bâton». Elle se fendit alors, et chaque versant fut comme une énorme montagne.
versets.en: 63. Then We inspired Musa (Moses) (saying): "Strike the sea with your stick." And it parted, and each separate part (of that sea water) became like the huge, firm mass of a mountain.

versets.ar: 64. وَأَزْلَفْنَا ثَمَّ الْآخَرِينَ ﴿64﴾
versets.fr: 64. Nous fîmes approcher les autres [Pharaon et son peuple].
versets.en: 64. Then We brought near the others [Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) party] to that place.

versets.ar: 65. وَأَنجَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَمَن مَّعَهُ أَجْمَعِينَ ﴿65﴾
versets.fr: 65. Et Nous sauvâmes Moïse et tous ceux qui étaient avec lui;
versets.en: 65. And We saved Musa (Moses) and all those with him.

versets.ar: 66. ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا الْآخَرِينَ ﴿66﴾
versets.fr: 66. ensuite Nous noyâmes les autres.
versets.en: 66. Then We drowned the others.

versets.ar: 67. إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ ﴿67﴾
versets.fr: 67. Voilà bien là un prodige, mais la plupart d'entre eux ne croient pas.
versets.en: 67. Verily! In this is indeed a sign (or a proof), yet most of them are not believers.

versets.ar: 68. وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ ﴿68﴾
versets.fr: 68. Et ton Seigneur, c'est en vérité Lui le Tout Puissant, le Très Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 68. And verily, your Lord! He is truly the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

versets.ar: 69. وَاتْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ نَبَأَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ ﴿69﴾
versets.fr: 69. Et récite-leur la nouvelle d'Abraham:
versets.en: 69. And recite to them the story of Ibrahim (Abraham).

versets.ar: 70. إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ ﴿70﴾
versets.fr: 70. Quand il dit à son père et à son peuple: «Qu'adorez-vous?»
versets.en: 70. When he said to his father and his people: "What do you worship?"

versets.ar: 71. قَالُوا نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَامًا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَاكِفِينَ ﴿71﴾
versets.fr: 71. Ils dirent: «Nous adorons des idoles et nous leurs restons attachés».
versets.en: 71. They said: "We worship idols, and to them we are ever devoted."

versets.ar: 72. قَالَ هَلْ يَسْمَعُونَكُمْ إِذْ تَدْعُونَ ﴿72﴾
versets.fr: 72. Il dit: «Vous entendent-elles lorsque vous [les] appelez?
versets.en: 72. He said: "Do they hear you, when you call (on them)?

versets.ar: 73. أَوْ يَنفَعُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَضُرُّونَ ﴿73﴾
versets.fr: 73. ou vous profitent-elles? ou vous nuisent-elles?»
versets.en: 73. "Or do they benefit you or do they harm (you)?"

versets.ar: 74. قَالُوا بَلْ وَجَدْنَا آبَاءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ ﴿74﴾
versets.fr: 74. Ils dirent: «Non! mais nous avons trouvé nos ancêtres agissant ainsi».
versets.en: 74. They said: "Nay, but we found our fathers doing so."

versets.ar: 75. قَالَ أَفَرَأَيْتُم مَّا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ ﴿75﴾
versets.fr: 75. Il dit: «Que dites-vous de ce que vous adoriez...?
versets.en: 75. He said: "Do you observe that which you have been worshipping,

versets.ar: 76. أَنتُمْ وَآبَاؤُكُمُ الْأَقْدَمُونَ ﴿76﴾
versets.fr: 76. Vous et vos vieux ancêtres?
versets.en: 76. "You and your ancient fathers?

versets.ar: 77. فَإِنَّهُمْ عَدُوٌّ لِّي إِلَّا رَبَّ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿77﴾
versets.fr: 77. Ils sont tous pour moi des ennemis sauf le Seigneur de l'univers,
versets.en: 77. "Verily! They are enemies to me, save the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists);

versets.ar: 78. الَّذِي خَلَقَنِي فَهُوَ يَهْدِينِ ﴿78﴾
versets.fr: 78. qui m'a créé, et c'est Lui qui me guide;
versets.en: 78. "Who has created me, and it is He Who guides me;

versets.ar: 79. وَالَّذِي هُوَ يُطْعِمُنِي وَيَسْقِينِ ﴿79﴾
versets.fr: 79. et c'est Lui qui me nourrit et me donne à boire;
versets.en: 79. "And it is He Who feeds me and gives me to drink.

versets.ar: 80. وَإِذَا مَرِضْتُ فَهُوَ يَشْفِينِ ﴿80﴾
versets.fr: 80. et quand je suis malade, c'est Lui qui me guérit,
versets.en: 80. "And when I am ill, it is He who cures me.

versets.ar: 81. وَالَّذِي يُمِيتُنِي ثُمَّ يُحْيِينِ ﴿81﴾
versets.fr: 81. et qui me fera mourir, puis me redonnera la vie,
versets.en: 81. "And Who will cause me to die, and then will bring me to life (again);

versets.ar: 82. وَالَّذِي أَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لِي خَطِيئَتِي يَوْمَ الدِّينِ ﴿82﴾
versets.fr: 82. et c'est de Lui que je convoite le pardon de mes fautes le Jour de la Rétribution.
versets.en: 82. "And Who, I hope will forgive me my faults on the Day of Recompense, (the Day of Resurrection),"

versets.ar: 83. رَبِّ هَبْ لِي حُكْمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِي بِالصَّالِحِينَ ﴿83﴾
versets.fr: 83. Seigneur, accorde-moi sagesse (et savoir) et fais-moi rejoindre les gens de bien;
versets.en: 83. My Lord! Bestow Hukman (religious knowledge, right judgement of the affairs and Prophethood) on me, and join me with the righteous;

versets.ar: 84. وَاجْعَل لِّي لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِي الْآخِرِينَ ﴿84﴾
versets.fr: 84. fais que j'aie une mention honorable sur les langues de la postérité;
versets.en: 84. And grant me an honourable mention in later generations;

versets.ar: 85. وَاجْعَلْنِي مِن وَرَثَةِ جَنَّةِ النَّعِيمِ ﴿85﴾
versets.fr: 85. et fais de moi l'un des héritiers du Jardin des délices.
versets.en: 85. And make me one of the inheritors of the Paradise of Delight;

versets.ar: 86. وَاغْفِرْ لِأَبِي إِنَّهُ كَانَ مِنَ الضَّالِّينَ ﴿86﴾
versets.fr: 86. et pardonne à mon père: car il a été du nombre des égarés;
versets.en: 86. And forgive my father, verily he is of the erring;

versets.ar: 87. وَلَا تُخْزِنِي يَوْمَ يُبْعَثُونَ ﴿87﴾
versets.fr: 87. et ne me couvre pas d'ignominie, le jour où l'on sera ressuscité,
versets.en: 87. And disgrace me not on the Day when (all the creatures) will be resurrected;

versets.ar: 88. يَوْمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٌ وَلَا بَنُونَ ﴿88﴾
versets.fr: 88. le jour où ni les biens, ni les enfants ne seront d'aucune utilité,
versets.en: 88. The Day whereon neither wealth nor sons will avail,

versets.ar: 89. إِلَّا مَنْ أَتَى اللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ ﴿89﴾
versets.fr: 89. sauf celui qui vient à Allah avec un cœur sain».
versets.en: 89. Except him who brings to Allah a clean heart [clean from Shirk (polytheism) and Nifaq (hypocrisy)].

versets.ar: 90. وَأُزْلِفَتِ الْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ ﴿90﴾
versets.fr: 90. On rapprochera alors le Paradis pour les pieux,
versets.en: 90. And Paradise will be brought near to the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2).

versets.ar: 91. وَبُرِّزَتِ الْجَحِيمُ لِلْغَاوِينَ ﴿91﴾
versets.fr: 91. et l'on exposera aux errants la Fournaise,
versets.en: 91. And the (Hell) Fire will be placed in full view of the erring.

versets.ar: 92. وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ ﴿92﴾
versets.fr: 92. et on leur dira: «Où sont ceux que vous adoriez,
versets.en: 92. And it will be said to them: "Where are those (the false gods whom you used to set up as rivals with Allah) that you used to worship

versets.ar: 93. مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ هَلْ يَنصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنتَصِرُونَ ﴿93﴾
versets.fr: 93. en dehors d'Allah? vous secourent-ils? ou se secourent-ils eux-mêmes?»
versets.en: 93. "Instead of Allah? Can they help you or (even) help themselves?"

versets.ar: 94. فَكُبْكِبُوا فِيهَا هُمْ وَالْغَاوُونَ ﴿94﴾
versets.fr: 94. Ils y seront donc jetés pêle-mêle, et les errants aussi,
versets.en: 94. Then they will be thrown on their faces into the (Fire), They and the Ghawun (devils, and those who were in error).

versets.ar: 95. وَجُنُودُ إِبْلِيسَ أَجْمَعُونَ ﴿95﴾
versets.fr: 95. ainsi que toutes les légions de Iblis.
versets.en: 95. And the whole hosts of Iblis (Satan) together.

versets.ar: 96. قَالُوا وَهُمْ فِيهَا يَخْتَصِمُونَ ﴿96﴾
versets.fr: 96. Ils diront, tout en s'y querellant:
versets.en: 96. They will say while contending therein,

versets.ar: 97. تَاللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ ﴿97﴾
versets.fr: 97. «Par Allah! Nous étions certes dans un égarement évident,
versets.en: 97. By Allah, we were truly in a manifest error,

versets.ar: 98. إِذْ نُسَوِّيكُم بِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿98﴾
versets.fr: 98. quand nous faisions de vous les égaux du Seigneur de l'univers.
versets.en: 98. When We held you (false gods) as equals (in worship) with the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists);

versets.ar: 99. وَمَا أَضَلَّنَا إِلَّا الْمُجْرِمُونَ ﴿99﴾
versets.fr: 99. Ce ne sont que les criminels qui nous ont égarés.
versets.en: 99. And none has brought us into error except the Mujrimun [Iblis (Satan) and those of human beings who commit crimes, murderers, polytheists, oppressors, etc.].

versets.ar: 100. فَمَا لَنَا مِن شَافِعِينَ ﴿100﴾
versets.fr: 100. Et nous n'avons pas d'intercesseurs,
versets.en: 100. Now we have no intercessors,

versets.fr: 101. ni d'ami chaleureux.
versets.en: 101. Nor a close friend (to help us).

versets.ar: 102. فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةً فَنَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿102﴾
versets.fr: 102. Si un retour nous était possible, alors nous serions parmi les croyants!»
versets.en: 102. (Alas!) If we only had a chance to return (to the world), we shall truly be among the believers!

versets.ar: 103. إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ ﴿103﴾
versets.fr: 103. Voilà bien là un signe; cependant, la plupart d'entre eux ne croient pas.
versets.en: 103. Verily! In this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

versets.ar: 104. وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ ﴿104﴾
versets.fr: 104. Et ton Seigneur, c'est Lui vraiment le Puissant, le Très Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 104. And verily, your Lord! He is truly the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

versets.ar: 105. كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ الْمُرْسَلِينَ ﴿105﴾
versets.fr: 105. Le peuple de Noé traita de menteurs les Messagers,
versets.en: 105. The people of Nuh (Noah) belied the Messengers.

versets.ar: 106. إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ ﴿106﴾
versets.fr: 106. lorsque Noé, leur frère, (contribule) leur dit: «Ne craindrez-vous pas [Allah]?
versets.en: 106. When their brother Nuh (Noah) said to them: "Will you not fear Allah and obey Him?

versets.ar: 107. إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ ﴿107﴾
versets.fr: 107. Je suis pour vous un messager digne de confiance.
versets.en: 107. "I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.

versets.ar: 108. فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ ﴿108﴾
versets.fr: 108. Craignez Allah donc et obéissez-moi.
versets.en: 108. "So fear Allah, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.

versets.ar: 109. وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿109﴾
versets.fr: 109. Et je ne vous demande pas de salaire pour cela; mon salaire n'incombe qu'au Seigneur de l'univers.
versets.en: 109. "No reward do I ask of you for it (my Message of Islamic Monotheism), my reward is only from the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists).

versets.ar: 110. فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ ﴿110﴾
versets.fr: 110. Craignez Allah donc, et obéissez-moi».
versets.en: 110. "So keep your duty to Allah, fear Him and obey me."

versets.ar: 111. ۞ قَالُوا أَنُؤْمِنُ لَكَ وَاتَّبَعَكَ الْأَرْذَلُونَ ﴿111﴾
versets.fr: 111. Ils dirent: «Croirons-nous en toi, alors que ce sont les plus vils qui te suivent.
versets.en: 111. They said: "Shall we believe in you, when the meanest (of the people) follow you?"

versets.ar: 112. قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِي بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ ﴿112﴾
versets.fr: 112. Il dit: «Je ne sais pas ce que ceux-là faisaient.
versets.en: 112. He said: "And what knowledge have I of what they used to do?

versets.ar: 113. إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّي ۖ لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ ﴿113﴾
versets.fr: 113. Leur compte n'incombe qu'à mon Seigneur. Si seulement vous êtes conscients.
versets.en: 113. "Their account is only with my Lord, if you could (but) know.

versets.ar: 114. وَمَا أَنَا بِطَارِدِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿114﴾
versets.fr: 114. Je ne suis pas celui qui repousse les croyants.
versets.en: 114. "And I am not going to drive away the believers.

versets.ar: 115. إِنْ أَنَا إِلَّا نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ ﴿115﴾
versets.fr: 115. Je ne suis qu'un avertisseur explicite».
versets.en: 115. I am only a plain warner."

versets.ar: 116. قَالُوا لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَا نُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمَرْجُومِينَ ﴿116﴾
versets.fr: 116. Ils dirent: «Si tu ne cesses pas, Noé, tu seras certainement du nombre des lapidés!»
versets.en: 116. They said: "If you cease not, O Nuh (Noah)! You will surely be among those stoned (to death)."

versets.fr: 117. Il dit: «O mon Seigneur, mon peuple me traite de menteur.
versets.en: 117. He said: "My Lord! Verily, my people have belied me.

versets.ar: 118. فَافْتَحْ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًا وَنَجِّنِي وَمَن مَّعِيَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿118﴾
versets.fr: 118. Tranche donc clairement entre eux et moi; et sauve-moi ainsi que ceux des croyants qui sont avec moi».
versets.en: 118. Therefore judge You between me and them, and save me and those of the believers who are with me."

versets.ar: 119. فَأَنجَيْنَاهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُ فِي الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ ﴿119﴾
versets.fr: 119. Nous le sauvâmes donc, de même que ceux qui étaient avec lui dans l'arche, pleinement chargée.
versets.en: 119. And We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.

versets.ar: 120. ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا بَعْدُ الْبَاقِينَ ﴿120﴾
versets.fr: 120. Et ensuite nous noyâmes le reste (les infidèles).
versets.en: 120. Then We drowned the rest (disbelievers) thereafter.

versets.ar: 121. إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ ﴿121﴾
versets.fr: 121. Voilà bien là un signe. Cependant, la plupart d'entre eux ne croient pas.
versets.en: 121. Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

versets.ar: 122. وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ ﴿122﴾
versets.fr: 122. Et Ton Seigneur, c'est lui vraiment le Puissant, le Très Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 122. And verily! Your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

versets.ar: 123. كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ الْمُرْسَلِينَ ﴿123﴾
versets.fr: 123. Les 'Aad traitèrent de menteurs les Envoyés.
versets.en: 123. 'Ad (people) belied the Messengers.

versets.ar: 124. إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ ﴿124﴾
versets.fr: 124. Et quand Hûd, leur frère (contribule), leur dit: «Ne craindrez-vous pas [Allah]?»
versets.en: 124. When their brother Hud said to them: "Will you not fear Allah and obey Him?

versets.ar: 125. إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ ﴿125﴾
versets.fr: 125. Je suis pour vous un messager digne de confiance,
versets.en: 125. "Verily! I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.

versets.ar: 126. فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ ﴿126﴾
versets.fr: 126. Craignez Allah donc et obéissez-moi.
versets.en: 126. "So fear Allah, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.

versets.ar: 127. وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿127﴾
versets.fr: 127. Et je ne vous demande pas de salaire pour cela; mon salaire n'incombe qu'au Seigneur de l'univers.
versets.en: 127. "No reward do I ask of you for it (my Message of Islamic Monotheism), my reward is only from the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns, and all that exists).

versets.ar: 128. أَتَبْنُونَ بِكُلِّ رِيعٍ آيَةً تَعْبَثُونَ ﴿128﴾
versets.fr: 128. Bâtissez-vous par frivolité sur chaque colline un monument?
versets.en: 128. "Do you build high palaces on every high place, while you do not live in them?

versets.ar: 129. وَتَتَّخِذُونَ مَصَانِعَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَخْلُدُونَ ﴿129﴾
versets.fr: 129. Et édifiez-vous des châteaux comme si vous deviez demeurer éternellement?
versets.en: 129. "And do you get for yourselves palaces (fine buildings) as if you will live therein for ever.

versets.ar: 130. وَإِذَا بَطَشْتُم بَطَشْتُمْ جَبَّارِينَ ﴿130﴾
versets.fr: 130. Et quand vous sévissez contre quelqu'un, vous le faites impitoyablement.
versets.en: 130. "And when you seize, seize you as tyrants?

versets.ar: 131. فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ ﴿131﴾
versets.fr: 131. Craignez Allah donc et obéissez-moi.
versets.en: 131. "So fear Allah, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.

versets.ar: 132. وَاتَّقُوا الَّذِي أَمَدَّكُم بِمَا تَعْلَمُونَ ﴿132﴾
versets.fr: 132. Craignez Celui qui vous a pourvus de [toutes les bonnes choses] que vous connaissez,
versets.en: 132. "And keep your duty to Him, fear Him Who has aided you with all (good things) that you know.

versets.ar: 133. أَمَدَّكُم بِأَنْعَامٍ وَبَنِينَ ﴿133﴾
versets.fr: 133. qui vous a pourvus de bestiaux et d'enfants,
versets.en: 133. "He has aided you with cattle and children.

versets.fr: 134. de jardins et de sources.
versets.en: 134. "And gardens and springs.

versets.ar: 135. إِنِّي أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ ﴿135﴾
versets.fr: 135. Je crains pour vous le châtiment d'un Jour terrible».
versets.en: 135. "Verily, I fear for you the torment of a Great Day."

versets.ar: 136. قَالُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْنَا أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُن مِّنَ الْوَاعِظِينَ ﴿136﴾
versets.fr: 136. Ils dirent: «Que tu nous exhortes ou pas, cela nous est parfaitement égal!
versets.en: 136. They said: "It is the same to us whether you preach or be not of those who preach.

versets.ar: 137. إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا خُلُقُ الْأَوَّلِينَ ﴿137﴾
versets.fr: 137. Ce ne sont là que des mours des anciens:
versets.en: 137. "This is no other than the false-tales and religion of the ancients, [Tafsir At-Tabari, Vol. 19, Page 97]

versets.fr: 138. Nous ne serons nullement châtiés».
versets.en: 138. "And we are not going to be punished."

versets.ar: 139. فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَاهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ ﴿139﴾
versets.fr: 139. Ils le traitèrent donc de menteur. Et nous les fîmes périr. Voilà bien là un signe! Cependant, la plupart d'entre eux ne croient pas.
versets.en: 139. So they belied him, and We destroyed them. Verily! In this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

versets.ar: 140. وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ ﴿140﴾
versets.fr: 140. Et Ton Seigneur, c'est Lui vraiment le Puissant, le Très Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 140. And verily! Your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

versets.ar: 141. كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ الْمُرْسَلِينَ ﴿141﴾
versets.fr: 141. Les Thamûd traitèrent de menteurs les Messagers.
versets.en: 141. Thamud (people) belied the Messenger.

versets.ar: 142. إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَالِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ ﴿142﴾
versets.fr: 142. Quand Sâlih, leur frère (contribule) leur dit: «Ne craindrez-vous pas [Allah]?»
versets.en: 142. When their brother Salih (Saleh) said to them: "Will you not fear Allah and obey Him?

versets.ar: 143. إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ ﴿143﴾
versets.fr: 143. Je suis pour vous un messager digne de confiance.
versets.en: 143. "I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.

versets.ar: 144. فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ ﴿144﴾
versets.fr: 144. Craignez Allah donc et obéissez-moi.
versets.en: 144. "So fear Allah, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.

versets.ar: 145. وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿145﴾
versets.fr: 145. Je ne vous demande pas de salaire pour cela, mon salaire n'incombe qu'au Seigneur de l'univers.
versets.en: 145. "No reward do I ask of you for it (my Message of Islamic Monotheism), my reward is only from the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists).

versets.ar: 146. أَتُتْرَكُونَ فِي مَا هَاهُنَا آمِنِينَ ﴿146﴾
versets.fr: 146. Vous laissera-t-on en sécurité dans votre présente condition?
versets.en: 146. "Will you be left secure in that which you have here?

versets.fr: 147. Au milieu de jardins, de sources,
versets.en: 147. "In gardens and springs.

versets.ar: 148. وَزُرُوعٍ وَنَخْلٍ طَلْعُهَا هَضِيمٌ ﴿148﴾
versets.fr: 148. de cultures et de palmiers aux fruits digestes?
versets.en: 148. And green crops (fields etc.) and date-palms with soft spadix.

versets.ar: 149. وَتَنْحِتُونَ مِنَ الْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا فَارِهِينَ ﴿149﴾
versets.fr: 149. Creusez-vous habilement des maisons dans les montagnes?
versets.en: 149. "And you carve houses out of mountains with great skill.

versets.ar: 150. فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ ﴿150﴾
versets.fr: 150. Craignez Allah donc et obéissez-moi.
versets.en: 150. "So fear Allah, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.

versets.ar: 151. وَلَا تُطِيعُوا أَمْرَ الْمُسْرِفِينَ ﴿151﴾
versets.fr: 151. N'obéissez pas à l'ordre des outranciers,
versets.en: 151. "And follow not the command of Al-Musrifun [i.e. their chiefs, leaders who were polytheists, criminals and sinners],

versets.ar: 152. الَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ ﴿152﴾
versets.fr: 152. qui sèment le désordre sur la terre et n'améliorent rien».
versets.en: 152. "Who make mischief in the land, and reform not."

versets.ar: 153. قَالُوا إِنَّمَا أَنتَ مِنَ الْمُسَحَّرِينَ ﴿153﴾
versets.fr: 153. Ils dirent: «Tu n'es qu'un ensorcelé.
versets.en: 153. They said: "You are only of those bewitched!

versets.ar: 154. مَا أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِآيَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ ﴿154﴾
versets.fr: 154. Tu n'es qu'un homme comme nous. Apporte donc un prodige, si tu es du nombre des véridiques».
versets.en: 154. "You are but a human being like us. Then bring us a sign if you are of the truthful."

versets.ar: 155. قَالَ هَٰذِهِ نَاقَةٌ لَّهَا شِرْبٌ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ ﴿155﴾
versets.fr: 155. Il dit: «Voici une chamelle: à elle de boire un jour convenu, et à vous de boire un jour.
versets.en: 155. He said: "Here is a she-camel; it has a right to drink (water), and you have a right to drink (water) (each) on a day, known.

versets.ar: 156. وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ ﴿156﴾
versets.fr: 156. Et ne lui infligez aucun mal, sinon le châtiment d'un jour terrible vous saisira».
versets.en: 156. "And touch her not with harm, lest the torment of a Great Day seize you."

versets.ar: 157. فَعَقَرُوهَا فَأَصْبَحُوا نَادِمِينَ ﴿157﴾
versets.fr: 157. Mais ils la tuèrent. Eh bien, ils eurent à regretter!
versets.en: 157. But they killed her, and then they became regretful.

versets.ar: 158. فَأَخَذَهُمُ الْعَذَابُ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ ﴿158﴾
versets.fr: 158. Le châtiment, en effet, les saisit. Voilà bien là un prodige. Cependant, la plupart d'entre eux ne croient pas.
versets.en: 158. So the torment overtook them. Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

versets.ar: 159. وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ ﴿159﴾
versets.fr: 159. Et ton Seigneur, c'est en vérité Lui le Tout Puissant, le Très Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 159. And verily! Your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

versets.ar: 160. كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍ الْمُرْسَلِينَ ﴿160﴾
versets.fr: 160. Le peuple de Lot traita de menteurs les Messagers,
versets.en: 160. The prople of Lout (Lot) (those dwelt in the towns of Sodom in Palestine) belied the Messengers.

versets.ar: 161. إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ ﴿161﴾
versets.fr: 161. quand leur frère Lot leur dit: «Ne craindrez-vous pas [Allah]?
versets.en: 161. When their brother Lout (Lot) said to them: "Will you not fear Allah and obey Him?

versets.ar: 162. إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ ﴿162﴾
versets.fr: 162. Je suis pour vous un messager digne de confiance.
versets.en: 162. "Verily! I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.

versets.ar: 163. فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ ﴿163﴾
versets.fr: 163. Craignez Allah donc et obéissez-moi.
versets.en: 163. "So fear Allah, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.

versets.ar: 164. وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿164﴾
versets.fr: 164. Je ne vous demande pas de salaire pour cela; mon salaire n'incombe qu'au Seigneur de l'univers.
versets.en: 164. "No reward do I ask of you for it (my Message of Islamic Monotheism), my reward is only from the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists).

versets.ar: 165. أَتَأْتُونَ الذُّكْرَانَ مِنَ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿165﴾
versets.fr: 165. Accomplissez-vous l'acte charnel avec les mâles de ce monde?
versets.en: 165. "Go you in unto the males of the 'Alamin (mankind),

versets.ar: 166. وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُم مِّنْ أَزْوَاجِكُم ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ عَادُونَ ﴿166﴾
versets.fr: 166. Et délaissez-vous les épouses que votre Seigneur a créées pour vous? Mais vous n'êtes que des gens transgresseurs».
versets.en: 166. "And leave those whom Allah has created for you to be your wives? Nay, you are a trespassing people!"

versets.ar: 167. قَالُوا لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَا لُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمُخْرَجِينَ ﴿167﴾
versets.fr: 167. Ils dirent: «Si tu ne cesses pas, Lot, tu seras certainement du nombre des expulsés».
versets.en: 167. They said: "If you cease not. O Lout (Lot)! Verily, you will be one of those who are driven out!"

versets.ar: 168. قَالَ إِنِّي لِعَمَلِكُم مِّنَ الْقَالِينَ ﴿168﴾
versets.fr: 168. Il dit: «Je déteste vraiment ce que vous faites.
versets.en: 168. He said: "I am, indeed, of those who disapprove with severe anger and fury your (this evil) action (of sodomy).

versets.ar: 169. رَبِّ نَجِّنِي وَأَهْلِي مِمَّا يَعْمَلُونَ ﴿169﴾
versets.fr: 169. Seigneur, sauve-moi ainsi que ma famille de ce qu'ils font».
versets.en: 169. "My Lord! Save me and my family from what they do."

versets.ar: 170. فَنَجَّيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ أَجْمَعِينَ ﴿170﴾
versets.fr: 170. Nous le sauvâmes alors, lui et toute sa famille,
versets.en: 170. So We saved him and his family, all,

versets.ar: 171. إِلَّا عَجُوزًا فِي الْغَابِرِينَ ﴿171﴾
versets.fr: 171. sauf une vieille qui fut parmi les exterminés.
versets.en: 171. Except an old woman (his wife) among those who remained behind.

versets.ar: 172. ثُمَّ دَمَّرْنَا الْآخَرِينَ ﴿172﴾
versets.fr: 172. Puis Nous détruisîmes les autres;
versets.en: 172. Then afterward We destroyed the others.

versets.ar: 173. وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًا ۖ فَسَاءَ مَطَرُ الْمُنذَرِينَ ﴿173﴾
versets.fr: 173. et Nous fîmes pleuvoir sur eux une pluie (de pierres). Et quelle pluie fatale pour ceux qui sont avertis!
versets.en: 173. And We rained on them a rain (of torment). And how evil was the rain of those who had been warned.

versets.ar: 174. إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ ﴿174﴾
versets.fr: 174. Voilà bien là un prodige. Cependant, la plupart d'entre eux ne croient pas.
versets.en: 174. Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

versets.ar: 175. وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ ﴿175﴾
versets.fr: 175. Et ton Seigneur, c'est en vérité Lui le Tout Puissant, le Très Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 175. And verily! Your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

versets.ar: 176. كَذَّبَ أَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ الْمُرْسَلِينَ ﴿176﴾
versets.fr: 176. Les gens d'Al-Ayka traitèrent de menteurs les Messagers.
versets.en: 176. The dwellers of Al-Aiyka [near Madyan (Midian)] belied the Messengers.

versets.ar: 177. إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ ﴿177﴾
versets.fr: 177. Lorsque Chuayb leur dit: «Ne craindrez-vous pas [Allah]».
versets.en: 177. When Shu'aib (Shuaib) said to them: "Will you not fear Allah (and obey Him)?

versets.ar: 178. إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ ﴿178﴾
versets.fr: 178. Je suis pour vous un messager digne de confiance.
versets.en: 178. "I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.

versets.ar: 179. فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ ﴿179﴾
versets.fr: 179. Craignez Allah donc et obéissez-moi,
versets.en: 179. "So fear Allah, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.

versets.ar: 180. وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿180﴾
versets.fr: 180. et je ne vous demande pas de salaire pour cela; mon salaire n'incombe qu'au Seigneur de l'univers.
versets.en: 180. "No reward do I ask of you for it (my Message of Islamic Monotheism), my reward is only from the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists).

versets.ar: 181. ۞ أَوْفُوا الْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا مِنَ الْمُخْسِرِينَ ﴿181﴾
versets.fr: 181. Donnez la pleine mesure et n'en faites rien perdre [aux gens].
versets.en: 181. "Give full measure, and cause no loss (to others).

versets.ar: 182. وَزِنُوا بِالْقِسْطَاسِ الْمُسْتَقِيمِ ﴿182﴾
versets.fr: 182. et pesez avec une balance exacte.
versets.en: 182. "And weigh with the true and straight balance.

versets.ar: 183. وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا النَّاسَ أَشْيَاءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا فِي الْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ ﴿183﴾
versets.fr: 183. Ne donnez pas aux gens moins que leur dû; et ne commettez pas de désordre et de corruption sur terre.
versets.en: 183. "And defraud not people by reducing their things, nor do evil, making corruption and mischief in the land.

versets.ar: 184. وَاتَّقُوا الَّذِي خَلَقَكُمْ وَالْجِبِلَّةَ الْأَوَّلِينَ ﴿184﴾
versets.fr: 184. Et craignez Celui qui vous a créés, vous et les anciennes générations».
versets.en: 184. "And fear Him Who created you and the generations of the men of old."

versets.ar: 185. قَالُوا إِنَّمَا أَنتَ مِنَ الْمُسَحَّرِينَ ﴿185﴾
versets.fr: 185. Ils dirent: «Tu es certes du nombre des ensorcelés;
versets.en: 185. They said: "You are only one of those bewitched!

versets.ar: 186. وَمَا أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ ﴿186﴾
versets.fr: 186. Tu n'es qu'un homme comme nous; et vraiment nous pensons que tu es du nombre des menteurs.
versets.en: 186. "You are but a human being like us and verily, we think that you are one of the liars!

versets.ar: 187. فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًا مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ ﴿187﴾
versets.fr: 187. Fais donc tomber sur nous des morceaux du ciel si tu es du nombre des véridiques!»
versets.en: 187. "So cause a piece of the heaven to fall on us, if you are of the truthful!"

versets.ar: 188. قَالَ رَبِّي أَعْلَمُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ ﴿188﴾
versets.fr: 188. Il dit: «Mon Seigneur sait mieux ce que vous faites».
versets.en: 188. He said: "My Lord is the Best Knower of what you do."

versets.ar: 189. فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ الظُّلَّةِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ ﴿189﴾
versets.fr: 189. Mais ils le traitèrent de menteur. Alors, le châtiment du jour de l'Ombre les saisit. Ce fut le châtiment d'un jour terrible.
versets.en: 189. But they belied him, so the torment of the day of shadow (a gloomy cloud) seized them, indeed that was the torment of a Great Day.

versets.ar: 190. إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ ﴿190﴾
versets.fr: 190. Voilà bien là un prodige. Cependant, la plupart d'entre eux ne croient pas.
versets.en: 190. Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

versets.ar: 191. وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ ﴿191﴾
versets.fr: 191. Et ton Seigneur, c'est en vérité Lui le Tout Puissant, le Très Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 191. And verily! Your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

versets.ar: 192. وَإِنَّهُ لَتَنزِيلُ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿192﴾
versets.fr: 192. Ce (Coran) ci, c'est le Seigneur de l'univers qui l'a fait descendre,
versets.en: 192. And truly, this (the Quran) is a revelation from the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists),

versets.ar: 193. نَزَلَ بِهِ الرُّوحُ الْأَمِينُ ﴿193﴾
versets.fr: 193. et l'Esprit fidèle est descendu avec cela
versets.en: 193. Which the trustworthy Ruh [Jibrael (Gabriel)] has brought down;

versets.ar: 194. عَلَىٰ قَلْبِكَ لِتَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُنذِرِينَ ﴿194﴾
versets.fr: 194. sur ton cœur, pour que tu sois du nombre des avertisseurs,
versets.en: 194. Upon your heart (O Muhammad SAW) that you may be (one) of the warners,

versets.fr: 195. en une langue arabe très claire.
versets.en: 195. In the plain Arabic language.

versets.ar: 196. وَإِنَّهُ لَفِي زُبُرِ الْأَوَّلِينَ ﴿196﴾
versets.fr: 196. Et ceci était déjà mentionné dans les Ecrits des anciens (envoyés).
versets.en: 196. And verily, it (the Quran, and its revelation to Prophet Muhammad SAW) is (announced) in the Scriptures [i.e. the Taurat (Torah) and the Injeel (Gospel)] of former people.

versets.ar: 197. أَوَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُمْ آيَةً أَن يَعْلَمَهُ عُلَمَاءُ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ ﴿197﴾
versets.fr: 197. N'est-ce pas pour eux un signe, que les savants des Enfants d'Israël le sachent?
versets.en: 197. Is it not a sign to them that the learned scholars (like 'Abdullah bin Salam who embraced Islam) of the Children of Israel knew it (as true)?

versets.ar: 198. وَلَوْ نَزَّلْنَاهُ عَلَىٰ بَعْضِ الْأَعْجَمِينَ ﴿198﴾
versets.fr: 198. Si Nous l'avions fait descendre sur quelqu'un des non-Arabes,
versets.en: 198. And if We had revealed it (this Quran) unto any of the non-Arabs,

versets.ar: 199. فَقَرَأَهُ عَلَيْهِم مَّا كَانُوا بِهِ مُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿199﴾
versets.fr: 199. et que celui-ci le leur eut récité, ils n'y auraient pas cru.
versets.en: 199. And he had recited it unto them, they would not have believed in it.

versets.ar: 200. كَذَٰلِكَ سَلَكْنَاهُ فِي قُلُوبِ الْمُجْرِمِينَ ﴿200﴾
versets.fr: 200. Ainsi l'avons Nous fait pénétrer [le doute] dans les cœurs des criminels;
versets.en: 200. Thus have We caused it (the denial of the Quran) to enter the hearts of the Mujrimun (criminals, polytheists, sinners, etc.).

versets.ar: 201. لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ ﴿201﴾
versets.fr: 201. mais ils n'y [le Coran] croiront pas avant de voir le châtiment douloureux,
versets.en: 201. They will not believe in it until they see the painful torment;

versets.ar: 202. فَيَأْتِيَهُم بَغْتَةً وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ ﴿202﴾
versets.fr: 202. qui viendra sur eux soudain, sans qu'ils s'en rendent compte;
versets.en: 202. It shall come to them of a sudden, while they perceive it not;

versets.ar: 203. فَيَقُولُوا هَلْ نَحْنُ مُنظَرُونَ ﴿203﴾
versets.fr: 203. alors ils diront: «Est-ce qu'on va nous donner du répit?»
versets.en: 203. Then they will say: "Can we be respited?"

versets.ar: 204. أَفَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونَ ﴿204﴾
versets.fr: 204. Est-ce qu'ils cherchent à hâter Notre châtiment?
versets.en: 204. Would they then wish for Our Torment to be hastened on?

versets.ar: 205. أَفَرَأَيْتَ إِن مَّتَّعْنَاهُمْ سِنِينَ ﴿205﴾
versets.fr: 205. Vois-tu si Nous leur permettions de jouir, des années durant,
versets.en: 205. Tell Me, if We do let them enjoy for years,

versets.ar: 206. ثُمَّ جَاءَهُم مَّا كَانُوا يُوعَدُونَ ﴿206﴾
versets.fr: 206. et qu'ensuite leur arrive ce dont on les menaçait,
versets.en: 206. And afterwards comes to them that (punishment) which they had been promised!

versets.ar: 207. مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يُمَتَّعُونَ ﴿207﴾
versets.fr: 207. les jouissances qu'on leur a permises ne leur serviraient à rien.
versets.en: 207. All that with which they used to enjoy shall not avail them.

versets.ar: 208. وَمَا أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ ﴿208﴾
versets.fr: 208. Et Nous ne faisons pas périr de cité avant qu'elle n'ait eu des avertisseurs,
versets.en: 208. And never did We destroy a township, but it had its warners

versets.ar: 209. ذِكْرَىٰ وَمَا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ ﴿209﴾
versets.fr: 209. [à titre de] rappel, et Nous ne sommes pas injuste.
versets.en: 209. By way of reminder, and We have never been unjust.

versets.ar: 210. وَمَا تَنَزَّلَتْ بِهِ الشَّيَاطِينُ ﴿210﴾
versets.fr: 210. Et ce ne sont point les diables qui sont descendus avec ceci (le Coran):
versets.en: 210. And it is not the Shayatin (devils) who have brought it (this Quran) down,

versets.ar: 211. وَمَا يَنبَغِي لَهُمْ وَمَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ ﴿211﴾
versets.fr: 211. cela ne leur convient pas; et ils n'auraient pu le faire.
versets.en: 211. Neither would it suit them, nor they can (produce it).

versets.ar: 212. إِنَّهُمْ عَنِ السَّمْعِ لَمَعْزُولُونَ ﴿212﴾
versets.fr: 212. Car ils sont écartés de toute écoute (du message divin).
versets.en: 212. Verily, they have been removed far from hearing it.

versets.ar: 213. فَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُعَذَّبِينَ ﴿213﴾
versets.fr: 213. N'invoque donc pas une autre divinité avec Allah, sinon tu seras du nombre des châtiés.
versets.en: 213. So invoke not with Allah another ilah (god) lest you be among those who receive punishment.

versets.ar: 214. وَأَنذِرْ عَشِيرَتَكَ الْأَقْرَبِينَ ﴿214﴾
versets.fr: 214. Et avertis les gens qui te sont les plus proches.
versets.en: 214. And warn your tribe (O Muhammad SAW) of near kindred.

versets.ar: 215. وَاخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ اتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿215﴾
versets.fr: 215. Et abaisse ton aile [sois bienveillant] pour les croyants qui te suivent.
versets.en: 215. And be kind and humble to the believers who follow you.

versets.ar: 216. فَإِنْ عَصَوْكَ فَقُلْ إِنِّي بَرِيءٌ مِّمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ ﴿216﴾
versets.fr: 216. Mais s'ils te désobéissent, dis-leur: «Moi, je désavoue ce que vous faites».
versets.en: 216. Then if they disobey you, say: "I am innocent of what you do."

versets.ar: 217. وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى الْعَزِيزِ الرَّحِيمِ ﴿217﴾
versets.fr: 217. Et place ta confiance dans le Tout Puissant, le Très Miséricordieux,
versets.en: 217. And put your trust in the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful,

versets.ar: 218. الَّذِي يَرَاكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ ﴿218﴾
versets.fr: 218. qui te voit quand tu te lèves,
versets.en: 218. Who sees you (O Muhammad SAW) when you stand up (alone at night for Tahajjud prayers).

versets.ar: 219. وَتَقَلُّبَكَ فِي السَّاجِدِينَ ﴿219﴾
versets.fr: 219. et (voit) tes gestes parmi ceux qui se prosternent.
versets.en: 219. And your movements among those who fall prostrate (along with you to Allah in the five compulsory congregational prayers).

versets.ar: 220. إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ ﴿220﴾
versets.fr: 220. C'est Lui vraiment, l'Audient, l'Omniscient.
versets.en: 220. Verily! He, only He, is the All-Hearer, the All-Knower.

versets.ar: 221. هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ الشَّيَاطِينُ ﴿221﴾
versets.fr: 221. Vous apprendrai-Je sur qui les diables descendent?
versets.en: 221. Shall I inform you (O people!) upon whom the Shayatin (devils) descend?

versets.fr: 222. Ils descendent sur tout calomniateur, pécheur.
versets.en: 222. They descend on every lying (one who tells lies), sinful person.

versets.ar: 223. يُلْقُونَ السَّمْعَ وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ كَاذِبُونَ ﴿223﴾
versets.fr: 223. Ils tendent l'oreille... Cependant, la plupart d'entre eux sont menteurs.
versets.en: 223. Who gives ear (to the devils and they pour what they may have heard of the unseen from the angels), and most of them are liars.

versets.ar: 224. وَالشُّعَرَاءُ يَتَّبِعُهُمُ الْغَاوُونَ ﴿224﴾
versets.fr: 224. Et quant aux poètes, ce sont les égarés qui les suivent.
versets.en: 224. As for the poets, the erring follow them,

versets.ar: 225. أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِي كُلِّ وَادٍ يَهِيمُونَ ﴿225﴾
versets.fr: 225. Ne vois-tu pas qu'ils divaguent dans chaque vallée,
versets.en: 225. See you not that they speak about every subject (praising others right or wrong) in their poetry?

versets.ar: 226. وَأَنَّهُمْ يَقُولُونَ مَا لَا يَفْعَلُونَ ﴿226﴾
versets.fr: 226. et qu'ils disent ce qu'ils ne font pas?
versets.en: 226. And that they say what they do not do.

versets.ar: 227. إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَذَكَرُوا اللَّهَ كَثِيرًا وَانتَصَرُوا مِن بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا أَيَّ مُنقَلَبٍ يَنقَلِبُونَ ﴿227﴾
versets.fr: 227. à part ceux qui croient et font de bonnes œuvres, qui invoquent souvent le nom d'Allah et se défendent contre les torts qu'on leur fait. Les injustes verront bientôt le revirement qu'ils [éprouveront]!
versets.en: 227. Except those who believe (in the Oneness of Allah Islamic Monotheism), and do righteous deeds, and remember Allah much, and reply back (in poetry) to the unjust poetry (which the pagan poets utter against the Muslims). And those who do wrong will come to know by what overturning they will be overturned.

versets.ar: 1. طس ۚ تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْقُرْآنِ وَكِتَابٍ مُّبِينٍ ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. T'â, Sîn. Voici les versets du Coran et d'un Livre explicite,
versets.en: 1. Ta-Sin. [These letters are one of the miracles of the Quran, and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings]. These are the Verses of the Quran, and (it is) a Book (that makes things) clear;

versets.ar: 2. هُدًى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. un guide et une bonne annonce aux croyants,
versets.en: 2. A guide (to the Right Path); and glad tidings for the believers [who believe in the Oneness of Allah (i.e. Islamic Monotheism)].

versets.ar: 3. الَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ الصَّلَاةَ وَيُؤْتُونَ الزَّكَاةَ وَهُم بِالْآخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. qui accomplissent la Salât, acquittent la Zakât et croient avec certitude en l'au-delà.
versets.en: 3. Those who perform As-Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat) and give Zakat and they believe with certainty in the Hereafter (resurrection, recompense of their good and bad deeds, Paradise and Hell, etc.).

versets.ar: 4. إِنَّ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ زَيَّنَّا لَهُمْ أَعْمَالَهُمْ فَهُمْ يَعْمَهُونَ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Quant à ceux qui ne croient pas en l'au-delà, Nous embellissons [à leurs yeux] leurs actions, et alors ils deviennent confus et hésitants.
versets.en: 4. Verily, those who believe not in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds fair-seeming to them, so they wander about blindly.

versets.ar: 5. أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ لَهُمْ سُوءُ الْعَذَابِ وَهُمْ فِي الْآخِرَةِ هُمُ الْأَخْسَرُونَ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Ce sont eux qui subiront le pire châtiment, tandis qu'ils seront dans l'au-delà les plus grands perdants.
versets.en: 5. They are those for whom there will be an evil torment (in this world). And in the Hereafter they will be the greatest losers.

versets.ar: 6. وَإِنَّكَ لَتُلَقَّى الْقُرْآنَ مِن لَّدُنْ حَكِيمٍ عَلِيمٍ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Certes, c'est toi qui reçois le Coran, de la part d'un Sage, d'un Savant.
versets.en: 6. And verily, you (O Muhammad SAW) are receiving the Quran from the One, All-Wise, All-Knowing.

versets.ar: 7. إِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِأَهْلِهِ إِنِّي آنَسْتُ نَارًا سَآتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوْ آتِيكُم بِشِهَابٍ قَبَسٍ لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَصْطَلُونَ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. (Rappelle) quand Moïse dit à sa famille: «J'ai aperçu un feu; je vais vous en apporter des nouvelles, ou bien je vous apporterai un tison allumé afin que vous vous réchauffiez».
versets.en: 7. (Remember) when Musa (Moses) said to his household: "Verily! I have seen a fire, I will bring you from there some information, or I will bring you a burning brand, that you may warm yourselves."
