versets.en: 30. Alas for mankind! There never came a Messenger to them but they used to mock at him.

versets.ar: 31. أَلَمْ يَرَوْا كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّنَ الْقُرُونِ أَنَّهُمْ إِلَيْهِمْ لَا يَرْجِعُونَ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. Ne voient-ils pas combien de générations avant eux Nous avons fait périr? Lesquelles ne retourneront jamais parmi eux.
versets.en: 31. Do they not see how many of the generations We have destroyed before them? Verily, they will not return to them.

versets.ar: 32. وَإِن كُلٌّ لَّمَّا جَمِيعٌ لَّدَيْنَا مُحْضَرُونَ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. Et tous sans exception comparaîtront devant Nous.
versets.en: 32. And surely, all, everyone of them will be brought before Us.

versets.ar: 33. وَآيَةٌ لَّهُمُ الْأَرْضُ الْمَيْتَةُ أَحْيَيْنَاهَا وَأَخْرَجْنَا مِنْهَا حَبًّا فَمِنْهُ يَأْكُلُونَ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. Une preuve pour eux est la terre morte, à laquelle Nous redonnons la vie, et d'où Nous faisons sortir des grains dont ils mangent.
versets.en: 33. And a sign for them is the dead land. We gave it life, and We brought forth from it grains, so that they eat thereof.

versets.ar: 34. وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا جَنَّاتٍ مِّن نَّخِيلٍ وَأَعْنَابٍ وَفَجَّرْنَا فِيهَا مِنَ الْعُيُونِ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. Nous y avons mis des jardins de palmiers et de vignes et y avons fait jaillir des sources,
versets.en: 34. And We have made therein gardens of date-palms and grapes, and We have caused springs of water to gush forth therein.

versets.ar: 35. لِيَأْكُلُوا مِن ثَمَرِهِ وَمَا عَمِلَتْهُ أَيْدِيهِمْ ۖ أَفَلَا يَشْكُرُونَ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. afin qu'ils mangent de Ses fruits et de ce que leurs mains ont produit. Ne seront-ils pas reconnaissants?
versets.en: 35. So that they may eat of the fruit thereof, and their hands made it not. Will they not, then, give thanks?

versets.ar: 36. سُبْحَانَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ الْأَزْوَاجَ كُلَّهَا مِمَّا تُنبِتُ الْأَرْضُ وَمِنْ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَمِمَّا لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. Louange à Celui qui a créé tous les couples de ce que la terre fait pousser, d'eux-mêmes, et de ce qu'ils ne savent pas!
versets.en: 36. Glory be to Him, Who has created all the pairs of that which the earth produces, as well as of their own (human) kind (male and female), and of that which they know not.

versets.ar: 37. وَآيَةٌ لَّهُمُ اللَّيْلُ نَسْلَخُ مِنْهُ النَّهَارَ فَإِذَا هُم مُّظْلِمُونَ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. Et une preuve pour eux est la nuit. Nous en écorchons le jour et ils sont alors dans les ténèbres.
versets.en: 37. And a sign for them is the night, We withdraw therefrom the day, and behold, they are in darkness.

versets.ar: 38. وَالشَّمْسُ تَجْرِي لِمُسْتَقَرٍّ لَّهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ تَقْدِيرُ الْعَزِيزِ الْعَلِيمِ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. et le soleil court vers un gîte qui lui est assigné; telle est la détermination du Tout Puissant, de l'Omniscient.
versets.en: 38. And the sun runs on its fixed course for a term (appointed). That is the Decree of the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing.

versets.ar: 39. وَالْقَمَرَ قَدَّرْنَاهُ مَنَازِلَ حَتَّىٰ عَادَ كَالْعُرْجُونِ الْقَدِيمِ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. Et la lune, Nous lui avons déterminé des phases jusqu'à ce qu'elle devienne comme la palme vieillie.
versets.en: 39. And the moon, We have measured for it mansions (to traverse) till it returns like the old dried curved date stalk.

versets.ar: 40. لَا الشَّمْسُ يَنبَغِي لَهَا أَن تُدْرِكَ الْقَمَرَ وَلَا اللَّيْلُ سَابِقُ النَّهَارِ ۚ وَكُلٌّ فِي فَلَكٍ يَسْبَحُونَ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. Le soleil ne peut rattraper la lune, ni la nuit devancer le jour; et chacun vogue dans une orbite.
versets.en: 40. It is not for the sun to overtake the moon, nor does the night outstrip the day. They all float, each in an orbit.

versets.ar: 41. وَآيَةٌ لَّهُمْ أَنَّا حَمَلْنَا ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ فِي الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. Et un (autre) signe pour eux est que Nous avons transporté leur descendance sur le bateau chargé;
versets.en: 41. And an Ayah (sign) for them is that We bore their offspring in the laden ship [of Nuh (Noah)].

versets.ar: 42. وَخَلَقْنَا لَهُم مِّن مِّثْلِهِ مَا يَرْكَبُونَ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. et Nous leur créâmes des semblables sur lesquels ils montent.
versets.en: 42. And We have created for them of the like thereunto, so on them they ride.

versets.ar: 43. وَإِن نَّشَأْ نُغْرِقْهُمْ فَلَا صَرِيخَ لَهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنقَذُونَ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. Et si Nous le voulons, Nous les noyons; pour eux alors, pas de secoureur et ils ne seront pas sauvés,
versets.en: 43. And if We will, We shall drown them, and there will be no shout (or helper) for them (to hear their cry for help) nor will they be saved.

versets.ar: 44. إِلَّا رَحْمَةً مِّنَّا وَمَتَاعًا إِلَىٰ حِينٍ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. sauf par une miséricorde de Notre part, et à titre de jouissance pour un temps.
versets.en: 44. Unless it be a mercy from Us, and as an enjoyment for a while.

versets.ar: 45. وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ اتَّقُوا مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيكُمْ وَمَا خَلْفَكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. Et quand on leur dit: «Craignez ce qu'il y a devant vous et ce qu'il y a derrière vous afin que vous ayez la miséricorde»!...
versets.en: 45. And when it is said to them: "Beware of that which is before you (worldly torments), and that which is behind you (torments in the Hereafter), in order that you may receive Mercy (i.e. if you believe in Allah's Religion Islamic Monotheism, and avoid polytheism, and obey Allah with righteous deeds).

versets.ar: 46. وَمَا تَأْتِيهِم مِّنْ آيَةٍ مِّنْ آيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ إِلَّا كَانُوا عَنْهَا مُعْرِضِينَ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. Or, pas une preuve ne leur vient, parmi les preuves de leur Seigneur sans qu'ils ne s'en détournent.
versets.en: 46. And never came an Ayah from among the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) of their Lord to them, but they did turn away from it.

versets.ar: 47. وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ أَنفِقُوا مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ اللَّهُ قَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا أَنُطْعِمُ مَن لَّوْ يَشَاءُ اللَّهُ أَطْعَمَهُ إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. Et quand on leur dit: «Dépensez de ce qu'Allah vous a attribué», ceux qui ont mécru disent à ceux qui ont cru: «Nourrirons-nous quelqu'un qu'Allah aurait nourri s'Il l'avait voulu? Vous n'êtes que dans un égarement évident».
versets.en: 47. And when it is said to them: "Spend of that with which Allah has provided you," those who disbelieve say to those who believe: "Shall we feed those whom, if Allah willed, He (Himself) would have fed? You are only in a plain error."

versets.ar: 48. وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا الْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. Et ils disent: «A quand cette promesse si vous êtes véridiques?»
versets.en: 48. And they say: "When will this promise (i.e. Resurrection) be fulfilled, if you are truthful?"

versets.ar: 49. مَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً تَأْخُذُهُمْ وَهُمْ يَخِصِّمُونَ ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. Ils n'attendent qu'un seul Cri qui les saisira alors qu'ils seront en train de disputer.
versets.en: 49. They await only but a single Saihah (shout, etc.), which will seize them while they are disputing!

versets.ar: 50. فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ تَوْصِيَةً وَلَا إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِمْ يَرْجِعُونَ ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. Ils ne pourront donc ni faire de testament, ni retourner chez leurs familles.
versets.en: 50. Then they will not be able to make bequest, nor they will return to their family.

versets.ar: 51. وَنُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ فَإِذَا هُم مِّنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يَنسِلُونَ ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. Et on soufflera dans la Trompe, et voilà que, des tombes, ils se précipiteront vers leur Seigneur,
versets.en: 51. And the Trumpet will be blown (i.e. the second blowing) and behold! From the graves they will come out quickly to their Lord.

versets.ar: 52. قَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا مَن بَعَثَنَا مِن مَّرْقَدِنَا ۜ ۗ هَٰذَا مَا وَعَدَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ وَصَدَقَ الْمُرْسَلُونَ ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. en disant: «Malheur à nous! Qui nous a ressuscités de là où nous dormions?» C'est ce que le Tout Miséricordieux avait promis; et les Messagers avaient dit vrai.
versets.en: 52. They will say: "Woe to us! Who has raised us up from our place of sleep." (It will be said to them): "This is what the Most Beneficent (Allah) had promised, and the Messengers spoke truth!"

versets.ar: 53. إِن كَانَتْ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً فَإِذَا هُمْ جَمِيعٌ لَّدَيْنَا مُحْضَرُونَ ﴿53﴾
versets.fr: 53. Ce ne sera qu'un seul Cri, et voilà qu'ils seront tous amenés devant Nous.
versets.en: 53. It will be but a single Saihah (shout, etc.), so behold! They will all be brought up before Us!

versets.ar: 54. فَالْيَوْمَ لَا تُظْلَمُ نَفْسٌ شَيْئًا وَلَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ ﴿54﴾
versets.fr: 54. Ce jour-là, aucune âme ne sera lésée en rien. Et vous ne serez rétribués que selon ce que vous faisiez.
versets.en: 54. This Day (Day of Resurrection), none will be wronged in anything, nor will you be requited anything except that which you used to do.

versets.ar: 55. إِنَّ أَصْحَابَ الْجَنَّةِ الْيَوْمَ فِي شُغُلٍ فَاكِهُونَ ﴿55﴾
versets.fr: 55. Les gens du Paradis seront, ce jour-là, dans une occupation qui les remplit de bonheur;
versets.en: 55. Verily, the dwellers of the Paradise, that Day, will be busy in joyful things.

versets.ar: 56. هُمْ وَأَزْوَاجُهُمْ فِي ظِلَالٍ عَلَى الْأَرَائِكِ مُتَّكِئُونَ ﴿56﴾
versets.fr: 56. eux et leurs épouses sont sous des ombrages, accoudés sur les divans.
versets.en: 56. They and their wives will be in pleasant shade, reclining on thrones.

versets.ar: 57. لَهُمْ فِيهَا فَاكِهَةٌ وَلَهُم مَّا يَدَّعُونَ ﴿57﴾
versets.fr: 57. Là ils auront des fruits et ils auront ce qu'ils réclameront,
versets.en: 57. They will have therein fruits (of all kinds) and all that they ask for.

versets.ar: 58. سَلَامٌ قَوْلًا مِّن رَّبٍّ رَّحِيمٍ ﴿58﴾
versets.fr: 58. «Salâm» [paix et salut]! Parole de la part d'un Seigneur Très Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 58. (It will be said to them): Salamun (peace be on you), a Word from the Lord (Allah), Most Merciful.

versets.ar: 59. وَامْتَازُوا الْيَوْمَ أَيُّهَا الْمُجْرِمُونَ ﴿59﴾
versets.fr: 59. «O injustes! Tenez-vous à l'écart ce jour-là!
versets.en: 59. (It will be said): "And O you Al-Mujrimun (criminals, polytheists, sinners, disbelievers in the Islamic Monotheism, wicked evil ones, etc.)! Get you apart this Day (from the believers).

versets.ar: 60. ۞ أَلَمْ أَعْهَدْ إِلَيْكُمْ يَا بَنِي آدَمَ أَن لَّا تَعْبُدُوا الشَّيْطَانَ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّ مُّبِينٌ ﴿60﴾
versets.fr: 60. Ne vous ai-Je pas engagés, enfants d'Adam, à ne pas adorer le Diable? Car il est vraiment pour vous un ennemi déclaré,
versets.en: 60. Did I not ordain for you, O Children of Adam, that you should not worship Shaitan (Satan). Verily, he is a plain enemy to you.

versets.ar: 61. وَأَنِ اعْبُدُونِي ۚ هَٰذَا صِرَاطٌ مُّسْتَقِيمٌ ﴿61﴾
versets.fr: 61. et [ne vous ai-Je pas engagés] à M'adorer? Voilà un chemin bien droit.
versets.en: 61. And that you should worship Me [Alone Islamic Monotheism, and set up not rivals, associate-gods with Me]. That is a Straight Path.

versets.ar: 62. وَلَقَدْ أَضَلَّ مِنكُمْ جِبِلًّا كَثِيرًا ۖ أَفَلَمْ تَكُونُوا تَعْقِلُونَ ﴿62﴾
versets.fr: 62. Et il a très certainement égaré un grand nombre d'entre vous. Ne raisonniez-vous donc pas?
versets.en: 62. And indeed he (Satan) did lead astray a great multitude of you. Did you not, then, understand?

versets.ar: 63. هَٰذِهِ جَهَنَّمُ الَّتِي كُنتُمْ تُوعَدُونَ ﴿63﴾
versets.fr: 63. Voici l'Enfer qu'on vous promettait.
versets.en: 63. This is Hell which you were promised!

versets.ar: 64. اصْلَوْهَا الْيَوْمَ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَكْفُرُونَ ﴿64﴾
versets.fr: 64. Brûlez-y aujourd'hui, pour avoir mécru».
versets.en: 64. Burn therein this Day, for that you used to disbelieve.

versets.ar: 65. الْيَوْمَ نَخْتِمُ عَلَىٰ أَفْوَاهِهِمْ وَتُكَلِّمُنَا أَيْدِيهِمْ وَتَشْهَدُ أَرْجُلُهُم بِمَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ ﴿65﴾
versets.fr: 65. Ce jour-là, Nous scellerons leurs bouches, tandis que leurs mains Nous parleront et que leurs jambes témoigneront de ce qu'ils avaient accompli.
versets.en: 65. This Day, We shall seal up their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their legs will bear witness to what they used to earn. (It is said that one's left thigh will be the first to bear the witness). [Tafsir At-Tabari, Vol. 22, Page 24]

versets.ar: 66. وَلَوْ نَشَاءُ لَطَمَسْنَا عَلَىٰ أَعْيُنِهِمْ فَاسْتَبَقُوا الصِّرَاطَ فَأَنَّىٰ يُبْصِرُونَ ﴿66﴾
versets.fr: 66. Et si Nous voulions, Nous effacerions leurs yeux et ils courront vers le chemin. Mais comment alors pourront-ils voir?
versets.en: 66. And if it had been Our Will, We would surely have wiped out (blinded) their eyes, so that they would struggle for the Path, how then would they see?

versets.ar: 67. وَلَوْ نَشَاءُ لَمَسَخْنَاهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِهِمْ فَمَا اسْتَطَاعُوا مُضِيًّا وَلَا يَرْجِعُونَ ﴿67﴾
versets.fr: 67. Et si Nous voulions, Nous les métamorphoserions sur place; alors ils ne sauront ni avancer ni revenir.
versets.en: 67. And if it had been Our Will, We could have transformed them (into animals or lifeless objects) in their places. Then they should have been unable to go forward (move about) nor they could have turned back. [As it happened with the Jews see Verse 7:166 The Quran].

versets.ar: 68. وَمَن نُّعَمِّرْهُ نُنَكِّسْهُ فِي الْخَلْقِ ۖ أَفَلَا يَعْقِلُونَ ﴿68﴾
versets.fr: 68. A quiconque Nous accordons une longue vie, Nous faisons baisser sa forme. Ne comprendront-ils donc pas?
versets.en: 68. And he whom We grant long life, We reverse him in creation (weakness after strength). Will they not then understand?

versets.ar: 69. وَمَا عَلَّمْنَاهُ الشِّعْرَ وَمَا يَنبَغِي لَهُ ۚ إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ وَقُرْآنٌ مُّبِينٌ ﴿69﴾
versets.fr: 69. Nous ne lui (à Muhammad) avons pas enseigné la poésie; cela ne lui convient pas non plus. Ceci n'est qu'un rappel et une Lecture [Coran] claire,
versets.en: 69. And We have not taught him (Muhammad SAW) poetry, nor is it meet for him. This is only a Reminder and a plain Quran.

versets.ar: 70. لِّيُنذِرَ مَن كَانَ حَيًّا وَيَحِقَّ الْقَوْلُ عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ ﴿70﴾
versets.fr: 70. pour qu'il avertisse celui qui est vivant et que la Parole se réalise contre les mécréants.
versets.en: 70. That he or it (Muhammad SAW or the Quran) may give warning to him who is living (a healthy minded the believer), and that Word (charge) may be justified against the disbelievers (dead, as they reject the warnings).

versets.ar: 71. أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا أَنَّا خَلَقْنَا لَهُم مِّمَّا عَمِلَتْ أَيْدِينَا أَنْعَامًا فَهُمْ لَهَا مَالِكُونَ ﴿71﴾
versets.fr: 71. Ne voient-ils donc pas que, parmi ce que Nos mains ont fait, Nous leur avons créé des bestiaux dont ils sont propriétaires;
versets.en: 71. Do they not see that We have created for them of what Our Hands have created, the cattle, so that they are their owners.

versets.ar: 72. وَذَلَّلْنَاهَا لَهُمْ فَمِنْهَا رَكُوبُهُمْ وَمِنْهَا يَأْكُلُونَ ﴿72﴾
versets.fr: 72. et Nous les leur avons soumis: certains leur servent de monture et d'autres de nourriture;
versets.en: 72. And We have subdued them unto them so that some of them they have for riding and some they eat.

versets.ar: 73. وَلَهُمْ فِيهَا مَنَافِعُ وَمَشَارِبُ ۖ أَفَلَا يَشْكُرُونَ ﴿73﴾
versets.fr: 73. et ils en retirent d'autres utilités et des boissons. Ne seront-ils donc pas reconnaissants?
versets.en: 73. And they have (other) benefits from them (besides), and they get (milk) to drink, will they not then be grateful?

versets.ar: 74. وَاتَّخَذُوا مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ آلِهَةً لَّعَلَّهُمْ يُنصَرُونَ ﴿74﴾
versets.fr: 74. Et ils adoptèrent des divinités en dehors d'Allah, dans l'espoir d'être secourus...
versets.en: 74. And they have taken besides Allah aliha (gods), hoping that they might be helped (by those so called gods).

versets.ar: 75. لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ نَصْرَهُمْ وَهُمْ لَهُمْ جُندٌ مُّحْضَرُونَ ﴿75﴾
versets.fr: 75. Celles-ci ne pourront pas les secourir, elles formeront au contraire une armée dressée contre eux.
versets.en: 75. They cannot help them, but they will be brought forward as a troop against those who worshipped them (at the time of Reckoning).

versets.ar: 76. فَلَا يَحْزُنكَ قَوْلُهُمْ ۘ إِنَّا نَعْلَمُ مَا يُسِرُّونَ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ ﴿76﴾
versets.fr: 76. Que leurs paroles ne t'affligent donc pas! Nous savons ce qu'ils cachent et ce qu'ils divulguent.
versets.en: 76. So let not their speech, then, grieve you (O Muhammad SAW). Verily, We know what they conceal and what they reveal.

versets.ar: 77. أَوَلَمْ يَرَ الْإِنسَانُ أَنَّا خَلَقْنَاهُ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ فَإِذَا هُوَ خَصِيمٌ مُّبِينٌ ﴿77﴾
versets.fr: 77. L'homme ne voit-il pas que Nous l'avons créé d'une goutte de sperme? Et le voilà [devenu] un adversaire déclaré!
versets.en: 77. Does not man see that We have created him from Nutfah (mixed male and female discharge semen drops). Yet behold! He (stands forth) as an open opponent.

versets.ar: 78. وَضَرَبَ لَنَا مَثَلًا وَنَسِيَ خَلْقَهُ ۖ قَالَ مَن يُحْيِي الْعِظَامَ وَهِيَ رَمِيمٌ ﴿78﴾
versets.fr: 78. Il cite pour Nous un exemple, tandis qu'il oublie sa propre création; il dit: «Qui va redonner la vie à des ossements une fois réduits en poussière?»
versets.en: 78. And he puts forth for Us a parable, and forgets his own creation. He says: "Who will give life to these bones when they have rotted away and became dust?"

versets.ar: 79. قُلْ يُحْيِيهَا الَّذِي أَنشَأَهَا أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ ۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ خَلْقٍ عَلِيمٌ ﴿79﴾
versets.fr: 79. Dis: «Celui qui les a créés une première fois, leur redonnera la vie. Il Se connaît parfaitement à toute création.
versets.en: 79. Say: (O Muhammad SAW) "He will give life to them Who created them for the first time! And He is the All-Knower of every creation!"

versets.ar: 80. الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ الشَّجَرِ الْأَخْضَرِ نَارًا فَإِذَا أَنتُم مِّنْهُ تُوقِدُونَ ﴿80﴾
versets.fr: 80. c'est Lui qui, de l'arbre vert, a fait pour vous du feu, et voilà que de cela vous allumez.
versets.en: 80. He, Who produces for you fire out of the green tree, when behold! You kindle therewith.

versets.ar: 81. أَوَلَيْسَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ بِقَادِرٍ عَلَىٰ أَن يَخْلُقَ مِثْلَهُم ۚ بَلَىٰ وَهُوَ الْخَلَّاقُ الْعَلِيمُ ﴿81﴾
versets.fr: 81. Celui qui a créé les cieux et la terre ne sera-t-Il pas capable de créer leur pareil? Oh que si! et Il est le grand Créateur, l'Omniscient.
versets.en: 81. Is not He, Who created the heavens and the earth Able to create the like of them? Yes, indeed! He is the All-Knowing Supreme Creator.

versets.ar: 82. إِنَّمَا أَمْرُهُ إِذَا أَرَادَ شَيْئًا أَن يَقُولَ لَهُ كُن فَيَكُونُ ﴿82﴾
versets.fr: 82. Quand Il veut une chose, Son commandement consiste à dire: «Sois», et c'est.
versets.en: 82. Verily, His Command, when He intends a thing, is only that He says to it, "Be!" and it is!

versets.ar: 83. فَسُبْحَانَ الَّذِي بِيَدِهِ مَلَكُوتُ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ ﴿83﴾
versets.fr: 83. Louange donc, à Celui qui détient en Sa main la royauté sur toute chose! Et c'est vers Lui que vous serez ramenés.
versets.en: 83. So Glorified is He and Exalted above all that they associate with Him, and in Whose Hands is the dominion of all things, and to Him you shall be returned.

versets.ar: 1. وَالصَّافَّاتِ صَفًّا ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. Par ceux qui sont rangés en rangs.
versets.en: 1. By those (angels) ranged in ranks (or rows).

versets.ar: 2. فَالزَّاجِرَاتِ زَجْرًا ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Par ceux qui poussent (les nuages) avec force.
versets.en: 2. By those (angels) who drive the clouds in a good way.

versets.ar: 3. فَالتَّالِيَاتِ ذِكْرًا ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Par ceux qui récitent, en rappel:
versets.en: 3. By those (angels) who bring the Book and the Quran from Allah to mankind [Tafsir Ibn Kathir].

versets.ar: 4. إِنَّ إِلَٰهَكُمْ لَوَاحِدٌ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. «Votre Dieu est en vérité unique,
versets.en: 4. Verily your Ilah (God) is indeed One (i.e. Allah);

versets.ar: 5. رَّبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَرَبُّ الْمَشَارِقِ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. le Seigneur des cieux et de la terre et de ce qui existe entre eux et Seigneur des Levants»
versets.en: 5. Lord of the heavens and of the earth, and all that is between them, and Lord of every point of the sun's risings. (None has the right to be worshipped but Allah).

versets.ar: 6. إِنَّا زَيَّنَّا السَّمَاءَ الدُّنْيَا بِزِينَةٍ الْكَوَاكِبِ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Nous avons décoré le ciel le plus proche d'un décor: les étoiles,
versets.en: 6. Verily! We have adorned the near heaven with the stars (for beauty).

versets.ar: 7. وَحِفْظًا مِّن كُلِّ شَيْطَانٍ مَّارِدٍ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. afin de le protéger contre tout diable rebelle.
versets.en: 7. And to guard against every rebellious devil.

versets.ar: 8. لَّا يَسَّمَّعُونَ إِلَى الْمَلَإِ الْأَعْلَىٰ وَيُقْذَفُونَ مِن كُلِّ جَانِبٍ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Ils ne pourront être à l'écoute des dignitaires suprêmes [les Anges]; car ils seront harcelés de tout côté,
versets.en: 8. They cannot listen to the higher group (angels) for they are pelted from every side.

versets.ar: 9. دُحُورًا ۖ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ وَاصِبٌ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. et refoulés. Et ils auront un châtiment perpétuel.
versets.en: 9. Outcast, and theirs is a constant (or painful) torment.

versets.ar: 10. إِلَّا مَنْ خَطِفَ الْخَطْفَةَ فَأَتْبَعَهُ شِهَابٌ ثَاقِبٌ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Sauf celui qui saisit au vol quelque [information]; il est alors pourchassé par un météore transperçant.
versets.en: 10. Except such as snatch away something by stealing and they are pursued by a flaming fire of piercing brightness.

versets.ar: 11. فَاسْتَفْتِهِمْ أَهُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَم مَّنْ خَلَقْنَا ۚ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَاهُم مِّن طِينٍ لَّازِبٍ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. Demande-leur s'ils sont plus difficiles à créer que ceux que Nous avons créés? Car Nous les avons créés de boue collante!
versets.en: 11. Then ask them (i.e. these polytheists, O Muhammad SAW): "Are they stronger as creation, or those (others like the heavens and the earth and the mountains, etc.) whom We have created?" Verily, We created them of a sticky clay.

versets.ar: 12. بَلْ عَجِبْتَ وَيَسْخَرُونَ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. Mais tu t'étonnes, et ils se moquent!
versets.en: 12. Nay, you (O Muhammad SAW) wondered (at their insolence) while they mock (at you and at the Quran).

versets.ar: 13. وَإِذَا ذُكِّرُوا لَا يَذْكُرُونَ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. Et quand on le leur rappelle (le Coran), ils ne se rappellent pas;
versets.en: 13. And when they are reminded, they pay no attention.

versets.ar: 14. وَإِذَا رَأَوْا آيَةً يَسْتَسْخِرُونَ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. et quand ils voient un prodige, ils cherchent à s'en moquer,
versets.en: 14. And when they see an Ayah (a sign, a proof, or an evidence) from Allah, they mock at it.

versets.ar: 15. وَقَالُوا إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُّبِينٌ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. et disent: «Ceci n'est que magie évidente.
versets.en: 15. And they say: "This is nothing but evident magic!

versets.ar: 16. أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Lorsque nous serons morts et que nous deviendrons poussière et ossements, serons-nous ressuscités?
versets.en: 16. "When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we (then) verily be resurrected?

versets.ar: 17. أَوَآبَاؤُنَا الْأَوَّلُونَ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. ainsi que nos premiers ancêtres?»
versets.en: 17. "And also our fathers of old?"

versets.ar: 18. قُلْ نَعَمْ وَأَنتُمْ دَاخِرُونَ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. Dis: «Oui! et vous vous humilierez».
versets.en: 18. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "Yes, and you shall then be humiliated."

versets.ar: 19. فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجْرَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ فَإِذَا هُمْ يَنظُرُونَ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Il n'y aura qu'un seul Cri, et voilà qu'ils regarderont,
versets.en: 19. It will be a single Zajrah [shout (i.e. the second blowing of the Trumpet)], and behold, they will be staring!

versets.ar: 20. وَقَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا هَٰذَا يَوْمُ الدِّينِ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. et ils diront: «Malheur à nous! c'est le jour de la Rétribution».
versets.en: 20. They will say: "Woe to us! This is the Day of Recompense!"

versets.ar: 21. هَٰذَا يَوْمُ الْفَصْلِ الَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. «C'est le jour du Jugement que vous traitiez de mensonge».
versets.en: 21. (It will be said): "This is the Day of Judgement which you used to deny."

versets.ar: 22. ۞ احْشُرُوا الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا وَأَزْوَاجَهُمْ وَمَا كَانُوا يَعْبُدُونَ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. «Rassemblez les injustes et leurs épouses et tout ce qu'ils adoraient,
versets.en: 22. (It will be said to the angels): "Assemble those who did wrong, together with their companions (from the devils) and what they used to worship.

versets.ar: 23. مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ فَاهْدُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَاطِ الْجَحِيمِ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. en dehors d'Allah. Puis conduisez-les au chemin de la Fournaise.
versets.en: 23. "Instead of Allah, and lead them on to the way of flaming Fire (Hell);

versets.ar: 24. وَقِفُوهُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُم مَّسْئُولُونَ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Et arrêtez-les: car ils doivent être interrogés».
versets.en: 24. "But stop them, verily they are to be questioned.

versets.ar: 25. مَا لَكُمْ لَا تَنَاصَرُونَ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. «Pourquoi ne vous portez-vous pas secours mutuellement?»
versets.en: 25. "What is the matter with you? Why do you not help one another (as you used to do in the world)?"

versets.ar: 26. بَلْ هُمُ الْيَوْمَ مُسْتَسْلِمُونَ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Mais ce jour-là, ils seront complètement soumis,
versets.en: 26. Nay, but that Day they shall surrender,

versets.ar: 27. وَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. et les uns se tourneront vers les autres s'interrogeant mutuellement;
versets.en: 27. And they will turn to one another and question one another.

versets.ar: 28. قَالُوا إِنَّكُمْ كُنتُمْ تَأْتُونَنَا عَنِ الْيَمِينِ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Ils diront: «C'est vous qui nous forciez (à la mécréance)».
versets.en: 28. They will say: "It was you who used to come to us from the right side [i.e. from the right side of one of us and beautify for us every evil, order us for polytheism, and stop us from the truth i.e. Islamic Monotheism and from every good deed]."

versets.ar: 29. قَالُوا بَل لَّمْ تَكُونُوا مُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. «C'est vous plutôt (diront les chefs) qui ne vouliez pas croire.
versets.en: 29. They will reply: "Nay, you yourselves were not believers.

versets.ar: 30. وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَيْكُم مِّن سُلْطَانٍ ۖ بَلْ كُنتُمْ قَوْمًا طَاغِينَ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Et nous n'avions aucun pouvoir sur vous. C'est vous plutôt qui étiez des gens transgresseurs.
versets.en: 30. "And we had no authority over you. Nay! But you were transgressing people (disobedient, polytheists, and disbelievers).

versets.ar: 31. فَحَقَّ عَلَيْنَا قَوْلُ رَبِّنَا ۖ إِنَّا لَذَائِقُونَ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. La parole de notre Seigneur s'est donc réalisée contre nous; certes, nous allons goûter [au châtiment].
versets.en: 31. "So now the Word of our Lord has been justified against us, that we shall certainly (have to) taste (the torment).

versets.ar: 32. فَأَغْوَيْنَاكُمْ إِنَّا كُنَّا غَاوِينَ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. Nous vous avons induits en erreur car, en vérité, nous étions égarés nous-mêmes».
versets.en: 32. "So we led you astray because we were ourselves astray."

versets.ar: 33. فَإِنَّهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ فِي الْعَذَابِ مُشْتَرِكُونَ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. Ce jour-là donc, ils seront tous associés dans le châtiment.
versets.en: 33. Then verily, that Day, they will (all) share in the torment.

versets.ar: 34. إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَفْعَلُ بِالْمُجْرِمِينَ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. Ainsi traitons-Nous les criminels.
versets.en: 34. Certainly, that is how We deal with Al-Mujrimun (polytheists, sinners, criminals, the disobedient to Allah, etc.).

versets.ar: 35. إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا إِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Quand on leur disait: «Point de divinité à part Allah», ils se gonflaient d'orgueil,
versets.en: 35. Truly, when it was said to them: La ilaha ill-Allah "(none has the right to be worshipped but Allah)," they puffed themselves up with pride (i.e. denied it).

versets.ar: 36. وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُو آلِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٍ مَّجْنُونٍ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. et disaient: «Allons-nous abandonner nos divinités pour un poète fou?»
versets.en: 36. And (they) said: "Are we going to abandon our aliha (gods) for the sake of a mad poet?

versets.ar: 37. بَلْ جَاءَ بِالْحَقِّ وَصَدَّقَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. Il est plutôt venu avec la Vérité et il a confirmé les messagers (précédents).
versets.en: 37. Nay! he (Muhammad SAW) has come with the truth (i.e. Allah's Religion - Islamic Monotheism and this Quran) and he confirms the Messengers (before him who brought Allah's religion - Islamic Monotheism).

versets.ar: 38. إِنَّكُمْ لَذَائِقُو الْعَذَابِ الْأَلِيمِ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. Vous allez certes, goûter au châtiment douloureux.
versets.en: 38. Verily, you (pagans of Makkah) are going to taste the painful torment;

versets.ar: 39. وَمَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. Et vous ne serez rétribués que selon ce que vous œuvriez,
versets.en: 39. And you will be requited nothing except for what you used to do (evil deeds, sins, and Allah's disobedience which you used to do in this world);

versets.ar: 40. إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. sauf les serviteurs élus d'Allah,
versets.en: 40. Save the chosen slaves of Allah (faithful, obedient, true believers of Islamic Monotheism).

versets.ar: 41. أُولَٰئِكَ لَهُمْ رِزْقٌ مَّعْلُومٌ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. Ceux-là auront une rétribution bien connue:
versets.en: 41. For them there will be a known provision (in Paradise).

versets.ar: 42. فَوَاكِهُ ۖ وَهُم مُّكْرَمُونَ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. des fruits, et ils seront honorés,
versets.en: 42. Fruits; and they shall be honoured,

versets.ar: 43. فِي جَنَّاتِ النَّعِيمِ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. dans les Jardins du délice,
versets.en: 43. In the Gardens of delight (Paradise),

versets.ar: 44. عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مُّتَقَابِلِينَ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. sur des lits, face à face.
versets.en: 44. Facing one another on thrones,

versets.ar: 45. يُطَافُ عَلَيْهِم بِكَأْسٍ مِّن مَّعِينٍ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. On fera circuler entre eux une coupe d'eau remplie à une source
versets.en: 45. Round them will be passed a cup of pure wine;

versets.ar: 46. بَيْضَاءَ لَذَّةٍ لِّلشَّارِبِينَ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. blanche, savoureuse à boire,
versets.en: 46. White, delicious to the drinkers,

versets.ar: 47. لَا فِيهَا غَوْلٌ وَلَا هُمْ عَنْهَا يُنزَفُونَ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. Elle n'offusquera point leur raison et ne les enivrera pas.
versets.en: 47. Neither they will have Ghoul (any kind of hurt, abdominal pain, headache, a sin, etc.) from that, nor will they suffer intoxication therefrom.

versets.ar: 48. وَعِندَهُمْ قَاصِرَاتُ الطَّرْفِ عِينٌ ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. Et Ils auront auprès d'eux des belles aux grands yeux, au regard chaste,
versets.en: 48. And with them will be chaste females, restraining their glances (desiring none except their husbands), with wide and beautiful eyes.

versets.fr: 49. semblables au blanc bien préservé de l'œuf.
versets.en: 49. (Delicate and pure) as if they were (hidden) eggs (well) preserved.

versets.ar: 50. فَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. Puis les uns se tourneront vers les autres s'interrogeant mutuellement.
versets.en: 50. Then they will turn to one another, mutually questioning.

versets.ar: 51. قَالَ قَائِلٌ مِّنْهُمْ إِنِّي كَانَ لِي قَرِينٌ ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. L'un d'eux dira: «J'avais un compagnon
versets.en: 51. A speaker of them will say: "Verily, I had a companion (in the world),

versets.ar: 52. يَقُولُ أَإِنَّكَ لَمِنَ الْمُصَدِّقِينَ ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. qui disait: «Es-tu vraiment de ceux qui croient?
versets.en: 52. Who used to say: "Are you among those who believe (in resurrection after death).

versets.ar: 53. أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ ﴿53﴾
versets.fr: 53. Est-ce que quand nous mourrons et serons poussière et ossements, nous aurons à rendre des comptes?»
versets.en: 53. "(That) when we die and become dust and bones, shall we indeed (be raised up) to receive reward or punishment (according to our deeds)?"

versets.ar: 54. قَالَ هَلْ أَنتُم مُّطَّلِعُونَ ﴿54﴾
versets.fr: 54. Il dira: «Est-ce que vous voudriez regarder d'en haut?»
versets.en: 54. (The man) said: "Will you look down?"

versets.ar: 55. فَاطَّلَعَ فَرَآهُ فِي سَوَاءِ الْجَحِيمِ ﴿55﴾
versets.fr: 55. Alors il regardera d'en haut et il le verra en plein dans la Fournaise,
versets.en: 55. So he looked down and saw him in the midst of the Fire.

versets.ar: 56. قَالَ تَاللَّهِ إِن كِدتَّ لَتُرْدِينِ ﴿56﴾
versets.fr: 56. et dira: «Par Allah! Tu as bien failli causer ma perte!
versets.en: 56. He said: "By Allah! You have nearly ruined me.

versets.ar: 57. وَلَوْلَا نِعْمَةُ رَبِّي لَكُنتُ مِنَ الْمُحْضَرِينَ ﴿57﴾
versets.fr: 57. et sans le bienfait de mon Seigneur, j'aurais certainement été du nombre de ceux qu'on traîne [au supplice].
versets.en: 57. "Had it not been for the Grace of my Lord, I would certainly have been among those brought forth (to Hell)."

versets.ar: 58. أَفَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَيِّتِينَ ﴿58﴾
versets.fr: 58. N'est-il pas vrai que nous ne mourrons
versets.en: 58. (Allah informs about that true believer that he said): "Are we then not to die (any more)?

versets.ar: 59. إِلَّا مَوْتَتَنَا الْأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ ﴿59﴾
versets.fr: 59. que de notre première mort et que nous ne serons pas châtiés?»
versets.en: 59. "Except our first death, and we shall not be punished? (after we have entered Paradise)."

versets.ar: 60. إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ ﴿60﴾
versets.fr: 60. C'est cela, certes, le grand succès.
versets.en: 60. Truly, this is the supreme success!

versets.ar: 61. لِمِثْلِ هَٰذَا فَلْيَعْمَلِ الْعَامِلُونَ ﴿61﴾
versets.fr: 61. C'est pour une chose pareille que doivent ouvrer ceux qui ouvrent.
versets.en: 61. For the like of this let the workers work.

versets.ar: 62. أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ نُّزُلًا أَمْ شَجَرَةُ الزَّقُّومِ ﴿62﴾
versets.fr: 62. Est-ce que ceci est meilleur comme séjour, ou l'arbre de Zaqqûm?
versets.en: 62. Is that (Paradise) better entertainment or the tree of Zaqqum (a horrible tree in Hell)?

versets.ar: 63. إِنَّا جَعَلْنَاهَا فِتْنَةً لِّلظَّالِمِينَ ﴿63﴾
versets.fr: 63. Nous l'avons assigné en épreuve aux injustes.
versets.en: 63. Truly We have made it (as) a trail for the Zalimun (polytheists, disbelievers, wrong-doers, etc.).

versets.ar: 64. إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٌ تَخْرُجُ فِي أَصْلِ الْجَحِيمِ ﴿64﴾
versets.fr: 64. C'est un arbre qui sort du fond de la Fournaise.
versets.en: 64. Verily, it is a tree that springs out of the bottom of Hell-fire,

versets.ar: 65. طَلْعُهَا كَأَنَّهُ رُءُوسُ الشَّيَاطِينِ ﴿65﴾
versets.fr: 65. Ses fruits sont comme des têtes de diables.
versets.en: 65. The shoots of its fruit-stalks are like the heads of Shayatin (devils);

versets.ar: 66. فَإِنَّهُمْ لَآكِلُونَ مِنْهَا فَمَالِئُونَ مِنْهَا الْبُطُونَ ﴿66﴾
versets.fr: 66. Ils doivent certainement en manger et ils doivent s'en remplir le ventre.
versets.en: 66. Truly, they will eat thereof and fill their bellies therewith.

versets.ar: 67. ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمْ عَلَيْهَا لَشَوْبًا مِّنْ حَمِيمٍ ﴿67﴾
versets.fr: 67. Ensuite ils auront par-dessus une mixture d'eau bouillante.
versets.en: 67. Then on the top of that they will be given boiling water to drink so that it becomes a mixture (of boiling water and Zaqqum in their bellies).

versets.ar: 68. ثُمَّ إِنَّ مَرْجِعَهُمْ لَإِلَى الْجَحِيمِ ﴿68﴾
versets.fr: 68. Puis leur retour sera vers la Fournaise.
versets.en: 68. Then thereafter, verily, their return is to the flaming fire of Hell.

versets.ar: 69. إِنَّهُمْ أَلْفَوْا آبَاءَهُمْ ضَالِّينَ ﴿69﴾
versets.fr: 69. C'est qu'ils ont trouvé leurs ancêtres dans l'égarement,
versets.en: 69. Verily, they found their fathers on the wrong path;

versets.ar: 70. فَهُمْ عَلَىٰ آثَارِهِمْ يُهْرَعُونَ ﴿70﴾
versets.fr: 70. et les voilà courant sur leurs traces.
versets.en: 70. So they (too) made haste to follow in their footsteps!

versets.ar: 71. وَلَقَدْ ضَلَّ قَبْلَهُمْ أَكْثَرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ ﴿71﴾
versets.fr: 71. En effet, avant eux, la plupart des anciens se sont égarés.
versets.en: 71. And indeed most of the men of old went astray before them;

versets.ar: 72. وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا فِيهِم مُّنذِرِينَ ﴿72﴾
versets.fr: 72. Et Nous avions certes envoyé parmi eux des avertisseurs.
versets.en: 72. And indeed We sent among them warners (Messengers);

versets.ar: 73. فَانظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُنذَرِينَ ﴿73﴾
versets.fr: 73. Regarde donc ce qu'il est advenu de ceux qui ont été avertis!
versets.en: 73. Then see what was the end of those who were warned (but heeded not).

versets.ar: 74. إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ ﴿74﴾
versets.fr: 74. Exception faite des élus, parmi les serviteurs d'Allah:
versets.en: 74. Except the chosen slaves of Allah (faithful, obedient, and true believers of Islamic Monotheism).

versets.ar: 75. وَلَقَدْ نَادَانَا نُوحٌ فَلَنِعْمَ الْمُجِيبُونَ ﴿75﴾
versets.fr: 75. Noé, en effet, fit appel à Nous qui sommes le Meilleur Répondeur (qui exauce les prières).
versets.en: 75. And indeed Nuh (Noah) invoked Us, and We are the Best of those who answer (the request).

versets.ar: 76. وَنَجَّيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ مِنَ الْكَرْبِ الْعَظِيمِ ﴿76﴾
versets.fr: 76. Et Nous le sauvâmes, lui et sa famille, de la grande angoisse,
versets.en: 76. And We rescued him and his family from the great distress (i.e. drowning),

versets.ar: 77. وَجَعَلْنَا ذُرِّيَّتَهُ هُمُ الْبَاقِينَ ﴿77﴾
versets.fr: 77. et Nous fîmes de sa descendance les seuls survivants.
versets.en: 77. And, his progeny, them We made the survivors (i.e. Shem, Ham and Japheth).

versets.ar: 78. وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ فِي الْآخِرِينَ ﴿78﴾
versets.fr: 78. et Nous avons perpétué son souvenir dans la postérité,
versets.en: 78. And left for him (a goodly remembrance) among generations to come in later times:

versets.ar: 79. سَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ نُوحٍ فِي الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿79﴾
versets.fr: 79. Paix sur Noé dans tout l'univers!
versets.en: 79. Salamun (peace) be upon Nuh (Noah) (from Us) among the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists)!"

versets.ar: 80. إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ ﴿80﴾
versets.fr: 80. Ainsi récompensons-Nous les bienfaisants.
versets.en: 80. Verily, thus We reward the Muhsinun (good-doers - see V. 2:112).

versets.ar: 81. إِنَّهُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿81﴾
versets.fr: 81. Il était, certes, un de Nos serviteurs croyants.
versets.en: 81. Verily, he [Nuh (Noah)] was one of Our believing slaves.

versets.ar: 82. ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا الْآخَرِينَ ﴿82﴾
versets.fr: 82. Ensuite Nous noyâmes les autres.
versets.en: 82. Then We drowned the other (disbelievers and polytheists, etc.).

versets.ar: 83. ۞ وَإِنَّ مِن شِيعَتِهِ لَإِبْرَاهِيمَ ﴿83﴾
versets.fr: 83. Du nombre de ses coreligionnaires, certes, fut Abraham.
versets.en: 83. And, verily, among those who followed his [Nuh's (Noah)] way (Islamic Monotheism) was Ibrahim (Abraham).

versets.ar: 84. إِذْ جَاءَ رَبَّهُ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ ﴿84﴾
versets.fr: 84. Quand il vint à son Seigneur avec un cœur sain.
versets.en: 84. When he came to his Lord with a pure heart [attached to Allah Alone and none else, worshipping none but Allah Alone true Islamic Monotheism, pure from the filth of polytheism].

versets.ar: 85. إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ مَاذَا تَعْبُدُونَ ﴿85﴾
versets.fr: 85. Quand il dit à son père et à son peuple: «Qu'est-ce que vous adorez?»
versets.en: 85. When he said to his father and to his people: "What is it that which you worship?

versets.ar: 86. أَئِفْكًا آلِهَةً دُونَ اللَّهِ تُرِيدُونَ ﴿86﴾
versets.fr: 86. Cherchez-vous dans votre égarement, des divinités en dehors d'Allah?
versets.en: 86. "Is it a falsehood aliha (gods) other than Allah that you seek?

versets.ar: 87. فَمَا ظَنُّكُم بِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿87﴾
versets.fr: 87. Que pensez-vous du Seigneur de l'univers?»
versets.en: 87. "Then what do you think about the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns, and all that exists)?"

versets.ar: 88. فَنَظَرَ نَظْرَةً فِي النُّجُومِ ﴿88﴾
versets.fr: 88. Puis, il jeta un regard attentif sur les étoiles,
versets.en: 88. Then he cast a glance at the stars (to deceive them),

versets.ar: 89. فَقَالَ إِنِّي سَقِيمٌ ﴿89﴾
versets.fr: 89. et dit: «Je suis malade».
versets.en: 89. And he said: "Verily, I am sick (with plague. He did this trick to remain in their temple of idols to destroy them and not to accompany them to the pagan's feast)."

versets.ar: 90. فَتَوَلَّوْا عَنْهُ مُدْبِرِينَ ﴿90﴾
versets.fr: 90. Ils lui tournèrent le dos et s'en allèrent.
versets.en: 90. So they turned away from him, and departed (for fear of the disease).

versets.ar: 91. فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰ آلِهَتِهِمْ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ ﴿91﴾
versets.fr: 91. Alors il se glissa vers leurs divinités et dit: «Ne mangez-vous pas?
versets.en: 91. Then he turned to their aliha (gods) and said: "Will you not eat (of the offering before you)?

versets.ar: 92. مَا لَكُمْ لَا تَنطِقُونَ ﴿92﴾
versets.fr: 92. Qu'avez-vous à ne pas parler?»
versets.en: 92. "What is the matter with you that you speak not?"

versets.ar: 93. فَرَاغَ عَلَيْهِمْ ضَرْبًا بِالْيَمِينِ ﴿93﴾
versets.fr: 93. Puis il se mit furtivement à les frapper de sa main droite.
versets.en: 93. Then he turned upon them, striking (them) with (his) right hand.

versets.ar: 94. فَأَقْبَلُوا إِلَيْهِ يَزِفُّونَ ﴿94﴾
versets.fr: 94. Alors [les gens] vinrent à lui en courant.
versets.en: 94. Then they (the worshippers of idols) came, towards him, hastening.

versets.ar: 95. قَالَ أَتَعْبُدُونَ مَا تَنْحِتُونَ ﴿95﴾
versets.fr: 95. Il [leur] dit: «Adorez-vous ce que vous-mêmes sculptez,
versets.en: 95. He said: "Worship you that which you (yourselves) carve?

versets.ar: 96. وَاللَّهُ خَلَقَكُمْ وَمَا تَعْمَلُونَ ﴿96﴾
versets.fr: 96. alors que c'est Allah qui vous a créés, vous et ce que vous fabriquez?»
versets.en: 96. "While Allah has created you and what you make!"

versets.ar: 97. قَالُوا ابْنُوا لَهُ بُنْيَانًا فَأَلْقُوهُ فِي الْجَحِيمِ ﴿97﴾
versets.fr: 97. Ils dirent: «Qu'on lui construise un four et qu'on le lance dans la fournaise!»
versets.en: 97. They said: "Build for him a building (it is said that the building was like a furnace) and throw him into the blazing fire!"

versets.ar: 98. فَأَرَادُوا بِهِ كَيْدًا فَجَعَلْنَاهُمُ الْأَسْفَلِينَ ﴿98﴾
versets.fr: 98. Ils voulurent lui jouer un mauvais tour; mais ce sont eux que Nous mîmes à bas.
versets.en: 98. So they plotted a plot against him, but We made them the lowest.

versets.ar: 99. وَقَالَ إِنِّي ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّي سَيَهْدِينِ ﴿99﴾
versets.fr: 99. Et il dit: «Moi, je pars vers mon Seigneur et Il me guidera.
versets.en: 99. And he said (after his rescue from the fire): "Verily, I am going to my Lord. He will guide me!"

versets.ar: 100. رَبِّ هَبْ لِي مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ ﴿100﴾
versets.fr: 100. Seigneur, fais-moi don d'une [progéniture] d'entre les vertueux».
versets.en: 100. "My Lord! Grant me (offspring) from the righteous."

versets.ar: 101. فَبَشَّرْنَاهُ بِغُلَامٍ حَلِيمٍ ﴿101﴾
versets.fr: 101. Nous lui fîmes donc la bonne annonce d'un garçon (Ismaël) longanime.
versets.en: 101. So We gave him the glad tidings of a forbearing boy.

versets.ar: 102. فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ السَّعْيَ قَالَ يَا بُنَيَّ إِنِّي أَرَىٰ فِي الْمَنَامِ أَنِّي أَذْبَحُكَ فَانظُرْ مَاذَا تَرَىٰ ۚ قَالَ يَا أَبَتِ افْعَلْ مَا تُؤْمَرُ ۖ سَتَجِدُنِي إِن شَاءَ اللَّهُ مِنَ الصَّابِرِينَ ﴿102﴾
versets.fr: 102. Puis quand celui-ci fut en âge de l'accompagner, [Abraham] dit: «O mon fils, je me vois en songe en train de t'immoler. Vois donc ce que tu en penses». (Ismaël) dit: «O mon cher père, fais ce qui t'es commandé: tu me trouveras, s'il plaît à Allah, du nombre des endurants».
versets.en: 102. And, when he (his son) was old enough to walk with him, he said: "O my son! I have seen in a dream that I am slaughtering you (offer you in sacrifice to Allah), so look what you think!" He said: "O my father! Do that which you are commanded, Insha' Allah (if Allah will), you shall find me of As-Sabirin (the patient ones, etc.)."

versets.ar: 103. فَلَمَّا أَسْلَمَا وَتَلَّهُ لِلْجَبِينِ ﴿103﴾
versets.fr: 103. Puis quand tous deux se furent soumis (à l'ordre d'Allah) et qu'il l'eut jeté sur le front,
versets.en: 103. Then, when they had both submitted themselves (to the Will of Allah), and he had laid him prostrate on his forehead (or on the side of his forehead for slaughtering);

versets.ar: 104. وَنَادَيْنَاهُ أَن يَا إِبْرَاهِيمُ ﴿104﴾
versets.fr: 104. voilà que Nous l'appelâmes «Abraham!
versets.en: 104. And We called out to him: "O Abraham!

versets.ar: 105. قَدْ صَدَّقْتَ الرُّؤْيَا ۚ إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ ﴿105﴾
versets.fr: 105. Tu as confirmé la vision. C'est ainsi que Nous récompensons les bienfaisants».
versets.en: 105. You have fulfilled the dream (vision)!" Verily! Thus do We reward the Muhsinun (good-doers - see V. 2:112).

versets.ar: 106. إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ الْبَلَاءُ الْمُبِينُ ﴿106﴾
versets.fr: 106. C'était là certes, l'épreuve manifeste.
versets.en: 106. Verily, that indeed was a manifest trial

versets.ar: 107. وَفَدَيْنَاهُ بِذِبْحٍ عَظِيمٍ ﴿107﴾
versets.fr: 107. Et Nous le rançonnâmes d'une immolation généreuse.
versets.en: 107. And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice (i.e. a ram);

versets.ar: 108. وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ فِي الْآخِرِينَ ﴿108﴾
versets.fr: 108. Et Nous perpétuâmes son renom dans la postérité:
versets.en: 108. And We left for him (a goodly remembrance) among generations (to come) in later times.

versets.ar: 109. سَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ إِبْرَاهِيمَ ﴿109﴾
versets.fr: 109. «Paix sur Abraham».
versets.en: 109. Salamun (peace) be upon Ibrahim (Abraham)!"

versets.ar: 110. كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ ﴿110﴾
versets.fr: 110. Ainsi récompensons-Nous les bienfaisants;
versets.en: 110. Thus indeed do We reward the Muhsinun (good-doers - see V. 2:112).

versets.ar: 111. إِنَّهُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿111﴾
versets.fr: 111. car il était de Nos serviteurs croyants.
versets.en: 111. Verily, he was one of Our believing slaves.

versets.ar: 112. وَبَشَّرْنَاهُ بِإِسْحَاقَ نَبِيًّا مِّنَ الصَّالِحِينَ ﴿112﴾
versets.fr: 112. Nous lui fîmes la bonne annonce d'Isaac comme prophète d'entre les gens vertueux.
versets.en: 112. And We gave him the glad tidings of Ishaque (Isaac) a Prophet from the righteous.

versets.ar: 113. وَبَارَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ وَعَلَىٰ إِسْحَاقَ ۚ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحْسِنٌ وَظَالِمٌ لِّنَفْسِهِ مُبِينٌ ﴿113﴾
versets.fr: 113. Et Nous le bénîmes ainsi que Isaac. Parmi leurs descendances il y a [l'homme] de bien et celui qui est manifestement injuste envers lui-même.
versets.en: 113. We blessed him and Ishaque (Isaac), and of their progeny are (some) that do right, and some that plainly wrong themselves.

versets.ar: 114. وَلَقَدْ مَنَنَّا عَلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ ﴿114﴾
versets.fr: 114. Et Nous accordâmes certes à Moïse et Aaron des faveurs,
versets.en: 114. And, indeed We gave Our Grace to Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron).

versets.ar: 115. وَنَجَّيْنَاهُمَا وَقَوْمَهُمَا مِنَ الْكَرْبِ الْعَظِيمِ ﴿115﴾
versets.fr: 115. Et les sauvâmes ainsi que leur peuple, de la grande angoisse,
versets.en: 115. And We saved them and their people from the great distress;

versets.ar: 116. وَنَصَرْنَاهُمْ فَكَانُوا هُمُ الْغَالِبِينَ ﴿116﴾
versets.fr: 116. et les secourûmes, et ils furent eux les vainqueurs.
versets.en: 116. And helped them, so that they became the victors;

versets.ar: 117. وَآتَيْنَاهُمَا الْكِتَابَ الْمُسْتَبِينَ ﴿117﴾
versets.fr: 117. Et Nous leur apportâmes le livre explicite
versets.en: 117. And We gave them the clear Scripture;

versets.ar: 118. وَهَدَيْنَاهُمَا الصِّرَاطَ الْمُسْتَقِيمَ ﴿118﴾
versets.fr: 118. et les guidâmes vers le droit chemin.
versets.en: 118. And guided them to the Right Path;

versets.ar: 119. وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِمَا فِي الْآخِرِينَ ﴿119﴾
versets.fr: 119. Et Nous perpétuâmes leur renom dans la postérité:
versets.en: 119. And We left for them (a goodly remembrance) among generations (to come) in later times;

versets.ar: 120. سَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ ﴿120﴾
versets.fr: 120. «Paix sur Moïse et Aaron»
versets.en: 120. Salamun (peace) be upon Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron)!"

versets.ar: 121. إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ ﴿121﴾
versets.fr: 121. Ainsi récompensons-Nous les bienfaisants;
versets.en: 121. Verily, thus do We reward the Muhsinun (good-doers - see V. 2:112).

versets.ar: 122. إِنَّهُمَا مِنْ عِبَادِنَا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿122﴾
versets.fr: 122. car ils étaient du nombre de Nos serviteurs croyants.
versets.en: 122. Verily! They were two of Our believing slaves.

versets.ar: 123. وَإِنَّ إِلْيَاسَ لَمِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ ﴿123﴾
versets.fr: 123. Elie était, certes, du nombre des Messagers.
versets.en: 123. And verily, Iliyas (Elias) was one of the Messengers.

versets.ar: 124. إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ ﴿124﴾
versets.fr: 124. Quand il dit à son peuple: «Ne craignez-vous pas [Allah]?»
versets.en: 124. When he said to his people: "Will you not fear Allah?

versets.ar: 125. أَتَدْعُونَ بَعْلًا وَتَذَرُونَ أَحْسَنَ الْخَالِقِينَ ﴿125﴾
versets.fr: 125. Invoquerez-vous Ball (une idole) et délaisserez-vous le Meilleur des créateurs,
versets.en: 125. "Will you call upon Ba'l (a well- known idol of his nation whom they used to worship) and forsake the Best of creators,

versets.ar: 126. اللَّهَ رَبَّكُمْ وَرَبَّ آبَائِكُمُ الْأَوَّلِينَ ﴿126﴾
versets.fr: 126. Allah, votre Seigneur et le Seigneur de vos plus anciens ancêtres?»
versets.en: 126. "Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers?"

versets.ar: 127. فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَإِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ ﴿127﴾
versets.fr: 127. Ils le traitèrent de menteur. Et bien, ils seront emmenées (au châtiment).
versets.en: 127. But they denied him [Iliyas (Elias)], so they will certainly be brought forth (to the punishment),

versets.ar: 128. إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ ﴿128﴾
versets.fr: 128. Exception faite des serviteurs élus d'Allah.
versets.en: 128. Except the chosen slaves of Allah.

versets.ar: 129. وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ فِي الْآخِرِينَ ﴿129﴾
versets.fr: 129. Et Nous perpétuâmes son renom dans la postérité:
versets.en: 129. And We left for him (a goodly remembrance) among generations (to come) in later times;

versets.ar: 130. سَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ إِلْ يَاسِينَ ﴿130﴾
versets.fr: 130. «Paix sur Elie et ses adeptes».
versets.en: 130. Salamun (peace) be upon Ilyasin (Elias)!"

versets.ar: 131. إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ ﴿131﴾
versets.fr: 131. Ainsi récompensons-Nous les bienfaisants,
versets.en: 131. Verily, thus do We reward the Muhsinun (good-doers, who perform good deeds totally for Allah's sake only - see V. 2:112).

versets.ar: 132. إِنَّهُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿132﴾
versets.fr: 132. car il était du nombre de Nos serviteurs croyants.
versets.en: 132. Verily, he was one of Our believing slaves.

versets.ar: 133. وَإِنَّ لُوطًا لَّمِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ ﴿133﴾
versets.fr: 133. Et Loût était, certes, du nombre des Messagers.
versets.en: 133. And verily, Lout (Lot) was one of the Messengers.

versets.ar: 134. إِذْ نَجَّيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ أَجْمَعِينَ ﴿134﴾
versets.fr: 134. Quand Nous le sauvâmes, lui et sa famille, tout entière,
versets.en: 134. When We saved him and his family, all,

versets.ar: 135. إِلَّا عَجُوزًا فِي الْغَابِرِينَ ﴿135﴾
versets.fr: 135. sauf une vieille femme qui devait disparaître avec les autres,
versets.en: 135. Except an old woman (his wife) who was among those who remained behind.

versets.ar: 136. ثُمَّ دَمَّرْنَا الْآخَرِينَ ﴿136﴾
versets.fr: 136. Et Nous détruisîmes les autres
versets.en: 136. Then We destroyed the rest [i.e. the towns of Sodom at the place of the Dead Sea (now) in Palestine]. [See the "Book of History" by Ibn Kathir].

versets.ar: 137. وَإِنَّكُمْ لَتَمُرُّونَ عَلَيْهِم مُّصْبِحِينَ ﴿137﴾
versets.fr: 137. Et vous passez certainement auprès d'eux le matin
versets.en: 137. Verily, you pass by them in the morning.

versets.ar: 138. وَبِاللَّيْلِ ۗ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ ﴿138﴾
versets.fr: 138. et la nuit. Ne raisonnez-vous donc pas?
versets.en: 138. And at night; will you not then reflect?

versets.ar: 139. وَإِنَّ يُونُسَ لَمِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ ﴿139﴾
versets.fr: 139. Jonas était certes, du nombre des Messagers.
versets.en: 139. And, verily, Yunus (Jonah) was one of the Messengers.

versets.ar: 140. إِذْ أَبَقَ إِلَى الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ ﴿140﴾
versets.fr: 140. Quand il s'enfuit vers le bateau comble,
versets.en: 140. When he ran to the laden ship,

versets.ar: 141. فَسَاهَمَ فَكَانَ مِنَ الْمُدْحَضِينَ ﴿141﴾
versets.fr: 141. Il prit part au tirage au sort qui le désigna pour être jeté [à la mer].
versets.en: 141. He (agreed to) cast lots, and he was among the losers,

versets.ar: 142. فَالْتَقَمَهُ الْحُوتُ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٌ ﴿142﴾
versets.fr: 142. Le poisson l'avala alors qu'il était blâmable.
versets.en: 142. Then a (big) fish swallowed him and he had done an act worthy of blame.

versets.ar: 143. فَلَوْلَا أَنَّهُ كَانَ مِنَ الْمُسَبِّحِينَ ﴿143﴾
versets.fr: 143. S'il n'avait pas été parmi ceux qui glorifient Allah,
versets.en: 143. Had he not been of them who glorify Allah,

versets.ar: 144. لَلَبِثَ فِي بَطْنِهِ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ ﴿144﴾
versets.fr: 144. il serait demeuré dans son ventre jusqu'au jour où l'on sera ressuscité.
versets.en: 144. He would have indeed remained inside its belly (the fish) till the Day of Resurrection.

versets.ar: 145. ۞ فَنَبَذْنَاهُ بِالْعَرَاءِ وَهُوَ سَقِيمٌ ﴿145﴾
versets.fr: 145. Nous le jetâmes sur la terre nue, indisposé qu'il était.
versets.en: 145. But We cast him forth on the naked shore while he was sick,

versets.ar: 146. وَأَنبَتْنَا عَلَيْهِ شَجَرَةً مِّن يَقْطِينٍ ﴿146﴾
versets.fr: 146. Et Nous fîmes pousser au-dessus de lui un plant de courge,
versets.en: 146. And We caused a plant of gourd to grow over him.

versets.ar: 147. وَأَرْسَلْنَاهُ إِلَىٰ مِائَةِ أَلْفٍ أَوْ يَزِيدُونَ ﴿147﴾
versets.fr: 147. et l'envoyâmes ensuite (comme prophète) vers cent mille hommes ou plus.
versets.en: 147. And We sent him to a hundred thousand (people) or even more.

versets.ar: 148. فَآمَنُوا فَمَتَّعْنَاهُمْ إِلَىٰ حِينٍ ﴿148﴾
versets.fr: 148. Ils crurent, et nous leur donnâmes jouissance de la vie pour un temps.
versets.en: 148. And they believed; so We gave them enjoyment for a while.

versets.ar: 149. فَاسْتَفْتِهِمْ أَلِرَبِّكَ الْبَنَاتُ وَلَهُمُ الْبَنُونَ ﴿149﴾
versets.fr: 149. Pose-leur donc la question: «Ton Seigneur aurait-Il des filles et eux des fils?
versets.en: 149. Now ask them (O Muhammad SAW): "Are there (only) daughters for your Lord and sons for them?"

versets.ar: 150. أَمْ خَلَقْنَا الْمَلَائِكَةَ إِنَاثًا وَهُمْ شَاهِدُونَ ﴿150﴾
versets.fr: 150. Ou bien avons-Nous créé des Anges de sexe féminin, et en sont-ils témoins?».
versets.en: 150. Or did We create the angels females while they were witnesses?

versets.ar: 151. أَلَا إِنَّهُم مِّنْ إِفْكِهِمْ لَيَقُولُونَ ﴿151﴾
versets.fr: 151. Certes, ils disent dans leur mensonge:
versets.en: 151. Verily, it is of their falsehood that they (Quraish pagans) say:

versets.ar: 152. وَلَدَ اللَّهُ وَإِنَّهُمْ لَكَاذِبُونَ ﴿152﴾
versets.fr: 152. «Allah a engendré» mais ce sont certainement des menteurs!
versets.en: 152. "Allah has begotten off spring or children (i.e. angels are the daughters of Allah)?" And, verily, they are liars!

versets.ar: 153. أَصْطَفَى الْبَنَاتِ عَلَى الْبَنِينَ ﴿153﴾
versets.fr: 153. Aurait-Il choisi des filles de préférence à des fils?
versets.en: 153. Has He (then) chosen daughters rather than sons?

versets.ar: 154. مَا لَكُمْ كَيْفَ تَحْكُمُونَ ﴿154﴾
versets.fr: 154. Qu'avez-vous donc à juger ainsi?
versets.en: 154. What is the matter with you? How do you decide?

versets.fr: 155. Ne réfléchissez-vous donc pas?
versets.en: 155. Will you not then remember?

versets.fr: 156. Ou avez-vous un argument évident?
versets.en: 156. Or is there for you a plain authority?

versets.ar: 157. فَأْتُوا بِكِتَابِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ ﴿157﴾
versets.fr: 157. Apportez donc votre Livre si vous êtes véridiques!»
versets.en: 157. Then bring your Book if you are truthful!

versets.ar: 158. وَجَعَلُوا بَيْنَهُ وَبَيْنَ الْجِنَّةِ نَسَبًا ۚ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمَتِ الْجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ ﴿158﴾
versets.fr: 158. Et ils ont établi entre Lui et les djinns une parenté, alors que les djinns savent bien qu'ils [les mécréants] vont être emmenés (pour le châtiment).
versets.en: 158. And they have invented a kinship between Him and the jinns, but the jinns know well that they have indeed to appear (before Him) (i.e. they will be brought for accounts).

versets.ar: 159. سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ ﴿159﴾
versets.fr: 159. Gloire à Allah. Il est au-dessus de ce qu'ils décrivent!
versets.en: 159. Glorified is Allah! (He is Free) from what they attribute unto Him!

versets.ar: 160. إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ ﴿160﴾
versets.fr: 160. Exception faite des serviteurs élus d'Allah.
versets.en: 160. Except the slaves of Allah, whom He choses (for His Mercy i.e. true believers of Islamic Monotheism who do not attribute false things unto Allah).

versets.fr: 161. En vérité, vous et tout ce que vous adorez,
versets.en: 161. So, verily you (pagans) and those whom you worship (idols).

versets.ar: 162. مَا أَنتُمْ عَلَيْهِ بِفَاتِنِينَ ﴿162﴾
versets.fr: 162. ne pourrez tenter [personne],
versets.en: 162. Cannot lead astray [turn away from Him (Allah) anyone of the believers],

versets.ar: 163. إِلَّا مَنْ هُوَ صَالِ الْجَحِيمِ ﴿163﴾
versets.fr: 163. excepté celui qui sera brûlé dans la Fournaise.
versets.en: 163. Except those who are predestined to burn in Hell!

versets.ar: 164. وَمَا مِنَّا إِلَّا لَهُ مَقَامٌ مَّعْلُومٌ ﴿164﴾
versets.fr: 164. Il n'y en a pas un, parmi nous, qui n'ait une place connue;
versets.en: 164. There is not one of us (angels) but has his known place (or position);

versets.ar: 165. وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ الصَّافُّونَ ﴿165﴾
versets.fr: 165. nous sommes certes, les rangés en rangs;
versets.en: 165. Verily, we (angels), we stand in rows for the prayers (as you Muslims stand in rows for your prayers);

versets.ar: 166. وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ الْمُسَبِّحُونَ ﴿166﴾
versets.fr: 166. et c'est nous certes, qui célébrons la gloire [d'Allah].
versets.en: 166. Verily, we (angels), we are they who glorify (Allah's Praises i.e. perform prayers).

versets.ar: 167. وَإِن كَانُوا لَيَقُولُونَ ﴿167﴾
versets.fr: 167. Même s'ils disaient:
versets.en: 167. And indeed they (Arab pagans) used to say;

versets.ar: 168. لَوْ أَنَّ عِندَنَا ذِكْرًا مِّنَ الْأَوَّلِينَ ﴿168﴾
versets.fr: 168. «Si nous avions eu un Rappel de [nos] ancêtres,
versets.en: 168. "If we had a reminder as had the men of old (before the coming of Prophet Muhammad SAW as a Messenger of Allah).

versets.ar: 169. لَكُنَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ ﴿169﴾
versets.fr: 169. nous aurions été certes les serviteurs élus d'Allah!
versets.en: 169. "We would have indeed been the chosen slaves of Allah (true believers of Islamic Monotheism)!"

versets.ar: 170. فَكَفَرُوا بِهِ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ ﴿170﴾
versets.fr: 170. Ils y ont mécru et ils sauront bientôt.
versets.en: 170. But (now that the Quran has come) they disbelieve therein (i.e. in the Quran and in Prophet Muhammad SAW, and all that which he brought, the Divine Revelation), so they will come to know!

versets.ar: 171. وَلَقَدْ سَبَقَتْ كَلِمَتُنَا لِعِبَادِنَا الْمُرْسَلِينَ ﴿171﴾
versets.fr: 171. En effet, Notre Parole a déjà été donnée à Nos serviteurs, les Messagers,
versets.en: 171. And, verily, Our Word has gone forth of old for Our slaves, the Messengers,

versets.ar: 172. إِنَّهُمْ لَهُمُ الْمَنصُورُونَ ﴿172﴾
versets.fr: 172. que ce sont eux qui seront secourus,
versets.en: 172. That they verily would be made triumphant.

versets.ar: 173. وَإِنَّ جُندَنَا لَهُمُ الْغَالِبُونَ ﴿173﴾
versets.fr: 173. et que Nos soldats auront le dessus.
versets.en: 173. And that Our hosts, they verily would be the victors.

versets.fr: 174. Eloigne-toi d'eux, jusqu'à un certain temps;
versets.en: 174. So turn away (O Muhammad SAW) from them for a while,

versets.ar: 175. وَأَبْصِرْهُمْ فَسَوْفَ يُبْصِرُونَ ﴿175﴾
versets.fr: 175. et observe-les: ils verront bientôt!
versets.en: 175. And watch them and they shall see (the punishment)!

versets.ar: 176. أَفَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونَ ﴿176﴾
versets.fr: 176. Quoi! est-ce Notre châtiment qu'ils cherchent à hâter?
versets.en: 176. Do they seek to hasten on Our Torment?

versets.ar: 177. فَإِذَا نَزَلَ بِسَاحَتِهِمْ فَسَاءَ صَبَاحُ الْمُنذَرِينَ ﴿177﴾
versets.fr: 177. Quand il tombera dans leur place, ce sera alors un mauvais matin pour ceux qu'on a avertis!
versets.en: 177. Then, when it descends into their courtyard (i.e. near to them), evil will be the morning for those who had been warned!

versets.fr: 178. Et éloigne-toi d'eux jusqu'à un certain temps;
versets.en: 178. So turn (O Muhammad SAW) away from them for a while,

versets.fr: 179. et observe; ils verront bientôt!
versets.en: 179. And watch and they shall see (the torment)!

versets.ar: 180. سُبْحَانَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ الْعِزَّةِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ ﴿180﴾
versets.fr: 180. Gloire à ton Seigneur, le Seigneur de la puissance. Il est au-dessus de ce qu'ils décrivent!
versets.en: 180. Glorified be your Lord, the Lord of Honour and Power! (He is free) from what they attribute unto Him!

versets.ar: 181. وَسَلَامٌ عَلَى الْمُرْسَلِينَ ﴿181﴾
versets.fr: 181. Et paix sur les Messagers,
versets.en: 181. And peace be on the Messengers!

versets.ar: 182. وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿182﴾
versets.fr: 182. et louange à Allah, Seigneur de l'univers!
versets.en: 182. And all the praise and thanks be to Allah, Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists).

versets.ar: 1. ص ۚ وَالْقُرْآنِ ذِي الذِّكْرِ ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. Sâd. Par le Coran, au renom glorieux (dikr)!
versets.en: 1. Sad [These letters (Sad etc.) are one of the miracles of the Quran and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings]. By the Quran full of reminding.

versets.ar: 2. بَلِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فِي عِزَّةٍ وَشِقَاقٍ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Ceux qui ont mécru sont plutôt dans l'orgueil et le schisme!
versets.en: 2. Nay, those who desbelieve are in false pride and opposition.

versets.ar: 3. كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَبْلِهِم مِّن قَرْنٍ فَنَادَوا وَّلَاتَ حِينَ مَنَاصٍ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Que de générations avant eux avons-Nous fait périr, qui ont crié, hélas, quand il n'était plus temps d'échapper?
versets.en: 3. How many a generation We have destroyed before them, and they cried out when there was no longer time for escape!

versets.ar: 4. وَعَجِبُوا أَن جَاءَهُم مُّنذِرٌ مِّنْهُمْ ۖ وَقَالَ الْكَافِرُونَ هَٰذَا سَاحِرٌ كَذَّابٌ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Et ils (les Mecquois) s'étonnèrent qu'un avertisseur parmi eux leur soit venu, et les infidèles disent: «C'est un magicien et un grand menteur,
versets.en: 4. And they (Arab pagans) wonder that a warner (Prophet Muhammad SAW) has come to them from among themselves! And the disbelievers say: "This (Prophet Muhammad SAW) is a sorcerer, a liar.

versets.ar: 5. أَجَعَلَ الْآلِهَةَ إِلَٰهًا وَاحِدًا ۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَشَيْءٌ عُجَابٌ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Réduira-t-il les divinités à un Seul Dieu? Voilà une chose vraiment étonnante».
versets.en: 5. "Has he made the aliha (gods) (all) into One Ilah (God - Allah). Verily, this is a curious thing!"

versets.ar: 6. وَانطَلَقَ الْمَلَأُ مِنْهُمْ أَنِ امْشُوا وَاصْبِرُوا عَلَىٰ آلِهَتِكُمْ ۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَشَيْءٌ يُرَادُ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Et leurs notables partirent en disant: «Allez-vous en, et restez constants à vos dieux: c'est là vraiment une chose souhaitable.
versets.en: 6. And the leaders among them went about (saying): "Go on, and remain constant to your aliha (gods)! Verily, This is a thing designed (against you)!

versets.ar: 7. مَا سَمِعْنَا بِهَٰذَا فِي الْمِلَّةِ الْآخِرَةِ إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا اخْتِلَاقٌ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. Nous n'avons pas entendu cela dans la dernière religion (le Christianisme); ce n'est en vérité que pure invention!
versets.en: 7. "We have not heard (the like) of this among the people of these later days. This is nothing but an invention!

versets.ar: 8. أَأُنزِلَ عَلَيْهِ الذِّكْرُ مِن بَيْنِنَا ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِي شَكٍّ مِّن ذِكْرِي ۖ بَل لَّمَّا يَذُوقُوا عَذَابِ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Quoi! C'est sur lui, parmi nous, qu'on aurait fait descendre le Rappel [le Coran]?» Plutôt ils sont dans le doute au sujet de Mon message. Ou plutôt ils n'ont pas encore goûté à Mon châtiment!
versets.en: 8. "Has the Reminder been sent down to him (alone) from among us?" Nay! but they are in doubt about My Reminder (this Quran)! Nay, but they have not tasted (My) Torment!

versets.ar: 9. أَمْ عِندَهُمْ خَزَائِنُ رَحْمَةِ رَبِّكَ الْعَزِيزِ الْوَهَّابِ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Ou bien détiennent-ils les trésors de la miséricorde de ton Seigneur, le Puissant, le Dispensateur par excellence.
versets.en: 9. Or have they the treasures of the Mercy of your Lord, the All-Mighty, the Real Bestower?

versets.ar: 10. أَمْ لَهُم مُّلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ فَلْيَرْتَقُوا فِي الْأَسْبَابِ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Ou bien ont-ils le royaume des cieux et de la terre et de ce qui existe entre eux? Eh bien, qu'ils y montent par n'importe quel moyen!
versets.en: 10. Or is it that the dominion of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them is theirs? If so, let them ascend up with means (to the heavens)!

versets.ar: 11. جُندٌ مَّا هُنَالِكَ مَهْزُومٌ مِّنَ الْأَحْزَابِ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. Une armée de coalisés qui, ici-même, sera mise en déroute!
versets.en: 11. (As they denied Allah's Message) they will be a defeated host like the confederates of the old times (who were defeated).

versets.ar: 12. كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَعَادٌ وَفِرْعَوْنُ ذُو الْأَوْتَادِ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. Avant eux, le peuple de Noé, les Aad et Pharaon l'homme aux pals (ou aux Pyramides),
versets.en: 12. Before them (were many who) belied Messengers, the people of Nuh (Noah); and 'Ad; and Fir'aun (Pharaoh) the man of stakes (with which he used to punish the people),

versets.ar: 13. وَثَمُودُ وَقَوْمُ لُوطٍ وَأَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ الْأَحْزَابُ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. et les Tamûd, le peuple de Lot, et les gens d'Al-Aykah, (ont tous démenti leurs Messagers). Voilà les coalisés.
versets.en: 13. And Thamud, and the people of Lout (Lot), and the dwellers of the wood; such were the confederates.

versets.ar: 14. إِن كُلٌّ إِلَّا كَذَّبَ الرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ عِقَابِ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. Il n'en est aucun qui n'ait traité les Messagers de menteurs. Et bien, Ma punition s'est avérée contre eux!
versets.en: 14. Not one of them but belied the Messengers, therefore My Torment was justified,

versets.ar: 15. وَمَا يَنظُرُ هَٰؤُلَاءِ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً مَّا لَهَا مِن فَوَاقٍ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Ceux-ci n'attendant qu'un seul Cri, sans répétition.
versets.en: 15. And these only wait for a single Saihah [shout (i.e. the blowing of the Trumpet by the angel Israfil Sarafil)] there will be no pause or ending thereto [till everything will perish except Allah (the only God full of Majesty, Bounty and Honour)].

versets.ar: 16. وَقَالُوا رَبَّنَا عَجِّل لَّنَا قِطَّنَا قَبْلَ يَوْمِ الْحِسَابِ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Et ils disent: «Seigneur, hâte-nous notre part avant le jour des Comptes».
versets.en: 16. They say: "Our Lord! Hasten to us Qittana (i.e. our Record of good and bad deeds so that we see it) before the Day of Reckoning!"

versets.ar: 17. اصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَاذْكُرْ عَبْدَنَا دَاوُودَ ذَا الْأَيْدِ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوَّابٌ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Endure ce qu'ils disent; et rappelle-toi David, Notre serviteur, doué de force [dans l'adoration] et plein de repentir [à Allah].
versets.en: 17. Be patient (O Muhammad SAW) of what they say, and remember Our slave Dawud (David), endued with power. Verily, he was ever oft-returning in all matters and in repentance (toward Allah).

versets.ar: 18. إِنَّا سَخَّرْنَا الْجِبَالَ مَعَهُ يُسَبِّحْنَ بِالْعَشِيِّ وَالْإِشْرَاقِ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. Nous soumîmes les montagnes à glorifier Allah, soir et matin, en sa compagnie,
versets.en: 18. Verily, We made the mountains to glorify Our Praises with him [Dawud (David)] in the 'Ashi (i.e. after the mid-day till sunset) and Ishraq (i.e. after the sunrise till mid-day).

versets.ar: 19. وَالطَّيْرَ مَحْشُورَةً ۖ كُلٌّ لَّهُ أَوَّابٌ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. de même que les oiseaux assemblés en masse, tous ne faisant qu'obéir à lui [Allah].
versets.en: 19. And (so did) the birds assembled: all with him [Dawud (David)] did turn (to Allah i.e. glorified His Praises).

versets.ar: 20. وَشَدَدْنَا مُلْكَهُ وَآتَيْنَاهُ الْحِكْمَةَ وَفَصْلَ الْخِطَابِ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. Et Nous renforçâmes son royaume et lui donnâmes la sagesse et la faculté de bien juger.
versets.en: 20. We made his kingdom strong and gave him Al-Hikmah (Prophethood, etc.) and sound judgement in speech and decision.

versets.ar: 21. ۞ وَهَلْ أَتَاكَ نَبَأُ الْخَصْمِ إِذْ تَسَوَّرُوا الْمِحْرَابَ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Et t'est-elle parvenue la nouvelle des disputeurs quand ils grimpèrent au mur du sanctuaire!
versets.en: 21. And has the news of the litigants reached you? When they climbed over the wall into (his) Mihrab (a praying place or a private room,).

versets.ar: 22. إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَىٰ دَاوُودَ فَفَزِعَ مِنْهُمْ ۖ قَالُوا لَا تَخَفْ ۖ خَصْمَانِ بَغَىٰ بَعْضُنَا عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ فَاحْكُم بَيْنَنَا بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا تُشْطِطْ وَاهْدِنَا إِلَىٰ سَوَاءِ الصِّرَاطِ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. Quand ils entrèrent auprès de David, il en fut effrayé. Ils dirent: «N'aie pas peur! Nous sommes tous deux en dispute; l'un de nous a fait du tort à l'autre. Juge donc en toute équité entre nous, ne sois pas injuste et guide-nous vers le chemin droit.
versets.en: 22. When they entered in upon Dawud (David), he was terrified of them, they said: "Fear not! (We are) two litigants, one of whom has wronged the other, therefore judge between us with truth, and treat us not with injustice, and guide us to the Right Way.

versets.ar: 23. إِنَّ هَٰذَا أَخِي لَهُ تِسْعٌ وَتِسْعُونَ نَعْجَةً وَلِيَ نَعْجَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ فَقَالَ أَكْفِلْنِيهَا وَعَزَّنِي فِي الْخِطَابِ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. Celui-ci est mon frère: il a quatre-vingt-dix-neuf brebis, tandis que je n'ai qu'une brebis. Il m'a dit: «Confie-la-moi» et dans la conversation, il a beaucoup fait pression sur moi».
versets.en: 23. Verily, this my brother (in religion) has ninety nine ewes, while I have (only) one ewe, and he says: "Hand it over to me, and he overpowered me in speech."

versets.ar: 24. قَالَ لَقَدْ ظَلَمَكَ بِسُؤَالِ نَعْجَتِكَ إِلَىٰ نِعَاجِهِ ۖ وَإِنَّ كَثِيرًا مِّنَ الْخُلَطَاءِ لَيَبْغِي بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَقَلِيلٌ مَّا هُمْ ۗ وَظَنَّ دَاوُودُ أَنَّمَا فَتَنَّاهُ فَاسْتَغْفَرَ رَبَّهُ وَخَرَّ رَاكِعًا وَأَنَابَ ۩ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Il [David] dit: «Il a été certes injuste envers toi en demandant de joindre ta brebis à ses brebis». Beaucoup de gens transgressent les droits de leurs associés, sauf ceux qui croient et accomplissent les bonnes œuvres - cependant ils sont bien rares -. Et David pensa alors que Nous l'avions mis à l'épreuve. Il demanda donc pardon à son Seigneur et tomba prosterné et se repentit.
versets.en: 24. [Dawud (David)] said (immediately without listening to the opponent): "He has wronged you in demanding your ewe in addition to his ewes. And, verily, many partners oppress one another, except those who believe and do righteous good deeds, and they are few." And Dawud (David) guessed that We have tried him and he sought Forgiveness of his Lord, and he fell down prostrate and turned (to Allah) in repentance.

versets.ar: 25. فَغَفَرْنَا لَهُ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَإِنَّ لَهُ عِندَنَا لَزُلْفَىٰ وَحُسْنَ مَآبٍ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Nous lui pardonnâmes. Il aura une place proche de Nous et un beau refuge.
versets.en: 25. So We forgave him that, and verily, for him is a near access to Us, and a good place of (final) return (Paradise).

versets.ar: 26. يَا دَاوُودُ إِنَّا جَعَلْنَاكَ خَلِيفَةً فِي الْأَرْضِ فَاحْكُم بَيْنَ النَّاسِ بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا تَتَّبِعِ الْهَوَىٰ فَيُضِلَّكَ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَضِلُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ شَدِيدٌ بِمَا نَسُوا يَوْمَ الْحِسَابِ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. «O David, Nous avons fait de toi un calife sur la terre. Juge donc en toute équité parmi les gens et ne suis pas la passion: sinon elle t'égarera du sentier d'Allah». Car ceux qui s'égarent du sentier d'Allah auront un dur châtiment pour avoir oublié le Jour des Comptes.
versets.en: 26. O Dawud (David)! Verily! We have placed you as a successor on earth, so judge you between men in truth (and justice) and follow not your desire for it will mislead you from the Path of Allah. Verily! Those who wander astray from the Path of Allah (shall) have a severe torment, because they forgot the Day of Reckoning.

versets.ar: 27. وَمَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاءَ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا بَاطِلًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ظَنُّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا ۚ فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنَ النَّارِ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Nous n'avons pas créé le ciel et la terre et ce qui existe entre eux en vain. C'est ce que pensent ceux qui ont mécru. Malheur à ceux qui ont mécru pour le feu [qui les attend]!
versets.en: 27. And We created not the heaven and the earth and all that is between them without purpose! That is the consideration of those who disbelieve! Then woe to those who disbelieve (in Islamic Monotheism) from the Fire!

versets.ar: 28. أَمْ نَجْعَلُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ كَالْمُفْسِدِينَ فِي الْأَرْضِ أَمْ نَجْعَلُ الْمُتَّقِينَ كَالْفُجَّارِ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Traiterons-Nous ceux qui croient et accomplissent les bonnes œuvres comme ceux qui commettent du désordre sur terre? ou traiterons-Nous les pieux comme les pervers?
versets.en: 28. Shall We treat those who believe (in the Oneness of Allah Islamic Monotheism) and do righteous good deeds, as Mufsidun (those who associate partners in worship with Allah and commit crimes) on earth? Or shall We treat the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2), as the Fujjar (criminals, disbelievers, wicked, etc)?

versets.ar: 29. كِتَابٌ أَنزَلْنَاهُ إِلَيْكَ مُبَارَكٌ لِّيَدَّبَّرُوا آيَاتِهِ وَلِيَتَذَكَّرَ أُولُو الْأَلْبَابِ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. [Voici] un Livre béni que Nous avons fait descendre vers toi, afin qu'ils méditent sur ses versets et que les doués d'intelligence réfléchissent!
versets.en: 29. (This is) a Book (the Quran) which We have sent down to you, full of blessings that they may ponder over its Verses, and that men of understanding may remember.

versets.ar: 30. وَوَهَبْنَا لِدَاوُودَ سُلَيْمَانَ ۚ نِعْمَ الْعَبْدُ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوَّابٌ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Et à David Nous fîmes don de Salomon, - quel bon serviteur! - Il était plein de repentir.
versets.en: 30. And to Dawud (David) We gave Sulaiman (Solomon). How excellent (a) slave! Verily, he was ever oft-returning in repentance (to Us)!

versets.ar: 31. إِذْ عُرِضَ عَلَيْهِ بِالْعَشِيِّ الصَّافِنَاتُ الْجِيَادُ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. Quand un après-midi, on lui présenta de magnifiques chevaux de course,
versets.en: 31. When there were displayed before him, in the afternoon, well trained horses of the highest breed [for Jihad (holy fighting in Allah's Cause)].

versets.ar: 32. فَقَالَ إِنِّي أَحْبَبْتُ حُبَّ الْخَيْرِ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّي حَتَّىٰ تَوَارَتْ بِالْحِجَابِ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. il dit: «Oui, je me suis complu à aimer les biens (de ce monde) au point [d'oublier] le rappel de mon Seigneur jusqu'à ce que [le soleil] se soit caché derrière son voile.
versets.en: 32. And he said: "Alas! I did love the good (these horses) instead of remembering my Lord (in my 'Asr prayer)" till the time was over, and (the sun) had hidden in the veil (of night).

versets.ar: 33. رُدُّوهَا عَلَيَّ ۖ فَطَفِقَ مَسْحًا بِالسُّوقِ وَالْأَعْنَاقِ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. Ramenez-les moi.» Alors il se mit à leur couper les pattes et les cous.
versets.en: 33. Then he said "Bring them (horses) back to me." Then he began to pass his hand over their legs and their necks (till the end of the display).

versets.ar: 34. وَلَقَدْ فَتَنَّا سُلَيْمَانَ وَأَلْقَيْنَا عَلَىٰ كُرْسِيِّهِ جَسَدًا ثُمَّ أَنَابَ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. Et Nous avions certes éprouvé Salomon en plaçant sur son siège un corps. Ensuite, il se repentit.
versets.en: 34. And, indeed We did try Sulaiman (Solomon) and We placed on his throne Jasadan (a devil, so he lost his kingdom for a while) but he did return (to his throne and kingdom by the Grace of Allah and he did return) to Allah with obedience and in repentance.

versets.ar: 35. قَالَ رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَهَبْ لِي مُلْكًا لَّا يَنبَغِي لِأَحَدٍ مِّن بَعْدِي ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الْوَهَّابُ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Il dit: «Seigneur, pardonne-moi et fais-moi don d'un royaume tel que nul après moi n'aura de pareil. C'est Toi le grand Dispensateur».
versets.en: 35. He said: "My Lord! Forgive me, and bestow upon me a kingdom such as shall not belong to any other after me: Verily, You are the Bestower."

versets.ar: 36. فَسَخَّرْنَا لَهُ الرِّيحَ تَجْرِي بِأَمْرِهِ رُخَاءً حَيْثُ أَصَابَ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. Nous lui assujettîmes alors le vent qui, par son ordre, soufflait modérément partout où il voulait.
versets.en: 36. So, We subjected to him the wind, it blew gently to his order whithersoever he willed,

versets.ar: 37. وَالشَّيَاطِينَ كُلَّ بَنَّاءٍ وَغَوَّاصٍ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. De même que les diables, bâtisseurs et plongeurs de toutes sortes.
versets.en: 37. And also the Shayatin (devils) from the jinns (including) every kind of builder and diver,

versets.ar: 38. وَآخَرِينَ مُقَرَّنِينَ فِي الْأَصْفَادِ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. Et d'autres encore, accouplés dans des chaînes.
versets.en: 38. And also others bound in fetters.

versets.ar: 39. هَٰذَا عَطَاؤُنَا فَامْنُنْ أَوْ أَمْسِكْ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. «Voilà Notre don; distribue-le ou retiens-le sans avoir à en rendre compte».
versets.en: 39. [Saying of Allah to Sulaiman (Solomon)]: "This is Our gift, so spend you or withhold, no account will be asked."

versets.ar: 40. وَإِنَّ لَهُ عِندَنَا لَزُلْفَىٰ وَحُسْنَ مَآبٍ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. Et il a une place rapprochée de Nous et un beau refuge.
versets.en: 40. And verily, he enjoyed a near access to Us, and a good final return (Paradise).

versets.ar: 41. وَاذْكُرْ عَبْدَنَا أَيُّوبَ إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُ أَنِّي مَسَّنِيَ الشَّيْطَانُ بِنُصْبٍ وَعَذَابٍ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. Et rappelle-toi Job, Notre serviteur, lorsqu'il appela son Seigneur: «Le Diable m'a infligé détresse et souffrance».
versets.en: 41. And remember Our slave Ayub (Job), when he invoked his Lord (saying): "Verily! Shaitan (Satan) has touched me with distress (by losing my health) and torment (by losing my wealth)!

versets.ar: 42. ارْكُضْ بِرِجْلِكَ ۖ هَٰذَا مُغْتَسَلٌ بَارِدٌ وَشَرَابٌ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. Frappe [la terre] de ton pied: voici une eau fraîche pour te laver et voici de quoi boire.
versets.en: 42. (Allah said to him): "Strike the ground with your foot: This is a spring of water to wash in, cool and a (refreshing) drink."

versets.ar: 43. وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُ أَهْلَهُ وَمِثْلَهُم مَّعَهُمْ رَحْمَةً مِّنَّا وَذِكْرَىٰ لِأُولِي الْأَلْبَابِ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. Et Nous lui rendîmes sa famille et la fîmes deux fois plus nombreuse, comme une miséricorde de Notre part et comme un rappel pour les gens doués d'intelligence.
versets.en: 43. And We gave him (back) his family, and along with them the like thereof, as a Mercy from Us, and a Reminder for those who understand.

versets.ar: 44. وَخُذْ بِيَدِكَ ضِغْثًا فَاضْرِب بِّهِ وَلَا تَحْنَثْ ۗ إِنَّا وَجَدْنَاهُ صَابِرًا ۚ نِّعْمَ الْعَبْدُ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوَّابٌ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. «Et prends dans ta main un faisceau de brindilles, puis frappe avec cela. Et ne viole pas ton serment». Oui, Nous l'avons trouvé vraiment endurant. Quel bon serviteur! Sans cesse il se repentait.
