versets.en: 44. "And take in your hand a bundle of thin grass and strike therewith (your wife), and break not your oath. Truly! We found him patient. How excellent (a) slave! Verily, he was ever oft-returning in repentance (to Us)!

versets.ar: 45. وَاذْكُرْ عِبَادَنَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَإِسْحَاقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ أُولِي الْأَيْدِي وَالْأَبْصَارِ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. Et rappelle-toi Abraham, Isaac et Jacob, Nos serviteurs puissants et clairvoyants.
versets.en: 45. And remember Our slaves, Ibrahim (Abraham), Ishaque (Isaac), and Ya'qub (Jacob), (all) owners of strength (in worshipping Us) and (also) of religious understanding.

versets.ar: 46. إِنَّا أَخْلَصْنَاهُم بِخَالِصَةٍ ذِكْرَى الدَّارِ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. Nous avons fait d'eux l'objet d'une distinction particulière: le rappel de l'au-delà.
versets.en: 46. Verily, We did choose them by granting them (a good thing, i.e.) the remembrance of the home [in the Hereafter and they used to make the people remember it, and also they used to invite the people to obey Allah and to do good deeds for the Hereafter].

versets.ar: 47. وَإِنَّهُمْ عِندَنَا لَمِنَ الْمُصْطَفَيْنَ الْأَخْيَارِ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. Ils sont auprès de Nous, certes, parmi les meilleurs élus.
versets.en: 47. And they are with Us, verily, of the chosen and the best!

versets.ar: 48. وَاذْكُرْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ وَالْيَسَعَ وَذَا الْكِفْلِ ۖ وَكُلٌّ مِّنَ الْأَخْيَارِ ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. Et rappelle-toi Ismaël et Elisée, et Dal Kifl, chacun d'eux parmi les meilleurs.
versets.en: 48. And remember Isma'il (Ishmael), Al-Yasa'a (Elisha), and Dhul-Kifl (Isaiah), all are among the best.

versets.ar: 49. هَٰذَا ذِكْرٌ ۚ وَإِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ لَحُسْنَ مَآبٍ ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. Cela est un rappel. C'est aux pieux qu'appartient, en vérité, la meilleure retraite,
versets.en: 49. This is a Reminder, and verily, for the Muttaqun (pious and righteous persons - see V. 2:2) is a good final return (Paradise),

versets.ar: 50. جَنَّاتِ عَدْنٍ مُّفَتَّحَةً لَّهُمُ الْأَبْوَابُ ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. Les Jardins d'Eden, aux portes ouvertes pour eux,
versets.en: 50. 'Adn (Edn) Paradise (everlasting Gardens), whose doors will be open for them, [It is said (in Tafsir At-Tabari, Part 23, Page 174) that one can speak to the doors, just one tells it to open and close, and it will open or close as it is ordered].

versets.ar: 51. مُتَّكِئِينَ فِيهَا يَدْعُونَ فِيهَا بِفَاكِهَةٍ كَثِيرَةٍ وَشَرَابٍ ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. où, accoudés, ils demanderont des fruits abondants et des boissons.
versets.en: 51. Therein they will recline; therein they will call for fruits in abundance and drinks;

versets.ar: 52. ۞ وَعِندَهُمْ قَاصِرَاتُ الطَّرْفِ أَتْرَابٌ ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. Et auprès d'eux seront les belles au regard chaste, toutes du même âge.
versets.en: 52. And beside them will be chaste females (virgins) restraining their glances only for their husbands, (and) of equal ages.

versets.ar: 53. هَٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِيَوْمِ الْحِسَابِ ﴿53﴾
versets.fr: 53. Voilà ce qui vous est promis pour le Jour des Comptes.
versets.en: 53. This it is what you (Al-Muttaqun - the pious) are promised for the Day of Reckoning!

versets.ar: 54. إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَرِزْقُنَا مَا لَهُ مِن نَّفَادٍ ﴿54﴾
versets.fr: 54. Ce sera Notre attribution inépuisable.
versets.en: 54. (It will be said to them)! Verily, this is Our Provision which will never finish;

versets.ar: 55. هَٰذَا ۚ وَإِنَّ لِلطَّاغِينَ لَشَرَّ مَآبٍ ﴿55﴾
versets.fr: 55. Voilà! Alors que les rebelles auront certes la pire retraite,
versets.en: 55. This is so! And for the Taghun (transgressors, disobedient to Allah and His Messenger - disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah, criminals, etc.), will be an evil final return (Fire),

versets.ar: 56. جَهَنَّمَ يَصْلَوْنَهَا فَبِئْسَ الْمِهَادُ ﴿56﴾
versets.fr: 56. L'Enfer où ils brûleront. Et quel affreux lit!
versets.en: 56. Hell! Where they will burn, and worst (indeed) is that place to rest!

versets.ar: 57. هَٰذَا فَلْيَذُوقُوهُ حَمِيمٌ وَغَسَّاقٌ ﴿57﴾
versets.fr: 57. Voilà! Qu'ils y goûtent: eau bouillante et eau purulente,
versets.en: 57. This is so! Then let them taste it, a boiling fluid and dirty wound discharges.

versets.ar: 58. وَآخَرُ مِن شَكْلِهِ أَزْوَاجٌ ﴿58﴾
versets.fr: 58. et d'autres punitions du même genre.
versets.en: 58. And other torments of similar kind, all together!

versets.ar: 59. هَٰذَا فَوْجٌ مُّقْتَحِمٌ مَّعَكُمْ ۖ لَا مَرْحَبًا بِهِمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ صَالُو النَّارِ ﴿59﴾
versets.fr: 59. Voici un groupe qui entre précipitamment en même temps que vous, nulle bienvenue à eux. Ils vont brûler dans le Feu.
versets.en: 59. This is a troop entering with you (in Hell), no welcome for them! Verily, they shall burn in the Fire!

versets.ar: 60. قَالُوا بَلْ أَنتُمْ لَا مَرْحَبًا بِكُمْ ۖ أَنتُمْ قَدَّمْتُمُوهُ لَنَا ۖ فَبِئْسَ الْقَرَارُ ﴿60﴾
versets.fr: 60. Ils dirent: «Pas de bienvenue pour vous, plutôt. C'est vous qui avez préparé cela pour nous». Quel mauvais lieu de séjour!
versets.en: 60. (The followers of the misleaders will say): "Nay, you (too)! No welcome for you! It is you (misleaders) who brought this upon us (because you misled us in the world), so evil is this place to stay in!"

versets.ar: 61. قَالُوا رَبَّنَا مَن قَدَّمَ لَنَا هَٰذَا فَزِدْهُ عَذَابًا ضِعْفًا فِي النَّارِ ﴿61﴾
versets.fr: 61. Ils dirent: «Seigneur, celui qui nous a préparé cela, ajoute-lui un double châtiment dans le Feu».
versets.en: 61. They will say: "Our Lord! Whoever brought this upon us, add to him a double torment in the Fire!"

versets.ar: 62. وَقَالُوا مَا لَنَا لَا نَرَىٰ رِجَالًا كُنَّا نَعُدُّهُم مِّنَ الْأَشْرَارِ ﴿62﴾
versets.fr: 62. Et ils dirent: «Pourquoi ne voyons-nous pas des gens que nous comptions parmi les malfaiteurs?
versets.en: 62. And they will say: "What is the matter with us that we see not men whom we used to count among the bad ones?"

versets.ar: 63. أَتَّخَذْنَاهُمْ سِخْرِيًّا أَمْ زَاغَتْ عَنْهُمُ الْأَبْصَارُ ﴿63﴾
versets.fr: 63. Est-ce que nous les avons raillés (à tort) ou échappent-ils à nos regards?»
versets.en: 63. Did we take them as an object of mockery, or have (our) eyes failed to perceive them?"

versets.ar: 64. إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ لَحَقٌّ تَخَاصُمُ أَهْلِ النَّارِ ﴿64﴾
versets.fr: 64. Telles sont en vérité les querelles des gens du Feu.
versets.en: 64. Verily, that is the very truth, the mutual dispute of the people of the Fire!

versets.ar: 65. قُلْ إِنَّمَا أَنَا مُنذِرٌ ۖ وَمَا مِنْ إِلَٰهٍ إِلَّا اللَّهُ الْوَاحِدُ الْقَهَّارُ ﴿65﴾
versets.fr: 65. Dis: «Je ne suis qu'un avertisseur. Point de divinité à part Allah, l'Unique, le Dominateur Suprême,
versets.en: 65. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "I am only a warner and there is no Ilah (God) except Allah (none has the right to be worshipped but Allah) the One, the Irresistible,

versets.ar: 66. رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا الْعَزِيزُ الْغَفَّارُ ﴿66﴾
versets.fr: 66. Seigneur des cieux et de la terre et de ce qui existe entre eux, le Puissant, le Grand Pardonneur».
versets.en: 66. "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the All-Mighty, the Oft-Forgiving."

versets.fr: 67. Dis: «Ceci (le Coran) est une grande nouvelle,
versets.en: 67. Say: "That (this Quran) is a great news,

versets.ar: 68. أَنتُمْ عَنْهُ مُعْرِضُونَ ﴿68﴾
versets.fr: 68. mais vous vous en détournez.
versets.en: 68. "From which you turn away!

versets.ar: 69. مَا كَانَ لِيَ مِنْ عِلْمٍ بِالْمَلَإِ الْأَعْلَىٰ إِذْ يَخْتَصِمُونَ ﴿69﴾
versets.fr: 69. Je n'avais aucune connaissance de la cohorte sublime au moment où elle disputait.
versets.en: 69. "I had no knowledge of the chiefs (angels) on high when they were disputing and discussing (about the creation of Adam).

versets.ar: 70. إِن يُوحَىٰ إِلَيَّ إِلَّا أَنَّمَا أَنَا نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ ﴿70﴾
versets.fr: 70. Il m'est seulement révélé que je suis un avertisseur clair».
versets.en: 70. "Only this has been inspired to me, that I am a plain warner."

versets.ar: 71. إِذْ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ إِنِّي خَالِقٌ بَشَرًا مِّن طِينٍ ﴿71﴾
versets.fr: 71. Quand ton Seigneur dit aux Anges: «Je vais créer d'argile un être humain.
versets.en: 71. (Remember) when your Lord said to the angels: "Truly, I am going to create man from clay".

versets.ar: 72. فَإِذَا سَوَّيْتُهُ وَنَفَخْتُ فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِي فَقَعُوا لَهُ سَاجِدِينَ ﴿72﴾
versets.fr: 72. Quand Je l'aurai bien formé et lui aurai insufflé de Mon Esprit, jetez-vous devant lui, prosternés».
versets.en: 72. So when I have fashioned him and breathed into him (his) soul created by Me, then you fall down prostrate to him."

versets.ar: 73. فَسَجَدَ الْمَلَائِكَةُ كُلُّهُمْ أَجْمَعُونَ ﴿73﴾
versets.fr: 73. Alors tous les Anges se prosternèrent,
versets.en: 73. So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them:

versets.ar: 74. إِلَّا إِبْلِيسَ اسْتَكْبَرَ وَكَانَ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ ﴿74﴾
versets.fr: 74. à l'exception d'Iblîs qui s'enfla d'orgueil et fut du nombre des infidèles.
versets.en: 74. Except Iblis (Satan) he was proud and was one of the disbelievers.

versets.ar: 75. قَالَ يَا إِبْلِيسُ مَا مَنَعَكَ أَن تَسْجُدَ لِمَا خَلَقْتُ بِيَدَيَّ ۖ أَسْتَكْبَرْتَ أَمْ كُنتَ مِنَ الْعَالِينَ ﴿75﴾
versets.fr: 75. (Allah) lui dit: «O Iblîs, qui t'a empêché de te prosterner devant ce que J'ai créé de Mes mains? T'enfles-tu d'orgueil ou te considères-tu parmi les hauts placés?»
versets.en: 75. (Allah) said: "O Iblis (Satan)! What prevents you from prostrating yourself to one whom I have created with Both My Hands. Are you too proud (to fall prostrate to Adam) or are you one of the high exalted?"

versets.ar: 76. قَالَ أَنَا خَيْرٌ مِّنْهُ ۖ خَلَقْتَنِي مِن نَّارٍ وَخَلَقْتَهُ مِن طِينٍ ﴿76﴾
versets.fr: 76. «Je suis meilleur que lui, dit [Iblîs,] Tu m'as créé de feu et tu l'as créé d'argile».
versets.en: 76. [Iblis (Satan)] said: "I am better than he, You created me from fire, and You created him from clay."

versets.ar: 77. قَالَ فَاخْرُجْ مِنْهَا فَإِنَّكَ رَجِيمٌ ﴿77﴾
versets.fr: 77. (Allah) dit: «Sors d'ici, te voilà banni;
versets.en: 77. (Allah) said: "Then get out from here, for verily, you are outcast.

versets.ar: 78. وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكَ لَعْنَتِي إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الدِّينِ ﴿78﴾
versets.fr: 78. et sur toi sera ma malédiction jusqu'au jour de la Rétribution».
versets.en: 78. "And verily!, My Curse is on you till the Day of Recompense."

versets.ar: 79. قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرْنِي إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ ﴿79﴾
versets.fr: 79. «Seigneur, dit [Iblîs], donne-moi donc un délai, jusqu'au jour où ils seront ressuscités».
versets.en: 79. [Iblis (Satan)] said: "My Lord! Give me then respite till the Day the (dead) are resurrected."

versets.ar: 80. قَالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ الْمُنظَرِينَ ﴿80﴾
versets.fr: 80. (Allah) dit: «Tu es de ceux à qui un délai est accordé,
versets.en: 80. (Allah) said: "Verily! You are of those allowed respite

versets.ar: 81. إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْوَقْتِ الْمَعْلُومِ ﴿81﴾
versets.fr: 81. jusqu'au jour de l'Instant bien Connu».
versets.en: 81. "Till the Day of the time appointed."

versets.ar: 82. قَالَ فَبِعِزَّتِكَ لَأُغْوِيَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ ﴿82﴾
versets.fr: 82. «Par Ta puissance! dit [Satan]. Je les séduirai assurément tous,
versets.en: 82. [Iblis (Satan)] said: "By Your Might, then I will surely mislead them all,

versets.ar: 83. إِلَّا عِبَادَكَ مِنْهُمُ الْمُخْلَصِينَ ﴿83﴾
versets.fr: 83. sauf Tes serviteurs élus parmi eux».
versets.en: 83. "Except Your chosen slaves amongst them (faithful, obedient, true believers of Islamic Monotheism)."

versets.ar: 84. قَالَ فَالْحَقُّ وَالْحَقَّ أَقُولُ ﴿84﴾
versets.fr: 84. (Allah) dit: «En vérité, et c'est la vérité que je dis,
versets.en: 84. (Allah) said: "The Truth is, and the Truth I say,

versets.ar: 85. لَأَمْلَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنكَ وَمِمَّن تَبِعَكَ مِنْهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ ﴿85﴾
versets.fr: 85. J'emplirai certainement l'Enfer de toi et de tous ceux d'entre eux qui te suivront».
versets.en: 85. That I will fill Hell with you [Iblis (Satan)] and those of them (mankind) that follow you, together."

versets.ar: 86. قُلْ مَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ وَمَا أَنَا مِنَ الْمُتَكَلِّفِينَ ﴿86﴾
versets.fr: 86. Dis: «Pour cela, je ne vous demande aucun salaire; et je ne suis pas un imposteur.
versets.en: 86. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "No wage do I ask of you for this (the Quran), nor am I one of the Mutakallifun (those who pretend and fabricate things which do not exist).

versets.ar: 87. إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِّلْعَالَمِينَ ﴿87﴾
versets.fr: 87. Ceci [le Coran] n'est qu'un rappel à l'univers.
versets.en: 87. "It (this Quran) is only a Reminder for all the 'Alamin (mankind and jinns).

versets.ar: 88. وَلَتَعْلَمُنَّ نَبَأَهُ بَعْدَ حِينٍ ﴿88﴾
versets.fr: 88. Et certainement vous en aurez des nouvelles bientôt!»
versets.en: 88. "And you shall certainly know the truth of it after a while.

versets.ar: 1. تَنزِيلُ الْكِتَابِ مِنَ اللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَكِيمِ ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. La révélation du Livre vient d'Allah, le Puissant, le Sage.
versets.en: 1. The revelation of this Book (the Quran) is from Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

versets.ar: 2. إِنَّا أَنزَلْنَا إِلَيْكَ الْكِتَابَ بِالْحَقِّ فَاعْبُدِ اللَّهَ مُخْلِصًا لَّهُ الدِّينَ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Nous t'avons fait descendre le Livre en toute vérité. Adore donc Allah en Lui vouant un culte exclusif.
versets.en: 2. Verily, We have sent down the Book to you (O Muhammad SAW) in truth: So worship Allah (Alone) by doing religious deeds sincerely for Allah's sake only, (and not to show-off, and not to set up rivals with Him in worship).

versets.ar: 3. أَلَا لِلَّهِ الدِّينُ الْخَالِصُ ۚ وَالَّذِينَ اتَّخَذُوا مِن دُونِهِ أَوْلِيَاءَ مَا نَعْبُدُهُمْ إِلَّا لِيُقَرِّبُونَا إِلَى اللَّهِ زُلْفَىٰ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَحْكُمُ بَيْنَهُمْ فِي مَا هُمْ فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِي مَنْ هُوَ كَاذِبٌ كَفَّارٌ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. C'est à Allah qu'appartient la religion pure. Tandis que ceux qui prennent des protecteurs en dehors de Lui (disent): «Nous ne les adorons que pour qu'ils nous rapprochent davantage d'Allah». En vérité, Allah jugera parmi eux sur ce en quoi ils divergent. Allah ne guide pas celui qui est menteur et grand ingrat.
versets.en: 3. Surely, the religion (i.e. the worship and the obedience) is for Allah only. And those who take Auliya' (protectors and helpers) besides Him (say): "We worship them only that they may bring us near to Allah." Verily, Allah will judge between them concerning that wherein they differ. Truly, Allah guides not him who is a liar, and a disbeliever.

versets.ar: 4. لَّوْ أَرَادَ اللَّهُ أَن يَتَّخِذَ وَلَدًا لَّاصْطَفَىٰ مِمَّا يَخْلُقُ مَا يَشَاءُ ۚ سُبْحَانَهُ ۖ هُوَ اللَّهُ الْوَاحِدُ الْقَهَّارُ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Si Allah avait voulu S'attribuer un enfant, Il aurait certes choisi ce qu'Il eût voulu parmi ce qu'Il crée. Gloire à Lui! C'est Lui Allah, l'Unique, le Dominateur suprême.
versets.en: 4. Had Allah willed to take a son (or offspring or children), He could have chosen whom He pleased out of those whom He created. But glory be to Him! (He is above such things). He is Allah, the One, the Irresistible.

versets.ar: 5. خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ بِالْحَقِّ ۖ يُكَوِّرُ اللَّيْلَ عَلَى النَّهَارِ وَيُكَوِّرُ النَّهَارَ عَلَى اللَّيْلِ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ ۖ كُلٌّ يَجْرِي لِأَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۗ أَلَا هُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْغَفَّارُ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Il a créé les cieux et la terre en toute vérité. Il enroule la nuit sur le jour et enroule le jour sur la nuit, et Il a assujetti le soleil et la lune à poursuivre chacun sa course pour un terme fixé. C'est bien Lui le Puissant, le Grand Pardonneur!
versets.en: 5. He has created the heavens and the earth with truth. He makes the night to go in the day and makes the day to go in the night. And He has subjected the sun and the moon. Each running (on a fixed course) for an appointed term. Verily, He is the All-Mighty, the Oft-Forgiving.

versets.ar: 6. خَلَقَكُم مِّن نَّفْسٍ وَاحِدَةٍ ثُمَّ جَعَلَ مِنْهَا زَوْجَهَا وَأَنزَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ الْأَنْعَامِ ثَمَانِيَةَ أَزْوَاجٍ ۚ يَخْلُقُكُمْ فِي بُطُونِ أُمَّهَاتِكُمْ خَلْقًا مِّن بَعْدِ خَلْقٍ فِي ظُلُمَاتٍ ثَلَاثٍ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ رَبُّكُمْ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ ۖ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ تُصْرَفُونَ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Il vous a créés d'une personne unique et a tiré d'elle son épouse. Et Il a fait descendre [créé] pour vous huit couples de bestiaux. Il vous crée dans les ventres de vos mères, création après création, dans trois ténèbres. Tel est Allah, votre Seigneur! A Lui appartient toute la Royauté. Point de divinité à part Lui. Comment pouvez-vous vous détourner [de son culte]?
versets.en: 6. He created you (all) from a single person (Adam); then made from him his wife [Hawwa' (Eve)]. And He has sent down for you of cattle eight pairs (of the sheep, two, male and female; of the goats, two, male and female; of the oxen, two, male and female; and of the camels, two, male and female). He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation in three veils of darkness, such is Allah your Lord. His is the kingdom, La ilaha illa Huwa (none has the right to be worshipped but He). How then are you turned away?

versets.ar: 7. إِن تَكْفُرُوا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَنِيٌّ عَنكُمْ ۖ وَلَا يَرْضَىٰ لِعِبَادِهِ الْكُفْرَ ۖ وَإِن تَشْكُرُوا يَرْضَهُ لَكُمْ ۗ وَلَا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ ۗ ثُمَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكُم مَّرْجِعُكُمْ فَيُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ ۚ إِنَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. Si vous ne croyez pas, Allah se passe largement de vous. De Ses serviteurs cependant, Il n'agrée pas la mécréance. Et si vous êtes reconnaissants, Il l'agrée pour vous. Nul pécheur ne portera les péchés d'autrui. Ensuite, vers votre Seigneur sera votre retour: Il vous informera alors de ce que vous faisiez car Il connaît parfaitement le contenu des poitrines.
versets.en: 7. If you disbelieve, then verily, Allah is not in need of you, He likes not disbelief for His slaves. And if you are grateful (by being believers), He is pleased therewith for you. No bearer of burdens shall bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, so He will inform you what you used to do. Verily, He is the All-Knower of that which is in (men's) breasts.

versets.ar: 8. ۞ وَإِذَا مَسَّ الْإِنسَانَ ضُرٌّ دَعَا رَبَّهُ مُنِيبًا إِلَيْهِ ثُمَّ إِذَا خَوَّلَهُ نِعْمَةً مِّنْهُ نَسِيَ مَا كَانَ يَدْعُو إِلَيْهِ مِن قَبْلُ وَجَعَلَ لِلَّهِ أَندَادًا لِّيُضِلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِ ۚ قُلْ تَمَتَّعْ بِكُفْرِكَ قَلِيلًا ۖ إِنَّكَ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ النَّارِ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Et quand un malheur touche l'homme, il appelle son Seigneur en se tournant vers Lui. Puis quand Il lui accorde de Sa part un bienfait, il oublie la raison pour laquelle il faisait appel, et il assigne à Allah des égaux, afin d'égarer (les gens) de son chemin. Dis «Jouis de ta mécréance un court moment. Tu fais partie des gens du Feu».
versets.en: 8. And when some hurt touches man, he cries to his Lord (Allah Alone), turning to Him in repentance, but when He bestows a favour upon him from Himself, he forgets that for which he cried for before, and he sets up rivals to Allah, in order to mislead others from His Path. Say: "Take pleasure in your disbelief for a while: surely, you are (one) of the dwellers of the Fire!"

versets.ar: 9. أَمَّنْ هُوَ قَانِتٌ آنَاءَ اللَّيْلِ سَاجِدًا وَقَائِمًا يَحْذَرُ الْآخِرَةَ وَيَرْجُو رَحْمَةَ رَبِّهِ ۗ قُلْ هَلْ يَسْتَوِي الَّذِينَ يَعْلَمُونَ وَالَّذِينَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ۗ إِنَّمَا يَتَذَكَّرُ أُولُو الْأَلْبَابِ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Est-ce que celui qui, aux heures de la nuit, reste en dévotion, prosterné et debout, prenant garde à l'au-delà et espérant la miséricorde de son Seigneur... Dis: «Sont-ils égaux, ceux qui savent et ceux qui ne savent pas?» Seuls les doués d'intelligence se rappellent.
versets.en: 9. Is one who is obedient to Allah, prostrating himself or standing (in prayer) during the hours of the night, fearing the Hereafter and hoping for the Mercy of his Lord (like one who disbelieves)? Say: "Are those who know equal to those who know not?" It is only men of understanding who will remember (i.e. get a lesson from Allah's Signs and Verses).

versets.ar: 10. قُلْ يَا عِبَادِ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اتَّقُوا رَبَّكُمْ ۚ لِلَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا فِي هَٰذِهِ الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةٌ ۗ وَأَرْضُ اللَّهِ وَاسِعَةٌ ۗ إِنَّمَا يُوَفَّى الصَّابِرُونَ أَجْرَهُم بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Dis: «O Mes serviteurs qui avez cru! Craignez votre Seigneur». Ceux qui ici-bas font le bien, auront une bonne [récompense]. La terre d'Allah est vaste et les endurants auront leur pleine récompense sans compter.
versets.en: 10. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "O My slaves who believe (in the Oneness of Allah Islamic Monotheism), be afraid of your Lord (Allah) and keep your duty to Him. Good is (the reward) for those who do good in this world, and Allah's earth is spacious (so if you cannot worship Allah at a place, then go to another)! Only those who are patient shall receive their rewards in full, without reckoning."

versets.ar: 11. قُلْ إِنِّي أُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ اللَّهَ مُخْلِصًا لَّهُ الدِّينَ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. Dis: «Il m'a été ordonné d'adorer Allah en Lui vouant exclusivement le culte,
versets.en: 11. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "Verily, I am commanded to worship Allah (Alone) by obeying Him and doing religious deeds sincerely for Allah's sake only and not to show off, and not to set up rivals with Him in worship;

versets.ar: 12. وَأُمِرْتُ لِأَنْ أَكُونَ أَوَّلَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. et il m'a été ordonné d'être le premier des Musulmans.
versets.en: 12. "And I am commanded (this) in order that I may be the first of those who submit themselves to Allah (in Islam) as Muslims."

versets.ar: 13. قُلْ إِنِّي أَخَافُ إِنْ عَصَيْتُ رَبِّي عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. Dis: «Je crains, si je désobéis à mon Seigneur, le châtiment d'un jour terrible».
versets.en: 13. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "Verily, if I disobey my Lord, I am afraid of the torment of a great Day."

versets.ar: 14. قُلِ اللَّهَ أَعْبُدُ مُخْلِصًا لَّهُ دِينِي ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. Dis: «C'est Allah que j'adore, et Lui voue exclusivement mon culte.
versets.en: 14. Say (O Muhammad SAW) "Allah Alone I worship by doing religious deeds sincerely for His sake only and not to show-off, and not to set up rivals with Him in worship."

versets.ar: 15. فَاعْبُدُوا مَا شِئْتُم مِّن دُونِهِ ۗ قُلْ إِنَّ الْخَاسِرِينَ الَّذِينَ خَسِرُوا أَنفُسَهُمْ وَأَهْلِيهِمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ ۗ أَلَا ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْخُسْرَانُ الْمُبِينُ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Adorez donc, en dehors de Lui, qui vous voudrez!» - Dis: «Les perdants sont ceux qui, au Jour de la Résurrection, auront causé la perte de leurs propres âmes et celles de leurs familles». C'est bien cela la perte évidente.
versets.en: 15. So worship what you like besides Him. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "The losers are those who will lose themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Verily, that will be a manifest loss!"

versets.ar: 16. لَهُم مِّن فَوْقِهِمْ ظُلَلٌ مِّنَ النَّارِ وَمِن تَحْتِهِمْ ظُلَلٌ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يُخَوِّفُ اللَّهُ بِهِ عِبَادَهُ ۚ يَا عِبَادِ فَاتَّقُونِ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Au-dessus d'eux ils auront des couches de feu et des couches au-dessous d'eux. Voilà ce dont Allah menace Ses esclaves. «O Mes esclaves, craignez-Moi donc!»
versets.en: 16. They shall have coverings of Fire, above them and covering (of Fire) beneath them; with this Allah does frighten His slaves: "O My slaves, therefore fear Me!"

versets.ar: 17. وَالَّذِينَ اجْتَنَبُوا الطَّاغُوتَ أَن يَعْبُدُوهَا وَأَنَابُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ لَهُمُ الْبُشْرَىٰ ۚ فَبَشِّرْ عِبَادِ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Et à ceux qui s'écartent des Taghût pour ne pas les adorer, tandis qu'ils reviennent à Allah, à eux la bonne nouvelle! Annonce la bonne nouvelle à Mes serviteurs
versets.en: 17. Those who avoid At-Taghut (false deities) by not worshipping them and turn to Allah in repentance, for them are glad tidings; so announce the good news to My slaves,

versets.ar: 18. الَّذِينَ يَسْتَمِعُونَ الْقَوْلَ فَيَتَّبِعُونَ أَحْسَنَهُ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ هَدَاهُمُ اللَّهُ ۖ وَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمْ أُولُو الْأَلْبَابِ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. qui prêtent l'oreille à la Parole, puis suivent ce qu'elle contient de meilleur. Ce sont ceux-là qu'Allah a guidés et ce sont eux les doués d'intelligence!
versets.en: 18. Those who listen to the Word [good advice La ilaha ill-Allah (none has the right to be worshipped but Allah) and Islamic Monotheism, etc.] and follow the best thereof (i.e. worship Allah Alone, repent to Him and avoid Taghut, etc.) those are (the ones) whom Allah has guided and those are men of understanding (like Zaid bin 'Amr bin Nufail, Salman Al-Farisi and Abu Dhar Al-Ghifari). [Tafsir Al-Qurtubi, Vol. 12, P. 244]

versets.ar: 19. أَفَمَنْ حَقَّ عَلَيْهِ كَلِمَةُ الْعَذَابِ أَفَأَنتَ تُنقِذُ مَن فِي النَّارِ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Et bien quoi! Celui contre qui s'avère le décret du châtiment,... est-ce que tu sauves celui qui est dans le Feu?
versets.en: 19. Is, then one against whom the Word of punishment justified (equal to the one who avoids evil). Will you (O Muhammad SAW) rescue him who is in the Fire?

versets.ar: 20. لَٰكِنِ الَّذِينَ اتَّقَوْا رَبَّهُمْ لَهُمْ غُرَفٌ مِّن فَوْقِهَا غُرَفٌ مَّبْنِيَّةٌ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ ۖ وَعْدَ اللَّهِ ۖ لَا يُخْلِفُ اللَّهُ الْمِيعَادَ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. Mais ceux qui auront craint leur Seigneur auront [pour demeure] des étages [au Paradis] au-dessus desquels d'autres étages sont construits et sous lesquels coulent les rivières. Promesse d'Allah! Allah ne manque pas à Sa promesse.
versets.en: 20. But those who fear Allah and keep their duty to their Lord (Allah), for them are built lofty rooms; one above another under which rivers flow (i.e. Paradise). (This is) the Promise of Allah: and Allah does not fail in (His) Promise.

versets.ar: 21. أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ أَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَسَلَكَهُ يَنَابِيعَ فِي الْأَرْضِ ثُمَّ يُخْرِجُ بِهِ زَرْعًا مُّخْتَلِفًا أَلْوَانُهُ ثُمَّ يَهِيجُ فَتَرَاهُ مُصْفَرًّا ثُمَّ يَجْعَلُهُ حُطَامًا ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكْرَىٰ لِأُولِي الْأَلْبَابِ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Ne vois-tu pas qu'Allah fait descendre du ciel de l'eau, puis Il l'achemine vers des sources dans la terre; ensuite avec cela, Il fait sortir une culture aux couleurs diverses, laquelle se fane ensuite, de sorte que tu la vois jaunie; ensuite, Il la réduit en miettes. C'est là certainement un rappel aux [gens] doués d'intelligence.
versets.en: 21. See you not, that Allah sends down water (rain) from the sky, and causes it to penetrate the earth, (and then makes it to spring up) as water-springs and afterward thereby produces crops of different colours, and afterward they wither and you see them turn yellow, then He makes them dry and broken pieces. Verily, in this, is a Reminder for men of understanding.

versets.ar: 22. أَفَمَن شَرَحَ اللَّهُ صَدْرَهُ لِلْإِسْلَامِ فَهُوَ عَلَىٰ نُورٍ مِّن رَّبِّهِ ۚ فَوَيْلٌ لِّلْقَاسِيَةِ قُلُوبُهُم مِّن ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. Est-ce que celui dont Allah ouvre la poitrine à l'Islam et qui détient ainsi une lumière venant de Son Seigneur... Malheur donc à ceux dont les cœurs sont endurcis contre le rappel d'Allah. Ceux-là sont dans un égarement évident.
versets.en: 22. Is he whose breast Allah has opened to Islam, so that he is in light from His Lord (as he who is non-Muslim)? So, woe to those whose hearts are hardened against remembrance of Allah! They are in plain error!

versets.ar: 23. اللَّهُ نَزَّلَ أَحْسَنَ الْحَدِيثِ كِتَابًا مُّتَشَابِهًا مَّثَانِيَ تَقْشَعِرُّ مِنْهُ جُلُودُ الَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُمْ ثُمَّ تَلِينُ جُلُودُهُمْ وَقُلُوبُهُمْ إِلَىٰ ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُدَى اللَّهِ يَهْدِي بِهِ مَن يَشَاءُ ۚ وَمَن يُضْلِلِ اللَّهُ فَمَا لَهُ مِنْ هَادٍ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. Allah a fait descendre le plus beau des récits, un Livre dont [certains versets] se ressemblent et se répètent. Les peaux de ceux qui redoutent leur Seigneur frissonnent (à l'entendre); puis leurs peaux et leurs cœurs s'apaisent au rappel d'Allah. Voilà le [Livre] guide d'Allah par lequel Il guide qui Il veut. Mais quiconque Allah égare n'a point de guide.
versets.en: 23. Allah has sent down the best statement, a Book (this Quran), its parts resembling each other in goodness and truth, oft-repeated. The skins of those who fear their Lord shiver from it (when they recite it or hear it). Then their skin and their heart soften to the remembrance of Allah. That is the guidance of Allah. He Guides therewith whom He pleases and whomever Allah sends astray, for him there is no guide.

versets.ar: 24. أَفَمَن يَتَّقِي بِوَجْهِهِ سُوءَ الْعَذَابِ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ ۚ وَقِيلَ لِلظَّالِمِينَ ذُوقُوا مَا كُنتُمْ تَكْسِبُونَ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Est-ce que celui qui, au Jour de la Résurrection, se sera protégé le visage contre le pire châtiment... Et l'on dira aux injustes: «Goûtez à ce que vous avez acquis».
versets.en: 24. Is he then, who will confront with his face the awful torment on the Day of Resurrection (as he who enters peacefully in Paradise)? And it will be said to the Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc.): "Taste what you used to earn!"

versets.ar: 25. كَذَّبَ الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ فَأَتَاهُمُ الْعَذَابُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Ceux qui ont vécu avant eux ont démenti (les Messagers), le châtiment leur est venu par où ils ne le pressentaient pas.
versets.en: 25. Those before them belied, and so the torment came on them from directions they perceived not.

versets.ar: 26. فَأَذَاقَهُمُ اللَّهُ الْخِزْيَ فِي الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ الْآخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا يَعْلَمُونَ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Allah leur a fait goûter l'ignominie dans la vie présente. Le châtiment de l'au-delà, cependant, est plus grand, si seulement ils savaient!
versets.en: 26. So Allah made them to taste the disgrace in the present life, but greater is the torment of the Hereafter if they only knew!

versets.ar: 27. وَلَقَدْ ضَرَبْنَا لِلنَّاسِ فِي هَٰذَا الْقُرْآنِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍ لَّعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Nous avons, dans ce Coran, cité pour les gens des exemples de toutes sortes afin qu'ils se souviennent.
versets.en: 27. And indeed We have put forth for men, in this Quran every kind of similitude in order that they may remember.

versets.ar: 28. قُرْآنًا عَرَبِيًّا غَيْرَ ذِي عِوَجٍ لَّعَلَّهُمْ يَتَّقُونَ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Un Coran [en langue] arabe, dénué de tortuosité, afin qu'ils soient pieux!
versets.en: 28. An Arabic Quran, without any crookedness (therein) in order that they may avoid all evil which Allah has ordered them to avoid, fear Him and keep their duty to Him.

versets.ar: 29. ضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا رَّجُلًا فِيهِ شُرَكَاءُ مُتَشَاكِسُونَ وَرَجُلًا سَلَمًا لِّرَجُلٍ هَلْ يَسْتَوِيَانِ مَثَلًا ۚ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. Allah a cité comme parabole un homme appartenant à des associés se querellant à son sujet et un [autre] homme appartenant à un seul homme: sont-ils égaux en exemple? Louanges à Allah! Mais la plupart d'entre eux ne savent pas.
versets.en: 29. Allah puts forth a similitude: a (slave) man belonging to many partners (like those who worship others along with Allah) disputing with one another, and a (slave) man belonging entirely to one master, (like those who worship Allah Alone). Are those two equal in comparison? All the praises and thanks be to Allah! But most of them know not.

versets.fr: 30. En vérité tu mourras et ils mourront eux aussi;
versets.en: 30. Verily, you (O Muhammad SAW) will die and verily, they (too) will die.

versets.ar: 31. ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ عِندَ رَبِّكُمْ تَخْتَصِمُونَ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. ensuite, au Jour de la Résurrection, vous vous disputerez auprès de votre Seigneur.
versets.en: 31. Then, on the Day of Resurrection, you will be disputing before your Lord.

versets.ar: 32. ۞ فَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّن كَذَبَ عَلَى اللَّهِ وَكَذَّبَ بِالصِّدْقِ إِذْ جَاءَهُ ۚ أَلَيْسَ فِي جَهَنَّمَ مَثْوًى لِّلْكَافِرِينَ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. Quel pire injuste donc, que celui qui ment contre Allah et qui traite de mensonge la vérité quand elle lui vient? N'est-ce pas dans l'Enfer qu'il y a un refuge pour les mécréants?
versets.en: 32. Then, who does more wrong than one who utters a lie against Allah, and denies the truth [this Quran, the Prophet (Muhammad SAW), the Islamic Monotheism, the Resurrection and the reward or punishment according to good or evil deeds] when it comes to him! Is there not in Hell an abode for the disbelievers?

versets.ar: 33. وَالَّذِي جَاءَ بِالصِّدْقِ وَصَدَّقَ بِهِ ۙ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُتَّقُونَ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. Tandis que celui qui vient avec la vérité et celui qui la confirme, ceux-là sont les pieux.
versets.en: 33. And he (Muhammad SAW) who has brought the truth (this Quran and Islamic Monotheism) and (those who) believed therein (i.e. the true believers of Islamic Monotheism), those are Al- Muttaqun (the pious and righteous persons - see V. 2:2).

versets.ar: 34. لَهُم مَّا يَشَاءُونَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ جَزَاءُ الْمُحْسِنِينَ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. Ils auront tout ce qu'ils désireront auprès de leur Seigneur; voilà la récompense des bienfaisants,
versets.en: 34. They shall have all that they will desire with their Lord. That is the reward of Muhsinun (good-doers - see V. 2:112).

versets.ar: 35. لِيُكَفِّرَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُمْ أَسْوَأَ الَّذِي عَمِلُوا وَيَجْزِيَهُمْ أَجْرَهُم بِأَحْسَنِ الَّذِي كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. afin qu'Allah leur efface les pires de leurs actions et les récompense selon ce qu'ils auront fait de meilleur.
versets.en: 35. So that Allah may remit from them the evil of what they did and give them the reward, according to the best of what they used to do.

versets.ar: 36. أَلَيْسَ اللَّهُ بِكَافٍ عَبْدَهُ ۖ وَيُخَوِّفُونَكَ بِالَّذِينَ مِن دُونِهِ ۚ وَمَن يُضْلِلِ اللَّهُ فَمَا لَهُ مِنْ هَادٍ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. Allah ne suffit-Il pas à Son esclave [comme soutien]? Et ils te font peur avec ce qui est en dehors de Lui. Et quiconque Allah égare n'a point de guide.
versets.en: 36. Is not Allah Sufficient for His slave? Yet they try to frighten you with those (whom they worship) besides Him! And whom Allah sends astray, for him there will be no guide.

versets.ar: 37. وَمَن يَهْدِ اللَّهُ فَمَا لَهُ مِن مُّضِلٍّ ۗ أَلَيْسَ اللَّهُ بِعَزِيزٍ ذِي انتِقَامٍ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. Quiconque Allah guide, nul ne peut l'égarer. Allah n'est-Il pas Puissant et Détenteur du pouvoir de châtier?
versets.en: 37. And whomsoever Allah guides, for him there will be no misleader. Is not Allah All-Mighty, Possessor of Retribution?

versets.ar: 38. وَلَئِن سَأَلْتَهُم مَّنْ خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ لَيَقُولُنَّ اللَّهُ ۚ قُلْ أَفَرَأَيْتُم مَّا تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ إِنْ أَرَادَنِيَ اللَّهُ بِضُرٍّ هَلْ هُنَّ كَاشِفَاتُ ضُرِّهِ أَوْ أَرَادَنِي بِرَحْمَةٍ هَلْ هُنَّ مُمْسِكَاتُ رَحْمَتِهِ ۚ قُلْ حَسْبِيَ اللَّهُ ۖ عَلَيْهِ يَتَوَكَّلُ الْمُتَوَكِّلُونَ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. Si tu leur demandais: «Qui a créé les cieux et la terre?», Ils diraient assurément: «Allah». Dis: «Voyez-vous ceux que vous invoquez en dehors d'Allah; si Allah me voulait du mal, est-ce que [ces divinités] pourraient dissiper Son mal? Ou s'Il me voulait une miséricorde, pourraient-elles retenir Sa miséricorde?» - Dis: «Allah me suffit: c'est en Lui que placent leur confiance ceux qui cherchent un appui».
versets.en: 38. And verily, if you ask them: "Who created the heavens and the earth?" Surely, they will say: "Allah (has created them)." Say: "Tell me then, the things that you invoke besides Allah, if Allah intended some harm for me, could they remove His harm, or if He (Allah) intended some mercy for me, could they withhold His Mercy?" Say: "Sufficient for me is Allah; in Him those who trust (i.e. believers) must put their trust."

versets.ar: 39. قُلْ يَا قَوْمِ اعْمَلُوا عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِكُمْ إِنِّي عَامِلٌ ۖ فَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. Dis: «O mon peuple, agissez selon votre méthode, moi j'agirai [selon la mienne]. Bientôt vous saurez
versets.en: 39. Say: (O Muhammad SAW) "O My people! Work according to your way, I am working (according to my way). Then you will come to know,

versets.ar: 40. مَن يَأْتِيهِ عَذَابٌ يُخْزِيهِ وَيَحِلُّ عَلَيْهِ عَذَابٌ مُّقِيمٌ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. sur qui s'abattra un châtiment qui l'avilira; et sur qui se justifiera un châtiment durable».
versets.en: 40. "To whom comes a disgracing torment, and on whom descends an everlasting torment."

versets.ar: 41. إِنَّا أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْكَ الْكِتَابَ لِلنَّاسِ بِالْحَقِّ ۖ فَمَنِ اهْتَدَىٰ فَلِنَفْسِهِ ۖ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَإِنَّمَا يَضِلُّ عَلَيْهَا ۖ وَمَا أَنتَ عَلَيْهِم بِوَكِيلٍ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. Nous t'avons fait descendre le Livre, pour les hommes, en toute vérité. Quiconque se guide [le fait] pour son propre bien; et quiconque s'égare, s'égare à son détriment. Tu n'es nullement responsable [de leurs propres affaires].
versets.en: 41. Verily, We have sent down to you (O Muhammad SAW) the Book (this Quran) for mankind in truth. So whosoever accepts the guidance, it is only for his ownself, and whosoever goes astray, he goes astray only for his (own) loss. And you (O Muhammad SAW) are not a Wakil (trustee or disposer of affairs, or keeper) over them.

versets.ar: 42. اللَّهُ يَتَوَفَّى الْأَنفُسَ حِينَ مَوْتِهَا وَالَّتِي لَمْ تَمُتْ فِي مَنَامِهَا ۖ فَيُمْسِكُ الَّتِي قَضَىٰ عَلَيْهَا الْمَوْتَ وَيُرْسِلُ الْأُخْرَىٰ إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. Allah reçoit les âmes au moment de leur mort ainsi que celles qui ne meurent pas au cours de leur sommeil. Il retient celles à qui Il a décrété la mort, tandis qu'Il renvoie les autres jusqu'à un terme fixé. Il y a certainement là des preuves pour des gens qui réfléchissent.
versets.en: 42. It is Allah Who takes away the souls at the time of their death, and those that die not during their sleep. He keeps those (souls) for which He has ordained death and sends the rest for a term appointed. Verily, in this are signs for a people who think deeply.

versets.ar: 43. أَمِ اتَّخَذُوا مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ شُفَعَاءَ ۚ قُلْ أَوَلَوْ كَانُوا لَا يَمْلِكُونَ شَيْئًا وَلَا يَعْقِلُونَ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. Ont-ils adopté, en dehors d'Allah, des intercesseurs? Dis: «Quoi! Même s'ils ne détiennent rien et sont dépourvus de raison?
versets.en: 43. Have they taken others as intercessors besides Allah? Say: "Even if they have power over nothing whatever and have no intelligence?"

versets.ar: 44. قُل لِّلَّهِ الشَّفَاعَةُ جَمِيعًا ۖ لَّهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ ثُمَّ إِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. Dis: «L'intercession toute entière appartient à Allah. A Lui la royauté des cieux et de la terre. Puis c'est vers Lui que vous serez ramenés».
versets.en: 44. Say: "To Allah belongs all intercession. His is the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, then to Him you shall be brought back."

versets.ar: 45. وَإِذَا ذُكِرَ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ اشْمَأَزَّتْ قُلُوبُ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ ۖ وَإِذَا ذُكِرَ الَّذِينَ مِن دُونِهِ إِذَا هُمْ يَسْتَبْشِرُونَ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. Et quand Allah est mentionné seul (sans associés), les cœurs de ceux qui ne croient pas en l'au-delà se crispent et quand on mentionne ceux qui sont en dehors de Lui, voilà qu'ils se réjouissent.
versets.en: 45. And when Allah Alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who believe not in the Hereafter are filled with disgust (from the Oneness of Allah and when those (whom they obey or worship) besides Him [like all false deities other than Allah, it may be a Messenger like 'Iesa (Jesus) - son of Maryam (Mary), 'Uzair (Ezra), an angel, a pious man, a jinn, or any other creature even idols, graves of religious people, saints, priests, monks, etc.] are mentioned, behold, they rejoice!

versets.ar: 46. قُلِ اللَّهُمَّ فَاطِرَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ عَالِمَ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ أَنتَ تَحْكُمُ بَيْنَ عِبَادِكَ فِي مَا كَانُوا فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. Dis: «O Allah, Créateur des cieux et de la terre, Connaisseur de tout ce que le monde ignore comme de ce qu'il perçoit, c'est Toi qui jugeras entre Tes serviteurs ce sur quoi ils divergeaient».
versets.en: 46. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "O Allah! Creator of the heavens and the earth! All-Knower of the Ghaib (unseen) and the seen. You will judge between your slaves about that wherein they used to differ."

versets.ar: 47. وَلَوْ أَنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا مَا فِي الْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا وَمِثْلَهُ مَعَهُ لَافْتَدَوْا بِهِ مِن سُوءِ الْعَذَابِ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ ۚ وَبَدَا لَهُم مِّنَ اللَّهِ مَا لَمْ يَكُونُوا يَحْتَسِبُونَ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. Si les injustes possédaient tout ce qui se trouve sur la terre, - et autant encore -, ils l'offriraient comme rançon pour échapper au pire châtiment le Jour de la Résurrection; et leur apparaîtra, de la part d'Allah, ce qu'ils n'avaient jamais imaginé;
versets.en: 47. And those who did wrong (the polytheists and disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah), if they had all that is in earth and therewith as much again, they verily, would offer it to ransom themselves therewith on the Day of Resurrection from the evil torment, and there will become apparent to them from Allah, what they had not been reckoning.

versets.ar: 48. وَبَدَا لَهُمْ سَيِّئَاتُ مَا كَسَبُوا وَحَاقَ بِهِم مَّا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. et leur apparaîtront les méfaits qu'ils ont commis, et ce dont ils se raillaient les enveloppera.
versets.en: 48. And the evils of that which they earned will become apparent to them, and they will be encircled by that which they used to mock at!

versets.ar: 49. فَإِذَا مَسَّ الْإِنسَانَ ضُرٌّ دَعَانَا ثُمَّ إِذَا خَوَّلْنَاهُ نِعْمَةً مِّنَّا قَالَ إِنَّمَا أُوتِيتُهُ عَلَىٰ عِلْمٍ ۚ بَلْ هِيَ فِتْنَةٌ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. Quand un malheur touche l'homme, il Nous invoque. Quand ensuite Nous lui accordons une faveur de Notre part, il dit: «Je ne la dois qu'à [ma] science». C'est une épreuve, plutôt; mais la plupart d'entre eux ne savent pas.
versets.en: 49. When harm touches man, he calls to Us (for help), then when We have (rescued him from that harm and) changed it into a favour from Us, he says: "Only because of knowledge (that I possess) I obtained it." Nay, it is only a trial, but most of them know not!

versets.ar: 50. قَدْ قَالَهَا الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ فَمَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. Ainsi parlaient ceux qui vécurent avant eux. Mais ce qu'ils ont acquis ne leur a servi à rien;
versets.en: 50. Verily, those before them said it, yet (all) that they had earned availed them not.

versets.ar: 51. فَأَصَابَهُمْ سَيِّئَاتُ مَا كَسَبُوا ۚ وَالَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا مِنْ هَٰؤُلَاءِ سَيُصِيبُهُمْ سَيِّئَاتُ مَا كَسَبُوا وَمَا هُم بِمُعْجِزِينَ ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. Ils furent donc atteints par les mauvaises conséquences de leurs acquis. Ceux de ces gens [les Mecquois] qui auront commis l'injustice seront atteints par les mauvaises conséquences de leurs acquis et ils ne pourront s'opposer à la puissance [d'Allah].
versets.en: 51. So, the evil results of that which they earned overtook them. And those who did wrong of these [people to whom you (Muhammad SAW) have been sent], will also be overtaken by the evil results (torment) for that which they earned, and they will never be able to escape.

versets.ar: 52. أَوَلَمْ يَعْلَمُوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَبْسُطُ الرِّزْقَ لِمَن يَشَاءُ وَيَقْدِرُ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. Ne savent-ils pas qu'Allah attribue Ses dons avec largesse ou les restreint à qui Il veut? Il y a en cela des preuves pour des gens qui croient.
versets.en: 52. Do they not know that Allah enlarges the provision for whom He wills, and straitens it (for whom He wills). Verily, in this are signs for the folk who believe!

versets.ar: 53. ۞ قُلْ يَا عِبَادِيَ الَّذِينَ أَسْرَفُوا عَلَىٰ أَنفُسِهِمْ لَا تَقْنَطُوا مِن رَّحْمَةِ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ جَمِيعًا ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ ﴿53﴾
versets.fr: 53. Dis: «O Mes serviteurs qui avez commis des excès à votre propre détriment, ne désespérez pas de la miséricorde d'Allah. Car Allah pardonne tous les péchés. Oui, c'est Lui le Pardonneur, le Très Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 53. Say: "O 'Ibadi (My slaves) who have transgressed against themselves (by committing evil deeds and sins)! Despair not of the Mercy of Allah, verily Allah forgives all sins. Truly, He is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

versets.ar: 54. وَأَنِيبُوا إِلَىٰ رَبِّكُمْ وَأَسْلِمُوا لَهُ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِيَكُمُ الْعَذَابُ ثُمَّ لَا تُنصَرُونَ ﴿54﴾
versets.fr: 54. Et revenez repentant à votre Seigneur, et soumettez-vous à Lui, avant que ne vous vienne le châtiment et vous ne recevez alors aucun secours.
versets.en: 54. "And turn in repentance and in obedience with true Faith (Islamic Monotheism) to your Lord and submit to Him, (in Islam), before the torment comes upon you, then you will not be helped.

versets.ar: 55. وَاتَّبِعُوا أَحْسَنَ مَا أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكُم مِّن رَّبِّكُم مِّن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِيَكُمُ الْعَذَابُ بَغْتَةً وَأَنتُمْ لَا تَشْعُرُونَ ﴿55﴾
versets.fr: 55. Et suivez la meilleure révélation qui vous est descendue de la part de votre Seigneur, avant que le châtiment ne vous vienne soudain, sans que vous ne [le] pressentiez;
versets.en: 55. "And follow the best of that which is sent down to you from your Lord (i.e. this Quran, do what it orders you to do and keep away from what it forbids), before the torment comes on you suddenly while you perceive not!"

versets.ar: 56. أَن تَقُولَ نَفْسٌ يَا حَسْرَتَا عَلَىٰ مَا فَرَّطتُ فِي جَنبِ اللَّهِ وَإِن كُنتُ لَمِنَ السَّاخِرِينَ ﴿56﴾
versets.fr: 56. avant qu'une âme ne dise: «Malheur à moi pour mes manquements envers Allah. Car j'ai été certes, parmi les railleurs»
versets.en: 56. Lest a person should say: "Alas, my grief that I was undutiful to Allah (i.e. I have not done what Allah has ordered me to do), and I was indeed among those who mocked [at the truth! i.e. La ilaha ill-Allah (none has the right to be worshipped but Allah), the Quran, and Muhammad SAW and at the faithful believers, etc.]

versets.ar: 57. أَوْ تَقُولَ لَوْ أَنَّ اللَّهَ هَدَانِي لَكُنتُ مِنَ الْمُتَّقِينَ ﴿57﴾
versets.fr: 57. ou qu'elle ne dise: «Si Allah m'avait guidée, j'aurais été certes, parmi les pieux»
versets.en: 57. Or (lest) he should say: "If only Allah had guided me, I should indeed have been among the Muttaqun (pious and righteous persons - see V. 2:2)."

versets.ar: 58. أَوْ تَقُولَ حِينَ تَرَى الْعَذَابَ لَوْ أَنَّ لِي كَرَّةً فَأَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُحْسِنِينَ ﴿58﴾
versets.fr: 58. ou bien qu'elle ne dise en voyant le châtiment: «Ah! S'il y avait pour moi un retour! Je serais alors parmi les bienfaisants».
versets.en: 58. Or (lest) he should say when he sees the torment: "If only I had another chance (to return to the world) then I should indeed be among the Muhsinun (good-doers - see V. 2:112)."

versets.ar: 59. بَلَىٰ قَدْ جَاءَتْكَ آيَاتِي فَكَذَّبْتَ بِهَا وَاسْتَكْبَرْتَ وَكُنتَ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ ﴿59﴾
versets.fr: 59. «Oh que si! Mes versets te sont venus et tu les as traités de mensonge, tu t'es enflé d'orgueil et tu étais parmi les mécréants».
versets.en: 59. Yes! Verily, there came to you My Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) and you denied them, and were proud and were among the disbelievers.

versets.ar: 60. وَيَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ تَرَى الَّذِينَ كَذَبُوا عَلَى اللَّهِ وُجُوهُهُم مُّسْوَدَّةٌ ۚ أَلَيْسَ فِي جَهَنَّمَ مَثْوًى لِّلْمُتَكَبِّرِينَ ﴿60﴾
versets.fr: 60. Et au Jour de la Résurrection, tu verras les visages de ceux qui mentaient sur Allah, assombris. N'est-ce pas dans l'Enfer qu'il y aura une demeure pour les orgueilleux?
versets.en: 60. And on the Day of Resurrection you will see those who lied against Allah (i.e. attributed to Him sons, partners, etc.) their faces will be black. Is there not in Hell an abode for the arrogant ones?

versets.ar: 61. وَيُنَجِّي اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ اتَّقَوْا بِمَفَازَتِهِمْ لَا يَمَسُّهُمُ السُّوءُ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ ﴿61﴾
versets.fr: 61. Et Allah sauvera ceux qui ont été pieux en leur faisant gagner [leur place au Paradis]. Nul mal ne les touchera et ils ne seront point affligés.
versets.en: 61. And Allah will deliver those who are the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2) to their places of success (Paradise). Evil shall touch them not, nor shall they grieve.

versets.ar: 62. اللَّهُ خَالِقُ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ ۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَكِيلٌ ﴿62﴾
versets.fr: 62. Allah est le Créateur de toute chose, et de toute chose Il est Garant.
versets.en: 62. Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the Wakil (Trustee, Disposer of affairs, Guardian, etc.) over all things.

versets.ar: 63. لَّهُ مَقَالِيدُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۗ وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِآيَاتِ اللَّهِ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْخَاسِرُونَ ﴿63﴾
versets.fr: 63. Il détient les clefs des cieux et de la terre; et ceux qui ne croient pas aux versets d'Allah, ce sont ceux-là les perdants.
versets.en: 63. To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. And those who disbelieve in the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, signs, revelations, etc.) of Allah, such are they who will be the losers.

versets.ar: 64. قُلْ أَفَغَيْرَ اللَّهِ تَأْمُرُونِّي أَعْبُدُ أَيُّهَا الْجَاهِلُونَ ﴿64﴾
versets.fr: 64. Dis: «Me commanderez-vous d'adorer autre qu'Allah, O ignorants?»
versets.en: 64. Say (O Muhammad SAW to the polytheists, etc.): "Do you order me to worship other than Allah O you fools?"

versets.ar: 65. وَلَقَدْ أُوحِيَ إِلَيْكَ وَإِلَى الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِكَ لَئِنْ أَشْرَكْتَ لَيَحْبَطَنَّ عَمَلُكَ وَلَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْخَاسِرِينَ ﴿65﴾
versets.fr: 65. En effet, il t'a été révélé, ainsi qu'à ceux qui t'ont précédé: «Si tu donnes des associés à Allah, ton œuvre sera certes vaine; et tu seras très certainement du nombre des perdants.
versets.en: 65. And indeed it has been revealed to you (O Muhammad SAW), as it was to those (Allah's Messengers) before you: "If you join others in worship with Allah, (then) surely (all) your deeds will be in vain, and you will certainly be among the losers."

versets.ar: 66. بَلِ اللَّهَ فَاعْبُدْ وَكُن مِّنَ الشَّاكِرِينَ ﴿66﴾
versets.fr: 66. Tout au contraire, adore Allah seul et sois du nombre des reconnaissants».
versets.en: 66. Nay! But worship Allah (Alone and none else), and be among the grateful.

versets.ar: 67. وَمَا قَدَرُوا اللَّهَ حَقَّ قَدْرِهِ وَالْأَرْضُ جَمِيعًا قَبْضَتُهُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ وَالسَّمَاوَاتُ مَطْوِيَّاتٌ بِيَمِينِهِ ۚ سُبْحَانَهُ وَتَعَالَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ ﴿67﴾
versets.fr: 67. Ils n'ont pas estimé Allah comme Il devrait l'être alors qu'au Jour de la Résurrection, Il fera de la terre entière une poignée, et les cieux seront pliés dans Sa [main] droite. Gloire à Lui! Il est au-dessus de ce qu'ils Lui associent.
versets.en: 67. They made not a just estimate of Allah such as is due to Him. And on the Day of Resurrection the whole of the earth will be grasped by His Hand and the heavens will be rolled up in His Right Hand. Glorified is He, and High is He above all that they associate as partners with Him!

versets.ar: 68. وَنُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ فَصَعِقَ مَن فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَن فِي الْأَرْضِ إِلَّا مَن شَاءَ اللَّهُ ۖ ثُمَّ نُفِخَ فِيهِ أُخْرَىٰ فَإِذَا هُمْ قِيَامٌ يَنظُرُونَ ﴿68﴾
versets.fr: 68. Et on soufflera dans la Trompe, et voilà que ceux qui seront dans les cieux et ceux qui seront sur la terre seront foudroyés, sauf ceux qu'Allah voudra [épargner]. Puis on y soufflera de nouveau, et les voilà debout à regarder.
versets.en: 68. And the Trumpet will be blown, and all who are in the heavens and all who are on the earth will swoon away, except him whom Allah will. Then it will blown a second time and behold, they will be standing, looking on (waiting).

versets.ar: 69. وَأَشْرَقَتِ الْأَرْضُ بِنُورِ رَبِّهَا وَوُضِعَ الْكِتَابُ وَجِيءَ بِالنَّبِيِّينَ وَالشُّهَدَاءِ وَقُضِيَ بَيْنَهُم بِالْحَقِّ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ ﴿69﴾
versets.fr: 69. Et la terre resplendira de la lumière de son Seigneur; le Livre sera déposé et on fera venir les prophètes et les témoins; on décidera parmi eux en toute équité et ils ne seront point lésés;
versets.en: 69. And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord (Allah, when He will come to judge among men) and the Book will be placed (open) and the Prophets and the witnesses will be brought forward, and it will be judged between them with truth, and they will not be wronged.

versets.ar: 70. وَوُفِّيَتْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَّا عَمِلَتْ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَفْعَلُونَ ﴿70﴾
versets.fr: 70. et chaque âme sera pleinement rétribuée pour ce qu'elle aura œuvré. Il [Allah] connaît mieux ce qu'ils font.
versets.en: 70. And each person will be paid in full of what he did; and He is Best Aware of what they do.

versets.ar: 71. وَسِيقَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ زُمَرًا ۖ حَتَّىٰ إِذَا جَاءُوهَا فُتِحَتْ أَبْوَابُهَا وَقَالَ لَهُمْ خَزَنَتُهَا أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ رُسُلٌ مِّنكُمْ يَتْلُونَ عَلَيْكُمْ آيَاتِ رَبِّكُمْ وَيُنذِرُونَكُمْ لِقَاءَ يَوْمِكُمْ هَٰذَا ۚ قَالُوا بَلَىٰ وَلَٰكِنْ حَقَّتْ كَلِمَةُ الْعَذَابِ عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ ﴿71﴾
versets.fr: 71. Et ceux qui avaient mécru seront conduits par groupes à l'Enfer. Puis, quand ils y parviendront, ses portes s'ouvriront et ses gardiens leur diront: «Des messagers [choisis] parmi vous ne vous sont-ils pas venus, vous récitant les versets de votre Seigneur et vous avertissant de la rencontre de votre jour que voici?» Ils diront: si, mais le décret du châtiment s'est avéré juste contre les mécréants.
versets.en: 71. And those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in groups, till, when they reach it, the gates thereof will be opened (suddenly like a prison at the arrival of the prisoners). And its keepers will say, "Did not the Messengers come to you from yourselves, reciting to you the Verses of your Lord, and warning you of the Meeting of this Day of yours?" They will say: "Yes, but the Word of torment has been justified against the disbelievers!"

versets.ar: 72. قِيلَ ادْخُلُوا أَبْوَابَ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۖ فَبِئْسَ مَثْوَى الْمُتَكَبِّرِينَ ﴿72﴾
versets.fr: 72. «Entrez, [leur] dira-t-on, par les portes de l'Enfer, pour y demeurer éternellement». Qu'il est mauvais le lieu de séjour des orgueilleux!
versets.en: 72. It will be said (to them): "Enter you the gates of Hell, to abide therein. And (indeed) what an evil abode of the arrogant!"

versets.ar: 73. وَسِيقَ الَّذِينَ اتَّقَوْا رَبَّهُمْ إِلَى الْجَنَّةِ زُمَرًا ۖ حَتَّىٰ إِذَا جَاءُوهَا وَفُتِحَتْ أَبْوَابُهَا وَقَالَ لَهُمْ خَزَنَتُهَا سَلَامٌ عَلَيْكُمْ طِبْتُمْ فَادْخُلُوهَا خَالِدِينَ ﴿73﴾
versets.fr: 73. Et ceux qui avaient craint leur Seigneur seront conduits par groupes au Paradis. Puis, quand ils y parviendront et que ses portes s'ouvriront ses gardiens leur diront: «Salut à vous! vous avez été bons: entrez donc, pour y demeurer éternellement».
versets.en: 73. And those who kept their duty to their Lord will be led to Paradise in groups, till, when they reach it, and its gates will be opened (before their arrival for their reception) and its keepers will say: Salamun 'Alaikum (peace be upon you)! You have done well, so enter here to abide therein."

versets.ar: 74. وَقَالُوا الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي صَدَقَنَا وَعْدَهُ وَأَوْرَثَنَا الْأَرْضَ نَتَبَوَّأُ مِنَ الْجَنَّةِ حَيْثُ نَشَاءُ ۖ فَنِعْمَ أَجْرُ الْعَامِلِينَ ﴿74﴾
versets.fr: 74. Et ils diront: «Louange à Allah qui nous a tenu Sa promesse et nous a fait hériter la terre! Nous allons nous installer dans le Paradis là où nous voulons». Que la récompense de ceux qui font le bien est excellente!
versets.en: 74. And they will say: "All the praises and thanks be to Allah Who has fulfilled His Promise to us and has made us inherit (this) land. We can dwell in Paradise where we will; how excellent a reward for the (pious good) workers!"

versets.ar: 75. وَتَرَى الْمَلَائِكَةَ حَافِّينَ مِنْ حَوْلِ الْعَرْشِ يُسَبِّحُونَ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّهِمْ ۖ وَقُضِيَ بَيْنَهُم بِالْحَقِّ وَقِيلَ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿75﴾
versets.fr: 75. Et tu verras les Anges faisant cercle autour du Trône, célébrant les louanges de leur Seigneur et Le glorifiant. Et il sera jugé entre eux en toute équité, et l'on dira: «Louange à Allah, Seigneur de l'univers».
versets.en: 75. And you will see the angels surrounding the Throne (of Allah) from all round, glorifying the praises of their Lord (Allah). And they (all the creatures) will be judged with truth, and it will be said. All the praises and thanks be to Allah, the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists).

versets.fr: 1. H'â, Mîm.
versets.en: 1. Ha-Mim. [These letters are one of the miracles of the Quran, and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings].

versets.ar: 2. تَنزِيلُ الْكِتَابِ مِنَ اللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْعَلِيمِ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. La révélation du Livre vient d'Allah, le Puissant, l'Omniscient.
versets.en: 2. The revelation of the Book (this Quran) is from Allah the All-Mighty, the All-Knower.

versets.ar: 3. غَافِرِ الذَّنبِ وَقَابِلِ التَّوْبِ شَدِيدِ الْعِقَابِ ذِي الطَّوْلِ ۖ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ إِلَيْهِ الْمَصِيرُ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Le Pardonneur des péchés, l'Accueillant au repentir, le Dur en punition, le Détenteur des faveurs. Point de divinité à part Lui et vers Lui est la destination.
versets.en: 3. The Forgiver of sin, the Acceptor of repentance, the Severe in punishment, the Bestower (of favours), La ilaha illa Huwa (none has the right to be worshipped but He), to Him is the final return.

versets.ar: 4. مَا يُجَادِلُ فِي آيَاتِ اللَّهِ إِلَّا الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فَلَا يَغْرُرْكَ تَقَلُّبُهُمْ فِي الْبِلَادِ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Seuls ceux qui ont mécru discutent les versets d'Allah. Que leurs activités dans le pays ne te trompent pas.
versets.en: 4. None disputes in the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) of Allah but those who disbelieve. So let not their ability of going about here and there through the land (for their purposes) deceive you [O Muhammad SAW, their ultimate end will be the Fire of Hell]!

versets.ar: 5. كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَالْأَحْزَابُ مِن بَعْدِهِمْ ۖ وَهَمَّتْ كُلُّ أُمَّةٍ بِرَسُولِهِمْ لِيَأْخُذُوهُ ۖ وَجَادَلُوا بِالْبَاطِلِ لِيُدْحِضُوا بِهِ الْحَقَّ فَأَخَذْتُهُمْ ۖ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عِقَابِ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Avant eux, le peuple de Noé a traité (Son Messager) de menteur, et les coalisés après eux (ont fait de même), et chaque communauté a conçu le dessein de s'emparer de Son Messager. Et ils ont discuté de faux arguments pour rejeter la vérité. Alors Je les ai saisis. Et quelle punition fut la Mienne!
versets.en: 5. The people of Nuh (Noah) and the confederates after them denied (their Messengers) before these, and every (disbelieving) nation plotted against their Messenger to seize him, and disputed by means of falsehood to refute therewith the truth. So I seized them (with punishment), and how (terrible) was My punishment!

versets.ar: 6. وَكَذَٰلِكَ حَقَّتْ كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ عَلَى الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا أَنَّهُمْ أَصْحَابُ النَّارِ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Ainsi s'avéra juste la Parole de ton Seigneur contre ceux qui ont mécru: «Ils seront les gens du Feu».
versets.en: 6. Thus has the Word of your Lord been justified against those who disbelieved, that they will be the dwellers of the Fire.

versets.ar: 7. الَّذِينَ يَحْمِلُونَ الْعَرْشَ وَمَنْ حَوْلَهُ يُسَبِّحُونَ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّهِمْ وَيُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِ وَيَسْتَغْفِرُونَ لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا رَبَّنَا وَسِعْتَ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ رَّحْمَةً وَعِلْمًا فَاغْفِرْ لِلَّذِينَ تَابُوا وَاتَّبَعُوا سَبِيلَكَ وَقِهِمْ عَذَابَ الْجَحِيمِ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. Ceux (les Anges) qui portent le Trône et ceux qui l'entourent célèbrent les louanges de leur Seigneur, croient en Lui et implorent le pardon pour ceux qui croient: «Seigneur! Tu étends sur toute chose Ta miséricorde et Ta science. Pardonne donc à ceux qui se repentent et suivent Ton chemin et protège-les du châtiment de l'Enfer.
versets.en: 7. Those (angels) who bear the Throne (of Allah) and those around it glorify the praises of their Lord, and believe in Him, and ask forgiveness for those who believe (in the Oneness of Allah) (saying): "Our Lord! You comprehend all things in mercy and knowledge, so forgive those who repent and follow Your Way, and save them from the torment of the blazing Fire!

versets.ar: 8. رَبَّنَا وَأَدْخِلْهُمْ جَنَّاتِ عَدْنٍ الَّتِي وَعَدتَّهُمْ وَمَن صَلَحَ مِنْ آبَائِهِمْ وَأَزْوَاجِهِمْ وَذُرِّيَّاتِهِمْ ۚ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Seigneur! Fais-les entrer aux jardins d'Eden que Tu leur as promis, ainsi qu'aux vertueux parmi leurs ancêtres, leurs épouses et leurs descendants, car c'est Toi le Puissant, le Sage.
versets.en: 8. "Our Lord! And make them enter the 'Adn (Eden) Paradise (everlasting Gardens) which you have promised them, and to the righteous among their fathers, their wives, and their offspring! Verily, You are the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

versets.ar: 9. وَقِهِمُ السَّيِّئَاتِ ۚ وَمَن تَقِ السَّيِّئَاتِ يَوْمَئِذٍ فَقَدْ رَحِمْتَهُ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Et préserve-les [du châtiment] des mauvaises actions. Quiconque Tu préserves [du châtiment] des mauvaises actions ce jour-là, Tu lui feras miséricorde». Et c'est là l'énorme succès.
versets.en: 9. "And save them from (the punishment, because of what they did of) the sins, and whomsoever You save from (the punishment, because of what they did of) the sins (i.e. excuse them) that Day, him verily, You have taken into mercy." And that is the supreme success.

versets.ar: 10. إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا يُنَادَوْنَ لَمَقْتُ اللَّهِ أَكْبَرُ مِن مَّقْتِكُمْ أَنفُسَكُمْ إِذْ تُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى الْإِيمَانِ فَتَكْفُرُونَ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. A ceux qui n'auront pas cru on proclamera: «l'aversion d'Allah [envers vous] est plus grande que votre aversion envers vous-mêmes, lorsque vous étiez appelés à la foi et que vous persistiez dans la mécréance».
versets.en: 10. Those who disbelieve will be addressed (at the time of entering into the Fire): "Allah's aversion was greater towards you (in the worldly life when you used to reject the Faith) than your aversion towards one another (now in the Fire of Hell, as you are now enemies to one another), when you were called to the Faith but you used to refuse."

versets.ar: 11. قَالُوا رَبَّنَا أَمَتَّنَا اثْنَتَيْنِ وَأَحْيَيْتَنَا اثْنَتَيْنِ فَاعْتَرَفْنَا بِذُنُوبِنَا فَهَلْ إِلَىٰ خُرُوجٍ مِّن سَبِيلٍ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. Ils diront: «Notre Seigneur, Tu nous as fais mourir deux fois et redonné la vie deux fois: nous reconnaissons donc nos péchés. Y a-t-il un moyen d'en sortir?»
versets.en: 11. They will say: "Our Lord! You have made us to die twice (i.e. we were dead in the loins of our fathers and dead after our deaths in this world), and You have given us life twice (i.e. life when we were born and life when we are Resurrected)! Now we confess our sins, then is there any way to get out (of the Fire)?"

versets.ar: 12. ذَٰلِكُم بِأَنَّهُ إِذَا دُعِيَ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ كَفَرْتُمْ ۖ وَإِن يُشْرَكْ بِهِ تُؤْمِنُوا ۚ فَالْحُكْمُ لِلَّهِ الْعَلِيِّ الْكَبِيرِ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. «... Il en est ainsi car lorsqu'Allah était invoqué seul (sans associé), vous ne croyiez pas; et si on Lui donnait des associés, alors vous croyiez. Le jugement appartient à Allah, le Très Haut, le Très Grand».
versets.en: 12. (It will be said): "This is because, when Allah Alone was invoked (in worship, etc.) you disbelieved, but when partners were joined to Him, you believed! So the judgement is only with Allah, the Most High, the Most Great!"

versets.ar: 13. هُوَ الَّذِي يُرِيكُمْ آيَاتِهِ وَيُنَزِّلُ لَكُم مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ رِزْقًا ۚ وَمَا يَتَذَكَّرُ إِلَّا مَن يُنِيبُ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. C'est Lui qui vous fait voir Ses preuves, et fait descendre du ciel, pour vous, une subsistance. Seul se rappelle celui qui revient [à Allah].
versets.en: 13. It is He, Who shows you His Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) and sends down (rain with which grows) provision for you from the sky. And none remembers but those who turn (to Allah) in obedience and in repentance (by begging His Pardon and by worshipping and obeying Him Alone and none else).

versets.ar: 14. فَادْعُوا اللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ الدِّينَ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ الْكَافِرُونَ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. Invoquez Allah donc, en Lui vouant un culte exclusif quelque répulsion qu'en aient les mécréants.
versets.en: 14. So, call you (O Muhammad SAW and the believers) upon (or invoke) Allah making (your) worship pure for Him (Alone) (by worshipping none but Him and by doing religious deeds sincerely for Allah's sake only and not to show-off and not to set up rivals with Him in worship). However much the disbelievers (in the Oneness of Allah) may hate (it).

versets.ar: 15. رَفِيعُ الدَّرَجَاتِ ذُو الْعَرْشِ يُلْقِي الرُّوحَ مِنْ أَمْرِهِ عَلَىٰ مَن يَشَاءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ لِيُنذِرَ يَوْمَ التَّلَاقِ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Il est Celui qui est élevé aux degrés les plus hauts, Possesseur du Trône, Il envoie par son ordre l'Esprit sur celui qu'Il veut parmi Ses serviteurs, afin que celui-ci avertisse du jour de la Rencontre,
versets.en: 15. (He is Allah) Owner of High Ranks and Degrees, the Owner of the Throne. He sends the Inspiration by His Command to any of His slaves He wills, that he (the person who receives inspiration) may warn (men) of the Day of Mutual Meeting (i.e. The Day of Resurrection).

versets.ar: 16. يَوْمَ هُم بَارِزُونَ ۖ لَا يَخْفَىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ مِنْهُمْ شَيْءٌ ۚ لِّمَنِ الْمُلْكُ الْيَوْمَ ۖ لِلَّهِ الْوَاحِدِ الْقَهَّارِ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. le jour où ils comparaîtront sans que rien en eux ne soit caché à Allah. A qui appartient la royauté, aujourd'hui? A Allah, l'Unique, le Dominateur.
versets.en: 16. The Day when they will (all) come out, nothing of them will be hidden from Allah. Whose is the kingdom this Day? (Allah Himself will reply to His Question): It is Allah's the One, the Irresistible!

versets.ar: 17. الْيَوْمَ تُجْزَىٰ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ ۚ لَا ظُلْمَ الْيَوْمَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَرِيعُ الْحِسَابِ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Ce jour-là, chaque âme sera rétribuée selon ce qu'elle aura acquis. Ce jour-là, pas d'injustice, car Allah est prompt dans [Ses] comptes.
versets.en: 17. This Day shall every person be recompensed for what he earned. No injustice (shall be done to anybody). Truly, Allah is Swift in reckoning.

versets.ar: 18. وَأَنذِرْهُمْ يَوْمَ الْآزِفَةِ إِذِ الْقُلُوبُ لَدَى الْحَنَاجِرِ كَاظِمِينَ ۚ مَا لِلظَّالِمِينَ مِنْ حَمِيمٍ وَلَا شَفِيعٍ يُطَاعُ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. Et avertis-les du jour qui approche, quand les cœurs remonteront aux gorges, terrifiés (ou angoissés). Les injustes n'auront ni ami zélé, ni intercesseur écouté.
versets.en: 18. And warn them (O Muhammad SAW) of the Day that is drawing near (i.e. the Day of Resurrection), when the hearts will be choking the throats, and they can neither return them (hearts) to their chests nor can they throw them out. There will be no friend, nor an intercessor for the Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc.), who could be given heed to.

versets.ar: 19. يَعْلَمُ خَائِنَةَ الْأَعْيُنِ وَمَا تُخْفِي الصُّدُورُ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Il (Allah) connaît la trahison des yeux, tout comme ce que les poitrines cachent.
versets.en: 19. Allah knows the fraud of the eyes, and all that the breasts conceal.

versets.ar: 20. وَاللَّهُ يَقْضِي بِالْحَقِّ ۖ وَالَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِ لَا يَقْضُونَ بِشَيْءٍ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْبَصِيرُ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. Et Allah juge en toute équité, tandis que ceux qu'ils invoquent en dehors de Lui ne jugent rien. En vérité c'est Allah qui est l'Audient, le Clairvoyant.
versets.en: 20. And Allah judges with truth, while those to whom they invoke besides Him, cannot judge anything. Certainly, Allah! He is the All-Hearer, the All-Seer.

versets.ar: 21. ۞ أَوَلَمْ يَسِيرُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ فَيَنظُرُوا كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الَّذِينَ كَانُوا مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ كَانُوا هُمْ أَشَدَّ مِنْهُمْ قُوَّةً وَآثَارًا فِي الْأَرْضِ فَأَخَذَهُمُ اللَّهُ بِذُنُوبِهِمْ وَمَا كَانَ لَهُم مِّنَ اللَّهِ مِن وَاقٍ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Ne parcourent-ils pas la terre, pour voir ce qu'il est advenu de ceux qui ont vécu avant eux? Ils étaient [pourtant] plus forts qu'eux et ont laissé sur terre bien plus de vestiges. Allah les saisit pour leurs péchés et ils n'eurent point de protecteur contre Allah.
versets.en: 21. Have they not travelled in the land and seen what was the end of those who were before them? They were superior to them in strength, and in the traces (which they left) in the land. But Allah seized them with punishment for their sins. And none had they to protect them from Allah.

versets.ar: 22. ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَانَت تَّأْتِيهِمْ رُسُلُهُم بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ فَكَفَرُوا فَأَخَذَهُمُ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ قَوِيٌّ شَدِيدُ الْعِقَابِ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. Ce fut ainsi, parce que leurs Messagers leur avaient apporté les preuves, mais ils se montrèrent mécréants. Allah donc les saisit, car Il est fort et redoutable dans Son châtiment.
versets.en: 22. That was because there came to them their Messengers with clear evidences, proofs and signs but they disbelieved (in them). So Allah seized them with punishment. Verily, He is All-Strong, Severe in punishment.

versets.ar: 23. وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مُوسَىٰ بِآيَاتِنَا وَسُلْطَانٍ مُّبِينٍ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. Nous envoyâmes effectivement Moïse avec Nos signes et une preuve évidente,
versets.en: 23. And indeed We sent Musa (Moses) with Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.), and a manifest authority,

versets.ar: 24. إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَهَامَانَ وَقَارُونَ فَقَالُوا سَاحِرٌ كَذَّابٌ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. vers Pharaon, Hâmân et Coré. Mais ils dirent: «Magicien! Grand menteur!»
versets.en: 24. To Fir'aun (Pharaoh), Haman and Qarun (Korah), but they called (him): "A sorcerer, a liar!"

versets.ar: 25. فَلَمَّا جَاءَهُم بِالْحَقِّ مِنْ عِندِنَا قَالُوا اقْتُلُوا أَبْنَاءَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مَعَهُ وَاسْتَحْيُوا نِسَاءَهُمْ ۚ وَمَا كَيْدُ الْكَافِرِينَ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَالٍ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Puis, quand il leur eut apporté la vérité venant de Nous, ils dirent: «Tuez les fils de ceux qui ont cru avec lui, et laissez vivre leurs femmes». Et les ruses des mécréants ne vont qu'en pure perte.
versets.en: 25. Then, when he brought them the Truth from Us, they said: "Kill the sons of those who believe with him and let their women live", but the plots of disbelievers are nothing but errors!

versets.ar: 26. وَقَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ ذَرُونِي أَقْتُلْ مُوسَىٰ وَلْيَدْعُ رَبَّهُ ۖ إِنِّي أَخَافُ أَن يُبَدِّلَ دِينَكُمْ أَوْ أَن يُظْهِرَ فِي الْأَرْضِ الْفَسَادَ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Et Pharaon dit: «Laissez-moi tuer Moïse. Et qu'il appelle son Seigneur! Je crains qu'il ne change votre religion ou qu'il ne fasse apparaître la corruption sur terre».
versets.en: 26. Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "Leave me to kill Musa (Moses), and let him call his Lord (to stop me from killing him)! I fear that he may change your religion, or that he may cause mischief to appear in the land!"

versets.ar: 27. وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ إِنِّي عُذْتُ بِرَبِّي وَرَبِّكُم مِّن كُلِّ مُتَكَبِّرٍ لَّا يُؤْمِنُ بِيَوْمِ الْحِسَابِ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Moïse [lui] dit: «Je cherche auprès de mon Seigneur et le vôtre, protection contre tout orgueilleux qui ne croit pas au jour du Compte».
versets.en: 27. Musa (Moses) said: "Verily, I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant who believes not in the Day of Reckoning!"

versets.ar: 28. وَقَالَ رَجُلٌ مُّؤْمِنٌ مِّنْ آلِ فِرْعَوْنَ يَكْتُمُ إِيمَانَهُ أَتَقْتُلُونَ رَجُلًا أَن يَقُولَ رَبِّيَ اللَّهُ وَقَدْ جَاءَكُم بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ مِن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ وَإِن يَكُ كَاذِبًا فَعَلَيْهِ كَذِبُهُ ۖ وَإِن يَكُ صَادِقًا يُصِبْكُم بَعْضُ الَّذِي يَعِدُكُمْ ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِي مَنْ هُوَ مُسْرِفٌ كَذَّابٌ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Et un homme croyant de la famille de Pharaon, qui dissimulait sa foi dit: «Tuez-vous un homme parce qu'il dit: «Mon Seigneur est Allah?» Alors qu'il est venu à vous avec les preuves évidentes de la part de votre Seigneur. S'il est menteur, son mensonge sera à son détriment; tandis que s'il est véridique, alors une partie de ce dont il vous menace tombera sur vous». Certes, Allah ne guide pas celui qui est outrancier et imposteur!
versets.en: 28. And a believing man of Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) family, who hid his faith said: "Would you kill a man because he says: My Lord is Allah, and he has come to you with clear signs (proofs) from your Lord? And if he is a liar, upon him will be (the sin of) his lie; but if he is telling the truth, then some of that (calamity) wherewith he threatens you will befall on you." Verily, Allah guides not one who is a Musrif (a polytheist, or a murderer who shed blood without a right, or those who commit great sins, oppressor, transgressor), a liar!

versets.ar: 29. يَا قَوْمِ لَكُمُ الْمُلْكُ الْيَوْمَ ظَاهِرِينَ فِي الْأَرْضِ فَمَن يَنصُرُنَا مِن بَأْسِ اللَّهِ إِن جَاءَنَا ۚ قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ مَا أُرِيكُمْ إِلَّا مَا أَرَىٰ وَمَا أَهْدِيكُمْ إِلَّا سَبِيلَ الرَّشَادِ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. «O mon peuple, triomphant sur la terre, vous avez la royauté aujourd'hui. Mais qui nous secourra de la rigueur d'Allah si elle nous vient?» Pharaon dit: «Je ne vous indique que ce que je considère bon. Je ne vous guide qu'au sentier de la droiture».
versets.en: 29. "O my people! Yours is the kingdom this day, you are uppermost in the land. But who will save us from the Torment of Allah, should it befall us?" Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "I show you only that which I see (correct), and I guide you only to the path of right policy!"

versets.ar: 30. وَقَالَ الَّذِي آمَنَ يَا قَوْمِ إِنِّي أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُم مِّثْلَ يَوْمِ الْأَحْزَابِ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Et celui qui était croyant dit: «O mon peuple, je crains pour vous un jour semblable à celui des coalisés.
versets.en: 30. And he who believed said: "O my people! Verily, I fear for you a fate like that day (of disaster) of the Confederates (of old)!

versets.ar: 31. مِثْلَ دَأْبِ قَوْمِ نُوحٍ وَعَادٍ وَثَمُودَ وَالَّذِينَ مِن بَعْدِهِمْ ۚ وَمَا اللَّهُ يُرِيدُ ظُلْمًا لِّلْعِبَادِ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. Un sort semblable à celui du peuple de Noé, des 'Aad et des Thamûd et de ceux [qui vécurent] après eux». Allah ne veut [faire subir] aucune injustice aux serviteurs.
versets.en: 31. "Like the fate of the people of Nuh (Noah), and 'Ad, and Thamud and those who came after them. And Allah wills no injustice for (His) slaves.

versets.ar: 32. وَيَا قَوْمِ إِنِّي أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ يَوْمَ التَّنَادِ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. «O mon peuple, je crains pour vous le jour de l'Appel Mutuel,
versets.en: 32. "And, O my people! Verily! I fear for you the Day when there will be mutual calling (between the people of Hell and of Paradise)."

versets.ar: 33. يَوْمَ تُوَلُّونَ مُدْبِرِينَ مَا لَكُم مِّنَ اللَّهِ مِنْ عَاصِمٍ ۗ وَمَن يُضْلِلِ اللَّهُ فَمَا لَهُ مِنْ هَادٍ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. Le jour où vous tournerez le dos en déroute, sans qu'il y ait pour vous de protecteur contre Allah». Et quiconque Allah égare, n'a point de guide.
versets.en: 33. A Day when you will turn your backs and flee having no protector from Allah, And whomsoever Allah sends astray, for him there is no guide.

versets.ar: 34. وَلَقَدْ جَاءَكُمْ يُوسُفُ مِن قَبْلُ بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ فَمَا زِلْتُمْ فِي شَكٍّ مِّمَّا جَاءَكُم بِهِ ۖ حَتَّىٰ إِذَا هَلَكَ قُلْتُمْ لَن يَبْعَثَ اللَّهُ مِن بَعْدِهِ رَسُولًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ اللَّهُ مَنْ هُوَ مُسْرِفٌ مُّرْتَابٌ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. Certes, Joseph vous est venu auparavant avec les preuves évidentes, mais vous n'avez jamais cessé d'avoir des doutes sur ce qu'il vous avait apporté. Mais lorsqu'il mourut, vous dites alors: «Allah n'enverra plus jamais de Messager après lui». Ainsi Allah égare-t-Il celui qui est outrancier et celui qui doute.
versets.en: 34. And indeed Yusuf (Joseph) did come to you, in times gone by, with clear signs, but you ceased not to doubt in that which he did bring to you, till when he died you said: "No Messenger will Allah send after him." Thus Allah leaves astray him who is a Musrif (a polytheist, oppressor, a criminal, sinner who commit great sins) and a Murtab (one who doubts Allah's Warning and His Oneness).

versets.ar: 35. الَّذِينَ يُجَادِلُونَ فِي آيَاتِ اللَّهِ بِغَيْرِ سُلْطَانٍ أَتَاهُمْ ۖ كَبُرَ مَقْتًا عِندَ اللَّهِ وَعِندَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَطْبَعُ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ قَلْبِ مُتَكَبِّرٍ جَبَّارٍ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Ceux qui discutent les prodiges d'Allah sans qu'aucune preuve ne leur soit venue, [leur action] est grandement haïssable auprès d'Allah et auprès de ceux qui croient. Ainsi Allah scelle-t-Il le cœur de tout orgueilleux tyran.
versets.en: 35. Those who dispute about the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) of Allah, without any authority that has come to them, it is greatly hateful and disgusting to Allah and to those who believe. Thus does Allah seal up the heart of every arrogant, tyrant. (So they cannot guide themselves to the Right Path).

versets.ar: 36. وَقَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ يَا هَامَانُ ابْنِ لِي صَرْحًا لَّعَلِّي أَبْلُغُ الْأَسْبَابَ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. Et Pharaon dit: «O Hâmân, bâtis-moi une tour: peut-être atteindrai-je les voies,
versets.en: 36. And Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "O Haman! Build me a tower that I may arrive at the ways,

versets.ar: 37. أَسْبَابَ السَّمَاوَاتِ فَأَطَّلِعَ إِلَىٰ إِلَٰهِ مُوسَىٰ وَإِنِّي لَأَظُنُّهُ كَاذِبًا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ زُيِّنَ لِفِرْعَوْنَ سُوءُ عَمَلِهِ وَصُدَّ عَنِ السَّبِيلِ ۚ وَمَا كَيْدُ فِرْعَوْنَ إِلَّا فِي تَبَابٍ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. les voies des cieux, et apercevrai-je le Dieu de Moïse; mais je pense que celui-ci est menteur». Ainsi la mauvaise action de Pharaon lui parut enjolivée; et il fut détourné du droit chemin; et le stratagème de Pharaon n'est voué qu'à la destruction.
versets.en: 37. "The ways of the heavens, and I may look upon the Ilah (God) of Musa (Moses) but verily, I think him to be a liar." Thus it was made fair-seeming, in Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) eyes, the evil of his deeds, and he was hindered from the (Right) Path, and the plot of Fir'aun (Pharaoh) led to nothing but loss and destruction (for him).

versets.ar: 38. وَقَالَ الَّذِي آمَنَ يَا قَوْمِ اتَّبِعُونِ أَهْدِكُمْ سَبِيلَ الرَّشَادِ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. Et celui qui avait cru dit: «O mon peuple, suivez-moi. Je vous guiderai au sentier de la droiture.
versets.en: 38. And the man who believed said: "O my people! Follow me, I will guide you to the way of right conduct [i.e. guide you to Allah's religion of Islamic Monotheism with which Musa (Moses) has been sent].

versets.ar: 39. يَا قَوْمِ إِنَّمَا هَٰذِهِ الْحَيَاةُ الدُّنْيَا مَتَاعٌ وَإِنَّ الْآخِرَةَ هِيَ دَارُ الْقَرَارِ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. O mon peuple, cette vie n'est que jouissance temporaire, alors que l'au-delà est vraiment la demeure de la stabilité.
versets.en: 39. "O my people! Truly, this life of the world is nothing but a (quick passing) enjoyment, and verily, the Hereafter that is the home that will remain forever."

versets.ar: 40. مَنْ عَمِلَ سَيِّئَةً فَلَا يُجْزَىٰ إِلَّا مِثْلَهَا ۖ وَمَنْ عَمِلَ صَالِحًا مِّن ذَكَرٍ أَوْ أُنثَىٰ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌ فَأُولَٰئِكَ يَدْخُلُونَ الْجَنَّةَ يُرْزَقُونَ فِيهَا بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. Quiconque fait une mauvaise action ne sera rétribué que par son pareil; et quiconque, mâle ou femelle, fait une bonne action tout en étant croyant, alors ceux-là entreront au Paradis pour y recevoir leur subsistance sans compter.
versets.en: 40. "Whosoever does an evil deed, will not be requited except the like thereof, and whosoever does a righteous deed, whether male or female and is a true believer (in the Oneness of Allah), such will enter Paradise, where they will be provided therein (with all things in abundance) without limit.

versets.ar: 41. ۞ وَيَا قَوْمِ مَا لِي أَدْعُوكُمْ إِلَى النَّجَاةِ وَتَدْعُونَنِي إِلَى النَّارِ ﴿41﴾
