versets.ar: 43. وَلَمَن صَبَرَ وَغَفَرَ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ لَمِنْ عَزْمِ الْأُمُورِ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. Et celui qui endure et pardonne, cela en vérité, fait partie des bonnes dispositions et de la résolution dans les affaires.
versets.en: 43. And verily, whosoever shows patience and forgives that would truly be from the things recommended by Allah.

versets.ar: 44. وَمَن يُضْلِلِ اللَّهُ فَمَا لَهُ مِن وَلِيٍّ مِّن بَعْدِهِ ۗ وَتَرَى الظَّالِمِينَ لَمَّا رَأَوُا الْعَذَابَ يَقُولُونَ هَلْ إِلَىٰ مَرَدٍّ مِّن سَبِيلٍ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. Et quiconque Allah égare n'a aucun protecteur après Lui. Cependant tu verras les injustes dire, en voyant le châtiment: «Y a-t-il un moyen de retourner [sur terre]?»
versets.en: 44. And whomsoever Allah sends astray, for him there is no Wali (protector) after Him. And you will see the Zalimun (polytheists, wrong-doers, oppressors, etc.) when they behold the torment, they will say: "Is there any way of return (to the world)?"

versets.ar: 45. وَتَرَاهُمْ يُعْرَضُونَ عَلَيْهَا خَاشِعِينَ مِنَ الذُّلِّ يَنظُرُونَ مِن طَرْفٍ خَفِيٍّ ۗ وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِنَّ الْخَاسِرِينَ الَّذِينَ خَسِرُوا أَنفُسَهُمْ وَأَهْلِيهِمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ ۗ أَلَا إِنَّ الظَّالِمِينَ فِي عَذَابٍ مُّقِيمٍ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. Et tu les verras exposés devant l'Enfer, confondus dans l'avilissement, et regardant d'un œil furtif, tandis que ceux qui ont cru diront: «Les perdants sont certes, ceux qui au Jour de la Résurrection font leur propre perte et celle de leurs familles». Les injustes subiront certes un châtiment permanent.
versets.en: 45. And you will see them brought forward to it (Hell) made humble by disgrace, (and) looking with stealthy glance. And those who believe will say: "Verily, the losers are they who lose themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Verily, the Zalimun [i.e. Al-Kafirun (disbelievers in Allah, in His Oneness and in His Messenger SAW, polytheists, wrong-doers, etc.)] will be in a lasting torment.

versets.ar: 46. وَمَا كَانَ لَهُم مِّنْ أَوْلِيَاءَ يَنصُرُونَهُم مِّن دُونِ اللَّهِ ۗ وَمَن يُضْلِلِ اللَّهُ فَمَا لَهُ مِن سَبِيلٍ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. Ils n'auront pas de protecteur en dehors d'Allah pour les secourir et quiconque Allah égare n'a plus aucune voie.
versets.en: 46. And they will have no Auliya' (protectors) to help them other than Allah. And he whom Allah sends astray, for him there is no way.

versets.ar: 47. اسْتَجِيبُوا لِرَبِّكُم مِّن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِيَ يَوْمٌ لَّا مَرَدَّ لَهُ مِنَ اللَّهِ ۚ مَا لَكُم مِّن مَّلْجَإٍ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَمَا لَكُم مِّن نَّكِيرٍ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. Répondez à l'appel de votre Seigneur avant que ne vienne un jour dont Allah ne reportera jamais le terme. Ce jour-là, nul refuge pour vous et vous ne pourrez point nier (vos péchés).
versets.en: 47. Answer the Call of your Lord (i.e. accept the Islamic Monotheism, O mankind, and jinns) before there comes from Allah a Day which cannot be averted. You will have no refuge on that Day nor there will be for you any denying (of your crimes as they are all recorded in the Book of your deeds).

versets.ar: 48. فَإِنْ أَعْرَضُوا فَمَا أَرْسَلْنَاكَ عَلَيْهِمْ حَفِيظًا ۖ إِنْ عَلَيْكَ إِلَّا الْبَلَاغُ ۗ وَإِنَّا إِذَا أَذَقْنَا الْإِنسَانَ مِنَّا رَحْمَةً فَرِحَ بِهَا ۖ وَإِن تُصِبْهُمْ سَيِّئَةٌ بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ فَإِنَّ الْإِنسَانَ كَفُورٌ ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. S'ils se détournent, ...Nous ne t'avons pas envoyé pour assurer leur sauvegarde: tu n'es chargé que de transmettre [le message]. Et lorsque Nous faisons goûter à l'homme une miséricorde venant de Nous, il en exulte; mais si un malheur les atteint pour ce que leurs mains ont perpétré..., l'homme est alors très ingrat!
versets.en: 48. But if they turn away (O Muhammad SAW from the Islamic Monotheism, which you have brought to them). We have not sent you (O Muhammad SAW) as a Hafiz (protector) over them (i.e. to take care of their deeds and to recompense them). Your duty is to convey (the Message). And verily, when We cause man to taste of Mercy from Us, he rejoices thereat, but when some ill befalls them because of the deeds which their hands have sent forth, then verily, man (becomes) ingrate!

versets.ar: 49. لِّلَّهِ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ يَخْلُقُ مَا يَشَاءُ ۚ يَهَبُ لِمَن يَشَاءُ إِنَاثًا وَيَهَبُ لِمَن يَشَاءُ الذُّكُورَ ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. A Allah appartient la royauté des cieux et de la terre. Il crée ce qu'Il veut. Il fait don de filles à qui Il veut, et don de garçons à qui Il veut,
versets.en: 49. To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He creates what He wills. He bestows female (offspring) upon whom He wills, and bestows male (offspring) upon whom He wills.

versets.ar: 50. أَوْ يُزَوِّجُهُمْ ذُكْرَانًا وَإِنَاثًا ۖ وَيَجْعَلُ مَن يَشَاءُ عَقِيمًا ۚ إِنَّهُ عَلِيمٌ قَدِيرٌ ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. ou bien Il donne à la fois garçons et filles; et Il rend stérile qui Il veut. Il est certes Omniscient et Omnipotent.
versets.en: 50. Or He bestows both males and females, and He renders barren whom He wills. Verily, He is the All-Knower and is Able to do all things.

versets.ar: 51. ۞ وَمَا كَانَ لِبَشَرٍ أَن يُكَلِّمَهُ اللَّهُ إِلَّا وَحْيًا أَوْ مِن وَرَاءِ حِجَابٍ أَوْ يُرْسِلَ رَسُولًا فَيُوحِيَ بِإِذْنِهِ مَا يَشَاءُ ۚ إِنَّهُ عَلِيٌّ حَكِيمٌ ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. Il n'a pas été donné à un mortel qu'Allah lui parle autrement que par révélation ou de derrière un voile, ou qu'Il [Lui] envoie un messager (Ange) qui révèle, par Sa permission, ce qu'Il [Allah] veut. Il est Sublime et Sage.
versets.en: 51. It is not given to any human being that Allah should speak to him unless (it be) by Inspiration, or from behind a veil, or (that) He sends a Messenger to reveal what He wills by His Leave. Verily, He is Most High, Most Wise.

versets.ar: 52. وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَيْكَ رُوحًا مِّنْ أَمْرِنَا ۚ مَا كُنتَ تَدْرِي مَا الْكِتَابُ وَلَا الْإِيمَانُ وَلَٰكِن جَعَلْنَاهُ نُورًا نَّهْدِي بِهِ مَن نَّشَاءُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا ۚ وَإِنَّكَ لَتَهْدِي إِلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. Et c'est ainsi que Nous t'avons révélé un esprit [le Coran] provenant de Notre ordre. Tu n'avais aucune connaissance du Livre ni de la foi; mais Nous en avons fait une lumière par laquelle Nous guidons qui Nous voulons parmi Nos serviteurs. Et en vérité tu guides vers un chemin droit,
versets.en: 52. And thus We have sent to you (O Muhammad SAW) Ruhan (an Inspiration, and a Mercy) of Our Command. You knew not what is the Book, nor what is Faith? But We have made it (this Quran) a light wherewith We guide whosoever of Our slaves We will. And verily, you (O Muhammad SAW) are indeed guiding (mankind) to the Straight Path (i.e. Allah's religion of Islamic Monotheism).

versets.ar: 53. صِرَاطِ اللَّهِ الَّذِي لَهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۗ أَلَا إِلَى اللَّهِ تَصِيرُ الْأُمُورُ ﴿53﴾
versets.fr: 53. le chemin d'Allah à Qui appartient ce qui est dans les cieux et ce qui est sur la terre. Oui c'est à Allah que s'acheminent toutes les choses.
versets.en: 53. The Path of Allah, to Whom belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth. Verily, all the matters at the end go to Allah (for decision).

versets.fr: 1. H'â, Mîm.
versets.en: 1. Ha-Mim. [These letters are one of the miracles of the Quran, and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings].

versets.ar: 2. وَالْكِتَابِ الْمُبِينِ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Par le Livre explicite!
versets.en: 2. By the manifest Book (that makes things clear, i.e. this Quran).

versets.ar: 3. إِنَّا جَعَلْنَاهُ قُرْآنًا عَرَبِيًّا لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Nous en avons fait un Coran arabe afin que vous raisonniez.
versets.en: 3. We verily, have made it a Quran in Arabic, that you may be able to understand (its meanings and its admonitions).

versets.ar: 4. وَإِنَّهُ فِي أُمِّ الْكِتَابِ لَدَيْنَا لَعَلِيٌّ حَكِيمٌ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Il est auprès de Nous, dans l'Ecriture-Mère (l'original au ciel), sublime et rempli de sagesse.
versets.en: 4. And Verily, it (this Quran) is in the Mother of the Book (i.e. Al-Lauh Al-Mahfuz), before Us, indeed Exalted, full of Wisdom.

versets.ar: 5. أَفَنَضْرِبُ عَنكُمُ الذِّكْرَ صَفْحًا أَن كُنتُمْ قَوْمًا مُّسْرِفِينَ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Quoi! Allons-Nous vous dispenser du Rappel [le Coran] pour la raison que vous êtes des gens outranciers?
versets.en: 5. Shall We then (warn you not and) take away the Reminder (this Quran) from you, because you are a people Musrifun

versets.ar: 6. وَكَمْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن نَّبِيٍّ فِي الْأَوَّلِينَ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Que de prophètes avons-Nous envoyés aux Anciens!
versets.en: 6. And how many a Prophet have We sent amongst the men of old.

versets.ar: 7. وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن نَّبِيٍّ إِلَّا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. et pas un prophète ne leur venait qu'ils ne le tournaient en dérision.
versets.en: 7. And never came there a Prophet to them but they used to mock at him.

versets.ar: 8. فَأَهْلَكْنَا أَشَدَّ مِنْهُم بَطْشًا وَمَضَىٰ مَثَلُ الْأَوَّلِينَ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Nous avons fait périr de plus redoutables qu'eux! Et on a déjà cité l'exemple des anciens.
versets.en: 8. Then We destroyed men stronger (in power) than these, and the example of the ancients has passed away (before them).

versets.ar: 9. وَلَئِن سَأَلْتَهُم مَّنْ خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ لَيَقُولُنَّ خَلَقَهُنَّ الْعَزِيزُ الْعَلِيمُ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Et si tu leur demandes: «Qui a créé les cieux et la terre?» Ils diront très certainement: «Le Puissant, l'Omniscient les a créés».
versets.en: 9. And indeed if you ask them, "Who has created the heavens and the earth?" They will surely say: "The All-Mighty, the All-Knower created them."

versets.ar: 10. الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ مَهْدًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُمْ فِيهَا سُبُلًا لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Celui qui vous a donné la terre pour berceau et vous y a tracé des sentiers afin que vous vous guidiez;
versets.en: 10. Who has made for you the earth like a bed, and has made for you roads therein, in order that you may find your way,

versets.ar: 11. وَالَّذِي نَزَّلَ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً بِقَدَرٍ فَأَنشَرْنَا بِهِ بَلْدَةً مَّيْتًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ تُخْرَجُونَ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. Celui qui a fait descendre l'eau du ciel avec mesure et avec laquelle Nous ranimons une cité morte [aride]. Ainsi vous serez ressuscités;
versets.en: 11. And Who sends down water (rain) from the sky in due measure. Then We revive a dead land therewith, and even so you will be brought forth (from the dead),

versets.ar: 12. وَالَّذِي خَلَقَ الْأَزْوَاجَ كُلَّهَا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ الْفُلْكِ وَالْأَنْعَامِ مَا تَرْكَبُونَ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. Celui qui a créé les couples dans leur totalité et a fait pour vous, des vaisseaux et des bestiaux, des montures,
versets.en: 12. And Who has created all the pairs and has appointed for you ships and cattle on which you ride,

versets.ar: 13. لِتَسْتَوُوا عَلَىٰ ظُهُورِهِ ثُمَّ تَذْكُرُوا نِعْمَةَ رَبِّكُمْ إِذَا اسْتَوَيْتُمْ عَلَيْهِ وَتَقُولُوا سُبْحَانَ الَّذِي سَخَّرَ لَنَا هَٰذَا وَمَا كُنَّا لَهُ مُقْرِنِينَ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. afin que vous vous installiez sur leurs dos, et qu'ensuite, après vous y être installés, vous vous rappeliez le bienfait de votre Seigneur et que vous disiez: «Gloire à Celui qui nous a soumis tout cela alors que nous n'étions pas capables de les dominer.
versets.en: 13. In order that you may mount firmly on their backs, and then may remember the Favour of your Lord when you mount thereon, and say: "Glory to Him who has subjected this to us, and we could never have it (by our efforts)."

versets.ar: 14. وَإِنَّا إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا لَمُنقَلِبُونَ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. C'est vers notre Seigneur que nous retournerons».
versets.en: 14. And verily, to Our Lord we indeed are to return!

versets.ar: 15. وَجَعَلُوا لَهُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ جُزْءًا ۚ إِنَّ الْإِنسَانَ لَكَفُورٌ مُّبِينٌ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Et ils Lui firent de Ses serviteurs une partie [de Lui-Même]. L'homme est vraiment un ingrat déclaré!
versets.en: 15. Yet they assign to some of His slaves a share with Him (by pretending that He has children, and considering them as equals or co-partners in worship with Him). Verily, man is indeed a manifest ingrate!

versets.ar: 16. أَمِ اتَّخَذَ مِمَّا يَخْلُقُ بَنَاتٍ وَأَصْفَاكُم بِالْبَنِينَ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Ou bien Se serait-Il attribué des filles parmi ce qu'Il crée et accordé à vous par préférence des fils?
versets.en: 16. Or has He taken daughters out of what He has created, and He has selected for you sons?

versets.ar: 17. وَإِذَا بُشِّرَ أَحَدُهُم بِمَا ضَرَبَ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ مَثَلًا ظَلَّ وَجْهُهُ مُسْوَدًّا وَهُوَ كَظِيمٌ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Or, quand on annonce à l'un d'eux (la naissance) d'une semblable de ce qu'il attribue au Tout Miséricordieux, son visage s'assombrit d'un chagrin profond.
versets.en: 17. And if one of them is informed of the news of (the birth of) that which he set forth as a parable to the Most Beneficent (Allah) (i.e. of a girl), his face becomes dark, gloomy, and he is filled with grief!

versets.ar: 18. أَوَمَن يُنَشَّأُ فِي الْحِلْيَةِ وَهُوَ فِي الْخِصَامِ غَيْرُ مُبِينٍ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. Quoi! Cet être (la fille) élevé au milieu des parures et qui, dans la dispute, est incapable de se défendre par une argumentation claire et convaincante?
versets.en: 18. (Do they then like for Allah) a creature who is brought up in adornments (wearing silk and gold ornaments, i.e. women), and in dispute cannot make herself clear?

versets.ar: 19. وَجَعَلُوا الْمَلَائِكَةَ الَّذِينَ هُمْ عِبَادُ الرَّحْمَٰنِ إِنَاثًا ۚ أَشَهِدُوا خَلْقَهُمْ ۚ سَتُكْتَبُ شَهَادَتُهُمْ وَيُسْأَلُونَ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Et ils firent des Anges qui sont les serviteurs du Tout Miséricordieux des [êtres] féminins! Etaient-ils témoins de leur création? Leur témoignage sera alors inscrit; et ils seront interrogés.
versets.en: 19. And they make the angels who themselves are slaves to the Most Beneficent (Allah) females. Did they witness their creation? Their evidence will be recorded, and they will be questioned!

versets.ar: 20. وَقَالُوا لَوْ شَاءَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ مَا عَبَدْنَاهُم ۗ مَّا لَهُم بِذَٰلِكَ مِنْ عِلْمٍ ۖ إِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا يَخْرُصُونَ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. Et ils dirent: «Si le Tout Miséricordieux avait voulu, nous ne les aurions pas adorés». Ils n'en ont aucune connaissance; ils ne font que se livrer à des conjectures.
versets.en: 20. And they said: "If it had been the Will of the Most Beneficent (Allah), we should not have worshipped them (false deities)." They have no knowledge whatsoever of that. They do nothing but lie!

versets.ar: 21. أَمْ آتَيْنَاهُمْ كِتَابًا مِّن قَبْلِهِ فَهُم بِهِ مُسْتَمْسِكُونَ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Ou bien, leur avions-Nous donné avant lui [le Coran] un Livre auquel ils seraient fermement attachés?
versets.en: 21. Or have We given them any Book before this (the Quran), to which they are holding fast?

versets.ar: 22. بَلْ قَالُوا إِنَّا وَجَدْنَا آبَاءَنَا عَلَىٰ أُمَّةٍ وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰ آثَارِهِم مُّهْتَدُونَ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. Mais plutôt ils dirent: «Nous avons trouvé nos ancêtres sur une religion, et nous nous guidons sur leurs traces».
versets.en: 22. Nay! They say: "We found our fathers following a certain way and religion, and we guide ourselves by their footsteps."

versets.ar: 23. وَكَذَٰلِكَ مَا أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ فِي قَرْيَةٍ مِّن نَّذِيرٍ إِلَّا قَالَ مُتْرَفُوهَا إِنَّا وَجَدْنَا آبَاءَنَا عَلَىٰ أُمَّةٍ وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰ آثَارِهِم مُّقْتَدُونَ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. Et c'est ainsi que Nous n'avons pas envoyé avant toi d'avertisseur en une cité, sans que ses gens aisés n'aient dit: «Nous avons trouvé nos ancêtres sur une religion et nous suivons leurs traces».
versets.en: 23. And similarly, We sent not a warner before you (O Muhammad SAW) to any town (people) but the luxurious ones among them said: "We found our fathers following a certain way and religion, and we will indeed follow their footsteps."

versets.ar: 24. ۞ قَالَ أَوَلَوْ جِئْتُكُم بِأَهْدَىٰ مِمَّا وَجَدتُّمْ عَلَيْهِ آبَاءَكُمْ ۖ قَالُوا إِنَّا بِمَا أُرْسِلْتُم بِهِ كَافِرُونَ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Il dit: «Même si je viens à vous avec une meilleure direction que celle sur laquelle vous avez trouvé vos ancêtres?» Ils dirent: «Nous ne croyons pas au message avec lequel vous avez été envoyés».
versets.en: 24. (The warner) said: "Even if I bring you better guidance than that which you found your fathers following?" They said: "Verily, We disbelieve in that with which you have been sent."

versets.ar: 25. فَانتَقَمْنَا مِنْهُمْ ۖ فَانظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Nous Nous vengeâmes d'eux. Regarde ce qu'il est advenu de ceux qui criaient au mensonge.
versets.en: 25. So We took revenge of them, then see what was the end of those who denied (Islamic Monotheism).

versets.ar: 26. وَإِذْ قَالَ إِبْرَاهِيمُ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ إِنَّنِي بَرَاءٌ مِّمَّا تَعْبُدُونَ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Et lorsqu'Abraham dit à son père et à son peuple: «Je désavoue totalement ce que vous adorez,
versets.en: 26. And (remember) when Ibrahim (Abraham) said to his father and his people: "Verily, I am innocent of what you worship,

versets.ar: 27. إِلَّا الَّذِي فَطَرَنِي فَإِنَّهُ سَيَهْدِينِ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. à l'exception de Celui qui m'a créé, car c'est Lui en vérité qui me guidera».
versets.en: 27. "Except Him (i.e. I worship none but Allah Alone) Who did create me, and verily, He will guide me."

versets.ar: 28. وَجَعَلَهَا كَلِمَةً بَاقِيَةً فِي عَقِبِهِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْجِعُونَ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Et il en fit une parole qui devait se perpétuer parmi sa descendance. Peut-être reviendront-ils?
versets.en: 28. And he made it [i.e. La ilaha ill-Allah (none has the right to be worshipped but Allah Alone)] a Word lasting among his offspring (True Monotheism), that they may turn back (i.e. to repent to Allah or receive admonition).

versets.ar: 29. بَلْ مَتَّعْتُ هَٰؤُلَاءِ وَآبَاءَهُمْ حَتَّىٰ جَاءَهُمُ الْحَقُّ وَرَسُولٌ مُّبِينٌ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. Mais à ces gens ainsi qu'à leurs ancêtres J'ai accordé la jouissance jusqu'à ce que leur vinrent la Vérité (le Coran) et un Messager explicite.
versets.en: 29. Nay, but I gave (the good things of this life) to these (polytheists) and their fathers to enjoy, till there came to them the truth (the Quran), and a Messenger (Muhammad SAW) making things clear.

versets.ar: 30. وَلَمَّا جَاءَهُمُ الْحَقُّ قَالُوا هَٰذَا سِحْرٌ وَإِنَّا بِهِ كَافِرُونَ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Et quand la Vérité leur vint, ils dirent: «C'est de la magie et nous n'y croyons pas».
versets.en: 30. And when the truth (this Quran) came to them, they (the disbelievers in this Quran) said: "This is magic, and we disbelieve therein."

versets.ar: 31. وَقَالُوا لَوْلَا نُزِّلَ هَٰذَا الْقُرْآنُ عَلَىٰ رَجُلٍ مِّنَ الْقَرْيَتَيْنِ عَظِيمٍ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. Et ils dirent: «Pourquoi n'a-t-on pas fait descendre ce Coran sur un haut personnage de l'une des deux cités?» (la Mecque et Tâ'îf).
versets.en: 31. And they say: "Why is not this Quran sent down to some great man of the two towns (Makkah and Ta'if)?"

versets.ar: 32. أَهُمْ يَقْسِمُونَ رَحْمَتَ رَبِّكَ ۚ نَحْنُ قَسَمْنَا بَيْنَهُم مَّعِيشَتَهُمْ فِي الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا ۚ وَرَفَعْنَا بَعْضَهُمْ فَوْقَ بَعْضٍ دَرَجَاتٍ لِّيَتَّخِذَ بَعْضُهُم بَعْضًا سُخْرِيًّا ۗ وَرَحْمَتُ رَبِّكَ خَيْرٌ مِّمَّا يَجْمَعُونَ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. Est-ce eux qui distribuent la miséricorde de ton Seigneur? C'est Nous qui avons réparti entre eux leur subsistance dans la vie présente et qui les avons élevés en grades les uns sur les autres, afin que les uns prennent les autres à leur service. La miséricorde de ton Seigneur vaut mieux, cependant, que ce qu'ils amassent.
versets.en: 32. Is it they who would portion out the Mercy of your Lord? It is We Who portion out between them their livelihood in this world, and We raised some of them above others in ranks, so that some may employ others in their work. But the Mercy (Paradise) of your Lord (O Muhammad SAW) is better than the (wealth of this world) which they amass.

versets.ar: 33. وَلَوْلَا أَن يَكُونَ النَّاسُ أُمَّةً وَاحِدَةً لَّجَعَلْنَا لِمَن يَكْفُرُ بِالرَّحْمَٰنِ لِبُيُوتِهِمْ سُقُفًا مِّن فِضَّةٍ وَمَعَارِجَ عَلَيْهَا يَظْهَرُونَ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. Si les hommes ne devaient pas constituer une seule communauté (mécréante), Nous aurions certes pourvu les maisons de ceux qui ne croient pas au Tout Miséricordieux, de toits d'argent avec des escaliers pour y monter;
versets.en: 33. And were it not that all mankind would have become of one community (all disbelievers, desiring worldly life only), We would have provided for those who disbelieve in the Most Beneficent (Allah), silver roofs for their houses, and elevators (and stair-ways, etc. of silver) whereby they ascend,

versets.ar: 34. وَلِبُيُوتِهِمْ أَبْوَابًا وَسُرُرًا عَلَيْهَا يَتَّكِئُونَ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. (Nous aurions pourvu) leurs maisons de portes et de divans où ils s'accouderaient,
versets.en: 34. And for their houses, doors (of silver), and thrones (of silver) on which they could recline,

versets.ar: 35. وَزُخْرُفًا ۚ وَإِن كُلُّ ذَٰلِكَ لَمَّا مَتَاعُ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا ۚ وَالْآخِرَةُ عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. ainsi que des ornements. Et tout cela ne serait que jouissance temporaire de la vie d'ici-bas, alors que l'au-delà, auprès de ton Seigneur, est pour les pieux.
versets.en: 35. And adornments of gold. Yet all this (i.e. the roofs, doors, stairs, elevators, thrones etc. of their houses) would have been nothing but an enjoyment of this world. And the Hereafter with your Lord is only for the Muttaqun.

versets.ar: 36. وَمَن يَعْشُ عَن ذِكْرِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ نُقَيِّضْ لَهُ شَيْطَانًا فَهُوَ لَهُ قَرِينٌ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. Et quiconque s'aveugle (et s'écarte) du rappel du Tout Miséricordieux, Nous lui désignons un diable qui devient son compagnon inséparable.
versets.en: 36. And whosoever turns away (blinds himself) from the remembrance of the Most Beneficent (Allah) (i.e. this Quran and worship of Allah), We appoint for him Shaitan (Satan - devil) to be a Qarin (an intimate companion) to him.

versets.ar: 37. وَإِنَّهُمْ لَيَصُدُّونَهُمْ عَنِ السَّبِيلِ وَيَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّهُم مُّهْتَدُونَ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. Ils [Les diables] détournent certes [les hommes] du droit chemin, tandis que ceux-ci s'estiment être bien guidés.
versets.en: 37. And verily, they (Satans / devils) hinder them from the Path (of Allah), but they think that they are guided aright!

versets.ar: 38. حَتَّىٰ إِذَا جَاءَنَا قَالَ يَا لَيْتَ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَكَ بُعْدَ الْمَشْرِقَيْنِ فَبِئْسَ الْقَرِينُ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. Lorsque cet [homme] vient à Nous, il dira [à son démon]: «Hélas! Que n'y a-t-il entre toi et moi la distance entre les deux orients [l'Est et l'Ouest]» - Quel mauvais compagnon [que tu es]!
versets.en: 38. Till, when (such a one) comes to Us, he says [to his Qarin (Satan / devil companion)] "Would that between me and you were the distance of the two easts (or the east and west)" a worst (type of) companion (indeed)!

versets.ar: 39. وَلَن يَنفَعَكُمُ الْيَوْمَ إِذ ظَّلَمْتُمْ أَنَّكُمْ فِي الْعَذَابِ مُشْتَرِكُونَ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. Il ne vous profitera point ce jour-là - du moment que vous avez été injustes - que vous soyez associés dans le châtiment.
versets.en: 39. It will profit you not this Day (O you who turn away from Allah's remembrance and His worship, etc.) as you did wrong, (and) that you will be sharers (you and your Qarin) in the punishment.

versets.ar: 40. أَفَأَنتَ تُسْمِعُ الصُّمَّ أَوْ تَهْدِي الْعُمْيَ وَمَن كَانَ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. Est-ce donc toi qui fait entendre les sourds ou qui guide les aveugles et ceux qui sont dans un égarement évident?
versets.en: 40. Can you (O Muhammad SAW) make the deaf to hear, or can you guide the blind or him who is in manifest error?

versets.ar: 41. فَإِمَّا نَذْهَبَنَّ بِكَ فَإِنَّا مِنْهُم مُّنتَقِمُونَ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. Soit que Nous t'enlevons [te ferons mourir] et alors Nous Nous vengerons d'eux;
versets.en: 41. And even if We take you (O Muhammad SAW) away, We shall indeed take vengeance on them.

versets.ar: 42. أَوْ نُرِيَنَّكَ الَّذِي وَعَدْنَاهُمْ فَإِنَّا عَلَيْهِم مُّقْتَدِرُونَ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. ou bien que Nous te ferons voir ce que Nous leur avons promis [le châtiment]; car Nous avons sur eux un pouvoir certain.
versets.en: 42. Or (if) We show you that wherewith We threaten them, then verily, We have perfect command over them.

versets.ar: 43. فَاسْتَمْسِكْ بِالَّذِي أُوحِيَ إِلَيْكَ ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. Tiens fermement à ce qui t'a été révélé car tu es sur le droit chemin.
versets.en: 43. So hold you (O Muhammad SAW) fast to that which is inspired in you. Verily, you are on a Straight Path.

versets.ar: 44. وَإِنَّهُ لَذِكْرٌ لَّكَ وَلِقَوْمِكَ ۖ وَسَوْفَ تُسْأَلُونَ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. C'est certainement un rappel [le Coran] pour toi et ton peuple. Et vous en serez interrogés.
versets.en: 44. And verily, this (the Quran) is indeed a Reminder for you (O Muhammad SAW) and your people (Quraish people, or your followers), and you will be questioned (about it).

versets.ar: 45. وَاسْأَلْ مَنْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ مِن رُّسُلِنَا أَجَعَلْنَا مِن دُونِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ آلِهَةً يُعْبَدُونَ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. Et demande à ceux de Nos messagers que Nous avons envoyés avant toi, si Nous avons institué, en dehors du Tout Miséricordieux, des divinités à adorer?
versets.en: 45. And ask (O Muhammad SAW) those of Our Messengers whom We sent before you: "Did We ever appoint aliha (gods) to be worshipped besides the Most Beneficent (Allah)?"

versets.ar: 46. وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مُوسَىٰ بِآيَاتِنَا إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَئِهِ فَقَالَ إِنِّي رَسُولُ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. Nous avons effectivement envoyé Moïse avec Nos miracles, à Pharaon et à ses notables. Il dit: «Je suis le Messager du Seigneur de l'univers».
versets.en: 46. And indeed We did send Musa (Moses) with Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) to Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and his chiefs (inviting them to Allah's Religion of Islam) He said: "Verily, I am a Messenger of the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists)."

versets.ar: 47. فَلَمَّا جَاءَهُم بِآيَاتِنَا إِذَا هُم مِّنْهَا يَضْحَكُونَ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. Puis, lorsqu'il vint à eux avec Nos miracles, voilà qu'ils en rirent.
versets.en: 47. But when he came to them with Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) behold! They laughed at them.

versets.ar: 48. وَمَا نُرِيهِم مِّنْ آيَةٍ إِلَّا هِيَ أَكْبَرُ مِنْ أُخْتِهَا ۖ وَأَخَذْنَاهُم بِالْعَذَابِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْجِعُونَ ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. Chaque miracle que Nous leur montrions était plus probant que son précédent. Et Nous les saisîmes par le châtiment, peut-être reviendront-ils [vers Nous].
versets.en: 48. And not an Ayah (sign, etc.) We showed them but it was greater than its fellow, and We seized them with torment, in order that they might turn [from their polytheism to Allah's Religion (Islamic Monotheism)].

versets.ar: 49. وَقَالُوا يَا أَيُّهَ السَّاحِرُ ادْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ بِمَا عَهِدَ عِندَكَ إِنَّنَا لَمُهْتَدُونَ ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. Et ils dirent: «O magicien! Implore pour nous ton Seigneur au nom de l'engagement qu'Il a pris envers toi. Nous suivrons le droit chemin».
versets.en: 49. And they said [to Musa (Moses)]: "O you sorcerer! Invoke your Lord for us according to what He has covenanted with you. Verily, We shall guide ourselves (aright)."

versets.ar: 50. فَلَمَّا كَشَفْنَا عَنْهُمُ الْعَذَابَ إِذَا هُمْ يَنكُثُونَ ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. Puis quand Nous eûmes écarté d'eux le châtiment, voilà qu'ils violèrent leurs engagements.
versets.en: 50. But when We removed the torment from them, behold! They broke their covenant (that they will believe if We remove the torment for them).

versets.ar: 51. وَنَادَىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ فِي قَوْمِهِ قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ أَلَيْسَ لِي مُلْكُ مِصْرَ وَهَٰذِهِ الْأَنْهَارُ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِي ۖ أَفَلَا تُبْصِرُونَ ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. Et Pharaon fit une proclamation à son peuple et dit: «O mon peuple! Le royaume de Misr [l'Egypte] ne m'appartient-il pas ainsi que ces canaux qui coulent à mes pieds? N'observez-vous donc pas?
versets.en: 51. And Fir'aun (Pharaoh) proclaimed among his people, saying: "O my people! Is not mine the dominion of Egypt, and these rivers flowing underneath me. See you not then?

versets.ar: 52. أَمْ أَنَا خَيْرٌ مِّنْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي هُوَ مَهِينٌ وَلَا يَكَادُ يُبِينُ ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. Ne suis-je pas meilleur que ce misérable qui sait à peine s'exprimer?
versets.en: 52. "Am I not better than this one [Musa (Moses)], who is Mahin [has no honour nor any respect, and is weak and despicable] and can scarcely express himself clearly?

versets.ar: 53. فَلَوْلَا أُلْقِيَ عَلَيْهِ أَسْوِرَةٌ مِّن ذَهَبٍ أَوْ جَاءَ مَعَهُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ مُقْتَرِنِينَ ﴿53﴾
versets.fr: 53. Pourquoi ne lui a-t-on pas lancé des bracelets d'or? Pourquoi les Anges ne l'ont-ils pas accompagné?»
versets.en: 53. "Why then are not golden bracelets bestowed on him, or angels sent along with him?"

versets.ar: 54. فَاسْتَخَفَّ قَوْمَهُ فَأَطَاعُوهُ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ ﴿54﴾
versets.fr: 54. Ainsi chercha-t-il à étourdir son peuple et ainsi lui obéirent-ils car ils étaient des gens pervers.
versets.en: 54. Thus he [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] befooled and misled his people, and they obeyed him. Verily, they were ever a people who were Fasiqun (rebellious, disobedient to Allah).

versets.ar: 55. فَلَمَّا آسَفُونَا انتَقَمْنَا مِنْهُمْ فَأَغْرَقْنَاهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ ﴿55﴾
versets.fr: 55. Puis lorsqu'ils Nous eurent irrité, Nous Nous vengeâmes d'eux et les noyâmes tous.
versets.en: 55. So when they angered Us, We punished them, and drowned them all.

versets.ar: 56. فَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ سَلَفًا وَمَثَلًا لِّلْآخِرِينَ ﴿56﴾
versets.fr: 56. Nous fîmes d'eux un antécédant et un exemple [une leçon] pour la postérité.
versets.en: 56. And We made them a precedent (as a lesson for those coming after them), and an example to later generations.

versets.ar: 57. ۞ وَلَمَّا ضُرِبَ ابْنُ مَرْيَمَ مَثَلًا إِذَا قَوْمُكَ مِنْهُ يَصِدُّونَ ﴿57﴾
versets.fr: 57. Quand on cite l'exemple du fils de Marie, ton peuple s'en détourne,
versets.en: 57. And when the son of Maryam (Mary) is quoted as an example [i.e. 'Iesa (Jesus) is worshipped like their idols), behold! Your people cry aloud (laugh out at the example).

versets.ar: 58. وَقَالُوا أَآلِهَتُنَا خَيْرٌ أَمْ هُوَ ۚ مَا ضَرَبُوهُ لَكَ إِلَّا جَدَلًا ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ خَصِمُونَ ﴿58﴾
versets.fr: 58. en disant: «Nos dieux sont-ils meilleurs, ou bien lui?» Ce n'est que par polémique qu'ils te le citent comme exemple. Ce sont plutôt des gens chicaniers.
versets.en: 58. And say: "Are our aliha (gods) better or is he ['Iesa (Jesus)]?" They quoted not the above example except for argument. Nay! But they are a quarrelsome people. [(See VV. 21:97-101) - The Quran.]

versets.ar: 59. إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا عَبْدٌ أَنْعَمْنَا عَلَيْهِ وَجَعَلْنَاهُ مَثَلًا لِّبَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ ﴿59﴾
versets.fr: 59. Il (Jésus) n'était qu'un Serviteur que Nous avions comblé de bienfaits et que Nous avions désigné en exemple aux Enfants d'Israël.
versets.en: 59. He ['Iesa (Jesus)] was not more than a slave. We granted Our Favour to him, and We made him an example to the Children of Israel (i.e. his creation without a father).

versets.ar: 60. وَلَوْ نَشَاءُ لَجَعَلْنَا مِنكُم مَّلَائِكَةً فِي الْأَرْضِ يَخْلُفُونَ ﴿60﴾
versets.fr: 60. Si Nous voulions, Nous ferions de vous des Anges qui vous succéderaient sur la terre.
versets.en: 60. And if it were Our Will, We would have [destroyed you (mankind) all, and] made angels to replace you on the earth. [Tafsir At-Tabari, Vol: 25, Page 89].

versets.ar: 61. وَإِنَّهُ لَعِلْمٌ لِّلسَّاعَةِ فَلَا تَمْتَرُنَّ بِهَا وَاتَّبِعُونِ ۚ هَٰذَا صِرَاطٌ مُّسْتَقِيمٌ ﴿61﴾
versets.fr: 61. Il sera un signe au sujet de l'Heure. N'en doutez point. Et suivez-moi: voilà un droit chemin.
versets.en: 61. And he ['Iesa (Jesus), son of Maryam (Mary)] shall be a known sign for (the coming of) the Hour (Day of Resurrection) [i.e. 'Iesa's (Jesus) descent on the earth]. Therefore have no doubt concerning it (i.e. the Day of Resurrection). And follow Me (Allah) (i.e. be obedient to Allah and do what He orders you to do, O mankind)! This is the Straight Path (of Islamic Monotheism, leading to Allah and to His Paradise).

versets.ar: 62. وَلَا يَصُدَّنَّكُمُ الشَّيْطَانُ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّ مُّبِينٌ ﴿62﴾
versets.fr: 62. Que le Diable ne vous détourne point! Car il est pour vous un ennemi déclaré.
versets.en: 62. And let not Shaitan (Satan) hinder you (from the right religion, i.e. Islamic Monotheism), Verily, he (Satan) to you is a plain enemy.

versets.ar: 63. وَلَمَّا جَاءَ عِيسَىٰ بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ قَالَ قَدْ جِئْتُكُم بِالْحِكْمَةِ وَلِأُبَيِّنَ لَكُم بَعْضَ الَّذِي تَخْتَلِفُونَ فِيهِ ۖ فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ ﴿63﴾
versets.fr: 63. Et quand Jésus apporta les preuves, il dit: «Je suis venu à vous avec la sagesse et pour vous expliquer certains de vos sujets de désaccord. Craignez Allah donc et obéissez-moi.
versets.en: 63. And when 'Iesa (Jesus) came with (Our) clear Proofs, he said: "I have come to you with Al-Hikmah (Prophethood), and in order to make clear to you some of the (points) in which you differ, therefore fear Allah and obey me,

versets.ar: 64. إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ رَبِّي وَرَبُّكُمْ فَاعْبُدُوهُ ۚ هَٰذَا صِرَاطٌ مُّسْتَقِيمٌ ﴿64﴾
versets.fr: 64. Allah est en vérité mon Seigneur et votre Seigneur. Adorez-Le donc. Voilà un droit chemin».
versets.en: 64. "Verily, Allah! He is my Lord (God) and your Lord (God). So worship Him (Alone). This is the (only) Straight Path (i.e. Allah's religion of true Islamic Monotheism)."

versets.ar: 65. فَاخْتَلَفَ الْأَحْزَابُ مِن بَيْنِهِمْ ۖ فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمٍ أَلِيمٍ ﴿65﴾
versets.fr: 65. Mais les factions divergèrent entre elles. Malheur donc aux injustes du châtiment d'un jour douloureux!
versets.en: 65. But the sects from among themselves differed. So woe to those who do wrong (by ascribing things to 'Iesa (Jesus) that are not true) from the torment of a painful Day (i.e. the Day of Resurrection)!

versets.ar: 66. هَلْ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا السَّاعَةَ أَن تَأْتِيَهُم بَغْتَةً وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ ﴿66﴾
versets.fr: 66. Attendent-ils seulement que l'Heure leur vienne à l'improviste, sans qu'ils ne s'en rendent compte?
versets.en: 66. Do they only wait for the Hour that it shall come upon them suddenly, while they perceive not?

versets.ar: 67. الْأَخِلَّاءُ يَوْمَئِذٍ بَعْضُهُمْ لِبَعْضٍ عَدُوٌّ إِلَّا الْمُتَّقِينَ ﴿67﴾
versets.fr: 67. Les amis, ce jour-là, seront ennemis les uns des autres; excepté les pieux.
versets.en: 67. Friends on that Day will be foes one to another except Al-Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2).

versets.ar: 68. يَا عِبَادِ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْكُمُ الْيَوْمَ وَلَا أَنتُمْ تَحْزَنُونَ ﴿68﴾
versets.fr: 68. «O Mes serviteurs! Vous ne devez avoir aucune crainte aujourd'hui; vous ne serez point affligés,
versets.en: 68. (It will be said to the true believers of Islamic Monotheism): My worshippers! No fear shall be on you this Day, nor shall you grieve,

versets.ar: 69. الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِآيَاتِنَا وَكَانُوا مُسْلِمِينَ ﴿69﴾
versets.fr: 69. Ceux qui croient en Nos signes et sont musulmans,
versets.en: 69. (You) who believed in Our Ayat (proofs, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) and were Muslims (i.e. who submit totally to Allah's Will, and believe in the Oneness of Allah - Islamic Monotheism).

versets.ar: 70. ادْخُلُوا الْجَنَّةَ أَنتُمْ وَأَزْوَاجُكُمْ تُحْبَرُونَ ﴿70﴾
versets.fr: 70. «Entrez au Paradis, vous et vos épouses, vous y serez fêtés».
versets.en: 70. Enter Paradise, you and your wives, in happiness.

versets.ar: 71. يُطَافُ عَلَيْهِم بِصِحَافٍ مِّن ذَهَبٍ وَأَكْوَابٍ ۖ وَفِيهَا مَا تَشْتَهِيهِ الْأَنفُسُ وَتَلَذُّ الْأَعْيُنُ ۖ وَأَنتُمْ فِيهَا خَالِدُونَ ﴿71﴾
versets.fr: 71. On fera circuler parmi eux des plats d'or et des coupes; et il y aura là [pour eux] tout ce que les âmes désirent et ce qui réjouit les yeux;» - et vous y demeurerez éternellement.
versets.en: 71. Trays of gold and cups will be passed round them, (there will be) therein all that the one's inner-selves could desire, all that the eyes could delight in, and you will abide therein forever.

versets.ar: 72. وَتِلْكَ الْجَنَّةُ الَّتِي أُورِثْتُمُوهَا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ ﴿72﴾
versets.fr: 72. Tel est le Paradis qu'on vous fait hériter pour ce que vous faisiez.
versets.en: 72. This is the Paradise which you have been made to inherit because of your deeds which you used to do (in the life of the world).

versets.ar: 73. لَكُمْ فِيهَا فَاكِهَةٌ كَثِيرَةٌ مِّنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ ﴿73﴾
versets.fr: 73. Il y aura là pour vous beaucoup de fruits dont vous mangerez».
versets.en: 73. Therein for you will be fruits in plenty, of which you will eat (as you desire).

versets.ar: 74. إِنَّ الْمُجْرِمِينَ فِي عَذَابِ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدُونَ ﴿74﴾
versets.fr: 74. Quant aux criminels, ils demeureront éternellement dans le châtiment de l'Enfer,
versets.en: 74. Verily, the Mujrimun (criminals, sinners, disbelievers, etc.) will be in the torment of Hell to abide therein forever.

versets.ar: 75. لَا يُفَتَّرُ عَنْهُمْ وَهُمْ فِيهِ مُبْلِسُونَ ﴿75﴾
versets.fr: 75. qui ne sera jamais interrompu pour eux et où ils seront en désespoir.
versets.en: 75. (The torment) will not be lightened for them, and they will be plunged into destruction with deep regrets, sorrows and in despair therein.

versets.ar: 76. وَمَا ظَلَمْنَاهُمْ وَلَٰكِن كَانُوا هُمُ الظَّالِمِينَ ﴿76﴾
versets.fr: 76. Nous ne leur avons fait aucun tort, mais c'étaient eux les injustes.
versets.en: 76. We wronged them not, but they were the Zalimun (polytheists, wrong-doers, etc.).

versets.ar: 77. وَنَادَوْا يَا مَالِكُ لِيَقْضِ عَلَيْنَا رَبُّكَ ۖ قَالَ إِنَّكُم مَّاكِثُونَ ﴿77﴾
versets.fr: 77. et ils crieront: «O Mâlik! Que ton Seigneur nous achève!» Il dira: «En vérité, vous êtes pour y demeurer [éternellement]»!
versets.en: 77. And they will cry: "O Malik (Keeper of Hell)! Let your Lord make an end of us." He will say: "Verily you shall abide forever."

versets.ar: 78. لَقَدْ جِئْنَاكُم بِالْحَقِّ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَكُمْ لِلْحَقِّ كَارِهُونَ ﴿78﴾
versets.fr: 78. «Certes, Nous vous avions apporté la Vérité; mais la plupart d'entre vous détestaient la Vérité».
versets.en: 78. Indeed We have brought the truth (Muhammad SAW with the Quran), to you, but most of you have a hatred for the truth.

versets.ar: 79. أَمْ أَبْرَمُوا أَمْرًا فَإِنَّا مُبْرِمُونَ ﴿79﴾
versets.fr: 79. Ont-ils pris quelque décision [entre eux]? Car c'est Nous qui décidons!
versets.en: 79. Or have they plotted some plan? Then We too are planning.

versets.ar: 80. أَمْ يَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّا لَا نَسْمَعُ سِرَّهُمْ وَنَجْوَاهُم ۚ بَلَىٰ وَرُسُلُنَا لَدَيْهِمْ يَكْتُبُونَ ﴿80﴾
versets.fr: 80. Ou bien escomptent-ils que Nous n'entendons pas leur secret ni leurs délibérations? Mais si! Nos Anges prennent note auprès d'eux.
versets.en: 80. Or do they think that We hear not their secrets and their private counsel? (Yes We do) and Our Messengers (appointed angels in charge of mankind) are by them, to record.

versets.ar: 81. قُلْ إِن كَانَ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ وَلَدٌ فَأَنَا أَوَّلُ الْعَابِدِينَ ﴿81﴾
versets.fr: 81. Dis: «Si le Tout Miséricordieux avait un enfant, alors je serais le premier à l'adorer».
versets.en: 81. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "If the Most Beneficent (Allah) had a son (or children as you pretend), then I am the first of Allah's worshippers [who deny and refute this claim of yours (and the first to believe in Allah Alone and testify that He has no children)]." [Tafsir At-Tabari].

versets.ar: 82. سُبْحَانَ رَبِّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ رَبِّ الْعَرْشِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ ﴿82﴾
versets.fr: 82. Gloire au Seigneur des cieux et de la terre, Seigneur du Trône; Il transcende ce qu'ils décrivent.
versets.en: 82. Glorified be the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne! Exalted be He from all that they ascribe (to Him).

versets.ar: 83. فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا وَيَلْعَبُوا حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ ﴿83﴾
versets.fr: 83. Laisse-les donc s'enfoncer dans leur fausseté et s'amuser jusqu'à ce qu'ils rencontrent le jour qui leur est promis.
versets.en: 83. So leave them (alone) to speak nonsense and play until they meet the Day of theirs, which they have been promised.

versets.ar: 84. وَهُوَ الَّذِي فِي السَّمَاءِ إِلَٰهٌ وَفِي الْأَرْضِ إِلَٰهٌ ۚ وَهُوَ الْحَكِيمُ الْعَلِيمُ ﴿84﴾
versets.fr: 84. C'est Lui qui est Dieu dans le ciel et Dieu sur terre; et c'est Lui le Sage, l'Omniscient!
versets.en: 84. It is He (Allah) Who is the only Ilah (God to be worshipped) in the heaven and the only Ilah (God to be worshipped) on the earth. And He is the All-Wise, the All-Knower.

versets.ar: 85. وَتَبَارَكَ الَّذِي لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَعِندَهُ عِلْمُ السَّاعَةِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ ﴿85﴾
versets.fr: 85. Et béni soit Celui à qui appartient la souveraineté des cieux et de la terre et de ce qui est entre eux. Il détient la science de l'Heure. Et c'est vers Lui que vous serez ramenés.
versets.en: 85. And blessed be He to Whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, and with Whom is the knowledge of the Hour, and to Whom you (all) will be returned.

versets.ar: 86. وَلَا يَمْلِكُ الَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِ الشَّفَاعَةَ إِلَّا مَن شَهِدَ بِالْحَقِّ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ ﴿86﴾
versets.fr: 86. Et ceux qu'ils invoquent en dehors de Lui n'ont aucun pouvoir d'intercession, à l'exception de ceux qui auront témoigné de la vérité en pleine connaissance de cause.
versets.en: 86. And those whom they invoke instead of Him have no power of intercession; except those who bear witness to the truth (i.e. believed in the Oneness of Allah, and obeyed His Orders), and they know (the facts about the Oneness of Allah).

versets.ar: 87. وَلَئِن سَأَلْتَهُم مَّنْ خَلَقَهُمْ لَيَقُولُنَّ اللَّهُ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ يُؤْفَكُونَ ﴿87﴾
versets.fr: 87. Et si tu leur demandes qui les a créés, ils diront très certainement: «Allah». Comment se fait-il donc qu'ils se détournent?
versets.en: 87. And if you ask them who created them, they will surely say: "Allah". How then are they turned away (from the worship of Allah, Who created them)?

versets.ar: 88. وَقِيلِهِ يَا رَبِّ إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ قَوْمٌ لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ ﴿88﴾
versets.fr: 88. Et sa parole (la parole du Prophète à Allah): «Seigneur, ce sont là des gens qui ne croient pas».
versets.en: 88. (Allah has knowledge) of (Prophet Muhammad's) saying: "O my Lord! Verily, these are a people who believe not!"

versets.ar: 89. فَاصْفَحْ عَنْهُمْ وَقُلْ سَلَامٌ ۚ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ ﴿89﴾
versets.fr: 89. Et bien, éloigne-toi d'eux (pardonne-leur); et dis: «Salut!» Car ils sauront bientôt.
versets.en: 89. So turn away from them (O Muhammad SAW), and say: Salam (peace)! But they will come to know.

versets.fr: 1. H'â, Mîm.
versets.en: 1. Ha-Mim. [These letters are one of the miracles of the Quran and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings].

versets.ar: 2. وَالْكِتَابِ الْمُبِينِ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Par le Livre (le Coran) explicite.
versets.en: 2. By the manifest Book (this Quran) that makes things clear,

versets.ar: 3. إِنَّا أَنزَلْنَاهُ فِي لَيْلَةٍ مُّبَارَكَةٍ ۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا مُنذِرِينَ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Nous l'avons fait descendre en une nuit bénie, Nous sommes en vérité Celui qui avertit,
versets.en: 3. We sent it (this Quran) down on a blessed night [(i.e. night of Qadr, Surah No: 97) in the month of Ramadan,, the 9th month of the Islamic calendar]. Verily, We are ever warning [mankind that Our Torment will reach those who disbelieve in Our Oneness of Lordship and in Our Oneness of worship].

versets.ar: 4. فِيهَا يُفْرَقُ كُلُّ أَمْرٍ حَكِيمٍ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. durant laquelle est décidé tout ordre sage,
versets.en: 4. Therein (that night) is decreed every matter of ordainments.

versets.ar: 5. أَمْرًا مِّنْ عِندِنَا ۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا مُرْسِلِينَ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. c'est là un commandement venant de Nous. C'est Nous qui envoyons [les Messagers],
versets.en: 5. Amran (i.e. a Command or this Quran or the Decree of every matter) from Us. Verily, We are ever sending (the Messengers),

versets.ar: 6. رَحْمَةً مِّن رَّبِّكَ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. à titre de miséricorde de la part de ton Seigneur, car c'est Lui l'Audient, l'Omniscient,
versets.en: 6. (As) a Mercy from your Lord. Verily! He is the All-Hearer, the All-Knower.

versets.ar: 7. رَبِّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. Seigneur des cieux et de la terre et de ce qui est entre eux, si seulement vous pouviez en avoir la conviction.
versets.en: 7. The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if you (but) have a faith with certainty.

versets.ar: 8. لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ يُحْيِي وَيُمِيتُ ۖ رَبُّكُمْ وَرَبُّ آبَائِكُمُ الْأَوَّلِينَ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Point de divinité à part Lui. Il donne la vie et donne la mort, et Il est votre Seigneur et le Seigneur de vos premiers ancêtres.
versets.en: 8. La ilaha illa Huwa (none has the right to be worshipped but He). It is He Who gives life and causes death, your Lord and the Lord of your fore-fathers.

versets.ar: 9. بَلْ هُمْ فِي شَكٍّ يَلْعَبُونَ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Mais ces gens-là, dans le doute, s'amusent.
versets.en: 9. Nay! They play in doubt.

versets.ar: 10. فَارْتَقِبْ يَوْمَ تَأْتِي السَّمَاءُ بِدُخَانٍ مُّبِينٍ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Eh bien, attends le jour où le ciel apportera une fumée visible
versets.en: 10. Then wait you for the Day when the sky will bring forth a visible smoke.

versets.ar: 11. يَغْشَى النَّاسَ ۖ هَٰذَا عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. qui couvrira les gens. Ce sera un châtiment douloureux.
versets.en: 11. Covering the people, this is a painful torment.

versets.ar: 12. رَّبَّنَا اكْشِفْ عَنَّا الْعَذَابَ إِنَّا مُؤْمِنُونَ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. «Seigneur, éloigne de nous le châtiment. Car, [à présent] nous croyons».
versets.en: 12. (They will say): "Our Lord! Remove the torment from us, really we shall become believers!"

versets.ar: 13. أَنَّىٰ لَهُمُ الذِّكْرَىٰ وَقَدْ جَاءَهُمْ رَسُولٌ مُّبِينٌ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. D'où leur vient cette prise de conscience alors qu'un Messager explicite leur est déjà venu,
versets.en: 13. How can there be for them an admonition (at the time when the torment has reached them), when a Messenger explaining things clearly has already come to them.

versets.ar: 14. ثُمَّ تَوَلَّوْا عَنْهُ وَقَالُوا مُعَلَّمٌ مَّجْنُونٌ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. Puis ils s'en détournèrent en disant: «C'est un homme instruit [par d'autres], un possédé».
versets.en: 14. Then they had turned away from him (Messenger Muhammad SAW) and said: "One (Muhammad SAW) taught (by a human being), a madman!"

versets.ar: 15. إِنَّا كَاشِفُو الْعَذَابِ قَلِيلًا ۚ إِنَّكُمْ عَائِدُونَ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Nous dissiperons le châtiment pour peu de temps; car vous récidiverez.
versets.en: 15. Verily, We shall remove the torment for a while. Verily! You will revert.

versets.ar: 16. يَوْمَ نَبْطِشُ الْبَطْشَةَ الْكُبْرَىٰ إِنَّا مُنتَقِمُونَ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Le jour où Nous userons de la plus grande violence et Nous Nous vengerons.
versets.en: 16. On the Day when We shall seize you with the greatest grasp. Verily, We will exact retribution.

versets.ar: 17. ۞ وَلَقَدْ فَتَنَّا قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمَ فِرْعَوْنَ وَجَاءَهُمْ رَسُولٌ كَرِيمٌ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Et avant eux Nous avons déjà éprouvé le peuple de Pharaon, quand un noble Messager leur était venu,
versets.en: 17. And indeed We tried before them Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) people, when there came to them a noble Messenger [i.e. Musa (Moses)],

versets.ar: 18. أَنْ أَدُّوا إِلَيَّ عِبَادَ اللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. [leur disant]: «Livrez-moi les serviteurs d'Allah! Je suis pour vous un Messager digne de confiance.
versets.en: 18. Saying: "Restore to me the slaves of Allah (i.e. the Children of Israel). Verily! I am to you a Messenger worthy of all trust,

versets.ar: 19. وَأَن لَّا تَعْلُوا عَلَى اللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّي آتِيكُم بِسُلْطَانٍ مُّبِينٍ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Ne vous montrez pas hautains vis-à-vis d'Allah, car je vous apporte une preuve évidente.
versets.en: 19. "And exalt not (yourselves) against Allah. Truly, I have come to you with a manifest authority.

versets.ar: 20. وَإِنِّي عُذْتُ بِرَبِّي وَرَبِّكُمْ أَن تَرْجُمُونِ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. Et je cherche protection auprès de mon Seigneur et votre Seigneur, pour que vous ne me lapidiez pas.
versets.en: 20. "And truly, I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord, lest you stone me (or call me a sorcerer or kill me).

versets.ar: 21. وَإِن لَّمْ تُؤْمِنُوا لِي فَاعْتَزِلُونِ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Si vous ne voulez pas croire en moi, éloignez-vous de moi».
versets.en: 21. "But if you believe me not, then keep away from me and leave me alone."

versets.ar: 22. فَدَعَا رَبَّهُ أَنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ قَوْمٌ مُّجْرِمُونَ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. Il invoqua alors son Seigneur: «Ce sont des gens criminels».
versets.en: 22. (But they were aggressive), so he [Musa (Moses)] called upon his Lord (saying): "These are indeed the people who are Mujrimun (disbelievers, polytheists, sinners, criminals, etc.)."

versets.ar: 23. فَأَسْرِ بِعِبَادِي لَيْلًا إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. «Voyage de nuit avec Mes serviteurs; vous serez poursuivis.
versets.en: 23. (Allah said): "Depart you with My slaves by night. Surely, you will be pursued.

versets.ar: 24. وَاتْرُكِ الْبَحْرَ رَهْوًا ۖ إِنَّهُمْ جُندٌ مُّغْرَقُونَ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Laisse la mer calme; [telle que tu l'as franchie] ce sont, des armées [vouées] à la noyade».
versets.en: 24. "And leave the sea as it is (quiet and divided). Verily, They are a host to be drowned."

versets.ar: 25. كَمْ تَرَكُوا مِن جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Que de jardins et de sources ils laissèrent [derrière eux]
versets.en: 25. How many of gardens and springs do they [Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) people] left.

versets.ar: 26. وَزُرُوعٍ وَمَقَامٍ كَرِيمٍ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. que de champs et de superbes résidences,
versets.en: 26. And green crops (fields etc.) and goodly places,

versets.ar: 27. وَنَعْمَةٍ كَانُوا فِيهَا فَاكِهِينَ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. que de délices au sein desquels ils se réjouissaient.
versets.en: 27. And comforts of life wherein they used to take delight!

versets.ar: 28. كَذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَأَوْرَثْنَاهَا قَوْمًا آخَرِينَ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Il en fut ainsi et Nous fîmes qu'un autre peuple en hérita.
versets.en: 28. Thus (it was)! And We made other people inherit them (i.e. We made the Children of Israel to inherit the kingdom of Egypt).

versets.ar: 29. فَمَا بَكَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ السَّمَاءُ وَالْأَرْضُ وَمَا كَانُوا مُنظَرِينَ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. Ni le ciel ni la terre ne les pleurèrent et ils n'eurent aucun délai.
versets.en: 29. And the heavens and the earth wept not for them, nor were they given a respite.

versets.ar: 30. وَلَقَدْ نَجَّيْنَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ مِنَ الْعَذَابِ الْمُهِينِ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Et certes, Nous sauvâmes les Enfants d'Israël du châtiment avilissant
versets.en: 30. And indeed We saved the Children of Israel from the humiliating torment,

versets.ar: 31. مِن فِرْعَوْنَ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ عَالِيًا مِّنَ الْمُسْرِفِينَ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. de Pharaon qui était hautain et outrancier.
versets.en: 31. From Fir'aun (Pharaoh); Verily! He was arrogant and was of the Musrifun (those who transgress beyond bound in spending and other things and commit great sins).

versets.ar: 32. وَلَقَدِ اخْتَرْنَاهُمْ عَلَىٰ عِلْمٍ عَلَى الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. A bon escient Nous les choisîmes parmi tous les peuples de l'univers,
versets.en: 32. And We chose them (the Children of Israel) above the 'Alamin (mankind, and jinns) [during the time of Musa (Moses)] with knowledge,

versets.ar: 33. وَآتَيْنَاهُم مِّنَ الْآيَاتِ مَا فِيهِ بَلَاءٌ مُّبِينٌ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. et leur apportâmes des miracles de quoi les mettre manifestement à l'épreuve.
versets.en: 33. And granted them signs in which there was a plain trial.

versets.ar: 34. إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ لَيَقُولُونَ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. Ceux-là (les Mecquois) disent:
versets.en: 34. Verily, these (Quraish) people are saying:

versets.ar: 35. إِنْ هِيَ إِلَّا مَوْتَتُنَا الْأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُنشَرِينَ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. «Il n'y a pour nous qu'une mort, la première. Et nous ne serons pas ressuscités.
versets.en: 35. "There is nothing but our first death, and we shall not be resurrected.

versets.ar: 36. فَأْتُوا بِآبَائِنَا إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. Faites donc revenir nos ancêtres, si vous êtes véridiques».
versets.en: 36. "Then bring back our fore-fathers, if you speak the truth!"

versets.ar: 37. أَهُمْ خَيْرٌ أَمْ قَوْمُ تُبَّعٍ وَالَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ أَهْلَكْنَاهُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا مُجْرِمِينَ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. Sont-ils les meilleurs ou le peuple de Tubba' et ceux qui les ont précédés? Nous les avons fait périr parce que vraiment ils étaient criminels.
versets.en: 37. Are they better or the people of Tubba' and those before them? We destroyed them because they were indeed Mujrimun (disbelievers, polytheists, sinners, criminals, etc.).

versets.ar: 38. وَمَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا لَاعِبِينَ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. Ce n'est pas par divertissement que Nous avons créé les cieux et la terre et ce qui est entre eux.
versets.en: 38. And We created not the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, for mere play,

versets.ar: 39. مَا خَلَقْنَاهُمَا إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. Nous ne les avons créés qu'en toute vérité. Mais la plupart d'entre eux ne savent pas.
versets.en: 39. We created them not except with truth (i.e. to examine and test those who are obedient and those who are disobedient and then reward the obedient ones and punish the disobedient ones), but most of them know not.

versets.ar: 40. إِنَّ يَوْمَ الْفَصْلِ مِيقَاتُهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. En vérité, le Jour de la Décision sera leur rendez-vous à tous,
versets.en: 40. Verily, the Day of Judgement (when Allah will judge between the creatures) is the time appointed for all of them,

versets.ar: 41. يَوْمَ لَا يُغْنِي مَوْلًى عَن مَّوْلًى شَيْئًا وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. le jour où un allié ne sera d'aucune utilité à un [autre] allié; et ils ne seront point secourus non plus,
versets.en: 41. The Day when Maulan (a near relative) cannot avail Maulan (a near relative) in aught, and no help can they receive,

versets.ar: 42. إِلَّا مَن رَّحِمَ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. sauf celui à qui Allah fera miséricorde. Car c'est Lui, le Puissant, le Très Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 42. Except him on whom Allah has Mercy. Verily, He is the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

versets.fr: 43. Certes l'arbre de Zakkûm
versets.en: 43. Verily, the tree of Zaqqum,

versets.ar: 44. طَعَامُ الْأَثِيمِ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. sera la nourriture du grand pécheur.
versets.en: 44. Will be the food of the sinners,

versets.ar: 45. كَالْمُهْلِ يَغْلِي فِي الْبُطُونِ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. Comme du métal en fusion; il bouillonnera dans les ventres
versets.en: 45. Like boiling oil, it will boil in the bellies,

versets.ar: 46. كَغَلْيِ الْحَمِيمِ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. comme le bouillonnement de l'eau surchauffée.
versets.en: 46. Like the boiling of scalding water.

versets.ar: 47. خُذُوهُ فَاعْتِلُوهُ إِلَىٰ سَوَاءِ الْجَحِيمِ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. Qu'on le saisisse et qu'on l'emporte en plein dans la fournaise;
versets.en: 47. (It will be said) "Seize him and drag him into the midst of blazing Fire,

versets.ar: 48. ثُمَّ صُبُّوا فَوْقَ رَأْسِهِ مِنْ عَذَابِ الْحَمِيمِ ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. qu'on verse ensuite sur sa tête de l'eau bouillante comme châtiment.
versets.en: 48. "Then pour over his head the torment of boiling water,

versets.ar: 49. ذُقْ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الْعَزِيزُ الْكَرِيمُ ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. Goûte! Toi [qui prétendait être] le puissant, le noble.
versets.en: 49. "Taste you (this)! Verily, you were (pretending to be) the mighty, the generous!

versets.ar: 50. إِنَّ هَٰذَا مَا كُنتُم بِهِ تَمْتَرُونَ ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. Voilà ce dont vous doutiez.
versets.en: 50. "Verily! This is that whereof you used to doubt!"

versets.ar: 51. إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي مَقَامٍ أَمِينٍ ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. Les pieux seront dans une demeure sûre,
versets.en: 51. Verily! The Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2), will be in place of Security (Paradise).

versets.ar: 52. فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. parmi des jardins et des sources,
versets.en: 52. Among Gardens and Springs;

versets.ar: 53. يَلْبَسُونَ مِن سُندُسٍ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٍ مُّتَقَابِلِينَ ﴿53﴾
versets.fr: 53. Ils porteront des vêtements de satin et de brocart et seront placés face à face.
versets.en: 53. Dressed in fine silk and (also) in thick silk, facing each other,

versets.ar: 54. كَذَٰلِكَ وَزَوَّجْنَاهُم بِحُورٍ عِينٍ ﴿54﴾
versets.fr: 54. C'est ainsi! Et Nous leur donnerons pour épouses des houris aux grands yeux.
versets.en: 54. So (it will be), and We shall marry them to Houris (female fair ones) with wide, lovely eyes.

versets.ar: 55. يَدْعُونَ فِيهَا بِكُلِّ فَاكِهَةٍ آمِنِينَ ﴿55﴾
versets.fr: 55. Ils y demanderont en toute quiétude toutes sortes de fruits.
versets.en: 55. They will call therein for every kind of fruit in peace and security;

versets.ar: 56. لَا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا الْمَوْتَ إِلَّا الْمَوْتَةَ الْأُولَىٰ ۖ وَوَقَاهُمْ عَذَابَ الْجَحِيمِ ﴿56﴾
versets.fr: 56. Ils n'y goûteront pas à la mort sauf leur mort première. Et [Allah] les protègera du châtiment de la Fournaise,
versets.en: 56. They will never taste death therein except the first death (of this world), and He will save them from the torment of the blazing Fire,

versets.ar: 57. فَضْلًا مِّن رَّبِّكَ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ ﴿57﴾
versets.fr: 57. c'est là une grâce de ton Seigneur. Et c'est là l'énorme succès.
versets.en: 57. As a Bounty from your Lord! That will be the supreme success!

versets.ar: 58. فَإِنَّمَا يَسَّرْنَاهُ بِلِسَانِكَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ ﴿58﴾
versets.fr: 58. Nous ne l'avons facilité dans ta langue, qu'afin qu'ils se rappellent!
versets.en: 58. Certainly, We have made this (Quran) easy in your tongue, in order that they may remember.

versets.ar: 59. فَارْتَقِبْ إِنَّهُم مُّرْتَقِبُونَ ﴿59﴾
versets.fr: 59. Attends donc. Eux aussi attendent.
versets.en: 59. Wait then (O Muhammad SAW); Verily, they (too) are waiting.

versets.fr: 1. H'â, Mîm.
versets.en: 1. Ha-Mim. [These letters are one of the miracles of the Quran and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings].

versets.ar: 2. تَنزِيلُ الْكِتَابِ مِنَ اللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَكِيمِ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. La révélation du Livre émane d'Allah, le Puissant, le Sage.
versets.en: 2. The revelation of the Book (this Quran) is from Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

versets.ar: 3. إِنَّ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ لَآيَاتٍ لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Il y a certes dans les cieux et la terre des preuves pour les croyants.
versets.en: 3. Verily, in the heavens and the earth are signs for the believers.

versets.ar: 4. وَفِي خَلْقِكُمْ وَمَا يَبُثُّ مِن دَابَّةٍ آيَاتٌ لِّقَوْمٍ يُوقِنُونَ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Et dans votre propre création, et dans ce qu'Il dissémine comme animaux, il y a des signes pour des gens qui croient avec certitude.
versets.en: 4. And in your creation, and what He scattered (through the earth) of moving (living) creatures are signs for people who have Faith with certainty.

versets.ar: 5. وَاخْتِلَافِ اللَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ وَمَا أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مِن رِّزْقٍ فَأَحْيَا بِهِ الْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا وَتَصْرِيفِ الرِّيَاحِ آيَاتٌ لِّقَوْمٍ يَعْقِلُونَ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. De même dans l'alternance de la nuit et du jour, et dans ce qu'Allah fait descendre du ciel comme subsistance [pluie] par laquelle Il redonne la vie à la terre une fois morte, et dans la distribution des vents, il y a des signes pour des gens qui raisonnent.
versets.en: 5. And in the alternation of night and day, and the provision (rain) that Allah sends down from the sky, and revives therewith the earth after its death, and in the turning about of the winds (i.e. sometimes towards the east or north, and sometimes towards the south or west etc., sometimes bringing glad tidings of rain etc., and sometimes bringing the torment), are signs for a people who understand.

versets.ar: 6. تِلْكَ آيَاتُ اللَّهِ نَتْلُوهَا عَلَيْكَ بِالْحَقِّ ۖ فَبِأَيِّ حَدِيثٍ بَعْدَ اللَّهِ وَآيَاتِهِ يُؤْمِنُونَ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Voilà les versets d'Allah que Nous te récitons en toute vérité. Alors dans quelle parole croiront-ils après [la parole] d'Allah et après Ses signes?
versets.en: 6. These are the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, revelations, etc.) of Allah, which We recite to you (O Muhammad SAW) with truth. Then in which speech after Allah and His Ayat will they believe?

versets.ar: 7. وَيْلٌ لِّكُلِّ أَفَّاكٍ أَثِيمٍ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. Malheur à tout grand imposteur pécheur!
versets.en: 7. Woe to every sinful liar,

versets.ar: 8. يَسْمَعُ آيَاتِ اللَّهِ تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ثُمَّ يُصِرُّ مُسْتَكْبِرًا كَأَن لَّمْ يَسْمَعْهَا ۖ فَبَشِّرْهُ بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Il entend les versets d'Allah qu'on lui récite puis persiste dans son orgueil, comme s'il ne les avait jamais entendus. Annonce-lui donc un châtiment douloureux.
versets.en: 8. Who hears the Verses of Allah (being) recited to him, yet persists with pride as if he heard them not. So announce to him a painful torment!

versets.ar: 9. وَإِذَا عَلِمَ مِنْ آيَاتِنَا شَيْئًا اتَّخَذَهَا هُزُوًا ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ مُّهِينٌ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. S'il a connaissance de quelques-uns de Nos versets, il les tourne en dérision. Ceux-là auront un châtiment avilissant:
versets.en: 9. And when he learns something of Our Verses (this Quran), he makes them a jest. For such there will be a humiliating torment.

versets.ar: 10. مِّن وَرَائِهِمْ جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَلَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُم مَّا كَسَبُوا شَيْئًا وَلَا مَا اتَّخَذُوا مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ أَوْلِيَاءَ ۖ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. l'Enfer est à leurs trousses. Ce qu'ils auront acquis ne leur servira à rien, ni ce qu'ils auront pris comme protecteurs, en dehors d'Allah. Ils auront un énorme châtiment.
versets.en: 10. In front of them there is Hell, and that which they have earned will be of no profit to them, nor (will be of any profit to them) those whom they have taken as Auliya' (protectors, helpers, etc.) besides Allah. And theirs will be a great torment.

versets.ar: 11. هَٰذَا هُدًى ۖ وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِآيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ مِّن رِّجْزٍ أَلِيمٌ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. Ceci [le Coran] est un guide. Et ceux qui récusent les versets de leur Seigneur auront le supplice d'un châtiment douloureux.
versets.en: 11. This (Quran) is a guidance. And those who disbelieve in the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) of their Lord, for them there is a painful torment of Rijz (a severe kind of punishment).

versets.ar: 12. ۞ اللَّهُ الَّذِي سَخَّرَ لَكُمُ الْبَحْرَ لِتَجْرِيَ الْفُلْكُ فِيهِ بِأَمْرِهِ وَلِتَبْتَغُوا مِن فَضْلِهِ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. Allah c'est Lui qui vous a assujetti la mer, afin que les vaisseaux y voguent, par Son ordre, et que vous alliez en quête de sa grâce afin que vous soyez reconnaissants.
versets.en: 12. Allah it is He Who has subjected to you the sea, that ships may sail through it by His Command, and that you may seek of His Bounty, and that you may be thankful,

versets.ar: 13. وَسَخَّرَ لَكُم مَّا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا مِّنْهُ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. Et Il vous a assujetti tout ce qui est dans les cieux et sur la terre, le tout venant de Lui. Il y a là des signes pour des gens qui réfléchissent.
versets.en: 13. And has subjected to you all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth; it is all as a favour and kindness from Him. Verily, in it are signs for a people who think deeply.

versets.ar: 14. قُل لِّلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا يَغْفِرُوا لِلَّذِينَ لَا يَرْجُونَ أَيَّامَ اللَّهِ لِيَجْزِيَ قَوْمًا بِمَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. Dis à ceux qui ont cru de pardonner à ceux qui n'espèrent pas les jours d'Allah afin qu'Il rétribue [chaque] peuple pour les acquis qu'ils faisaient.
versets.en: 14. Say (O Muhammad SAW) to the believers to forgive those who (harm them and) hope not for the Days of Allah (i.e. His Recompense), that He may recompense people according to what they have earned (i.e. to punish these disbelievers, who harm the believers).

versets.ar: 15. مَنْ عَمِلَ صَالِحًا فَلِنَفْسِهِ ۖ وَمَنْ أَسَاءَ فَعَلَيْهَا ۖ ثُمَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكُمْ تُرْجَعُونَ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Quiconque fait le bien, le fait pour lui-même; et quiconque agit mal, agit contre lui-même. Puis vous serez ramenés vers votre Seigneur,
versets.en: 15. Whosoever does a good deed, it is for his ownself, and whosoever does evil, it is against (his ownself). Then to your Lord you will be made to return.

versets.ar: 16. وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ الْكِتَابَ وَالْحُكْمَ وَالنُّبُوَّةَ وَرَزَقْنَاهُم مِّنَ الطَّيِّبَاتِ وَفَضَّلْنَاهُمْ عَلَى الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Nous avons effectivement apporté aux Enfants d'Israël le Livre, la sagesse, la prophétie, et leur avons attribué de bonnes choses, et les préférâmes aux autres humains [leurs contemporains];
versets.en: 16. And indeed We gave the Children of Israel the Scripture, and the understanding of the Scripture and its laws, and the Prophethood; and provided them with good things, and preferred them above the 'Alamin (mankind and jinns) (of their time, during that period),

versets.ar: 17. وَآتَيْنَاهُم بَيِّنَاتٍ مِّنَ الْأَمْرِ ۖ فَمَا اخْتَلَفُوا إِلَّا مِن بَعْدِ مَا جَاءَهُمُ الْعِلْمُ بَغْيًا بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَقْضِي بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ فِيمَا كَانُوا فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Et Nous leur avons apporté des preuves évidentes de l'Ordre. Ils ne divergèrent qu'après que la science leur fut venue par agressivité entre eux. Ton Seigneur décidera parmi eux, au Jour de la Résurrection, sur ce en quoi ils divergeaient.
versets.en: 17. And gave them clear proofs in matters [by revealing to them the Taurat (Torah)]. And they differed not until after the knowledge came to them, through envy among themselves. Verily, Your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection about that wherein they used to differ.

versets.ar: 18. ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَاكَ عَلَىٰ شَرِيعَةٍ مِّنَ الْأَمْرِ فَاتَّبِعْهَا وَلَا تَتَّبِعْ أَهْوَاءَ الَّذِينَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. Puis Nous t'avons mis sur la voie de l'Ordre [une religion claire et parfaite]. Suis-la donc et ne suis pas les passions de ceux qui ne savent pas.
versets.en: 18. Then We have put you (O Muhammad SAW) on a plain way of (Our) commandment [like the one which We commanded Our Messengers before you (i.e. legal ways and laws of the Islamic Monotheism)]. So follow you that (Islamic Monotheism and its laws), and follow not the desires of those who know not. [Tafsir At-Tabari Vol. 25, Page 146].

versets.ar: 19. إِنَّهُمْ لَن يُغْنُوا عَنكَ مِنَ اللَّهِ شَيْئًا ۚ وَإِنَّ الظَّالِمِينَ بَعْضُهُمْ أَوْلِيَاءُ بَعْضٍ ۖ وَاللَّهُ وَلِيُّ الْمُتَّقِينَ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Ils ne te seront d'aucune utilité vis-à-vis d'Allah. Les injustes sont vraiment alliés les uns des autres; tandis qu'Allah est le Protecteur des pieux.
versets.en: 19. Verily, they can avail you nothing against Allah (if He wants to punish you). Verily, the Zalimun (polytheists, wrong-doers, etc.) are Auliya' (protectors, helpers, etc.) to one another, but Allah is the Wali (Helper, Protector, etc.) of the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2).

versets.ar: 20. هَٰذَا بَصَائِرُ لِلنَّاسِ وَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةٌ لِّقَوْمٍ يُوقِنُونَ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. Ceci [le Coran] constitue pour les hommes une source de clarté, un guide et une miséricorde pour des gens qui croient avec certitude.
versets.en: 20. This (Quran) is a clear insight and evidence for mankind, and a guidance and a mercy for people who have Faith with certainty.

versets.ar: 21. أَمْ حَسِبَ الَّذِينَ اجْتَرَحُوا السَّيِّئَاتِ أَن نَّجْعَلَهُمْ كَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ سَوَاءً مَّحْيَاهُمْ وَمَمَاتُهُمْ ۚ سَاءَ مَا يَحْكُمُونَ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Ceux qui commettent des mauvaises actions comptent-ils que Nous allons les traiter comme ceux qui croient et accomplissent les bonnes œuvres, dans leur vie et dans leur mort? Comme ils jugent mal!
versets.en: 21. Or do those who earn evil deeds think that We shall hold them equal with those who believe (in the Oneness of Allah Islamic Monotheism) and do righteous good deeds, in their present life and after their death? Worst is the judgement that they make.

versets.ar: 22. وَخَلَقَ اللَّهُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ بِالْحَقِّ وَلِتُجْزَىٰ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. Et Allah a créé les cieux et la terre en toute vérité et afin que chaque âme soit rétribuée selon ce qu'elle a acquis. Ils ne seront cependant pas lésés.
versets.en: 22. And Allah has created the heavens and the earth with truth, in order that each person may be recompensed what he has earned, and they will not be wronged.

versets.ar: 23. أَفَرَأَيْتَ مَنِ اتَّخَذَ إِلَٰهَهُ هَوَاهُ وَأَضَلَّهُ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ عِلْمٍ وَخَتَمَ عَلَىٰ سَمْعِهِ وَقَلْبِهِ وَجَعَلَ عَلَىٰ بَصَرِهِ غِشَاوَةً فَمَن يَهْدِيهِ مِن بَعْدِ اللَّهِ ۚ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. Vois-tu celui qui prend sa passion pour sa propre divinité? Et Allah l'égare sciemment et scelle son ouïe et son cœur et étend un voile sur sa vue. Qui donc peut le guider après Allah? Ne vous rappelez-vous donc pas?
versets.en: 23. Have you seen him who takes his own lust (vain desires) as his ilah (god), and Allah knowing (him as such), left him astray, and sealed his hearing and his heart, and put a cover on his sight. Who then will guide him after Allah? Will you not then remember?

versets.ar: 24. وَقَالُوا مَا هِيَ إِلَّا حَيَاتُنَا الدُّنْيَا نَمُوتُ وَنَحْيَا وَمَا يُهْلِكُنَا إِلَّا الدَّهْرُ ۚ وَمَا لَهُم بِذَٰلِكَ مِنْ عِلْمٍ ۖ إِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا يَظُنُّونَ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Et ils dirent: «Il n'y a pour nous que la vie d'ici-bas: nous mourons et nous vivons et seul le temps nous fait périr». Ils n'ont de cela aucune connaissance: ils ne font qu'émettre des conjectures.
versets.en: 24. And they say: "There is nothing but our life of this world, we die and we live and nothing destroys us except Ad-Dahr (the time). And they have no knowledge of it, they only conjecture.

versets.ar: 25. وَإِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ آيَاتُنَا بَيِّنَاتٍ مَّا كَانَ حُجَّتَهُمْ إِلَّا أَن قَالُوا ائْتُوا بِآبَائِنَا إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Et quand on leur récite Nos versets bien clairs, leur seul argument est de dire: «Faites revenir nos ancêtres si vous êtes véridiques».
versets.en: 25. And when Our Clear Verses are recited to them, their argument is no other than that they say: "Bring back our (dead) fathers, if you are truthful!"

versets.ar: 26. قُلِ اللَّهُ يُحْيِيكُمْ ثُمَّ يُمِيتُكُمْ ثُمَّ يَجْمَعُكُمْ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ لَا رَيْبَ فِيهِ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ النَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Dis: «Allah vous donne la vie puis Il vous donne la mort. Ensuite Il vous réunira le Jour de la Résurrection, il n'y a pas de doute à ce sujet, mais la plupart des gens ne savent pas.
versets.en: 26. Say (to them): "Allah gives you life, then causes you to die, then He will assemble you on the Day of Resurrection about which there is no doubt. But most of mankind know not."

versets.ar: 27. وَلِلَّهِ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَيَوْمَ تَقُومُ السَّاعَةُ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَخْسَرُ الْمُبْطِلُونَ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. A Allah appartient le royaume des cieux et de la terre. Et le jour où l'Heure arrivera, ce jour-là, les imposteurs seront perdus.
versets.en: 27. And to Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. And on the Day that the Hour will be established, on that Day the followers of falsehood (polytheists, disbelievers, worshippers of false deities, etc.) shall lose (everything).

versets.ar: 28. وَتَرَىٰ كُلَّ أُمَّةٍ جَاثِيَةً ۚ كُلُّ أُمَّةٍ تُدْعَىٰ إِلَىٰ كِتَابِهَا الْيَوْمَ تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Et tu verras chaque communauté agenouillée. Chaque communauté sera appelée vers son livre. On vous rétribuera aujourd'hui selon ce que vous œuvriez.
versets.en: 28. And you will see each nation humbled to their knees (kneeling), each nation will be called to its Record (of deeds). This Day you shall be recompensed for what you used to do.

versets.ar: 29. هَٰذَا كِتَابُنَا يَنطِقُ عَلَيْكُم بِالْحَقِّ ۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا نَسْتَنسِخُ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. Voilà Notre Livre. Il parle de vous en toute vérité car Nous enregistrions [tout] ce que vous faisiez».
versets.en: 29. This Our Record speaks about you with truth. Verily, We were recording what you used to do (i.e. Our angels used to record your deeds).

versets.ar: 30. فَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ فَيُدْخِلُهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ فِي رَحْمَتِهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْمُبِينُ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Ceux qui ont cru et fait de bonnes œuvres, leur Seigneur les fera entrer dans Sa miséricorde. Voilà le succès évident.
versets.en: 30. Then, as for those who believed (in the Oneness of Allah Islamic Monotheism) and did righteous good deeds, their Lord will admit them to His Mercy. That will be the evident success.

versets.ar: 31. وَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا أَفَلَمْ تَكُنْ آيَاتِي تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ فَاسْتَكْبَرْتُمْ وَكُنتُمْ قَوْمًا مُّجْرِمِينَ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. Et quant à ceux qui ont mécru [il sera dit]: «Mes versets ne vous étaient-ils pas récités? Mais vous vous enfliez d'orgueil et vous étiez des gens criminels».
versets.en: 31. But as for those who disbelieved (it will be said to them): "Were not Our Verses recited to you? But you were proud, and you were a people who were Mujrimun (polytheists, disbelievers, sinners, criminals)."

versets.ar: 32. وَإِذَا قِيلَ إِنَّ وَعْدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ وَالسَّاعَةُ لَا رَيْبَ فِيهَا قُلْتُم مَّا نَدْرِي مَا السَّاعَةُ إِن نَّظُنُّ إِلَّا ظَنًّا وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُسْتَيْقِنِينَ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. Et quand on disait: «La promesse d'Allah est vérité; et l'Heure n'est pas l'objet d'un doute», vous disiez: «Nous ne savons pas ce que c'est que l'Heure; et nous ne faisions à son sujet que de simples conjectures et nous ne sommes pas convaincus [qu'elle arrivera].
versets.en: 32. And when it was said: "Verily! Allah's Promise is the truth, and there is no doubt about the coming of the Hour," you said; "We know not what is the Hour, we do not think it but as a conjecture, and we have no firm convincing belief (therein)."

versets.ar: 33. وَبَدَا لَهُمْ سَيِّئَاتُ مَا عَمِلُوا وَحَاقَ بِهِم مَّا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. Et leur apparaîtra [la laideur] de leurs mauvaises actions. Et ce dont ils se moquaient les cernera.
versets.en: 33. And the evil of what they did will appear to them, and they will be completely encircled by that which they used to mock at!

versets.ar: 34. وَقِيلَ الْيَوْمَ نَنسَاكُمْ كَمَا نَسِيتُمْ لِقَاءَ يَوْمِكُمْ هَٰذَا وَمَأْوَاكُمُ النَّارُ وَمَا لَكُم مِّن نَّاصِرِينَ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. Et on leur dira: «Aujourd'hui Nous vous oublions comme vous avez oublié la rencontre de votre jour que voici. Votre refuge est le Feu; et vous n'aurez point de secoureurs.
versets.en: 34. And it will be said: "This Day We will forget you as you forgot the Meeting of this Day of yours. And your abode is the Fire, and there is none to help you."

versets.ar: 35. ذَٰلِكُم بِأَنَّكُمُ اتَّخَذْتُمْ آيَاتِ اللَّهِ هُزُوًا وَغَرَّتْكُمُ الْحَيَاةُ الدُّنْيَا ۚ فَالْيَوْمَ لَا يُخْرَجُونَ مِنْهَا وَلَا هُمْ يُسْتَعْتَبُونَ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Cela parce que vous preniez en raillerie les versets d'Allah et que la vie d'ici-bas vous trompait». Ce jour-là on ne les en fera pas sortir et on ne les excusera pas non plus.
versets.en: 35. This, because you took the revelations of Allah (this Quran) in mockery, and the life of the world deceived you. So this Day, they shall not be taken out from there (Hell), nor shall they be Yusta'tabun (i.e. they shall not return to the worldly life, so that they repent to Allah, and beg His Pardon for their sins).

versets.ar: 36. فَلِلَّهِ الْحَمْدُ رَبِّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَرَبِّ الْأَرْضِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. Louange à Allah, Seigneur des cieux et Seigneur de la terre: Seigneur de l'univers.
versets.en: 36. So all the praises and thanks are to Allah, the Lord of the heavens and the Lord of the earth, and the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists).

versets.ar: 37. وَلَهُ الْكِبْرِيَاءُ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. Et à Lui la grandeur dans les cieux et la terre. Et c'est Lui le Puissant, le Sage.
versets.en: 37. And His (Alone) is the Majesty in the heavens and the earth, and He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

versets.fr: 1. H'â, Mîm.
versets.en: 1. Ha-Mim. [These letters are one of the miracles of the Quran, and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings].

versets.ar: 2. تَنزِيلُ الْكِتَابِ مِنَ اللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَكِيمِ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. La révélation du Livre émane d'Allah, le Puissant, le Sage.
versets.en: 2. The revelation of the Book (this Quran) is from Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

versets.ar: 3. مَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ وَأَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۚ وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا عَمَّا أُنذِرُوا مُعْرِضُونَ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Nous n'avons créé les cieux et la terre et ce qui est entre eux qu'en toute vérité et [pour] un terme fixé. Ceux qui ont mécru se détournent de ce dont ils ont été avertis.
versets.en: 3. We created not the heavens and the earth and all that is between them except with truth, and for an appointed term. But those who disbelieve turn away from that whereof they are warned.

versets.ar: 4. قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُم مَّا تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ أَرُونِي مَاذَا خَلَقُوا مِنَ الْأَرْضِ أَمْ لَهُمْ شِرْكٌ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ ۖ ائْتُونِي بِكِتَابٍ مِّن قَبْلِ هَٰذَا أَوْ أَثَارَةٍ مِّنْ عِلْمٍ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Dis: «Que pensez-vous de ceux que vous invoquez en dehors d'Allah? Montrez-moi donc ce qu'ils ont créé de la terre! Ou ont-ils dans les cieux une participation avec Dieu? Apportez-moi un Livre antérieur à celui-ci (le Coran) ou même un vestige d'une science, si vous êtes véridiques».
versets.en: 4. Say (O Muhammad SAW to these pagans): "Think! All that you invoke besides Allah show me! What have they created of the earth? Or have they a share in (the creation of) the heavens? Bring me a Book (revealed before this), or some trace of knowledge (in support of your claims), if you are truthful!"

versets.ar: 5. وَمَنْ أَضَلُّ مِمَّن يَدْعُو مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ مَن لَّا يَسْتَجِيبُ لَهُ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ وَهُمْ عَن دُعَائِهِمْ غَافِلُونَ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Et qui est plus égaré que celui qui invoque en dehors d'Allah, et que la vie ne saura lui répondre jusqu'au Jour de la Résurrection? Et elles [leurs divinités] sont indifférentes à leur invocation.
versets.en: 5. And who is more astray than one who calls (invokes) besides Allah, such as will not answer him till the Day of Resurrection, and who are (even) unaware of their calls (invocations) to them?

versets.ar: 6. وَإِذَا حُشِرَ النَّاسُ كَانُوا لَهُمْ أَعْدَاءً وَكَانُوا بِعِبَادَتِهِمْ كَافِرِينَ ﴿6﴾
