versets.en: 14. And the dwellers of the Wood, and the people of Tubba'; everyone of them denied (their) Messengers, so My Threat took effect.

versets.ar: 15. أَفَعَيِينَا بِالْخَلْقِ الْأَوَّلِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِي لَبْسٍ مِّنْ خَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Quoi? Avons-Nous été fatigué par la première création? Mais ils sont dans la confusion [au sujet] d'une création nouvelle.
versets.en: 15. Were We then tired with the first creation? Nay, They are in confused doubt about a new creation (i.e. Resurrection)?

versets.ar: 16. وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنسَانَ وَنَعْلَمُ مَا تُوَسْوِسُ بِهِ نَفْسُهُ ۖ وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنْ حَبْلِ الْوَرِيدِ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Nous avons effectivement créé l'homme et Nous savons ce que son âme lui suggère et Nous sommes plus près de lui que sa veine jugulaire
versets.en: 16. And indeed We have created man, and We know what his ownself whispers to him. And We are nearer to him than his jugular vein (by Our Knowledge).

versets.ar: 17. إِذْ يَتَلَقَّى الْمُتَلَقِّيَانِ عَنِ الْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ الشِّمَالِ قَعِيدٌ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. quand les deux recueillants, assis à droite et à gauche, recueillent.
versets.en: 17. (Remember!) that the two receivers (recording angels) receive (each human being after he or she has attained the age of puberty), one sitting on the right and one on the left (to note his or her actions).

versets.ar: 18. مَّا يَلْفِظُ مِن قَوْلٍ إِلَّا لَدَيْهِ رَقِيبٌ عَتِيدٌ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. Il ne prononce pas une parole sans avoir auprès de lui un observateur prêt à l'inscrire.
versets.en: 18. Not a word does he (or she) utter, but there is a watcher by him ready (to record it).

versets.ar: 19. وَجَاءَتْ سَكْرَةُ الْمَوْتِ بِالْحَقِّ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنتَ مِنْهُ تَحِيدُ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. L'agonie de la mort fait apparaître la vérité: «Voilà ce dont tu t'écartais».
versets.en: 19. And the stupor of death will come in truth: "This is what you have been avoiding!"

versets.ar: 20. وَنُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْوَعِيدِ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. Et l'on soufflera dans la Trompe: Voilà le jour de la Menace.
versets.en: 20. And the Trumpet will be blown, that will be the Day whereof warning (had been given) (i.e. the Day of Resurrection).

versets.ar: 21. وَجَاءَتْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَّعَهَا سَائِقٌ وَشَهِيدٌ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Alors chaque âme viendra accompagnée d'un conducteur et d'un témoin.
versets.en: 21. And every person will come forth along with an (angel) to drive (him), and an (angel) to bear witness.

versets.ar: 22. لَّقَدْ كُنتَ فِي غَفْلَةٍ مِّنْ هَٰذَا فَكَشَفْنَا عَنكَ غِطَاءَكَ فَبَصَرُكَ الْيَوْمَ حَدِيدٌ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. «Tu restais indifférent à cela. Et bien, Nous ôtons ton voile; ta vue est perçante aujourd'hui.
versets.en: 22. (It will be said to the sinners): "Indeed you were heedless of this, now We have removed your covering, and sharp is your sight this Day!"

versets.ar: 23. وَقَالَ قَرِينُهُ هَٰذَا مَا لَدَيَّ عَتِيدٌ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. Et son compagnon dira: «Voilà ce qui est avec moi, tout prêt».
versets.en: 23. And his companion (angel) will say: "Here is (this Record) ready with me!"

versets.ar: 24. أَلْقِيَا فِي جَهَنَّمَ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ عَنِيدٍ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. «Vous deux, jetez dans l'Enfer tout mécréant endurci et rebelle,
versets.en: 24. (And it will be said): "Both of you throw (Order from Allah to the two angels) into Hell, every stubborn disbeliever (in the Oneness of Allah, in His Messengers, etc.).

versets.fr: 25. acharné à empêcher le bien, transgresseur, douteur,
versets.en: 25. "Hinderer of good, transgressor, doubter,

versets.ar: 26. الَّذِي جَعَلَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ فَأَلْقِيَاهُ فِي الْعَذَابِ الشَّدِيدِ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. celui qui plaçait à côté d'Allah une autre divinité. Jetez-le donc dans le dur châtiment».
versets.en: 26. "Who set up another ilah (god) with Allah, then (both of you) cast him in the severe torment."

versets.ar: 27. ۞ قَالَ قَرِينُهُ رَبَّنَا مَا أَطْغَيْتُهُ وَلَٰكِن كَانَ فِي ضَلَالٍ بَعِيدٍ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Son camarade (le Diable) dira: «Seigneur, ce n'est pas moi qui l'ai fait transgresser; mais il était déjà dans un profond égarement».
versets.en: 27. His companion (Satan devil)] will say: "Our Lord! I did not push him to transgress, (in disbelief, oppression, and evil deeds) but he was himself in error far astray."

versets.ar: 28. قَالَ لَا تَخْتَصِمُوا لَدَيَّ وَقَدْ قَدَّمْتُ إِلَيْكُم بِالْوَعِيدِ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Alors [Allah] dira:«Ne vous disputez pas devant moi! Alors que Je vous ai déjà fait part de la menace.
versets.en: 28. Allah will say: "Dispute not in front of Me, I had already, in advance, sent you the threat.

versets.ar: 29. مَا يُبَدَّلُ الْقَوْلُ لَدَيَّ وَمَا أَنَا بِظَلَّامٍ لِّلْعَبِيدِ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. Chez Moi, la parole ne change pas; et Je n'opprime nullement les serviteurs».
versets.en: 29. The Sentence that comes from Me cannot be changed, and I am not unjust (to the least) to the slaves."

versets.ar: 30. يَوْمَ نَقُولُ لِجَهَنَّمَ هَلِ امْتَلَأْتِ وَتَقُولُ هَلْ مِن مَّزِيدٍ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Le jour où Nous dirons à l'Enfer; «Es-tu rempli?» Il dira: «Y en a-t-il encore?»
versets.en: 30. On the Day when We will say to Hell: "Are you filled?" It will say: "Are there any more (to come)?"

versets.ar: 31. وَأُزْلِفَتِ الْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. Le Paradis sera rapproché à proximité des pieux.
versets.en: 31. And Paradise will be brought near to the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2) not far off.

versets.ar: 32. هَٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِكُلِّ أَوَّابٍ حَفِيظٍ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. «Voilà ce qui vous a été promis, [ainsi qu'] à tout homme plein de repentir et respectueux [des prescriptions divines]
versets.en: 32. (It will be said): "This is what you were promised, - (it is) for those oft-returning (to Allah) in sincere repentance, and those who preserve their covenant with Allah (by obeying Him in all what He has ordered, and worship none but Allah Alone, i.e. follow Allah's Religion, Islamic Monotheism).

versets.ar: 33. مَّنْ خَشِيَ الرَّحْمَٰنَ بِالْغَيْبِ وَجَاءَ بِقَلْبٍ مُّنِيبٍ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. qui redoute le Tout Miséricordieux bien qu'il ne Le voit pas, et qui vient [vers Lui] avec un cœur porté à l'obéissance.
versets.en: 33. "Who feared the Most Beneficent (Allah) in the Ghaib (unseen): (i.e. in this worldly life before seeing and meeting Him), and brought a heart turned in repentance (to Him - and absolutely free from each and every kind of polytheism),

versets.ar: 34. ادْخُلُوهَا بِسَلَامٍ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْخُلُودِ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. Entrez-y en toute sécurité,». Voilà le jour de l'éternité!
versets.en: 34. "Enter you therein in peace and security; this is a Day of eternal life!"

versets.ar: 35. لَهُم مَّا يَشَاءُونَ فِيهَا وَلَدَيْنَا مَزِيدٌ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Il y aura là pour eux tout ce qu'ils voudront. Et auprès de Nous il y a davantage encore.
versets.en: 35. There they will have all that they desire, and We have more (for them, i.e. a glance at the All-Mighty, All-Majestic).

versets.ar: 36. وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْنٍ هُمْ أَشَدُّ مِنْهُم بَطْشًا فَنَقَّبُوا فِي الْبِلَادِ هَلْ مِن مَّحِيصٍ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. combien avons-Nous fait périr, avant eux, de générations bien plus fortes qu'eux. Ils avaient parcouru les contrées, cherchant [vainement] où fuir.
versets.en: 36. And how many a generation We have destroyed before them, who were stronger in power than them, and (when Our Torment came) they ran for a refuge in the land! Could they find any place of refuge (for them to save themselves from destruction)?

versets.ar: 37. إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكْرَىٰ لِمَن كَانَ لَهُ قَلْبٌ أَوْ أَلْقَى السَّمْعَ وَهُوَ شَهِيدٌ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. Il y a bien là un rappel pour quiconque a un cœur, prête l'oreille tout en étant témoin.
versets.en: 37. Verily, therein is indeed a reminder for him who has a heart or gives ear while he is heedful.

versets.ar: 38. وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ وَمَا مَسَّنَا مِن لُّغُوبٍ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. En effet Nous avons créé les cieux et la terre et ce qui existe entre eux en six jours, sans éprouver la moindre lassitude.
versets.en: 38. And indeed We created the heavens and the earth and all between them in six Days and nothing of fatigue touched Us.

versets.ar: 39. فَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ الشَّمْسِ وَقَبْلَ الْغُرُوبِ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. Endure donc ce qu'ils disent; et célèbre la louange de ton Seigneur avant le lever du soleil et avant [son] coucher;
versets.en: 39. So bear with patience (O Muhammad SAW) all that they say, and glorify the Praises of your Lord, before the rising of the sun and before (its) setting (i.e. the Fajr, Zuhr, and 'Asr prayers).

versets.ar: 40. وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَأَدْبَارَ السُّجُودِ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. et célèbre Sa gloire, une partie de la nuit et à la suite des prosternations [prières].
versets.en: 40. And during a part of the night (also), glorify His praises (i.e. Maghrib and 'Isha prayers), and (so likewise) after the prayers [As-Sunnah, Nawafil optional and additional prayers, and also glorify, praise and magnify Allah - Subhan Allah, Alhamdu lillah, Allahu-Akbar].

versets.ar: 41. وَاسْتَمِعْ يَوْمَ يُنَادِ الْمُنَادِ مِن مَّكَانٍ قَرِيبٍ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. Et sois à l'écoute, le jour où le Crieur criera d'un endroit proche,
versets.en: 41. And listen on the Day when the caller will call from a near place,

versets.ar: 42. يَوْمَ يَسْمَعُونَ الصَّيْحَةَ بِالْحَقِّ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْخُرُوجِ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. le jour où ils entendront en toute vérité le Cri. Voilà le Jour de la Résurrection.
versets.en: 42. The Day when they will hear As-Saihah (shout, etc.) in truth, that will be the Day of coming out (from the graves i.e. the Day of Resurrection).

versets.ar: 43. إِنَّا نَحْنُ نُحْيِي وَنُمِيتُ وَإِلَيْنَا الْمَصِيرُ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. C'est Nous qui donnons la vie et donnons la mort, et vers Nous sera la destination,
versets.en: 43. Verily, We it is Who give life and cause death; and to Us is the final return,

versets.ar: 44. يَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ الْأَرْضُ عَنْهُمْ سِرَاعًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ حَشْرٌ عَلَيْنَا يَسِيرٌ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. le jour où la terre se fendra, les [rejetant] précipitamment. Ce sera un rassemblement facile pour Nous.
versets.en: 44. On the Day when the earth shall be cleft, from off them, (they will come out) hastening forth. That will be a gathering, quite easy for Us.

versets.ar: 45. نَّحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ ۖ وَمَا أَنتَ عَلَيْهِم بِجَبَّارٍ ۖ فَذَكِّرْ بِالْقُرْآنِ مَن يَخَافُ وَعِيدِ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. Nous savons mieux ce qu'ils disent. Tu n'as pas pour mission d'exercer sur eux une contrainte. Rappelle donc, par le Coran celui qui craint Ma menace.
versets.en: 45. We know of best what they say; and you (O Muhammad SAW) are not a tyrant over them (to force them to Belief). But warn by the Quran, him who fears My Threat.

versets.ar: 1. وَالذَّارِيَاتِ ذَرْوًا ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. Par les vents qui éparpillent!
versets.en: 1. By (the winds) that scatter dust.

versets.ar: 2. فَالْحَامِلَاتِ وِقْرًا ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Par les porteurs de fardeaux!
versets.en: 2. And (the clouds) that bear heavy weight of water;

versets.ar: 3. فَالْجَارِيَاتِ يُسْرًا ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Par les glisseurs agiles!
versets.en: 3. And (the ships) that float with ease and gentleness;

versets.ar: 4. فَالْمُقَسِّمَاتِ أَمْرًا ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Par les distributeurs selon un commandement!
versets.en: 4. And those (angels) who distribute (provisions, rain, and other blessings) by (Allah's) Command;

versets.ar: 5. إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقٌ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Ce qui vous est promis est certainement vrai.
versets.en: 5. Verily, that which you are promised (i.e. Resurrection in the Hereafter and receiving the reward or punishment of good or bad deeds, etc.) is surely true.

versets.ar: 6. وَإِنَّ الدِّينَ لَوَاقِعٌ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Et la Rétribution arrivera inévitablement.
versets.en: 6. And verily, the Recompense is sure to happen.

versets.ar: 7. وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الْحُبُكِ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. Par le ciel aux voies parfaitement tracées!
versets.en: 7. By the heaven full of paths,

versets.ar: 8. إِنَّكُمْ لَفِي قَوْلٍ مُّخْتَلِفٍ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. vous divergez sur ce que vous dites.
versets.en: 8. Certainly, you have different ideas (about Muhammad SAW and the Quran).

versets.ar: 9. يُؤْفَكُ عَنْهُ مَنْ أُفِكَ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Est détourné de lui quiconque a été détourné de la foi.
versets.en: 9. Turned aside therefrom (i.e. from Muhammad SAW and the Quran) is he who is turned aside (by the Decree and Preordainment of Allah).

versets.ar: 10. قُتِلَ الْخَرَّاصُونَ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Maudits soient les menteurs,
versets.en: 10. Cursed be the liars,

versets.ar: 11. الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي غَمْرَةٍ سَاهُونَ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. qui sont plongés dans l'insouciance.
versets.en: 11. Who are under a cover of heedlessness (think not about the gravity of the Hereafter),

versets.ar: 12. يَسْأَلُونَ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ الدِّينِ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. Ils demandent: «A quand le jour de la Rétribution?»
versets.en: 12. They ask; "When will be the Day of Recompense?"

versets.ar: 13. يَوْمَ هُمْ عَلَى النَّارِ يُفْتَنُونَ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. Le jour où ils seront éprouvés au Feu:
versets.en: 13. (It will be) a Day when they will be tried (i.e. burnt) over the Fire!

versets.ar: 14. ذُوقُوا فِتْنَتَكُمْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. «Goûtez à votre épreuve [punition]; voici ce que vous cherchiez à hâter».
versets.en: 14. "Taste you your trial (burning)! This is what you used to ask to be hastened!"

versets.ar: 15. إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Les pieux seront dans des Jardins et [parmi] des sources,
versets.en: 15. Verily, the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2) will be in the midst of Gardens and Springs (in the Paradise),

versets.ar: 16. آخِذِينَ مَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحْسِنِينَ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. recevant ce que leur Seigneur leur aura donné. Car ils ont été auparavant des bienfaisants:
versets.en: 16. Taking joy in the things which their Lord has given them. Verily, they were before this Muhsinun (good-doers - see V. 2:112).

versets.ar: 17. كَانُوا قَلِيلًا مِّنَ اللَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. ils dormaient peu, la nuit,
versets.en: 17. They used to sleep but little by night [invoking their Lord (Allah) and praying, with fear and hope].

versets.ar: 18. وَبِالْأَسْحَارِ هُمْ يَسْتَغْفِرُونَ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. et aux dernières heures de la nuit ils imploraient le pardon [d'Allah];
versets.en: 18. And in the hours before dawn, they were (found) asking (Allah) for forgiveness,

versets.ar: 19. وَفِي أَمْوَالِهِمْ حَقٌّ لِّلسَّائِلِ وَالْمَحْرُومِ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. et dans leurs biens, il y avait un droit au mendiant et au déshérité.
versets.en: 19. And in their properties there was the right of the beggar, and the Mahrum (the poor who does not ask the others).

versets.ar: 20. وَفِي الْأَرْضِ آيَاتٌ لِّلْمُوقِنِينَ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. Il y a sur terre des preuves pour ceux qui croient avec certitude;
versets.en: 20. And on the earth are signs for those who have Faith with certainty,

versets.ar: 21. وَفِي أَنفُسِكُمْ ۚ أَفَلَا تُبْصِرُونَ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. ainsi qu'en vous-mêmes. N'observez-vous donc pas?
versets.en: 21. And also in your ownselves. Will you not then see?

versets.ar: 22. وَفِي السَّمَاءِ رِزْقُكُمْ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. Et il y a dans le ciel votre subsistance et ce qui vous a été promis.
versets.en: 22. And in the heaven is your provision, and that which you are promised.

versets.ar: 23. فَوَرَبِّ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ إِنَّهُ لَحَقٌّ مِّثْلَ مَا أَنَّكُمْ تَنطِقُونَ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. Par le Seigneur du ciel et de la terre! Ceci est tout aussi vrai que le fait que vous parliez.
versets.en: 23. Then, by the Lord of the heaven and the earth, it is the truth (i.e. what has been promised to you), just as it is the truth that you can speak.

versets.ar: 24. هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيْفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ الْمُكْرَمِينَ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. T'est-il parvenu le récit des visiteurs honorables d'Abraham?
versets.en: 24. Has the story reached you, of the honoured guests [three angels; Jibrael (Gabriel) along with another two] of Ibrahim (Abraham)?

versets.ar: 25. إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا سَلَامًا ۖ قَالَ سَلَامٌ قَوْمٌ مُّنكَرُونَ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Quand ils entrèrent chez lui et dirent: «Paix!», il [leur] dit: «Paix, visiteurs inconnus».
versets.en: 25. When they came in to him, and said, "Salam, (peace be upon you)!" He answered; "Salam, (peace be upon you)," and said: "You are a people unknown to me,"

versets.ar: 26. فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ فَجَاءَ بِعِجْلٍ سَمِينٍ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Puis il alla discrètement à sa famille et apporta un veau gras.
versets.en: 26. Then he turned to his household, so brought out a roasted calf [as the property of Ibrahim (Abraham) was mainly cows].

versets.ar: 27. فَقَرَّبَهُ إِلَيْهِمْ قَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Ensuite il l'approcha d'eux... «Ne mangez-vous pas?» dit-il.
versets.en: 27. And placed it before them, (saying): "Will you not eat?"

versets.ar: 28. فَأَوْجَسَ مِنْهُمْ خِيفَةً ۖ قَالُوا لَا تَخَفْ ۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَامٍ عَلِيمٍ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Il ressentit alors de la peur vis-à-vis d'eux. Ils dirent: «N'aie pas peur». Et ils lui annoncèrent [la naissance] d'un garçon plein de savoir.
versets.en: 28. Then he conceived a fear of them (when they ate not). They said: "Fear not." And they gave him glad tidings of an intelligent son, having knowledge (about Allah and His religion of True Monotheism).

versets.ar: 29. فَأَقْبَلَتِ امْرَأَتُهُ فِي صَرَّةٍ فَصَكَّتْ وَجْهَهَا وَقَالَتْ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٌ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. Alors sa femme s'avança en criant, se frappa le visage et dit: «Une vieille femme stérile...»
versets.en: 29. Then his wife came forward with a loud voice, she smote her face, and said: "A barren old woman!"

versets.ar: 30. قَالُوا كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْحَكِيمُ الْعَلِيمُ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Ils dirent: «Ainsi a dit ton Seigneur. C'est Lui vraiment le Sage, l'Omniscient».
versets.en: 30. They said: "Even so says your Lord. Verily, He is the All-Wise, the All-Knower."

versets.ar: 31. ۞ قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ أَيُّهَا الْمُرْسَلُونَ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. Alors [Abraham] dit: «Quelle est donc votre mission, ô envoyés?»
versets.en: 31. [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Then for what purpose you have come, O Messengers?"

versets.ar: 32. قَالُوا إِنَّا أُرْسِلْنَا إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ مُّجْرِمِينَ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. Ils dirent: «Nous avons été envoyés vers des gens criminels,
versets.en: 32. They said: "We have been sent to a people who are Mujrimun (polytheists, sinners, criminals, disbelievers in Allah);

versets.ar: 33. لِنُرْسِلَ عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِّن طِينٍ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. pour lancer sur eux des pierres de glaise,
versets.en: 33. To send down upon them stones of baked clay.

versets.ar: 34. مُّسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلْمُسْرِفِينَ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. marquées auprès de ton Seigneur à l'intention des outranciers».
versets.en: 34. Marked by your Lord for the Musrifun (polytheists, criminals, sinners those who trespass Allah's set limits in evil-doings by committing great sins).

versets.ar: 35. فَأَخْرَجْنَا مَن كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Nous en fîmes sortir alors ce qu'il y avait comme croyants,
versets.en: 35. So We brought out from therein the believers.

versets.ar: 36. فَمَا وَجَدْنَا فِيهَا غَيْرَ بَيْتٍ مِّنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. mais Nous n'y trouvâmes qu'une seule maison de gens soumis.
versets.en: 36. But We found not there any household of the Muslims except one [i.e. Lout (Lot) and his two daughters].

versets.ar: 37. وَتَرَكْنَا فِيهَا آيَةً لِّلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. Et Nous y laissâmes un signe pour ceux qui redoutent le douloureux châtiment;
versets.en: 37. And We have left there a sign (i.e. the place of the Dead Sea, well-known in Palestine) for those who fear the painful torment.

versets.ar: 38. وَفِي مُوسَىٰ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَاهُ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ بِسُلْطَانٍ مُّبِينٍ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. [Il y a même un signe] en Moïse quand Nous l'envoyâmes, avec une preuve évidente, vers Pharaon.
versets.en: 38. And in Musa (Moses) (too, there is a sign). When We sent him to Fir'aun (Pharaoh) with a manifest authority.

versets.ar: 39. فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكْنِهِ وَقَالَ سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. Mais [celui-ci] se détourna confiant en sa puissance, et dit: «C'est un magicien ou un possédé!»
versets.en: 39. But [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] turned away (from Belief in might) along with his hosts, and said: "A sorcerer, or a madman."

versets.ar: 40. فَأَخَذْنَاهُ وَجُنُودَهُ فَنَبَذْنَاهُمْ فِي الْيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٌ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. Nous le saisîmes ainsi que ses troupes, puis les jetâmes dans les flots, pour son comportement blâmable.
versets.en: 40. So We took him and his hosts, and dumped them into the sea, while he was to be blamed.

versets.ar: 41. وَفِي عَادٍ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ الرِّيحَ الْعَقِيمَ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. De même pour les 'Aad, quand Nous envoyâmes contre eux le vent dévastateur
versets.en: 41. And in 'Ad (there is also a sign) when We sent against them the barren wind;

versets.ar: 42. مَا تَذَرُ مِن شَيْءٍ أَتَتْ عَلَيْهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتْهُ كَالرَّمِيمِ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. n'épargnant rien sur son passage sans le réduire en poussière.
versets.en: 42. It spared nothing that it reached, but blew it into broken spreads of rotten ruins.

versets.ar: 43. وَفِي ثَمُودَ إِذْ قِيلَ لَهُمْ تَمَتَّعُوا حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. De même pour les Thamûd, quand il leur fut dit: «Jouissez jusqu'à un certain temps!»
versets.en: 43. And in Thamud (there is also a sign), when they were told: "Enjoy yourselves for a while!"

versets.ar: 44. فَعَتَوْا عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّاعِقَةُ وَهُمْ يَنظُرُونَ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. Ils défièrent le commandement de leur Seigneur. La foudre les saisit alors qu'ils regardaient.
versets.en: 44. But they insolently defied the Command of their Lord, so the Sa'iqah overtook them while they were looking.

versets.ar: 45. فَمَا اسْتَطَاعُوا مِن قِيَامٍ وَمَا كَانُوا مُنتَصِرِينَ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. Ils ne purent ni se mettre debout ni être secourus.
versets.en: 45. Then they were unable to rise up, nor could they help themselves.

versets.ar: 46. وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِّن قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. De même, pour le peuple de Noé auparavant. Ils étaient des gens pervers.
versets.en: 46. (So were) the people of Nuh (Noah) before them. Verily, they were a people who were Fasiqun (rebellious, disobedient to Allah).

versets.ar: 47. وَالسَّمَاءَ بَنَيْنَاهَا بِأَيْدٍ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. Le ciel, Nous l'avons construit par Notre puissance: et Nous l'étendons [constamment] dans l'immensité.
versets.en: 47. With power did We construct the heaven. Verily, We are Able to extend the vastness of space thereof.

versets.ar: 48. وَالْأَرْضَ فَرَشْنَاهَا فَنِعْمَ الْمَاهِدُونَ ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. Et la terre, Nous l'avons étendue. Et de quelle excellente façon Nous l'avons nivelée!
versets.en: 48. And We have spread out the earth, how Excellent Spreader (thereof) are We!

versets.ar: 49. وَمِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقْنَا زَوْجَيْنِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. Et de toute chose Nous avons créé [deux éléments] de couple. Peut-être vous rappellerez-vous?
versets.en: 49. And of everything We have created pairs, that you may remember (the Grace of Allah).

versets.ar: 50. فَفِرُّوا إِلَى اللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. «Fuyez donc vers Allah. Moi, je suis pour vous de Sa part, un avertisseur explicite.
versets.en: 50. So flee to Allah (from His Torment to His Mercy Islamic Monotheism), verily, I (Muhammad SAW) am a plain warner to you from Him.

versets.ar: 51. وَلَا تَجْعَلُوا مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. Ne placez pas avec Allah une autre divinité. Je suis pour vous de Sa part, un avertisseur explicite».
versets.en: 51. And set not up (or worship) any other ilahan (god) along with Allah [Glorified be He (Alone), Exalted above all that they associate as partners with Him]. Verily, I (Muhammad SAW) am a plain warner to you from Him.

versets.ar: 52. كَذَٰلِكَ مَا أَتَى الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُوا سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. Ainsi, aucun Messager n'est venu à leurs prédécesseurs sans qu'ils n'aient dit: «C'est un magicien ou un possédé!»
versets.en: 52. Likewise, no Messenger came to those before them, but they said: "A sorcerer or a madman!"

versets.ar: 53. أَتَوَاصَوْا بِهِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ ﴿53﴾
versets.fr: 53. Est-ce qu'ils se sont transmis cette injonction? Ils sont plutôt des gens transgresseurs.
versets.en: 53. Have they (the people of the past) transmitted this saying to these (Quraish pagans)? Nay, they are themselves a people transgressing beyond bounds (in disbelief)!

versets.ar: 54. فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَمَا أَنتَ بِمَلُومٍ ﴿54﴾
versets.fr: 54. Détourne-toi d'eux, tu ne seras pas blâmé [à leur sujet].
versets.en: 54. So turn away (O Muhammad SAW) from them (Quraish pagans) you are not to be blamed (as you have conveyed Allah's Message).

versets.ar: 55. وَذَكِّرْ فَإِنَّ الذِّكْرَىٰ تَنفَعُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ﴿55﴾
versets.fr: 55. Et rappelle; car le rappel profite aux croyants.
versets.en: 55. And remind (by preaching the Quran, O Muhammad SAW) for verily, the reminding profits the believers.

versets.ar: 56. وَمَا خَلَقْتُ الْجِنَّ وَالْإِنسَ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُونِ ﴿56﴾
versets.fr: 56. Je n'ai créé les djinns et les hommes que pour qu'ils M'adorent.
versets.en: 56. And I (Allah) created not the jinns and humans except they should worship Me (Alone).

versets.ar: 57. مَا أُرِيدُ مِنْهُم مِّن رِّزْقٍ وَمَا أُرِيدُ أَن يُطْعِمُونِ ﴿57﴾
versets.fr: 57. Je ne cherche pas d'eux une subsistance; et Je ne veux pas qu'ils me nourrissent.
versets.en: 57. I seek not any provision from them (i.e. provision for themselves or for My creatures) nor do I ask that they should feed Me (i.e. feed themselves or My creatures).

versets.ar: 58. إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الرَّزَّاقُ ذُو الْقُوَّةِ الْمَتِينُ ﴿58﴾
versets.fr: 58. En vérité, c'est Allah qui est le Grand Pourvoyeur, Le Détenteur de la force, l'Inébranlable.
versets.en: 58. Verily, Allah is the All-Provider, Owner of Power, the Most Strong.

versets.ar: 59. فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا ذَنُوبًا مِّثْلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصْحَابِهِمْ فَلَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونِ ﴿59﴾
versets.fr: 59. Ceux qui ont été injustes auront une part [de tourments] pareille à celle de leurs compagnons. Qu'ils ne soient pas trop pressés.
versets.en: 59. And verily, for those who do wrong, there is a portion of torment like to the evil portion of torment (which came for) their likes (of old), so let them not ask Me to hasten on!

versets.ar: 60. فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِن يَوْمِهِمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ ﴿60﴾
versets.fr: 60. Malheur donc à ceux qui ont mécru à cause du jour dont ils sont menacés!
versets.en: 60. Then, woe to those who disbelieve (in Allah and His Oneness Islamic Monotheism) from (that) their Day which they have been promised (for their punishment).

versets.ar: 1. وَالطُّورِ ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. Par At-Tûr!
versets.en: 1. By the Mount;

versets.ar: 2. وَكِتَابٍ مَّسْطُورٍ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Et par un Livre écrit
versets.en: 2. And by the Book Inscribed.

versets.ar: 3. فِي رَقٍّ مَّنشُورٍ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. sur un parchemin déployé!
versets.en: 3. In parchment unrolled.

versets.ar: 4. وَالْبَيْتِ الْمَعْمُورِ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Et par la Maison peuplée!
versets.en: 4. And by the Bait-ul-Ma'mur (the house over the heavens parable to the Ka'bah at Makkah, continuously visited by the angels);

versets.ar: 5. وَالسَّقْفِ الْمَرْفُوعِ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Et par la Voûte élevée!
versets.en: 5. And by the roof raised high (i.e. the heaven).

versets.ar: 6. وَالْبَحْرِ الْمَسْجُورِ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Et par la Mer portée à ébullition! (au Jour dernier)
versets.en: 6. And by the sea kept filled (or it will be fire kindled on the Day of Resurrection).

versets.ar: 7. إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ لَوَاقِعٌ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. Le châtiment de ton Seigneur aura lieu inévitablement.
versets.en: 7. Verily, the Torment of your Lord will surely come to pass,

versets.ar: 8. مَّا لَهُ مِن دَافِعٍ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Nul ne pourra le repousser.
versets.en: 8. There is none that can avert it;

versets.ar: 9. يَوْمَ تَمُورُ السَّمَاءُ مَوْرًا ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Le jour où le ciel sera agité d'un tourbillonnement,
versets.en: 9. On the Day when the heaven will shake with a dreadful shaking,

versets.ar: 10. وَتَسِيرُ الْجِبَالُ سَيْرًا ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. et les montagnes se mettront en marche.
versets.en: 10. And the mountains will move away with a (horrible) movement.

versets.ar: 11. فَوَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. Ce jour-là, malheur à ceux qui traitent (les signes d'Allah) de mensonges,
versets.en: 11. Then woe that Day to the beliers;

versets.ar: 12. الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي خَوْضٍ يَلْعَبُونَ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. ceux qui s'ébattent dans des discours frivoles
versets.en: 12. Who are playing in falsehood.

versets.ar: 13. يَوْمَ يُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. le jour où ils seront brutalement poussés au feu de l'Enfer:
versets.en: 13. The Day when they will be pushed down by force to the Fire of Hell, with a horrible, forceful pushing.

versets.ar: 14. هَٰذِهِ النَّارُ الَّتِي كُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. Voilà le feu que vous traitiez de mensonge.
versets.en: 14. This is the Fire which you used to belie.

versets.ar: 15. أَفَسِحْرٌ هَٰذَا أَمْ أَنتُمْ لَا تُبْصِرُونَ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Est-ce que cela est de la magie? Ou bien ne voyez-vous pas clair?
versets.en: 15. Is this magic, or do you not see?

versets.ar: 16. اصْلَوْهَا فَاصْبِرُوا أَوْ لَا تَصْبِرُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Brûlez dedans! Supportez ou ne supportez pas, ce sera égal pour vous: vous n'êtes rétribués que selon ce que vous faisiez.
versets.en: 16. Taste you therein its heat, and whether you are patient of it or impatient of it, it is all the same. You are only being requited for what you used to do.

versets.ar: 17. إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَنَعِيمٍ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Les pieux seront dans des Jardins et dans des délices,
versets.en: 17. Verily, the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2) will be in Gardens (Paradise), and Delight.

versets.ar: 18. فَاكِهِينَ بِمَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ وَوَقَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ عَذَابَ الْجَحِيمِ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. se réjouissant de ce que leur Seigneur leur aura donné, et leur Seigneur les aura protégés du châtiment de la Fournaise.
versets.en: 18. Enjoying in that which their Lord has bestowed on them, and (the fact that) their Lord saved them from the torment of the blazing Fire.

versets.ar: 19. كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. «En récompense de ce que vous faisiez, mangez et buvez en toute sérénité,
versets.en: 19. "Eat and drink with happiness because of what you used to do."

versets.ar: 20. مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَّصْفُوفَةٍ ۖ وَزَوَّجْنَاهُم بِحُورٍ عِينٍ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. accoudés sur des lits bien rangés», et Nous leur ferons épouser des houris aux grands yeux noirs,
versets.en: 20. They will recline (with ease) on thrones arranged in ranks. And We shall marry them to Houris (female, fair ones) with wide lovely eyes.

versets.ar: 21. وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَاتَّبَعَتْهُمْ ذُرِّيَّتُهُم بِإِيمَانٍ أَلْحَقْنَا بِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ وَمَا أَلَتْنَاهُم مِّنْ عَمَلِهِم مِّن شَيْءٍ ۚ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِينٌ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Ceux qui auront cru et que leurs descendants auront suivis dans la foi, Nous ferons que leurs descendants les rejoignent. Et Nous ne diminuerons en rien le mérite de leurs œuvres, chacun étant tenu responsable de ce qu'il aura acquis.
versets.en: 21. And those who believe and whose offspring follow them in Faith, to them shall We join their offspring, and We shall not decrease the reward of their deeds in anything. Every person is a pledge for that which he has earned.

versets.ar: 22. وَأَمْدَدْنَاهُم بِفَاكِهَةٍ وَلَحْمٍ مِّمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. Nous les pourvoirons abondamment des fruits et des viandes qu'ils désireront.
versets.en: 22. And We shall provide them with fruit and meat, such as they desire.

versets.ar: 23. يَتَنَازَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا لَّا لَغْوٌ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأْثِيمٌ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. Là, ils se passeront les uns les autres une coupe qui ne provoquera ni vanité ni incrimination.
versets.en: 23. There they shall pass from hand to hand a (wine) cup, free from any Laghw (dirty, false, evil vague talk between them), and free from sin (because it will be legal for them to drink).

versets.ar: 24. ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ غِلْمَانٌ لَّهُمْ كَأَنَّهُمْ لُؤْلُؤٌ مَّكْنُونٌ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Et parmi eux circuleront des garçons à leur service, pareils à des perles bien conservées.
versets.en: 24. And there will go round boy-servants of theirs, to serve them as if they were preserved pearls.

versets.ar: 25. وَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Et ils se tourneront les uns vers les autres s'interrogeant;
versets.en: 25. And some of them draw near to others, questioning.

versets.ar: 26. قَالُوا إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبْلُ فِي أَهْلِنَا مُشْفِقِينَ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Ils diront: «Nous vivions au milieu des nôtres dans la crainte [d'Allah];
versets.en: 26. Saying: "Aforetime, we were afraid with our families (from the punishment of Allah).

versets.ar: 27. فَمَنَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا وَوَقَانَا عَذَابَ السَّمُومِ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Puis Allah nous a favorisés et protégés du châtiment du Samûm.
versets.en: 27. "But Allah has been gracious to us, and has saved us from the torment of the Fire.

versets.ar: 28. إِنَّا كُنَّا مِن قَبْلُ نَدْعُوهُ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْبَرُّ الرَّحِيمُ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Antérieurement, nous L'invoquions. C'est Lui certes, le Charitable, le Très Miséricordieux».
versets.en: 28. "Verily, We used to invoke Him (Alone and none else) before. Verily, He is Al-Barr (the Most Subtle, Kind, Courteous, and Generous), the Most Merciful."

versets.ar: 29. فَذَكِّرْ فَمَا أَنتَ بِنِعْمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنٍ وَلَا مَجْنُونٍ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. Rappelle donc et par la grâce de ton Seigneur tu n'es ni un devin ni un possédé.
versets.en: 29. Therefore, remind and preach (mankind, O Muhammad SAW of Islamic Monotheism). By the Grace of Allah, you are neither a soothsayer, nor a madman.

versets.ar: 30. أَمْ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٌ نَّتَرَبَّصُ بِهِ رَيْبَ الْمَنُونِ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Ou bien ils disent: «C'est un poète! Attendons pour lui le coup de la mort».
versets.en: 30. Or do they say: "(Muhammad SAW is) a poet! We await for him some calamity by time!

versets.ar: 31. قُلْ تَرَبَّصُوا فَإِنِّي مَعَكُم مِّنَ الْمُتَرَبِّصِينَ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. Dis: «Attendez! Je suis avec vous parmi ceux qui attendent».
versets.en: 31. Say (O Muhammad SAW to them): "Wait! I am with you, among the waiters!"

versets.ar: 32. أَمْ تَأْمُرُهُمْ أَحْلَامُهُم بِهَٰذَا ۚ أَمْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. Est-ce leur raison qui leur commande cela? Ou sont-ils des gens outranciers?
versets.en: 32. Do their minds command them this [i.e. to tell a lie against you (Muhammad SAW)] or are they people exceeding the bounds (i.e. from Belief in Allah to disbelief).

versets.ar: 33. أَمْ يَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُ ۚ بَل لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. Ou bien ils disent: «Il l'a inventé lui-même?» Non... mais ils ne croient pas.
versets.en: 33. Or do they say: "He (Muhammad SAW) has forged it (this Quran)?" Nay! They believe not!

versets.ar: 34. فَلْيَأْتُوا بِحَدِيثٍ مِّثْلِهِ إِن كَانُوا صَادِقِينَ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. Eh bien, qu'ils produisent un récit pareil à lui (le Coran), s'ils sont véridiques.
versets.en: 34. Let them then produce a recital like unto it (the Quran) if they are truthful.

versets.ar: 35. أَمْ خُلِقُوا مِنْ غَيْرِ شَيْءٍ أَمْ هُمُ الْخَالِقُونَ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Ont-ils été créé à partir de rien ou sont-ils eux les créateurs?
versets.en: 35. Were they created by nothing, or were they themselves the creators?

versets.ar: 36. أَمْ خَلَقُوا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۚ بَل لَّا يُوقِنُونَ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. Ou ont-ils créé les cieux et la terre? Mais ils n'ont plutôt aucune conviction.
versets.en: 36. Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Nay, but they have no firm Belief.

versets.ar: 37. أَمْ عِندَهُمْ خَزَائِنُ رَبِّكَ أَمْ هُمُ الْمُصَيْطِرُونَ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. Possèdent-ils les trésors de ton Seigneur? Ou sont-ils eux les maîtres souverains?
versets.en: 37. Or are with them the treasures of your Lord? Or are they the tyrants with the authority to do as they like?

versets.ar: 38. أَمْ لَهُمْ سُلَّمٌ يَسْتَمِعُونَ فِيهِ ۖ فَلْيَأْتِ مُسْتَمِعُهُم بِسُلْطَانٍ مُّبِينٍ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. Ont-ils une échelle d'où ils écoutent? Que celui des leurs qui reste à l'écoute apporte une preuve évidente!
versets.en: 38. Or have they a stairway (to heaven), by means of which they listen (to the talks of the angels)? Then let their listener produce some manifest proof.

versets.ar: 39. أَمْ لَهُ الْبَنَاتُ وَلَكُمُ الْبَنُونَ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. [Allah] aurait-Il les filles, tandis que vous, les fils?
versets.en: 39. Or has He (Allah) only daughters and you have sons?

versets.ar: 40. أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. Ou leur demandes-tu un salaire, de sorte qu'ils soient grevés d'une lourde dette?
versets.en: 40. Or is it that you (O Muhammad SAW) ask a wage from them (for your preaching of Islamic Monotheism) so that they are burdened with a load of debt?

versets.ar: 41. أَمْ عِندَهُمُ الْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. Ou bien détiennent-ils l'Inconnaissable pour le mentionner par écrit?
versets.en: 41. Or that the Ghaib (unseen) is with them, and they write it down?

versets.ar: 42. أَمْ يُرِيدُونَ كَيْدًا ۖ فَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا هُمُ الْمَكِيدُونَ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. Ou cherchent-ils un stratagème? Mais ce sont ceux qui ont mécru qui sont victimes de leur propre stratagème.
versets.en: 42. Or do they intend a plot (against you O Muhammad SAW)? But those who disbelieve (in the Oneness of Allah Islamic Monotheism) are themselves in a plot!

versets.ar: 43. أَمْ لَهُمْ إِلَٰهٌ غَيْرُ اللَّهِ ۚ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. Ou ont-ils une autre divinité à part Allah? Qu'Allah soit glorifié et purifié de tout ce qu'ils associent!
versets.en: 43. Or have they an ilah (a god) other than Allah? Glorified be Allah from all that they ascribe as partners (to Him)

versets.ar: 44. وَإِن يَرَوْا كِسْفًا مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ سَاقِطًا يَقُولُوا سَحَابٌ مَّرْكُومٌ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. Et s'ils voient tomber des fragments du ciel, ils disent: «Ce sont des nuages superposés».
versets.en: 44. And if they were to see a piece of the heaven falling down, they would say: "Clouds gathered in heaps!"

versets.ar: 45. فَذَرْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي فِيهِ يُصْعَقُونَ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. Laisse-les donc, jusqu'à ce qu'ils rencontrent leur jour où ils seront foudroyés,
versets.en: 45. So leave them alone till they meet their Day, in which they will sink into a fainting (with horror).

versets.ar: 46. يَوْمَ لَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْئًا وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. le jour où leur ruse ne leur servira à rien, où ils ne seront pas secourus.
versets.en: 46. The Day when their plotting shall not avail them at all nor will they be helped (i.e. they will receive their torment in Hell).

versets.ar: 47. وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا عَذَابًا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. Les injustes auront un châtiment préalable. Mais la plupart d'entre eux ne savent pas.
versets.en: 47. And verily, for those who do wrong, there is another punishment (i.e. the torment in this world and in their graves) before this, but most of them know not. [Tafsir At-Tabari, Vol. 27, Page 36].

versets.ar: 48. وَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا ۖ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. Et supporte patiemment la décision de ton Seigneur. Car en vérité, tu es sous Nos yeux. Et célèbre la gloire de ton Seigneur quand tu te lèves;
versets.en: 48. So wait patiently (O Muhammad SAW) for the Decision of your Lord, for verily, you are under Our Eyes, and glorify the Praises of your Lord when you get up from sleep.

versets.ar: 49. وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَإِدْبَارَ النُّجُومِ ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. Glorifie-Le une partie de la nuit et au déclin des étoiles.
versets.en: 49. And in the night time, also glorify His Praises, and at the setting of the stars.

versets.ar: 1. وَالنَّجْمِ إِذَا هَوَىٰ ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. Par l'étoile à son déclin!
versets.en: 1. By the star when it goes down, (or vanishes).

versets.ar: 2. مَا ضَلَّ صَاحِبُكُمْ وَمَا غَوَىٰ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Votre compagnon ne s'est pas égaré et n'a pas été induit en erreur
versets.en: 2. Your companion (Muhammad SAW) has neither gone astray nor has erred.

versets.ar: 3. وَمَا يَنطِقُ عَنِ الْهَوَىٰ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. et il ne prononce rien sous l'effet de la passion;
versets.en: 3. Nor does he speak of (his own) desire.

versets.ar: 4. إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا وَحْيٌ يُوحَىٰ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. ce n'est rien d'autre qu'une révélation inspirée.
versets.en: 4. It is only an Inspiration that is inspired.

versets.ar: 5. عَلَّمَهُ شَدِيدُ الْقُوَىٰ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Que lui a enseigné [l'Ange Gabriel] à la force prodigieuse,
versets.en: 5. He has been taught (this Quran) by one mighty in power [Jibrael (Gabriel)].

versets.ar: 6. ذُو مِرَّةٍ فَاسْتَوَىٰ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. doué de sagacité; c'est alors qu'il se montra sous sa forme réelle [angélique],
versets.en: 6. Dhu Mirrah (free from any defect in body and mind), Fastawa [then he (Jibrael - Gabriel) rose and became stable]. [Tafsir At-Tabari].

versets.ar: 7. وَهُوَ بِالْأُفُقِ الْأَعْلَىٰ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. alors qu'il se trouvait à l'horizon supérieur.
versets.en: 7. While he [Jibrael (Gabriel)] was in the highest part of the horizon,

versets.fr: 8. Puis il se rapprocha et descendit encore plus bas,
versets.en: 8. Then he [Jibrael (Gabriel)] approached and came closer,

versets.ar: 9. فَكَانَ قَابَ قَوْسَيْنِ أَوْ أَدْنَىٰ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. et fut à deux portées d'arc, ou plus près encore.
versets.en: 9. And was at a distance of two bows' length or (even) nearer,

versets.ar: 10. فَأَوْحَىٰ إِلَىٰ عَبْدِهِ مَا أَوْحَىٰ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Il révéla à Son serviteur ce qu'Il révéla.
versets.en: 10. So did (Allah) convey the Inspiration to His slave [Muhammad SAW through Jibrael (Gabriel)].

versets.ar: 11. مَا كَذَبَ الْفُؤَادُ مَا رَأَىٰ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. Le cœur n'a pas menti en ce qu'il a vu.
versets.en: 11. The (Prophet's) heart lied not (in seeing) what he (Muhammad SAW) saw.

versets.ar: 12. أَفَتُمَارُونَهُ عَلَىٰ مَا يَرَىٰ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. Lui contestez-vous donc ce qu'il voit?
versets.en: 12. Will you then dispute with him (Muhammad SAW) about what he saw [during the Mi'raj: (Ascent of the Prophet SAW over the seven heavens)].

versets.ar: 13. وَلَقَدْ رَآهُ نَزْلَةً أُخْرَىٰ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. Il l'a pourtant vu, lors d'une autre descente,
versets.en: 13. And indeed he (Muhammad SAW) saw him [Jibrael (Gabriel)] at a second descent (i.e. another time).

versets.ar: 14. عِندَ سِدْرَةِ الْمُنتَهَىٰ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. près de la Sidrat-ul-Muntahâ,
versets.en: 14. Near Sidrat-ul-Muntaha [lote-tree of the utmost boundary (beyond which none can pass)],

versets.ar: 15. عِندَهَا جَنَّةُ الْمَأْوَىٰ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. près d'elle se trouve le jardin de Ma'w?:
versets.en: 15. Near it is the Paradise of Abode.

versets.ar: 16. إِذْ يَغْشَى السِّدْرَةَ مَا يَغْشَىٰ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. au moment où le lotus était couvert de ce qui le couvrait.
versets.en: 16. When that covered the lote-tree which did cover it!

versets.ar: 17. مَا زَاغَ الْبَصَرُ وَمَا طَغَىٰ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. la vue n'a nullement dévié ni outrepassé la mesure.
versets.en: 17. The sight (of Prophet Muhammad SAW) turned not aside (right or left), nor it transgressed beyond (the) limit (ordained for it).

versets.ar: 18. لَقَدْ رَأَىٰ مِنْ آيَاتِ رَبِّهِ الْكُبْرَىٰ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. Il a bien vu certaines des grandes merveilles de son Seigneur.
versets.en: 18. Indeed he (Muhammad SAW) did see, of the Greatest Signs, of his Lord (Allah).

versets.ar: 19. أَفَرَأَيْتُمُ اللَّاتَ وَالْعُزَّىٰ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Que vous en semble [des divinités], Lât et Uuzzâ
versets.en: 19. Have you then considered Al-Lat, and Al-'Uzza (two idols of the pagan Arabs).

versets.ar: 20. وَمَنَاةَ الثَّالِثَةَ الْأُخْرَىٰ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. ainsi que Manât, cette troisième autre?
versets.en: 20. And Manat (another idol of the pagan Arabs), the other third?

versets.ar: 21. أَلَكُمُ الذَّكَرُ وَلَهُ الْأُنثَىٰ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Sera-ce à vous le garçon et à Lui la fille?
versets.en: 21. Is it for you the males and for Him the females?

versets.ar: 22. تِلْكَ إِذًا قِسْمَةٌ ضِيزَىٰ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. Que voilà donc un partage injuste!
versets.en: 22. That indeed is a division most unfair!

versets.ar: 23. إِنْ هِيَ إِلَّا أَسْمَاءٌ سَمَّيْتُمُوهَا أَنتُمْ وَآبَاؤُكُم مَّا أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلْطَانٍ ۚ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ وَمَا تَهْوَى الْأَنفُسُ ۖ وَلَقَدْ جَاءَهُم مِّن رَّبِّهِمُ الْهُدَىٰ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. Ce ne sont que des noms que vous avez inventés, vous et vos ancêtres. Allah n'a fait descendre aucune preuve à leur sujet. Ils ne suivent que la conjecture et les passions de [leurs] âmes, alors que la guidée leur est venue de leur Seigneur.
versets.en: 23. They are but names which you have named, you and your fathers, for which Allah has sent down no authority. They follow but a guess and that which they themselves desire, whereas there has surely come to them the Guidance from their Lord!

versets.ar: 24. أَمْ لِلْإِنسَانِ مَا تَمَنَّىٰ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Ou bien l'homme aura-t-il tout ce qu'il désire?
versets.en: 24. Or shall man have what he wishes?

versets.ar: 25. فَلِلَّهِ الْآخِرَةُ وَالْأُولَىٰ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. A Allah appartiennent la vie future et la vie d'ici-bas.
versets.en: 25. But to Allah belongs the last (Hereafter) and the first (the world).

versets.ar: 26. ۞ وَكَم مِّن مَّلَكٍ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ لَا تُغْنِي شَفَاعَتُهُمْ شَيْئًا إِلَّا مِن بَعْدِ أَن يَأْذَنَ اللَّهُ لِمَن يَشَاءُ وَيَرْضَىٰ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Et que d'Anges dans les cieux dont l'intercession ne sert à rien, sinon qu'après qu'Allah l'aura permis, en faveur de qui Il veut et qu'Il agrée.
versets.en: 26. And there are many angels in the heavens, whose intercession will avail nothing except after Allah has given leave for whom He wills and pleases.

versets.ar: 27. إِنَّ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ لَيُسَمُّونَ الْمَلَائِكَةَ تَسْمِيَةَ الْأُنثَىٰ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Ceux qui ne croient pas en l'au-delà donnent aux Anges des noms de femmes,
versets.en: 27. Verily, those who believe not in the Hereafter, name the angels with female names.

versets.ar: 28. وَمَا لَهُم بِهِ مِنْ عِلْمٍ ۖ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ ۖ وَإِنَّ الظَّنَّ لَا يُغْنِي مِنَ الْحَقِّ شَيْئًا ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. alors qu'ils n'en ont aucune science: ils ne suivent que la conjecture, alors que la conjecture ne sert à rien contre la vérité.
versets.en: 28. While they have no knowledge thereof. They follow but a guess, and verily, guess is no substitute for the truth.

versets.ar: 29. فَأَعْرِضْ عَن مَّن تَوَلَّىٰ عَن ذِكْرِنَا وَلَمْ يُرِدْ إِلَّا الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. Ecarte-toi donc, de celui qui tourne le dos à Notre rappel et qui ne désire que la vie présente.
versets.en: 29. Therefore withdraw (O Muhammad SAW) from him who turns away from Our Reminder (this Quran) and desires nothing but the life of this world.

versets.ar: 30. ذَٰلِكَ مَبْلَغُهُم مِّنَ الْعِلْمِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ اهْتَدَىٰ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Voilà toute la portée de leur savoir. Certes ton Seigneur connaît parfaitement celui qui s'égare de Son chemin et Il connaît parfaitement qui est bien guidé.
versets.en: 30. That is what they could reach of knowledge. Verily, your Lord it is He Who knows best him who goes astray from His Path, and He knows best him who receives guidance.

versets.ar: 31. وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ لِيَجْزِيَ الَّذِينَ أَسَاءُوا بِمَا عَمِلُوا وَيَجْزِيَ الَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا بِالْحُسْنَى ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. A Allah appartient ce qui est dans les cieux et sur la terre afin qu'Il rétribue ceux qui font le mal selon ce qu'ils œuvrent, et récompense ceux qui font le bien par la meilleure [récompense],
versets.en: 31. And to Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth, that He may requite those who do evil with that which they have done (i.e. punish them in Hell), and reward those who do good, with what is best (i.e. Paradise).

versets.ar: 32. الَّذِينَ يَجْتَنِبُونَ كَبَائِرَ الْإِثْمِ وَالْفَوَاحِشَ إِلَّا اللَّمَمَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَاسِعُ الْمَغْفِرَةِ ۚ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِكُمْ إِذْ أَنشَأَكُم مِّنَ الْأَرْضِ وَإِذْ أَنتُمْ أَجِنَّةٌ فِي بُطُونِ أُمَّهَاتِكُمْ ۖ فَلَا تُزَكُّوا أَنفُسَكُمْ ۖ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ اتَّقَىٰ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. ceux qui évitent les plus grands péchés ainsi que les turpitudes et [qui ne commettent] que des fautes légères. Certes, le pardon de Ton Seigneur est immense. C'est Lui qui vous connaît le mieux quand Il vous a produits de terre, et aussi quand vous étiez des embryons dans les ventres de vos mères. Ne vantez pas vous-mêmes votre pureté; c'est Lui qui connaît mieux ceux qui [Le] craignent.
versets.en: 32. Those who avoid great sins (see the Quran, Verses: 6:152, 153) and Al-Fawahish (illegal sexual intercourse, etc.) except the small faults, verily, your Lord is of vast forgiveness. He knows you well when He created you from the earth (Adam), and when you were fetuses in your mothers' wombs. So ascribe not purity to yourselves. He knows best him who fears Allah and keep his duty to Him [i.e. those who are Al-Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2)].

versets.ar: 33. أَفَرَأَيْتَ الَّذِي تَوَلَّىٰ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. Vois-tu celui qui s'est détourné,
versets.en: 33. Did you (O Muhammad SAW) observe him who turned away (from Islam).

versets.ar: 34. وَأَعْطَىٰ قَلِيلًا وَأَكْدَىٰ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. donné peu et a [finalement] cessé de donner?
versets.en: 34. And gave a little, then stopped (giving)?

versets.ar: 35. أَعِندَهُ عِلْمُ الْغَيْبِ فَهُوَ يَرَىٰ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Détient-il la science de l'Inconnaissable en sorte qu'il voit?
versets.en: 35. Is with him the knowledge of the unseen so that he sees?

versets.ar: 36. أَمْ لَمْ يُنَبَّأْ بِمَا فِي صُحُفِ مُوسَىٰ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. Ne lui a-t-on pas annoncé ce qu'il y avait dans les feuilles de Moïse
versets.en: 36. Or is he not informed with what is in the Pages (Scripture) of Musa (Moses),

versets.ar: 37. وَإِبْرَاهِيمَ الَّذِي وَفَّىٰ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. et celles d'Abraham qui a tenu parfaitement [sa promesse de transmettre]
versets.en: 37. And of Ibrahim (Abraham) who fulfilled (or conveyed) all that (what Allah ordered him to do or convey),

versets.ar: 38. أَلَّا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. qu'aucune [âme] ne portera le fardeau (le péché) d'autrui,
versets.en: 38. That no burdened person (with sins) shall bear the burden (sins) of another.

versets.ar: 39. وَأَن لَّيْسَ لِلْإِنسَانِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. et qu'en vérité, l'homme n'obtient que [le fruit] de ses efforts;
versets.en: 39. And that man can have nothing but what he does (good or bad).

versets.fr: 40. et que son effort, en vérité, lui sera présenté (le jour du Jugement).
versets.en: 40. And that his deeds will be seen,

versets.ar: 41. ثُمَّ يُجْزَاهُ الْجَزَاءَ الْأَوْفَىٰ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. Ensuite il en sera récompensé pleinement,
versets.en: 41. Then he will be recompensed with a full and the best recompense.

versets.ar: 42. وَأَنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ الْمُنتَهَىٰ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. et que tout aboutit, en vérité, vers ton Seigneur,
versets.en: 42. And that to your Lord (Allah) is the End (Return of everything).

versets.fr: 43. et que c'est Lui qui a fait rire et qui a fait pleurer,
versets.en: 43. And that it is He (Allah) Who makes (whom He wills) laugh, and makes (whom He wills) weep;

versets.ar: 44. وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ أَمَاتَ وَأَحْيَا ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. et que c'est Lui qui a fait mourir et qui a ramené à la vie,
versets.en: 44. And that it is He (Allah) Who causes death and gives life;

versets.ar: 45. وَأَنَّهُ خَلَقَ الزَّوْجَيْنِ الذَّكَرَ وَالْأُنثَىٰ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. et que c'est Lui qui a crée les deux éléments de couple, le mâle et la femelle,
versets.en: 45. And that He (Allah) creates the pairs, male and female,

versets.ar: 46. مِن نُّطْفَةٍ إِذَا تُمْنَىٰ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. d'une goutte de sperme quand elle est éjaculée
versets.en: 46. From Nutfah (drops of semen male and female discharges) when it is emitted;

versets.ar: 47. وَأَنَّ عَلَيْهِ النَّشْأَةَ الْأُخْرَىٰ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. et que la seconde création Lui incombe,
versets.en: 47. And that upon Him (Allah) is another bringing forth (Resurrection);

versets.fr: 48. et c'est Lui qui a enrichi et qui a fait acquérir.
versets.en: 48. And that it is He (Allah) Who gives much or a little (or gives wealth and contentment),

versets.fr: 49. Et c'est Lui qui est le Seigneur de Sirius,
versets.en: 49. And that He (Allah) is the Lord of Sirius (the star which the pagan Arabs used to worship);

versets.ar: 50. وَأَنَّهُ أَهْلَكَ عَادًا الْأُولَىٰ ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. et c'est Lui qui a fait périr les anciens 'Aad,
versets.en: 50. And that it is He (Allah) Who destroyed the former 'Ad (people),

versets.ar: 51. وَثَمُودَ فَمَا أَبْقَىٰ ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. ainsi que les Thamûd, et Il fit que rien n'en subsistât,
versets.en: 51. And Thamud (people). He spared none of them.

versets.ar: 52. وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِّن قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا هُمْ أَظْلَمَ وَأَطْغَىٰ ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. ainsi que le peuple de Noé antérieurement, car ils étaient encore plus injustes et plus violents,
versets.en: 52. And the people of Nuh (Noah) aforetime, verily, they were more unjust and more rebellious and transgressing [in disobeying Allah and His Messenger Nuh (Noah)].

versets.ar: 53. وَالْمُؤْتَفِكَةَ أَهْوَىٰ ﴿53﴾
versets.fr: 53. de même qu'Il anéantit les villes renversées.
versets.en: 53. And He destroyed the overthrown cities [of Sodom to which Prophet Lout (Lot) was sent].

versets.fr: 54. Et les recouvrit de ce dont Il les recouvrit.
versets.en: 54. So there covered them that which did cover (i.e. torment with stones).

versets.ar: 55. فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكَ تَتَمَارَىٰ ﴿55﴾
versets.fr: 55. Lequel donc des bienfaits de ton Seigneur mets-tu en doute?
versets.en: 55. Then which of the Graces of your Lord (O man!) will you doubt.

versets.ar: 56. هَٰذَا نَذِيرٌ مِّنَ النُّذُرِ الْأُولَىٰ ﴿56﴾
versets.fr: 56. Voici un avertisseur analogue aux avertisseurs anciens:
versets.en: 56. This (Muhammad SAW) is a warner (Messenger) of the (series of) warners (Messengers) of old.

versets.ar: 57. أَزِفَتِ الْآزِفَةُ ﴿57﴾
versets.fr: 57. l'Imminente (L'heure du Jugement) s'approche.
versets.en: 57. The Day of Resurrection draws near,

versets.ar: 58. لَيْسَ لَهَا مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ كَاشِفَةٌ ﴿58﴾
versets.fr: 58. Rien d'autre en dehors d'Allah ne peut la dévoiler.
versets.en: 58. None besides Allah can avert it, (or advance it, or delay it).

versets.ar: 59. أَفَمِنْ هَٰذَا الْحَدِيثِ تَعْجَبُونَ ﴿59﴾
versets.fr: 59. Quoi! vous étonnez-vous de ce discours (le Coran)?
versets.en: 59. Do you then wonder at this recital (the Quran)?

versets.ar: 60. وَتَضْحَكُونَ وَلَا تَبْكُونَ ﴿60﴾
versets.fr: 60. Et vous [en] riez et n'[en] pleurez point?
versets.en: 60. And you laugh at it and weep not,

versets.ar: 61. وَأَنتُمْ سَامِدُونَ ﴿61﴾
versets.fr: 61. absorbés [que vous êtes] par votre distraction.
versets.en: 61. Wasting your (precious) lifetime in pastime and amusements (singing, etc.).

versets.ar: 62. فَاسْجُدُوا لِلَّهِ وَاعْبُدُوا ۩ ﴿62﴾
versets.fr: 62. Prosternez-vous donc à Allah et adorez-Le.
versets.en: 62. So fall you down in prostration to Allah, and worship Him (Alone).

versets.ar: 1. اقْتَرَبَتِ السَّاعَةُ وَانشَقَّ الْقَمَرُ ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. L'Heure approche et la Lune s'est fendue.
versets.en: 1. The Hour has drawn near, and the moon has been cleft asunder (the people of Makkah requested Prophet Muhammad SAW to show them a miracle, so he showed them the splitting of the moon).

versets.ar: 2. وَإِن يَرَوْا آيَةً يُعْرِضُوا وَيَقُولُوا سِحْرٌ مُّسْتَمِرٌّ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Et s'ils voient un prodige, ils s'en détournent et disent: «Une magie persistante».
versets.en: 2. And if they see a sign, they turn away, and say: "This is continuous magic."

versets.ar: 3. وَكَذَّبُوا وَاتَّبَعُوا أَهْوَاءَهُمْ ۚ وَكُلُّ أَمْرٍ مُّسْتَقِرٌّ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Et ils [le] traitent de mensonge et suivent leurs propres impulsions, or chaque chose arrivera à son terme [et son but].
versets.en: 3. They belied (the Verses of Allah, this Quran), and followed their own lusts. And every matter will be settled [according to the kind of deeds (for the doer of good deeds, his deeds will take him to Paradise, and similarly evil deeds will take their doers to Hell)].

versets.ar: 4. وَلَقَدْ جَاءَهُم مِّنَ الْأَنبَاءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزْدَجَرٌ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Ils ont pourtant reçu comme nouvelles de quoi les empêcher (du mal);
versets.en: 4. And indeed there has come to them news (in this Quran) wherein there is (enough warning) to check (them from evil),

versets.ar: 5. حِكْمَةٌ بَالِغَةٌ ۖ فَمَا تُغْنِ النُّذُرُ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. [Cela est] une sagesse parfaite. Mais les avertissements ne [leur] servent à rien.
versets.en: 5. Perfect wisdom (this Quran), but (the preaching of) warners benefit them not,

versets.ar: 6. فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ ۘ يَوْمَ يَدْعُ الدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَيْءٍ نُّكُرٍ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Détourne-toi d'eux. Le jour où l'appeleur appellera vers une chose affreuse,
versets.en: 6. So (O Muhammad SAW) withdraw from them. The Day that the caller will call (them) to a terrible thing.

versets.ar: 7. خُشَّعًا أَبْصَارُهُمْ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمْ جَرَادٌ مُّنتَشِرٌ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. les regards baissés, ils sortiront des tombes comme des sauterelles éparpillées,
versets.en: 7. They will come forth, with humbled eyes from (their) graves as if they were locusts spread abroad,

versets.ar: 8. مُّهْطِعِينَ إِلَى الدَّاعِ ۖ يَقُولُ الْكَافِرُونَ هَٰذَا يَوْمٌ عَسِرٌ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. courant, le cou tendu, vers l'appeleur. Les mécréants diront: «Voilà un jour difficile».
versets.en: 8. Hastening towards the caller, the disbelievers will say: "This is a hard Day."

versets.ar: 9. ۞ كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ فَكَذَّبُوا عَبْدَنَا وَقَالُوا مَجْنُونٌ وَازْدُجِرَ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Avant eux, le peuple de Noé avait crié au mensonge. Ils traitèrent Notre serviteur de menteur et dirent: «C'est un possédé!» et il fut repoussé.
versets.en: 9. The people of Nuh (Noah) denied (their Messenger) before them, they rejected Our slave, and said: "A madman!" and he was insolently rebuked and threatened.

versets.ar: 10. فَدَعَا رَبَّهُ أَنِّي مَغْلُوبٌ فَانتَصِرْ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Il invoqua donc son Seigneur: «Moi, je suis vaincu. Fais triompher (Ta cause)».
versets.en: 10. Then he invoked his Lord (saying): "I have been overcome, so help (me)!"

versets.ar: 11. فَفَتَحْنَا أَبْوَابَ السَّمَاءِ بِمَاءٍ مُّنْهَمِرٍ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. Nous ouvrîmes alors les portes du ciel à une eau torrentielle,
versets.en: 11. So We opened the gates of heaven with water pouring forth.

versets.ar: 12. وَفَجَّرْنَا الْأَرْضَ عُيُونًا فَالْتَقَى الْمَاءُ عَلَىٰ أَمْرٍ قَدْ قُدِرَ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. et fîmes jaillir la terre en sources. Les eaux se rencontrèrent d'après un ordre qui était déjà décrété dans une chose [faite].
versets.en: 12. And We caused the earth to gush forth with springs. So the waters (of the heaven and the earth) met for a matter predestined.

versets.ar: 13. وَحَمَلْنَاهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلْوَاحٍ وَدُسُرٍ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. Et Nous le portâmes sur un objet [fait] de planches et de clous [l'arche],
versets.en: 13. And We carried him on a (ship) made of planks and nails,

versets.ar: 14. تَجْرِي بِأَعْيُنِنَا جَزَاءً لِّمَن كَانَ كُفِرَ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. voguant sous Nos yeux: récompense pour celui qu'on avait renié [Noé].
versets.en: 14. Floating under Our Eyes, a reward for him who had been rejected!

versets.ar: 15. وَلَقَد تَّرَكْنَاهَا آيَةً فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Et Nous la laissâmes, comme un signe [d'avertissement]. Y a-t-il quelqu'un pour réfléchir?
versets.en: 15. And indeed, We have left this as a sign, then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?

versets.ar: 16. فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Comment furent Mon châtiment et Mes avertissements?
versets.en: 16. Then how (terrible) was My Torment and My Warnings?

versets.ar: 17. وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. En effet, Nous avons rendu le Coran facile pour la méditation. Y a-t-il quelqu'un pour réfléchir?
versets.en: 17. And We have indeed made the Quran easy to understand and remember, then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?

versets.ar: 18. كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. Les 'Aad ont traité de menteur (leur Messager). Comment furent Mon châtiment et Mes avertissements?
versets.en: 18. 'Ad (people) belied (their Prophet, Hud), then how (terrible) was My Torment and My Warnings?

versets.ar: 19. إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِيحًا صَرْصَرًا فِي يَوْمِ نَحْسٍ مُّسْتَمِرٍّ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Nous avons envoyé contre eux un vent violent et glacial, en un jour néfaste et interminable;
versets.en: 19. Verily, We sent against them a furious wind of harsh voice on a day of evil omen and continuous calamity.

versets.ar: 20. تَنزِعُ النَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ مُّنقَعِرٍ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. il arrachait les gens comme des souches de palmiers déracinés.
versets.en: 20. Plucking out men as if they were uprooted stems of date-palms.

versets.ar: 21. فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Comment furent Mon châtiment et Mes avertissements?
versets.en: 21. Then, how (terrible) was My Torment and My Warnings?

versets.ar: 22. وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. En effet, Nous avons rendu le Coran facile pour la méditation. Y a-t-il quelqu'un pour réfléchir?
versets.en: 22. And We have indeed made the Quran easy to understand and remember, then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?

versets.ar: 23. كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِالنُّذُرِ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. Les Thamûd ont traité de mensonges les avertissements.
versets.en: 23. Thamud (people also) belied the warnings.

versets.ar: 24. فَقَالُوا أَبَشَرًا مِّنَّا وَاحِدًا نَّتَّبِعُهُ إِنَّا إِذًا لَّفِي ضَلَالٍ وَسُعُرٍ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Ils dirent: «Allons-nous suivre un seul homme (Sâlih) d'entre nous-mêmes? Nous serions alors dans l'égarement et la folie.
versets.en: 24. For they said: "A man! Alone from among us, that we are to follow? Truly, then we should be in error and distress or madness!"

versets.ar: 25. أَأُلْقِيَ الذِّكْرُ عَلَيْهِ مِن بَيْنِنَا بَلْ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٌ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Est-ce que le message a été envoyé à Lui à l'exception de nous tous? C'est plutôt un grand menteur, plein de prétention et d'orgueil».
versets.en: 25. "Is it that the Reminder is sent to him [Prophet Salih (Saleh)] alone from among us? Nay, he is an insolent liar!"

versets.ar: 26. سَيَعْلَمُونَ غَدًا مَّنِ الْكَذَّابُ الْأَشِرُ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Demain, ils sauront qui est le grand menteur plein de prétention et d'orgueil.
versets.en: 26. Tomorrow they will come to know, who is the liar, the insolent one!

versets.ar: 27. إِنَّا مُرْسِلُو النَّاقَةِ فِتْنَةً لَّهُمْ فَارْتَقِبْهُمْ وَاصْطَبِرْ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Nous leur enverrons la chamelle, comme épreuve. Surveille-les donc et sois patient.
versets.en: 27. Verily, We are sending the she-camel as a test for them. So watch them [O Salih (Saleh)], and be patient!

versets.ar: 28. وَنَبِّئْهُمْ أَنَّ الْمَاءَ قِسْمَةٌ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ كُلُّ شِرْبٍ مُّحْتَضَرٌ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Et informe-les que l'eau sera en partage entre eux [et la chamelle]; chacun boira à son tour.
versets.en: 28. And inform them that the water is to be shared between (her and) them. Each one's right to drink being established (by turns).

versets.ar: 29. فَنَادَوْا صَاحِبَهُمْ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. Puis ils appelèrent leur camarade qui prit [son épée] et [la] tua.
versets.en: 29. But they called their comrade and he took (a sword) and killed (her).

versets.ar: 30. فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Comment furent donc Mon châtiment et Mes avertissements?
versets.en: 30. Then, how (terrible) was My Torment and My Warnings?

versets.ar: 31. إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً فَكَانُوا كَهَشِيمِ الْمُحْتَظِرِ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. Nous lachâmes sur eux un seul Cri, et voilà qu'ils furent réduits à l'état de paille d'étable.
versets.en: 31. Verily, We sent against them a single Saihah (torment - awful cry, etc.), and they became like the dry stubble of a fold-builder.

versets.ar: 32. وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. Et vraiment, Nous avons rendu le Coran facile pour la méditation. Y a-t-il quelqu'un pour réfléchir?
versets.en: 32. And indeed, We have made the Quran easy to understand and remember, then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?

versets.ar: 33. كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍ بِالنُّذُرِ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. Le peuple de Lot traita de mensonges les avertissements.
versets.en: 33. The people of Lout (Lot) belied the warnings.

versets.ar: 34. إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حَاصِبًا إِلَّا آلَ لُوطٍ ۖ نَّجَّيْنَاهُم بِسَحَرٍ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. Nous lachâmes sur eux un ouragan, excepté la famille de Lot que Nous sauvâmes avant l'aube,
versets.en: 34. Verily, We sent against them a violent storm of stones (which destroyed them all), except the family of Lout (Lot), whom We saved in last hour of the night,

versets.ar: 35. نِّعْمَةً مِّنْ عِندِنَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي مَن شَكَرَ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. à titre de bienfait de Notre part: ainsi récompensons-Nous celui qui est reconnaissant.
versets.en: 35. As a Favour from Us, thus do We reward him who gives thanks (by obeying Us).

versets.ar: 36. وَلَقَدْ أَنذَرَهُم بَطْشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوْا بِالنُّذُرِ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. Il les avait pourtant avertis de Nos représailles. Mais ils mirent les avertissements en doute.
versets.en: 36. And he [Lout (Lot)] indeed had warned them of Our Grasp, but they did doubt the warnings!

versets.ar: 37. وَلَقَدْ رَاوَدُوهُ عَن ضَيْفِهِ فَطَمَسْنَا أَعْيُنَهُمْ فَذُوقُوا عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. En effet, ils voulaient séduire ses hôtes. Nous aveuglâmes leurs yeux «Goûtez donc Mon châtiment et Mes avertissements».
versets.en: 37. And they indeed sought to shame his guest (by asking to commit sodomy with them). So We blinded their eyes, "Then taste you My Torment and My Warnings."

versets.ar: 38. وَلَقَدْ صَبَّحَهُم بُكْرَةً عَذَابٌ مُّسْتَقِرٌّ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. En effet, au petit matin, un châtiment persistant les surprit.
versets.en: 38. And verily, an abiding torment seized them early in the morning.

versets.ar: 39. فَذُوقُوا عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. Goûtez donc Mon châtiment et Mes avertissements.
versets.en: 39. "Then taste you My Torment and My Warnings."

versets.ar: 40. وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. Et vraiment, Nous avons rendu le Coran facile pour la méditation. Y a-t-il quelqu'un pour réfléchir?
versets.en: 40. And indeed, We have made the Quran easy to understand and remember, then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?

versets.ar: 41. وَلَقَدْ جَاءَ آلَ فِرْعَوْنَ النُّذُرُ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. Les avertissements vinrent certes, aux gens de Pharaon.
versets.en: 41. And indeed, warnings came to the people of Fir'aun (Pharaoh) [through Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron)].

versets.ar: 42. كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذْنَاهُمْ أَخْذَ عَزِيزٍ مُّقْتَدِرٍ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. Ils traitèrent de mensonges tous Nos prodiges. Nous les saisîmes donc, de la saisie d'un Puissant Omnipotent.
versets.en: 42. (They) belied all Our Signs, so We seized them with a Seizure of the All-Mighty, All-Capable to carry out what he Will (Omnipotent).

versets.ar: 43. أَكُفَّارُكُمْ خَيْرٌ مِّنْ أُولَٰئِكُمْ أَمْ لَكُم بَرَاءَةٌ فِي الزُّبُرِ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. Vos mécréants sont-ils meilleurs que ceux-là? Ou bien y a-t-il dans les Ecritures une immunité pour vous?
versets.en: 43. Are your disbelievers (O Quraish!) better than these [nations of Nuh (Noah), Lout (Lot), Salih (Saleh), and the people of Fir'aun (Pharaoh), etc., who were destroyed)? Or have you an immunity (against Our Torment) in the Divine Scriptures?

versets.ar: 44. أَمْ يَقُولُونَ نَحْنُ جَمِيعٌ مُّنتَصِرٌ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. Ou bien ils disent: «Nous formons un groupe [fort] et nous vaincrons».
versets.en: 44. Or do they say: "We are a great multitude, and we shall be victorious?"

versets.ar: 45. سَيُهْزَمُ الْجَمْعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ الدُّبُرَ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. Leur rassemblement sera bientôt mis en déroute, et ils fuiront.
versets.en: 45. Their multitude will be put to flight, and they will show their backs.

versets.ar: 46. بَلِ السَّاعَةُ مَوْعِدُهُمْ وَالسَّاعَةُ أَدْهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. L'Heure, plutôt, sera leur rendez-vous, et l'Heure sera plus terrible et plus amère.
versets.en: 46. Nay, but the Hour is their appointed time (for their full recompense), and the Hour will be more grievous and more bitter.

versets.ar: 47. إِنَّ الْمُجْرِمِينَ فِي ضَلَالٍ وَسُعُرٍ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. Les criminels sont certes, dans l'égarement et la folie.
versets.en: 47. Verily, the Mujrimun (polytheists, disbelievers, sinners, criminals, etc.) are in error (in this world) and will burn (in the Hell-fire in the Hereafter).

versets.ar: 48. يَوْمَ يُسْحَبُونَ فِي النَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ ذُوقُوا مَسَّ سَقَرَ ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. Le jour où on les traînera dans le Feu sur leurs visages, (on leur dira): «Goûtez au contact de Saqar [la chaleur brûlante de l'Enfer]».
versets.en: 48. The Day they will be dragged in the Fire on their faces (it will be said to them): "Taste you the touch of Hell!"

versets.ar: 49. إِنَّا كُلَّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقْنَاهُ بِقَدَرٍ ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. Nous avons créé toute chose avec mesure,
versets.en: 49. Verily, We have created all things with Qadar (Divine Preordainments of all things before their creation, as written in the Book of Decrees Al-Lauh Al-Mahfuz).

versets.ar: 50. وَمَا أَمْرُنَا إِلَّا وَاحِدَةٌ كَلَمْحٍ بِالْبَصَرِ ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. et Notre ordre est une seule [parole]; [il est prompt] comme un clin d'œil.
versets.en: 50. And Our Commandment is but one, as the twinkling of an eye.

versets.ar: 51. وَلَقَدْ أَهْلَكْنَا أَشْيَاعَكُمْ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. En effet, nous avons fait périr des peuples semblables à vous. Y a-t-il quelqu'un pour s'en souvenir?
versets.en: 51. And indeed, We have destroyed your likes, then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?

versets.ar: 52. وَكُلُّ شَيْءٍ فَعَلُوهُ فِي الزُّبُرِ ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. Et tout ce qu'ils ont fait est mentionné dans les registres,
versets.en: 52. And each and everything they have done is noted in (their) Records (of deeds).

versets.ar: 53. وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٍ وَكَبِيرٍ مُّسْتَطَرٌ ﴿53﴾
versets.fr: 53. et tout fait, petit et grand, est consigné.
versets.en: 53. And everything, small and big is written (in Al-Lauh Al-Mahfuz already beforehand i.e. before it befalls, or is done by its doer) (See the Quran V. 57:22).

versets.ar: 54. إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَنَهَرٍ ﴿54﴾
versets.fr: 54. Les pieux seront dans des Jardins et parmi des ruisseaux,
versets.en: 54. Verily, The Muttaqun (pious), will be in the midst of Gardens and Rivers (Paradise).

versets.ar: 55. فِي مَقْعَدِ صِدْقٍ عِندَ مَلِيكٍ مُّقْتَدِرٍ ﴿55﴾
versets.fr: 55. dans un séjour de vérité, auprès d'un Souverain Omnipotent.
versets.en: 55. In a seat of truth (i.e. Paradise), near the Omnipotent King (Allah, the All-Blessed, the Most High, the Owner of Majesty and Honour).

versets.fr: 1. Le Tout Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 1. The Most Beneficent (Allah)!

versets.ar: 2. عَلَّمَ الْقُرْآنَ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Il a enseigné le Coran.
versets.en: 2. Has taught (you mankind) the Quran (by His Mercy).

versets.ar: 3. خَلَقَ الْإِنسَانَ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Il a créé l'homme.
versets.en: 3. He created man.

versets.ar: 4. عَلَّمَهُ الْبَيَانَ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Il lui a appris à s'exprimer clairement.
versets.en: 4. He taught him eloquent speech.

versets.ar: 5. الشَّمْسُ وَالْقَمَرُ بِحُسْبَانٍ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Le soleil et la lune [évoluent] selon un calcul [minutieux].
versets.en: 5. The sun and the moon run on their fixed courses (exactly) calculated with measured out stages for each (for reckoning, etc.).

versets.ar: 6. وَالنَّجْمُ وَالشَّجَرُ يَسْجُدَانِ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Et l'herbe et les arbres se prosternent.
versets.en: 6. And the herbs (or stars) and the trees both prostrate.

versets.ar: 7. وَالسَّمَاءَ رَفَعَهَا وَوَضَعَ الْمِيزَانَ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. Et quant au ciel, Il l'a élevé bien haut. Et Il a établi la balance,
versets.en: 7. And the heaven He has raised high, and He has set up the Balance.

versets.ar: 8. أَلَّا تَطْغَوْا فِي الْمِيزَانِ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. afin que vous ne transgressiez pas dans la pesée:
versets.en: 8. In order that you may not transgress (due) balance.

versets.ar: 9. وَأَقِيمُوا الْوَزْنَ بِالْقِسْطِ وَلَا تُخْسِرُوا الْمِيزَانَ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Donnez [toujours] le poids exact et ne faussez pas la pesée.
versets.en: 9. And observe the weight with equity and do not make the balance deficient.

versets.ar: 10. وَالْأَرْضَ وَضَعَهَا لِلْأَنَامِ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Quant à la terre, Il l'a étendue pour les êtres vivants:
versets.en: 10. And the earth He has put for the creatures.

versets.ar: 11. فِيهَا فَاكِهَةٌ وَالنَّخْلُ ذَاتُ الْأَكْمَامِ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. il s'y trouve des fruits, et aussi les palmiers aux fruits recouverts d'enveloppes,
versets.en: 11. Therein are fruits, date-palms producing sheathed fruit-stalks (enclosing dates).

versets.ar: 12. وَالْحَبُّ ذُو الْعَصْفِ وَالرَّيْحَانُ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. tout comme les grains dans leurs balles, et les plantes aromatiques.
versets.en: 12. And also corn, with (its) leaves and stalk for fodder, and sweet-scented plants.

versets.ar: 13. فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. Lequel donc des bienfaits de votre Seigneur nierez-vous?
versets.en: 13. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinns and men) deny?

versets.ar: 14. خَلَقَ الْإِنسَانَ مِن صَلْصَالٍ كَالْفَخَّارِ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. Il a crée l'homme d'argile sonnante comme la poterie;
versets.en: 14. He created man (Adam) from sounding clay like the clay of pottery.

versets.ar: 15. وَخَلَقَ الْجَانَّ مِن مَّارِجٍ مِّن نَّارٍ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. et Il a créé les djinns de la flamme d'un feu sans fumée.
versets.en: 15. And the jinns did He create from a smokeless flame of fire.

versets.ar: 16. فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Lequel donc des bienfaits de votre Seigneur nierez-vous?
versets.en: 16. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinns and men) deny?

versets.ar: 17. رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقَيْنِ وَرَبُّ الْمَغْرِبَيْنِ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Seigneur des deux Levants et Seigneur des deux Couchants!
versets.en: 17. (He is) the Lord of the two easts (places of sunrise during early summer and early winter) and the Lord of the two wests (places of sunset during early summer and early winter).

versets.ar: 18. فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. Lequel donc des bienfaits de votre Seigneur nierez-vous?
versets.en: 18. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinns and men) deny?

versets.ar: 19. مَرَجَ الْبَحْرَيْنِ يَلْتَقِيَانِ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Il a donné libre cours aux deux mers pour se rencontrer;
versets.en: 19. He has let loosed the two seas (the salt water and the sweet) meeting together.

versets.ar: 20. بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخٌ لَّا يَبْغِيَانِ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. il y a entre elles une barrière qu'elles ne dépassent pas.
versets.en: 20. Between them is a barrier which none of them can transgress.

versets.ar: 21. فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Lequel donc des bienfaits de votre Seigneur nierez-vous?
versets.en: 21. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinns and men) deny?

versets.ar: 22. يَخْرُجُ مِنْهُمَا اللُّؤْلُؤُ وَالْمَرْجَانُ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. De ces deux [mers] sortent la perle et le corail.
versets.en: 22. Out of them both come out pearl and coral.

versets.ar: 23. فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. Lequel donc des bienfaits de votre Seigneur nierez-vous?
versets.en: 23. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinns and men) deny?

versets.ar: 24. وَلَهُ الْجَوَارِ الْمُنشَآتُ فِي الْبَحْرِ كَالْأَعْلَامِ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. A Lui appartiennent les vaisseaux élevés sur la mer comme des montagnes.
versets.en: 24. And His are the ships going and coming in the seas, like mountains.

versets.ar: 25. فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Lequel donc des bienfaits de votre Seigneur nierez-vous?
versets.en: 25. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinns and men) deny?

versets.ar: 26. كُلُّ مَنْ عَلَيْهَا فَانٍ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Tout ce qui est sur elle [la terre] doit disparaître,
versets.en: 26. Whatsoever is on it (the earth) will perish.

versets.ar: 27. وَيَبْقَىٰ وَجْهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. [Seule] subsistera La Face [Wajh] de ton Seigneur, plein de majesté et de noblesse.
versets.en: 27. And the Face of your Lord full of Majesty and Honour will abide forever.

versets.ar: 28. فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Lequel donc des bienfaits de votre Seigneur nierez-vous?
versets.en: 28. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinns and men) deny?

versets.ar: 29. يَسْأَلُهُ مَن فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ هُوَ فِي شَأْنٍ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. Ceux qui sont dans les cieux et la terre L'implorent. Chaque jour, Il accomplit une œuvre nouvelle.
versets.en: 29. Whosoever is in the heavens and on earth begs of Him (its needs from Him). Every day He has a matter to bring forth (such as giving honour to some, disgrace to some, life to some, death to some, etc.)!

versets.ar: 30. فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Lequel donc des bienfaits de votre Seigneur nierez-vous?
versets.en: 30. Then which of the Blessings of your Lord will you both (jinns and men) deny?
