versets.en: 23. Say it is He Who has created you, and endowed you with hearing (ears), seeing (eyes), and hearts. Little thanks you give.

versets.ar: 24. قُلْ هُوَ الَّذِي ذَرَأَكُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Dis: «C'est Lui qui vous a répandus sur la terre, et c'est vers Lui que vous serez rassemblés».
versets.en: 24. Say: "It is He Who has created you from the earth, and to Him shall you be gathered (in the Hereafter)."

versets.ar: 25. وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا الْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Et ils disent: «A quand cette promesse si vous êtes véridiques?»
versets.en: 25. They say: "When will this promise (i.e. the Day of Resurrection) come to pass? if you are telling the truth."

versets.ar: 26. قُلْ إِنَّمَا الْعِلْمُ عِندَ اللَّهِ وَإِنَّمَا أَنَا نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Dis: «Allah seul [en] a la connaissance. Et moi je ne suis qu'un avertisseur clair».
versets.en: 26. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "The knowledge (of its exact time) is with Allah only, and I am only a plain warner."

versets.ar: 27. فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهُ زُلْفَةً سِيئَتْ وُجُوهُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَقِيلَ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِ تَدَّعُونَ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Puis, quand ils verront (le châtiment) de près, les visages de ceux qui ont mécru seront affligés. Et il leur sera dit: «Voilà ce que vous réclamiez».
versets.en: 27. But when they will see it (the torment on the Day of Resurrection) approaching, the faces of those who disbelieve will be different (black, sad, and in grieve), and it will be said (to them): "This is (the promise) which you were calling for!"

versets.ar: 28. قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَهْلَكَنِيَ اللَّهُ وَمَن مَّعِيَ أَوْ رَحِمَنَا فَمَن يُجِيرُ الْكَافِرِينَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Dis: «Que vous en semble? Qu'Allah me fasse périr ainsi que ceux qui sont avec moi ou qu'Il nous fasse miséricorde, qui protégera alors les mécréants d'un châtiment douloureux?»
versets.en: 28. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "Tell me! If Allah destroys me, and those with me, or He bestows His Mercy on us, - who can save the disbelievers from a painful torment?"

versets.ar: 29. قُلْ هُوَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ آمَنَّا بِهِ وَعَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ هُوَ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. Dis: «C'est Lui, le Tout Miséricordieux. Nous croyons en Lui et c'est en Lui que nous plaçons notre confiance. Vous saurez bientôt qui est dans un égarement évident».
versets.en: 29. Say: "He is the Most Beneficent (Allah), in Him we believe, and in Him we put our trust. So you will come to know who is it that is in manifest error."

versets.ar: 30. قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَصْبَحَ مَاؤُكُمْ غَوْرًا فَمَن يَأْتِيكُم بِمَاءٍ مَّعِينٍ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Dis: «Que vous en semble? Si votre eau était absorbée au plus profond de la terre, qui donc vous apporterait de l'eau de source?»
versets.en: 30. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "Tell me! If (all) your water were to be sunk away, who then can supply you with flowing (spring) water?"

versets.ar: 1. ن ۚ وَالْقَلَمِ وَمَا يَسْطُرُونَ ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. Nûn. Par la plume et ce qu'ils écrivent!
versets.en: 1. Nun. [These letters (Nun, etc.) are one of the miracles of the Quran, and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings]. By the pen and what the (angels) write (in the Records of men).

versets.ar: 2. مَا أَنتَ بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ بِمَجْنُونٍ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Tu (Muhammad) n'es pas, par la grâce de ton Seigneur, un possédé.
versets.en: 2. You (O Muhammad SAW) are not, by the Grace of your Lord, a madman.

versets.ar: 3. وَإِنَّ لَكَ لَأَجْرًا غَيْرَ مَمْنُونٍ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Et il y aura pour toi certes, une récompense jamais interrompue.
versets.en: 3. And verily, for you (O Muhammad SAW) will be an endless reward.

versets.ar: 4. وَإِنَّكَ لَعَلَىٰ خُلُقٍ عَظِيمٍ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Et tu es certes, d'une moralité éminente.
versets.en: 4. And verily, you (O Muhammad SAW) are on an exalted standard of character.

versets.ar: 5. فَسَتُبْصِرُ وَيُبْصِرُونَ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Tu verras et ils verront
versets.en: 5. You will see, and they will see,

versets.ar: 6. بِأَييِّكُمُ الْمَفْتُونُ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. qui d'entre vous a perdu la raison.
versets.en: 6. Which of you is afflicted with madness.

versets.ar: 7. إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِالْمُهْتَدِينَ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. C'est ton Seigneur qui connaît mieux ceux qui s'égarent de Son chemin, et Il connaît mieux ceux qui suivent la bonne voie.
versets.en: 7. Verily, your Lord knows better, who (among men) has gone astray from His Path, and He knows better those who are guided.

versets.ar: 8. فَلَا تُطِعِ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. N'obéis pas à ceux qui crient au mensonge,
versets.en: 8. So (O Muhammad SAW) obey not the deniers [(of Islamic Monotheism those who belie the Verses of Allah), the Oneness of Allah, and the Messenger of Allah (Muhammad SAW), etc.]

versets.ar: 9. وَدُّوا لَوْ تُدْهِنُ فَيُدْهِنُونَ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Ils aimeraient bien que tu transiges avec eux afin qu'ils transigent avec toi.
versets.en: 9. They wish that you should compromise (in religion out of courtesy) with them, so they (too) would compromise with you.

versets.ar: 10. وَلَا تُطِعْ كُلَّ حَلَّافٍ مَّهِينٍ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Et n'obéis à aucun grand jureur, méprisable,
versets.en: 10. And obey not everyone who swears much, and is considered worthless,

versets.fr: 11. grand diffamateur, grand colporteur de médisance,
versets.en: 11. A slanderer, going about with calumnies,

versets.ar: 12. مَّنَّاعٍ لِّلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. grand empêcheur du bien, transgresseur, grand pécheur,
versets.en: 12. Hinderer of the good, transgressor, sinful,

versets.fr: 13. au cœur dur, et en plus de cela bâtard.
versets.en: 13. Cruel, after all that base-born (of illegitimate birth),

versets.ar: 14. أَن كَانَ ذَا مَالٍ وَبَنِينَ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. Même s'il est doté de richesses et (de nombreux) enfants.
versets.en: 14. (He was so) because he had wealth and children.

versets.ar: 15. إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ آيَاتُنَا قَالَ أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Quand Nos versets lui sont récités, il dit: «Des contes d'anciens».
versets.en: 15. When Our Verses (of the Quran) are recited to him, he says: "Tales of the men of old!"

versets.ar: 16. سَنَسِمُهُ عَلَى الْخُرْطُومِ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Nous le marquerons sur le museau [nez].
versets.en: 16. We shall brand him over the nose!

versets.ar: 17. إِنَّا بَلَوْنَاهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَا أَصْحَابَ الْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Nous les avons éprouvés comme Nous avons éprouvé les propriétaires du verger qui avaient juré d'en faire la récolte au matin,
versets.en: 17. Verily, We have tried them as We tried the people of the garden, when they swore to pluck the fruits of the (garden) in the morning,

versets.ar: 18. وَلَا يَسْتَثْنُونَ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. sans dire: «Si Allah le veut».
versets.en: 18. Without saying: Insha' Allah (If Allah will).

versets.ar: 19. فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَائِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَائِمُونَ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Une calamité de la part de ton Seigneur tomba dessus pendant qu'ils dormaient,
versets.en: 19. Then there passed by on the (garden) something (fire) from your Lord at night and burnt it while they were asleep.

versets.ar: 20. فَأَصْبَحَتْ كَالصَّرِيمِ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. et le matin, ce fut comme si tout avait été rasé.
versets.en: 20. So the (garden) became black by the morning, like a pitch dark night (in complete ruins).

versets.ar: 21. فَتَنَادَوْا مُصْبِحِينَ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Le [lendemain] matin, ils s'appelèrent les uns les autres:
versets.en: 21. Then they called out one to another as soon as the morning broke,

versets.ar: 22. أَنِ اغْدُوا عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَارِمِينَ ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. «Partez tôt à votre champ si vous voulez le récolter».
versets.en: 22. Saying: "Go to your tilth in the morning, if you would pluck the fruits."

versets.ar: 23. فَانطَلَقُوا وَهُمْ يَتَخَافَتُونَ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. Ils allèrent donc, tout en parlant entre eux à voix basse:
versets.en: 23. So they departed, conversing in secret low tones (saying),

versets.ar: 24. أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا الْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. «Ne laissez aucun pauvre y entrer aujourd'hui».
versets.en: 24. No Miskin (poor man) shall enter upon you into it today.

versets.ar: 25. وَغَدَوْا عَلَىٰ حَرْدٍ قَادِرِينَ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Ils partirent de bonne heure décidés à user d'avarice [envers les pauvres], convaincus que cela était en leur pouvoir.
versets.en: 25. And they went in the morning with strong intention, thinking that they have power (to prevent the poor taking anything of the fruits therefrom).

versets.ar: 26. فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهَا قَالُوا إِنَّا لَضَالُّونَ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Puis, quand ils le virent [le jardin], ils dirent: «vraiment, nous avons perdu notre chemin.
versets.en: 26. But when they saw the (garden), they said: "Verily, we have gone astray,"

versets.ar: 27. بَلْ نَحْنُ مَحْرُومُونَ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Ou plutôt nous sommes frustrés».
versets.en: 27. (Then they said): "Nay! Indeed we are deprived of (the fruits)!"

versets.ar: 28. قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Le plus juste d'entre eux dit: «Ne vous avais-je pas dit: Si seulement vous avez rendu gloire à Allah!»
versets.en: 28. The best among them said: "Did I not tell you: why do you not say: Insha' Allah (If Allah will)."

versets.ar: 29. قَالُوا سُبْحَانَ رَبِّنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. Ils dirent: «Gloire à notre Seigneur! Oui, nous avons été des injustes».
versets.en: 29. They said: "Glory to Our Lord! Verily, we have been Zalimun (wrong-doers, etc.)."

versets.ar: 30. فَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَلَاوَمُونَ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Puis ils s'adressèrent les uns aux autres, se faisant des reproches.
versets.en: 30. Then they turned, one against another, in blaming.

versets.ar: 31. قَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا طَاغِينَ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. Ils dirent: «Malheur à nous! Nous avons été des rebelles.
versets.en: 31. They said: "Woe to us! Verily, we were Taghun (transgressors and disobedient, etc.)

versets.ar: 32. عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَا أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَا إِنَّا إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَاغِبُونَ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. Nous souhaitons que notre Seigneur nous le remplace par quelque chose de meilleur. Nous désirons nous rapprocher de notre Seigneur».
versets.en: 32. We hope that our Lord will give us in exchange a better (garden) than this. Truly, we turn to our Lord (wishing for good that He may forgive our sins, and reward us in the Hereafter)."

versets.ar: 33. كَذَٰلِكَ الْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ الْآخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا يَعْلَمُونَ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. Tel fut le châtiment; et le châtiment de l'au-delà est plus grand encore, si seulement ils savaient!
versets.en: 33. Such is the punishment (in this life), but truly, the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they but knew.

versets.ar: 34. إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّاتِ النَّعِيمِ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. Les pieux auront auprès de leur Seigneur les Jardins du délice.
versets.en: 34. Verily, for the Muttaqun (pious and righteous persons - see V. 2:2) are Gardens of delight (Paradise) with their Lord.

versets.ar: 35. أَفَنَجْعَلُ الْمُسْلِمِينَ كَالْمُجْرِمِينَ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Traiterons-Nous les soumis [à Allah] à la manière des criminels?
versets.en: 35. Shall We then treat the (submitting) Muslims like the Mujrimun (criminals, polytheists and disbelievers, etc.)?

versets.ar: 36. مَا لَكُمْ كَيْفَ تَحْكُمُونَ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. Qu'avez-vous? Comment jugez-vous?
versets.en: 36. What is the matter with you? How judge you?

versets.ar: 37. أَمْ لَكُمْ كِتَابٌ فِيهِ تَدْرُسُونَ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. Ou bien avez-vous un Livre dans lequel vous apprenez
versets.en: 37. Or have you a Book through which you learn.

versets.ar: 38. إِنَّ لَكُمْ فِيهِ لَمَا تَخَيَّرُونَ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. qu'en vérité vous obtiendrez tout ce que vous désirez?
versets.en: 38. That you shall have all that you choose?

versets.ar: 39. أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَانٌ عَلَيْنَا بَالِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. Ou bien est-ce que vous avez obtenu de Nous des serments valables jusqu'au Jour de la Résurrection, Nous engageant à vous donner ce que vous décidez?
versets.en: 39. Or you have oaths from Us, reaching to the Day of Resurrection that yours will be what you judge.

versets.ar: 40. سَلْهُمْ أَيُّهُم بِذَٰلِكَ زَعِيمٌ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. Demande-leur qui d'entre eux en est garant?
versets.en: 40. Ask them, which of them will stand surety for that!

versets.ar: 41. أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَاءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا بِشُرَكَائِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا صَادِقِينَ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. Ou encore, est-ce qu'ils ont des associés? Eh bien, qu'ils fassent venir leurs associés s'ils sont véridiques!
versets.en: 41. Or have they "partners"? Then let them bring their "partners" if they are truthful!

versets.ar: 42. يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى السُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. Le jour où ils affronteront les horreurs [du Jugement] et où ils seront appelés à la Prosternation mais ils ne le pourront pas.
versets.en: 42. (Remember) the Day when the Shin shall be laid bare (i.e. the Day of Resurrection) and they shall be called to prostrate (to Allah), but they (hypocrites) shall not be able to do so,

versets.ar: 43. خَاشِعَةً أَبْصَارُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى السُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَالِمُونَ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. Leurs regards seront abaissés, et l'avilissement les couvrira. Or, ils étaient appelés à la Prosternation au temps où ils étaient sains et saufs!...
versets.en: 43. Their eyes will be cast down, ignominy will cover them; they used to be called to prostrate (offer prayers), while they were healthy and good (in the life of the world, but they did not).

versets.ar: 44. فَذَرْنِي وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَٰذَا الْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. Laisse-Moi donc avec quiconque traite de mensonge ce discours; Nous allons les mener graduellement par où ils ne savent pas!
versets.en: 44. Then leave Me Alone with such as belie this Quran. We shall punish them gradually from directions they perceive not.

versets.ar: 45. وَأُمْلِي لَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ كَيْدِي مَتِينٌ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. Et Je leur accorde un délai, car Mon stratagème est sûr!
versets.en: 45. And I will grant them a respite. Verily, My Plan is strong.

versets.ar: 46. أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. Ou bien est-ce que tu leur demandes un salaire, les accablant ainsi d'une lourde dette?
versets.en: 46. Or is it that you (O Muhammad SAW) ask them a wage, so that they are heavily burdened with debt?

versets.ar: 47. أَمْ عِندَهُمُ الْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. Ou savent-ils l'Inconnaissable et c'est de là qu'ils écrivent [leurs mensonges]?
versets.en: 47. Or that the Ghaib (unseen here in this Verse it means Al-Lauh Al-Mahfuz) is in their hands, so that they can write it down?

versets.ar: 48. فَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ الْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. Endure avec patience la sentence de ton Seigneur, et ne sois pas comme l'homme au Poisson [Jonas] qui appela (Allah) dans sa grande angoisse.
versets.en: 48. So wait with patience for the Decision of your Lord, and be not like the Companion of the Fish, when he cried out (to Us) while he was in deep sorrow. (See the Quran, Verse 21:87).

versets.ar: 49. لَّوْلَا أَن تَدَارَكَهُ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِ لَنُبِذَ بِالْعَرَاءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. Si un bienfait de son Seigneur ne l'avait pas atteint, il aurait été rejeté honni sur une terre déserte,
versets.en: 49. Had not a Grace from his Lord reached him, he would indeed have been (left in the stomach of the fish, but We forgave him), so he was cast off on the naked shore, while he was to be blamed.

versets.ar: 50. فَاجْتَبَاهُ رَبُّهُ فَجَعَلَهُ مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. Puis son Seigneur l'élut et le désigna au nombre des gens de bien.
versets.en: 50. But his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.

versets.ar: 51. وَإِن يَكَادُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَارِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا الذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُ لَمَجْنُونٌ ﴿51﴾
versets.fr: 51. Peu s'en faut que ceux qui mécroient ne te transpercent par leurs regards, quand ils entendent le Coran, ils disent: «Il est certes fou!»
versets.en: 51. And verily, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes through hatredness when they hear the Reminder (the Quran), and they say: "Verily, he (Muhammad SAW) is a madman!"

versets.ar: 52. وَمَا هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِّلْعَالَمِينَ ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. Et ce n'est qu'un Rappel, adressé aux mondes!
versets.en: 52. But it is nothing else than a Reminder to all the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists).

versets.fr: 1. L'inévitable [l'Heure qui montre la vérité]
versets.en: 1. The Reality (i.e. the Day of Resurrection)!

versets.ar: 2. مَا الْحَاقَّةُ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Qu'est-ce que l'inévitable?
versets.en: 2. What is the Reality?

versets.ar: 3. وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الْحَاقَّةُ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Et qui te dira ce que c'est que l'inévitable?
versets.en: 3. And what will make you know what the Reality is?

versets.ar: 4. كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ وَعَادٌ بِالْقَارِعَةِ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Les Thamûd et les 'Aad avaient traité de mensonge le cataclysme.
versets.en: 4. Thamud and 'Ad people denied the Qari'ah [the striking Hour (of Judgement)]!

versets.ar: 5. فَأَمَّا ثَمُودُ فَأُهْلِكُوا بِالطَّاغِيَةِ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Quant aux Thamûd, ils furent détruits par le [bruit] excessivement fort.
versets.en: 5. As for Thamud, they were destroyed by the awful cry!

versets.ar: 6. وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Et quant aux 'Aad, ils furent détruits par un vent mugissant et furieux
versets.en: 6. And as for 'Ad, they were destroyed by a furious violent wind;

versets.ar: 7. سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَانِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى الْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. qu'[Allah] déchaîna contre eux pendant sept nuits et huit jours consécutifs; tu voyais alors les gens renversés par terre comme des souches de palmiers évidées.
versets.en: 7. Which Allah imposed on them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so that you could see men lying overthrown (destroyed), as if they were hollow trunks of date-palms!

versets.ar: 8. فَهَلْ تَرَىٰ لَهُم مِّن بَاقِيَةٍ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. En vois-tu le moindre vestige?
versets.en: 8. Do you see any remnants of them?

versets.ar: 9. وَجَاءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَن قَبْلَهُ وَالْمُؤْتَفِكَاتُ بِالْخَاطِئَةِ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Pharaon et ceux qui vécurent avant lui ainsi que les Villes renversées, commirent des fautes.
versets.en: 9. And Fir'aun (Pharaoh), and those before him, and the cities overthrown [the towns of the people of [Lout (Lot)] committed sin,

versets.ar: 10. فَعَصَوْا رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَّابِيَةً ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Ils désobéirent au Messager de leur Seigneur. Celui-ci donc, les saisit d'une façon irrésistible.
versets.en: 10. And they disobeyed their Lord's Messenger, so He punished them with a strong punishment.

versets.ar: 11. إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَى الْمَاءُ حَمَلْنَاكُمْ فِي الْجَارِيَةِ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. C'est Nous qui, quand l'eau déborda, vous avons chargés sur l'Arche
versets.en: 11. Verily! When the water rose beyond its limits [Nuh's (Noah) Flood], We carried you (mankind) in the floating [ship that was constructed by Nuh (Noah)].

versets.ar: 12. لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَا أُذُنٌ وَاعِيَةٌ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. afin d'en faire pour vous un rappel que toute oreille fidèle conserve.
versets.en: 12. That We might make it a remembrance for you, and the keen ear (person) may (hear and) understand it.

versets.ar: 13. فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. Puis, quand d'un seul souffle, on soufflera dans la Trompe,
versets.en: 13. Then when the Trumpet will be blown with one blowing (the first one),

versets.ar: 14. وَحُمِلَتِ الْأَرْضُ وَالْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَاحِدَةً ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. et que la terre et les montagnes seront soulevées puis tassées d'un seul coup;
versets.en: 14. And the earth and the mountains shall be removed from their places, and crushed with a single crushing,

versets.ar: 15. فَيَوْمَئِذٍ وَقَعَتِ الْوَاقِعَةُ ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. ce jour-là alors, l'Evénement se produira,
versets.en: 15. Then on that Day shall the (Great) Event befall,

versets.ar: 16. وَانشَقَّتِ السَّمَاءُ فَهِيَ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَاهِيَةٌ ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. et le ciel se fendra et sera fragile, ce jour-là.
versets.en: 16. And the heaven will split asunder, for that Day it (the heaven will be frail (weak), and torn up,

versets.ar: 17. وَالْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰ أَرْجَائِهَا ۚ وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ ثَمَانِيَةٌ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Et sur ses côtés [se tiendront] les Anges, tandis que huit, ce jour-là, porteront au-dessus d'eux le Trône de ton Seigneur.
versets.en: 17. And the angels will be on its sides, and eight angels will, that Day, bear the Throne of your Lord above them.

versets.ar: 18. يَوْمَئِذٍ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنكُمْ خَافِيَةٌ ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. Ce jour-là vous serez exposés; et rien de vous ne sera caché.
versets.en: 18. That Day shall you be brought to Judgement, not a secret of you will be hidden.

versets.ar: 19. فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِيَمِينِهِ فَيَقُولُ هَاؤُمُ اقْرَءُوا كِتَابِيَهْ ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Quant à celui à qui on aura remis le Livre en sa main droite, il dira: «Tenez! lisez mon livre.
versets.en: 19. Then as for him who will be given his Record in his right hand will say: "Take, read my Record!

versets.ar: 20. إِنِّي ظَنَنتُ أَنِّي مُلَاقٍ حِسَابِيَهْ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. J'étais sûr d'y trouver mon compte».
versets.en: 20. "Surely, I did believe that I shall meet my Account!"

versets.ar: 21. فَهُوَ فِي عِيشَةٍ رَّاضِيَةٍ ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Il jouira d'une vie agréable:
versets.en: 21. So he shall be in a life, well-pleasing.

versets.fr: 22. dans un Jardin haut placé
versets.en: 22. In a lofty Paradise,

versets.ar: 23. قُطُوفُهَا دَانِيَةٌ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. dont les fruits sont à portée de la main.
versets.en: 23. The fruits in bunches whereof will be low and near at hand.

versets.ar: 24. كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِي الْأَيَّامِ الْخَالِيَةِ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. «Mangez et buvez agréablement pour ce que vous avez avancé dans les jours passés».
versets.en: 24. Eat and drink at ease for that which you have sent on before you in days past!

versets.ar: 25. وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِشِمَالِهِ فَيَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَابِيَهْ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Quant à celui à qui on aura remis le Livre en sa main gauche, il dira: «Hélas pour moi! J'aurai souhaité qu'on ne m'ait pas remis mon livre,
versets.en: 25. But as for him who will be given his Record in his left hand, will say: "I wish that I had not been given my Record!

versets.ar: 26. وَلَمْ أَدْرِ مَا حِسَابِيَهْ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. et ne pas avoir connu mon compte...
versets.en: 26. "And that I had never known, how my Account is?

versets.ar: 27. يَا لَيْتَهَا كَانَتِ الْقَاضِيَةَ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Hélas, comme j'aurai souhaité que [ma première mort] fût la définitive.
versets.en: 27. "I wish, would that it had been my end (death)!

versets.ar: 28. مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنِّي مَالِيَهْ ۜ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Ma fortune ne m'a servi à rien.
versets.en: 28. "My wealth has not availed me,

versets.ar: 29. هَلَكَ عَنِّي سُلْطَانِيَهْ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. Mon autorité est anéantie et m'a quitté!»
versets.en: 29. "My power and arguments (to defend myself) have gone from me!"

versets.fr: 30. «Saisissez-le! Puis, mettez-lui un carcan;
versets.en: 30. (It will be said): "Seize him and fetter him,

versets.ar: 31. ثُمَّ الْجَحِيمَ صَلُّوهُ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. ensuite, brûlez-le dans la Fournaise;
versets.en: 31. Then throw him in the blazing Fire.

versets.ar: 32. ثُمَّ فِي سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًا فَاسْلُكُوهُ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. puis, liez-le avec une chaîne de soixante-dix coudées,
versets.en: 32. "Then fasten him with a chain whereof the length is seventy cubits!"

versets.ar: 33. إِنَّهُ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. car il ne croyait pas en Allah, le Très Grand.
versets.en: 33. Verily, He used not to believe in Allah, the Most Great,

versets.ar: 34. وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ الْمِسْكِينِ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. et n'incitait pas à nourrir le pauvre.
versets.en: 34. And urged not on the feeding of Al-Miskin (the poor),

versets.ar: 35. فَلَيْسَ لَهُ الْيَوْمَ هَاهُنَا حَمِيمٌ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Il n'a pour lui ici, aujourd'hui, point d'ami chaleureux [pour le protéger],
versets.en: 35. So no friend has he here this Day,

versets.ar: 36. وَلَا طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِنْ غِسْلِينٍ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. ni d'autre nourriture que du pus,
versets.en: 36. Nor any food except filth from the washing of wounds,

versets.ar: 37. لَّا يَأْكُلُهُ إِلَّا الْخَاطِئُونَ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. que seuls les fautifs mangeront».
versets.en: 37. None will eat except the Khati'un (sinners, disbelievers, polytheists, etc.).

versets.ar: 38. فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِمَا تُبْصِرُونَ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. Mais non... Je jure par ce que vous voyez,
versets.en: 38. So I swear by whatsoever you see,

versets.ar: 39. وَمَا لَا تُبْصِرُونَ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. ainsi que par ce que vous ne voyez pas,
versets.en: 39. And by whatsoever you see not,

versets.ar: 40. إِنَّهُ لَقَوْلُ رَسُولٍ كَرِيمٍ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. que ceci [le Coran] est la parole d'un noble Messager,
versets.en: 40. That this is verily the word of an honoured Messenger [i.e. Jibrael (Gabriel) or Muhammad SAW which he has brought from Allah].

versets.ar: 41. وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تُؤْمِنُونَ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. et que ce n'est pas la parole d'un poète; mais vous ne croyez que très peu,
versets.en: 41. It is not the word of a poet, little is that you believe!

versets.ar: 42. وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. ni la parole d'un devin, mais vous vous rappelez bien peu.
versets.en: 42. Nor is it the word of a soothsayer (or a foreteller), little is that you remember!

versets.ar: 43. تَنزِيلٌ مِّن رَّبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. C'est une révélation du Seigneur de l'Univers.
versets.en: 43. This is the Revelation sent down from the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists).

versets.ar: 44. وَلَوْ تَقَوَّلَ عَلَيْنَا بَعْضَ الْأَقَاوِيلِ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. Et s'il avait forgé quelques paroles qu'ils Nous avait attribuées,
versets.en: 44. And if he (Muhammad SAW) had forged a false saying concerning Us (Allah),

versets.ar: 45. لَأَخَذْنَا مِنْهُ بِالْيَمِينِ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. Nous l'aurions saisi de la main droite,
versets.en: 45. We surely should have seized him by his right hand (or with power and might),

versets.ar: 46. ثُمَّ لَقَطَعْنَا مِنْهُ الْوَتِينَ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. ensuite, Nous lui aurions tranché l'aorte.
versets.en: 46. And then certainly should have cut off his life artery (Aorta),

versets.ar: 47. فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَاجِزِينَ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. Et nul d'entre vous n'aurait pu lui servir de rempart.
versets.en: 47. And none of you could withhold Us from (punishing) him.

versets.fr: 48. C'est en vérité un rappel pour les pieux.
versets.en: 48. And verily, this Quran is a Reminder for the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2).

versets.ar: 49. وَإِنَّا لَنَعْلَمُ أَنَّ مِنكُم مُّكَذِّبِينَ ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. Et Nous savons qu'il y a parmi vous qui le traitent de menteur;
versets.en: 49. And verily, We know that there are some among you that belie (this Quran). [Tafsir At-Tabari, Vol. 29, Page 68]

versets.ar: 50. وَإِنَّهُ لَحَسْرَةٌ عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ ﴿50﴾
versets.fr: 50. mais en vérité, ce sera un sujet de regret pour les mécréants,
versets.en: 50. And indeed it (this Quran) will be an anguish for the disbelievers (on the Day of Resurrection).

versets.fr: 51. c'est là la véritable certitude.
versets.en: 51. And Verily, it (this Quran) is an absolute truth with certainty.

versets.ar: 52. فَسَبِّحْ بِاسْمِ رَبِّكَ الْعَظِيمِ ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. Glorifie donc le nom de ton Seigneur, le Très Grand!
versets.en: 52. So glorify the Name of your Lord, the Most Great.

versets.ar: 1. سَأَلَ سَائِلٌ بِعَذَابٍ وَاقِعٍ ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. Un demandeur a réclamé un châtiment inéluctable,
versets.en: 1. A questioner asked concerning a torment about to befall

versets.ar: 2. لِّلْكَافِرِينَ لَيْسَ لَهُ دَافِعٌ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. pour les mécréants, que nul ne pourrait repousser,
versets.en: 2. Upon the disbelievers, which none can avert,

versets.ar: 3. مِّنَ اللَّهِ ذِي الْمَعَارِجِ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. et qui vient d'Allah, le Maître des voies d'ascension.
versets.en: 3. From Allah, the Lord of the ways of ascent.

versets.ar: 4. تَعْرُجُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَالرُّوحُ إِلَيْهِ فِي يَوْمٍ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُ خَمْسِينَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Les Anges ainsi que l'Esprit montent vers Lui en un jour dont la durée est de cinquante mille ans.
versets.en: 4. The angels and the Ruh [Jibrael (Gabriel)] ascend to Him in a Day the measure whereof is fifty thousand years,

versets.ar: 5. فَاصْبِرْ صَبْرًا جَمِيلًا ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Supporte donc, d'une belle patience.
versets.en: 5. So be patient (O Muhammad SAW), with a good patience.

versets.ar: 6. إِنَّهُمْ يَرَوْنَهُ بَعِيدًا ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Ils le (le châtiment) voient bien loin,
versets.en: 6. Verily! They see it (the torment) afar off,

versets.ar: 7. وَنَرَاهُ قَرِيبًا ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. alors que Nous le voyons bien proche,
versets.en: 7. But We see it (quite) near.

versets.ar: 8. يَوْمَ تَكُونُ السَّمَاءُ كَالْمُهْلِ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. le jour où le ciel sera comme du métal en fusion
versets.en: 8. The Day that the sky will be like the boiling filth of oil, (or molten copper or silver or lead, etc.).

versets.ar: 9. وَتَكُونُ الْجِبَالُ كَالْعِهْنِ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. et les montagnes comme de la laine,
versets.en: 9. And the mountains will be like flakes of wool,

versets.ar: 10. وَلَا يَسْأَلُ حَمِيمٌ حَمِيمًا ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. où nul ami dévoué ne s'enquerra d'un ami,
versets.en: 10. And no friend will ask of a friend,

versets.ar: 11. يُبَصَّرُونَهُمْ ۚ يَوَدُّ الْمُجْرِمُ لَوْ يَفْتَدِي مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمِئِذٍ بِبَنِيهِ ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. bien qu'ils se voient l'un l'autre. Le criminel aimerait pouvoir se racheter du châtiment de ce jour, en livrant ses enfants,
versets.en: 11. Though they shall be made to see one another [(i.e. on the Day of Resurrection), there will be none but see his father, children and relatives, but he will neither speak to them nor will ask them for any help)], - the Mujrim, (criminal, sinner, disbeliever, etc.) would desire to ransom himself from the punishment of that Day by his children.

versets.ar: 12. وَصَاحِبَتِهِ وَأَخِيهِ ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. sa compagne, son frère,
versets.en: 12. And his wife and his brother,

versets.ar: 13. وَفَصِيلَتِهِ الَّتِي تُؤْوِيهِ ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. même son clan qui lui donnait asile,
versets.en: 13. And his kindred who sheltered him,

versets.ar: 14. وَمَن فِي الْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. et tout ce qui est sur la terre, tout, qui pourrait le sauver.
versets.en: 14. And all that are in the earth, so that it might save him.

versets.fr: 15. Mais rien [ne le sauvera]. [L'Enfer] est un brasier
versets.en: 15. By no means! Verily, it will be the Fire of Hell!

versets.fr: 16. arrachant brutalement la peau du crâne.
versets.en: 16. Taking away (burning completely) the head skin!

versets.ar: 17. تَدْعُو مَنْ أَدْبَرَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Il appellera celui qui tournait le dos et s'en allait,
versets.en: 17. Calling: "[O Kafir (O disbeliever in Allah, His angels, His Book, His Messengers, Day of Resurrection and in Al-Qadar (Divine Preordainments), O Mushrik (O polytheist, disbeliever in the Oneness of Allah)] (all) such as turn their backs and turn away their faces (from Faith) [picking and swallowing them up from that great gathering of mankind (on the Day of Resurrection) just as a bird picks up a food-grain from the earth with its beak and swallows it up] [Tafsir Al-Qurtubi, Vol. 18, Page 289]

versets.fr: 18. amassait et thésaurisait.
versets.en: 18. And collect (wealth) and hide it (from spending it in the Cause of Allah).

versets.ar: 19. ۞ إِنَّ الْإِنسَانَ خُلِقَ هَلُوعًا ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Oui, l'homme a été créé instable [très inquiet];
versets.en: 19. Verily, man (disbeliever) was created very impatient;

versets.ar: 20. إِذَا مَسَّهُ الشَّرُّ جَزُوعًا ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. quand le malheur le touche, il est abattu;
versets.en: 20. Irritable (discontented) when evil touches him;

versets.ar: 21. وَإِذَا مَسَّهُ الْخَيْرُ مَنُوعًا ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. et quand le bonheur le touche, il est grand refuseur.
versets.en: 21. And niggardly when good touches him;

versets.fr: 22. Sauf ceux qui pratiquent la Salât
versets.en: 22. Except those devoted to Salat (prayers)

versets.ar: 23. الَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمْ دَائِمُونَ ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. qui sont assidus à leurs Salâts,
versets.en: 23. Those who remain constant in their Salat (prayers);

versets.ar: 24. وَالَّذِينَ فِي أَمْوَالِهِمْ حَقٌّ مَّعْلُومٌ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. et sur les biens desquels il y a un droit bien déterminé [la Zakât]
versets.en: 24. And those in whose wealth there is a known right,

versets.ar: 25. لِّلسَّائِلِ وَالْمَحْرُومِ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. pour le mendiant et le déshérité;
versets.en: 25. For the beggar who asks, and for the unlucky who has lost his property and wealth, (and his means of living has been straitened);

versets.ar: 26. وَالَّذِينَ يُصَدِّقُونَ بِيَوْمِ الدِّينِ ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. et qui déclarent véridique le Jour de la Rétribution,
versets.en: 26. And those who believe in the Day of Recompense,

versets.ar: 27. وَالَّذِينَ هُم مِّنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشْفِقُونَ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. et ceux qui craignent le châtiment de leur Seigneur
versets.en: 27. And those who fear the torment of their Lord,

versets.ar: 28. إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّهِمْ غَيْرُ مَأْمُونٍ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. car vraiment, il n'y a nulle assurance contre le châtiment de leur Seigneur;
versets.en: 28. Verily! The torment of their Lord is that before which none can feel secure,

versets.ar: 29. وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ لِفُرُوجِهِمْ حَافِظُونَ ﴿29﴾
versets.fr: 29. et qui se maintiennent dans la chasteté
versets.en: 29. And those who guard their chastity (i.e. private parts from illegal sexual acts).

versets.ar: 30. إِلَّا عَلَىٰ أَزْوَاجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. et n'ont de rapports qu'avec leurs épouses ou les esclaves qu'ils possèdent car dans ce cas, ils ne sont pas blâmables,
versets.en: 30. Except with their wives and the (women slaves and captives) whom their right hands possess, for (then) they are not to be blamed,

versets.ar: 31. فَمَنِ ابْتَغَىٰ وَرَاءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْعَادُونَ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. mais ceux qui cherchent [leur plaisir] en dehors de cela, sont des transgresseurs;
versets.en: 31. But whosoever seeks beyond that, then it is those who are trespassers.

versets.ar: 32. وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ لِأَمَانَاتِهِمْ وَعَهْدِهِمْ رَاعُونَ ﴿32﴾
versets.fr: 32. et qui gardent les dépôts confiés à eux, et respectent leurs engagements scrupuleusement;
versets.en: 32. And those who keep their trusts and covenants;

versets.ar: 33. وَالَّذِينَ هُم بِشَهَادَاتِهِمْ قَائِمُونَ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. et qui témoignent de la stricte vérité,
versets.en: 33. And those who stand firm in their testimonies;

versets.ar: 34. وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمْ يُحَافِظُونَ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. et qui sont réguliers dans leur Salât.
versets.en: 34. And those who guard their Salat (prayers) well.

versets.ar: 35. أُولَٰئِكَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ مُّكْرَمُونَ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. Ceux-là seront honorés dans des Jardins.
versets.en: 35. Such shall dwell in the Gardens (i.e. Paradise) honoured.

versets.ar: 36. فَمَالِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا قِبَلَكَ مُهْطِعِينَ ﴿36﴾
versets.fr: 36. Qu'ont donc, ceux qui ont mécru, à courir vers toi, le cou tendu,
versets.en: 36. So what is the matter with those who disbelieve that they hasten to listen from you (O Muhammad SAW), in order to belie you and to mock at you, and at Allah's Book (this Quran).

versets.ar: 37. عَنِ الْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ الشِّمَالِ عِزِينَ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. de droite et de gauche, [venant] par bandes?
versets.en: 37. (Sitting) in groups on the right and on the left (of you, O Muhammad SAW)?

versets.ar: 38. أَيَطْمَعُ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُدْخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٍ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. Chacun d'eux convoite-t-il qu'on le laisse entrer au Jardin des délices?
versets.en: 38. Does every man of them hope to enter the Paradise of delight?

versets.ar: 39. كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَاهُم مِّمَّا يَعْلَمُونَ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. Mais non! Nous les avons créés de ce qu'ils savent.
versets.en: 39. No, that is not like that! Verily, We have created them out of that which they know!

versets.ar: 40. فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِرَبِّ الْمَشَارِقِ وَالْمَغَارِبِ إِنَّا لَقَادِرُونَ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. Eh Non!... Je jure par le Seigneur des Levants et des Couchants que Nous sommes Capable
versets.en: 40. So I swear by the Lord of all [the three hundred and sixty (360)] points of sunrise and sunset in the east and the west that surely We are Able

versets.ar: 41. عَلَىٰ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيْرًا مِّنْهُمْ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. de les remplacer par de meilleurs qu'eux, et nul ne peut nous en empêcher.
versets.en: 41. To replace them by (others) better than them; and We are not to be outrun.

versets.ar: 42. فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا وَيَلْعَبُوا حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. Laisse-les donc s'enfoncer (dans leur mécréance) et se divertir jusqu'à ce qu'ils rencontrent leur jour dont on les menaçait,
versets.en: 42. So leave them to plunge in vain talk and play about, until they meet their Day which they are promised.

versets.ar: 43. يَوْمَ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ سِرَاعًا كَأَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٍ يُوفِضُونَ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. le jour où ils sortiront des tombes, rapides comme s'ils couraient vers des pierres dressées;
versets.en: 43. The Day when they will come out of the graves quickly as racing to a goal,

versets.ar: 44. خَاشِعَةً أَبْصَارُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمُ الَّذِي كَانُوا يُوعَدُونَ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. leurs yeux seront abaissés, l'avilissement les couvrira. C'est cela le jour dont on les menaçait!
versets.en: 44. With their eyes lowered in fear and humility, ignominy covering them (all over)! That is the Day which they were promised!

versets.ar: 1. إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ أَنْ أَنذِرْ قَوْمَكَ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِيَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. Nous avons envoyé Noé vers son peuple: «Avertis ton peuple, avant que leur vienne un châtiment douloureux».
versets.en: 1. Verily, We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people (Saying): "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful torment."

versets.ar: 2. قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ إِنِّي لَكُمْ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Il [leur] dit: «O mon peuple, je suis vraiment pour vous, un avertisseur clair,
versets.en: 2. He said: "O my people! Verily, I am a plain warner to you,

versets.ar: 3. أَنِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ وَاتَّقُوهُ وَأَطِيعُونِ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Adorez Allah, craignez-Le et obéissez-moi,
versets.en: 3. "That you should worship Allah (Alone), be dutiful to Him, and obey me,

versets.ar: 4. يَغْفِرْ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمْ وَيُؤَخِّرْكُمْ إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ اللَّهِ إِذَا جَاءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُ ۖ لَوْ كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. pour qu'Il vous pardonne vos péchés et qu'Il vous donne un délai jusqu'à un terme fixé. Mais quand vient le terme fixé par Allah, il ne saurait être différé si vous saviez!»
versets.en: 4. "He (Allah) will forgive you of your sins and respite you to an appointed term. Verily, the term of Allah when it comes, cannot be delayed, if you but knew."

versets.ar: 5. قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي دَعَوْتُ قَوْمِي لَيْلًا وَنَهَارًا ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Il dit: «Seigneur! J'ai appelé mon peuple, nuit et jour.
versets.en: 5. He said: "O my Lord! Verily, I have called my people night and day (i.e. secretly and openly to accept the doctrine of Islamic Monotheism).

versets.ar: 6. فَلَمْ يَزِدْهُمْ دُعَائِي إِلَّا فِرَارًا ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Mais mon appel n'a fait qu'accroître leur fuite.
versets.en: 6. "But all my calling added nothing but to (their) flight (from the truth).

versets.ar: 7. وَإِنِّي كُلَّمَا دَعَوْتُهُمْ لِتَغْفِرَ لَهُمْ جَعَلُوا أَصَابِعَهُمْ فِي آذَانِهِمْ وَاسْتَغْشَوْا ثِيَابَهُمْ وَأَصَرُّوا وَاسْتَكْبَرُوا اسْتِكْبَارًا ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. Et chaque fois que je les ai appelés pour que Tu leur pardonnes, ils ont mis leurs doigts dans leurs oreilles. se sont enveloppés de leurs vêtements, se sont entêtés et se sont montrés extrêmement orgueilleux.
versets.en: 7. "And verily! Every time I called unto them that You might forgive them, they thrust their fingers into their ears, covered themselves up with their garments, and persisted (in their refusal), and magnified themselves in pride.

versets.ar: 8. ثُمَّ إِنِّي دَعَوْتُهُمْ جِهَارًا ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Ensuite, je les ai appelés ouvertement.
versets.en: 8. "Then verily, I called to them openly (aloud);

versets.ar: 9. ثُمَّ إِنِّي أَعْلَنتُ لَهُمْ وَأَسْرَرْتُ لَهُمْ إِسْرَارًا ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Puis, je leur ai fait des proclamations publiques, et des confidences en secret.
versets.en: 9. "Then verily, I proclaimed to them in public, and I have appealed to them in private,

versets.ar: 10. فَقُلْتُ اسْتَغْفِرُوا رَبَّكُمْ إِنَّهُ كَانَ غَفَّارًا ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. J'ai donc dit: «Implorez le pardon de votre Seigneur, car Il est grand Pardonneur,
versets.en: 10. "I said (to them): 'Ask forgiveness from your Lord; Verily, He is Oft-Forgiving;

versets.ar: 11. يُرْسِلِ السَّمَاءَ عَلَيْكُم مِّدْرَارًا ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. pour qu'Il vous envoie du ciel, des pluies abondantes,
versets.en: 11. 'He will send rain to you in abundance;

versets.ar: 12. وَيُمْدِدْكُم بِأَمْوَالٍ وَبَنِينَ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ جَنَّاتٍ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ أَنْهَارًا ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. et qu'Il vous accorde beaucoup de biens et d'enfants, et vous donne des jardins et vous donne des rivières.
versets.en: 12. 'And give you increase in wealth and children, and bestow on you gardens and bestow on you rivers."

versets.ar: 13. مَّا لَكُمْ لَا تَرْجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارًا ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. Qu'avez-vous à ne pas vénérer Allah comme il se doit,
versets.en: 13. What is the matter with you, [that you fear not Allah (His punishment), and] you hope not for reward (from Allah or you believe not in His Oneness).

versets.ar: 14. وَقَدْ خَلَقَكُمْ أَطْوَارًا ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. alors qu'Il vous a créés par phases successives?
versets.en: 14. While He has created you in (different) stages [i.e. first Nutfah, then 'Alaqah and then Mudghah, see (VV. 23:13, 14) the Quran].

versets.ar: 15. أَلَمْ تَرَوْا كَيْفَ خَلَقَ اللَّهُ سَبْعَ سَمَاوَاتٍ طِبَاقًا ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. N'avez-vous pas vu comment Allah a créé sept cieux superposés
versets.en: 15. See you not how Allah has created the seven heavens one above another,

versets.ar: 16. وَجَعَلَ الْقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورًا وَجَعَلَ الشَّمْسَ سِرَاجًا ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. et y a fait de la lune une lumière et du soleil une lampe?
versets.en: 16. And has made the moon a light therein, and made the sun a lamp?

versets.ar: 17. وَاللَّهُ أَنبَتَكُم مِّنَ الْأَرْضِ نَبَاتًا ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Et c'est Allah qui, de la terre, vous a fait croître comme des plantes,
versets.en: 17. And Allah has brought you forth from the (dust of) earth. [Tafsir At-Tabari, Vol. 29, Page 97].

versets.ar: 18. ثُمَّ يُعِيدُكُمْ فِيهَا وَيُخْرِجُكُمْ إِخْرَاجًا ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. puis Il vous y fera retourner et vous en fera sortir véritablement.
versets.en: 18. Afterwards He will return you into it (the earth), and bring you forth (again on the Day of Resurrection)?

versets.ar: 19. وَاللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ بِسَاطًا ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Et c'est Allah qui vous a fait de la terre un tapis,
versets.en: 19. And Allah has made for you the earth wide spread (an expanse).

versets.ar: 20. لِّتَسْلُكُوا مِنْهَا سُبُلًا فِجَاجًا ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. pour que vous vous acheminiez par ses voies spacieuses».
versets.en: 20. That you may go about therein in broad roads.

versets.ar: 21. قَالَ نُوحٌ رَّبِّ إِنَّهُمْ عَصَوْنِي وَاتَّبَعُوا مَن لَّمْ يَزِدْهُ مَالُهُ وَوَلَدُهُ إِلَّا خَسَارًا ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Noé dit: «Seigneur, ils m'ont désobéi et ils ont suivi celui dont les biens et les enfants n'ont fait qu'accroître la perte.
versets.en: 21. Nuh (Noah) said: "My Lord! They have disobeyed me, and followed one whose wealth and children give him no increase but only loss.

versets.ar: 22. وَمَكَرُوا مَكْرًا كُبَّارًا ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. Ils ont ourdi un immense stratagème,
versets.en: 22. "And they have plotted a mighty plot.

versets.ar: 23. وَقَالُوا لَا تَذَرُنَّ آلِهَتَكُمْ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدًّا وَلَا سُوَاعًا وَلَا يَغُوثَ وَيَعُوقَ وَنَسْرًا ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. et ils ont dit: «N'abandonnez jamais vos divinités et n'abandonnez jamais Wadd, Suwâ, Yaghhû, Ya'ûq et Nasr'.
versets.en: 23. "And they have said: 'You shall not leave your gods, nor shall you leave Wadd, nor Suwa', nor Yaghuth, nor Ya'uq, nor Nasr (names of the idols);

versets.ar: 24. وَقَدْ أَضَلُّوا كَثِيرًا ۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ الظَّالِمِينَ إِلَّا ضَلَالًا ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Elles [les idoles] ont déjà égaré plusieurs. Ne fais (Seigneur) croître les injustes qu'en égarement.
versets.en: 24. "And indeed they have led many astray. And (O Allah): 'Grant no increase to the Zalimun (polytheists, wrong-doers, and disbelievers, etc.) save error."

versets.ar: 25. مِّمَّا خَطِيئَاتِهِمْ أُغْرِقُوا فَأُدْخِلُوا نَارًا فَلَمْ يَجِدُوا لَهُم مِّن دُونِ اللَّهِ أَنصَارًا ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. A cause de leurs fautes, ils ont été noyés, puis on les a fait entrer au Feu, et ils n'ont pas trouvé en dehors d'Allah, de secoureurs».
versets.en: 25. Because of their sins they were drowned, then were made to enter the Fire, and they found none to help them instead of Allah.

versets.ar: 26. وَقَالَ نُوحٌ رَّبِّ لَا تَذَرْ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ دَيَّارًا ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. Et Noé dit: «Seigneur, ne laisse sur la terre aucun infidèle.
versets.en: 26. And Nuh (Noah) said: "My Lord! Leave not one of the disbelievers on the earth!

versets.ar: 27. إِنَّكَ إِن تَذَرْهُمْ يُضِلُّوا عِبَادَكَ وَلَا يَلِدُوا إِلَّا فَاجِرًا كَفَّارًا ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Si Tu les laisses [en vie], ils égareront Tes serviteurs et n'engendreront que des pécheurs infidèles.
versets.en: 27. "If You leave them, they will mislead Your slaves, and they will beget none but wicked disbelievers."

versets.ar: 28. رَّبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَلِوَالِدَيَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيْتِيَ مُؤْمِنًا وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ وَلَا تَزِدِ الظَّالِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارًا ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Seigneur! Pardonne-moi, et à mes père et mère et à celui qui entre dans ma demeure croyant, ainsi qu'aux croyants et croyantes; et ne fais croître les injustes qu'en perdition».
versets.en: 28. "My Lord! Forgive me, and my parents, and him who enters my home as a believer, and all the believing men and women. And to the Zalimun (polytheists, wrong-doers, and disbelievers, etc.) grant You no increase but destruction!"

versets.ar: 1. قُلْ أُوحِيَ إِلَيَّ أَنَّهُ اسْتَمَعَ نَفَرٌ مِّنَ الْجِنِّ فَقَالُوا إِنَّا سَمِعْنَا قُرْآنًا عَجَبًا ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. Dis: «Il m'a été révélé qu'un groupe de djinns prêtèrent l'oreille, puis dirent: «Nous avons certes entendu une Lecture [le Coran] merveilleuse,
versets.en: 1. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "It has been revealed to me that a group (from three to ten in number) of jinns listened (to this Quran). They said: 'Verily! We have heard a wonderful Recital (this Quran)!

versets.ar: 2. يَهْدِي إِلَى الرُّشْدِ فَآمَنَّا بِهِ ۖ وَلَن نُّشْرِكَ بِرَبِّنَا أَحَدًا ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. qui guide vers la droiture. Nous y avons cru, et nous n'associerons jamais personne à notre Seigneur.
versets.en: 2. 'It guides to the Right Path, and we have believed therein, and we shall never join (in worship) anything with our Lord (Allah).

versets.ar: 3. وَأَنَّهُ تَعَالَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا اتَّخَذَ صَاحِبَةً وَلَا وَلَدًا ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. En vérité notre Seigneur - que Sa grandeur soit exaltée - ne S'est donné ni compagne, ni enfant!
versets.en: 3. 'And exalted be the Majesty of our Lord, He has taken neither a wife, nor a son (or offspring or children).

versets.ar: 4. وَأَنَّهُ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى اللَّهِ شَطَطًا ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Notre insensé [Iblis] disait des extravagances contre Allah.
versets.en: 4. 'And that the foolish among us [i.e. Iblis (Satan) or the polytheists amongst the jinns] used to utter against Allah that which was wrong and not right.

versets.ar: 5. وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّا أَن لَّن تَقُولَ الْإِنسُ وَالْجِنُّ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Et nous pensions que ni les humains ni les djinns ne sauraient jamais proférer de mensonge contre Allah.
versets.en: 5. 'And verily, we thought that men and jinns would not utter a lie against Allah.

versets.ar: 6. وَأَنَّهُ كَانَ رِجَالٌ مِّنَ الْإِنسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٍ مِّنَ الْجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمْ رَهَقًا ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Or, il y avait parmi les humains, des mâles qui cherchaient protection auprès des mâles parmi les djinns mais cela ne fit qu'accroître leur détresse.
versets.en: 6. 'And verily, there were men among mankind who took shelter with the masculine among the jinns, but they (jinns) increased them (mankind) in sin and disbelief.

versets.ar: 7. وَأَنَّهُمْ ظَنُّوا كَمَا ظَنَنتُمْ أَن لَّن يَبْعَثَ اللَّهُ أَحَدًا ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. Et ils avaient pensé comme vous avez pensé qu'Allah ne ressusciterait jamais personne.
versets.en: 7. 'And they thought as you thought, that Allah will not send any Messenger (to mankind or jinns).

versets.ar: 8. وَأَنَّا لَمَسْنَا السَّمَاءَ فَوَجَدْنَاهَا مُلِئَتْ حَرَسًا شَدِيدًا وَشُهُبًا ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Nous avions frôlé le ciel et nous l'avions trouvé plein d'une forte garde et de bolides.
versets.en: 8. 'And we have sought to reach the heaven; but found it filled with stern guards and flaming fires.

versets.ar: 9. وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقْعُدُ مِنْهَا مَقَاعِدَ لِلسَّمْعِ ۖ فَمَن يَسْتَمِعِ الْآنَ يَجِدْ لَهُ شِهَابًا رَّصَدًا ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. Nous y prenions place pour écouter. Mais quiconque prête l'oreille maintenant, trouve contre lui un bolide aux aguets.
versets.en: 9. 'And verily, we used to sit there in stations, to (steal) a hearing, but any who listens now will find a flaming fire watching him in ambush.

versets.ar: 10. وَأَنَّا لَا نَدْرِي أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَن فِي الْأَرْضِ أَمْ أَرَادَ بِهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ رَشَدًا ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Nous ne savons pas si on veut du mal aux habitants de la terre ou si leur Seigneur veut les mettre sur le droit chemin.
versets.en: 10. 'And we know not whether evil is intended for those on earth, or whether their Lord intends for them a Right Path.

versets.ar: 11. وَأَنَّا مِنَّا الصَّالِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ كُنَّا طَرَائِقَ قِدَدًا ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. Il y a parmi nous des vertueux et [d'autres] qui le sont moins: nous étions divisés en différentes sectes.
versets.en: 11. 'There are among us some that are righteous, and some the contrary; we are groups each having a different way (religious sect, etc.).

versets.ar: 12. وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّا أَن لَّن نُّعْجِزَ اللَّهَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَن نُّعْجِزَهُ هَرَبًا ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. Nous pensions bien que nous ne saurions jamais réduire Allah à l'impuissance sur la terre et que nous ne saurions jamais le réduire à l'impuissance en nous enfuyant.
versets.en: 12. 'And we think that we cannot escape (from the punishment of) Allah in the earth, nor can we escape (from the punishment) by flight.

versets.ar: 13. وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعْنَا الْهُدَىٰ آمَنَّا بِهِ ۖ فَمَن يُؤْمِن بِرَبِّهِ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخْسًا وَلَا رَهَقًا ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. Et lorsque nous avons entendu le guide [le Coran], nous y avons cru, et quiconque croit en son Seigneur ne craint alors ni diminution de récompense ni oppression.
versets.en: 13. 'And indeed when we heard the Guidance (this Quran), we believed therein (Islamic Monotheism), and whosoever believes in his Lord shall have no fear, either of a decrease in the reward of his good deeds or an increase in punishment for his sins.

versets.ar: 14. وَأَنَّا مِنَّا الْمُسْلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا الْقَاسِطُونَ ۖ فَمَنْ أَسْلَمَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ تَحَرَّوْا رَشَدًا ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. Il y a parmi nous les Musulmans, et il y en a les injustes [qui ont dévié]. Et ceux qui se sont convertis à l'Islam sont ceux qui ont cherché la droiture.
versets.en: 14. 'And of us some are Muslims (who have submitted to Allah, after listening to this Quran), and of us some are Al-Qasitun (disbelievers those who have deviated from the Right Path)'. And whosoever has embraced Islam (i.e. has become a Muslim by submitting to Allah), then such have sought the Right Path."

versets.ar: 15. وَأَمَّا الْقَاسِطُونَ فَكَانُوا لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبًا ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Et quant aux injustes, ils formeront le combustible de l'Enfer.
versets.en: 15. And as for the Qasitun (disbelievers who deviated from the Right Path), they shall be firewood for Hell,

versets.ar: 16. وَأَن لَّوِ اسْتَقَامُوا عَلَى الطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسْقَيْنَاهُم مَّاءً غَدَقًا ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Et s'ils se maintenaient dans la bonne direction, Nous les aurions abreuvés, certes d'une eau abondante,
versets.en: 16. If they (non-Muslims) had believed in Allah, and went on the Right Way (i.e. Islam) We should surely have bestowed on them water (rain) in abundance.

versets.ar: 17. لِّنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِ ۚ وَمَن يُعْرِضْ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّهِ يَسْلُكْهُ عَذَابًا صَعَدًا ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. afin de les y éprouver. Et quiconque se détourne du rappel de son Seigneur, Il l'achemine vers un châtiment sans cesse croissant.
versets.en: 17. That We might try them thereby. And whosoever turns away from the Reminder of his Lord (i.e. this Quran, and practice not its laws and orders), He will cause him to enter in a severe torment (i.e. Hell).

versets.ar: 18. وَأَنَّ الْمَسَاجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدْعُوا مَعَ اللَّهِ أَحَدًا ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. Les mosquées sont consacrées à Allah: n'invoquez donc personne avec Allah.
versets.en: 18. And the mosques are for Allah (Alone), so invoke not anyone along with Allah.

versets.ar: 19. وَأَنَّهُ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ يَدْعُوهُ كَادُوا يَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِ لِبَدًا ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Et quand le serviteur d'Allah s'est mis debout pour L'invoquer, ils faillirent se ruer en masse sur lui.
versets.en: 19. (It has been revealed to me that) When the slave of Allah (Muhammad SAW) stood up invoking (his Lord Allah) in prayer to Him they (the jinns) just made round him a dense crowd as if sticking one over the other (in order to listen to the Prophet's recitation).

versets.ar: 20. قُلْ إِنَّمَا أَدْعُو رَبِّي وَلَا أُشْرِكُ بِهِ أَحَدًا ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. Dis: «Je n'invoque que mon Seigneur et ne Lui associe personne».
versets.en: 20. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "I invoke only my Lord (Allah Alone), and I associate none as partners along with Him."

versets.ar: 21. قُلْ إِنِّي لَا أَمْلِكُ لَكُمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا رَشَدًا ﴿21﴾
versets.fr: 21. Dis: «Je ne possède aucun moyen pour vous faire du mal, ni pour vous mettre sur le chemin droit».
versets.en: 21. Say: "It is not in my power to cause you harm, or to bring you to the Right Path."

versets.ar: 22. قُلْ إِنِّي لَن يُجِيرَنِي مِنَ اللَّهِ أَحَدٌ وَلَنْ أَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِ مُلْتَحَدًا ﴿22﴾
versets.fr: 22. Dis: «Vraiment, personne ne saura me protéger contre Allah; et jamais je ne trouverai de refuge en dehors de Lui.
versets.en: 22. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "None can protect me from Allah's punishment (if I were to disobey Him), nor should I find refuge except in Him.

versets.ar: 23. إِلَّا بَلَاغًا مِّنَ اللَّهِ وَرِسَالَاتِهِ ۚ وَمَن يَعْصِ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ فَإِنَّ لَهُ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا ﴿23﴾
versets.fr: 23. [Je ne puis que transmettre] une communication et des messages [émanant] d'Allah. Et quiconque désobéit à Allah et à Son Messager aura le feu de l'Enfer pour y demeurer éternellement.
versets.en: 23. "(Mine is) but conveyance (of the truth) from Allah and His Messages (of Islamic Monotheism), and whosoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger, then verily, for him is the Fire of Hell, he shall dwell therein forever."

versets.ar: 24. حَتَّىٰ إِذَا رَأَوْا مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَضْعَفُ نَاصِرًا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدًا ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Puis, quand ils verront ce dont on les menaçait, ils sauront lesquels ont les secours les plus faibles et [lesquels] sont les moins nombreux.
versets.en: 24. Till, when they see that which they are promised, then they will know who it is that is weaker concerning helpers and less important concerning numbers.

versets.ar: 25. قُلْ إِنْ أَدْرِي أَقَرِيبٌ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ أَمْ يَجْعَلُ لَهُ رَبِّي أَمَدًا ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. Dis: «Je ne sais pas si ce dont vous êtes menacés est proche, ou bien, si mon Seigneur va lui assigner un délai.
versets.en: 25. Say (O Muhammad SAW): "I know not whether (the punishment) which you are promised is near or whether my Lord will appoint for it a distant term.

versets.ar: 26. عَالِمُ الْغَيْبِ فَلَا يُظْهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيْبِهِ أَحَدًا ﴿26﴾
versets.fr: 26. [C'est Lui] qui connaît le mystère. Il ne dévoile Son mystère à personne,
versets.en: 26. "(He Alone) the All-Knower of the Gha'ib (unseen), and He reveals to none His Gha'ib (unseen)."

versets.ar: 27. إِلَّا مَنِ ارْتَضَىٰ مِن رَّسُولٍ فَإِنَّهُ يَسْلُكُ مِن بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِ رَصَدًا ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. sauf à celui qu'Il agrée comme Messager et qu'Il fait précéder et suivre de gardiens vigilants,
versets.en: 27. Except to a Messenger (from mankind) whom He has chosen (He informs him of unseen as much as He likes), and then He makes a band of watching guards (angels) to march before him and behind him.

versets.ar: 28. لِّيَعْلَمَ أَن قَدْ أَبْلَغُوا رِسَالَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ وَأَحْصَىٰ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ عَدَدًا ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. afin qu'Il sache s'ils ont bien transmis les messages de leur Seigneur. Il cerne (de Son savoir) ce qui est avec eux, et dénombre exactement toute chose.
versets.en: 28. [He (Allah) protects them (the Messengers)], till He sees that they (the Messengers) have conveyed the Messages of their Lord (Allah). And He (Allah) surrounds all that which is with them, and He (Allah) keeps count of all things (i.e. He knows the exact number of everything).

versets.ar: 1. يَا أَيُّهَا الْمُزَّمِّلُ ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. O toi, l'enveloppé [dans tes vêtements]!
versets.en: 1. O you wrapped in garments (i.e. Prophet Muhammad SAW)!

versets.ar: 2. قُمِ اللَّيْلَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Lève-toi [pour prier], toute la nuit, excepté une petite partie;
versets.en: 2. Stand (to pray) all night, except a little.

versets.ar: 3. نِّصْفَهُ أَوِ انقُصْ مِنْهُ قَلِيلًا ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. Sa moitié, ou un peu moins;
versets.en: 3. Half of it, or a little less than that,

versets.ar: 4. أَوْ زِدْ عَلَيْهِ وَرَتِّلِ الْقُرْآنَ تَرْتِيلًا ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. ou un peu plus. Et récite le Coran, lentement et clairement.
versets.en: 4. Or a little more; and recite the Quran (aloud) in a slow, (pleasant tone and) style.

versets.ar: 5. إِنَّا سَنُلْقِي عَلَيْكَ قَوْلًا ثَقِيلًا ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Nous allons te révéler des paroles lourdes (très importantes).
versets.en: 5. Verily, We shall send down to you a weighty Word (i.e. obligations, legal laws, etc.).

versets.ar: 6. إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ اللَّيْلِ هِيَ أَشَدُّ وَطْئًا وَأَقْوَمُ قِيلًا ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. La prière pendant la nuit est plus efficace et plus propice pour la récitation.
versets.en: 6. Verily, the rising by night (for Tahajjud prayer) is very hard and most potent and good for governing (the soul), and most suitable for (understanding) the Word (of Allah).

versets.ar: 7. إِنَّ لَكَ فِي النَّهَارِ سَبْحًا طَوِيلًا ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. Tu as, dans la journée, à vaquer à de longues occupations.
versets.en: 7. Verily, there is for you by day prolonged occupation with ordinary duties,

versets.ar: 8. وَاذْكُرِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلْ إِلَيْهِ تَبْتِيلًا ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Et rappelle-toi le nom de ton Seigneur et consacre-toi totalement à Lui,
versets.en: 8. And remember the Name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with a complete devotion.

versets.ar: 9. رَّبُّ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَاتَّخِذْهُ وَكِيلًا ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. le Seigneur du Levant et du Couchant. Il n'y a point de divinité à part Lui. Prends-Le donc comme Protecteur.
versets.en: 9. (He Alone is) the Lord of the east and the west, La ilaha illa Huwa (none has the right to be worshipped but He). So take Him Alone as Wakil (Disposer of your affairs).

versets.ar: 10. وَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَاهْجُرْهُمْ هَجْرًا جَمِيلًا ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. Et endure ce qu'ils disent; et écarte-toi d'eux d'une façon convenable.
versets.en: 10. And be patient (O Muhammad SAW) with what they say, and keep away from them in a good way.

versets.ar: 11. وَذَرْنِي وَالْمُكَذِّبِينَ أُولِي النَّعْمَةِ وَمَهِّلْهُمْ قَلِيلًا ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. Et laisse-moi avec ceux qui crient au mensonge et qui vivent dans l'aisance; et accorde-leur un court répit:
versets.en: 11. And leave Me Alone to deal with the beliers (those who deny My Verses, etc.), and those who are in possession of good things of life. And give them respite for a little while.

versets.ar: 12. إِنَّ لَدَيْنَا أَنكَالًا وَجَحِيمًا ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. Nous avons [pour eux] lourdes chaînes et Enfer,
versets.en: 12. Verily, with Us are fetters (to bind them), and a raging Fire.

versets.ar: 13. وَطَعَامًا ذَا غُصَّةٍ وَعَذَابًا أَلِيمًا ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. et nourriture à faire suffoquer, et châtiment douloureux.
versets.en: 13. And a food that chokes, and a painful torment.

versets.ar: 14. يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ الْأَرْضُ وَالْجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ الْجِبَالُ كَثِيبًا مَّهِيلًا ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. Le jour où la terre et les montagnes trembleront, tandis que les montagnes deviendront comme une dune de sable dispersée.
versets.en: 14. On the Day when the earth and the mountains will be in violent shake, and the mountains will be a heap of sand poured out and flowing down.

versets.ar: 15. إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَيْكُمْ رَسُولًا شَاهِدًا عَلَيْكُمْ كَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ رَسُولًا ﴿15﴾
versets.fr: 15. Nous vous avons envoyé un Messager pour être témoin contre vous, de même que Nous avions envoyé un Messager à Pharaon.
versets.en: 15. Verily, We have sent to you (O men) a Messenger (Muhammad SAW) to be a witness over you, as We did send a Messenger [Musa (Moses)] to Fir'aun (Pharaoh).

versets.ar: 16. فَعَصَىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ الرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذْنَاهُ أَخْذًا وَبِيلًا ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Pharaon désobéit alors au Messager. Nous le saisîmes donc rudement.
versets.en: 16. But Fir'aun (Pharaoh) disobeyed the Messenger [Musa (Moses)], so We seized him with a severe punishment.

versets.ar: 17. فَكَيْفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِن كَفَرْتُمْ يَوْمًا يَجْعَلُ الْوِلْدَانَ شِيبًا ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Comment vous préserverez-vous, si vous mécroyez, d'un jour qui rendra les enfants comme des vieillards aux cheveux blancs?
versets.en: 17. Then how can you avoid the punishment, if you disbelieve, on a Day that will make the children grey-headed (i.e. the Day of Resurrection)?

versets.ar: 18. السَّمَاءُ مُنفَطِرٌ بِهِ ۚ كَانَ وَعْدُهُ مَفْعُولًا ﴿18﴾
versets.fr: 18. [et] durant lequel le ciel se fendra. Sa promesse s'accomplira sans doute.
versets.en: 18. Whereon the heaven will be cleft asunder? His Promise is certainly to be accomplished.

versets.ar: 19. إِنَّ هَٰذِهِ تَذْكِرَةٌ ۖ فَمَن شَاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبِيلًا ﴿19﴾
versets.fr: 19. Ceci est un rappel. Que celui qui veut prenne une voie [menant] à son Seigneur.
versets.en: 19. Verily, this is an admonition, therefore whosoever will, let him take a Path to His Lord!

versets.ar: 20. ۞ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدْنَىٰ مِن ثُلُثَيِ اللَّيْلِ وَنِصْفَهُ وَثُلُثَهُ وَطَائِفَةٌ مِّنَ الَّذِينَ مَعَكَ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ ۚ عَلِمَ أَن لَّن تُحْصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ فَاقْرَءُوا مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ الْقُرْآنِ ۚ عَلِمَ أَن سَيَكُونُ مِنكُم مَّرْضَىٰ ۙ وَآخَرُونَ يَضْرِبُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ يَبْتَغُونَ مِن فَضْلِ اللَّهِ ۙ وَآخَرُونَ يُقَاتِلُونَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۖ فَاقْرَءُوا مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنْهُ ۚ وَأَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكَاةَ وَأَقْرِضُوا اللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا ۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُوا لِأَنفُسِكُم مِّنْ خَيْرٍ تَجِدُوهُ عِندَ اللَّهِ هُوَ خَيْرًا وَأَعْظَمَ أَجْرًا ۚ وَاسْتَغْفِرُوا اللَّهَ ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ ﴿20﴾
versets.fr: 20. Ton Seigneur sait, certes, que tu (Muhammad) te tiens debout moins de deux tiers de la nuit, ou sa moitié, ou son tiers. De même qu'une partie de ceux qui sont avec toi. Allah détermine la nuit et le jour. Il sait que vous ne saurez jamais passer toute la nuit en prière. Il a usé envers vous avec indulgence. Récitez donc ce qui [vous] est possible du Coran. Il sait qu'il y aura parmi vous des malades, et d'autres qui voyageront sur la terre, en quête de la grâce d'Allah, et d'autres encore qui combattront dans le chemin d'Allah. Récite-en donc ce qui [vous] sera possible. Accomplissez la Salât, acquittez la Zakât, et faites à Allah un prêt sincère. Tout bien que vous vous préparez, vous le retrouverez auprès d'Allah, meilleur et plus grand en fait de récompense. Et implorez le pardon d'Allah. Car Allah est Pardonneur et Très Miséricordieux.
versets.en: 20. Verily, your Lord knows that you do stand (to pray at night) a little less than two-thirds of the night, or half the night, or a third of the night, and so do a party of those with you, And Allah measures the night and the day. He knows that you are unable to pray the whole night, so He has turned to you (in mercy). So, recite you of the Quran as much as may be easy for you. He knows that there will be some among you sick, others travelling through the land, seeking of Allah's Bounty; yet others fighting in Allah's Cause. So recite as much of the Quran as may be easy (for you), and perform As-Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat) and give Zakat, and lend to Allah a goodly loan, and whatever good you send before you for yourselves, (i.e. Nawafil non-obligatory acts of worship: prayers, charity, fasting, Hajj and 'Umrah, etc.), you will certainly find it with Allah, better and greater in reward. And seek Forgiveness of Allah. Verily, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most-Merciful.

versets.ar: 1. يَا أَيُّهَا الْمُدَّثِّرُ ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. O, toi (Muhammad)! Le revêtu d'un manteau!
versets.en: 1. O you (Muhammad SAW) enveloped (in garments)!

versets.fr: 2. Lève-toi et avertis.
versets.en: 2. Arise and warn!

versets.fr: 3. Et de ton Seigneur, célèbre la grandeur.
versets.en: 3. And your Lord (Allah) magnify!

versets.ar: 4. وَثِيَابَكَ فَطَهِّرْ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Et tes vêtements, purifie-les.
versets.en: 4. And your garments purify!

versets.ar: 5. وَالرُّجْزَ فَاهْجُرْ ﴿5﴾
versets.fr: 5. Et de tout péché, écarte-toi.
versets.en: 5. And keep away from Ar-Rujz (the idols)!

versets.ar: 6. وَلَا تَمْنُن تَسْتَكْثِرُ ﴿6﴾
versets.fr: 6. Et ne donne pas dans le but de recevoir davantage.
versets.en: 6. And give not a thing in order to have more (or consider not your deeds of Allah's obedience as a favour to Allah).

versets.ar: 7. وَلِرَبِّكَ فَاصْبِرْ ﴿7﴾
versets.fr: 7. Et pour ton Seigneur, endure.
versets.en: 7. And be patient for the sake of your Lord (i.e. perform your duty to Allah)!

versets.ar: 8. فَإِذَا نُقِرَ فِي النَّاقُورِ ﴿8﴾
versets.fr: 8. Quand on sonnera du Clairon,
versets.en: 8. Then, when the Trumpet is sounded (i.e. its second blowing);

versets.ar: 9. فَذَٰلِكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَوْمٌ عَسِيرٌ ﴿9﴾
versets.fr: 9. alors, ce jour-là sera un jour difficile,
versets.en: 9. Truly, that Day will be a Hard Day.

versets.ar: 10. عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ غَيْرُ يَسِيرٍ ﴿10﴾
versets.fr: 10. pas facile pour les mécréants.
versets.en: 10. Far from easy for the disbelievers.

versets.ar: 11. ذَرْنِي وَمَنْ خَلَقْتُ وَحِيدًا ﴿11﴾
versets.fr: 11. Laisse-Moi avec celui que J'ai créé seul,
versets.en: 11. Leave Me Alone (to deal) with whom I created Alone (without any means, i.e. Al-Walid bin Al-Mughirah Al-Makhzumi)!

versets.ar: 12. وَجَعَلْتُ لَهُ مَالًا مَّمْدُودًا ﴿12﴾
versets.fr: 12. et à qui J'ai donné des biens étendus,
versets.en: 12. And then granted him resources in abundance.

versets.ar: 13. وَبَنِينَ شُهُودًا ﴿13﴾
versets.fr: 13. et des enfants qui lui tiennent toujours compagnie,
versets.en: 13. And children to be by his side!

versets.ar: 14. وَمَهَّدتُّ لَهُ تَمْهِيدًا ﴿14﴾
versets.fr: 14. pour qui aussi J'ai aplani toutes difficultés
versets.en: 14. And made life smooth and comfortable for him!

versets.fr: 15. Cependant, il convoite [de Moi] que Je lui donne davantage.
versets.en: 15. After all that he desires that I should give more;

versets.ar: 16. كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّهُ كَانَ لِآيَاتِنَا عَنِيدًا ﴿16﴾
versets.fr: 16. Pas du tout! Car il reniait nos versets (le Coran) avec entêtement.
versets.en: 16. Nay! Verily, he has been stubborn and opposing Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.).

versets.ar: 17. سَأُرْهِقُهُ صَعُودًا ﴿17﴾
versets.fr: 17. Je vais le contraindre à gravir une pente.
versets.en: 17. I shall oblige him to (climb a slippery mountain in the Hell-fire called As-Sa'ud, or to) face a severe torment!

versets.fr: 18. Il a réfléchi. Et il a décidé.
versets.en: 18. Verily, he thought and plotted;

versets.fr: 19. Qu'il périsse! Comme il a décidé!
versets.en: 19. So let him be cursed! How he plotted!

versets.fr: 20. Encore une fois, qu'il périsse; comme il a décidé!
versets.en: 20. And once more let him be cursed, how he plotted!

versets.fr: 21. Ensuite, il a regardé.
versets.en: 21. Then he thought;

versets.fr: 22. Et il s'est renfrogné et a durci son visage.
versets.en: 22. Then he frowned and he looked in a bad tempered way;

versets.fr: 23. Ensuite il a tourné le dos et s'est enflé d'orgueil
versets.en: 23. Then he turned back and was proud;

versets.ar: 24. فَقَالَ إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا سِحْرٌ يُؤْثَرُ ﴿24﴾
versets.fr: 24. Puis il a dit: «Ceci (le Coran) n'est que magie apprise
versets.en: 24. Then he said: "This is nothing but magic from that of old;

versets.ar: 25. إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا قَوْلُ الْبَشَرِ ﴿25﴾
versets.fr: 25. ce n'est là que la parole d'un humain».
versets.en: 25. "This is nothing but the word of a human being!"

versets.fr: 26. Je vais le brûler dans le Feu intense (Saqar).
versets.en: 26. I will cast him into Hell-fire

versets.ar: 27. وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا سَقَرُ ﴿27﴾
versets.fr: 27. Et qui te dira ce qu'est Saqar?
versets.en: 27. And what will make you know exactly what Hell-fire is?

versets.ar: 28. لَا تُبْقِي وَلَا تَذَرُ ﴿28﴾
versets.fr: 28. Il ne laisse rien et n'épargne rien;
versets.en: 28. It spares not (any sinner), nor does it leave (anything unburnt)!

versets.fr: 29. Il brûle la peau et la noircit.
versets.en: 29. Burning the skins!

versets.ar: 30. عَلَيْهَا تِسْعَةَ عَشَرَ ﴿30﴾
versets.fr: 30. Ils sont dix neuf à y veiller.
versets.en: 30. Over it are nineteen (angels as guardians and keepers of Hell).

versets.ar: 31. وَمَا جَعَلْنَا أَصْحَابَ النَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَائِكَةً ۙ وَمَا جَعَلْنَا عِدَّتَهُمْ إِلَّا فِتْنَةً لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لِيَسْتَيْقِنَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ وَيَزْدَادَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِيمَانًا ۙ وَلَا يَرْتَابَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ وَالْمُؤْمِنُونَ ۙ وَلِيَقُولَ الَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌ وَالْكَافِرُونَ مَاذَا أَرَادَ اللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا مَثَلًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ اللَّهُ مَن يَشَاءُ وَيَهْدِي مَن يَشَاءُ ۚ وَمَا يَعْلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ وَمَا هِيَ إِلَّا ذِكْرَىٰ لِلْبَشَرِ ﴿31﴾
versets.fr: 31. Nous n'avons assigné comme gardiens du Feu que des Anges. Cependant, Nous n'en avons fixé le nombre que pour éprouver les mécréants, et aussi afin que ceux à qui le Livre a été apporté soient convaincus, et que croisse la foi de ceux qui croient, et que ceux à qui le Livre a été apporté et les croyants n'aient point de doute; et pour que ceux qui ont au cœur quelque maladie ainsi que les mécréants disent: «Qu'a donc voulu Allah par cette parabole?» C'est ainsi qu'Allah égare qui Il veut et guide qui Il veut. Nul ne connaît les armées de ton Seigneur, à part Lui. Et ce n'est là qu'un rappel pour les humains.
versets.en: 31. And We have set none but angels as guardians of the Fire, and We have fixed their number (19) only as a trial for the disbelievers, in order that the people of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) may arrive at a certainty [that this Quran is the truth as it agrees with their Books i.e. their number (19) is written in the Taurat (Torah) and the Injeel (Gospel)] and the believers may increase in Faith (as this Quran is the truth) and that no doubts may be left for the people of the Scripture and the believers, and that those in whose hearts is a disease (of hypocrisy) and the disbelievers may say: "What Allah intends by this (curious) example?" Thus Allah leads astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And none can know the hosts of your Lord but He. And this (Hell) is nothing else than a (warning) reminder to mankind.

versets.fr: 32. Non!... Par la lune!
versets.en: 32. Nay, and by the moon,

versets.ar: 33. وَاللَّيْلِ إِذْ أَدْبَرَ ﴿33﴾
versets.fr: 33. Et par la nuit quand elle se retire!
versets.en: 33. And by the night when it withdraws,

versets.ar: 34. وَالصُّبْحِ إِذَا أَسْفَرَ ﴿34﴾
versets.fr: 34. Et par l'aurore quand elle se découvre!
versets.en: 34. And by the dawn when it brightens,

versets.ar: 35. إِنَّهَا لَإِحْدَى الْكُبَرِ ﴿35﴾
versets.fr: 35. [Saqar] est l'un des plus grands [malheurs]
versets.en: 35. Verily, it (Hell, or their denial of the Prophet Muhammad SAW, or the Day of Resurrection) is but one of the greatest calamities.

versets.fr: 36. un avertissement, pour les humains.
versets.en: 36. A warning to mankind,

versets.ar: 37. لِمَن شَاءَ مِنكُمْ أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوْ يَتَأَخَّرَ ﴿37﴾
versets.fr: 37. Pour qui d'entre vous, veut avancer ou reculer.
versets.en: 37. To any of you that chooses to go forward (by working righteous deeds), or to remain behind (by commiting sins),

versets.ar: 38. كُلُّ نَفْسٍ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ رَهِينَةٌ ﴿38﴾
versets.fr: 38. Toute âme est l'otage de ce qu'elle a acquis.
versets.en: 38. Every person is a pledge for what he has earned,

versets.ar: 39. إِلَّا أَصْحَابَ الْيَمِينِ ﴿39﴾
versets.fr: 39. Sauf les gens de la droite (les élus):
versets.en: 39. Except those on the Right, (i.e. the pious true believers of Islamic Monotheism);

versets.ar: 40. فِي جَنَّاتٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ ﴿40﴾
versets.fr: 40. dans des Jardins, ils s'interrogeront
versets.en: 40. In Gardens (Paradise) they will ask one another,

versets.ar: 41. عَنِ الْمُجْرِمِينَ ﴿41﴾
versets.fr: 41. au sujet des criminels:
versets.en: 41. About Al-Mujrimun (polytheists, criminals, disbelievers, etc.), (And they will say to them):

versets.ar: 42. مَا سَلَكَكُمْ فِي سَقَرَ ﴿42﴾
versets.fr: 42. «Qu'est-ce qui vous a acheminés à Saqar?»
versets.en: 42. "What has caused you to enter Hell?"

versets.ar: 43. قَالُوا لَمْ نَكُ مِنَ الْمُصَلِّينَ ﴿43﴾
versets.fr: 43. Ils diront: «Nous n'étions pas de ceux qui faisaient la Salât,
versets.en: 43. They will say: "We were not of those who used to offer their Salat (prayers)

versets.ar: 44. وَلَمْ نَكُ نُطْعِمُ الْمِسْكِينَ ﴿44﴾
versets.fr: 44. et nous ne nourrissions pas le pauvre,
versets.en: 44. "Nor we used to feed Al-Miskin (the poor);

versets.ar: 45. وَكُنَّا نَخُوضُ مَعَ الْخَائِضِينَ ﴿45﴾
versets.fr: 45. et nous nous associions à ceux qui tenaient des conversations futiles,
versets.en: 45. "And we used to talk falsehood (all that which Allah hated) with vain talkers.

versets.ar: 46. وَكُنَّا نُكَذِّبُ بِيَوْمِ الدِّينِ ﴿46﴾
versets.fr: 46. et nous traitions de mensonge le jour de la Rétribution,
versets.en: 46. "And we used to belie the Day of Recompense

versets.ar: 47. حَتَّىٰ أَتَانَا الْيَقِينُ ﴿47﴾
versets.fr: 47. jusqu'à ce que nous vînt la vérité évidente [la mort]».
versets.en: 47. "Until there came to us (the death) that is certain."

versets.ar: 48. فَمَا تَنفَعُهُمْ شَفَاعَةُ الشَّافِعِينَ ﴿48﴾
versets.fr: 48. Ne leur profitera point donc, l'intercession des intercesseurs.
versets.en: 48. So no intercession of intercessors will be of any use to them.

versets.ar: 49. فَمَا لَهُمْ عَنِ التَّذْكِرَةِ مُعْرِضِينَ ﴿49﴾
versets.fr: 49. Qu'ont-ils à se détourner du Rappel?
versets.en: 49. Then what is wrong with them (i.e. the disbelievers) that they turn away from (receiving) admonition?

versets.fr: 50. Ils sont comme des onagres épouvantés,
versets.en: 50. As if they were frightened (wild) donkeys.

versets.fr: 51. s'enfuyant devant un lion.
versets.en: 51. Fleeing from a hunter, or a lion, or a beast of prey.

versets.ar: 52. بَلْ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُؤْتَىٰ صُحُفًا مُّنَشَّرَةً ﴿52﴾
versets.fr: 52. Chacun d'eux voudrait plutôt qu'on lui apporte des feuilles tout étalées.
versets.en: 52. Nay, everyone of them desires that he should be given pages spread out (coming from Allah with a writing that Islam is the right religion, and Muhammad SAW has come with the truth from Allah the Lord of the heavens and earth, etc.).

versets.ar: 53. كَلَّا ۖ بَل لَّا يَخَافُونَ الْآخِرَةَ ﴿53﴾
versets.fr: 53. Ah! Non! C'est plutôt qu'ils ne craignent pas l'au-delà.
versets.en: 53. Nay! But they fear not the Hereafter (from Allah's punishment).

versets.fr: 54. Ah! Non! Ceci est vraiment un Rappel.
versets.en: 54. Nay, verily, this (Quran) is an admonition,

versets.ar: 55. فَمَن شَاءَ ذَكَرَهُ ﴿55﴾
versets.fr: 55. Quiconque veut, qu'il se le rappelle.
versets.en: 55. So whosoever will (let him read it), and receive admonition (from it)!

versets.ar: 56. وَمَا يَذْكُرُونَ إِلَّا أَن يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ هُوَ أَهْلُ التَّقْوَىٰ وَأَهْلُ الْمَغْفِرَةِ ﴿56﴾
versets.fr: 56. Mais ils ne se rappelleront que si Allah veut. C'est Lui qui est Le plus digne d'être craint; et c'est Lui qui détient le pardon.
versets.en: 56. And they will not receive admonition unless Allah wills; He (Allah) is the One, deserving that mankind should be afraid of, and should be dutiful to Him, and should not take any Ilah (God) along with Him, and He is the One Who forgives (sins).

versets.ar: 1. لَا أُقْسِمُ بِيَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ ﴿1﴾
versets.fr: 1. Non!... Je jure par le Jour de la Résurrection!
versets.en: 1. I swear by the Day of Resurrection;

versets.ar: 2. وَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِالنَّفْسِ اللَّوَّامَةِ ﴿2﴾
versets.fr: 2. Mais non!, Je jure par l'âme qui ne cesse de se blâmer.
versets.en: 2. And I swear by the self-reproaching person (a believer).

versets.ar: 3. أَيَحْسَبُ الْإِنسَانُ أَلَّن نَّجْمَعَ عِظَامَهُ ﴿3﴾
versets.fr: 3. L'homme, pense-t-il que Nous ne réunirons jamais ses os?
versets.en: 3. Does man (a disbeliever) think that We shall not assemble his bones?

versets.ar: 4. بَلَىٰ قَادِرِينَ عَلَىٰ أَن نُّسَوِّيَ بَنَانَهُ ﴿4﴾
versets.fr: 4. Mais si! Nous sommes Capable de remettre à leur place les extrémités de ses doigts.
